Expert Pain Management in Wilmington

At Interventional Spine Pain Doctor, we specialize in providing advanced solutions for chronic pain management. Our practice, conveniently located at 3411 Silverside Rd #103R in Wilmington, Delaware, offers comprehensive care using cutting-edge interventional techniques. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, focusing on minimally invasive procedures that target the source of pain while minimizing recovery time. Our services include:

  • Radiofrequency ablation procedures

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Joint injections

  • Diagnostic nerve blocks

With our board-certified specialists and state-of-the-art facilities, we're committed to helping patients return to their daily activities with reduced pain and improved function. For those suffering from chronic back, neck, or joint pain, we offer Interventional Pain Management Services tailored to each individual's specific needs and conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Relief Solutions in Maryland

At Nova Interventional Pain Management, we are dedicated to providing all-inclusive interventional care for adults throughout Edgewood, Bel Air, and Rosedale, Maryland. Led by board-certified interventional pain management specialist Faisal Sayeed, MD, our team develops custom treatment plans that improve joint and musculoskeletal function through an interdisciplinary approach. We prioritize using the safest, least invasive treatments to enhance quality of life and promote a more active lifestyle for our patients.

Our comprehensive services include:

  • Personalized pain management consultations

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Joint and musculoskeletal therapy

We set aside ample time for each appointment, ensuring thorough evaluations that lead to effective care plans tailored to individual needs. Visit our official website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 410-676-1463. Our clinic is conveniently located at 1952 Pulaski Hwy Suite B, Edgewood, MD 21040.

column40:
I have been going to DR Sayheed for about 6 months and I'm 67 years old and my urinalyses came back with Cocaine in it . They had another urine in the box that did not have a name on it. I think that it was not my urine they tested. I have never done Cocaine in my life. They seen  me for the last time and acted like everything was ok . Got my medication and then I was told I was Discharged. I don't understand why they will never admit that they made a mistake. I have never had any problem with this Practice but I'm really concerned about the way things were handled. Everyone makes mistakes!!! But I know as a fact I did not have any Cocaine in my system. But I was still discharged . I went to DR Fulton for 22 years and never had any problems. ( May he R.I.P ) . THE DEA handled all the Urinalyses and for all that time I never had anything in my Urine. I just think I should be given another chance. They can give me another Urine or whatever they would like. No one wanted to hear what I had to say. But as a practice in whole I liked going there. I would really like to come back to Dr. Sayheed. I think I should get another chance. This just really sadens my heart.|This is the WORST Dr's office I have ever experienced! Injections are MANDATORY, staff turnovers are constant! My best friend husband is a severe diabetic and he received a MANDATORY Cortisone Injection, and he was NOT WARNED that the Steroids spiked his blood sugar for a week! I have went here years ago. NOTHING HAS CHANGED! Sayeed is all about the MONEY. His exams for follow ups are so painful that I would leave that office in more pain than before I arrived! Sayeed also has multiple MALPRACTICE CASES! Please do your research to save the time, money and headache!

I HIGHLY recommend going to Center for Interventional Pain and Spine, at Elkton! That is the BEST office I have been to!!|I love seeing Dr. S. He is very good when it comes to new patients. He really tries to narrow down where the pain is coming from, and make a plan to relieve the pain. There is a women at the front desk by I believe her name is Nicole. She's very polite always smiles and does her best to help you with what you need. Energy is amazing she works very hard and tried to accommodate you to the best of her ability. A women works there by name of Linda she's very rude and nasty. She talks to people how ever she likes patients and staff. She's yells and gets disrespectful, and she's just has very nasty energy. She doesn't acknowledge the good her staff do only the bad. She's has 0 patients. Other then that I do wish my medication went back to how it was before my pregnancy, but for some reason they won't put it back to tha. Other then that they been doing better with the wait time and Ms.Joan is very nice and also tries to manage your pain correctly.|Finally found a pain practice that is really focused on their patients well-being and how they are progressing to make you pain free... U Matter 2 Radio|BEWARE
Do not go to this office. I repeat. Do not go here period they have the rudest. Most disrespectful staff I have ever encountered. I have been cussed out, hung up on and screamed at as well as many of their other patients. Their staff has a very high turnover rate as well. I have spoken to a few of their staff members and even one doctor it is just as bad to work there. They do not care about your pain. The doctor just wants to give injection, so he can get the money. Dr
Sayeed is rough and cold. LINDA AND MELISSA ARE THE WORST OF THE WORST. How can any good come from such a nightmare of a place. Do yourself a favor.  Avoid this horror show!|Very polite staff and Dr S really explained my MRI and after all these years I finally understand what's going on with my back. I have been to several pain doctors but Dr S made me feel like he really cares. He set up a plan and I really hope I finally get some relief|I love all of the providers at Nova Interventional Pain Management. They have helped be get through my pain for several years now. I don't know what I would do without them. I love all of the new receptionists, especially Nicole. She goes above and beyond to help me with any issues that may arise.|I had previously had interactions with Dr. Sayeed when accompanying my wife but had never been his "patient". However, after being with her with almost every Pain Management doctor in Baltimore & Harford counties ~ when it came to my OWN strange eye problem that my PCP, Retina Surgeon, Glaucoma Ophthalmologist, Neurologist and others COULDN'T figure out how to resolve ASAP ~ I was able to get an EMERGENCY appointment with Dr. SAYEED and after being in his Pulaski Hwy. Clinic for nearly 3 hours with nonstop attention from his staff and at least an hour with Dr. SAYEED ~ MY PAINFUL PROBLEM was DIAGNOSED. 3 Prescriptions were sent to my chosen Pharmacy and I immediately took them when I got home. Within 24 hours MY 7 WEEKS of AGONIZING PAIN was HISTORY. My choice to see him was CORRECT. Dr. SAYEED, in my own case, performed what I consider a personal MIRACLE and I'll FOREVER be GRATEFUL to him.

Advanced Pain Management Solutions in Feasterville-Trevose

At Delaware Valley Pain & Spine Institute (DVPSI), we specialize in providing highly advanced procedures for chronic pain management that help restore quality of life to our patients. Our dedicated team of pain specialists, including Dr. Rosen, Dr. Bromberg, and Dr. Patel, brings decades of combined experience to every treatment plan. We offer comprehensive pain management services including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Nerve blocks and injections

  • Medication management

  • Customized treatment plans

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take a personalized approach to each patient's care. Our compassionate team treats you like family, taking the time to listen to your concerns and develop effective solutions. We're currently accepting new patients at our conveniently located office in Feasterville-Trevose. Contact us today at +1 267-288-5601 or visit our website to schedule your consultation at 4979 Old Street Rd B, Feasterville-Trevose, PA 19053.

column40:
Dr. Rosen is a truly compassionate skilled surgeon. His bedside manner is genuine and thorough and the staff at both the practice and surgical centers are the best I've ever encountered. This practice saved my life; gave me back my sanity and my future ability to be mobile and active. Highly recommend!!|Excellent care, excellent bedside manor, caring Dr's. Treated as a person, family member. Knows our name and history without chart. Dr Patel talks frankly and with compassion. Great sense of humor. Gets to the problem and explores options that the patient understands and is comfortable with. Cannot recommend this practice enough. We see Dr A. Patel and so happy to have found him and staff.|I did not have a good experience. I initially came to see if they could take over the epidurals I was getting, but they refused to give me the same dose of medication based on their feelings instead of any evidence. Then, I needed occipital nerve blocks, and I advised the pain was at the base of my skull. Injections were done in the top of my head and not where the pain was in the lower occipital region. It was a wasted procedure and I'm still confused why it was done. I have since seen the medical records from the visit and I'm pretty sure they say he did the lower injections when they were not performed. All I know is I didn't get appropriate treatment, and there seems to be a lack of understanding of the medications being used  as well as a lack of understanding of the anatomy.|As someone with Ankylosing Spondylitis, chronic pain was unfortunately a part of my day-to-day. I'm so glad I found Delaware Valley Pain & Spine. I had no idea pain management existed, and Dr Patel and his team did such an amazing job at making my life more manageable. Highly recommend these guys, they are both friendly and effective!|Dr. Rosen is the best pain management doctor I've had, and I've had several over 30 years for back pain. I've gotten more relief since I've been seeing him than I've had from other places.

He isn't very close, but it's worth the drive to see him. I'm about 45 min to an hour away depending on traffic of course. If you have Pain Management issues be sure to give them a try, you won't regret it.|Super friendly and welcoming staff, felt very taken care of. Dr. Patel is an excellent doctor, listened to me with a lot of respect and empathy, was very informative and made me feel like I will be ok. He was very clear on next steps and possible courses of treatment. Front desk staff was also very helpful when I had to call back to get an MRI script fixed and updated so I could schedule the test. Highly recommend this office!|The best move I ever made was switching pain management doctors.  DVP&SI is wonderful.  Dr. Rosen takes the time to listen to his patients' concerns.  PA-C Armen is also fantastic.  I can't say enough wonderful things about his office staff.  They return phone calls on the same day!  They are on top of all the prior authorization documentation Express Scripts throws at them. I am receiving great care and I can't thank them enough .|Everyone there care about you. The front desk pleasantly checks you in an give you another appointment when you are done. Dr. Rosen, Sue and Heather are great they are very caring, go over your history ask how you are doing and go over any new treatment that could help you with pain. Highly recommend.

Specialized Care for Auto Accidents & Personal Injuries

At Wilmington Accident Doctors, Dr. Mike Francis and our team of experienced physicians provide comprehensive care for patients suffering from auto accident injuries, sports-related trauma, and general chiropractic needs. We specialize in personal injury treatment, having successfully helped hundreds of patients recover and regain their quality of life. Our practice offers flexible payment options including:

  • PIP or No-Fault insurance

  • Third-party billing

  • Auto insurance claims

  • Attorney liens

We understand the complexities of accident recovery, which is why we can work directly with your attorney or guide you through the process independently. If you've recently suffered an injury from a car crash, don't delay your treatment. Wilmington Auto Accident Doctors combines chiropractic care, physiotherapy, and pain management techniques to create personalized treatment plans. Visit our office at 2500 Grubb Rd #132-B, Wilmington, DE 19810, or call us today at +1 302-475-3200 to schedule your consultation.
column11: Dr. Mike Francis and his team of doctors treat auto accidents, sports injuries and general chiropractic. With a focus on personal injury, Dr. Francis has helped hundreds of patients recover from personal injuries. He can accept pip or no fault, third party billing, auto insurance, attorneys liens. We can work with your attorney or without. Give us a call today after you have suffered a injury from a car crash

column40: I had an infection in the disc of my spine as well as breaking my neck when I fell. Was in quite a bit of pain. I was treated and prescribed pain medications which took awhile to find the right combination. Clearway has always accommodated me when I had any problems from scheduling or medical issues. While a busy office they are efficient and flexible working with patients. As a former RN I can be a little picky in selecting my healthcare providers and I have absolutely no complaints.|The office staff was a bit curt.  More importantly I came for a simple follow up appointment - 5 minutes long - and waited for over an hour.  When I mentioned this to Dr. John he lectured me on how important his other patients are.  It seems he has more patients than he can handle, so I did him a favor and left.|Dr John's staff are very upbeat! And as you should know, what you put out there, comes back at you! I always come out of the office feeling energized! Almost to the point I forget why I had an appointment. Dr John is very to the point about where's your pain right now, and what's your score, what do you want to change if anything! Has has good bedside manor, some might take offense at his bluntness, but I like it and down to earth is a good way to Doctor! He also said to me every doctor is the same in pain management but they all have a unique set of skills! The pies all come out the same in the end but are made differently! He's a really good guy! And very knowledgeable in his skill set !|I can't say that I enjoy my visits but Dr. John and his friendly and capable staff sure make it easy. Dr. John knows just how much pain I am about to feel as he performs the procedure and lets me know what's coming. I don't use an anesthetic but you can if you like.|Friendly welcome. Respectful treatment by staff and medical personnel. They ALL listen very well and their comments and questions demonstrate they understand.|I've been going to Clearway seeing Dr. Ed L and he's great! He listens to me and helps me decide on what we can do to minimize my pain. I highly recommend him, he works out of the Salisbury and Easton, Maryland offices.|Beth is absolutely wonderful, amazing. She is so very compassionate, relatable, she makes me feel like a friend instead of just another patient. She is trying so hard to help me get out of pain! She is just so genuine!|I was just hung up on while trying to explain something to the lady on the phone who was extremely rude and nasty to me about a miscommunication between two practices and a pharmacy and I am a new patient and have never been treated so badly all while the main reason she was calling was to cancel my appointment I had today last minute hours before scheduled appointment and refusing to have the doctor call me back to get the situation resolved very unprofessional

column40:
I had a procedure with doctor Schneider to have a cyst removed from my face. Prior to the procedure, I went to his office on Falls Rd to have the cyst examined. The staff was very sweet and welcoming, during my initial visit and during my follow up visit. In addition, the staff at the surgery center was amazing also. Overall, my experience was great and I would definitely recommend Dr. Schneider to my family and friends.|Dr. Schneider is very patient with his patients for sure. Answers all questions and very friendly. Professionally, he did a great job with the lasers on a large scar on my leg. Highly recommended.|Dr Schneider is probably one of the best doctors I've ever encountered. He is extremely well formed and will do everything that he can to help a patient. He is great with patients with rare conditions and will do due diligence to find the treatment that will best help a patient. In my years as his patient he very seldomly gave me pills for my condition and when he did they were adjacent to other treatments and never narcotics! He's not the type to get you stuck on pills or pain medication. And injections is what pain management does if you don't take pills! Not all patients qualify for procedures such as burning or freezing of the nerves. Other type of palliative treatments are also conducive to the condition and the patients' physical makeup. There's no such thing as a catch all help all in one treatment for pain. People who give great doctors like this bad ratings because they do not understand how pain management works is harmful to everyone!|Troubles me to read reviews in reference to Dr. Schneider...but assume your pain has affected your negative attitude!!. I personally think Dr. Schneider wants NOTHING BUT THE BEST for his patients!!. He is in his position to treat Chronic Pain and his GOAL is to Decrease as much pain as Possible and must say he has went BEYOND My expectations...by truly listening to my issues and Trying his BEST to HELP BY ANY means possible!!. I am also Cancer Survivor..which brings on issues of its own and myself and Dr. Schneider are well aware of its side effects and the realization that he isn't GOD but still does his best to help me. Must also say as a cancer survivor Dr. Schneider has found ..by examination...growths within me that my own ONCOLOGIST hasn't detected. I was then sent for PET Scan to rule out re-occurring cancer and I Truly Thank Him for his KNOWLEDGE..WISDOM...CARING...AND LAST BUT NOT LEAST...JUST TAKING THE TIME!!!.|After several years of severe, painful spinal stenosis Dr. Schneider administered a series of cortisone shots which provided incredible relief. I can now walk upright and participate in everyday activities again. I found Dr. Schneider to be a caring and profoundly knowledgeable physician with the patient's best interest at heart. I highly recommend him to those in need of pain relief.|Extremely inefficient and poorly run office. In the office for an hour, up to 2.5 hours each visit with 99% of that time waiting. The billing office is uneducated in Medicare billing as well. Absolutely double check the co-pays before writing the check!

Dr Schneider started out to be a well informed provider who quickly turned into one of those pain providers who would rather get a patient bstuck on medications then offer due diligence in finding other options to treat pain or find it's cause.

Steer clear of Nurse Heiderman as well, extremely ill informed and unable to work with rare disease or complex patients.

Unfortunately, it was an overall poor experiance at Spine and Pain. I really wanted to feel comfortable there as I live close by however a longer drive is well worth it to avoid the headaches this office causes. I highly recommend looking elsewhere. This office is geared towards increasing their profit and moving patients in.and out as quickly as possible.  Which may not be too bad if it meant us patients were in and out of the office promptly as well.|I have been seeing Dr. Schneider and his group of Nurse Practitioners and PA's since 2014.  They are excellent and never more than 10-15 past your scheduled time.  However, I'm really afraid that it might go downhill now that Dr. Schneider is being pulled away from this location and put in the White Marsh office.  I'm crossing my fingers and hope to remain with the BelAir Office.  I totally disagree with a prior review.  The BelAir Office is Extremely Efficient and Very Well Run.  As I said, I am just afraid that since Dr. Schneider is moving to the White Marsh office that things might go downhill.  They really do TREAT PAIN.  I'd be 6 feet under without them.|My husband is a Parkinsons patient with chronic pain.  We have to go here every 30 days to get his Rx for pain medication.  The office is very poorly run with staff that clearly would prefer to be elsewhere.  My husband never sees a doctor.  He sees a staffer who's only job is to issue his Rx for a controlled drug.  She does not check his vitals or weight.  His visit is literally 5 minutes from the time he is called back to the time he comes back out.  It is a Medicare rip off as far as I am concerned.

column40:
I came into the office not knowing what to expect after suffering trauma from an automobile accident. I was seen by Dr. Bruchell for a consultation to treatment for my neck, shoulder and arm. He was professional, informative and compassionate to my needs. Very happy with his care and would recommend him to anyone.|CRNP Alyssa Heiderman is an amazingly skilled professional. She has been able to get to the root of some medical issues that have plagued me for years, and the treatments I have received there have contributed to my overall better health.

She is incredibly knowledgeable, and she makes each patient feel as if they are the most important and have her entire attention. Honestly, The entire team Is a one of a kind including the 2 young ladies at the front desk.  I would highly recommend this establishment.|Whenever I visit National Spine and Pain, I am treated respectfully and efficiently. Maria always asks the right questions and discusses the best ways to address my needs. I have confidence that my treatment is is the result of compassionate consideration.|Came in for lower spine issues due to trauma. It seemed that the doc didn't really listened and brushed it off as SI joint problems, set me up to get shots and if that wouldn't work we'd further troubleshoot. He didn't even touch my back once or did any exercises to see where the pain exactly comes from. My insurance denied the claim for shots at first because of the lack of a physical exam, he convinced them after all and in my desperation I gave it a try. Who am I to second guess a professional?
Well, the shots did not improve anything. Came back 2 weeks later to follow up. Different doc, she said I need imaging and then there's the option for more shots.
They hand you out professionally made pamphlets about the shots. My question is, why hasn't any doctor done an actual physical exam to get to the bottom of the issue? Why not imaging first before you pester my body with an invasive procedure? I'm not going back there, it seems they are just trying to milk you for money and dont care about your issue.

Update: shortly after my 1 star review I finally got in contact with the original doctor. He admitted we should have proceeded to get imaging done first. To not battle my insurance, I've finished the PT sessions that were required.
Now I'm ready to book my MRI and misplaced my referral. Of course I cannot get in contact with anyone once again. This is the most frustrating place I've ever had to deal with. I've been calling for days. Don't expect any favors unless you go there to give them money.
The email sent in their reply does not work anymore either.

Update 2:
Shelly is amazing. She works in scheduling and helped me out with my MRI referral, she sent it out immediately. Nonetheless due to the wording the Dr. left in my notes, my insurance would still not approve my MRI.
I'm at a loss.
My problems got triggered by 2 recent incidents, he emphasized the fact that I was having issues since pregnancy, which is true but totally unrelated, probably, so he can get paid for giving me shots, but not caring about my still persistent issue at all.

Terrible place! Other than Shelly. Do yourself a favor and stay away!|After 7 years of being a loyal patient with Maria Wilson at the National Spine and Pain Center in Bel Air MD, I had to re-locate to SC for work.  I found a National Spine and Pain Center in NC, they sent my medical records etc and Dr. Munoz Gonzales treated me like some sort of criminal, like I walked in off the street.  I called them back in Bel Air and Maria Wilson told me to "go to the hospital" wow!  I spent over $20k there and they have treated me so poorly its disgusting.  Now I finally find a doctor in SC and I can't seem to get a referral from the National Spine and Pain Center in Bel AIr.  Maria Wilson and Dr Burchell should be ashamed of themselves, and from what I hear I am not the only paitent who has been treated poorly.  I am going to expose these folks and have them investigated, this is horrible!|Front desk people are always pleasant and helpful. I see Maria, she is also very pleasant, interested in my well being, answers all my questions, offers suggestions helpful to my pain management, gives her full attention to my concerns, would highly recommend her to anyone.|After a bad experience with a new provider, they refused to allow me to be transferred to another provider. They seem to have no regard to provide quality care for their patients. I will never return.|If you have back leg hip or knee pain this is the place you need to go to. The Doctors and staff know exactly how to treat you and will get you feeling better.

column38: Joyce Mulrooney|Victoria Vaden|Steve Weaver|Gabrielle Rosales|pat sweeney|Stephanie Delucia|Ashley Parisi|Rebecca Draper
column40:
Dr. Tim and his team are AMAZING!!! I've come here for years for spine health and am always so appreciative of their kindness, flexibility with appointments, and the relief I experience physically.  Most recently, I developed a knee problem. Struggled with it for months and finally asked Dr. Tim to take a look. Not just a spine Dr here. I'm over the moon that I'm finally feeling relief. Highly recommended!!!!!|You know, it's funny how life works sometimes. A decade ago, I was just casually scrolling through Groupon looking for deals on massages when I stumbled upon Integrative Physical Health. I thought, "Why not?" and booked an appointment. Little did I know, it was a decision that would literally change my life.

After a free massage and X-ray, he sat me down and gave me some news. Turns out, past head injuries I had suffered severely affected my spine. It was to the point where another fall could have been disastrous. Sounds grim, right?

But here's the thing: Dr. Tim didn't just send me on my way. Instead, he suggested a treatment plan that, I kid you not, has been nothing short of transformative. I never felt pressured to begin care which is why I have no problem paying even now that he is considered out of network for us.

The office staff at Integrative Physical Health? Amazing. They're friendly, professional, and incredibly accommodating. They make you feel like you've been part of their family for years.

Honestly, I even briefly switched to a different practice that was closer so I could walk from my job. While they were nice enough, it just wasn't the same experience.

And when we moved to Florida, I started care there, but bragged about Dr. Tim's to everyone who asked about my chiropractic experience.

After 10 long years since my first visit, I'm back with Dr. Tim and his team, and let me tell you, I couldn't be happier. If you're ever in need, I highly recommend Integrative Physical Health. It's not just about the treatment, it's about the entire experience.|I was experiencing sharp knee pain that made my life miserable. By chance, I received one of Dr. Tim's flyers in the mail, which specifically mentioned knee pain (I never usually read those flyers).

Despite my skepticism, I made an appointment with Dr. Tim. He discovered that the issue was actually in my lumbar/hips, not my knee. After a few adjustments, I was pain-free! If you are experiencing joint pain, I highly recommend consulting with this practice.|I had been getting severe back and neck pain that would cause debilitating headaches on a daily basis. It was getting difficult to work, play with my children, or pick up my baby. I had never done chiropractic care before so I was unsure of what to expect. I found this group through my insurance and am so thankful that I did. I called and they were able to squeeze me in same day for an evaluation and start my adjustments the following week. column40:
What I am about to say is coming from the heart. I am 100% appalled with the behavior of the advanced pain management staff. My elderly and disabled husband Larry Crawford had been a patient of the Augusta Georgia office for 4 years now and we have started to face neglectful and improper care from his pain management doctor. He has visited with Dr. Malia and Angel who have all been so caring and attentive to his needs in term of pain. However I have had my run ins with other staff members. A receptionist by the name of Ms. Angela is constantly speaking to me in a degrading tone and acting as if she has some kind of superiority to me. I am in no way a rude or confrontational person but she has constantly presented a bad attitude to me and though I have spoken to people about her, the attitude persists. I have been made aware of the many staffing changes that have taken place including Dr. Malia and Angel leaving as well as new doctors being brought in and so I have been a hard time in terms of my husband's medication management. He has had his treatment plan switched without first being informed MULTIPLE times and this has caused his pain to skyrocket because he's being supplied with so many different amounts of medication by his doctor because they do not call us they just make their own decisions based off of FDA regulations instead of tuning the care directly to their patients. I am not by any means saying that laws are not laws but there is not and never has been a reason for my husband to be under suspicion of ANYTHING. He has always maintained anything that his Dr asked. Passed drug tests, was always presenting and talking about his pain, and never ran out any earlier than he should. This doctors office has become nothing more than people in white coats there to keep the numbers right. I am sorry if there is anyone who disagrees but I have had it to my wits end with the Augusta Advanced Pain Management Staff!!!! My husband is a PERSON, not just a number and I will not continue to let him be in pain and even risk dependency development because they feel it is ok to continuously lower his prescription dosage without his nor my knowledge. This is not Ok and I will not stand for it any longer!!  I will  be reaching out to proper advocates who support elderly people dealing with chronic health issues. WE HAVE RIGHTS TOO!!
DEA Enforcement versus Pain Practice
May 16, 2011 - The coverage typically highlights investigations, prosecutions, and doctors leaving pain medicine and abandoning pain patients. Anxiety levels ...
Missing: maintaining|Show results with: maintaining
People also ask
Do doctors have an obligation to treat pain?
Al Overview
+3
Yes, doctors have a recognized ethical and legal obligation to treat pain, meaning they should actively assess and manage a patient's pain as part of their standard of care; failing to do so can be considered medical negligence.
Key points about this obligation:
Ethical principle:
The medical field widely considers pain relief as a fundamental ethical duty, with many professional codes explicitly stating physicians should strive to alleviate suffering and pain.
Patient rights:
Patients have a right to appropriate pain management, and undertreating pain can be considered a violation of their rights.
Legal implications:
In many jurisdictions, not adequately addressing a patient's pain can lead to malpractice lawsuits.
However, important considerations exist:
Individualized approach:
While pain management is a priority, the appropriate treatment will vary based on the patient's specific condition, medical history, and potential risks.
Open communication:
Doctors should engage in open dialogue with patients to understand their pain experience and collaboratively decide on the best treatment plan.|I have been a patient of Advanced Pain Management for numerous years following injuries sustained on my job as a State Trooper for 30 years.  These injuries left me permanently disabled.  Here I was so fortunate to meet Dr Van Malia!  Dr Malia is one of the most knowledgeable, kind hearted Pain Specialists that I have EVER met.  From the start he listened to me, read my LENGTHY case charts from the various surgeons and pain specialists that have worked on me over the years, all without making any significant progress in reducing pain symptoms.  Dr Malia worked tirelessly working out courses of treatment designed to give me better quality of life, never once telling me there was nothing more to be done as I heard SO many times before!  Now Dr Malia worked with my insurance company to get me approved for a spinal cord stimulator designed to improve life quality.  Initial testing was impressive in pain reduction levels.  The only problems are the two Medtronic representatives that have constantly failed to work with me to fine tune the settings to achieve maximum benefits.  Dr Malia continues to get them to do their jobs and follow protocols even though his duties ended with the test phases. How many Doctors do you know that continuously keeps going above and beyond his responsibilities because he truly 100 % CARES about his patients welfare!   Thank you Dr Malia for your caring, your friendship and always being there for me!|I was extremely pleased with the Doctor Hemant Yagnick evaluation of me and my MRI of my lower back which is extremely painful. He stated that based on the MRI he saw of my lower back spine that he recommended that I have surgery to help do away with the extreme pain and issues that affect my lower back and leg. I told him that the VA has refused to perform surgery on my lower spine back. So he said he was going to send a evaluation letter to the VA recommending surgeon and also having the same evaluation letter given to me that I can use at Fort Eisenhower Hospital to maybe have them perform the surgery.|I have been a patient at Advanced Pain Mgmt for 13 years and they are the best! Dr. Yagnick and Karen are compassionate, kind, and so smart. They always go above and beyond to help their patients. So very thankful for this practice.|Dr. Yanick has been my doctor for over 20yaers he has given me injections and has never caused me any pain he is the only doctor that i would ever let give me injections in my back if anyone ever needs injections he is the best doctor for that. He is a great doctor that cares about his patients.|This professional group of specialists are second to none. The office staff are friendly and helpful. Don't think twice about seeking

column40:
My experience with family first is pretty good. The staff welcomes you with a warm smile and very kind. I do see Dr. Agrawal from time to time and each time, its with a big smile and a warm welcoming. Everything is usually explained to me in details which I liked if I have any questions. Lately I've been getting in and out pretty quickly from the office. I appreciate everyone and everything that they all do for me.|They were quite busy today but they worked through the patients smoothly and efficiently. I received excellent feedback and learned new information regarding my daily questionnaire. Everyone was warm and friendly.|I missed my appointment this morning and I called the staff and they got me back in today. I really like this staff. They are very friendly and nice.|The staff is great they have people skills they greet you with a smile all day long you're in and out in a good time frame even when they're behind and the lobby is full the doctor is friendly and he explains everything he's going to do before he does it it's their policies I don't agree with $50 if you're late a minute after the allowed 15 minute grace period,$50 if you call days before your appointment telling them why you can't come that day at that time bc something unexpected came up,$50 if you miss your appointment, this is my true story with family first pain clinic I was referred to family first I was a new client to them and I had to do a urine screen for the first time with them they gave me the address I googled it and I thought I could find the address but I didn't find the address to where the facility was so called family first and explained to them what my situation was long story short bc I couldn't find the facility where they do the urine screens I missed my appointment and they charged me $50 when I went to my next appointment I explained to them that it wasn't my fault and they shouldn't charge me $50bc it's an honest mistake it could've happened to anyone they still charged me $50 so I had to pay $100 or I couldn't see the doctor I was so pissed off bc I couldn't believe they could do me and I know I'm not the only person this has happened to like this their policies suck like a duck in a truck|I was recommended to this place. I spoke with some guy that didn't have good English. He told me what I needed and I said ok I needed a few weeks to get all that information but never scheduled an appointment. So called Drs they said everything was faxed over. Called and talked to same guy he said , yes, all my information was faxed over. Said yes to every question. He assured me everything they needed was faxed over so made the same. For those of you who live in Georgia it was a FREAKING HOT day in July. But I had the appointment so I arrived 15 mins early. Found the right door after walking around and knocking on every other door. The front steps are not easy to walk up. It was 112 out that day and I use oxygen. It was awful. So I get in there told the sweet lady behind the counter everything the guy told me that everything was faxed over and I'm here to pee in my cup. She said we don't have any of your paperwork. I was already so hot from having to be out that day. I started crying. I said the guy I talked to said everything was here but she said nope. She said without your paperwork and referral you can't keep this appointment and since you can't we have to charge you $50 for missing it. I lost it. Crying and telling her how hard it was for me to even come out today. Having a hard time with the heat. Nothing. She went from a sweet lady to not one. She said until your paperwork is here we have to reschedule your appointment and now you owe us $50. Well I said I will not be paying the $50.

Long story short. The end up saying next appointment my paperwork wasn't there and now she said you owe us $100. I said NO. I said I know my stuff was faxed over and they said no.

End in the end. They did have my paperwork. They had me mixed up with someone else. Even after they said they messed up. They still refused to take the $100 off. I said y'all made the mistake and had my paperwork all this time and still want me to pay $100 because y'all got me mixed up with someone else and she said sorry. I refused to pay. I shouldn't have had to if they did their job right.

So warning DO NOT try this place. Before that they tried to charge me another $50 because I couldn't pee enough . That would have been $150 plus they were also filing my insurance.

This place has no intention of helping you if you need a pain dr. Just a bunch of "towel head type" of people that just want your money and file false claims on your insurance.

Please report this place if you haven't.|Great experience. Dr. Agrawal and his team went over and above to assist me today. They are always friendly and helpful. A+|They turned me away and I have a debilitating genetic disorder and they made me come three times to
Charge me for drug tests & a nerve study test which put me down for 5 days and was in excruciating pain from it and triggered 2 knee dislocations then waited 6 months and called pretending they would see me then called back the very next day and said sorry so very unprofessional & I would not go here and I'm warning others as much as possible especially on my genetic groups Athens Facebook page for Ehlers Danlos|They have an very nice receptionist..
Staff is always pleasant

column40: Dr.Parimi has always made himself available to me for any question I may have. He is consistently on time, which is very refreshing and has many suggestions as far as herbs, diet and alternative therapies to try to improve my overall quality of life. As far as doctors go, he is always professional, gives me all the time I need for each visit and isn't  judgmental in any way. I would recommend him to anyone who is looking for a very different pain management experience.|I have been seeing Dr. Parimi for several years now. He is by far the best doctor i have ever been involved with. He was very thorough in his initial assessment of my situation  and suggested several different treatment options. You can tell on your first visit that he really cares and knows what he is talking about. Very down to earth doctor. His scheduling is awesome. There is no wait time for your appointment, at which he is very attentive in making sure your treatment option is working well for you. Dr. Parimi is very professional, but also someone you would call a friend!|I had my first appointment with Dr. Parimi yesterday.  Prior to even seeing him, he spent a considerable amount of time on the phone with me discussing my situation.  This, in and of itself, is very unusual and greatly appreciated!  I was switching pain management doctors, and I was so happy to be able to consult with him prior to officially making the change.  I was so pleased with my first appointment.  I can be a hard critic of pain management centers, where my personal issues are barely addressed. Combine that attitude with an innate crankiness when I'm not feeling at all well and the result can be much less than pleasant at times. This visit was a world away from previous experiences elsewhere. It was good to be treated with professionalism and care. When I say Dr. Parimi made me feel that I was in very safe hands, and even made me feel comfortable enough to share my experiences in truth, then you can believe he is the best. I am truly grateful and I don't get that awful feeling of dread anymore over being in pain management.  I also appreciate Dr. Parimi's partnership agreement with his clients, as I am a by the book type of person.   I don't think words can describe how happy I am.  And, it does not hurt that he is a fellow corgi owner!|As a middle-aged busy executive with chronic pain, Dr Parimi has helped me regain control of my daily routine and hectic schedule. My treatment includes proactive approaches to compliment my medications. His practice is focused and effective. Our appointments have always run on time and the office environment is soothing in itself. For over two years I have been comforted by the dedication to a working patient/physician pain management plan. Many thanks!!|I have seen many doctors over the years, for a variety of health conditions. Dr. Parimi is the first to take the time to sit and talk with me, answer questions, and actively investigate something he wasn't sure about so that we could be on the same page. He is considerate and honest, and I've always had the sincere feeling that he had my best interests at heart. If I need to contact him, he is available, and if I have a question about something not on my medication or exercise regime, he is happy to look into it on the spot for me. I would not hesitate to recommend Dr. Parimi to anyone seeking assistance with pain management.|Dr Parimi is great to work with.  He is professional, personable, and always wants to make sure that I am being provided the best care possible.  I would recommend anyone that has serious pain issues to use Dr Parimi.  He has made my life much better, after numerous surgeries from playing college football I was at the point where I couldn't go outside and play with my children because I hurt too much.  Now they have trouble keeping up with me!  I've used him for the last 2 years and will continue to see him for the foreseeable future.|Dr Parimi is hands on with his patients. Very polite, professional and extremely knowledgeable about different pain mangement options to put you on the road to recovery. Takes the necessary time to get to know you and is dedicated to assisting your pain issues heads on. Never makes you feel like your just another patient. Which is so hard to find with so many Doctors these days.Great bedside manner! Nice & quiet laid back office environment also.|Dr Parimi is very kind and listens to what I say,  feeling and what I'm going through. He takes the time to make sure that my treatment is right for me. He takes great pride in what he does, is flexible and very easy to work with! I have been to Another pain management place years ago that was a TOTAL nightmare!!!  Dr Parimi sees you AT YOUR APPT TIME!!! He spends time I need, gets medical records to me and insurance company when requested and in a timely manner(immediately!). I have been dealing with many doctors and institutions, and could only wish to have received this level of professionalism with them! Emory could take a lesson from Dr Parimi!!!!

I have been a patient of Dr Marshall for years. I absolutely love the care that I get from him and the NP Monica McGowan. If you're looking for a Dr that  knows what he is doing and how to hire the best staff to look after you. Look no farther.|Most professional and clean doctor's office! Pain management can be a hard road and I'm so glad to have found Dr. Marshall. He understands women's pain issues related to endometriosis and other conditions better than most OBGYNs I've been to. Highly recommend.|My care was excellent! Dr. Xion explained procedures to me and had visual diagrams  of what she was gong to perform.  Her staff was very friendly and professional.  I would recommend my family
Members  and friends to
Definitely seek this medical office with pain problems

O|I've known this physician and his nurse Monica McGowan for quite some time. I met them at another practice and because of some issues, I lost track of both Dr. Marshall and Nurse McGowan, NP. One day, while scanning Google, I first saw Dr. Marshall. Some MD's develop a deep trust with their patients and I truly believe that they must keep it! In Pain Management, it's very imperative that a patient MUST SHOW that MD that they're doing what's prescribed! I myself am taking strong medicine! At this juncture, he knows I balk at the more invasive procedures that's offered. Every MD needs a good Nurse. I understood that when I was a scrub tech. I met many great Nurses. Monica McGowan mainly works with Dr. Marshall and she's a great Nurse. They're hard to find! She seemed not to talk much to me in the beginning so, I didn't get to know her like I did Dr. Marshall, and even now, the only time there's any interaction with her is at appointment time. This past July, I was hospitalized and even now, I'm recovering. She saw me a few weeks ago. I wanted to discuss this matter with them both, but Dr. Marshall was at his Paces Ferry location. So far, the trigger point's holding. My epidural's scheduled for the day before Thanksgiving. After the interaction with Ms. McGowan, NP and how Dr. Marshall and his medical staff handles change in the office, it seems to me, I'm guaranteed relief and if you decide on Dr Marshall, and Ms. McGowan, NP. you too will experience satisfaction and great relief. (I bet Nurse Monica's smiling at how I kept using NP.) She's a good one and would make a great P.A. Still, she has great knowledge of how Dr. Marshall wants things to go in his practice. I use one word: Positivity. Without that, look for again one word: Chaos. It's no chaos at Regenerative Spine and Pain. They are all good at what they do. Dr. Marshall's double board certified, and graduated from Harvard out of Boston, Emory, and Morehouse, the latter two: Atlanta. Dr. Jennifer Xiong a Harvard graduate is with Dr. Marshall, and Dr. Christopher Williams. They ALL, including Monica, Nurse Practitioner, at his practice, are highly trained at pain relief! This "snake oil" they sell on the Net won't hack it and it's a waste of time, but this Regenerative Spine and Pain is part and parcel of how I was wearing nice shoes! Dr. Marshall and his team's making it again, possible. I recommend this medical practice.|Everyone was polite and energetic with positive attitudes. While the appointment seemed fast. The nurses and doctors listened to everything I needed to say and they gave me positive feedback and hope. Even check out had me leaving with a smile.|I've received the best care ever. I have no complaints. The staff is amazing, office is always spotless and no communication issues. I would definitely refer family and friends.|The office asked me to take a drug test, which I agreed to, as I knew they wanted to make sure any medication that was perhaps prescribed didn't interfere with anything in my system.  I waited 30 - 45 mins. to be seen by the Dr. with no update or apology for the long wait. A few weeks later I see they billed my insurance for $600.00 for ONE DRUG TEST!  First of all no one informed me that it would be an additional charge outside of my copay or just possibly an additional charged in general.  They billed TWO separate billing codes to my insurance for ONE DRUG TEST!  I did however still go back to get an injection because I was in pain and the preauthorization process for the injection through my insurance had already begun.  The injection was a  2 HOUR wait! and I was informed of 2 different amounts both of which was not accurate, as now I'm expected to pay 3x the amount AFTER the procedure. Had I been informed of this prior to the procedure I would have held off or not had the procedure done at all!  This office does not have the best communication or transparency.

***UPDATE***

There were 2 claims submitted to my insurance with the SAME billing code for 1 procedure.  I was told one charge was for the Dr. and one was for the hospital/procedure location, but both charges are in the same amount and now I'm being asked to cover 3x the amount I was told I was required to pay at the time of procedure!!|My first visit at Regenerative Spine and Pain Specialists was very reassuring. Office personnel very professional and friendly. Received an excellent explanation and response to my questions by Dr Xiong. Looking forward to my next visit.

column2: Northeast Georgia Physicians Group Interventional Pain Medicine
column3:
At NGPG Interventional Pain Management, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive solutions for acute and chronic pain. Our practice features board-certified pain management physicians who deliver exceptional specialty care for patients suffering from spine pain, nerve pain, and musculoskeletal conditions.

Advanced Pain Management Solutions

We specialize in non-surgical treatment options utilizing state-of-the-art image-guided fluoroscopy procedures, all performed in the comfort of our physician office located in Medical Park 1. Our services include:

  • Image-guided procedures for spine pain

  • Targeted treatments for nerve pain

  • Specialized care for musculoskeletal conditions

  • Comprehensive pain management plans

We understand how debilitating chronic pain can be, which is why our team is committed to developing personalized treatment plans that address your specific needs. Visit NGPG Interventional Pain Medicine or call us at +1 770-848-7246 to schedule your consultation at our Gainesville location: 1315 Jesse Jewell Pkwy #300, Gainesville, GA 30501.
column11: NGPG Interventional Pain Management is dedicated to the treatment of acute and chronic pain. Our board certified pain management physician provides high quality specialty care including image guided procedures for spine pain, nerve pain and musculoskeletal pain. Our center focuses on the non-surgical treatment of pain, utilizing image guided flouroscopy, in the comfort of our physician office located in Medical Park 1.

column3:
At Interventional Pain Specialists of Georgia (IPSG), we are dedicated to delivering exceptional pain management solutions under the expert leadership of Dr. Sackdinanh Nok Keomahathai (Dr. Nok). Our comprehensive approach to pain management combines cutting-edge interventional techniques with personalized care plans to help patients regain control of their lives. As a Board-Certified specialist in both Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation and Pain Medicine, Dr. Nok brings extensive expertise through his Fellowship Training in Sports Medicine and Electrodiagnostic Medicine to every patient interaction.

Our Specialized Services Include:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Comprehensive diagnostic evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Sports medicine rehabilitation

  • Electrodiagnostic testing

As the President of the Georgia Society for Interventional Pain Physicians, Dr. Nok ensures our clinic maintains the highest standards of care in the field. We pride ourselves on our clean, welcoming environment and compassionate staff who are committed to addressing each patient's unique needs. Located in Cartersville, our state-of-the-art facility at 650 Henderson Drive offers convenient access to premier pain management services. For more information or to schedule an appointment, visit Interventional Pain Specialists of Georgia or call us at +1 470-274-2800.

column3:
Atlanta's Premier Pain Management Specialists

At Pain Consultants of Atlanta, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Atlanta metro area. Located at 1800 Peachtree Rd in Atlanta, our specialized medical clinic offers personalized treatment plans designed to address chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified physicians, led by respected specialists like Dr. Callaway and Dr. Pleasant, brings decades of combined experience in pain medicine to every patient consultation. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, ensuring each individual receives thorough evaluations and customized care plans.

Our comprehensive services include:

  • Interventional procedures including epidural spine blocks and cortisone treatments

  • Advanced diagnostic testing to identify pain sources

  • Personalized treatment plans for chronic pain management

  • Specialized lumbar procedures including lumbar puncture patches

What sets us apart is our commitment to compassionate care. We understand that living with pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we take the time to listen, explain options, and develop solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. For more information or to schedule a consultation, visit our website at painconsultantsofatlanta.com or call us at +1 404-351-7654.

Thank you Christopher Watson|This long-awaited review is to express my immense gratitude for the exceptional care I received at Pain Consultants of Atlanta. On 9/18/2024 I recently had a lumbar puncture patch performed there, and initially, I was quite nervous. However, my anxieties were quickly put to rest thanks to the outstanding interactions I had with everyone at the clinic, from the front desk to the nurses and doctors.

Dr. Callaway was absolutely phenomenal. He was incredibly meticulous, which I greatly appreciated. His caring approach ensured that everything was done accurately and in great detail, which put my mind at ease.

I also want to give a special shout-out to the PCA Surgical Team: Lionellie D., Chandra A., Cherelle B., and Jay B. Your professionalism and dedication to patient care were evident throughout my entire experience.

This clinic will undoubtedly be my first choice for any future pain issues. Keep up the excellent work, and thank you for everything!|My doctor sent a referral to a specific MD and every day for 6 days I tried to reach them to schedule an appt but after requesting appt online, leaving 3 phone messages and surgeon referral being ignored, I gave up. column2: Ashford Pain Solutions: James Ashford, MD
column3:
At Ashford Pain Solutions, we understand that chronic pain can be both frustrating and debilitating. Led by Dr. James Ashford, MD, our Athens-based pain management practice is dedicated to restoring your quality of life through personalized care. We recognize that each patient's pain journey is unique, which is why we take the time to listen to your concerns and develop individualized treatment plans.

Our Comprehensive Approach to Pain Management

We believe effective pain management begins with accurate diagnosis. Our process involves:

  • Thorough evaluation to determine the root cause of your pain

  • Personalized treatment plans tailored to your specific condition

  • Interventional pain procedures when appropriate

  • Ongoing support throughout your recovery journey

Located at 1000 Hawthorne Ave, Suite J in Athens, GA, we're committed to being with you every step of the way toward feeling like yourself again. Your pain matters to us, and we're here to help you find relief. Learn more about our services by visiting Ashford Pain Solutions or call us at +1 706-286-8344 to schedule your consultation.
column11:
Chronic pain can be frustrating and debilitating. At Ashford Pain Solutions, we understand the impact pain can have on your quality of life. We recognize that you may feel like you are all alone in your struggle - that your voice is not being heard and your individual needs are not being met. That's where Ashford Interventional Pain Solutions is different.

We are with you every step of the way on this journey toward restoring you to feeling like yourself again. Our process is to first determine a diagnosis for your pain. You can't effectively treat pain without knowing what is causing it. After determining your diagnosis, Dr. Ashford formulates a personalized treatment plan. Your pain matters to us!

Doctor explained my treatment in words I understood.I'm so excited about my treatment plan!!|The staff was friendly and kind and Dr.Polk was very nice.|I felt like I was being used for insurance fraud. He continued the care of another physician because I moved but he barely examined me. I got an additional injury while in his care and instead of him doing something for it he just told me the pain will go away on its own. I told him I couldn't be prescribed ibuprofen because of my kidneys and he sent it to my pharmacy 3x's all different occasions and says it was done in error (even after I told him about the first incident). I left and am now seeing a real pain management doctor smh. Watch some of these GA doctors they are money hungry and need to care more about their patients than what insurance they carry.|This use to be the best drs office you could walk into, I started two years ago with Dr Ellison, she was fantastic the office staff was fantastic.. then one day I walked in and was told she wasn't there anymore I would be seeing Dr Polk. He was ok but wasn't Dr Ellison. The last year they have had numerous staff come and go, only one that's still there since I started. She's wonderful and she truly took care of me. The icing on the cake for me was when I went in for my procedure they let a girl that was 'interviewing' to be hired stick me with a needle to put my IV, you could tell she was not comfortable doing it, she stuck me 5 different times before their anesthesiologist (that watched this girl continue to stick me and tell her to keep sticking me in the same arm)  stepped in and did it. Then when I called to cancel the second round of the procedure due to my husband having surgery, the girl that answered the phone was new of course was ugly, made me feel like a junkie for asking to schedule my normal monthly appointment and said 'I mean are you out of medicine or something?' No it's called common courtesy to give notice I won't make that appointment and need to schedule another weeks in advance. Fast forward I come into my appointment on a Wednesday Dr Polk isn't there, Dr Nelson is, no pharmacy would fill my prescriptions because his signature being on Dr polks prescription paper. I went back and forth for days with this office being told different stuff and went without my medications I have been taking 2+ years for 7 days and it didn't phase them at all. I am truly disappointed at how I was done, and hope the office staff learns how to treat people.|Dr. Polk and his staff are very professional, kind and caring. They definitely treat you like family with the care they provide. I would definitely recommend them.

column3:
At Georgia Pain Management, we specialize in cutting-edge interventional pain management techniques that form the cornerstone of our patient care approach in Woodstock. As one of medicine's newest and most exciting specialties, our practice follows the trend toward minimally invasive therapies that provide effective pain relief with fewer side effects.

Expert Leadership in Pain Management

Our founder and medical director, Dr. James Ellner, has been a leader in interventional pain management for almost 20 years. Dr. Ellner brings exceptional credentials to our practice, including board certifications from both the American Board of Anesthesiology and the American Board of Pain Medicine. His active membership in prestigious organizations such as the American Society of Interventional Pain Physicians, Georgia Society of Interventional Pain Physicians, and International Spine Intervention Society ensures we stay at the forefront of pain management innovations.

Our Comprehensive Services Include:

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Minimally invasive therapies

  • Chronic pain management solutions

We're committed to providing compassionate, responsive care that helps our patients regain mobility and improve quality of life. Located at 120 Stone Bridge Pkwy #420 in Woodstock, we welcome patients seeking effective pain control solutions. Learn more about our approach to pain management by visiting our website at Georgia Pain Management or call us at +1 770-544-1000 to schedule your consultation.

The founder and medical director of Georgia Pain Management is Dr. James Ellner, a leader in interventional pain management for almost 20 years. Dr. Ellner is board certified by the American Board of Anesthesiology and the American Board of Pain Medicine.

Dr. Ellner is an active member of numerous societies including the American Society of Interventional Pain Physicians, Georgia Society of Interventional Pain Physicians and International Spine Intervention Society.

We have seen Dr. Ellner and his staff for several years. We have been pleased with his care and the concern he shows for his patients. I have seen doctors who care, but I am telling you he really stands head and shoulders above the rest. If you have chronic pain I suggest you come see Dr. Ellner.|Dr. Ellner and his staff were friendly. I was extremely upset to be asked for a urine sample so they could conduct a drug screen.  I pushed back and was told it was necessary.  Keep in mind I was in extreme pain and already told I needed a spinal fusion. I complied with the request, passed of course and was taken back to prepare for the epidurals.

Much to my surprise I have now received a bill from the company that provides the drug testing services.  I feel I should have been told there would be a separate bill for a service I tried to deny.  I will add they greatly reduced it from $1370 to 102. I'm 54 years old and in screaming pain referred by a Neurosurgeon in the network  Of course I'm not a drug addict trying to jump from dr. to dr.

I finally ended up at Emory having the same procedure and no drug test was required.|I absolutely love Dr. Either and his staff. Before we got referred to Dr.Ellner, I was beginning to wonder if Billy McCollum would ever have relief from his pain. Now, he has!!! column40: I have been going to this office for some time now.  I have encountered many problems with receiving my prescriptions. I stay in constant pain and do everything that he asked me to do including injections. But he only offers one type of injections. column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Metro Atlanta

At Pain Care, LLC, we are dedicated to delivering high-quality, cost-effective pain management across our eight locations throughout Georgia. Founded in 2008 by renowned board-certified anesthesiologist Vincent Galan, MD, MBA, DABPM, our practice has spent more than a decade helping patients find relief from chronic pain conditions. We specialize in treating:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Joint pain

  • Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS)

  • And many other chronic pain conditions

Our approach focuses on cutting-edge, evidence-based non-surgical treatments that require no incisions or medication to significantly reduce or resolve pain. We're committed to ethical pain management that improves quality of life for our patients. Visit our official website to learn more about how we can help you manage your chronic pain and regain control of your life.
column11:
About The Practice

With eight locations throughout Georgia, Pain Care, LLC, strives to deliver high-quality, cost-effective, comprehensive, and ethical pain management solutions to patients in Metro Atlanta suffering from chronic pain. Renowned board-certified anesthesiologist Vincent Galan, MD, MBA, DABPM, founded the practice in 2008.
For more than a decade, Pain Care, LLC, has pursued its mission to treat chronic pain patients with cutting-edge technology and evidence-based non-surgical treatments. These treatments require no incisions or medication to resolve or significantly reduce back pain, neck pain, neuropathic pain, joint pain, complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS) problems, and more.

column2: Georgia Pain Management: James Ellner, MD
column3:
At Georgia Pain Management in Woodstock, Georgia, we specialize in providing nonsurgical relief from acute and chronic pain to patients of all ages. Under the expert guidance of Dr. James Ellner, MD, our board-certified interventional pain management specialist, we understand that pain creates both physical and emotional barriers to healing. We make unwavering patient care the cornerstone of our practice, recognizing that persistent pain often continues despite careful treatment, making chronic pain management challenging for both patients and their physicians.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We focus on interventional treatments as the foundation of our patient care approach, addressing the complex nature of chronic pain that can increase risks of:

  • Physical disability

  • Drug dependence

  • Psychosocial dysfunction

Dr. Ellner brings extensive experience to each personalized treatment plan, offering compassionate care in a professional environment. Located at 120 Stone Bridge Pkwy #420 in Woodstock, GA, we invite you to discover how our specialized approach can help restore your quality of life. Visit our website or call us at +1 770-626-5282 to schedule your consultation today.
column11:
Georgia Pain Management in Woodstock, Georgia, offers nonsurgical relief from acute and chronic pain to people of all ages.
James Ellner, MD, is an experienced, board-certified interventional pain management expert who understands that pain is a physical and emotional block to healing, and he makes unwavering patient care the focus of his practice.
Pain often persists despite careful treatment, making chronic pain management difficult for patients and their physicians. Chronic pain also increases the risk of physical disability, drug dependence, and psychosocial dysfunction.
Interventional treatments form the basis of all patient care at Georgia Pain Management.

column49:
Change pain docs, and that's not easy. If you have been seeing this current doc for a while, a new doc might not accept you without a letter from the current one stating that you are a patient in GOOD STANDING... in other words, your not a drug addict in this for the drugs.

I highly recommend Southern pain and spine in jasper, GA. They have a very common sense approach to pain... start with xrays, etc, and for me they started me into physical therapy, which really helped not only bring some lasting relief but also uncovered the real causes of my pain!

Her name is Jordan Tate,MD and she and her assistant Emily Cummins are fantastic. You won't be sorry.

Some of the personnel here needs to learn better bedside manners.|Amy and Dr. Patel were amazing! I felt heard! After 3 months in a lot of pain and still no answers as to what is actually wrong I finally feel like someone listened about the pain I've been in instead of simply disregarding it. THANK YOU SO MUCH for listening and HEARING!!!|Everyone was friendly and you don't have to wait long. I only have one complaint.  They kicked me out of the clinic saying that my urine  test after 1 month and just a couple of days before my next appointment, was dirty. They know that same day if the test is dirty and they wouldn't  have given me any narcotics.  I don't know why  all of a sudden they came to this conclusion.  Maybe because I  rescheduled  my appointment  the day of my appointment. My blood pressure  was dangerously low and I had to be transported to the hospital by ambulance.   I assured them that the only drugs I  take are the ones prescribed to me. Since they  insisted that my test was dirty, they could have taken a hair sample at no cost to them instead  they chose to kick me out the clinic. Now I have problems getting into another pain clinic. And I  truly am in pain. My MRI confirms that. What recourse dose a patient  have if they disagree with the urine test.  NONE|My office visit has always been punctual from the time I walk in the door. I appreciate Dr Keiffer taking the time to answer my questions & discuss any concerns I have. Talk about a profiling bias of their patients.|The doctors are amazing! Very thorough, caring, knowledgeable, and unbelievably nice. They gave us hope!|Yvette diligently helped me with a bit of confusion I had. She stayed with me writing a note in detail to share with Dr Gage. I called a few times in a row as she remained polite, kind, and through! She is a gem!!!Caitlin checks me in each appointment with a smile and a welcoming spirit! She always has that smile and makes all of us feel important! Then, often she will go about setting me up for my next appointment! I feel it is my great fortune to come see Dr Gage and Rachel. I wouldn't go anywhere else!!|Great visit. The doctor is very knowledgeable and will actually listen to you about your pain.

column49:
Good Morning
Thank you for reaching out to us.  We do accept your insurance plans.  A referral isn't required  to schedule an appointment but if possible, it's best to have your prior GP visit notes, any imaging, etc but it's not required.   You can schedule your appointment within the same week of calling.  I hope I've  answered your questions.  Thank you again for reaching out to us.

Compassionate Care, One Patient at a Time

Our objective is to help patients regain and improve their quality of life through personalized treatment plans delivered with genuine compassion. As specialized pain management physicians in Lawrenceville, we offer a comprehensive range of services including:

column40:
I would give this a five the staff is really accommodating and you get in very easily. However, I was giving a lot of forms to fill out before my procedure. Nobody discussed any of them with me prior During or after many of them discussed complications, etc., nobody explained side effects, etc. afterwards this was a little concerning to me. I have had many operations mini procedures in my life and whenever you're messing with the spinal cord, I feel like there should be at least a review of the Procedure with the doctor or nurse practitioner. I asked about signing the forms and the front desk said they would go over all of them with me when we got into the exam room. This did not happen. I went under an anesthesia and woke in a wheelchair was pushed out to my car quickly with No aftercare instructions.
I am seeing my regular doctor today as I have developed a rash at the injection site. No one has called from the clinic to check on my progress like I would normally expect after any outpatient procedure or anesthesia. I really like the physician that I had initially but that's not who performed the procedure. I was surprised by another Doctor Who said he would be doing it. All this being said the clinic is clean the people are friendly, helpful, and waiting was left to a minimum.|Been going here quite awhile now. About a year ago I wanted off opiods and did so. They kept calling me for months to come back. I decided to give it one more go and they right away not only wanted me back on opiods but increased it to the max dose. I've followed all their rules and guidelines and then get told that my recent urine test had "small traces of cocaine" in it which would be impossible since I do not do that kind of thing, I'm drug tested for work and drug tested for another medication. On top of it I have a heart condition and on a stimulant for ADD and with said heart condition I have regular tests, EKGs and blood work done to make sure I can stay with the ADD medication. Basically if I did cocaine I would have a heart attack so it's not possible. Although with this information as well as clean history and record and only back on opiods because they begged and harassed me for months and now I am dependent on them, they kicked me out and also didn't give me any medication to ween off or find another doctor. I am in process of taking legal action for malpractice, especially getting me hooked on an opioid I didn't want to be on in first place with them insisting it was perfectly fine.|At the age of 68 years, having just moved to Georgia, not knowing any doctors, and having suffered chronic back pain for over 40 years, I never dreamed I would find a doctor who could give me relief from the pain. Too many have tried and failed. After my first injection... nothing. But after the second two, I am PAIN-FRE I didn't believe that it would relieve my sciatic nerve pain either, which would not allow me to stand for more than 10-15 minutes, could not find a comfortable position, and even pain pills didn't help. But EUREKA, the nerve pain is gone,..COMPLETELY!!! THANK YOU SUMMIT SPINE AND JOINT!!! I am a patient for life!!|If you're looking for a personable practice who looks out for what treatment best suits you then Summit Spine and Joint Centers is the place you should go. I had a discrepancy with some paperwork and was handling it by phone for two days. I spoke to several nice and helpful associates. One in particular Tory remembered my exact reason I was calling back and altogether they were able to fulfill my issue without having to make the drive to the office. The whole staff is respectful, courteous, and willing to help. Thank y'all very much.|I've been coming here for a couple years now. The front desk staff attitudes have improved immensely!!!!! The young ladies that WERE there carried themselves in a way that caused patients to feel as if they were a bother. Cold, blank stares, monotone voices. I'm glad that there has been a change. Great job. Scott is A-1. He listens and is very personable. He is certainly THE BEST provider here.
The young lady, ladies in transport as of November 5-6, 2024, need SERIOUS training in workplace etiquette. Their conversations in the presence of patients is TOTALLY unacceptable. The cussing and obnoxious, rambunctious attitudes are tiring to say the least. While awaiting my procedure I was subjected to 25-30 minutes of NONE STOP, gossiping, cussing, and LOUD trivial conversations. While the "grown-ups" on staff noticeably separated themselves from the young ladies in obvious irritation. The young ladies were COMPLETELY oblivious to the fact that they were AT WORK and in a PROFESSIONAL environment. Certainly I'm not saying that anyone should lose their job. HOWEVER, they need to be made aware that their conduct is unacceptable in this type of environment and that there is a process of maturation that needs to take place|I must say that the couple of times I've been at Summit,  I was treated with respect and dignity. Dr Patel, ( he's adorable by the way) listen to my concerns and didn't rush me off like some kind of medical number. Doc, you rock!  Please don't ever lose the bedside you provide your patients,  or rather me.
Keep doing what you do!!|Summit Spine and Joint has been a Godsend for me in helping with the chronic pain I suffer with. I've been receiving care here for over two years and the doctors and staff have been very professional and caring. They haven't stopped on continuously trying different procedures, covered by my insurance, that offer me the most benefits.|The Lawrenceville office is my favorite by far. The atmosphere is much nicer, cleaner and roomie. Wait times are minimal and the staff so friendly and always treating me professionally and courteous.
As for the Decatur office, Alot of the staff are nice but the few bad apples there, especially at the front desk, Made me never want to go there again and drive the extra 15 miles to Lawrenceville. Maybe you will get treated better but don't say I didn't warn you!
