column38: Belinda Culpepper|Roberta Blanton|Walker Holder|Kim Kelley|Teraisa Patterson|Lyn T.|Meka XOXO|Brenda Mclaughlin
column40:
This place is terrible. On day 1 I had incidents with the data entry Ricky, the way he treat patients is horrible. He argues with them back and forth, I believe he tries to set the tone for how things are run there. Until I met the doctor Dr. Moore, then I understood why. This man is a brute. I missed an appt Oct 1, because my phone broke( they send you reminders).Well they reschedule me for the following week Oct 8th. Well my car broke down, a tree fell in my house and I lost electricity during the hurricane Helene. I got a ride from a friend and I thought my appt was for 9:30am instead it was for 9:00am so I was actually 17 minutes late. While in the way there I called to let them know I was indeed on my way, the lady told me that I was now late and would not be seen and that I wouldn't be seen at all for the month and that ALL APPOINTMENTS HAVE BEEN CANCELED AS WELL. In all my years of living and dealing with doctors, I have missed, rescheduled and been late and I have never seen where a doctor refuse to see you or to reschedule an appt.  Their bedside manners in dealing with patients who are in need is horrible. I since found another pain doctor altogether. This doctor talks to you any kind of way, so the staff talks to you any kind of way. This doctor is a terrible choice. Beware Aware of Dr. Moore at North Georgia Pain Clinic at 285 Boulevard NE Unit 640 Atlanta Ga. 30312|I like the fact that I usually don't have to wait for a long time. The Medical Assistants are nice and the doctor is friendly most of the time.  However,  sometimes doctors need to try and put themselves in the patients shoes.  Myself personally I have more going on than just back pain, sometimes the pain I have is more debilitating and I take what's prescribed to me for the most part as planned.  Sometimes I have gone of course but not on purpose.  I'm satisfied with Dr. M.

He is really a nice person if you learn him. Thank you staff at the Atlanta office.|Dr Morrison has restored my ability to work, and live my life to the fullest possible. I had seen several other pain doctors, and had had many epidurals, as we as radio frequency nerve ablation. Nothing was helping my uncontrolled chronic pain.
Dr. Morrison's ability to preform regular epidurals has been nothing short of a miracle in my life. I am extremely grateful for him, and the North Georgia staff.|My daughter moved to Georgia and was looking for a new pain management doctor. North Georgia pain clinic was recommended. She tried for 5 months to see one of these doctors. After she jumped through all their hoops and got all the info they asked for she was told by the clinic they would not take her as a patient. When she asked why they said we don't take your insurance. She found out they do take her insurance so she called back and told them. They called her back and said we do not owe you an explanation why we will not see you. So they lied and said they didn't take her insurance instead of giving her the truth. I've worked in the medical field for over 15 years and never have we told a patient we do not owe you an explanation. Very poor  practice and horrible doctors that would tell a young lady who suffers from 4 chronic illnesses. Shame on them. People need to know what kind of doctors they are seeing.|Dr. Moore is very professional and caring.  He explained my procedure in detail and made me feel at ease. Great bedside manner!! Could not ask for more. Thanks Dr. Moore.|The staff is professional yet personable.  The office is clean and Covid precautions are observed. There's nowhere else I'd rather be treated.|The entire staff is great. I never have to wait more than a few minutes.|The staff members are awesome and on point about there patients!

Premier Pain Management Specialists in Georgia

At Alliance Spine & Pain Centers, we are dedicated to providing real pain relief through our expansive network of offices across Georgia. Our locations in Austell, Augusta, Woodstock, Atlanta, Marietta, Conyers, Lawrenceville, Jasper, Cartersville, Dallas, Suwanee, Covington, Carrollton, Canton, Sandy Springs, Douglasville, Peachtree City, and Roswell ensure accessible care for patients throughout the region.

column40:
Very clear and both Robin and Dr. Neman spent a great deal of time with Me and we got a lot of things clarified. Refreshing considering that most medical experiences are not like that. Had a little bit of trouble checking out because it was incredibly busy and there was only one person at the front desk, and had to call this morning to make my follow up. But prescription was called in quickly, and I'm glad I went and happy to have this Clinic at my disposal. Still waiting on PT orders.|Miller talked with me working to explain what would be done to my back. The information was expressed clearly and I'm comfortable with the procedure. Been going to her for several years-she's a Good and caring doctor.|Miss Robin beavers is such an amazing, compassionate, caring, understanding dr as well as a very amazing woman she will sit with you and talk with you. If you have any questions she's always there to answer you. She doesn't try and rush you out of the office to her. It is not just we are not just client or customers she truly wants to help people she does not judge she understands, and I cannot say enough about this Robin beavers. I've been with her for about five years now and seeing her every month I feel the same way.|She is very business like which turned me off at first! Sometimes I get a little smile from her!  She knows her stuff when diagnosing my problems.  She gives me a clear understanding of my problems and what course we'll be following. All the staff are polite and very helpful.|I unfortunately can't rate the doctor because I never had the opportunity to see one.  I never passed the waiting room to see one.  1st appointment I waited 45 minutes for them to do back office paperwork approval before I could be seen.  I elected to leave since the wait was long and I asked if they could reschedule me to allow them to get paperwork processed.   I received a call and I was rescheduled the for the following week.  I asked them at this appointment would I have wait or would I be seen without the longer wait time.  The response was no I wouldn't have a long wait.   Appointment day arrived and my appointment time was for 8am.  There was one person there before me.  They called this patient back, then another patient arrived afterwards who was called back in less than one minute.  I'm still waiting, another patient arrives rushing because they were stuck in traffic.  They called her back within 2 seconds!  I was over it because the lack of communication and me just waiting for what reason this time.   I tried to tell the young lady at the desk who walked off as she couldn't hear me call on her.  I just politely left as my time is valuable to me and I was missing time from work again only not be seen.  The office called me when I was halfway home saying they were ready to see me.  Again, my appointment time was 8am I arrived at 7:50am and they were ready for me at 8:35am!  The doctor was there and they were taking patients back who arrived well after me.  But the lack of communication just didn't help.   I called back and explained my reasons I left and the lady just ok and disconnected the call.

Warning to any new patients make sure have a free day to spend with the Covington location because the lack of communication and wait time didn't make me feel welcomed to this practice.|Dr Rosenfeld is a great Dr along with his staff that I have come to think of as family. They listen to your concerns and make procedures much more comfortable. I wouldn't want to go anywhere else. I feel safe with them and have wonderful results with my chronic pain. They understand my pain and go the extra mile to help and try and come up with the help that I need. I know that I will always have the pain and issues that I have but feel good knowing they are there.
Lisa Batchelor|Dr. Kilday and the staff were excellent. He took time to go over my problem and provided feedback on my options for treatment. Dr. Kilday's knowledge gave me confidence in our plan. After a simple procedure I could walk again without pain or discomfort. I would highly recommend.|My wife and I see Dr Rosenfeld in Covington, GA. We also see his P.A., Mara Ehret, for office visits. Mara has been extremely helpful with her diagnosis and treatments. She has been spot on with the exams and recommendations to the Doctor. She has given me bursitis injections in my hip and trigger point injections in my back when appropriate that give me needed relief between the Doctors treatments. Definitely a five  recommendation!
Troy & Barbara Loy

column38: Layne Gallman|Davis|Jamie Mullinax|Kristen Smith|Mandy Meyer|Gary Murphy|Shelly L Shields|Randall Lingerfelt
column40:
The office staff is professional, friendly & and always up to share a joke. Dr. Strauss is fast, efficient and has an exceptional bedside manner. He always makes pleasant conversation and always listens when my husband or myself voice new concerns. I highly recommend this practice for anyone suffering pain.|I've been seeing Dr. Strauss for years, he is by far the best pain specialist I've ever had. He makes sure that the medication will NOT be too much. I'm so thankful for Dr. Strauss, he actually saved my life by getting me on the CORRECT medication and dosage . Thank you Dr.Strauss and the entire staff.|I saw 4 different pain management Drs before I found Dr Strauss and I'm so glad I found them ! Every Dr I saw before him would just write scripts and send you on your way but Dr Strauss listen to everything I said he made ajustments to my medicine that allowed me to get off the strongest stuff and not suffer. The Staff is fantastic Lisa , Dana , Ricky everyone I have had the pleasure of meeting has been so helpful and positive.I would recommend them to anyone that is suffering.|It is hard to find a doctor who cares. I am happy to say that I found one with Dr. Strauss.  He has helped me through some of the worst pain I have ever experienced.  He is careful with my time, yet thorough. I have gone through so many doctors in the past year or so with the herniated discs in my neck, back pain, shoulder problems and rheumatoid arthritis. He makes sure we are on the right track. If we are doing things that do not work, he adjusts. He listens to what I say. Though I still have to see several doctors, he is by far the best one. The one that has helped the most.|Staff is so friendly and after a couple of visits they remembered my name! It's so nice to be remembered and not just a client number! No waiting and waiting either. Dr Straus is timely but he does listen  and examine if I'm having issues other than just bad pain days. On my first visit he reviewed my radiology reports from the MRIs and notes from my general practitioner then he did his own assessment as well. He's offered medication and procedure options so I have a bit of a choice with my treatments and what I can afford. He is a very kind Dr and it's obvious he loves what he does as he's always friendly! It's a referral only practice but if you need pain mgmt I highly recommend this clinic!|Tried to get an appointment with DR. Morrison but since it was an auto accident I can't get treated. My question is what different does it make how someone gets hurt?  Injured is injured! That makes no sense. I guess if you jump off a building you can get an appointment but if you have a car accident they want nothing to do with you.|Great customer service from ALL staff.  Dr. Morrison is very compassionate, kind, professional, & has taken care of my very complex health issues for nearly seven years.
The staff at NGPC goes well above & beyond to help me stay as functional as possible.  Which in & of itself is next door to a full on miracle.
There amazing folks have supported me through the best & worst of times.  And never once has anyone @NGPC Ever made me feel less than fully appreciated.
There just aren't enough words in the English language for me to express how very much I appreciate this group of VERY EXTRA ORDINARY Medical Staff!  From booking appointments to having procedures done & all in between, I don't believe anyone could ask for better.
My Heartfelt thanks to ALL @NGPC.|This place is a joke if you don't have any medical insurance. Dr Strauss had my long term disability cut out because he said he didn't see how I couldn't work. I had my primary Dr refer me to a spine specialist with Harbin clinic. My first appt there was April 3, he wanted to do surgery on April 6. Ended up having it on April 13 because of financial reasons. Thanks to Dr Strauss, we are in more of a bind now since he never examined me. He walked in handed me a rX and walked out. I tried telling him on several occasions on what I was feeling and he didn't care. He just told me when I get insurance we would discuss it further. If you just going for the pain meds then he's your guy. If you really want help go to Harbin Pain Mgmt. They screen the applicants and if they accept you, then you will get an appt.  Hopefully he will be shut down!! The ladies up front were very nice though.  I appreciate their concern for me when I could barely walk because of the pain I was in just about every time I went there. Good job office staff! Dr Strauss, yea ... thanks for nothing!!!

column38: Phanta Music|Wolf Tyndall|Stephanie McAlkich|Veronica Carpenter|Stephanie Lynch|Doug Hildreth|ilescia hodge|Angela Higgs
column40:
I have been a customer for 8 years and I have never failed a drug test, never overtook my medicine, never gave any problems. I had a dentist appointment and was in pain. The dentist gave me a 1 day Tylenol 3. I didn't no what Tylenol 3 was. I assumed that it was just Tylenol. I had a appointment and the appointment was as like all of my appointment routine. They took my vitals, asked clinical questions, went over medications, then the NP that I've never seen before said I'm sorry but we got to dismiss you and I was Shocked , hurt , angry  all at the same time. I have 2 Chronic Diseases, plus get infusions. I proceeded  to ask them for all my paperwork and questioned them and they literally called the police on me which 2 or 3 police officers came out. I felt used because I realized that they took me through the routine to get paid for the day knowing that they was dismissing me  They do not care, it is only for the
Money. It's always chaos from when you walk in the door until you leave. Nothing is organized and is never peaceful. Looses files, forget to call your medicine in and the communication is horrible. They do not ever return calls. I will never refer this place at all. RUN, RUN  RUN. When God give you signs be obedient. Hopefully my story may save others. God Bless|Everyone at this office is amazing. Starting at the front desk, Jocelyn, Kristen or Vickie greet you warmly as you come in and treat you as a valued person, even remembering your name. The triage team, who are often overlooked for the good job they do, is always very caring and attentive to your needs and getting you back as soon as possible. Next you are seen by a nurse, another very sweet. intelligent staff member who asks lots of important questions about your health, family and life making sure the doctor has all the important information he/she needs as well as building a good relationship with their patient. The doctor I see is great, Dr. Vaid. He has treated me for 3 years and helped me manage my pain so that I can live life and not let the pain control me. He has performed several procedures on me and done so well I didn't need sedation. There is also a woman named Jennifer who checks in on the patients and is one of my favorite staff members. She asks any questions that may have been missed and checks in on your personal life as well, developing better relationships with the patients.  As I stated I have been with them over 3 years and I would recommend this Office, Family, to anyone that reads this.

PS - Whoever wrote that review for Debra Meadows is totally wrong about the wait times. As for the 15 minutes most doctors do that as a courtesy, they see lots of patients and ask that you come 15 minutes early to avoid that and delay the person after you.  It sounds like someone had a bad day and seeing them talk like that about such a great office that I love bothers me because it isn't true.|My mother had a procedure done without anesthesia and had the most horrible operation and post op experience, they again tried to schedule her another procedure with no anesthesia with their excuse being that they don't have an anesthesiologist to work for them currently. Don't do a procedure on my mother where she is screaming in pain from a back procedure no anesthesia and you have to turn up the music in the office so people in the waiting room don't hear her crys. Shameful.|I recently moved from IN to GA.  I Have been seeing a neurologist for years and I dreaded having to get a new Dr.  The office staff is great  the nursing staff too.  Dr. Valid is Awesome!!  He's  punctual and very thorough.  He has a wonderful  bedside manner.  My husband was impressed too.  I am really happy to have found this place.|Impressive first visit
Dr. Kassamali and his assistant, Jeremy, were very pleasant and informative during my initial visit with this practice.  I felt very comfortable and that I was being taken seriously.  I felt I could trust them to have my best interests in mind.
The office staff were kind and responsive.  My first prescription turned out to need a prior authorization and their staff person responsible for that got it processed in 24 hours or less.
High marks all around.|I have been a patient for over two years.  Both before covid and after. Dr. Vaid and his staff have always been attentive to whatever my chronic pain I was feeling at the time.  Four stars instead of five reflects on the facility, not the staff.  They are always so busy  treating patients that it becomes obvious they need more staff, better phones (the on hold recording is awful) and an IT upgrade. I also would recommend the White Oak surgery  center. Always a good experience there as well.|I honestly love this place. The staff is very professional and nice and Dr. Polk is absolutely wonderful. Very patient, he explains what he's going to do and makes sure you understand. He also listens and makes you as comfortable as possible when doing the procedure. I would strongly recommend this place to anyone in need of a great doctor. Dr. Polk is one of a kind..|Dr Vaid is one of the most talented and compassionate doctors I have ever met. Dr.K is awesome. Staff is awesome. Only problem is they NEVER & I mean NEVER answer the phone. So hard to contact them. You'll literally have to go up there to get things handled.|Dr. K is the best at what he does, in my opinion. I don't want anyone else giving me spinal injections. The staff is awesome, and the physicians assist is great as well. 10 out of 10, in my opinion.|Dr. K is what I refer to him as because I'm a long time patient. Almost 5 years. Dr. K, pays attention to detail. He listens to you. He will give you the injections you need when you need them. He writes your prescriptions. But will drug test you monthly to make sure you are taking your medicines and not anything you're not supposed to take. He may also recommend outside care if he feels like you need something more than he can provide. He's a really great doctor.|Dr. K is one of the best. He listens to you, helps you to keep your pain tolerable. He has you get tests as needed. He's been helping me for years now. I've had back surgery and was recommended to me by my back surgeon Dr. Plas James who is excellent as well. I recommend Dr. Kabackboo highly.|Omgoodness, living with chronic pain everyday for years, is no joke. There have been times I felt like giving up. Thanks to God leading me to Dr. K, I am still here. I love him and his staff. They truly care about their patients and will work with your other doctors to try to get you in a better place. We need more medical practices like this.|I contacted Dr. Kabakibou's office for an emergency situation.  The motor in my Intrathecal Pain Pump stalled.  I wanted him to replace the pump.  I called, the referral was sent over & I waited.
I called spokewithJana(,Medical Assisiant)   We talked & she was to call back but didn't.  Then I called & emailed Melissa Smith (Surgery Coordinator)  who never redponded .  Then finally someone emailed me from his office & said,"Unfortunately @ this time your referral has been denied.  I emailed her back for
clarification & she responded y saying Dr. Kabakibou said that he was unable to help me. What kind of society do we live in when physicians choose not to see patients?  I've had my Intrathecal Pain Pump with 5 revisions definitely 4 & Dr. Kabakibou did  them all except 1.  He did the last revision 04/25/2018 & moved location of pump from abdomen to lower back.  In fact, It was he that did my trial pump @ Emory Adventist ( No longer open) on 10/24/2005 & he placed the permanent pump 01/16/2006.  I had the utmost respect for him as a professional  & as a kind & compassionate man.  I never disrespected him or his staff.  His actions have truly saddened & disappointed me.|I was in a bad car wreck a few years ago. Dr. K has taken care of me since it happened. Him and his staff are first rate. Can't say enough about the great care  and concern they've shown me.|The doctor was fine treating me after I had a horrible auto crash.  When the money ended, he dropped me as a patient. It was not a problem until the accident claims were settled.  Very obvious that he just wanted the money.

column40:
If I could give negative stars I would .. what has happened in the medical field that a doctor see's fit to smirk at a patients position that they are in.  Dr Robinson has no empathy and is an arrogant individual that treats everyone as if they are a drug dealers or criminal.  My husband has been disabled from a debilitating disease for more than 20 years now and our life has not been so easy.  It is unlike me to wish any harm to another human being, but I feel like if this doctor had a family member himself that was going through what my husband and I have been going through the last 20 years and are currently going through he would have more empathy.  Dr. Robinson you are sworn in your profession to "do no harm" as a principle of medical ethics and is your obligation as a physician.  Dr. Robinson, please be mindful that your actions, words and the way you express yourself to others harms others. The act to "do no harm" simply conveys several moral rules - do not kill, do not cause pain or suffering, do not incapacitate, do not cause offense and do not deprive others of the goods of life. We'll you Dr. Robinson need to take a very good look at the ethics you swore to uphold because you fall very short of maintaining the moral rules.

Our community just went through a tragic event this week (school shooting) and people every day commit suicide because people just think of themselves and not how they treat others. You are supposed to "HELP" people in need and make them feel safe.  Your words, actions, and your lack of empathy for others cause people to feel the opposite.

I write this not to be revengeful but to warn my fellow community of your actions, your lack of care, empathy and especially your lack of upholding your obligation.  I do hope and pray that no one else has to feel like we have been made to feel and that you take a hard look at yourself and how you carry yourself.  These are real people (not all are drug addicts) with real painful issues and diseases that just need someone / someone in your profession to actually care. Please do yourself and your entire staff a huge favor and schedule sensitivity training!

I did not post this review or hide my name because I have nothing to hide and want the community to know "We are real people just like you and I hope no one treats your family the way you have treated my husband."

Be Blessed!
Sonia Sewell|This clinic is the sister to the one I went to in Florida and I expected the same great staff and doctor. Well that didn't happen. This doctor had the nerve to question my drug allergies even saying he might make me get allergy testing. The staff has no sensitivity training and the billing is farmed out to a company in the Midwest. The procedure authorization and billing departments are abysmal! 3 months before I got refunds for copays (they didn't think I checked my EOBs) and they claim they either didn't get an authorization approval (I get one in my email from insurance 7 days prior to procedure) from insurance or they submit the wrong procedure for approval causing a denial for treatment.
Just saying think twice before using this pain management clinic.|I don't know what has happened to this practice over the last year but I can tell you I will NEVER refer them to anyone again. It's not the Doctor's or the medical staff it's the billing and people over them. They now no longer let you carry a balance and make payments on it then they turn around and charge 100.00 dollars for a drug test. Those who are self pay because we don't have insurance can't afford the extra 100 dollars and the reason they charge that much is because of the insurance companies.
This company that has taken over this practice is nothing but corporate greed taking advantage of people who have to have their services. People are struggling right now and and instead of helping their patients that have been there for years they're doing all they can to create even more of an economic hardship. I want to stress again it's NOT The Doctors or the medical staff they are amazing. Now I have to decide where I'm going to have to take the extra 100 out of maybe my power bill or rent to pay for what should only cost 30.00 to remain a patient because unfortunately I need the medicine to have any kind of quality of life.|Dr Jorge Alvear is very good and professional, he listens and all way understand about my pain . He is excellent speaking espanol. But please Dr call back when we leave a message, we know you are busy person but we call cause we really need you help.
Staff always treated me with respect. Especialmente Rosa.
Thanks for your job !|When Dr. Lena Lake left the practice, I thought no one would be able to believe in my issues and give me the care I truly need for my spine. However, Dr. Jorge Alvear became my doctor and he always took me seriously, believed me when I told him about my ongoing muscle cramps and pain in my spine, and trusted me above other specialists and doctors who made false reports on me. Then, he left and there are no good doctors and/NP's or PA's at the practice. I've stayed with them for 7 months and I have decided to go back to Dr. Alvear, even if it's going to be 2hrs longer drive because I place my total faith in him.|Dr. Chaundry is great, but the front desk staff are a joke and literally can not do the simplest of tasks. All voicemails are "disabled" so you can't leave a message and even if you could they wouldn't call back.|If I could give no stars I would .. when Dr Crider was there he was amazing However since he has left and his whole staff this place is a joke!!! Dr Robinson is an arrogant jerk that treats people like they are criminals and Dr Alcvear was my Dr after Dr crider left he was okay the one time I had an appt w him However he discharged me from the program without letting me know and for no reason advised I didn't follow protocol because I accidently left my medication in TN at when I went for Thanksgiving at the hotel so I needed a refill a few days sooner that is why I was discharged w no notice from anyone I have called the office manager Sandra several times she will not return my call or my new Dr faxes or phone calls this place is a joke save your self and find another Dr these people here are useless and care about nothing!!! Also they would not provide me or my new Dr my discharge paperwork where I can get anymore medicine this should be illegal what they are doing|I have had excellent experiences with both Dr Crider and Dr Robinson. I came in about 6 months ago with excruciating pain in my neck and also my lower back. Both providers were very attentive, have excellent bedside manner, and are gentle during examinations and all 4 of the spinal injection procedures I've undergone so far. I am doing so much better, the pain is much more manageable, and I feel SEEN and HEARD by the doctors and staff at Specialty Spine & Pain. Thank you so much for taking such good care of me, and my health!

column40:
Love Ellis Pain Management, have been going to them for about 12 years. They have been able to help control my pain while simultaneously lowering the amount of narcotics I need to take by using alternative medicine to make me comfortable. The staff is wonderful and since they have little turnover I see the same people every month. I really appreciate Dr. Mark Ellis, he talks to me like an equal and is very knowledgeable about my case and the options available to me. He is wonderful person and truly cares about his patients. I see them every month and it's more a social visit rather than a medical visit and enjoy seeing the staff. Although my favorite person there is Diane who assist Dr. Ellis in procedures. She has been there longer than me and she is a ray of sunshine  everytime I see her. She helps my anxiety to calm before procedures. Would recommend Ellis Pain Management to anyone who wants options to help control daily pain management.|I came here to do a review of both Courtney, the nurse practitioner and Danielle the medical assistant. They are both so good to work with. Danielle gets me back as quickly as possible and is very professional while also being warm and friendly. I really feel like she is concerned for the patients. And a little friendly chat on the side doesn't hurt.

I cannot say enough good things about Courtney. I have been seen Courtney for a few years now and she is always so kind, friendly, and yet very professional. I not only feel like Courtney cares about her patients, I know Courtney cares about her patients. She treats the whole patient. Of course, she's concerned about the medical things and the pain that's going on, but she also is concerned about personal things in my life. She knows that wellness is a big package of mind, body, and spirit. Like I said there's so many things I could say good about Courtney that this would be a very long review. I highly recommend Courtney to anyone and everyone.|I am a disabled veteran and I am a patient of Courtney Hinson NP-C and RN Danielle. They are truly professional, courteous and compassionate. They really care about your health and overall well-being, I truly look forward to my appointments with them at Ellis Pain Center. They are truly awesome and I thank Courtney and Danielle for being there for my pain management needs. Tyrone Sebastian Huff|Been going there for years, always been easy to get along with everyone.
I wish more doctors offices had more employees like Dr Ellis has.
Thank you Dr Ellis keep up the good work.|Courtney and Danielle are the bomb. I look forward to every appointment. They always greet me with a smile and make me feel at home. It's a pleasure with everyone at Ellis pain center. I've been a patient probably since they opened. Have never had a bad experience.|I truly love The Staff  they have been there for me. Courtney and Danielle and My favorite Nurse.. I Appreciate everything  they have  done  for me. This is one of the best place  to come to get the best Medical care..

You. Are Appreciate|Ellis pain center is great. They take the time to get to know you and help you with your pain management. All the staff is friendly. Ms. Danielle and Ms. Courtney especially put you at ease and listen to what you have going on. Absolutely a great group of people!|If you're thinking about going to this Ellis pain management, please don't go. This pain management has tried to mess me up from seeing any other pain management because I wanted to leave them. The nurse practitioner, Courtney Henson yelled at me and stormed out of the Room that I was in because I said I will release this office. First Courtney said that there was going to go down on my medicine and then when I went back, they took me all the way off the medication that I was on. I asked her about the change and why am I being taken off the medication. I told her that I was there for almost 5 years she says SO we have patience that have been with us over 20 years. I told her I understand but I'm talking about myself. She said either you get off the medicine or sign the paper to leave our office and at this point she was yelling at me. I said I have never been treated like this before she said either you accept what we say or leave. I said well I will sign the papers to be released not because we're changing medication's but because you lied and said we just gonna go down on the medicine, and because you are yelling at me she got up walk out and slammed the door. When I was looking for other pain management to go to. Because I sign the release form from Ellis Pain when they asked for my records from Ellis they said that I was difficult, I did not want to go down on medication's. 2 of the office refused to see me because of what they said about me. I had to beg an office to see me and I told them my side of the story in order for them to give me an appointment. Please I beg you please do not go to Ellis pain management because they will destroy you if you try to leave or if you ask them any questions about them lying to you that is a problem for them. I RATE this office the worst pain management office EVER. They really are trying to destroy me and my character. I am seeking attorneys about this matter as today because I just got word another pain office do not want to see me because of what they said about me. They lied on ME  .

UPDATE: they did not want to continue a conversation with me, they sent me a threatening letter. The letter was from Dr. Ellis himself, he was very rude and told me I can never come back to his facility. I was not planning on coming back, I have already found a new Pain Doctor that is very excellent. Dear Dr. Ellis, if you wanted to talk to me so I can take this post down you should have called me. You guys have my number. We could've talked about this sir.

At Pain Physicians of Atlanta, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified anesthesiologists and pain management specialists is dedicated to providing personalized care using the latest evidence-based treatments. Located in Alpharetta at 3333 Old Milton Pkwy Suite #400, our state-of-the-art facility is equipped to address a wide range of pain-related issues.

Our Specialized Services Include:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Spinal cord stimulation therapy

  • Joint injections and nerve blocks

  • Migraine and headache management

  • Conservative pain management approaches

  • Comprehensive treatment for neck and back pain

Under the leadership of Dr. Ravi Dammanna and our expert physicians, we take pride in our multidisciplinary approach to pain control. We carefully evaluate each patient's condition, review diagnostic imaging, and develop customized treatment plans that focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence. Our compassionate team works diligently to help patients regain mobility and return to their daily activities with reduced pain. For more information about our services or to schedule a consultation, please visit painphysiciansofatlanta.com or call us at +1 770-391-3979.

column40:
I have been a patient of Dr. Dammanna for several years.  He is the first physician who could manage my cervical and lumbar  injuries where others were not successful.  Dr. Dammanna uses conservative treatment and the highest quality of care.

I have read several of the reviews regarding the office staff.  In my experience I have not found this to be true.  When making an appointment I have had to leave a message on occasion and my call has been returned with in the same day or the follow business day. I have never waited two days.  I did have to reschedule an appointment because I WAS LATE due to unforeseen circumstances. The front desk worked with me to reschedule for the next available appointment.

Procedures are handled very professionally and I have had issues with my insurance and the staff has been amazing appealing denial of services  when they truly do not have to. They were doing it as a courtesy.   Once approved and the day of my procedure all of the surgical staff was so kind, caring and also professional. I do hope you have a wonderful positive experience as I have. had.  Thank you Pain Physians of Atlanta|I have been under the care of Dr. Ravi Dammanna for the last 12 years. Throughout this time, I have undergone several neck and joint surgeries and have dealt with chronic pain stemming from a car accident many years ago. Dr. Dammanna and his surgical team have profoundly improved my pain levels and mobility over the years. They are compassionate and attentive, taking the time to review my MRI and explain what is happening so that I can fully understand. The surgical team is top notch and truly cares about how they prep patients for procedures.  Dr. Dammanna has performed numerous procedures for me, providing substantial relief and allowing me to continue activities without surgery.  I am so grateful for this practice and appreciate Dr. Dammanna's honesty with me about my medical conditions.  PPof A is an Excellent practice that I highly recommend.|Dr Damamna was my doctor and I could not have been more pleased. He was very honest and informative at visit before my procedure. His team was great from checking until I left. The entire team was so pleasant, friendly, courteous, and knowledgeable. I would highly recommend this group to any of my family or friends.|I sincerely appreciate how they treat their patients.  Dr. Ravi Damamna is my physcian. He truly listens to his patients, is sincerely compassionate when things are serious, goes the extra mile when the need arises, and his team rate a 5-star in my book!  The entire staff is amazing.  I feel very lucky to have been referred to them.  He has kept me from having to have more spinal surgery for many years and am very grateful!  Thanks Pain Physicans of Atlanta!!|I was referred by my oncologist because of the constant pain from radiation.  Dr Wada is completely laid back, making me more relaxed, still hurt like...
He went through several oral med options, nothing worked. We then tried the spinal cord stimulator.  BINGO.  Finally something that eased a huge percentage of the agony I've dealt with for almost a year. That was the temporary unit, (an insurance hoop to see if it did anything)  I'm scheduled for my permanent unit, next week.  I am totally looking forward to being able to sit to eat, walk and everything else I've forgotten about.|I have been seeing Dr. Ravi Dammanna for many years for chronic migraines, and he is amazing! He really listens and wants to help his patients.  His staff has been great especially with the med shortages! I am very thankful for them because migraines have caused me to have to miss out on a lot of things and events. Now with proper pain management and figuring out triggers, I don't have to miss out on life!|PaIn Physicians of Atlanta is a top notch professional Healthcare organization. I survived Lung Cancer in 2011 only to have a lot of issues with my back and Dr. Ravi Dammanna has enabled me to live a quality life without pain for which I am forever grateful. He is such a kind, knowledgeable, compassionate doctor who always listens to me and makes suggestions and together we come up with a plan.

Recently I started having severe pain down my left leg shortly before leaving for vacation and he was able to order an MRI, get the results and work me in for a steroid epi 2 days before we left. The steroid epi, completely eliminated my leg pain and several months later, I'm still pain free. Very few if ANY other doctor could have pulled all that off so quickly!

His surgical team (especially Caleb) is so nice and calming. I feel like I'm visiting old friends when I go in as they are always so kind and actually talk to me when I enter the surgical room. Some healthcare providers forget how important that is-not Dr Dammanna and his fabulous team!

I like to remind Dr Dammanna and my incredible Neurosurgeon Dr Charles Weaver that my Thoracic Surgeon and Oncologist may have saved my life but THEY made my life worth living with their outstanding kindness and skills.

I trust Dr Dammanna completely and have recommended several friends to him.|Suffering with sacroiliac joint pain for several years, going for numerous physical therapies and taking meloxicam with no relief, my first appointment with Dr. Dammanna convinced me I found the right team to help me. He reviewed my MRI and explained every detail of the cause of my pain and options for treatment. I had sacroiliac joint injection twice. After the first dose the pain was still mostly there but the second injection managed 90% of it. Dr. Dammanna and his nurses make a great team before, during, and after the procedure. Also, the office staff was well organized, knowledgeable, and easy to deal with.

Dr. Moore  is a very friendly and concerned physician.   He is even helping people in Tanzania.  That shows the dedication and commitment  he has for each  of us e en if we are senior citizens still fighting arthritis and defending clients.|Dr. Morrison is the best  he knows his stuff he and his staff are very nice they go out of there way to address any problems that you may have. My husband and I both see dr. Morrison we know he is the best
I would definitely recommend N.G.P Tammy|This clinic, which has several locations! will get you feeling better!

I can't speak for the other doctors here, but I can tell you that Dr. Moore will change your life.

This is not one of those "pain clinics". This is a doctor's office. Dr. Moore treats your pain. He doesn't hand out pills. But he DOES give the BEST injections! I wish I could post my latest MRI, well I guess I can. I have severe issues. I have had at least 10 doctors give me epidurals. Not different clinics, some have different guys at the same location back in the day. And nobody has come close to alleviating my pain. Dr. Moore's epidurals get rid of my pain 100%! Like I have no problems. He laughs and says "Just bc you feel better, you're still messed up. Don't go out there doing stuff." (Something like that).

Dr. Moore is not irresponsible with steroid shots like a lot of places that will let you come back in a week for another. I beg him to do another for me two weeks later, but he makes me wait if there's a reason. Dang it, he's so responsible. That's what I get for waiting too long. Ha.

Stop searching for a place if you're in pain. THIS is where you need to come.|Dr Efrim Moore has helped me through  many different levels of pain in 22+ years. He alleviated pain in my back that surgeries  could not.|This is a great Physcian practice that believes in helping people and changing their lives. I know they've changed mine.  Caring staff, Appointments are always good and very thorough.  I highly recommend Them. They have several locations .|Dr. Morrison is one of the best doctors I've ever met and I have had a lot! He truly listens and takes time to explain everything!|Dr Morrison is very caring and goes into detail on how to control your pain.  I would recommend him to anyone who is dealing with pain.|Dr Morrison is great with paitents and families. Is really concerned with helping his paitents get out of their pain.

The ongoing shots are working and I have not had the sciatic nerve pain that left me on my knees. This latest shot offered me some immediate relief from the arthritis and two bulging discs and the shots should offer even more relief in the coming weeks

There will be a follow up consult to discuss my issues and course of action.

I am happy to say the least!|My wife goes to summit and we love it there. She's finally got some relief and there so friendly and welcoming. My wife loves the care she gets from them. Morgan was so helpful...and kind. Bless her sweet heart..she listened to me when I was emotional...she was respectful, and kind.
Thank you, ladies. From my heart
DS|I have been going here for over 2 years. I had been going to another pain clinic that was helping me (more then just pain meds), the doctor quit, and so I decided to seek another physician. column38: Acacia|Cynthia Combes|cathy sampson|Amber Lazzara|Pam Robertson|Angie Newton|Pamela Baxter|Gayla Guest
column40:
Dr. Gandhi is a wonderful doctor! He's always got a great attitude, makes you feel safe during procedures, and his staff are all amazing!!! He accepts VA Community Care, HUGE BONUS!!! He and his staff are very efficient. They speak to you and are polite, but don't drag on appointments causing other appointments to run behind. 5/5 all day long.|Dr. Gandhi has been my doctor for 2 yrs. I have gotten excellent care
. He explains all my procedures I trust him. Everyone  in the clinic has been very professional.  I would recommend  friends  and family if their  in need of a pain specialist.|Dr. Gandhi is so gentle, very aware of any concerns or hesitation that I have due to anxiety. He is calming and is such a wonderful kind doctor. All of the staff are professional and kind as well. I highly Recommend their practice. Thank you to all.|One of the worst patient care experiences I have ever experienced. The doctors themselves could be outstanding, however the staff member responsible for intake and scheduling (Sherry?Shelly? I genuinely can't recall) is just awful. I had a lumbar puncture at Piedmont hospital and they sent a referral to pain consultants of Atlanta and told me to call shortly after and ask if it was possible to be seen that day for a blood patch. I waited a while and called- but the woman I spoke to not only was condescending and rude, but when I explained why I was calling she huffed and said "yeah I got one yesterday for that- where do you live- yeah that's not you" making it clear she hadn't bothered to call that received referral either. She abruptly told me "that's not how things work" when I said Piedmont had said to ask about getting in asap. She said she would call me when my information was received. I never heard from her, and followed up with the hospital who assure me they had sent it and told me when. The weekend passed with me in significant pain and unable to do much more than lay flat and hope I didn't move too quickly or cough or sneeze. I called back Monday morning around 11 am. Someone else answered there and yelled over asking if anything had come in with my name and did they want to talk to me. I was put in the phone with the same woman as Friday. She said yes she received the info, then asked me when I had the procedure and explained it had been Wednesday and I bad initially called Friday morning. Her response was "it's been FIVE days- you don't feel better?" She proceeded to say they didn't have any openings and she would have to talk to her supervisor and call me back. That was Monday morning- it's Thursday and I haven't received a call. I would hope those running this office would look into this as I can't think this is a one off situation.|Very professional and patient focused team. Great patient care from provider and staff. I accepted a referral for continued care with an epidural steroid not knowing anyone of the providers or clinical staff prior to my scheduled procedure and was well taken care of throughout my visit! Great team! Thanks to all!!!|This practice has very caring employes. Making an appointment is a very easy process and the wait time when you arrive is with in 10-15 minutes.  Dr Gaundi is a wonderful person and caring doctor. Be assured that he will do everything he can to help you.|He's a great, friendly, knowledgeable, doctor that takes your feelings and pain seriously.|I have recommended PCA to numerous people, including my mother. The staff are friendly, competent and efficient. I love the Nurse Practitioners. They listen well and work with you to implement a plan. Dr. Gandhi listens and recommends epidurals or other injections as needed. I joke with him being able to do them in his sleep as he is very proficient. I have every confidence in this practice. Also, to prove they listen, they moved their location of the Newnan office because we patients had difficulty with the parking lot of the old location. That says a lot to me!

Located at 1075 Lafayette Pkwy Ste 100, LaGrange, GA 30241, we welcome patients seeking relief from chronic and acute pain conditions. Contact us at +1 706-443-5273 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management with our dedicated team.

Total Diagnostic and Interventional Pain is a full spectrum pain management practice led by Davin Mitchell, MD located in LaGrange, Georgia. The practice offers top-quality patient care, ensuring each patient receives the latest tools and education to receive effective management of their pain conditions.
Starting from a personalized consultation, the providers at TDI Pain gather information about your medical history, symptoms, and treatment goals. Then, they develop a comprehensive pain management program that considers your lifestyle and preferences to help you find the best pain relief for your condition.
TDI Pain specializes in making sure you understand the underlying condition that is causing your pain.

column40:
TDI Pain is the best pain management practice I have ever been to.  I was a patient there for 5 years while living in Georgia, and my experience was exceptional.  Dr. Mitchell is incredibly knowledgeable and truly outstanding at what he does.  Since moving out of state and switching to a new doctor, I can absolutely feel the difference - my pain was much better managed under Dr. Mitchell's care.  The multiple injections I received allowed me to function without constant discomfort, something I haven't experienced elsewhere.

Dr. Mitchell is not only a brilliant physician but also one of the kindest doctors you could ever meet.  He takes the time to explain everything in a way that's easy to understand and always makes you feel comfortable.

I highly recommend TDI Pain over any other practice.  Unlike the large network-owned facilities where patients can feel like just a number, TDI Pain truly cares about each individual.  Thank you, Dr. Mitchell and TDI Pain, for your exceptional care!

Respectfully,
Emily Coffey|My experience with TDI pain and Dr. Mitchell have been one of the most rewarding experience. When I 1st met him that day he told me he would do all he could to help ease my pain. And now years, later, he is still taking good care of me. I love Dr. Mitchell and all the staff. Terry is very tentative to his patients and the girls that get you set up for the procedures are sweet as they can be. I am very happy and pleased with my visits. I love my PA Robin. she defiantly understands my pain. love all these folks!
Donna Estes|They are good at getting enough people, more than an enough to an enormous amount of money coming in. I was a patient for I think about a year & after getting talked into a different pain meds for a few months, ended up with many side affects & instead of going back to my original meds, I again prescribed a different one that needed to be approved by my insurance & IT WAS NOT! Of course instead of going back to my original meds they made the decision to keep me on the meds that gave me side effects, today on this day I have NO! pain meds to take so that I have NO quality of a life since my insurance company & doctor took & made my decision for me. NO ONE AT EITHER PLACE LISTENED OR CARED FOR ME, MY WELL BEING OR HOW I FELT! TDI has thousands of patients & couldn't give a hoot if I didn't stay in their practice.

THIS IS SO VERY & EXTREMELY UNCALLED FOR! I have been to every single doctor I was recommended to go to to see if there was something that could help me get out of my daily & extremely awful pain so I could I could live the rest of my life with some comfort & not the pain I experience now. Prayer & the Lord is my only hope left in my situation as GOG IS IN CONTROL!
Blessings & prayers & hope for all who can relate to my situation & daily pain!!|They are SCAMMERS (and they are proud of it!)!  If you have a personal injury case due to a crash, the schedulers will tell you that they work off of "Letters of Protection" (LOPs) but then when you go for your visit, they force you to pay out-of-pocket!  Richard ("CFO") sees the patients and he tells the patient a completely opposite story and makes them pay for their visit and medications upfront!  Even if the patient is out of work and does not have an income.  Beware of this place because it seems like they say one thing to you in order to get you in the door, and then they tell you something else once they have you in the visit!  I would not refer ANY patient to this place after learning how poorly they treated one recently!|Been going here for years. I used to really enjoy my visits. The ppl were so nice, but that's not the case anymore. Yes, I began to complain when they put me with a young PA that wasn't even old enough to understand the pain that I deal with. Then reception is the worse. After you're labeled a troublemaker for expressing your opinion, they made me wait 2 hours before giving me my prescription..totally on purpose. I am fond of, Dr. Mitchell. I only wish I could say the same for his current staff.|I love everything about TDI Pain. They are the only place that has attempted to help me with my pain issues. The provider I have now is amazing she truly listens to me and doesn't try to push medication! I love seeing Dr. Mitchell when I have procedures done he is always in a great mood and very caring!|I drive 2 hours one way to go here. I see Tya, a nurse practioner for office visits & Dr Mitchell does all of my procedures. And i absolutely love them both, they make it worth the drive. The staff is awesome.  Antwonette, Zack & Penny are always very nice & go above & beyond for the patients. My 3 complaints would be: difficult to get thru when calling, wait time is often extensive, procedures scd too far out. I've been making the 4 hour round trip for several years now. The pros outweigh the cons, in my opinion. They are worth it The CFO (I think is his title) Richard, will try his best to do anything & everything he can to help you out|I had an app with both offices today. All they staff was courteous as they could be. Dr. Mitchell is wonderful, goodness I can't remember his name right now. It's the guy that puts you too sleep, he is wonderful.

Laneisha is great, I am so thankful, I got her a my new NP.

The Guy that does the BP.and other vitals is very nice and professional.

Comprehensive Pain Management in Brunswick, GA

At The Spine Center of Southeast Georgia, we believe that successfully treating pain requires skill, patience, empathy, and staying current within our field. Our dedicated team of pain management physicians provides personalized care for patients throughout Brunswick and surrounding communities. We are committed to developing comprehensive treatment plans that address an array of conditions including:

  • Chronic back and neck pain

  • Sciatica and nerve pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

Our approach combines advanced interventional techniques with holistic strategies to improve your quality of life. Located at 1111 Glynco Pkwy Bldg. #2, Suite 300 in Brunswick, we offer a comfortable environment where patients receive individualized attention. column40:
I have been going to the spine center for over 10 yrs. I am very pleased with my treatment and surgeries. Dr Bovinet and his staff are outstanding. They treat you as a human being and are not in a hurry to leave. They listen and provide answers and professional medical opinions to you. Anyone who comes here will be treated with respect and dignity.  I refer my friends to him and they to have been impressed and happy with the treatment they have received and the way they were treated as a whole.|The back injections I got yesterday hurt considerably more than the first ones I received last year. I was a patient at this facility about 4 years ago. I arrived for my appointment and was taken back for prepping. When I left the facility that day 4 years ago, I decided to never go back. It felt like the doctor had used my back as a dartboard. That's exactly the way I felt yesterday. I will be attending the February 4th appointment with the PA. He should expect to get an earful.|The complete medical staff as well as the complete office staff are competent, efficient, polite and especially caring. I've been a patient since 2018 and would not consider going anywhere else!|Dr. Bovient is probably the most arrogant person I have ever met. I was there to talk about my Nalu stimulator and he wanted to talk about his leg day! His clothes are incredibly tight and he walks around like a deity of pain medicine (over compensation maybe???). He actually moved my Nalu stimulator to a worse location, and when I was struggling in the healing process, he couldn't have cared less. His bedside manner is that of an ape and I would rather deal with my pain than visit him again.

Also, the front staff is SOOOOO unfriendly. I was there several mornings when the receptionist didn't even look like she had bothered to brush her hair. Every interaction left an impression on me like I was bothering them by asking for them to do their job. My husband also had constantly fight with billing, even after we had met my deductible. It was as if no one in that office knew how to do their job. The office manager was the only shining light, but I had to go through several steps to get acknowledged by her and get my questions answered. The staff needs customer service training and Dr. Bovient needs to worry a little less about his EXTRA tight pants and his workout and worry a little more about his patients' overall care.|I've been dealing with chronic pain for years - struggling to find the right care to treat it. I've only been to this office maybe 3 times now. However, at each visit Dr. Delva has treated me with nothing but respect and has taken his time with me listening to my concerns and giving me helpful information. At my last visit, he told me that he really hopes they can do right by me and help me, which that alone meant the world to me. I have nothing but good things to say about him. Thank you Dr. Delva!|Dr Delva is wonderful!  His assistant, Shante, is amazing as well!  They are so caring and helpful!  They both truly listened to my issues and concerns & worked diligently to help alleviate my pain which made life so much better for me.  Can't say enough good things about them!|My mother is a patient of Dr Delva. She loves him and his staff. He is friendly and listens to his patients to gain as much information from the patient to help assist him in their care. I personally recommend him.|Dr Delva is the bomb yall he breaks it down and helps u get the right annswed to ur problems and he is very patient and a ppl person ! His staff is amazing and Shante was very patient and helpful! If y'all need to see a spine dr he is the one u go to! Thanks Dr Davenport for referring me to this guy! I give them 10 stars

column3:
At The Pain Relief Center of Georgia, we specialize in helping patients develop effective therapies and lifestyle changes to relieve chronic or severe pain. Our dedicated team works collaboratively with your referring physician and specialists to ensure you receive a comprehensive approach to pain management.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We offer a range of specialized services including:

- Medication management tailored to individual needs

Located in Fayetteville, our pain control clinic is committed to improving your quality of life through personalized care. column40:
First I want to begin the 2 ladies in the office staff were very sweet and helpful. Of course I was there to see Dr. Allen and yes my very first appointment. I want to say he pushed me on the test he had to administer but at the same time he did everything with care and understanding.  Dr. Allen very thorough and detailed and listened to my concerns.  Honestly he seemed to just know what my issues were from his examination. Wonderful physician and I am happy to now be his patient under his care. I recommend seeing him if you are dealing with pain.|Dr. Allen is the best doctor I have ever seen. After years of struggling with Lupus and other painful conditions he has successfully treated me. He is very series about finding the correct solution for you individually and that he's not "ignoring" you as some other reviews state but typing in every word you say into your chart to not miss a thing. He has helped me and I tried to find help for my condition for YEARS and nothing ever changed. I felt like just a number and they just treated all patients the same and spent 2 minutes with me and that's it. My injections help me so much and I can finally sleep through the night with the treatment plan he has used for me. I love his staff.   He cares and he will find a way to help you if possible, you have to let him take the notes and ask the questions because he is listening and will do the right thing for you.|Dr Allen. Is a great doctor
He take the time to help you with all of your issues. He take the time to input everything into the system so he does not miss anything. He is to the point but this doesn't make him  a bad guy. He offers other help for you pain like procedure that helps a lot. along with physical therapy.  I have suffered with Lupus and other complications for years now.  I don't know what  I would do without him in my life. I am so thankful for him and his staff. You have to follow all the rules and he will help you.|Going to Dr. Idi Allen was one of the worst doctor experiences that I have in my 62yrs. Dr. Allen was unfriendly, cold, Un compassionate, uncaring, tried to belittle and degrade me in every way he possibly could. I would ask him questions and he would respond with be quiet I am typing. He didn't like me from our very first visit and he made sure I knew that every time I went to my appointments. I went to my appointment the day after getting out of the hospital in the ICU for RSV and one of his staff came down to get me when I called for a wheelchair (which was very nice). When he came in the room for our visit and saw me in the wheelchair he asked me sarcastically what was wrong with me now? The same appointment day my blood pressure was 225/119 and he said and did NOTHING about it (doctors are suppose to send you to the hospital or call EMS when a patient has blood pressure that high and he did not). On top of his nasty attitude, every time I went to my appointment he threatened to just stop my medicine cold turkey and discharge me. He was a very mean and wicked doctor and one of the worst doctors I have ever encountered. On top of all of his terrible traits and attitude, he made NO secret in anyway that he is extremely with out a doubt prejudice against white people. I wouldn't recommend Dr. Allen to my worst enemy or ANYONE. THE WORST EVER!!!|I came back to this doctor to get records referring to a car accident and it has been over six or seven months have nothing to not heard from anyone from this office. I came by to check personally and there is no one at the door office is black with post notes all over that he is not in the office. If this is bellied up and gone bankrupt I would like to know so that I can indeed get my records that I require in order to go before jury.

I'd like to add to the reply, it is my wife and she has not been seen in years it was last year and she had to go to Emory because she ran out of medication and the doctor went silent on her with no reply and no concern for the patient. The attorneys did not get all records-and some dates are wrong. She went in person to get the records but the place was closed.|Dr.Allen has helped my father in ways I can not describe.  He couldn't walk for long, stand or even sleep. He went to see Dr.Allen and he checked every possible thing that could be wrong with him. My father is old and had a stroke but Dr.Allen was very patient and explained things to him til he understood it. He has helped my dad so much that he's up early in the mornings, working in the garden and going fishing all day long. He is the happiest I have seen him in years. Thank God for Dr.Allen he gave my dad his life back.|I've been going to Dr.Allen and he's short with me, since my first visit and I've had 2procedures that the back injections I felt NO relief,I have lower back problems where I can't walk no more than 15 mins.at a time. And it flares up I stay at and 8 on pain level on daily basis I'm still young, 54 the second was in my hips it lasted bought 3days I could walk better, so I'm mostly at home in bed to my sofa, it's gotten worse since my TKR my body is offsetted by the TKR, now since the hips shots I been having upper back spasms they come as soon as I lay down in bed. I'm on my muscle relaxers helps a little, my sleep is 2hours and back up I have inflammation in my body, I so irritated by the doctors not getting me some kind of longterm help!! Last we talked about was a back brace, if my insurance pays for it I'm on a fixed income!! Now I can barely pay my co pay and these medication they keep prescribing me!!! I went to him for help with my pain! Not saying he is the problem but he is abrute and short with me! I think it's been since Jan or Feb of this year. I have also gained a lot of weight since the TKR surgery! I'm now trying to break so of my poor eating habits to try and lose sum
Weight, God help me!|Worse pain relief center in Ga, I've had multiple rounds of shots that they claim will give relief. The first round caused my leg to go numb to the point I couldn't even walk on it for 2 days, I have had multiple rounds and still no relief. They never answer their phones and the office manager places any issues onto the patient even when they're at fault.... Save yourself some time and money and stay far away from this pain center.

* Notice their response* Please try to pursue me for defamation, just because my name isn't showing up in your system as Shay Jackson doesn't mean I wasn't a patient.... I have all calls made to you within the past year and all medical records showing procedures performed with zero improvement*

Expert Pain Management Solutions Since 2001

At Augusta Pain Center, we are proud to be the area's leading pain management specialists, offering comprehensive care for chronic pain conditions at our state-of-the-art surgical center in Augusta. With more than 30 years of combined experience, our interventional pain management physicians specialize in treating a wide range of chronic pain issues, particularly back and neck pain. We provide our patients with personalized treatment plans that include:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Minimally invasive procedures

  • Spinal cord stimulation therapy

  • Targeted injection therapies

  • Comprehensive pain management programs

Our dedicated team is committed to improving quality of life through effective pain relief strategies rather than simply masking symptoms. Located conveniently at 1321 Interstate Parkway, we combine medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients of all ages regain function and return to their daily activities. Visit Augusta Pain Center or call us at +1 706-738-7246 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.
column11: The Augusta Pain Center is an area leader in pain management offering a variety of state-of-the-art services designed to help patients of all ages find relief from chronic pain. column40:
My experience with Augusta Pain Consultants has been absolutely wonderful! The team has been attentive, addressing my concerns promptly and explaining everything in a clear and easy-to-understand manner. I was so impressed with their care and professionalism that I recommended their services to two others. I highly recommend them to anyone in need of compassionate and effective pain management!|Dr. Epter has done so much to improve the quality of my life. I'm 72 and have been seeing him for several injuries and their aftermath for over three years. Because of his expertise I have overcome debilitating injuries that were the result of an active life. By following his advice I am able to keep my busy lifestyle. I can't thank him enough. His office is full of incredible staff. The nurses and front office treat you like one of their own. Many thanks to Mandy and others that are too numerous to mention!! So glad I found this practice!|I've been a patient here for years. They have always been kind and listened to my needs and concerns. The doctors and PAs are knowledgeable and compassionate.  My pain has been managed well and I am grateful for their expertise and resources.

The staff is wonderful! Mandy is kind and understanding with me and my scheduling needs. Andrea and Cathy always greet we with smiles and kind words. The front desk and nursing staff are kind and caring. My PA Lance is personable and treats me like an individual not just a number. Dr. Epter has a wealth of knowledge and is the reason this practice has succeeded for so many years.

I've obviously gotten to know the staff well as my chronic pain has had me here for many years. I just want to encourage others with chronic pain that this practice is the real deal. I feel seen and cared for here. They look out for my best interest and help find ways to get a better quality of life rather than just masking it with something temporary.

I highly recommend Augusta Pain Center!|My experience at  Augusta Pain Center was nothing short of exceptional. From start to finish, the entire team created an environment that felt both professional and welcoming. The check-in process was quick and efficient, with the front desk staff setting the tone for an incredibly positive visit. Lots of smiles looking at me.

When I was called back, I noticed how seamlessly the team worked together to ensure everything flowed smoothly. Meeting Doctor Epter as well as Lance was the highlight of my visit. They took the time to thoroughly explain everything in a way that was easy to understand, leaving no questions unanswered. It's rare to meet someone so knowledgeable yet approachable, and it made a huge difference in my confidence moving forward.

The check-out process was equally impressive. Mandy, made it easy and even enjoyable to wrap up my visit. She is a very friendly person that goes above and beyond.
It's clear this practice prioritizes patient care at every level.
Thank you, Augusta Pain Center, for truly setting the standard. I couldn't be more grateful!"|I've been seeing Dr. Epter for a while and I have been pleased with his services provided. The office environment is always inviting from making appointments to the signing in process is made easy. His staff is amazing from all sides of the clinic no matter what their position is. Thank you Mandy for always being kind|My experience is always great. One of the best parts of the visit is talking to and checking out with Mandy! She's always super nice and friendly. She shows sincere emotions and cares about my health. She fabulous and she needs to know this! Great employee!|Ok so let me start off by saying..."wow"  My last visit with Augusta Pain Center effortlessly takes the cake with the most well rounded team of empathic individuals I have ever encountered.  From the very first step of the process filled with an amazing check-in crew to being called back before seeing the doctor. It was one great atmosphere to another and another. Everyone was nice and well spoken, it was a total blessing. In regards to my visit with Dr. Epter, it was a wonderful experience in which things were explained and I was able to comprehend. He explains himself really well and I've got to say, that's very hard to come by. It's a bit of a drive to come to this practice but that's what you do for the best. I would also like to point out the check out process was smooth as well. Mandy was inviting and meeting her was such a blast. All star group from beginning to end. Thanks Augusta Pain Center.|I would like to give a big SHOUT OUT to Mandy Robinson at the Augusta Pain Center. She's always professional and personable and clearly understands her job. She makes every attempt to schedule my appointments around the time that best fits my calendar. At the end of an office visit when you're in pain, it's always wonderful to be greeted with a smiling face! That's what Tammy gives every patient!

column3:
Advanced Pain Management Solutions in Gainesville, GA

At Lanier Interventional Pain Center, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from acute and chronic pain conditions. Our approach combines traditional treatments with cutting-edge regenerative therapies, including platelet-rich plasma (PRP) injections and stem cell treatments derived from your own body. Under the leadership of our medical director, Dr. John L. Givogre, who is board-certified in both anesthesiology and pain medicine with over 25 years of hands-on experience, we deliver personalized care plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. Dr. Givogre received his specialized training at Johns Hopkins in a fully-accredited pain medicine fellowship program, ensuring the highest standard of care for our patients. Our services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Regenerative medicine therapies

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

Visit us at Lanier Interventional Pain Center or call +1 770-297-0356 to schedule your consultation at our Gainesville location: 2335 Limestone Overlook, Gainesville, GA 30501.
column11: We offer comprehensive, leading edge treatments for acute and chronic pain syndromes, including the latest regenerative therapies such as injections of platelet-rich plasma(PRP) and stem cells acquired from your own body. Our medical director, John L. Givogre, MD, is board-certified in both anesthesiology and pain medicine and has over twenty-five years of hands-on experience. He was trained at Johns Hopkins in a fully-accredited pain medicine fellowship program.

column40:
Dr Advear is a great doctor who seems,so far, to be very supportive & concerned about helping you with getting your pain issues under control as best as possible...(only been patient for 4 months now & anyone with true pain knows that you can have your pain controlled but it will never be 100% pain free all the time!) He helps you to figure out all the different kinds of treatment processes to help you to be as pain free as he possibly can. If you have to use opioid or other types of pain medications, then he is very helpful at deciding which is best for your conditions & helping to keep you safe with whichever is finally decided upon. The people in the front are always helpful & courteous with any questions or concerns you may have. My nurse has always been great also. The only issues I've had is when you need to speak with nurse on phone, it can sometimes be a hassle. Example: I've had nurse call me back but have to leave me voicemail to call her back ASAP & when calling back, only to be sent to her voicemail & have to wait ALL day for another call back or even it being next day before being able to speak with her. But other than that, I've had great overall experience since becoming patient last November 2020.
I would recommend this pain management clinic/Doctors to any & all who were looking for a pain management or just needing a new one to be able to get better help with their pain issues to help to better get them under control!!!|I had my first appointment at Specialty Spine & Pain this week with Dr. Alvear. It had take n me a month to get the paperwork from my previous practice to be accepted and I was feeling less than confident that I would be happy. I had to make a change, however, due to my move. Dr. Alvear put me at ease immediately. He is kind, understanding, and very friendly. He thoroughly explained the cause of the new pain and described his plan of action. I can't imagine a better experience. The staff members I encountered were friendly and efficient. I was only there for just over an hour, and most of that time was spent with the doctor or his assistant. I am very hopeful that my upcoming procedure will bring pain relief, and I am confident that I will receive excellent care.|I have been a patient for 12 years. I came to them with excruciating back pain that prevented me from standing up straight. I had severe muscle spasms and was so stiff  and sore that i was chronically exhausted from it.
My pain is managed.  I stand up straight.  The stiffness and soreness no longer rule my life.
They are a team of providers that consistently gives quality care so their patients can have good lives.
The best possible care!|Dr. Alvear is one of the greatest doctors out there. He's so caring and personable. He spends quality time with you and is easy to communicate with. The nurses and receptionists are all very kind as well.|Dr. Steven Crider and his support staff is amazing.  I couldn't keep walking without them taking care of me.  They are the best.  I already recommend my doctor and Speciality Spine and Pain to everyone with spine issues.|If you are truly wanting the whole package in Pain Control please pick Specialty Spine & Pain in Gainesville GA. From reception to Staff to Dr Assistant to Dr you will feel hear and understood and validated. Pain has to be lived with but bringing it down to managable to have quality of life is what they do best! I am a patient and so is my Husband. We wont go anywhere else.|April is a warm compassionate lady
I am so blessed to have her and Dr.Turner and his  staff helping me through this journey of life I am on.
Thank you Dr.Turner and April you two have always been here for me yall are truly amazingly wonderful people|Dr. Alvear is wonderful! He listens and is kind. And he is excellent when I need a shot in the back. Everyone in the practice is nice and friendly.
