column3:
At Physician Pain Care, we are dedicated to providing exceptional interventional pain management treatments for patients suffering from various pain conditions.

Personalized Pain Management Solutions

Our privately-owned practice is led by Dr. Jeffrey W. Rubin, who brings over 30 years of experience and is board-certified in both anesthesia and pain medicine. We take a comprehensive approach to pain management by first determining the root cause of your pain, then developing a personalized treatment plan designed to achieve optimal relief. Our services include:

- Minimally invasive injection therapy

- Medication management

- Customized treatment plans

- State-of-the-art surgical facilities

Our goal is simple: to help our patients return to living their best lives with reduced pain and improved function. column40:
Dr. Rubin and his Nurse Practitioner Richard are two of the most competent and caring pain management specialists I could have hoped to receive treatment from. Also, their procedure office (attached in tandem to the normal pain management office, and the procedure office is called "Salubrious") is wonderful. The nurses and the staff for my radio frequency ablation procedures on my spine have always been informative, kind and they put in the effort to care for you and remember you.

My wife and I spent a lot of effort and time into choosing the right pain management doctor, as I'm young, only 28, and have multiple diseases that can complicate things, so we did not just simply want a doctor that prescribes meds and gets rid of me. Dr Rubin is exactly what we had hoped for and more.

I can say Dr. Rubin and ALL of his staff are respectful, they take the time to find the right treatment for each person, and they take appropriate and strong precautions to ensure the medication (if prescribed) is being taken appropriately (I.e. random urine tests, pill counting, etc). It is encouraging to have a doctor's office for my pain issues that cares enough to ensure proper therapeutic usage of prescribed medications.

Literally he is the kindest and most patient doctor I've ever met, and has worked diligently to get me back on track to being able to spend a bit more time with my family instead of simply always being in pain.

Thanks to everyone at Physician Pain Care & Salubrious.

-Luke|I remember a time when the world was a different place. Doctor's actually would greet the patient with a smile. Doctor's wanted to find the best solution to your issue. They would take the time to listen to your concerns, because you really mattered to them. People never forget, how you made them feel. Dr. Rubin, is an expert in his profession. What I'm most impressed by is, his integrity, and the way he makes his patients his top priority every visit. The office, as well as the staff are always extremely professional, and inviting. Thank you Dr. Rubin for recognizing that, those characteristics are still important today.|I have been suffering with nonstop pain for almost a decade (I am in my mid 30's), been seen by over 10 different doctors with different specialties across the US, and Dr. Rubin has been the only one to listen to what has been happening, and not just prescribing opiates. Many of the other doctors just prescribe opiates and call it treatment. Dr. Rubin took the time to ask the questions and talk game plan. He listened to my concerns, and answered all of my questions. I could not be happier with the treatment and the staff. I was finally able to receive a proper diagnosis, and treatment all in one location, with the same doctor and staff. Having the nerve block injections has been life changing. I can finally and honestly say for the first time in almost a decade I am pain free, and it is all thank to Dr. Rubin for listening. I could not be happier with everyone at this office.|BEWARE & BECAREFUL OF DR JEFFREY RUBIN. my recent pain mgmt provider lft his practice after 1 yr n i was haplessly handed off to a new Dr at Physician Pain Care, Dr Jeffrey Rubin. At first i was told my treatment would continue as it had been for the last 3 yrs,  but unfortunately he lied thru his teeth. N After the multiple incompetence n repeated mistakes from his office staff, messing up everything about my meds, the dosage, quantity n dates, which hadnt changedon for 3yrs. When i finally complained after coming to my wits end, Dr. Rubin met with me for the only time at my final appt to inform me he changed his mind and would not continue my care. Naturally I got upset n lost my temper n spoke the truth too bluntly n was basically kicked out of the practice n he did it in the meanest n most unethical way possible. He told me to find a new Dr n he chose to stop everything cold turkey instead of slowly weaning down off my meds in a safe manner n then outright lied on my Official Discharge Letter stating i was in "Bad Standing" which gave every new dr i tried to set up appts with, the easy excuse for them to not even meet me for a new patient appt. Lastly he refused to provide any meds to counter the side effects of immediate opiod detox, which he knew i would immediately start to experienc since I've been on these meds 4 over 2 decades following a car accident which i became legally disabled as a result of. Luckily my mom came w/ so at least i had a witness not on the Physician Pain Care's Payroll who also heard his lies n sorry excuses as well as his highly unethical medical behavior. Then add insult to injury, when i asked what I was supposed to do while I attempted to find a new Dr while unwillingly suffering from severe n immediate opioid detox, n how could I lessen my upcoming suffering? Dr Rubin then callously informed "if" i needed help, I could always go to the ER. I've dealt with chronic pain as my everyday way of life for 2 decades, so plz believe me when I say, if u choose to go under the medical care of Dr Jeffrey Rubin for any reason, u do so at ur own peril. Ull most likely suffer as i have suffered entirely unnecessarily cuz the man n his practice doesnt give a single solitary piece of crap of ur physical n metal well-being. the Hell I've endured since this happened on 1/25/25 till today, 2/20/25, was easily avoidable n ull eventually regret ever allowing Dr Rubin anywhere near u for the purpose of pain reduction, relief or real help of any kind. Good luck to u all. I pray u never experience the hell I went through while he "cared for my medical needs". Please, Beware n Becareful, he'll only help ruin ur life not improve it. At least thats exactly what he did to me n I fear thats what he'll do to I chose to share this story & review, cuz if even 1 person is saved from Dr Rubin's intentional failure to act accordingly as a human being n a supposed health care professional. N i could save even 1 indiv from his blatant diregard to his Hippocratic Oath of "Do No Harm". Then it's worth it.  next victim, I'm sorry, I mean patient.... I chose to share this story & review, cuz if even 1 person is saved from Dr Rubin's intentional failure to act accordingly as a human being n a supposed health care professional. N i can save even 1 indiv from his blatant diregard to his Hippocratic Oath of "Do No Harm". Then it's worth it. He and his office of "Healthcare professionals " made it clear in no uncertain terms that my current and future physical well-being was a no real big concern to him as a Doctor or a human being. My opinion n advice, stay away from Physician Pain Care n Dr Rubin, cuz regardless of the lies they spk, everyone i dealt with there had absolutely no issue leaving me to suffer alone n with zero help or advice for my future well-being n saw nothing wrong with the intentional n preventable upcoming suffering i experienced from detox from medications which there practice had provided me w/ for over a yr, but somehow I was the wrong one in this situation. Uve been warned.|I would highly recommend Dr Rubin for any pain management needs. He is highly skilled, patient and very good at explaining procedures. His staff are all very caring, courteous and friendly. I will definitely use his services again if I am in need of treatment.|I have been receiving care here for over a year. Everyone I have dealt with have great bedside manners which is a hard thing to come by these days. I would refer them to anyone seeking a cornic pain physician.  They are an amazing group . Very attentive and caring.|Dr. Sheahan is an exceptional physician who is both intelligent and compassionate.  I am grateful for his medical expertise and to be a patient of his. 

Also, the nurses and office staff are friendly & helpful. Great practice - thank you!!!|I've been a patient here for approximately 8 years, and all I've experienced is complete competence and professionalism. Veronica has been my nurse on several occasions. She is knowledgeable, and respectful. But more than that, you can tell that she's invested in her work because she genuinely cares for her patients. She has gone above and beyond for me personally on quite a few occasions. Dr. Rubin's masterful, I love the entire staff, and Veronica is heaven sent. Definitely an asset to the practice

column40:
The entire staff at Nova is focused on the quality of the patient experience.  I feel like everyone wants to help me from the time I walk in the door to the time I leave. They all seem to enjoy their work.  Nova is a "happy place."  And Dr. Ram is the best at what she does.|Had an appointment today...Nova staff is wonderful. Everyone smiles and makes you feel comfortable ... They care and attend to your needs and explain procedures so we understand what to expect with their treatments. They're great. Thank you.|Cannot say enough about this practice.  The staff is excellent, very conserving, very easy to make an appointment.  Doctor Ram is excellent.  She talks to you and tell you what she will be doing and durning the process, she reassured you what is happening.|I had been seeing an orthopedist for 10 months with no relief.  Finally went to a neurosurgeon who suggested I see Dr Ram.  She and her staff have been great.  All the pain is not gone yet but we are somuch better and I think within the next few months I will have little to no pain.  I appreciate how they have listened to me explain where my pain is and have been so proactive to help me.  Thank you Dr Ram and your staff.|I suffered a few physical injuries during my time in the U.S. Army years ago, and it finally got to the point where I couldn't tolerate the chronic pain any longer. After having a less than stellar experience with my previous spine/pain management provider, I was referred to Nova by my Neurologist.

I knew I was in the right place when I told Dr. Ram on the first day that I wasn't there to just get some opioids and go home. One of dearest Army buddies overdosed on them, and it's just not something in which I feel comfortable. Dr. Ram smiled and said "Good! Because I don't like handing them out!". I learned that opioids are but a single arrow in her quiver, but not always the go-to solution.

She is a terrific listener, and really took the time to understand everything that I was suffering from (not just physical issues). She and her office staff have done an impressive job not just in holistically treating me, but also making the entire experience as pleasant and relaxing as possible.

I simply cannot recommend them highly enough!|The office staff is so efficient. The doctors are always willing to listen to Whatever need you have. I would recommend this place for anybody that has back pain.|Great Experience! Very professional and methodical. Everything was explained well and even documented for additional record. The procedure was very seamless and I appreciated and respected their thoroughness of the process. It is always nice to have people who know what they are doing and provide friendly customer service as well with a smile.|I initially came in for lower back issues. Dr Ram is an incredible doctor and thoroughly explains everything. Danyelle is a charm; she is always smiling and in a pleasant mood. Her happy outlook makes the experience go that much better. Renee, Lindsey, Jennifer, and all the back-office staff are wonderful. I can't express enough the great experience I have had. I highly recommend them, and you won't be disappointed. 2 thumbs up!

column40:
When Dr. Seymore was there it was a great place. But the NPs seem to think everyone needs a procedure. If you don't  they tell you no meds. So if medication keeps you functioning everyday in a normal way, they don't want you here.|This was my first experience with a pain clinic.  After several months, I never saw a doctor.  No doctor explained my condition to me nor discussed treatment options. I was told that the doctor never comes to the Griffin office. To see him, I would have to go to Stockbridge.
My pain was well controlled with medication but I was told that I MUST submit to injections which were never explained to me, other than to say that sometimes it worked, sometimes it doesn't.
I told her that I did not feel my pain was bad enough for such an invasive procedure.  I was not given any input into my care.  She told me that's what their doctors demand. I don't do anything without the opportunity to research the procedure and the qualifications of who is working on me.  Because I did not agree to the more invasive and expensive procedure, I was kicked out of the practice with no discussion of next steps. I will find a clinic that meets my definition of proper patient care.|The front desk: 
The MA: 
The NP: 

I was made to feel like I was wrong for being a patient. I have an entire care team of four Specialists who are CARING, MAKE EYE CONTACT and SPEAK TO ME AS A PATIENT. I have been dealing with this disease for almost 2 decades and only recently started seeing pain management FOR PAIN MANAGEMENT!
I am the Director of Operations for a Healthcare company! I would never allow ANY OF MY STAFF TO RECEIVE THE TREATMENT I EXPERIENCED!!!!
No one should ever feel like they have to explain their disease or why thrive and have a better quality of life on a particular treatment.

Thank you front desk staff for your care and concern as I stood there in tears!! You are a true professional and a kind human being. I felt heard.

ADVOCATE FOR YOURSELF AND OTHERS!!!
Never allow anyone to make you feel like a problem because you have a disease.|This Pain Management has been nothing but good to me. They have taken care of all of my needs. Doctor Seymore Is highly skilled and he will take the time to discuss and issues that you have. Plus the staff are wonderful and caring. I read a negative post about the needle going into the neck. Of course it's going to hurt, But not like it was described. Anyways Thanks to The Pain Management for all that you have done for me.|Dr Seymour is The Most Genuine and Compassionate Physician you will ever come across. His patients are always treated with the upmost care and respect and His priority has always been to give Me the best treatment as possible. Dr Seymour is very knowledgeable and well educated with today's technology in modern medicine. Everyone working in that office is very friendly and caring towards His patients and will go above and beyond to help with any specific needs you may have, you will know you have received the Best quality of care once you are there.  Dr Seymour is  A Prime example of A Physician who truly cares about His Patients.|Dr. Seymore was great. I was so nervous but he explained everything he was going to do before he did it. His staff was so nice and friendly, yet very professional.|I visited two other pain clinics before I came here 8 years ago. Dr. Seymore has done miracles where two other doctors have failed. I had back surgery about 11 years ago with metal rods and screws everywhere. I re-hurt my back after the initial operation and was having extreme burning in my left leg that totally incapacitated me. The short story is that Dr. Seymore gave me back some semblance of a normal life where others had failed. I will never let another doctor give me back injections and if Dr. Seymore ever leaves Pain Management Specialist Of Atlanta I will follow him where ever he goes. I want to thank Dr. Seymore, and P.A. Laren, and all the staff for the caring and effective services I have received. If you are looking for true professionalism and a truly caring knowledgeable physician look no further, make an appointment today to see Dr. Seymore and his staff.|Pain Management was ABSOLUTELY THE ULTIMATE WORST doctor's office I have ever been to. Dr. Seymore and Dr. White are most INCOMPETENT doctors I have ever had to deal with. Their patients are NOT patients that they care about, but ONLY CASH COWS!  Dr. White did numerous procedures on my left knee and during all that time he NEVER SAW MY KNEE AND TIBIA BONE WAS BROKEN! Dr. Seymore gave me an epidural on my neck and it was so painful I thought I was going to die on the table and I cried for 2 hours after. Another time he gave an occipital block, had his PA practice on me and she stuck the needle in my skull 4 times and I couldn't move my neck for a week.
Because for my benefit I went to another doctor to check on a different procedure I was thinking about doing since I had a lack of trust in Dr. White and Dr. Seymore at this time not having any procedures done by the other the discharged me from their practice leaving me high and dry with NO NARCOTICS AFTER THEM GIVING THEM TO ME FOR 2 yrs. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS PRACTICE TO MY WORST ENEMY!!! BEWARE!! Their PA Lauren breaks your confidence and their office manager Cindy is a down an out right liar!

column3:
Pain Consultants of Atlanta (PCA) is a premier pain management medical practice with four highly skilled physicians serving patients across our convenient locations in Atlanta, Newnan, and Fayetteville, Georgia. At our Fayetteville office, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive care for those suffering from both acute and chronic pain conditions.

Specialized Pain Management Services

Our expertise encompasses a wide range of pain-related conditions, including:

  • Neck and back pain

  • Spinal stenosis

  • Failed back surgery syndrome

  • Complex regional pain syndrome

  • Post-herpetic neuralgia

  • Myofascial pain

  • Arthritic conditions

  • Cancer pain management

We offer a total pain management approach that combines minimally invasive interventional procedures with medical pain management techniques when appropriate. Our physicians take the time to listen to each patient's unique concerns, developing personalized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life. Located at 1233 GA-54 in Fayetteville, we invite you to visit our website or call us at +1 404-351-7654 to learn more about how we can help alleviate your pain and restore your comfort.
column11:
Pain Consultants of Atlanta (PCA") is a pain management medical practice with four physicians with office locations in Atlanta, Newnan, Fayetteville, and Newnan, Georgia.

Our practice is committed to helping patients who suffer from acute and chronic pain conditions. Common referrals may include but are not limited to: neck or back pain, spinal stenosis, failed back surgery syndrome, complex regional pain syndrome, post-herpetic neuralgia, myofascial pain, management of arthritic conditions, and cancer pain. We offer comprehensive, total pain management with minimally invasive interventional procedures and medical pain management when appropriate.

Contact PCA to learn more about how PCA can help alleviate your pain.
column38: Kathy Cameron|Phillip Rogers|Jo Ann Abercrombie|Laura|Sandy Smith|James Akin|William Bithoney|James Spearman
column40:
I've have been a patient here for over a decade. I love Dr Pleasant. He is a good listener and strives to apply his wealth of knowledge in order to control my pain. Stephanie the P. A. Is wonderful and always has a smile for everyone. Susan the front office worker is another person that xare about the patients that go here. If you are looking for a pain management team that will be there for you and all your pain needs. Look no further.|Dr Pleasant and his office staff are wonderful. Dr Pleasant is very easy to talk to and very personable. He took as much time with me as I needed and answered all of our questions. I highly recommend the Pain Consultants of Atlanta - Fayetteville office.|Dr Pleasant is the best!  He truly cares for his patients. He is very empathetic and works very hard to give them the best outcome. He has kept me going for a number of years now and I have no doubts that if it were not for his care that I would not be mobile. I highly recommend him.|I have attempted to schedule a new patient appointment with the Fayetteville office since October 23rd (today is November 21st) with no results.
I called the office on 10/23/24 and was sent to voicemail (I did not leave one at this time). I called again the next day on 10/24/24 where I left a voicemail requesting a call back. After never hearing back, I called again on 11/15/24 and left another voicemail. To be on the safe side, I also completed an Appointment Request form on their website at 2:45pm. Only 30 minutes later at 3:15pm I received a call from a lovely lady that acknowledged me and asked additional questions. She informed me I should receive a call back from their scheduler 1 to 2 business days later. She is the only good part of this upsetting situation. After not hearing back from them by the end of the 2nd business day (Tuesday, 11/19/24) I tried calling again only to yet again be sent to voicemail. It is now Thursday, 11/21/24 and their office has closed for the day and I have received no further communications from their office.
I have chronic pain from a genetic condition as well as a previous lumbar fusion. My grandmother was a patient before she passed almost a decade ago and my mother recommended this office based on that experience. The care team treated my grandmother with dignity towards the end of her life and so I wanted to have them assist me with my chronic pain. I'm sure the doctors are great based off of my mother's testimony and other reviews. But if you are wanting to establish care, you will not be contacted even if you are proactive with following up. I am left to assume that either their scheduling staff is incompetent (I feel awful for even typing that out) or they have made assumptions that I am drug seeking and think of me as less than human and not deserving of so much as even a response. Either way, others should rethink this office for pain management.
It should also be noted I rarely leave negative reviews. People who experience chronic pain deserve more decency as they struggle enough. Please do better moving forward.|I LOVE LOVE LOVE Dr. Pleasant!!! He's very personable and really detailed about my treatment(s) and always explains things in layman's terms. I would (and have) recommend Dr. Pleasant to anyone!!|Nathaniel Pleasant, MD Is a consumate professional. He is compassionate, caring, and has an excellent "bedside" manner. I feel fortunate to have him as my pain management care physician.
He listens to his patients and is considerate of their concerns. I recommend his care to any person seeking help with chronic pain.
Additionally, the members and staff at Pain Consultants of Atlanta are kind and caring.
Overall, my experience has been excellent and very positive.|Dr. Pleasant is a wonderful person. He seems to truly care about His patients. He's clearly very knowledgeable and skilled as well. A perfect combination.|Excellent check in, minimal wait time for Dr Pleasant.  Dr Pleasant showed interest in my physical limitation and my current pain levels.  He is one of the best Doctors that I've seen.  Hats off sir.

column40: I have struggled for years with chronic pain because of my chronic illness. My Primary doctor suggested I find someone who could assist with managing my pain. Dr Patel was wonderful. We went over my images and scans and discussed several options I could pursue to improve my daily life. He was very patient and kind. He listens without judgment and encourages you to discuss your treatment options and do research on items that will assist in your search for a better quality of life. The practitioners are skilled and knowledgeable. Everyone on the staff are eager to assist you and make your experience a pleasant one. I highly recommend this amazing group of compassionate people if you are looking for help with pain of any kind. It is an all around beautiful experience.|Dr Patel has really helped relieve my back pain. Not only does he provide pain medication, but he's also done several nerve blocks over the past 18 months that makes it more bearable. I definitely recommend him for anyone who suffers from chronic pain.|Summit is a really good place. They have been really trying to help me get rid of the pain in my lower back by different means other than just taking pain meds. The only thing I have to say other than that is that I'm not receiving enough medication to get by when the shots wear off|Summit has helped me beyond expectation! Dr. Patel listens and pays attention to me when I tell him how I'm feeling. He offers suggestions like a dr should and is absolutely amazing. He truly cares about me getting better. The only thing that I didn't like was the Docs often made light of my pain. Just because I'm not rolling on the fourth writhing in pain doesn't mean that it's not extremely painful to walk, sit or lie down. I had to learn to live with most of it. It's a long process but they get the job done.|I've been going to the Rome , Georgia office and seeing Dr. Patel for a couple of years or so now and it's amazing with him ! Thank you Summit.|I was a new patient. I went to see the Dr about the severe pain I have had for about 2 years due to Bursitis in my shoulder and Arthritis in my thumb. I waited in the waiting room for over a hour. I was in the patient room for 5 mins before the Dr came in and informed me that he couldn't help me. He stated that he would refer me to a hand surgeon and would contact me with the appointment info. I have yet to hear from either office. I paid $150 for this visit to be told he couldn't help me. I am in the process of trying to get my $150 back so I can make my own appointment with a surgeon and use the money for that Dr. I was very unsatisfied with this office and I hope I don't have any problems getting the refund.

column40:
The staff at Origins Spine and Joints Physicians are very professional and courteous, they care about everyone that visits their office.  I always have my questions answered before I walk out the door.  I recently had a procedure that I was a bit concerned about but Dr. Crider and his staff made me feel relaxed from start to finish.  I tell my friends and family that I am grateful that I was referred to Origins Spine and Joints Physicians.  I will continue to have Dr. Crider and his staff proved me with my spinal treatments.|The entire staff were helpful and patient with everyone. I witnessed this being done with patients there and some over the phones while checking in and out. Dr. Crider was approachable and very informative. It's evident Dr. Crider enjoys his profession and wants to help his patients. Thank you! C Sanders|Best place i've ever been. Staff was very polite and Dr. Crider is the best Dr. i've ever talked to. He's not in a hurry.
My treatment was  almost painless. My rating is 5star.
I would recommend him to everybody that is in pain.
Thanks Doc.
Tommy  Dillard|I'm so glad I switched!

I just signed on with Dr. Crider at Origins. What a huge change from the doctor I was switching from! Everyone was so kind and welcoming. They had me do A LOT of medical history paperwork; which I think is a good thing. They're definitely not there to just dole out meds. Although, if needed, they will manage your meds.

The PA spent a good amount of time with me asking a lot of questions to get a good sense of my issues. Then, Dr. Crider came in and chatted with me for a good amount of time also. He ordered a test, we set up a follow up appointment, and took care of meds. Great visit!|Dr.Steve was very genuine and that's important for a patient.  I like that he offers different solutions to manage pain. This Doctor listened to me attentively and I didn't feel judged or embarrassed by my situation. I know this Doc is going to help me, I'm very grateful to be in his care.|Dr. Crider and his staff are all very kind and compassionate. They are friendly and there's a good energy in the office. Dr. Crider explains diagnosis and treatments in a way that is easy to understand. He walked me through my MRI results and explained every issue in great detail and answered all my questions. Dr. Crider is also very understanding that I do not want to take medications for pain and has provided alternatives as well as support in me finding solutions and cures for the source of the pain. Since my very first visit, I felt like I was in good hands.|Love Dr. Crider and staff. He's made me feel very comfortable in helping with my bank pain and provided multiple options on things we could try and not just throwing medicine at the issue. He provides the medicine however which I'm super grateful for but very nice knowing we have other things we can try to hopefully relieve my back pain to a more manageable level and after going through one back surgery and looking at the option of another facing me, I was very glad to find Dr. Crider to hopefully not have to go through that again. I've already had one back injection that has relieved my sciatica and due to a miscommunication had to go through the procedure without the anesthesia. Dr. Crider was super calm and confident and talked me through the entire thing even though I was unsure and very anxious. Knowing he gives me the option however for my next procedure to use different things such as once again doing it with nothing, valium, or anesthesia when my previous doctor gave neither of the last two options and made it feel like he only did the injections as a money grab (they didn't work either) rather than a tool to help with pain makes me feel so much better. I would definitely recommend this office to anyone suffering with back issues. The staff is really great too! If I have issues with appointments, medicine questions or any other concerns, they always are quick to respond. Rarely have I had to leave a message for a nurse to call me back and waited forever for a response, usually I can call and speak directly to someone instantly. I have only had to wait longer than 10 minutes to go back to a room after arriving only once also. I appreciate everything Dr. Crider and his staff are doing for me.|It is a great place to go too. The whole staff is very caring and respectful!! The doctor and nurses are wonderful too!!! Doctor Crider is very thorough and thoughtful. He found a fracture in my back when the surgeon and the radiologist didn't see it. I highly recommend this practice to everyone.

column40:
Dr Taylor really helped my chronic pain from my advanced stage arthritis. I can now somewhat live a more bareable life. The staff is super friendly and professional. Dr Taylor's bedside mannerism is stellar. If you are tired of living your life in excruciating pain, please give Dr. Taylor's office a call. Thank you so very much.|I've been with Dr Taylor since 2010 for my suboxone treatment and other treatments. I wish Dr Taylor was a full-service medical doctor degreed in all medical specialties because he is the best Dr I've ever had in all my 48 years. He does not treat you like a number. He sits down and calmly listens to your questions without rushing you and he doesn't get up to leave the room until the entire conversation is finished. His wife Nancy, is a nurse who works with him and she is a complete doll! If you're looking for a compassionate doctor who is thorough with you and is a good listener and communicates well, Dr Taylor is the Dr for you. A good Christian man and his staff is always kind.

Michelle Couch
2010-current|I could write a LOT about how happy I am with Comprehensive Pain Care, but I will try to summarize my feelings below:

Dr. Taylor is professional, compassionate, personable, interested in making sure your pain care is being managed; and from my perspective, one of the BEST DRs around.  I appreciate him taking the time to listen to me and making diagnoses that make sense and get you feeling better.  He should be named as one of the "TOP TEN" DRs!!

His staff is friendly, professional and always recognize you by name.  Thank you for all the things you do in the background!  I'm grateful for everyone at Comprehensive Pain Care.|Dr Taylor has been absolutely God sent to me. I have suffered with chronic back pain for almost 13 years . I had a failed back surgery in 2008. Dr Taylor is the first Doctor in all these years that has truly cared & listened to me! He has & continues to work diligently to control my pain. I feel so blessed to have found him & have him as my Doctor. I highly recommend him to anyone in need of a caring, compassionate Doctor who cares about his patients, listens & takes the appropriate actions to give you the best quality of life he can. If I could give him more than 5 stars I definitely would!|If you decide to visit Dr Taylor's office, be ready for inconsiderate, and condescending treatment by both his support staff and Dr. Taylor himself. You'll be talked to as one would speak to a small child. I went to one appointment and immediately realized I'd made a mistake.|I have been seeing Dr Taylor since 1997. I had a sinus surgery that damaged my Supraorbita Nerve and has cause me terrible pain since. I don't know what I would do without Dr Taylor. In 1998 he flew up to Johns Hopkins University Hospital where I was having experimental brain surgery just to give me support during the first couple of hours of surgery. The staff at Comprehensive Pain Center is also great. They actually care how you are feeling and greet you with a smile. Dr Taylor and his wife Nancy are two of the kindest most knowledgeable people I know when it comes to relieving pain.
Dr Taylor travels around the world giving seminars on pain relief. Most of his patients don't even know this because he's not the bragging or telling type. All I know is he the best pain management Dr around Atlanta.|I've been very happy with the doctor and the staff . It is obvious, very soon,  that doctor Taylor truly cares for his patients. The staff is wonderful and polite and it makes you feel like you're in a place that people really care. I feel better just being here. Keep up the good work!|Dr. Taylor and his staff are the most caring people ever! He has a heart of gold and I am so blessed that he is my doctor. May he practice for many more years because none of us want to lose him. God bless you Dr. Taylor and staff!

Liz

When I try to call them with or when told they would call to me they don't!!|I am very distrustful of medical personnel and facilities in general but Dr. Tafor and Dr. Datta and the excellent NPs have treated me with dignity and respect. I have had several procedures there (epidurals, steroid injections) and have received excellent care. The bedside manners of the medical staff are impeccable. If you're a skeptic like me, you'll be pleasantly surprised at the professional and top notch care you'll receive here. Highly recommend.|Very knowledgeable people and very clean. They take the time to explain to you about your procedure before and after it. I love this place and I hope VA see fit for me to stay with these people.|Good manner , knowledgeable. Long wait if you are not the 1st patient of the day or after lunch. Has never submitted paperwork on time and not completed as needed. Last FMLA paperwork never sent to my employer.|Dr. Datta is very nice and explains things in laymens terms for my understanding. Only complaint is long waits for normal visits.  Dr. Tafor injected pain relief medicine in my lower back.  Very tender and explains everything.|I have been a patient of Dr. Stephen N. I am a very difficult patient to treat, because I am allergic to so many things. I have been to several other physicians for pain treatment and they were not able to help me. Dr. Tafor never gave up on me and because of his diligence, I am now able to stand and walk with considerably less pain. He truly is a God send to me and to his other patients. I would highly recommend anyone with issues with pain to call and make an appointment to go see Dr. Tafor as soon as possible. Have a wonderful day.

Expert Pain Management in Canton, GA

At Nova Spine and Pain Care, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions in a thoughtful, personalized, and friendly environment. Led by Dr. Chitra Ramasubbu, who is double board certified in Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine, our practice brings elite training from Johns Hopkins School of Medicine and the University of Pennsylvania to Canton. With over a decade of experience serving patients in the Atlanta area, Dr. Ramasubbu now offers her expertise in our private practice setting where we prioritize individualized care plans for each patient's unique needs.

Our comprehensive services include:

column11:
Welcome to Nova Spine and Pain Care!
Our mission is to provide you with the highest quality of care and meet your pain management needs in a meaningful manner.

Dr. Chitra Ramasubbu is double board certified in Anesthesiology and Pain Medicine. She trained in Interventional Pain Management at Johns Hopkins School of Medicine as well as the University of Pennsylvania. This was my 3rd treatment for my neck pain and definitely the best experience!  Everyone was so kind and gentle. The doctor explained each step and continually asked if I was comfortable.
Most of all I appreciated Renee ! She was so kind and informative and expressed a lot of compassion!|I visited Nova Spine and Pain Care Centre for my chronic pain. When I first walked in, I was incredibly nervous about my chronic pain issues. However, Dr. Ram is very compassionate and she explained the treatment plan well and put me at ease. Her team thoroughly assessed my condition and explained every step of the treatment process. From diagnostic procedures to personalized pain management plans, her experience is evident. Thanks to Dr. Ram and her team, I now have hope and effective pain management strategies.|From the moment my wife and I first walked into Nova Spine and Pain it was like we had entered a new dimension.  The entire staff treated us like they were glad to see us  and they were happy to be there to help.   Dr. Ramasubbu or Dr. Ram as she is known to all is the "icing on the cake".  She is smart, compassionate, knowledgeable and has an "infectious" laugh. We knew from the beginning she really wanted to help us.  And she tells it like it is. She gained our confidence and she continues to help us grow  methods for dealing with our conditions.|Dr Ram and her staff are empathetic, considerate, efficient, caring and highly skilled professionals. She has treated my neck and shoulder pain and I am so glad that I went to her practice. Norman Kalmin,MD|Dr. Chitra Ramasubbu, a renowned spine and pain specialist at Nova Spine And Pain Care, is instrumental in my wife and my recovery after a devastating car accident that totaled our X7. Dr. Ramasubbu and the entire team at Nova Spine And Pain Care are providing exceptional care and support throughout our journey.

We are profoundly grateful for their unwavering dedication and expertise. Dr. Ramasubbu's compassionate care and the team's collaborative efforts are truly unmatched. We can't fathom what we would have done without their unwavering commitment to our well-being.

Thank you, Dr. Chitra Ramasubbu and the entire team at Nova Spine And Pain Care, for everything!

Mitch|I was given my 1st epidural for leg and feet pain. Neurapathy. I usually have a high threshold of pain but the neuropathy was getting to the level of the large kidney stones I had. I am waiting to see how it takes but last night it was much later before the pain came than ususal.
I have not had a single negative action from any of the  team. And they were very willing to answer any questions I asked!!!!!|After 10+ years of excruciating pain (and unsuccessful treatments) I fortunately discovered this amazing specialist and have remained her dedicated patient ever since.  If not for her compassionate care I would likely be wheelchair bound and Rx drug dependent. Dr. Ramasubbu is especially personable, attentive, and encouraging. Her well-credentialed, professional staff is sympathetic and cognizant of how pain steals our lives. Nova Spine & Pain is surely the quintessential practice in all of Northeast Georgia.  I thank them for giving me hope!|Dr. Rama and her entire team are excellent in knowledge and friendly patient care  My initial visit was very informative. Dr.Rama had reviewed my medical status and explained the game plan for future treatment. When I returned for a procedure, the team was once again professional and friendly. I look forward to future pain management treatment with this team !

column40: I really like Dr. Adrian Birladeanu and the nurses. They listen and try to help. There is one young woman at the front desk (I'm sorry I don't know her name) who is extremely rude and dismissive. I also get no less than five reminders for each appointment.  For my last appointment on December 30, I got six reminders, three on Christmas Day, one during our Christmas dinner blessing. I've tried to explain that while I appreciate a reminder, I only need one. Nothing changes. It is clear they couldn't care less what the patients have to say. So, if you can endure the administrative team, the doctor and nurses are great.|The front office staff are great. The doctors are wonderful. My only complaint is  the wait time.  You have to wait at least an hour before you are seen.|I had been suffering with severe back pain and could not have surgery nor any more epidurals due to being on blood thinners.  After discussing my condition snd my alternatives, Dr. B prescribed medication.  I have since been able to do my PT exercises and walk better without my walker.|I had the experience of the very best Ayanna in the medical records department. To me there is mediocre service and then there is excellent service!!!!!! They hit the excellent 5 star experience! I actually was able to speak with Ayanna's supervisor Marcia. She too was excellent I could see how her staff do such a great job with a great leader in Marcia as well. To add to my thoughts this entire practice has been a God send to me. Emily my nurse Practitioner is amazing. She takes the time to listen and she has been there every step of the way with all of my medical needs. If you are looking for pain management help this practice is the BEST! Karen E|Met with Dr. Birladeanu in the Braselton office and he was very kind, patient and illustrative about the procedure for my wife. Very nice folks.|After mri results they never read the reports just put me through one procedure after another spinal cortisone injections which did not work spinal nerves blocks which did not work then spinal nerve ablations which did not work. When I finally asked why they were not treating the injury and could I see the reports they told me they never got the mris so they were working blindly. They had me on pain meds which were low dosage hydrocodone I had gotten Covid my pcp put me on pacslovid and pharmacists told me to cut pain meds in half I went back to Summit and the did my monthly pee test. My meds were cut in half obviously. Which it also says take as needed (The pain medication that is) And they fired me because they said I was not doing what they said I was supposed to do. They cut me off all care and they were the ones to make a mistake!|Warning: If they ask if you'd like to pay the full upfront cost for an injection due to not receiving insurance pre-approval in time, DO NOT DO IT.  I did that in February and, 14 months later, I'm still trying to get them to refund me the amount that was covered by insurance (after they waited 5 months to submit the claim to insurance).  The billing department never answers the phone and when you're forced to leave a message they never return your call and the front-desk folks can't help.|Please, Please, Please don't go to this place!  I'm so mad at myself as I KNEW better!  Having had back surgery in 2017, I was an insured patient and went through a couple of years following that surgery.  At that time all they ever pushed was POINTLESS injections as this is where they make so much money ($4,000.00 + billed to the insurance) PER INJECTION!  Injections that not once lasted longer then time it took me to get to the door.  Now, not insured, they charged me $500.00 just for the office visit and then refused to help me with the pain I was having with narcotics but once again insisting on costly MRI's and pushing once again their very costly junk injections.  STAY AWAY!  Their greed is SO VERY OBVIOUS....Dr.'s have lost their way, morals and have zero character these days as it's all about parting you with your hard earned money at whatever cost.  I WILL NEVER BE BACK so enjoy my wasted $500

column40:
Dr. Wilkinson is incredibly thorough during his examinations, taking the time to ask detailed questions and listen attentively to understand the root cause of the problem. His genuine care for his patients is evident in his methodical approach, ensuring no detail is overlooked. He combines his medical expertise with a compassionate demeanor, making patients feel both understood and well cared for.|This was my first time seeing Dr, Wilkerson. He is kind, caring, and compassionate. He took over an hour with me obtaining my history, reviewing my medical records, and completing a thorough exam. He identified abnormalities in my spine on an MRI I'd had in 2023 that no doctor ever told me about and quickly put a plan in place to address the problem to decrease my pain. When I told him I couldn't afford my pain medication, he took the time to research the cost from various sources and tried to find an alternative. The staff are friendly and the atmosphere is warm and pleasant. If you're looking for a good pain management office, look no further. I highly recommend it. Thanks Dr. Wilkerson and staff!

Regards,
Sharri J.|Dr l. Wilkinson is an excellent listener. As a patient with chronic pain one of the attributes I value my medical provider is listening. Dr. Wilkinson takes his time to take hear what I am sharing that is going on with my body. I don't feel rushed. He makes me feel like I am his only patient. He then thoroughly answer my questions and propose the best possible plan of care for my pain.

He is an amazing doctor.  He is extremely professional, knowledgeable,  easy to talk to and genuinely cares. Although I have only been going to him a short time, it doesn't feel like it because he actually knows my history and medical condition. He doesn'tcome in the room asking what I am there for today or what is going on with me. He comes into the room knowing what he is treating me for. Dr.Wilkinson is the type of doctor I need taking care of me.|Best doctor I have ever experienced and I am 71 years old! At pre-op appointment he sat down with me and went over my MRI report, explaining everything and making me feel I had all the information I needed prior to my surgery. He sat down and talked with me at eye level and made me feel at ease. He made sure I had all my questions answered.|I  felt comfortable talking about my health problems to him. He was understanding, helpful, knowledgeable, and very nice. He gave me instructions and  directions on my next  steps for caring for the problem: prescription for medication, X-ray referral, therapy referral  and follow-up.|Dr. Wilkinson was very professional and knowledgeable about my condition.  He also spent an appropriate amount of time with me showing concern for my health and addressing my health problems.|Everyone in the office from the door to upstairs we're super nice and kind. I was nervous but you all made me feel at ease. Thank you Dr Wilkinson for taking the time to make me feel at ease and to make me feel like you really knew what was going on. See you soon|Dr. Wilkinson is an excellent doctor. He takes the time to explain issues and his staff is also very friendly and professional. I highly recommend his pratice.

column40:
I have seen Dr. Arun Joseph, MD on multiple occasions.  Besides being an outstanding pain management doctor, he possesses great listening skills (sometimes rare in doctors these days).  He genuinely cares for me as a patient and wants the best possible clinical outcomes without pushing surgery as a first option.  I highly recommend him to my family and friends.   David W.|I have been on the schedule here for a cortisone epidural for over a month.  The morning of the procedure I received a call that they were taking me off the schedule due to insurance denying the claim.  However, they admit to receiving the information from Insurance 4 days prior and made no efforts to contact me or correct this.  I called my insurance company and they said the claim was denied because the doctor did not file it correctly and had neglected to inform them I had been receiving chiropractic therapy for over 6 months since my car wreck.  After some time on the phone I was very angry and and clearly in pain when they simply refused to do the procedure.  So much for patient care and doing the right thing.  I was asked to get back in line and wait while they worked out fixing the mistake they made in the first place.  So now I am looking for another place to get this procedure.  There are several issues here.
1. When they called to schedule this we discussed the therapies I had received and they failed to relay this to the insurance company.

2. They received the letter of denial from the insurance company 4 days prior and waited until the morning of to call me and remove me from the schedule when this could have been resolved on Monday morning

3.  They have clearly shown that ALL they care about is money and not doing the right thing.

4.  They allowed me to go without food or water from 11pm the night before, pull my 17 year old daughter out of school for a ride back and forth (I was to be sedated), and alter my business calendar to suit this procedure.  When they had every opportunity to correct this the day before.

5.  Apparently when you are in pain and they have done nothing to fix or help you are expected to be calm cool and collected because God forbid they feel offended by your pain.  Don't worry though they will apologize for the inconvenience

Sincerely,

Seeking other doctors that actually care about the patients and take responsibility for their mistakes|Just switched to Dr. Arun Joseph. He is intelligent, articulate, and empathetic to his patients needs and concerns. I was a Firefighter Paramedic for 28 years. I test every doctors knowledge, "bed side manor", and ability to explain things to a normal person. He as-of-yet has passed the mark surprisingly well. I set the bar with "would I trust this individual with my special needs sons care"? I can give an enthusiastic endorsement of Dr. Joseph and his office aids. A few of the paperwork staff are difficult to take at moments. Dr. Joseph and his aids offset the scales into the realm of a pleasurable experience. I highly recommend him and his staff. Job well done!|Charmaine gets rite to it. She doesn't allow her patients to have to wait. That's  great. She's efficient addressing issues and all concerns. She does a great job takeing care of us.|All of my medication was not placed to be refilled and it was time for them to be refilled.  I was not happy about that.  But other than that I love her and would not like to see anyone else.  She is a loving caring awesome individual.|Dr. Gale and his PA Charmaine are outstanding medical professionals! Both are thorough, compassionate, and dedicated to helping patients find pain relief. In addition, Dr.Gale has  a wonderful sense of humor which makes office visits pleasant! I highly recommend this practice for help with chronic pain issues!|Dr. Joseph helped me more in 15-30 minutes than three other doctors had during a half dozen sessions. I was hopeful, and she was everything I hoped for and more. She motivates me to work on improving. She is caring, and she is an excellent diagnostician! I am grateful that she is capable and willing to help me.|I've been going to Alliance painting mine now for about six months. I am really satisfied with everybody there the staff the doctors they are really concerned about their patients they take time and they listen to you and they try to provide you with the best care that they can give you. I recommend this place to anyone who's having problems with pain back problems and so on, they really take good care of me. Thank you.
Pamela Fisher

column40:
Aside from a little difficulty finding the office, every aspect of my visit was superb. The front desk person assisted with my work up. After being worked up by friendly staff I met Dr Epps . He explained the findings of my MRI, performed the epidural today. The surgical staff were gentle and encouraging and talked me thru the procedures.. . More friendly Staff explained thoroughly  followup home care and then I was on my way home. Dr. Epps is great .|Really liked this doctor. He took the time to read my husband's complicated medical notes, explained his condition to us in an easily understandable way, and came up with a good plan of care.|The entire staff at Alliance Spine is wonderful. I've had two surgeries and I'm facing a third on my cervical spine. They've been attentive and caring regarding my extreme pain. (I have 4 herniated discs in my cervical spine that are pressing/pinching my spinal cord)
They listen, adjust as necessary, and never make you feel awkward or ashamed of needing pain management. Dr Epps has performed injection & epidural procedures for me, and I've been very satisfied with the results. He is kind and compassionate. I highly recommend both the Covington & Conyers locations!|Dr Epps spent time talking to me to see what my n concerns and pain level was. Just got home and am pain free so far.|I have been a patient of Alliance Pain and Spine Clinic for more than 10 years. I have sciatica and stenosis with extreme joint pain as a result of injuries from heavy weight lifting in my youth.

Yesterday was the first time I met and interacted with Dr. Epps. He was very personable as well as professional. I was impressed that he obviously knew my past diagnosis' although this was our first meeting. In other words he took the time to research my history before meeting.

He made suggestions about my pain medications and counseled with me. I found him thorough and likeable, he left me with a feeling of confidence that I was in good hands with a physician that cared. JIM ZIEGLER|Dr. Epps, all the nurses, and office staff are great! He has helped me tremendously with all the different procedures. I highly recommend Alliance Spine & pain management. I go to their Sugarloaf office.|Dr William Epps is very good doctor and he is expert in his work. I was in pain since 2019 and was not able to tolerate pain. I was not able to sit, stand and sleep probably without pain. I am quite better now. This is my sec procedure in which he burned my nerve and now, I am 70 to 80% recovered from my nerve pain which I think that it will work for 1 to 1 1/2 year based on my last procedure. His office staff is also very good. Dr Epps and his staff also take care of insurance and authorization approval. No need to worry about coverage and approval as well.|Dr Epps is the best. He has tackled my back issues and we're winning!  I'm almost pain free!

column40:
I wanted to write this review to give a rating overall on this practice. Myself working in the medical field for 14 years as a clinical lead and RMA I had a tragic car accident in March of 2024 and after being in wonderful health for most of my life overnight it changed. After months of being in the hospital and multiple surgeries I had to learn a new lifestyle of now being a patient. I was referred to Dr Chi and his staff. I was so nervous my first visit but there was a front office staff member named Madison Thornton that seeing her smile and kindness made my anxiety and nervousness simmer down then meeting Dr Chi and his nurse I soon realized that this place was special and they listened to all my concerns. FNP Mary Bracken is absolutely amazing and I truly adore and appreciate her. It has almost been a year since I have been a patient here and I refer them to everyone even from my old practice I worked at I have let the physicians and my FNP know to send patients here. Today I had an appointment and @ 10 am and I accidentally left my cc at home and since I am now a cash pay patient my husband asked if he could run home which is 6 minutes away and the check in lady (not going to publicly name) was like no you have to reschedule your appointment when For 1 I am already here sitting in my chair waiting and my husband was going to go grab it she was adamant about telling us no ,but Madison Thornton there amazing front office staff member went above and beyond by helping us and I got to see my provider as well I was not taking back until 10:45 and my husband definitely had time to go get our payment method with time to spare but with being told no by the other front staff member multiple times we found a different payment method well we're forced to do so or not see my provider.Kindness doesn't cost anything and she is what makes this office worth coming to. As well as Lyric Ellis the MA in the back absolutely AMAZING. The heart of any practice starts from the front and goes to the the back. Those two women deserve a big raise and a special day off!!! And the only other suggestion I would have is for the other staff is to just have empathy for those of us that have had a life changing experience and we come here for help and to show a little more compassion. Other than that 5 stars for the providers and the staff that does show the patients genuine care.|The doctors are top notch!! Life changing and never condescending. The staff is lovely. The only issue I have is seeing different doctors a lot, and the practice is so large, it's hard to get prior authorizations and other forms you will need if you go to these sorts of docs. However, they absolutely work hard for you, you just have to stay on them a lot and stay on the phone more than should be. However, the doctors are absolutely worth your time.|I was told by a Dr nothing could be done so he sent me to Summit. They showed me something they could do and I am waiting on insurance to approve it. They get right to work on you because they know you are hurting. Everyone is super nice. Give it a try. You will be glad you did. To live with pain daily is no fun.|Dr. Chai is a wonderful positive person. He listens to your problem than he goes after what the actual problem may be. He did that with me . My rt lower lumbar always hurts and causes problems with my rt leg..I have a problem with my Sacroiliac as well as my fusion and Dr. Chai replaced my old stimulator with his unit. Just a few weeks ago. Did great job. This one is different from my last one. Going through testing and maybe a retune at my next follow up.So, far it is doing the job.Considering my circumstances. If you have pain. Talk to Dr. Chai. He knows what he is doing as well as his staff. Great people. Recommend Summit Spine out of Carrollton, GA
Veterans talk to your VA doctor to out source Community Care Services. Close to your homes. I'm a Veteran.|Overall, I felt like I received very great care from Summit. Staff were always pleasant. Providers seemed caring. I felt like my pain was being adequately managed. I don't want to badmouth them, but I have some deep concerns about how my end care was managed. It is very hard to be a person who needs pain management. It feels like it's not ok for patients to ask questions because we're treated like criminals.

Is there a safe process for patients (or former patients) to reach out regarding concerns? I don't know how else to get questions answered and was hoping somebody from management might see this post.|I have been going to see Dr Chai for over a year now and he has listened and helped me with my chronic pain. Not only is he a great doctor but he truly cares about his patients. Lastly, he has the absolute best bedside manner and makes you feel comfortable.|I really feel summit is the right place to treat my pain and keep it under control .I've been under pain management since 2008 .I went to another pain clinic from 2008 till 2024 nearly 16 years,I even continued going to them after I moved here in 2020 two and half hours away.till 2024 of september.i had good Drs but the staff was so bad the last few years .I have to say I'm happy with summit I made a good choice it's hard changing Drs after that many years.i love my Drs I had.but Dr chai, just the six months I been going he's such a pleasant person to talk to he friendly and makes you feel like he really does care ,puts you at ease to talk to.explains everything he's going to do and why.and while he was doing my shots he's having  conversation with me. He's just very nice and professional  but  caring. I have never had a doctor that just made you feel like all his patients are really important to him.he told me if I need help when I go back to work,if i need a letter saying I can't stand for just a certain amount of time.  this is so different from a lot of Drs, I've never had the last Drs I seen all those years I went,ever offer to help me out in such a caring and compassion way, as Dr chai, as he show me he cares if I'm ok while I'm working if I need too again.i really like the staff,that matters a lot to me. due to the last 16 years of the front desk of my last drs office their staff had no compassion. every six months they would be some new staff up front and they didn't know how to treat people who was in pain.they didn't need to be in that kind of career at all  and I told them a few times just how I felt about the treatment and they needed to find a different kind of career because they have chosen the wrong one.i felt like they was only there to receive their paycheck.id be in tears and angry sometimes by the time I saw the Dr. Cant say that  about the Drs. there great and very good Doctors which is why I went to them for so many years and put up with the staff.but I'm happy to be going  now to summit spine and pain Doctor now in Carrollton, probably will continue as long as the doors are open.I have no complaints of staff are the Drs here.they have been great so far. I never waited more than 20 minutes in the lobby and once I'm in the back I am seeing the Doctor within 15 mins.these doctors here impressed me how they are willing to adjust your medication as needed. and also with any other treatments. they are kind enough to answer any questions you may have for them.i feel I'm in good hands now.|I am currently being treated for spinal issues and chronic pain.
Dr Gerald Chai is  always very caring and kind.
He is a wonderful doctor with high energy, enthusiasm, and humility.
I will continue to refer him to everyone I know, and Summit is blessed to have his expertise and high level of professional etiquette on board.
There are not enough stars  to give him.

column3:
At NEXus Pain Center of Columbus, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from a wide range of chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of dedicated pain management physicians and anesthesiologists work diligently to provide personalized treatment plans that address the root cause of your discomfort.

Conditions We Treat

We offer expert care for numerous pain conditions, including:

  • Chronic pain syndrome and fibromyalgia

  • Spinal issues (herniated discs, stenosis, low back pain, neck pain)

  • Joint pain and various forms of arthritis

  • Neuropathic conditions (diabetic neuropathy, post-herpetic neuralgia)

  • Headaches, migraines, and facial pain (including trigeminal neuralgia)

Our Advanced Treatment Options

We provide a comprehensive range of interventional procedures and treatments, including epidural injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. Our facility is equipped to perform specialized procedures such as kyphoplasty for vertebral compression fractures, Botox injections for chronic migraines, and various joint injections to target specific pain sources. Visit our website to learn more about our full range of services or call us at +1 877-963-9876 to schedule your consultation at our Columbus location on Old Moon Road.

column40:
I was referred here after my previous pain doc stopped accepting my insurance in the middle of the year when I couldn't change my provider.  They contacted me almost immediately and got me into the office in less than two weeks (I actually think it was a week but I'm not positive). The new patient appt person was lovely on the phone.

I was shocked at my first appointment though.  The office reception area was PACKED and a huge line to check in.  I waited an hour to see Dr Strother but she was great.  The med assistant that took me back was extremely friendly

My thoughts are that the Columbus office isn't as nice as Lagrange. I'm going to do all my appointments there. I've had a couple procedures and Dr Strother never seems to rush or ignore me.  She listens and we work on the most painful issues.  I highly recommend her

I would say though the Columbus office needs help with time management and to thoroughly clean that office especially the front office. It just smells dirty and looks messy

Overall I'm pretty happy going to Lagrange|I havnt been a patient here in two years. But when I was, I set aside the whole afternoon because I would be in the waiting area for 2-3 hours. The reason I'm back however, is that two years ago they tried to bill me repeatedly for an operation that the Dr confirmed with me multiple times was covered by tricare. After I was billed he confirmed again and said you have nothing to worry about. Here I am two years later receiving yet again ... another bill for something I am not suppose to pay for. Two years. At this point it's going to collections. I do not care. I feel sorry for anyone who's forced to go here through tricare.

Also have been trying to get ahold of anyone the past few few days. No response from leaving a voicemail or the patient portal I was told to use.|I have been a patient since 2016 at Nexus Pain Care Center Columbus GA. It has really deteriorated over the past year and a half. This correspondences with the expansion of the company to 3 other locations. Just an example, today my appointment was at 11:30 AM. It's currently 1:15 PM and I am still in the waiting room. The staff can't even tell me how much longer I have to wait to be seen. This is totally unexcepable.|I met with Dr. Casiano today. Not only is he caring, but also takes the time to listen and get to the root of the problem. I very much recommend him! Thanks for fast, great service!|They used to treat me and all of my friends with super great efficiency and proficiency. Jennifer was like the first sergeant at the front desk running everything smoothly if you had a problem you could contact her and she'd get it fixed immediately. I don't know if she's on vacation but she hasn't been here in a couple weeks and the place has totally fallen apart. They need to keep her here all the time because she knows all of the Patients and they all love her. If she's not back soon myself and all of my friends are going to start looking for another pain center because she's the glue that holds this place together.|Saying I haven't taking a drug test sense April but have charged me for them. Denying my medication cause they too lazy to print a hard copy have been waiting in the lobby an hr after my appointment and to threaten to show out to get them to do anything. I'm going to ask for a transfer to try e other office I'd rather drive n he out of my way then deal with the two faced back stabbing liers at this office. Am leaving the office today and headed straight to a lawyer.|There is something strange going on with m medication. The story is too confusing to try to explain, but the fact remains that I am beginning to distrust this place insofar as accurate record keeping concerning medication.|I had a referral for this location and never received an appointment. I called and couldn't reach anyone. I was looking forward to going here because my boss praised this place.

Comprehensive Pain Relief Solutions in Stockbridge, GA

At Pain Management Specialists of Atlanta, we provide specialized care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our team of board-certified anesthesiologists offers personalized treatment plans designed to improve quality of life and restore function. Located at 165 N Park Trail in Stockbridge, we serve patients throughout the Atlanta metro area with advanced interventional procedures and comprehensive pain management strategies.

Our services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management

  • Nerve blocks and injections

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Radiofrequency ablation

We understand that living with chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take a multidisciplinary approach to treatment. Our facility is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to ensure accurate diagnosis and effective treatment. For more information or to schedule an appointment, visit our official website or call us at +1 770-506-1800.

column40:
My mother is a patient. And I had high hopes for her and he upcoming appointments. She was told she would feel better and gain a quality of life she once had. Instead she's had nothing but trouble. Unprofessional staff. Not just to my mother but also to other patients in the waiting room and checking in... It's their way or the highway. I've seen all the responses to the reviews "thank you for your response" but hopefully the one star will help bring the rating down for future patients can be aware.|I'm very thankful that I'm a patient here. I feel better and I know I need more help with this nerve pain but Dr. B. is an excellent Dr.so glad my Dr. referred me.I thought I would never get relief but I have. Thank you Dr.B you are awesome.|I'm VERY grateful for him and his staff
I've been going to them for over 2 years. They are some of the nicest people.  They are always there when I call and need them. They stay in the solution and I appreciate that... again wonderful staff.|Worse office staff EVER!!! They don't answer or return your calls, suck at procedure scheduling, always billing incorrectly, and the list goes on. RUN FAR AWAY from this office!!! I'm a new patient here and don't plan to return.|I had no problems for almost two years. I didn't as for special favors. I went in and saw the nurse practitioner and got my prescription. She kept asking bout the neck injections and I kept refusing and for some reason that day she was in a mood! Very Vindictive nurse practitioner! I refused to get steroid injections in my neck and she started typing! Before I left that day, my pain management had been discontinued without warning after two years  and I had been locked out and informed by the nurse! The nurse practitioner didn't even have the guts to tell me in person! She locked me out like a dog and sent someone else to do her dirty work! Steroid injections don't work for everyone, including me! And I most certainly don't want anybody messing around my neck! I've informed her of this at every appointment! Maybe I should have informed her of how they didn't wear gloves when I had my shoulder injectioned, not even when they took blood! They fumbled around the spot as if they didn't know what they were doing during the injection and I just can't have that level of incompetence when dealing with my NECK! As a medical professional, I was taught to do no harm! What were they taught? My way or the highway! O yea, hardly any of the staff wears a mask! Also I wasn't given any guidance after being on pain management for two years! I think that's a dangerous practice to drop a patient with no warning!|I highly recommend Dr. B.  He and his office staff have been helpful and nice  over and above what is expected.  He successfully relieved my 76 year old Mom's back and hip pain that no other Dr. could do. He and his staff made sure we understood what they were doing and allowed us all the time we needed to ask questions.  We cannot say enough about how wonderful we were treated from the time we arrived to the time we left and the days after.  They have been intouch to ask how she is doing and if we needed anything.  We visited several other Dr.'s for this same pain and no one could help her.  Thank you Dr. B. and all of your staff.|I had an outpatient procedure done on September 2, 2021. I was scheduled for a follow up for next week. I was given in writing that date and time of the appointment. I arrive 15 minutes early for the appointment on the scheduled day. I was placed into a exam room and left for an hour. Since I had a prior engagement scheduled,  I ended up leaving because I could no longer wait. My appointment was very changed in the system from two until the hour I waited already. So I rescheduled the appointment for a couple days later. I arrived at the appointment only to find that the usual front office clerk was not sitting at her desk and was helped by another member who is not the nicest person I've ever spoken to. I was charged a co-pay for a follow up appointment.   I sat in the waiting room and after 30 minute wait I was told that my appointment has been canceled and a message had been left the previous day on my answering machine. I looked at my voicemail and I never received a cancellation phone call. I was told that I do not need a follow up appointment although I did have a very tedious procedure and have not spoken to the doctor since.  It's this kind of retaliation from the staff members that could cost a person their health.|I recommended  Dr White to my sister when she moved down here. If he took the time to talk to her he might have know what was going on with her. But she had different intake Assistants and apparently when ordering procedures they don't know the correct wording. They were rude and dismissive. They pretty much left my 75 year old sister in pain. Thought they say they are trying I just didn't see it. She has been in pain for 2 mnths now and barely able to get out of bed. They took their sweet time getting her first surgery scheduled and thats where the damage was done. finally did the second after we had reminded them(they said they had no idea lie) it.didn't take. Their wording to the insurance for a procedure she didn't need was wrong and denied.
The Dr. himself she liked very much
that being said, this either shows their ineptness to do their job or the plain nasty, rudeness of the people that work there.

column3:
Specialized Pain Management in Columbus, GA

At Columbus Pain Center, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Columbus area. Located at 7141 Moon Rd A, Columbus, GA 31909, our practice is led by Dr. Serrato, a straightforward and knowledgeable physician who specializes in developing personalized treatment plans for chronic pain conditions. We take pride in our efficient appointment scheduling system that respects our patients' time and our caring staff who go above and beyond to ensure patient comfort. Our services include:

  • Customized pain management treatment plans

  • Nerve blocks for neck and back pain

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management when appropriate

  • Comprehensive evaluations for chronic pain conditions

We understand how debilitating chronic pain can be, which is why we're committed to providing effective solutions in a professional and compassionate environment. For appointments or more information about our services, call us at +1 706-322-7246 or visit our website at https://columbuspaincenter.com/.
