column38: Elaine Perkins|grady horner|Shannon Walden|Vickie Holmes|Michael Dosier|Liz H|Debra Kirkley|Tawanna Jamison
column40:
Had my first appointment last week. I found all staff members to be pleasant and helpful. Dr. Seratto is a straightforward to the point kind of man. I liked that, not mincing words or wasting time with likely scenarios. Very knowledgeable doctor. He answered all my questions and explained everything in layman's terms. His diagnosis and treatment plan have given me the much needed pain relief I have desperately needed, as well as the most restful and pain free nights in months. So grateful I was referred to him.|Went there till I got out of the service in 2013. Just got a referral to go back for a bulging disk and nerve blocks for neck . All they wanted to know is why I quit going in 2013 . Like it hurt their feelings.  Did not ask for pain meds was told several times they wasn't give me any . Did not want them . All Dr sotto did was ask why I left in 2013 , and what do I want him to do . Long story short he finally decided to order a procedure on my back never heard back from them . Hopefully I can find another Dr . Want be back to him . Obviously he has to much buisness handing out prescription.|I have no problem with Dr Serrato. Yeah he could work on his bedside manner, but I just spoke over him for the first minute of the visit until he was finished reading my chart, he listened to me and offered more than one solution. He is very straight forward, I like that. The only people that have issues with him are usually patients that don't follow the strict guidelines of pain management..|My 87 year old mom went there and after a 40 minute wait seen the doctor and was told he would call her prescription into her pharmacy, he did not. I have called 3times this past week and was told someone would call me back, they didn't. MO day it will be a week she has been in tears cause we can't get her meds
And this isn't the 1st time this has happened|You have to deal with totally random incompetent people! It take 1-2 hours after your appointment for the prescription nurse to send it to your pharmacy! They really need to look at they treat the older patients!!!!|Great location and very caring head nurse. Head nurse goes beyond the call of duty. Awesome customer service. Mask not required but suggested. No three or four hour wait to see the Dr. Appointment are required and patients are seen accordingly.|I have never had any issues with the staff, in fact I find them pleasant. Sure the Dr maybe straight forward, but who doesn't want a doctor to be honest and straight forward with you as a patient, if I have questions, he answers them fully and I'm completely satisfied with that.|Do not waste your time with this "1 man show". Dr. Serrato is very rude as well as majority of his staff, especially the white women at the front desk. When you're in pain and suffer from severe anxiety and depression, he will DEFINITELY Escalate your trauma. Extremely poor bedside manners, he doesn't show that he care about you as a person to help you get better. This is only a means to pay his expenses. You will be just another number, especially if you start asking questions about your treatment plan. He goes in between patients within 5 to 10 minutes. I had one epidural cervical I needed a valium prior to treatment,  his staff gave me the med 15 minutes prior to the procedure. I was severely nervous and starting crying because the pain of the needle was tremendous! Dr. Serrato started belittling me and said he'd never in 20 years had a patient cry before. Following procedure, no one called or scheduled a follow up. I couldn't walk for up to 10hrs afterwards due to excruciating pain in arms and legs. It took about four days to get back to pain level 5 consistently.  So I dont see the benefits of getting a cervical epidural.

column38: Katie Bruder|Holly Waller|Sewell Family|Catherine Adams|Keith Y|Heather Dawn (Zarina Blue)|Connie Tschudy|Linda Richards
column40:
Does anyone know why the pain clinic closed? I called to reschedule my appointment with Dr. Singleton three days before my appointment and, they told me i couldn't because the office was closing. I had to scramble to find a new pain doctor.
Not only did they not contact me to let me know this was happening but they also, didn't help me find a new doctor. I could sue for malpractice and negligence. You can't just stop the medicines he prescribed cold turkey, without titrating down because of the high dosages. It can cause death if not handled properly.

I am very angry at how Doctor Smith and Doctor Singleton have handled my case and driven this once great pain clinic into the ground. Doctor Sheehan and Doctor Rollins were the greatest doctors and it's so sad how the owners of the practice made them leave and left us with the other horrible doctors.|UPDATE....
The person who responded to my review said to please call or email them for further details. I emailed them and they have NEVER responded to me. Just an FYI.

I had been seeing Dr. Rollins for the past 8 years or so and he was amazing. I started seeing Dr. Smith about a year ago and it has been hell. Without even talking to me and seeing how my current meds and treatments were working she immediately started force tapering me. I am a very compliant patient. Never missed an appointment and never failed a drug test. About a month or so ago I was at my ropes end with my pain so at my last appointment I asked her if she was going to take all of my oral meds and she said YES. That would leave me with only my pain pump. It barely touched my pain. She also told me at my first 3 appointments that she just needed to bring my meds down a bit to show compliance with the DEA she said if it was too much she'd put me back on my regular dose. Needless to say she did not. She's a liar! She is hands down the worst doctor I've ever seen. A pain management doctor who doesn't actually treat pain. Stay away from this doctor.|Dr. Stephanie Smith is absolutely AWESOME!  Former doctor was pleasant, but was not managing pain well - which is not good for a "specialist".  Dr. Smith introduced options that I had no idea were possible - even experiencing immediate pain relief.  Her care and attention to detail are phenomenal.  Oh and the new option to send narcotic prescriptions directly to the pharmacy?  What!!!!  This was possible?  Nice to see the office get some hi-tech upgrades.  Never understood why the old office was fiddling with paper. 1 star missing from this review because the office staff are unable to keep up with the load - get them some help if possible.|My husband had been seeing Dr. Rollins for many years, than started care with Dr. Smith. I wasn't sure at first but honestly she has given the very best care in all 10 years of our Worker's Comp injury nightmare. She is the 1st & only Dr to take his many issues head on, seek to get answers and best laid plan of action. I truly thank her from the bottom of my !!! The staff have always been pleasant, not always easy to get communication through...but it does get addressed. They have a large amount of patients, hence sometimes a delay in communication.  THANK YOU, DR. STEPHANIE SMITH for trying to give my husband back some of his life. I'm forever grateful!!!|I went a couple of weeks ago, and it was a long wait. That's because 1 provider was seeing pts that 3 providers used to see. I rescheduled, because I had some other things to take care of that day. I went back yesterday, saw the Dr, and was very impressed with her care and concern for me. She spent the needed time with me, to refill my pump, and discuss my medications and make sure they were working for me. I was really impressed with Dr Smith. I think she spent the necessary time needed with me, and probably every pt. Thank you!|I have been a patient with SIPA since '16 when a doctor there consulted on one of my legal proceedings.
Much like everyone else I was shocked when the previous doctors and NP were gone overnight and replaced with Dr Smith.

Whom I have never seen. She repeatedly canceled and pushed back my appointment and each time I asked if she would still be able to submit my meds. I was anxious to be seen and figure out why the drastic cuts to medication to a patient she had never laid eyes on and who told me she couldn't find extensive records on me.

This past month they went on vacation for a week, refused to fill my prescription till they see me and pushed my appointment out another 6 days. After trying to contact them over a dozen times (documented), two trips to the ER, (I have new cervical damage due to suddenly coming off my medication.) I was told they would prescribe me something to help with discontinuation syndrome. Which they haven't yet.

I take care of a terminal cancer patient, my ex-husband, and our my daughter who has the same genetic condition that led to his cancer. Needless to say we have spent a lot of time in the medical system and this is far and away the most jaw dropping treatment I have ever seen. I mean who pushes out appointments for life or death treatment and then uses not seeing a patient as an excuse for discontinuing treatment?

Edit - 09/22/22 - I have now been diagnosed with cervical radiculopathy. Between the sneezing and vomiting I have had two discs herniated. Meanwhile a prescription for a drug that is no longer available and would be dangerous for me to take was called into a pharmacy. One that has nothing to do with what I am experiencing. The pharmacist thought it must of been a mistake. So far I haven't been contacted.|Dr Smith is very nice and the office staff is as well. I've been going to this office for 12 years and I have always had a great service and care. I have recently noticed there is a longer wait time but that's due to Dr Smith being the only doctor at this time. I do have confidence that things will work out soon and she'll have some help. If your considering this office I give it a go. They really are good and will work a plan to help you in feeling better.|I was a former patient here, seen by Dr. Rollins.  When the 3 health care providers were FORCED OUT ,I had no choice but to see Dr. Smith.  It was the most unprofessional visit of my life.  She scheduled me during her LUNCH!  Then she criticized prior Doctor's to me.  I was given Dr. Sheahans phone number by one of the patients in the waiting room.  Thank you God, I was able to get back with him ....a REAL doctor!

column2: Newton and Associates Spine and Pain
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions in Marietta

At Newton and Associates Spine & Pain North Atlanta, we are dedicated to helping patients overcome pain from various sources, whether it stems from auto accidents, workplace injuries, or natural bodily changes. Under the leadership of Dr. Jonathan Newton, MD, PhD, our board-certified pain management physician, we provide physician-directed treatment for all types of discomfort. Our expertise extends to:

  • Neck and back pain management

  • Arm and leg pain treatment

  • Abdominal and pelvic pain relief

  • Targeted injection therapies

  • Customized medication plans

We utilize scientifically proven treatment methods, including precision-guided injections combined with a variety of supporting medications to create personalized pain management plans. Our goal is simple yet profound: to return you to an active, engaging life free from debilitating pain. Located in Marietta, we invite you to discover how our compassionate approach can transform your pain management journey at North Atlanta Spine & Pain Care or call us at +1 770-771-6300 to schedule your consultation.
column11: North Atlanta Spine & Pain Care is dedicated to helping patients treat the pain whether it is from an auto accident, work or the result of your body changing. The goal is to return you back to engaging active life. Jonathan Newton, MD, PhD, a board-certified pain management physician, provides physician-directed pain treatment for all types of pain, especially neck and back pain, but also arm pain, leg pain, abdominal pain and pelvic pain. Dr. Newton uses scientifically proven treatment methods including proven targeted injections with the use of a wide variety of supporting medications to create your successful pain management plan.
column38: Linda Biniasz|keith dejesus|Bloncelia Wynn|Matthew Obie|Courtney Loquasto|Nidhi Sinha|debbie presley|Starr Kitchen
column40:
This facility is awesome.  Very low key, pleasant and efficient.
Made an appointment to get a second opinion on my condition.
Dr. Newton eagerly and patiently listened. He suggested several procedures to proceed with.
He listens and seems geniunely concerned for my well being.
I would recommend him.  Linda B.|What an amazing experience with Dr. Newton. I was completely mortified of having a neck injection and even cancelled the first procedure. I finally gained the nerve to move forward 2weeks later and I can honestly say it really was an easy, quick and painless procedure. Dr. Newton's care and compassion was flawless as was the staff. If you're afraid of having this procedure done, trust me lose the fear it's really an easy process and no need for fear.|Dr. Newton and staff was amazing and his bed side manners remarkable. During the procedure I felt no pain just a sting and pressure just the way he explained it to me earlier. I would gladly refer my friends and family members to his office.  Thank you Dr. Newton for an amazing first time experience.|Dr. Newton and his staff were an amazing help in my recovery of my accident. At first I was unsure of getting the injections in my neck and lower back but Dr. Newton was great at informing me on the procedure I was going to recieve. I greatly recommend his office to any and everyone, you won't be let down.|Awesome experience!  Staff was great, they got me right in, barely any wait, and Dr. Newton himself took a long time talking with me, asking me questions, and finally suggested treatment another doctor hadn't tried. He even showed me different exercises I could do to make sure it didn't happen again.  The treatment worked!  For the first time in one whole year I am pain-free!  I'm a very happy camper- will be referring everyone I know to Dr. Newton- starting with my own mom!!|I have been seeing Dr. Newton for over 8 years now, before he started his own practice. He has been extremely effective with his treatments to help me with several issues I have due to my autoimmune conditions. He has given me the ability to function normally in my day to day life and I am extremely grateful to him. Both he and his staff are are very caring and supportive. I highly recommend him to anyone looking for real results!|Dr. Newton and his staff were very pleasant and took very great care of my husband. column48: I am looking for a clinic that will provide me with relief from my pain. Does this provider treat you with pain medicine as well with procedure? Any info will be greatly appreciated.
column49:
Dr Newton is a highly skilled and compassionate professional.  We see him for multiple ailments, and are very satisfied with the outcome.  Dr Newton has recently opened a surgical suite next door for more complicated procedures. He is quite skilled in this arena, as we would expect.

As for medication, if you're only looking for quick access to Schedule II medications, please look elsewhere.  Dr Newton is a consummate professional with a focus on pain relief for back issues, and Sch II requires patient doctor history, trust, diagnosis, etc. For chronic pain that only responds to Sch II, a contract including random urinalysis, pill checks, etc. is required.  If you're a pill head, you know what I'm talking about, so move along.  If not, place your trust in Dr Newton and he will not guide you wrong. (this is a general reply, not directed specifically at the questioner, but answers the question asked)

column3:
Metro Atlanta's Premier Pain Management Specialists

At Pain Care, LLC, we are dedicated to delivering high-quality, comprehensive pain management solutions across our eight locations throughout Georgia. Founded in 2008 by renowned board-certified anesthesiologist Vincent Galan, MD, MBA, DABPM, our practice has spent over a decade helping Metro Atlanta residents find relief from chronic pain. We pride ourselves on utilizing cutting-edge technology and evidence-based non-surgical treatments that require no incisions or medication to effectively address various pain conditions. Our specialized services include:

  • Back and neck pain management

  • Neuropathic pain treatment

  • Joint pain relief

  • Complex regional pain syndrome (CRPS) care

  • Innovative pain management procedures

Located at 2401 Newnan Crossing Blvd Suite 120 & 130 in Newnan, we combine the expertise of pain management physicians, anesthesiologists, and nurse practitioners to deliver cost-effective and ethical care. Visit www.georgiapaincare.com or call us at +1 770-629-9792 to discover how we can help you regain control of your life through effective pain management.

The healing journey has been a joy under her care because I am not alone.|Torrey  is excellent at her job.  She listens intently, and ask the correct key questions.
Follow up appointments with her are very worthwhile.  They are well timed around my treatments.|Ms. Torre Is the first person in more than 30 years of suffering that has listened to me explain where a certain pain is coming from. People have insisted to me that this is my low back or lumbar region.
Ms Torre took the time to let me explain my issue and join me in examining a spinal chart on the wall. Don't forget, these are in almost every room in every pain management doctors office.
No one has ever been willing to take the time and be patient enough to listen to me until now. It is not my lumbar or low back. It is my middle back,  thoracic region. And now a new MRI is ordered and I will be getting treatment for the pain that has been making me ill for many years.
I don't suppose any of the previous practitioners would want to give me back any of my time or money even if they could. They've been treating a low back problem. While I don't have a great low back, this extreme pain has been in my middle back the whole time.
Miss Tori better be prepared, cause I think I love her.
And she works with Dr. Will Epps, And his treatments are amazing.
Everybody's amazing.|I love going to a alliance spine and pain center. I go to the one on Sugarloaf and I wouldn't trade them for the world unless they close down and I had to go someplace else other than that the staff is friendly Dr Epps is wonderful his staff is great they kind of make you feel like family yeah I like going to them, I love going to them.
Thank you guys for all you do. MS. Torre is the best, she is kind, funny and very considerate when it comes to your consultation, she is great. column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management in Stockbridge, Georgia

At The Pain Specialists, we provide advanced pain management solutions from our state-of-the-art facility in Stockbridge, Georgia. Led by Dr. Platon, who brings her prestigious Emory University School of Medicine training to every patient interaction, we specialize in treating both simple and complex pain disorders through a multidisciplinary approach. Our holistic treatment plans often incorporate collaboration with other specialties including orthopedics, neurology, neurosurgery, general surgery, urology, and psychiatry to address the full spectrum of pain conditions. Our primary goal is to accurately diagnose and effectively treat chronic pain to help our patients achieve a higher quality of life and improved daily function.

Our Comprehensive Services Include:

  • Personalized pain management plans

  • Advanced interventional procedures including epidurals

  • Radiofrequency treatments for long-lasting pain relief

  • Multidisciplinary care coordination with other specialists

  • Holistic pain management approaches that minimize medication dependence

Located at 1506 Rock Quarry Rd, Stockbridge, GA 30281, we welcome patients seeking compassionate, effective pain management solutions. Call us today at (470) 207-9244 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward reclaiming your life from chronic pain.

column40:
I was trying to get a referral to be seen here. My general doctors office said they required an npi number to complete the referral. So, I called and asked for it. The lady that answered the phone was so rude to me and said no one needs that number and I don't really feel comfortable giving it to you. She questioned me as if I were a criminal. I told her I was doing what my doctor office asked. She refused and was very mean about it. Needless to say I'm going somewhere else. I don't have the energy for dealing with this.
I called them back and explained to them this is what the doctor said. The office personnel to me to google it! So I can google it but she can't just give me the information I need? This place is a joke and obviously could care less about anyone in pain.|I've had excellent care from Dr. Morrison and his staff over many years. He takes the time to hear my situation and finds a way to help. Dr. Morrison has taken better care of my overall health issues more than some of my other physicians. He is not just a doctor that gives you a script and runs in the room and out quickly. He takes the time you need and listens.  I HIGHLY recommend him and I am blessed to have him as my doctor watching over my overall health and care.|Made my first appointment with office for which I waited a week for scheduled date - severe nerve pain  - can barely walk.  I missed my first appointment  -  by hours - and called when I realized I had conflicting info.  I was told by a less than kind office personnel, that Doctor Morrison would no longer take me as a patient since I missed my appointment.  I explained to the office personal that possibly, just possibly, there was an error in communication which they steadfastly stated that could not happen.  I advised them that I have paperwork that clearly shows some poorly communicated information.  At this point, I knew any doctor that would refuse a patient in pain that had waited a week for that appointment was not doctor I would want to care for me...but I did want him to see the information I had that clearly shows - yes indeed we all make mistakes.  I was told by his office to submit my info thru the patient portal.  I did .  A few hours later I checked the portal to see if there was any sort of acknowledgement and found they had already disabled my account - so who knows if this doctor even saw my email.  I called back and spoke with another office personal who told me that once the doctor decides to not see you he will not read any of my information.   The conversation when downhill from there.  In a nutshell - this doctor should possibly reconsider his field of profession.  So disappointed in his callous handling of a person in pain.  Shame on him and 'his' policy.|I love this office all around. They are well versed in the paperwork needed for insurance. They have always treated me kindly. Dr. Straus has always listened to my needs as they have changed throughout the years. He has never pushed me into taking something I was not comfortable taking. He is kind and only prescribes the amounts needed to keep my pain controlled.
I believe in him, His staff and the circumstances under which they work. .|There was Miscommunication with signing the release form as i was moving from one clinic to this clinic because of travel convenience. The office manager immediately accused me of pill seeking! I explain my situation and then she proceeded to say that I couldn't attend 2 clinics at once! Duh! Maybe if she shut her mouth and listened she would have understood my concerns and may have gotten a new patient! I will drive the 30 minutes for some divinity and respect!!!!!!-|I almost died from this place.  They kept me on tramadol and I'm bedridden in pain . Then I accidently somehow got Medicaid even though I never applied and they dropped me like a fly and I was on benzos.  Ended up in the e.r for weeks . We called to tell them this one staff said she would talk to the e.r doctor about my situation and what I'm on then when we called back when the doctor was in the room she said I never said that . I will not speak to him!!!!! The doctor even believed me that she did that.  He said pain clinics are awful and kill ppl and I almost did die from this place .   I literally almost died.  The staff was so rude to my boyfriend who takes care of me . When we called the last time and asked if I get off Medicaid can i get another appt they said . We might not even take you back if we don't want to. Really mean how they said it to and I have never failed a drug test . did as they said.  was very sweet to them. My medicine we kept in a locked safe counted them every single day so I would never mess up . Oh and we had to call all the time cause they would mess up on how many to give me in the bottle had the times messed up and everything and we called and told them of the day we got the medicine and they said it was our fault .  Had proof of my problems . Idk why they were so mean to me . Almost like they didn't want to deal with such a severe case.  I have a new doctor now.  And I'm on straight morphine and I'm bedridden for life.  My new doctors cares for me and the first day I came crawling in her office she said why in the world do they have you on tramadol . Every disc in my back is herniated so severe there is no help with even surgery.  Also they erased all the bad reviews from this site the day I almost died.  So they will erase this one . They will remember me I know it.  I hate to write a bad review.  And it took me a long time to put it cause I was so nice to you guys . Really wanted doctor Strauss  To help me to believe me . But No . No . Yall didn't care at all . And it saddens me all the ppl I saw in the waiting room was fine while I was screaming in pain . And you guys didn't want to have to deal with it . Point blank . That's why yall wouldn't take me back . Oh well I'm better off now with a doctor who found my real problems . And put me on the medicine I needed to be able to even take a shower.|Only in my second visit but they have a highly efficient process your not there hours wasting a whole day sitting in a waiting room. All the staff is very pleasant  doctor is absolutely spot on and easy to talk to and answers questions  that are easy to understand. Hope to stay a patient as long as possible.|Dr. Straus is amazing . He is thorough and friendly . However , the answering service is extremely rude , unfriendly , not helpful , and bad attitude each time I've called in . Which is why they get 4 star . Really need better people with customer service experience and patience answering phone calls . People are in enough pain as is , no need to be rude .

She is AMAZING....& I love her. I leave my appts w such peace. She wants to help. Instead of making my pain worse. Truly adore her!!!

Wanna leave this practice.|I have been going to Dr. Davis for over 3 yrs now, and I can honestly say she truly cares about me as a human being. Shes the only doctor I've found that doesn't look at your past and judge you for it! She judges you by who you are today, not who you was or the mistakes you made years ago. The only thing that sucks is they don't except wellcare insurance anymore so I have to find a new doctor  I hope I can find another doctor who is just like her or half as good as she is! I miss her being my doctor but I'm hopeful that my new doctor won't be an ***. If your looking for a maintenance program or if you have pain issue she is the doctor to see. She is very talented, smart, and beautiful inside and out and you can share anything with her the good and even the very bad parts of your life and she will encourage you to be the best you that you can be without holding any of those bad things against you! I've been sober for a little over 4 years and i own a huge thank you to Dr Davis and to my doctor before her Dr Finley. These two doctors saved my life and because of them I am the woman I am now! So thank you Dr Davis!!  Remember folks some times we create our own hell but we can turn it into a beautiful testimony!!|I have dealt with Chronic Migraines and cluster headaches since I was a child. column40:
For years I woke up in agony; crying every morning with debilitating back pain and had to use a cane just to get around.  Life was unbearable!  One day a friend told me about their success from being treated at Georgia Pain Specialist. So, I promptly made an appointment to see Dr. Williams for my multiple spinal issues.
Now, I wake up cheerfully with NO PAIN and just a wonderful attitude, I no longer must walk with a cane! His spinal injection therapy has dramatically improved the quality of my life; basically, he gave me my life back!  As well as SO MANY OTHERS!  Some patients he has treating for over 20 years!  I have been a satisfied patient since 2008.
With his 3 board certifications & numerous highly regarded awards, Dr. Williams is MORE than qualified to treat basic to severe spine & joint ailments. He is a true miracle worker that I recommend to EVERYONE with pain issues!  He has a positive outlook on life, pays attention to each patients' needs, is confidential, has great bedside manner, always looks out for his patient's best needs, and he has a great since of humor!
If you are in pain from a car accident, a serious injury, or simply those "growing older pains", PLEASE make an appointment & start getting treatments!  And in no time, you will positively have your quality & value of life back!|They treat you like family at Dr. Williams office. column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management in North Atlanta

At Align Spine and Pain Institute, we provide personalized pain management solutions for residents throughout the North Atlanta area. Our dedicated physicians take the time to understand each patient's unique condition, often spending over an hour during initial consultations to develop customized treatment plans. We specialize in a wide range of interventional procedures and therapies including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Regenerative therapies (PRP)

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Nerve ablation procedures

  • Sports medicine treatments

Our approach combines advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions affecting the spine, joints, and musculoskeletal system. Located in Roswell, our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with the latest technology to ensure precise diagnosis and effective treatment. We believe in creating partnerships with our patients, taking the time to explain all available options and developing comprehensive plans that focus on long-term relief rather than temporary fixes. Visit our website to learn more about our services or call us at (770) 988-7246 to schedule your consultation.

column40:
I started to see Dr. Ju in August of 2024 for hip & spine pain.  On my first appointment, Dr. Ju spent over an hour with me listening to all my concerns and reviewing my medical records from previous appointments with other doctors.  After his review, he generated a plan of action to help reduce my pain with a goal of elimination.  He was very sure that he could help assist me, where previous doctors had failed.

Throughout the process Dr. Ju was attentive, empathetic, and took his time to ensure I was heard.  He listened as if I was his only patient and he had all the time in the world to spend with me.

My pain has begun to subside and I feel that I am on my way back to living my life without pain.  I would highly recommend Dr. Ju and his office staff to anyone who is living with chronic pain.|Dr. Ju is an amazing doctor. He will not stop until he figures out the cause of your pain. I came to him a year ago and this journey has been difficult, but he's been amazing, kind, compassionate and patient. I've seen other doctors on this journey, and I trust Dr. Ju the most. He's professional but can be super casual as well, which you don't get much, and it's refreshing. It's good to laugh during these times when you're starting to feel hopeless. The staff at Dr. Ju's office are amazing as well. They are kind and caring every time I see them or call. I'd recommend him to anyone. I'm so glad he was put in my path and that he's on this adventure with me.|Dr. K and his team exemplify a rare breed of genuine, good medicine - and if the Align team could take care of every specialty of medicine I needed, I'd be in the best hands possible in this state.

But as my body began to fail and my medical team began to abandon me, Dr. K and the Align Spine team safeguarded me and stood by my side, taking care of any of my needs- questions, pain, and beyond - as they came.

They deserve a testimony that goes beyond what I can write right now. But do know that you'll feel welcomed and helped to the best extent possible by Align.|Dr. Ju is the best and most comprehensive pain management practitioner I have ever seen. He truly has your best interest at heart and cares on a level that is reassuring and kind. I trust him and his office with my multiple injuries. He also has great contacts and has referred me to other great doctors who take great care of me and often in tandem with Dr. Ju. I would reference all my friends and family to him. His entire office staff are kind and efficient. They all do above and beyond for their patients. I cannot recommend him more.|Dr. K understands back pain is real and treats the patient. He listens and spends time explaining your options. No lower back pain this week. I'd forgotten what it feels like not to hurt!|Dr. Tom Ju did a stellar job managing my husband's pain from a C6-7 herniated disc. He's knowledgeable, warm, personable and a  pleasure to talk to. He takes his time with each visit and explains his treatment plans and thoughts very thoroughly. Whenever we had questions/concerns after hours, he returned calls pretty promptly and addressed those questions/concerns in full. Heck, he even called us on a Sunday evening to address an insurance situation! Additionally, he recommended a neurosurgeon for a surgical intervention to this debilitating injury. Dr. Ju definitely understands the assignment! 10 out of 10. Would highly recommend for pain management!|Tired of daily pain keeping you from doing what you love? Are you tired of the same old routine treatment from orthopedists? You've gotta try Dr. Ju at Align Spine for Pain Management. Can't believe there exists a specialist (Anesthesiologist) willing to outline every pain  issue you need help with, outline possible treatment plans with timelines and costs, flexible scheduling, friendliest staff, regenerative therapy (PRP) for arthritic joints, nerve ablation, lidocaine patch strips for painful hand joints, etc.,that makes sure you understand and actually listens to you and truly helps relieve pain without pills. I love that he lets you use nitrous oxide while giving x-ray guided injections of H.A. or PRP EXACTLY where it's needed to relieve pain.
I recently underwent the trial use of a NEVRO Spinal Cord Stimulator device, while under mild I.V. sedation. I was told to expect 60% reduction of pain from herniated disc and longstanding sciatica. I'd had a laminectomy last year that gave me only 8 weeks of pain relief, then returned same as before - unable to sit, stand, walk, lie down, or LIVE, without tight, nagging pain down back of both of my legs. Plus, it took me 3 months to heal and be off work! Within a couple of hours of turning on the device, I could not believe the pain signal was blocked 99% for those 3 days! I did everything that previously induced pain, (except I wasn't allowed to bend over), and I felt NOTHNG! The 1% came on the 3rd day when I got into a low seated car. All I had to do was get out the remote control and increase the high frequency setting from 4 to 5,  and the pain was blocked! I didn't even take my usual meds at bedtime and slept fine and woke up without my typical pain and stiffness! Unbelievable! Next step is to get in with a surgeon to implant the device under my skin for the next 10 years and move on with retirement!|I came to Align spin from a referral through my primary doctor and let's just say it has been  one of the best decisions of my life : for many years I've seen so many doctors with the same issue and within 2 appointments My doctor at Align has figured out more than 5 doctors combined. Not only does he take his time with each patient but during that time he is explaining things , educating you and listening to any concerns you might have. He actually cares about your quality of life and how what you are seeing him for is being treated. I can't recommend him enough. He even lets you put your input in on what you feel might work for you. I always leave my appointments with all my questions answered and a clear plan on what we are doing next.

Thank you Ace Pain and Spine for all you do!|If you're looking for a pain clinic that helps with just about all sorts of pain, I believe this is the perfect place! She really cares for her patients seems like and doesn't just do like most people do and say she will do this and that and doesn't.  Again seems like she genuinely cares for her patients that call in and need help and follows up to make sure they get that help.  Everyone here is so nice and friendly, including Ashley of course, and she is the reason my family continues going to Ace Pain & Spine.  Thank you so much Ashley.|Ngoc is the MA and she was so sweet. column2: ARILEX Medical Dr. Gary G. Theofilis Anesthesiology
column3:
At ARILEX Medical, we harness the body's unique ability to heal itself through advanced regenerative medicine techniques. Founded by Dr. Gary Theofilis DO, DABAM, DAAIM, a Mayo Clinic Fellowship Trained Anesthesiologist, our center has successfully treated thousands of patients throughout the United States. Dr. Theofilis brings exceptional credentials as a board-certified specialist with fellowship training in Integrative Medicine, Interventional Pain Medicine, Addiction Medicine, and Aesthetic Medicine.

Specialized Care for Complex Conditions

We specialize in treating complex medical conditions with a comprehensive approach. As a sub-specialty, Dr. Theofilis has extensive experience treating Female Pelvic Pain, including conditions such as:

  • Endometriosis (all stages)

  • Pelvic Trauma

  • Pudendal Neuralgia

  • Cancer of the Pelvis

Patients travel from across the country to our Dawsonville, GA location for our innovative treatments. Our comprehensive services also include pain management, addiction treatment, family practice, men's health, and mental health services. We take pride in providing personalized care that addresses the root causes of pain and illness rather than just treating symptoms.

column11:
ARILEX Medical harnesses the body's unique ability to heal itself.

Founded by Mayo Clinic Fellowship Trained Anesthesiologist Dr. Gary Theofilis DO, DABAM, DAAIM, the Arilex Center for Regenerative Medicine has successfully treated thousands of patients throughout the United States.

As a sub-specialty, Dr. Theofilis has treated Female Pelvic Pain for many years. Patients come from all over the US to be treated for Chronic Pelvic Pain cause by Endometriosis, Pelvic Trauma, Pudendal Neuralgia and Cancer of the Pelvis.

column38: Miranda Snider|Eric Gruen|ed s|Kenneth Miller|Mason Simmons|Amanda hodges|Johnny Woods|Brit
column40: Dr. Theofilis is the best doctor I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. I moved to Georgia over 2 years ago when I first started recovery. I knew I couldn't do it alone and needed professional help so I Googled addiction doctors and his name was at the very top so I called. The doctor himself answered the phone (amazing), he was very kind and worked with me to schedule an appointment that best fit my schedule. I went to my first appointment a few days later and have been seeing him every month since. He treats me like a human being, he doesn't use words I don't understand and if he does he fully explains it to me, and he doesn't treat me like the addict I once was. He is a pain management doctor but he also treats addiction, was an anesthesiologist, and he is very educated in what he does in all aspects. He is a no nonsense type of doctor which is a good thing and he also listens to his patients instead of talking over them. I'd recommend him to anyone for addiction and/or pain management! Anyone that says otherwise has never actually been treated by him.|Dr. Theofilis is a very smart physician that really knows his stuff. I had been in pain for a month and it was increasing very rapidly to the point where I could barely walk. I had been on several medications that were not doing any good. He met me after hours,  and after a thorough exam, diagnosed exactly what was going on (which was later confirmed by MRI). He was 100% correct when he told me that any treatment that he would do would not be long term and that I needed to see a neurosurgeon for surgery. A few weeks later, after having the surgery, I'm pain free, exercising and even lifting weights again. Thank you Dr. Theofilis!!!|I have been working with Dr Theofilis over the past 2 plus years after becoming injured.  His knowledge and skill level along with his passion to help others who TRULY want help are amazing.  He is brash, no doubt, but he is doing this in ways to protect you as the patient.  His office and staff are in no way a pill mill..  They have been fantastic!  And I attest, I am a very hard patient to deal with....  Thanks Dr T and staff for helping give me a life after my injury!|I've been seeing Dr.T for 2 years now and he's the best thing that ever happened to me. He is so kind and so knowledgeable about my condition. Not only is he my doctor, but I truly feel like he's my friend. I have so much respect for this man and his care and concern for us. Not just from a medical stand point, but from a personal perspective. He is one of a kind and will get you feeling better immediately! Thanks for everything Dr.T!!|How can I even begin to describe in words what this doctor means to my family. Let me start off by saying after 20+ surgeries, 7 gyenecologic, gynecologic oncologists and endometriosis  specialists, I was finally referred to Dr. Theofilis. I went into this appointment like I did the many many other appointments I had with the other specialists, I'm going to go in here, they are going to go through all of my records and finally tell me "there's nothing we can do to help you!" Little did I know this day would be the day that changed my life forever! Dr. Theofilis already had all of my records and had went through every single one of them! When I walked in he started with a very thorough head to toe assessment. Then we sat down and I waited for those words I often heard, instead he not only knew what was going on with all of my vaginal prolapses, but he also picked up on why I was having excruciating pain in my abdomen and my low back!! He has done everything, and I mean everything to get me back to living a normal, pain-free life. I have went from living on a coach daily not able to even walk to the bathroom, to holding a full time job, never missing a day of work, able to keep up with my 10 and 12 year old kids and all of their many sporting events, to traveling the world with my family and not being fearful of the long car rides because of the pain. Dr. Theofilis cares deeply for his patients, goes above and beyond to take care of his patients, advocates for his patients. He is stern but it is to keep you safe and on the right road to recovery. I've even known him to come in on his off days just to be there for one of his patients. Dr. Theofilis is not your typical doctor, he truly is the best there is!! He considers us his family, not his patients. I thank my God daily for putting Dr. Theofilis and his family in my life because he truly has given me mine back!!|Dr. Theofilis completely changed my life. For the last 7 years, I was bounced back and forth between gynecologists and pain managements. I was suffering from debilitating pelvic and back pain, and was being offered no real answers or treatment. From my first visit at Arilex Medical, I knew this would be different. Dr. Theofilis explained my conditions in great detail. I cannot explain the feeling of hearing this wonderful man say that he understood my pain, and how it must be affecting my life! Since becoming his patient, my pain has been reduced and I'm starting to be able to enjoy my daughters and my life again! The sweet ladies in the office are incredible and always make me feel welcome. From the bottom of my heart, thank you for all you do! You're such a blessing to me.|I have suffered, as many of you have, incredible back and hip pain. Trying to get out of bed, doing daily activities and just trying to make in from day-to-day is very challenging and disheartening to say the least. I'm not saying that I haven't been seen by good physicians in the past, but Dr.Theofilis stands head-and-shouders from anyone that I have ever experienced. He will sit down and explain to his patients, in an elementary but not demeaning manner, what he recommends. He makes the complex look easy.I am most grateful for his work. I would be remiss if I did not mention his phenomenal staff. They're very professional and will do everything in their power to work with you as a patient.|Dr. T has been so helpful trying to help me manage my abdominal/pelvic, back and leg nerve pain.  I feel like I'm a complicated case having had 5 surgeries in and through my abdomen, and he has always believed he can improve my situation.  It's a process, but I can say it is working!  He always explains the mechanisms and research behind different drugs and treatments.  I'm looking forward to continued improvement and getting my life back!

At Alliance Spine & Pain, we are a premier pain management practice dedicated to providing real pain relief through our expansive network of offices across Georgia. With locations in Austell, Augusta, Woodstock, Atlanta, Marietta, Conyers, Lawrenceville, Jasper, Cartersville, Dallas, Suwanee, Covington, Carrollton, Canton, Sandy Springs, Douglasville, Peachtree City, and Roswell, we ensure accessible care for patients throughout the region. Our comprehensive approach to pain management is delivered by our best-in-class team of specialists working collaboratively to address your unique needs.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer a range of innovative treatments designed to discover the root cause of pain and achieve substantial relief. Our services include:

  • Personalized pain assessment and treatment planning

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Comprehensive behavioral health support

  • Collaborative care coordination

What sets us apart is our dedicated team of physicians, physician assistants, nurse practitioners, behavioral health specialists, patient concierges, and physician referral specialists who all work together with one mission: to help you regain control of your life through effective pain management. Visit Alliance Spine and Pain Centers or call us at +1 770-929-9033 to discover how we can help you find relief from chronic pain.

column40:
Brandon takes time to listen to ones concerns and doesn't make you feel like you're being rushed out of the office. His is very thorough and knowledgeable and seems to really want to resolve the issue conservatively, without jumping immediately to resolution through medication.  I've been seeing him for years now and trust his judgement and professionalism.|Receptionists and nurse were very kind and listened, and were accommodating of me and my service dog. However the doctor I spoke to was very dismissive. While my father was in the room he said that they were unable to treat my specific pain and would refer me to Emory. However when my father left the room to take my service dog to the bathroom the doctor suddenly changed his mind and told me I needed to see a psychiatrist. I've dealt with chronic pain and disability for most of my life, and doctors dismissing me is unfortunately nothing new to me. I found the act of only changing his tune when my father left the room  with my service dog particularly insulting, as if he was waiting for there to be nobody to stick up for me. I'm sure if you're older this is the place for you, but anyone under the age of 40 should probably avoid.|Dr. Gupta truly cares about any problems you're having and strives to get them resolved. She's very caring and concerned with your well being. The team reaches out to check on you after your procedure. I would recommend her to anyone experiencing any back or spinal pains.|I would like to thank everyone on the team including the staff upfront. Thy are always caring but most importantly I will like to thank William because he is very interested in helping me figure out this diagnosis. He's open to what I have to say and advocates for my well being. Although I'm not where i want to be, I'm hopeful due to the way they treat me.|I have been a patient of Dr. Palavi Gupta for many years now. If you are in severe back pain, in my opinion she is indeed "The Best Pain Doctor" you can find. I was referred to this Practice by my Rheumatologist. The  medicines she prescribed, didn't help me manage the Chronic Pains, from my Rheumatoid Arthritis.  I wasn't going to get the regular back surgery done. I was determined that no Doctor would cut open my back. So, I was happy to receive mon-invasive Surgeries to enable me to stand up straight, and  walk.  I normally would see her at the Austell location. But, when I  requested a meeting with her, concerning a new upcoming procedure, she was in her Dallas office,  on Friday.  I found out it was so much closer to my residence. It only took me 13 minutes to arrive.  The staff was so friendly, and smiled  a lot. I fell in love with Deneen, she is Dr. Gupta's PA, at that location.  Now, both locations are very clean, and you will be treated well. But now, I will be switching most definitely, to Alliance Pain and Spine, at their Dallas, GA  location.
She is the reason that I am able to still drive my car  and move around so much better, now. Please give her office,  a chance to give you a better quality of life. You will be so happy  like me.|I love this clinic !
I see Brandon and I always make my appointments with him.
He is always kind and caring and listens to you.
The girls that run this office are always helpful and friendly.
Dr. Gupta is awesome!!
I like her very much. She is always on point and very sweet.|Dr E is a wonderful doctor. He is very knowledgeable and takes the time to examine , explain what is going on, next steps and what to expect. In Addition his nursing staff are so kind, even will take the time to visit with you to make you comfortable.  Finally the office staff are incredibly pleasant as well.  I am very grateful I was referred to him, I feel I have found a physician that can make a difference with the medical condition I am fighting.|Never met this doctor before, but she is one of the top docs. I was very pleased with her approach with her knowledge and with her touch she was very, very very I would recommend anyone that has any back injections. You will not be disappointed.
I should say the same about her nurse who is very attentive acts all the right questions and did all the good things that a nurse should do for patient and I really appreciate it. Kudos to you.

column38: Wendy Bloome|Lauren Gilbert|Hotzcakez P|VICKIE JUSTUS-HOOPER|Kathy Wiggins|jacki Ballad|Twila Brooks|Nicky Frederick
column40:
Very professional, caring staff. They are always friendly and smiling and make you feel welcome! Facility is clean and nice. Doctor is very thorough and spends time with you. I have never had to wait very long for my appointment (thankfully). They are a legitimate clinic that runs 'by the book'
and I am grateful to have found them.|I have dealt with chronic pain for the last 20 years. I have been to three different clinics, and when I finally asked the doctor at the last clinic was there actually a doctor who was willing to look at each individual patient  and their individual problems I was told to see if I could get accepted at Suwanee pain management. Although the doctor who recommended me to the place was more concerned with what the government was telling them to do and didn't look at all at the MRIs or my individual problems, I will thank him for sending me to this place. The doctor is awesome! It's not a pill Mill, they don't have 30 or 40 people in the waiting room to usher in and out in a 15 minute time frame. The doctor sees each patient and spends 15 minutes with them he looks them in the eye, he listens to them he asks questionsAND HE LOOKS AT THE CLINICAL DATA FROM THE MRIs AND THE X-RAYS ETC, and he knows what he's looking at. He knows whether someone is actually in pain and why and he is honest and concerned for each patient. I can't say enough about this place. The above comments apply to all of the staff as well. I just thank God that I found this place. One more thing, at every other place I had been my prescriptions all said chronic pain syndrome as the reason for the prescription. The prescriptions that I get here actually have the medical coding for each individual problem that is going on in my body.|As a patient for almost 8 years I would recommend going somewhere else. Why?  I have never gone to a different dr
Before. These are straight facts. Pricing goes up almost every year for visits. Long wait times. ( Have waited 3 hours to be seen in the past). They get a new doctor on average every other year. So there is no consistency there. This is not run by a doctor it's run by a businessman he tells the doctor what to do the doctor doesn't make the rules. They have changed UDS third parties three times in the last year or so.the place they're using now are charging me $800 every time I get tested. If you screw up with screens, or pill counts. There is no warning you get dismissed immediately no second chances.|Have been a patient who receives care and medications for the past five years. They have provided my care above and beyond any other doctors (regardless of the specialty of them, all variations of doctors, any/all doctors in general), throughout my entire life of greater than 45 years. They run a very well put together team that seems to look as if they were a well oiled machine. Shows the utmost bedside manner never have been given the rush through affect,  taking the time needed to be able to provide any and all kinds of concerns or questions. Not sure what Or even how the"pill mill" words have ever been associated with this particular pain management office. They are very well updated on all levels of the law enforcement agencies and the rules that they have to follow and inform us about any kind of changes that has set any kind of restrictions upon them (office), us (patients), and the pharmacy changes that they are aware of. Having to renew your contract with the entire rules and regulations of their expectations and your own responsibilities as for being considered a patient who receives care from them and follow the rules and regulations for them to the fullest extent. I've recently moved into a complete different area from my previous residents. It happens to be a little more of a commute to get to the same center but has never had me entertaining the thought of switching to another clinic that is closer to get to. I'm a firm believer in the old saying if it's not broken then why fix it. My thoughts about Suwanee Pain Management Center.|They have always took good CARE of me and they still are.And the Doctor Ditaranto MD is a Sweet Heart and Also Jennifer she will help you when you need help ,I can always depend on them and her if she can't help you then she will find a way to do the best she can.And I love them for that,They are like Family to me because I have been going there for year's So I say if you need a good Doctor and good staff GI see them they are the best to me!!! Thanks Again Suwanee Pain Management you're the greatest in my book!!!!! See you soon, Thanks to all of them and staff .I don't know what I would do without you guysb or girls Love Y'all and GOD BLESS all of you !!!!|He is worth going to. If you have legitimate pain, don't waste your time with self-righteous imbeciles at other clinics. Healthy people, even doctors, have an incredibly hard time understanding chronically acute pain. They like to presume you are weak for taking pills. But they will eventually know what pain is even if just on their death beds.

This isn't to say this clinic will prescribe anybody. But regardless of where you are prescribed, you will next find out which pharmacy has the monopoly on filling orders upon walk in. You will have to drive to the hospital in Cumming.

DEA has harmed every pain patient in one way or another, and we are stigmatized by the healthy majority. Incorporate compassion in your quest for superiority so as you meet those less fortunate, you might be viewed as a saint instead of a devil.|This place is uncoordinated incompetent and disorganized for 3 weeks I jumped threw hoops trying to become a new patient and the office personnel procrastinated and after 15 calls was ask to provide more paperwork because that didn't treat MS I was looking for PM as a result of the damaged caused by the disease, I've been in PM for the last 9 years. Got insurance & money... Dropped the ball here! VERY UNPROFESSIOAL
I go to the Shepherd center for my MS treatment and told them.that, just don't need my business! So many other clinics that are interested in growing their practices, this is not one of them just move to the next. Don't waste your time & efforts!|Very human and nice/professional atmosphere during visits.  I've had and seen different specialists over the years but this Dr has a smaller firm and had surrounded themselves with a great bunch of team players and are always willing to answer as well as listen.

column3:
Award-Winning Pain Management Specialist in Columbus, GA

At our practice, Dr. Rutvij Shah, MD, MPH brings exceptional expertise as an ACGME accredited fellowship-trained Interventional Pain physician. As a board-certified Neurologist and the Director of Interventional Pain, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions using state-of-the-art interventional procedures. Dr. Shah's distinguished career includes numerous scientific publications, participation in clinical trials, and active membership in several prestigious national and international pain societies. We're proud to announce that Dr. Shah was recently recognized with the Business Rate - Best of 2024 - Pain Management Physician award, highlighting our commitment to excellence in patient care.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

  • State-of-the-art interventional procedures

  • Chronic pain management solutions

  • Compassionate, patient-centered care

Located at 1831 5th Ave in Columbus, GA, we welcome patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Learn more about our services or schedule an appointment by visiting Dr. Rutvij Shah Pain Management Physician or calling +1 706-320-8700.
column11: Rutvij Shah, MD, MPH is an ACGME accredited fellowship trained Interventional Pain physician. Dr. Shah is a board-certified Neurologist and an active member of several well-known national and international pain societies. He has published numerous scientific papers and abstracts and participated in many clinical trials. Dr. Shah was also the recipient of the Business Rate - Best of 2024 - Pain Management Physician. As Director of Interventional Pain, Dr. Shah will provide management of chronic pain with state of the art interventional procedures.
column38: eric funderburg|Pat Etemadi|Jenny|Michael Robinson I|Amanda Young|Est 1985|Sam Roring|Linda Brantley
column40:
Dr Shah thoroughly explained my mri for my cervical issues. He explained my choices to alleviate the pain acutely and the long pain relief options. This pain process started with pain in my hip. But because my cervical condition is so severe all the providers have been concentrating on the process for eventual cervical surgery. Dr Shah was the first of all the providers that listened to the pain and was able to diagnose SI issues. He told me stretches to perform and gave me some literature on SI issues. I honestly had issues even putting weight on my leg. I work long hours and it was so nice to be listened to. I highly recommend Dr. Shah.|I would highly recommend anyone experiencing pain to see Dr Shah. He is a very kind and compassionate doctor. He really listens to you. Some doctors will cut you off when you are explaining your pain, he doesn't.  His nurse Heather is wonderful she will fight your insurance company when something is denied. Heather and Dr. Shah actually calls and checks on you. I am very impressed with this office.|Went in for RFA only to find out by another doctor that he burned the wrong nerves and caused me additional pain and a month out of work! I'm still in a LOT of pain but that will be corrected by my new pain management physician.  One who actually SPOKE with me in depth and got to the bottom of the problem. I do NOT, NOT recommend Dr. Shah!!|This doctor is one the best doctors ever! He listens, explains, and really does his best to take care of you! I thank God for him, he really took good care of me. When they hired him, they made a great choice! Thanks again, Dr. Shah!|Dr Shah has been amazing. He cares for the patient and their quality of life. Suggests best plan to reach managed pain and productive lifestyle.  He is patient, answers questions and shows patient medical devices (if needed), explains thoroughly any procedures being suggested.  He is funny, approachable, has a fantastic bed side manner, gets to know his patient and shares his life as well. He is honest with his approach and is determined to help his patient with their pain management.  His staff is friendly and professional, and his office admin/nurse is great. He works with your schedule and is very caring and flexible.  His knowledge and procedure has changed a life of chronic to pain to a life of doing great!!|9/6/2024 will be the absolute LAST time that I see Dr. Shah for pain management. Not only does he dismiss my complaints that I am in excruciating pain 24/7 he continues to suggest that I can work and perform physical actions that I CONTINUOUSLY tell him I can not do due to my spine and back problem. Every visit he down plays my pain as if there is nothing wrong with me. First visit with him, he put either his foot or knee in my lower back, grabbed both arms and bent me backwards knowing I was referred to him for complaints of lower back problems! Over the years I have read about how black women are often ignored and treated unfair in health care and I can honestly say this feels like it. I have DDD, arthritis in back, an annular fissure and other things going on in my spine . I received spinal injections once and called his office 3 weeks afterwards to report the pain has returned and he mentioned nothing of this on 9/6. He now believes as of 9/6/2024 that I also may have fibromyalgia and suggests taking Vitamin D and tumeric...for pain. Every single day I suffer from unbearable pain, which leads to my blood pressure staying elevated and depression. Shah stated in other visits that my BP is high because I am in his office. MAN WHAT??? Good thing I've screen shot all notes from my MRI and every visit with him. He also noted in my mychart a few months ago that I was  "obese" and he talked to me about needing to lose the weight...this is not true, we NEVER had this conversation. Life is no easier and discomfort is still taking over my life. Pain management has managed NOTHING.To those who have great things to say about Dr. Shah, I am truly happy for you. I didn't ask for Disk degeneration and othr musculoskeletal issues.I don't deserve to be treated like crap either. I suffer enough.
He also lies about the time frame spent within our visits in my mychart.. He notes that they are from 25-45 minutes. He spends NO MORE than 10 minutes talking to me. I'm in and OUT.|Dr. Shah is very knowledgeable about pain management and cares about his patients. Dr Shah and his staff are outstanding, I would recommend him to anyone who suffers from pain.|This is a wonderful office! He's always caring and concerned.  He listens very carefully to all my cares and concerns. Whenever I call, I'm given an appointment to come into the office. He makes sure to give it his all. The staff are always friendly and professional.  Making appointments is fast and easy.  I would recommend this office to anyone who is suffering from pain.

column40:
i have been going to dr vyas for 13 years and he is very thorough and the front office is full of angels he only gives what you need doesnt give you what u want ...he remembers every detail of your life and i love that|The doctor there is horrible! I don't even think he's a real doctor. I told him I wanted to get treated to fix my back/spine and not mask it shot injections. He told me what I have can't be fixed and that I was expecting too much. I haven5 herniated disc in my back and I could not continue to work due to the type of work that I do. I brought my short term disability paper with me because the previous chiropractor that referred me to this doctor told me they will have to fill it out because they are treating you now. This doctor said I will not fill out paper and that only came to for paper. How sir???! When my MRI shows I have 5 herniated disc and my pain supports it. Needless to say, he lied and said he will write up that I refused treatment. Horrible experience. Will never recommend. Sounds like they must make money off of injections. You can barely understand the words that are coming out of mouth and in addition the mask he wears makes it harder to understand him. This was the worse experience I've had with a doctor.|I left my last pain specialist, because I was tired of being lied to and feeling like a bank account number, instead of a patient. Imagine my surprise, when on my first appointment with Dr. Vyas at Atlanta Pain Clinic, he personally spent 4 1/2 hours with me and my husband, going over my history and asking and answering questions. He quickly realized just from talking to me that I had been on the wrong medication for years. I have been a patient of his now for five years. In all that time, his staff has always been beyond sweet and kind, and will bend over backwards to help you. I have never been handed over to a nurse practitioner or a physician's assistant, as he is the only doctor, so I see and talk to him every appointment. Dr. Vyas remembers me, my family, and my health issues with out having to read my file. I honestly recommend him has a doctor to anyone who is in need of a pain specialist, you will not regret it.|I read these reviews on here and it makes me wonder if the "bad doctor" is the same doctor I see every month. I disagree with all the Na-sayers. I have been going to Dr. Vjas for almost 3 years now. I have never once had to sit in the waiting room for hours on end. Never once did the office staff belittle me in any way shape or form. As far as bedside manners. I get 4 epidural steroid injections a year and there is not one time I remember that I was mistreated in any way. I would and I do recommend Dr. Vjas to anybody who has chronic pain and needs serious relief. People say that when someone leaves a bed review its mostly because they didn't get what they wanted from the good doctor. Usually this applies to people who are just out for prescription drugs and the affect they have on the mind & body.|I only gave three stars only because the office assistants where so kind and helpful. The doctor singal handedly has ruin my respect and comparability as a customer. He has no people skills to the point the he talks over his own assistant. I called to reschedule an appointment and he told me that if i cancelled again to just dont come back. Little does he know Im having trouble with transportation. It's the holidays and its hectic out here he should be more mindful of his tone.|Worst Doctor Ever!
I  have NEVER seen a more condesending, rude, judgemental, disrespectful, no type of compassion for the pain that a person is in.  Let alone a "Doctor". He even spoke to his staff horrible. I've never experienced anything like that in my life. He doesn't speak english well at all. I visited him there times and the very day this Doctor act as if he knew everything is about me.|This is the worst doctors office experience that I have ever had in all.of my 48 years, the doctor has a language barrier so the front desk clerk has to type everything for him and explain things that you say to him ,he is very condescending and has no bed side manner. Then when I called for my bill they don't want to send it to me...Crazy right well all I can say is find some where better to treat your pain unless you want more pain!|At first, I felt offended by doctor vyas when he said my previous doctor was a pill mill doctor (which I can assure you he is not), but after having seen Doctor Vyas for several months now I can honestly say he only has your best interests in mind. The staff is ALWAYS kind, and if you're  there only to get pills, then THATS the reason you won't like him, because he actually cares and won't over prescribe. If I had to deal with a bunch of "pill seekers" yelling and being rude to me all day, I'd be in a bad mood too I guess. Dr Vyas is a good Dr. who is trying to actually manage pain, Not just be a legal drug dealer, so keep that in mind before being seen. I wish everyone the best because living with pain is terrible, good luck to all!

column38: David Post|Melissa Fleming|Hillary Brown|Jackson Everage|Marie Jones|Doug Archer|Lona Summers|Kathy Hendrix
column40:
When I first started with Summit I was quite impressed. After being a patient for a while now my experience and attitude have totally reversed.
I no longer feel the doctors care about the patient or the condition of pain care and management.
When I first became a patient I was taking 180 pills every month. The doctor said that was more than I could take and be in your program. I was informed I would have to cut back to 150. I had no problem no issue with that objective. I can manage my daily activities with that level.
Currently I have been cut to 140. In doing so there was no discussion about it with the doctor. He basically informed me and then walked out of the room saying he would "be right back" which he didn't do but sent the med tech in to check me out.
So much for the care and concern about the patient.
I live daily with my pain and still attempt to have a somewhat normal life.
I cannot do so at the current level of medication and also face the possibility (probability) of having my medication further decreased.
I never ask for an increase, I never have an issue with drug screen or any procedures suggested (although I have done everything short of surgery).|Was referred there by medical physician for pain management. After paying $150 for my deductible. Waiting 2 and 1/2 hours in the waiting room passed my appointment time. I was seen by the physician for exactly 30 seconds to tell me I didn't have the proper paperwork for referral to be seen by him. No. Exam no advice for pain management. Just come back with a proper paperwork withithin 2 weeks first available appointment. Never mind the 11 pages. My physician had faxed to them from the office with my history included as well as referral. I know they got it because that's how they called me to schedule this appointment . This can't be legal|I had my first appointment the first week of January 2025. I was nervous at first because I've never been to pain management before because my primary doctor handled everything but she moved away. Anyway, going in I was greeted by the two sweetest girls up front! I filled out some paperwork and waited maybe 10 minutes if that. They said it's usually busier but that I came on the right day. lol
But I went back and talked with the medical assistant and explained that my doctor had moved away and I had been experiencing pain for a couple of years and it just kept getting worse (lower back) and she treated my pain but since she moved that I was referred to their practice. I had been involved in two car wrecks a few years prior that I believe was the main reason for my pain and that I was excited to start a new doctor because I had been doing research about some people doing injections and if I was a possible candidate for injections because I had read all the success stories. Luckily Dr. Pulido specializes in injections so in the mean time I'm going for a MRI and he said we will go from there! I love having a game plan!!  Before I left since I got medicine everyone has to take a drug test, but the bathroom is super clean and big so you will have no problem with that! I would highly recommend them if you like having clear instructions and having a game plan and feeling like it's a team effort because that's how I felt when I left after my first appointment. Before I left I finished my drug test, took my prescription and then made an appointment for a month out to come back! Seriously, I never leave reviews unless I had a bad experience and I don't want people to waste their time but I decided to go ahead and do a review for them because of the outstanding care I received while I was there!!|I will say that the staff and Drs have been great to me. No long wait times and the Drs actually listen to you, answer your questions and help you understand exactly what and why they're doing what they're doing.
I've been helped greatly, Dr. Patel especially has helped me. I had my wife switch her PM Dr and Clinic to this PM Clinic. He assured me they'd keep her at her current medication and levels and then once she returned a couple times they'd work out a new plan of action for her.
We all have been through the oh crap, I don't wanna have to start over routine when we move from one clinic to another.

So I recommend them fully !|I went into Commerce Summit Pain Management today. I saw a Doctor Emily, I absolutely loved her she handled all my questions. Even though they were very busy she had so much concern and kindness and took the time to ask me all the questions so she could understand all of my concerns. I definitely would recommend Commerce Summit Pain Management to all . Thank you so much Merry Christmas to each and all|The visits are not bad and everytime I go they listen If I have an issue and try to resolve it. The only thing is wait time when you are at the office and also trying to schedule injections. I still haven't hears about that and its been e weeks.|I have been going to Athens Clinic for a year. 1 week ago I was told I fail a drug test for COCAINE. You could have hit me in the head with a hammer. I have Not did Any COCAINE.  I am a 70 year old woman on oxygen 24/7. I don't smoke or drink and diffently don't do no COCAINE
I have never been a COCAINE user. I got put out the program and I had a fit in the Dr's. Office.  They don't believe you when you say the test is wrong. You have not did any drugs other than the ones they give me. I ask for my urine so I could have it tested at some other lab. Surprise it has already been done away with.  I have nerver failed a drug test in all the 6 years i have been going to a pain clinic. The 2 other clinics i was going to closed down. Never had a bad experience with them at all.Thank god my family and friends know better. My primary Dr. knew better also. I called right then and saw him the next day. He gave me a few of my medicine to last 2 weeks. No luck with finding another pain clinic and they probably have red flaged me whatever that means.  How can I get this wrong drug test  proven to be false/ positive.  I have cried a million tears over this. Does anyone have
any suggestions about what to do. I will say this all the workers were nice people. The Dr. did not even talk with me that day. I was told I failed by one of the girls that takes you to the room. I'm so heart broke over this. My life will never be the same.|I went to the commerce location after losing my pain MGMT Dr to retirement, if you need pain medicine or are on pain medicine this isn't a place for you, I have been stable on my meds for 7+ years I was told they were going to cut my meds to 1 a day and put me on bupenorphine and told by the Dr they could just keep feeding me pain meds until I overdose exact words! I have never failed a drug screening or overdosed in my life! Couldn't believe I was treated like this! I lost my insurance and paid $255 and told if I didn't get insurance again they couldn't see me cause they couldn't do injections and procedures to my back without it so they couldn't see me! I left and never went back this place is a drill mill the doctors are rude and act like your drug seeking. This place is a joke
