column38: Brittany Bachler|J W|Cheryl Mercer|Winy Neaur|Glory Memolo|marisa fernandez|Bobert Pug|Danny
column40:
Dr. A is one of the kindest, smartest, doctors I have ever met. She's been on a rollercoaster with me on my health journey but not only listens to the patient she actually cares! The other docs as well!  The staff is amazing, friendly, funny and kind! I can't say enough good things about this place! As someone with a chronic pain disease not being believed for two years and finally figuring out what was wrong after four she took me seriously right away.|I have been seeing "Dr. A," for several months as I try to recover from a substantial fall damaging my whole left side of my body. I was trapped in worker's comp hell during this time. I was able to see Dr. A by private paying because I needed help with all of my injuries and no work comp doctor cared to help me with pain management.

Dr. A is very intelligent and compassionate. She listens and does not apply a one size fits all approach or treatment. She was the only doctor I felt listened to me and treated me with respect and dignity.

The location (Norcross) can be super busy and it can be a nightmare to reach staff on the phone in a timely manner, but that is my only complaint. Jessica, the office manager, is helpful, responsive, and personable. Huge shout-out to you, Jessica!

I moved out of the area, and I miss Dr. A both as a provider and as a person. She is a gem in a city where most are scamming you or failing to provide services you pay for. You can trust this review, I'm not from Atlanta! You're the best, Dr. A! Thank you for helping me.|Dr. A has been such a blessing.  We were referred to her for a baclofen pump.  We live about 100 miles away and she has been professional, reassuring and calming since we've met. My son is special needs and she is patient and just great with him.  He loves her! She listens and explains everything.  Never rushes you.  She was able to set up baclofen pump and refills  at our home so we wouldn't have to make as many trips to her office.  I thank God for her and her staff who is just as wonderful!|Wonderful friendly folk! All pain medicine practice is a tight rope walk for the providers. The balance between the rightfully so law (Fentynal deaths) and taking care of patients. The Doctors and Nurses and other personnel do it masterfully at Summit. Really like that Summit has lots of locations and Doctors. Highly recommend!|DONT go here if you are looking for help with addiction! The doctor was nice  but since it is hard to find the medication in stock at pharmacy's they tell you to let them know and they will send it somewhere else. We did that same day as appropriate and called 4x the next day with little response from the office just keep sayin we will let you know when it has been sent. Meanwhile I'm having to watch the person I care about withdraw with nothing.did not find out the medication had been finally sent over till a day or two after the fact so a total of 4 days of withdrawal. Anyone who has withdrawn from drugs knows that is the hardest days. THIS PLACE Should not be dealing with MAT treatment bc most addicts would have turned to the streets if this happened to them! Thankfully my loved one stayed strong and made it through.|I have very severe back pain due to my S curve scoliosis- and I have been looking for a new doctor/ potentially looking into physical therapy and/or chiropractic services in addition to my medication. I drive past this location daily bc I live close. R u taking new patients?|Dr. Hall is the man! My only complaint is he isn't my physician! He's a very nice man who is really easy to talk to. But most importantly he genuinely cares and you can tell he loves helping people. If he's an hour plus drive away I would make the drive, you're not going to find anyone better and to top it off his staff are phenomenal! If you're deciding where to go for the help you need trust me, you have found the right place to go.|Let me start off with my name is Daniel I go to solutions pain management on Hamilton mill rd Georgia and it's been the most complicated  most toughest time and visits,time of my life ..I been dealing with my back and injections since 2018 I've never had so many problems and issues switching doctors to come to solutions it's been so tough and aggravating in my life so I just started going to solutions the last 3 or 4 months and let me say just to get my prescriptions sent over to the pharmacy omg is the biggest pain I understand the doctor might be busy or the pain medicine has to be authorized but I've did everything I'm asked including passing drug tests taking my medication as prescribed going to different locations more than 45 min away from my home updated mri within 3 years everything correctly but for example I had an appointment yesterday at 10 in the morning I came prepared because my insurance changed so I had to find a different pharmacy that will cover my medication I came with that information and I'm still sitting here the following next day only one prescription has been sent still waiting on the other prescriptions to be sent I've called the office more than 4 times emailed I've did everything I'm supposed to do and it's bothering me so bad I have never went through this from the last 6 years going to pain management not only that I've dealt with a parent passing away and had to go out of state and was out of my medicine for a period of time because you can't just go to a pain doc out of state because I was helping my parent temporarily like not even a month and when I came back started going back to solutions my insurance didn't cover my medicines so had all that changed and got different insurance different pharmacy and still yet I don't have my medicine it's so crazy I'm not bashing no one from the office nor the doctor I just want my experience to be heard and hope no one has to go through this just to get there medicine for the issue they got going on that's all thanks Daniel

column40:
My Name is Donna Means I have been a patient of Dr Hairder for years now like 7 and this is the absolute best pain Mgment Dr around! It absolutely makes me wanna loose my temper when people that come for any reasons other than pain throw shade at my doctor. It absolutely bull then his good patients have to suffer because of people that don't get what they want instead of what they need! This is a good doctor that don't just write prescriptions Willy nilly I am so upset with people!  He is an amazing doctor period!|I have been going to Dr. Haider for a few years now and have always had a pleasant experience,  The entire staff go above and beyond to take care of their patients. Dr. Haider,  Damion, and all the ladies in the office have always treated me with care and compassion during each visit.  They always have a smile on their face and willing to address any concerns you may have!|My experience in this place with Brandon, Mike and Damion is a second family. They truly care about how I feel medically and emotionally. They make sure I feel comfortable about the procedures that I undergo and that I full understand what will happen during and what I should expect afterwards. They come check on me periodically while waiting for to be seen or for to my procedure to be done.  If I have a phone in with a question they are always calling me back in a timely manner.  In all my experience with doctor offices this staff is one of the best staffs that I have had the pleasure to be service by.
You have a wonderful caring staff one of the best I have had the pleasure to know. They all should be praised what a great job they do.

Donna Lee|When I first started coming the pain was unbearable and now I can actually function . The staff is amazing and always makes sure I'm comfortable and doing okay.Damien,Brandon, and Mike have always made sure that I understand every part of my healthcare. The office is always clean! I would highly recommend if you want a office that actually cares!|My husband has gone to this doctor for years and the staff here are awesome. They are always looking out for the patients and making sure that, while the pain is taken care of, the patients are safe. I have a lot of respect for them and they have helped my husband tremendously.|Dr. Syed Haider and his staff provide amazing service.

I required an epidural and he went out of his way to accommodate my schedule.

Upon my arrival I was greeted promptly not only by the front desk but his assistant Brandon as well... whom also possesses a fantastic a sense of humor.

Dr. Haider is warm, professional, caring and gets down to business.

I arrived at 12:30 for a 1:00 PM appointment. And like clock work I was politely escorted to the exam room at 1:00 PM sharp.

Brandon then covered the procedure in great detail while also assisting me with the paperwork required by insurance.

Within 30 minutes I was on the table.

Needless to say...Dr. Haider is a perfectionist and made sure the injections were precise by using his X-ray machine.

I highly recommend Dr. Haider for any and all pain management procedures.

Lastly, please note for those reading my review and other reviews.... the pain management business is not an easy profession. And unfortunately when the few and far between patients become angry based upon addictive traits..... any caring responsible physician must remove the patient from treatment.

Eg.,. If you read some of the negative comments it is without a doubt written from the perspective of an angry and irresponsible patient. (Always two sides to a story).  As there is no way he or his staff would ever treat a patient in that manner.

Todd J Tankersley - Atlanta GA|Dr. haider took very good care of my mother who had severe back pain. The office had minimal wait time and he personally saw my mom and we did not have to deal with a PA or nurse practioner...finally good to actually see the Dr himself !!

His staff is very courteous and and he answered all our questions which most other docs had brushed off....we will continue to see Dr Haider as needed.|Absolutely the worst experience with a doctor in my entire life! Office was dirty and unkempt, staff and physician (Dr.Haider and 'Brandon') were rude, hateful and disrespectful. Was accused of 'drug seeking' and yelled at to the point where it spilled out into the hallway and waiting room. And SO much more! I filed a complaint with my insurance company and reported them to the Joint Commission. Steer clear of this practice!

column38: Elsa Johnson|Joshua Soto|Robert Laws|Patricia Hartman|Terra Stone|Teresa Earnest|J Pace|Paul NeSmith
column40:
In 7 years, Dr. Pandya is the ONLY Dr. in Savannah who has finally helped my mother with her knee and back pain. One reviewer here said they just want your money and that could not be further from the truth in our experience! His bedside manner is impeccable and he is extremely thorough and really gets to the route of the issue.|The staff & doctors are very polite but they just want your money. I have been dealing with sciatica and disc herniation for 2 years due to these doctors. Put me on lyrica for a year & had me keep following up. Insurance approved 2 epidural injections in a 2 year span which neither did anything for me. So they charged my insurance $1,421 for these epidurals but when I asked how much out of pocket they told me around $300. It took me asking my pcp to refer me to a spine surgeon. Within a month my surgeon had me in surgery. I know this is a pain management place but dont waste your time. Surgeons are gonna give you more options.|Dr Pandya is a very good Dr However, some of the staff isn't! I was scheduled for a procedure, I waited in the the room for well over a hour and a half, she called two patients in front of my Procedure while I was still waiting. Needless to say I left without getting my Procedure. Done and I'm still in pain. I regret leaving Dr Pandya, but that's Unacceptable!|Friendly and efficient staff. Dr. Pandya is a great doctor! He explains everything! My procedure went just like he explained. My back pain is gone. It took 3 or 4 weeks to become completely effective - which he also previously explained. Can't express my thanks enough!|I cannot say enough about how much Dr.Ryan Sanchovic has helped my chronic pain. Before moving to GA last year I had been treated for this pain for over 15 years in NC. I have been under Dr.Sanchovic's care since December. I am able to move more than I have in years almost pain free. It has been a process but he has listened from the beginning and we came up with a plan of care that has worked for me. He does not push meds like other providers I have seen. The staff is very friendly and caring.
If you are in pain, don't wait, schedule your appointment today!|I live with a chronic illness and suffer from what at times is debilitating pain. I put off treating my pain for far too long because I once had a doctor accuse me drug seeking. I was so embarrassed and shamed that I no longer would mention my pain to my doctors. This year as my disease progressed I was experiencing pain that was causing me to not sleep and suffer with depression. I was referred to Dr. Pandya and cannot say enough about how positive my experience has been. The first time I met Dr. Pandya he was, for lack of a better word, excited to help me. My illness is incredibly rare so some Doctors do not want to treat me. He had the opposite reaction and showed genuine care and interest. I wanted to cry!  Over the past several months we have tried a couple of things that are really helping me. I'm still working on the shame I feel over taking (low dose) narcotics but that is my own issue. I've not even remotely felt any judgment from any of the staff at centurion!  I'm so incredibly thankful for all of them.|The staff is horrible at that office. I've had several bad experiences with the office. The doctors are wonderful, but the office staff is horrible. I've had to speak to office managers several times because of the rude office staff I change doctors because I was tired of dealing with ignorant people.|I have been with Dr Pandya for over 10 years. I not only consider him as a great doctor but as a friend too. When I don't see him, I see Courtney. She is awesome. She listens to what you have to say and helps with any concerns I may have.
Since he has been with Centurion, the atmosphere is totally different. Everyone has a smile on their face. Especially Kali at check in. When I come for a visit, she sets the tone for the whole office. Even when I call, I can feel that big smile over the phone.
Overall, the complete staff is terrific and I would suggest anyone to go see them.

column3:
At Neuro Spine and Pain Center of Savannah, we specialize exclusively in chronic spine pain management, providing compassionate care to patients throughout the Savannah area. Our dedicated team of pain management physicians and nurse practitioners focuses on developing personalized treatment plans to help improve quality of life for those suffering from persistent spinal conditions.

Comprehensive Spine Pain Management Services

We offer a range of specialized services including:

  • Personalized chronic pain evaluations

  • Advanced interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management for spine-related pain

  • Convenient telehealth appointments

  • Faith-based, compassionate care approach

Our practice is known for taking the time to truly listen to our patients, addressing both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain. column40:
Dr. Tada is absolutely amazing. It took me many years to seek care from a Pain Management specialist and I came to trust him completely over my 2 years under his care. Unfortunately, his office no longer provides RFA procedures for Veterans because they state the VA will not pay for the procedure. After being told this, I contacted the VA Patient Advocate who in turn worked with Care in the Community and was informed that the VA would indeed pay for RFA. The Patient Advocate and CITC Clinician contacted Dr. Tada's office to explain the procedure would be covered. They tried several methods to try and get the procedure accomplished, but the office person was adamant they wouldn't be paid...even after repeatedly told the procedure would be covered. I was personally informed by the office person that if I received the procedure from another provider that I could no longer see Dr. Tada, told several times the procedure won't be covered, and that there was no method to provide feedback other than through this google review. After no progress with Dr. Tada's office, the VA contacted another provider who is known for his continuous service to Veterans and I made the difficult decision to leave Dr. Tada's care. The new provider was equally amazing and saw me quickly and performed the RFA...for which the VA did pay for (I received the benefits statement today). Again, Dr. Tada is one of the very best; however, there is a disconnect in their billing and understanding of the VA. If you are a Veteran and RFA is a procedure that is a stop gap between injections and surgery, advocate for yourself and allow the VA to intervene on your behalf.|Im a patient of Dr Wang.  He has helped me with pain after I dislocated my rib cage while pregnant, i got turned away from many drs because they didnt want to treat someone pregnant with twins. He was the only one that was willing to help me and I am glad he did! From nerve ablations to the spinal cord stimulator, it completely resolved my pain. Anytime I have any issues he gets me right in and answers all my questions. He is very friendly, and takes in account of other health issues and listens to other specialists involved in your care. The staff is very nice. Danny the receptionist is very helpful and understanding. Highly recommend this clinic!|The receptionist(Auburn) is terrible. Twice she changed my appointment time 10 minutes later so I had to wait longer to see a doctor. I put in a complaint. Hopefully, she's fired so no one else has to deal with her incompetence. Everyone at the office is friendly besides her.|The worst!
Tiffany Hooks is heartless. Also the fact that Dr.Wang backs her up shows how he cares about his patients as well. A family member who is 80 years old has been going to Dr.Wang for years without any problems. The problem started with his aprn Tiffany Hooks. She doesn't know how to handle complex cases nor does she have any compassion for patients. She doesn't even have much experience working as an APRN or provider and it truly shows. She adjusted my family members' medications when he was on a perfect regimen from Dr.Wang for over 30 years. Tiffany Hook instead sent him in to full withdrawals and wouldn't even help with that. She lacks experience in basic nursing/aprn provider needs. Bases her clinical judgment of results that are old or not correct. She won't even listen to other specialty providers such as cardiology on recommendations because ,She said "she knows best." Doesn't answer her calls in urgent situations.  She truly lacks any experience of knowning a patient is suffering and withdrawals were occurring she discharged my family member and left him to go cold turkey. Imagine leaving someone suffering and not even have a heart or understanding. That is Tiffany Hooks. As a medical provider she lacks the empathy of looking as a patient as a human being and only cares for her and he ego/power trip. I work in the medical field as well and would never treat a patient like this. The culture of treating each patient as if they were your own family member doesn't exist to Tiffany. The Honolulu Pain management was a very good place until her. Tiffany Hooks ruined the clinic and I wouldn't recommend anyone to see her. Try to get another care provider instead of her at the Honolulu pain clinic. My family member is dying a very slow and painful life full of suffering because of Tiffany Hooks. Tiffany should not be a provider to the people in Hawaii and the clinic would be better off without her. The other providers there such as kelsi understand the local culture here and compassion treating patients.|Dr. Tada is incredibly compassionate and has helped me manage my chronic pain successfully for the last year. The front desk staff is exceptional as well.|I've been a patient of Dr. Troy Tada's for a number of years.  I feel he takes a real interest in how my pain/injury affects my life,  hobbies,  and interactions in the world.   I feel he cares about me as his patient and a person.  I'm so thankful that he is so caring.  I've encountered doctors who see you merely as a means to  make  money.  He's not like that at all!  I'd like to share a glimpse of just who Dr. Tada is beyond just being a doctor.

I was experiencing sudden EXCRUCIATING tooth pain this past Monday (July 29, 2019) and of course it waited to start until around 8pm.  Now, I know you're thinking WHY am I telling you about my dental pain right?  We all know Dr. Tada is not a dentist.  No, he's not a dentist.... but he is an amazingly compassionate doctor.  Let me introduce the "real" Dr. Troy Tada to you.

You see, I had seen my dentist earlier that day and had x-rays of the teeth.  Now it's 8pm and I am in excruciating pain. (Of course this starts "after hours" right?  So, I call my dentist.  I wasn't  wanting  an emergency appointment right then.  I didn't want any painkillers.  I merely didn't know whether to take ibuprofen, acetaminophen, ice or a heating pad.  This was an excruciating pain and I was literally out of my mind and unable to think!  What would work best with my current pain management medication?  (He knows I'm in pain management).  Brace yourself..... my dentists response was a mere "there's nothing I can do for you" and he hung up.  He simply didn't care.  I was in unbearable pain and he did NOT care about me at all!  I immediately broke down and cried.  That really didn't help my tooth pain at all.

In the midst of my blubbering meltdown (with crocodile tears flowing.  I phoned Dr. Tada.  Within two minutes he had stopped my  blubbering, outlined a pain management plan for the next several days until I could get into a NEW dentist and he even suggested a dentist that provides emergency dental services for me to try the next morning.

A review should give readers true insight into a person.  I hope that my "glimpse" shows you what a caring person Dr. Tada of really is and just how important his patients are to him.

Btw..... thanks doc...I got into the dental clinic yesterday and those teeth.... are gone!!|Dr. Tada, is THE BEST, he walks you through the (injection) procedures, he's like an athletic sport coach or some sportscaster, while he's performing the injections to your injuried back, leg or whatever body part, he tells you exactly what's happening.  His words are encouraging he puts you at ease and your nervousness, and it's all done while he's injecting the numbing medicine and the medication itself to the joints and nerve areas. And, before the procedures he gives a clear picture with a model of the spine to keep you're informed and what to expect.|The doc and his nurse need to learn some bedside manners.  When you try to ask a question or explain something about your pain issues they just talk over you. They're somewhat robotic and just seem to want to get their paperwork done and get you out. The girls who work behind the desk are super nice tho.

column2: Hawaii Institute for Pain / HI Pain East Oahu
column3:
Specialized Pain Management in East Oahu

At Hawaii Institute for Pain, our mission is to give chronic pain sufferers the best possible outcome while providing them with the best possible experience. We believe in treating chronic pain using a multi-disciplinary approach, combining minimally invasive, state-of-the-art techniques with good, old-fashioned individualized care. Located in the Hale Pawa'a Building in Honolulu, our practice stands apart through our philosophy of finding the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. We do NOT believe in using opioid medications or other addictive substances to treat chronic, non-cancer pain as these work only temporarily and often cause more harm than good in the long run.

Our comprehensive pain management services include:

  • Minimally invasive injections and nerve blocks

  • Spinal cord stimulator procedures

  • Lumbar epidural steroid injections

  • Personalized treatment plans targeting pain generators

With convenient validated parking (first hour free) and a professional, friendly staff, we're committed to making your experience as comfortable as possible. Learn more about our approach to pain management at Hawaii Institute for Pain or call us at +1 808-206-5301 to schedule your consultation.
column11:
Our Mission at HI Pain is to give chronic pain sufferers the best possible outcome while providing them with the best possible experience.
Our Philosophy at HI Pain is to treat chronic pain using a multi-disciplinary approach, combining minimally invasive, state-of-the-art techniques with good, old-fashioned individualized care. We do NOT believe in using opioid medications (a.k.a. narcotics) or other addictive medications to treat chronic, non-cancer pain as these substances work only very transiently by masking the pain and do more harm than good in the long run. We believe in finding the root cause of the pain and focusing our minimally invasive treatments such as injections and nerve blocks on these so-called "pain generators."

Office is  very attractive and clean . Staff is very professional and friendly ! Dr. Wang really took his time explaining my spinal cord stimulator surgery procedure and how it can help alleviate my chronic pain . His confidence shines through ! He explains the different types of spinal cord stimulator brands available and how different ones worked differently for each individual. That was very informative ! . I feel quite comfortable in his care, and look forward to getting my trial implantation
scheduled soon ! Very grateful !
Keri Hayes|Short staffed but lady at front desk was nice. Parking garage is super close so that's convenient and parking's validated from docs office (Free first hour) but $1 every 30 min.
This was my first spinal injection ever. The doctor came in and literally just said hello, asked how I was and started to work on my neck.. I didn't think about this til after, but I should've gotten a verbal explanation of the sites (spinal areas), maybe confirming those were the correct areas he's injecting, or informed me the name of the medicine ect. He just injected the meds and dipped out without any after care instructions or how long I should wait. He just said "careful when getting off the table since u may be dizzy". I felt like the docs should put a little more care and especially for new patients.|I highly recommend D.O.Calvin Chen ..
He asks pertinent questions and is very engaged with the patient !
( I have 3 disc bulges in my lower back-causing debilitating pain and muscle spasms at times)
.. he explained, in detail,
what would happen with my procedure
.. he put me at ease with my upcoming " Lumbar Epidural Steroid Shot ..
.. I had canceled the first appointment, out of fear.
.. he was very understanding and through as well as empathetic..

column40:
Do not at all costs schedule with Dr Garcia, especially in the morning. I scheduled several appointments for morning procedures and each time he was irresponsibly late!  Not like 10-15 minutes but over an hour. His staff knows he is chronically late but still schedules him. If he is so irresponsible with getting to work in time please beware of his responsibility as a doctor when he's injecting you. Was he responsible enough to get the education he needed or just slid by with c's?  Not sure but he is highly irresponsible!  My appointment was for 8 and I'm still sitting here waiting|The nurse here is super helpful and caring. She answered my questions throughly and gave me the care I needed for my pain. Clinic is clean and staff is friendly. Nice seating area too.|Horrible! The address they had given sent me to the wrong place tried to contact three time finally I had for the correct address walk in explain myself and the girl that was at the front desk with a attitude sa8d your late and we will have to reschedule,  again I explain and showed the map that was sent, she dis not even look at me and said we can see you in June,  I told hernever mind and To cancel, I'll will talk to my provider to find some other pain provider.. Bad attitude and nasty communication|I appreciated how he listened. I wasn't just a patient with pain but a person with a name who had pain. As a chronic pain patient, I was thankful.

I've had nothing but great experiences as a chronic pain patient. It's frustrating explaining your pain and your inability to do simple tasks, but I'm always comforted in knowing I will be heard. This experience was no different. Keep doing what you guys do; best listen to your patients.|Dr. Chen is very detailed physician who takes his time on first visit to listen and understand what type of injury you have sustained and symptoms and pain that you're suffering from. He makes recommendations on what he thinks would help you best. After few visits I started to have changes in my progress with pain which was better with medications. I went to the point of pain from 10+ to 3-4 pain level. Meanwhile  Dr. Chen suggested a procedure to implant a device in my upper thigh area and researched for a physician who does the implant procedure in Hawaii for me. Medications helped me but body couldn't handle dosage. But! for me I think it takes a lot from a physician to recommend another physician to send you to who can help you have a better life dealing with constant pain. Thank you Dr. Chen for all your suggestions, recommendations in trying to get a better life dealing with pain. I am now at a point to get off medications and see if I can do that implant and awaiting approval from worker's comp. adjuster to approve procedure which takes the longest time at Firms insurance company. WISH ME LUCK WITH THE WAITING!!|I don't understand why anyone would leave a bad review for this doctor or any of his staff.  My experience was chronic pain that I didn't understand which was quickly diagnosed.  As for the injections, they always bring a measure of relief. The staff is very enjoyable to interact with.|The Doctors and majority of the staff here are great. I got treatment for chronic pain I have had for 10 years when everyone else I had seen told me it was in my head. HOWEVER I would like to report a staff member that treated me horribly. I believe he was a MA or some type of assistant, sadly didn't have a badge with his name on it. When he was prepping me for my procedure I asked for the IV sedation that is offered for my procedure (cervical facet multiple level injections), and the entire time he was bullying me, trying to get me not get sedation because he doesn't want to put in an IV. I have had the procedure before without any sedation and it was incredibly painful. He told me "I will try to put in the IV once and if I can't you will do the procedure without sedation." I could not believe what I was hearing, as a RN and as a patient, I was appalled by this health care "professional's" incompetence and disregard for proper patient treatment. Thankfully he was able to get the IV "on the first try" but he forgot to remove the tourniquet and apply pressure above the IV so blood was gushing everywhere, and he BLAMED IT ON ME. Saying "see it's messy" and rolled his eyes. If you are reading this Hawaii Institute of Pain, please make sure your staff is able to perform the duties in their job discription and stop gaslighting your patients.|Honestly it's been a long time since I've seen Dr Garcia but I never left a review and I think he deserves one. My daughter, at only 9 years old at the time suffered from a chronic pain condition that was left undiagnosed for months. He was the doctor that literally diagnosed what she had and was so informative about it. I remember me and my daughter crying when we realized this may never go away...6 years later, she still suffers and now is spreading... BUT... I remember Dr Garcia warned this could happen and we've been prepared all these years thanks to him. I wish we could go back to him to manage her pain now however we no longer live in Hawaii. He put our minds at ease finally getting a diagnosis and helping her cope with the pain for a long time until the next flare up and spreading but I'm so grateful for all he has done for me and my daughter. His compassion and help was enough and wish all pain management doctors could be like him. I honestly don't care how rude anyone else is in that office if at all. He is a great doctor and deserves to be recognized as that. We are as prepared as we can be for this next level. Wish he could treat her now! CRPS WARRIOR for Life!!! Thank you for all your help Dr Garcia.

Specialized Pain Management in Kealakekua, Hawaii

At Hawaii Pain Medicine, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for residents and visitors on the Big Island. Located at 81-948 Waenaoihana Loop #120 in Kealakekua, our practice is led by experienced physicians who specialize in both interventional procedures and medication management approaches. We take pride in our personalized treatment plans that address various pain conditions including:

  • Neck and back pain

  • Nerve pain and neuropathy

  • Joint and musculoskeletal pain

  • Chronic pain conditions

Our approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Through careful evaluation and advanced diagnostic techniques, we develop targeted treatment strategies that may include minimally invasive procedures, medication management, or a combination of therapies. Many of our patients experience significant relief after their first visit, allowing them to return to daily activities with improved function and quality of life. Contact us at Hawaii Pain Medicine or call +1 808-322-6692 to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward effective pain relief.

I was having severe leg and neck nerve pain while in Kona for the winter.  My assumption was I would need epidural injections like I have done before.

While Dr Nichols was certainly competent to do the procedure, he said "not so fast"

He prescribed a low dose of Lyrica to make sure I tolerated it.  It was effective and he prescribed a higher dose.  Within 2 weeks leg, neck and shoulder pain were completely gone.

No injections, just pain insight.|Dr Nichols totally fixed my neck severe nerve pain the very first injection after suffering for 6 horrible unsleepable nights & getting 3 injections from a diff doctor. He subsequently was very supportive to a painful bladder disease with pain medication to keep me sane. His staff is so helpful & competent as well. Thank you all.|Dr. Nichols is very kind and professional.  After reviewing my MRI he was able to pinpoint where the issue was and preformed a procedure that was very effective at reducing the pain that I had been living with for years.  I could not be more happy with his service.  The staff there are extremely kind and professional as well. It is obvious that Dr. Nichols and his staff truly care about their patients well-being. Herd medicine (where they just wanna get you in and out) is something that does not take place in his office.|He saved me. After 20 + years of bad back pain 8.5 everyday. He was able to pinpoint the problem. I was able to reduce my pain level and am able to be a productive Vet again

Thanks Dr|Lisa, the woman who answers the phone is extremely rude and unprofessional every time I call. It's been 4 weeks since their office received my referral from my PCP and still don't have an appointment. I've been proactively calling multiple times weekly and keep getting the same response "the Dr is very busy but your case is under review". The only reason I haven't asked my Dr to send my referral elsewhere is because I want to tell the Dr how bad his employee is because he'll never get the feedback if I don't tell him face to face|The best doctor I ever had. He cured my back pain and gave me a new lease on life! I highly recommend him.|Extremely helpful staff. Doctor was incredible. I cannot say enough good about these guys. column2: Hawaii Institute for Pain / HI Pain Maui
column3:
At Hawaii Institute for Pain, we are dedicated to providing relief to those suffering from chronic pain through our comprehensive, multi-disciplinary approach.

Our Specialized Pain Management Solutions

We believe in addressing the root cause of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Our team utilizes state-of-the-art, minimally invasive techniques combined with personalized care to deliver the best possible outcomes for our patients. We proudly offer:

  • Minimally invasive injections targeting specific pain generators

  • Nerve blocks for effective pain relief

  • Botox injections for certain pain conditions

  • Ablation procedures for long-term pain management

  • Facet joint injections for spinal pain

What sets us apart is our commitment to non-opioid pain management. We do NOT rely on narcotics or other addictive medications to treat chronic, non-cancer pain, as these substances only temporarily mask symptoms while potentially causing more harm than good. Instead, we focus on identifying and treating the underlying causes of your pain. Located in Kahului, our facility is equipped to provide individualized care that addresses your specific needs. Learn more about our approach to pain management by visiting our website at Hawaii Institute for Pain or call us at +1 808-206-5301 to schedule your consultation.
column11:
Our Mission at HI Pain is to give chronic pain sufferers the best possible outcome while providing them with the best possible experience.
Our Philosophy at HI Pain is to treat chronic pain using a multi-disciplinary approach, combining minimally invasive, state-of-the-art techniques with good, old-fashioned individualized care. We do NOT believe in using opioid medications (a.k.a. narcotics) or other addictive medications to treat chronic, non-cancer pain as these substances work only very transiently by masking the pain and do more harm than good in the long run. We believe in finding the root cause of the pain and focusing our minimally invasive treatments such as injections and nerve blocks on these so-called "pain generators."

column40: I keep getting disappointed by the service, today, July 11 a prescription was called into Longs drug store in Kihei and they forgot to write the number of pills to be given, I got the message while I was still in Kahului so I went back to the office at about  10:30  and by chance I saw Dr: Garcia step out and I explained to him the situation, he said he would take care of it.  While I waited for Dr: Garcia to come back out I asked the assistant if I should wait for his answer, she said it was taken care and if not I would get a call.  When I arrived at Longs they informed that the prescription was not fixed and if they wrote the prescription correctly and sent it in they would filled it, I proceded to call the office and explained again that they just had to send a new script, they promised that they would do it.  I called back 4 times with the same message, the 4th time she said that they were very busy and would take care of it at the end of the day, it never happened and as a result I have to spend another night with nerve pain which could possibly have been avoided if they were responsible to their patient, me!|Natasha Murray is an excellent clinical operator. The two woman who greet and help with scheduling and health tasks in getting the patients visit . I feel they work well as a team with Natasha leading the clinics appointments. I have had two surgeries this year and was very glad to have the support this group of staff in my quest to heal and be able to live my life as a Older adult with a team of people working to make that a reality.|This place should be closed down.  I had an appointment for a procedure written on a card they gave me in office.  I waited a month for the procedure and endured the pain. I went to office on the appointed day and they said no one was available.  After looking further she said "oh, your appointment in in Ohau.  Are you kidding me?  The girls in the front office are rude and uncaring and you never get a phone call returned.  Stay away from this place.  I have requested my neurosurgeon for a referral to someome place more competent and professional.|They are criminals don't go there I had a horrible experience there and the doctor that did it conveniently left.|The Hawaii Pain Institute on Maui is the best! Everyone from the folks at reception to Dr. Henson and in between. Especially Ms. Natasha! Not only has she taken great care of my health, but she is also lovely to speak with at every visit. It's rare to find a nurse practitioner that combines such personal touches and care for a patient. She never rushes your appointment and always listens closely to your concerns while explaining the options for your care. I highly recommend becoming her patient!!|As I get older I have more Drs but none more treasured and appreciated than Dr Murray. Chronic pain needs a kind of working relationship with a dr. that is hard to forge and it's easy to forget the human amidst the the pain. Dr Murray treats the whole patient and really listens. The Maui staff is so exceptional... from making appointments to helping with med / insurance questions. I truly am grateful for the entire staff and my quality of life is so much better because of them. I highly recommend them!|I was poked so many times I just got bills and no relief. I was told they are just supposed to be the bandaid people. I have had this pain since 2018 and with every procedure they said they were eliminating what it could be. Then they sent me back to who referred me. It's unbelievable the painful procedures I went through and for nothing just bills. They had no one on staff to speak with about the bills. They said their billing department was in the Philippines so I would just have to keep calling. The made me pay a co pay for a procedure and didn't do it but didn't refund any of it. Just sad. I also was prescribed nerve pain medication that I at the time was already on for my sciatica but my pain is not nerve pain I was seeing them for. So disappointed.|Shortly after moving to Maui, my knee became quite painful due to arthritis. I contacted Hawaii Institute for Pain and made an appointment. When I arrived at the office, the staff was incredibly friendly and professional from the front desk to the fellow taking my vitals. Dr. Henson examined my knee, reviewed my history, and gave me several options. We discussed them thoroughly and I found her to be very patient and a great listener! We decided a cortisone injection would be the best way to treat my pain. She performed this procedure in the office with the help of a very friendly x-ray technician. Since I previously had this procedure elsewhere, I was quite apprehensive about the pain I would experience. Thanks to Dr. Henson, I never felt a thing!! I recommend this place 100%!! They really helped my pain.

column40:
So happy I went to Dr Maya! I have been remodeling my house for the last year and have been having neck pain, but one day I woke up and I was in level 10 pain. Not knowing what to do, I went to the immediate care. Unfortunately, the immediate care did nothing for me but recommend I go see a specialist. My pain level was at a 10 literally laying on the ground shaking. I could not sit, I could not walk ,I could not sleep, I could not lay down without being at a level 10 pain. Not knowing what to do, I went to the emergency room. The emergency room recommended I see a specialist And loaded me up on pain medication and sent me home. I reached out to multiple doctors on island and everybody told me, it would be a minimum of two weeks before they could see me. When I called Malama Pain, Spine and Joint Medicine , they took the time to actually listen to me and even went out of their way to move some of their nonemergency clients around to get me in ASAP.  Dr. Maya  was able to see me and took the time to really figure out what was going on and find out that I have a pinched nerve . Not only was she able to put me on the right medication to help dissipate the pain and help release the nerve, she also got me in physical therapy to help with my recovery as well. I don't have medical benefits and I just pay out-of-pocket. Their prices are beyond fair and I feel half the price of anybody else on the island. Dr Maya is great!She is  professional and most importantly was able to actually figure out what was going on with with me and figure out the proper treatment plan to fix me.|I am delighted to share my exceptional experience with Dr. Maya. From the moment I walked into the clinic, I was greeted by a warm and friendly staff who made me feel comfortable and at ease.
Dr. Maya is not only highly knowledgeable and skilled in her field but also possesses a genuine compassion for her patients. She took the time to listen attentively to my concerns, thoroughly examined my condition, and explained the diagnosis and treatment options in a clear and understandable manner. Her ability to communicate complex medical information in a way that is easily comprehensible is truly commendable.
She goes above and beyond to ensure my comfort and satisfaction every time I see her. She checked in on my progress, making sure that the treatment plan was effective. I am seeing great results and know that my pain is being managed by a wonderful doctor!|Dr. Maya and her staff run an extremely kind, accommodating, and professional practice. Making a decision about who to trust with your health care and quality of life can be difficult. I couldn't be more happy with my experience at Malama Pain. Dr. Maya is a focused listener, an effective communicator, a skilled practitioner and a caring person. I felt like I received very detailed information about my issue and treatment options, but was also empowered to choose my path toward recovery. I strongly recommend trusting her as a care provider.|I just have no words for how amazing this clinic is. Dr. W absolutely saved me. She fought for me to get an MRI when I needed it. Then I was able to have surgery. She doesn't just write you a script for pain medication, she digs down and figures out the problem. I'll never go anywhere else for pain.|I am so grateful for this ohana based team they were welcoming from the moment I walked in the door. Dr. M has been very patient and supportive of my pain plan. She has spent a generous amount of time getting to know me and personally explaining procedures. She was extremely empathetic and understanding of my situation. She was willing to work with me and collaborate on my healing process. I am so incredibly grateful for a team that was willing to work with me and seeing me as an individual person.|Andres and Maya are both very caring, responsive and most importantly embody the Aloha spirit. Highly recommend them for any of your medical needs!

column40:
Gave me quality of life! I have multiple chronic pain conditions. Dr. Wang and his team took a whole-person approach and have completely changed my life in a matter of months! Dr. Loos is a terrific psychologist, Mary Gutierrez RN is one of the best nurse practitioners and Mike their physical therapist gave me my life back!|EXCELLENT EXCELLENT EXCELLENT. The medical world of managing pain  changes constantly.  Theres no right or wrong in this field of medicine, its either a hit or miss; and the goal is to prevent harm. Dr Wangs job is to make sure the patient doesnt develop worse problems as a result of the treatment, so sometimes things get worse before they get better; AND he has to address the emotional aspect of the patients panick into the formula of managing pain.  Dr Wang keeps abreast of what has proven to work..I appreciate his support and guidance. Its on me to help myself, and I know his treatment is not THE answer, but it helps me buy time to manage my pain better. Soo thankful his help is an option!! Looking forwards to whatever can help.. good or bad..(The heating pad just isnt cutting it).. lol|I spoke with his office and Dr.Wang, before I moved to Hawaii to make sure that 1 he would take me and 2 have a problem with my meds I was on. Didn't seem to be a problem at tat time, BUT AS SOON AS I moved to the big Island, I knew I was 2 fly over. No problem with that, so my first official appointment  Dr.Wang Changed everything and said if I didn't like it find someone else. Knowing it wasnt that easy to do since I have a pain pump that needed to be filled occasionally.  I have had 6 visits to fill pump,And asked if I could get another pain dr. On the big Island to help control the pain.. he said no.and still in pain since he wanted different  meds in it.. guess who who profited from that..NOT ME.. . Even know everything was good the way it was..
Even took away other pain meds since I wasn't on that island.. now I'm here, NO WAY TO MOVE BACK, AND HURTING... NO REASON 4 THAT.. WHEN THINGS WHERE GOOD ,why change it when it was working..!! THE ONLY REASON I HAVE TO GO BACK IS BECAUSE  I NEED MY PUMP FILLED..
GOD HELP ME !!|The worst.  Don't waste your time.  I went there multiple times and yet they would not ever give me any prescriptions at all.  They only want to insert an electronic device under my skin.  This is not acceptable.  Now they have just sent me a bill for $75 which I will not pay, ever.  Now that I've got this bill, I am contacting my insurance carrier to withhold payment.  This company will not give you pain medication.  DON'T GO HERE!  They need to be put out of business.|I have been a patient for 10 years. I'm a cancer survivor. I'm blessed to have a good quality of medical care professionals that care about me as an individual.|I've been a patient with Dr. Jeffrey Wang for over 2 years now.
I've been happy with my care.||

Great establishment.|He's the best I've been too for ablations and epidural injections. He communicates well helps me understand and involves me in what's the best of options. Never had a bad experience. Staff is all very friendly and efficient. They are very open about all your options and quick to send you out to other facilities if necessary|HORRIBLE, HORRIBLE  treatment by Damien T. The receptionist and the nurse or staff prior to meeting this egotistical man was amazing but he refused me service because me and my husband were simply asking questions. He was ok at the start and then I could hear him huffing under his breath as we were talking. Anyone who asks questions should not go here because he instantly gets defensive and refuses to take you like he is offended by questions!! Will never return and actually was happy to leave because we deserve better treatment from a true professional who doesn't get easily hurt!!|Dr. Tavares is the 3rd pain management specialist I've been too. He's also the 1st doctor that has actually tried everything to help me get my pain under control, especially since I'm so young and started seeing him as a teen, to where I can function on a normal daily basis, and also not be completely drugged up to where I can't function like a normal human being.

My previous pain management clinic would triple book appointments so I'd be there waiting for at least an hour after my scheduled appointment to be seen, and they would prescribe me a 7 day supply telling me to make it last 30 days, it was horrible. Even one time during a procedure when I was getting injections into the nerves in my spinal cord, I told the doctor I could feel it, and he told me I was lying. He proceeded with the procedure until I started screaming from pain, and finally numbed me more.

I am so thankful for him, and his team! He's truly an amazing, compassionate doctor. I recommend him to everyone I know looking for a pain management clinic! He's honestly the only reason I'm staying with the insurance I am on because I don't want to lose him as my doctor. Thank you so much Dr. Tavares for all you, and your clinic have done for me and are continuing to do for me!|I'm a disabled combat veteran and have been to a number of clinics over the last decade on the mainland as well as Oahu. This clinic is one of the worst I've been referred to. Dr. Tavares is unprofessional, condescending and makes assumptions based on non factual information. He is young and inexperienced, which shows mainly through his biased opinion based philosophy instead of actual medical practice. Hopefully he will get better as time goes on so his patients do not suffer. He allows other people into the room without asking for permission from the patient unconcerned with patient privacy. Communication is terrible between their clinic and the VA. I was told after every visit notes were sent, for the past 5 months nothing was received. This may be to laziness, too many patients or lack of effort. I finally requested paper copies to hand deliver. I do not recommend. Office is located in the St. Francis medical building where parking can be troublesome at times and there is no vaildation. If you have a chance to go elsewhere I suggest it. Appointments never start on time. Search other reviews and his lower rated areas will reflect this review.  Added a screenshot of other WebMD ratings as well.|I have been seeing Dr Traverse and absolutely love him. He has helped me alot and every experience I have had has been wonderful. Everyone here is so genuine and takes the time to listen and address your needs.  Happy to go here.|Love this company especially Dr Damian Smith, he' nice, kind & awesome.  He helped me with my bulging disc & with my lower back pain & my aching hip.  I highly recommend him!!!|I am a nurse and work long hours.  We do a lot of pushing, pulling, carrying, twisting and standing in a 12 hour period.  I've been going to see Dr. J and the team at HCPRC for about a year now.  I am grateful for the care they have provided me.  The initial evaluation was with an xray and then manual manipulation of my back and surrounding areas.  The TENS type unit they use to help with my back pain and the hour long massage working all the major muscle and attachment parts really helped with my back pain.  The pain went from a 8-7/10 down to a 2-3/10.  Now, I incorporate both the massage and manual manipulation with my visits and this has really helped keep my body posture and endurance for those long 12 hour shifts.  Mahalo nui loa to the front desk staff and the treatment team for all you have done.|They truly live up to their name.

The front desk always picks up the phone. They have been very kind and flexible, especially if you need to reschedule.

The nurses are passionate and friendly; they remember you and each conversation and interaction, even if it is short.

column40: I would absolutely recommend this place to anyone I know. I had really bad back pain for a long time, I finally decided to see someone and a friend of mine sent me to Kevin. I'm one of those people who ask why or what's that a lot, and without skipping a beat he answers me and in a way that's easily understood. To add to it he's very skilled in different things, so yesterday I got cupping done and I had no clue what that was. As for the place, there are stairs, the waiting room is cute, the rooms are super clean and well decorated (I'm a housekeeper btw so I notice those small things), restrooms are clean and easy to get to, and the people are incredibly nice.|Kevin is an amazing body work specialist! I had the best massage of my life during a 90 minute session. The deep tissue and mobility work on my hip reduced my pain significantly and increased my range of motion by almost 50% and that was after just one session! I highly recommend visiting the Pain Relief Center if you are in pain or just want to get the best massage you have ever had. My first session with Kevin left me with tears of relief. I have never felt so in tune with my body before. He is not only an amazing massage therapist, but a knowledgeable holistic healer as well. The owner, Kevin, is my massage therapist and truly one of the best I've ever had. As a chiropractor, I'm very picky when it comes to who is taking care of me. Kevin has such a thorough understanding of the human anatomy to where you don't just feel better getting a massage, but your body heals better as well! column2: Hawaii Pain & Spine: Jonathan Carlson, MD
column3:
At Hawaii Pain & Spine, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of

Dr. Jonathan Carlson, MD

. As both a board-certified anesthesiologist and pain management physician, Dr. Carlson brings specialized expertise to treating complex pain conditions. We take a thorough, personalized approach to each patient's care, offering advanced diagnostic evaluations and innovative treatment options to address chronic pain at its source.

Our comprehensive services include:

  • Spinal interventional procedures

  • DRG implants for complex regional pain syndrome

  • ViaDisc stem cell injections

  • Customized pain management plans

  • Non-surgical treatment alternatives

Located in Kailua at 40 Aulike St, Suite 411, our practice combines cutting-edge techniques with compassionate care. We understand the debilitating impact chronic pain can have on your quality of life, which is why we're committed to developing effective treatment strategies that help restore function and reduce suffering. Visit Hawaii Pain & Spine or call us at +1 808-452-1379 to schedule a consultation and take the first step toward reclaiming your active lifestyle.
column38: Falisha H|Dragos Oprescu|Jim Kennedy|Andy Singer|Erik Lundgren|John Roberts|S R|Sara Uchihara
column40:
Dr. Carlson CHANGED MY LIFE!!!
I sought him out for severe, debilitating back pain, increasing in severity over time, but not precipitated by injury; therefore, difficult to diagnose. Even more difficult to treat. I tried to address it several times in the past, to no avail. Dr. Carlson was highly recommended by my PT, so after years of coping, I decided to give it a go.

From day one, Dr. Carlson listened patiently to my concerns & addressed them promptly with a treatment plan of attack! His communication style is abrupt, a straight shooter, which I appreciate! He doesn't coddle his patients; he tells you like it is, describes realistic options & recommendations moving forward, and implements the plan efficiently. Dr. Carlson was very skilled AND compassionate, empathizing with my pain, nailing the course of treatment choice, & implementing treatment flawlessly!

Also, I can't imagine how difficult it must be to have so much patience w/ a clientele in constant pain because WE ARE A GRUMPY LOT! I imagine it is stressful! But respect breeds respect. I didn't take my pain out on Dr. Carlson or his staff, & they were awesome in turn! His staff have always been courteous and professional, even tho they are abused by grumpy patients all day & busy as all hell! They even worked hard to fit me in last minute before a trip, harassing my insurance company for an approval, just so I would not have to travel with pain!

When visiting the office there was a reasonable amount of wait time, usually about 20 - 30 mins (sometimes less), just like most health care providers on island; so I plan for it. Healthcare providers must schedule according to the standard insurance-mandated 10-20 min slots, but some patients need more time than that. When a doctor is running late, I take that to mean he cares enough about his patients to spend extra time with them when they need it. Once the wait was a bit longer. I was told Dr. Carlson was working in a delicate procedure requiring more time than is typical, & would be with me as soon as he could. I appreciated that (1) he took his time to do that other procedure properly, not allowing himself to be rushed and possibly make a mistake, and (2) had I been the other patient, I would not have been abandoned for the next appointment.

It did take a couple months to get my insurance company to push the procedure approvals thru but it was well worth the wait! The diagnostic txs were effective, we were able to implement a lasting treatment, and I am almost pain free for the first time in YEARS!

I also want to add, I am "anesthesia resistant;" procedure anesthesia is less effective on me (even at the dentist!). During my first procedure, I could feel EVERYTHING! Dr. Carlson wasn't able to increase my dosage because my O2 kept dropping. He gave me the option to cease the procedure, but I chose to see it thru. Some ppl do it without any anesthesia!
To say it hurt would be a gross understatement! And my coping mechanism: to curse...LOUDLY. LOL! Although I'm sure it was entertaining, I would like to apologize to anyone who was in the offices & waiting room. And I thank Dr. Carlson and his staff for being patient with my "sailors mouth," as they say. I was embarrassed that I kept uncontrollably shouting explicits (the "F" word being my absolute favorite :o)! Granted, I was shouting bad words to the wind, not disrespectfully at a person, but still! Dr. Carlson helped alleviate my humiliation by quoting positive research on cussing. His kind words made me not just feel better & less embarrassed, but he made me feel like an exceptional human being because of it. And he worked with me to mediate my resistance during the second procedure so I didn't feel it as much! Although that doesn't mean I didn't cuss. A LOT! Haha :-P

Thank you Dr. Carlson and staff for your respectful service and effective treatment!
Thank you Dr. Carlson for your compassion, patience, and especially your expertise! Your treatment plan was spot on and I can actually live life again! I cannot express how grateful I am! I highly recommend!|I'm a new patient of Dr. Carlson.  I've had several visits and had two procedures done already.  My experience so far at Dr Carlson's cabinet has been great, in spite of my presenting medical condition. The staff has been very pleasant, professional and courteous, and Dr. Carlson seems very knowledgeable and genuine in providing the best medical treatment. My questions were always answered.  The waiting time is no more or less than other doctors' waiting rooms.  For me, growing up in a country where waiting for a doctor could take the whole day and then only some got to see the doctor, I don't mind waiting. I'm grateful that Dr. Carson even accepted a new patient. Wishing everyone at Hawaii Pain & Spine a Blessed New Year!|I have my life back. After spinal fusion surgery I got CRPS. After 16 months of extreme pain and little to no relief from any treatments, I was referred to Dr Carlson at  Hawaii Pain & Spine. Dr. Carlson was accepting, compassionate, concerned, thorough and determined to set a plan that ultimately led to a DRG implant.
It's been 4 months since the implant and I no longer need a walker or a cane to go out and about and will soon be going International for my 30th anniversary.  I have a nearly completely pain free life now thanks to Dr. Carlson and the staff at Hawaii Pain & Spine.

Mahalo Nui Loa

Gina K|Dr Carlson is the most unprofessional Dr I've ever dealt with.
Saw this coming when last year I had to walk out after my first appointment after waiting for over an hour and a half in a room and not told of any delay.
Subsequent appointments were usually at least 20 minutes if not 30 to 45 minutes late before seeing him .
At least appointments with his practitioner nurse were mostly on time and she is terrific.
Care quality by the staff is good but he  is just very mechanical and arrogant-and that shows in his attitude. More an atmosphere of treatment factory than health care.
Had a follow-up telemedicine visit scheduled for today at 8 o'clock --at 7:50. I got a call from his staff reminding me to be ready to go at 8 and they would call when he got in and was ready.  At 8:30 I still have not heard from him or his staff.
I happened to be in the building for another appointment at 9 o'clock so I asked the staff if I could just walk down there and do it in person to which they said yes.
Walked down, waited ~10 minutes.  He showed up acting very agitated, and started lecturing me about making an exception for seeing me in person when it was supposed to be a telemedicine visit.
I offered that my telemedicine appointment was over 30 minutes ago and if it had been on time we would've been able  to telemedicine but I have to go to 9 o'clock appointment across the way. He blew up and in a furious rage said "I'm not dealing with this. " You're no longer patient of mine --get out of here.  As I picked up my stuff and started to leave, he was down the hall and yelled for me to leave or he was calling the police. As I was leaving he raged about it being his private practice and I was no longer a patient.

If you have time to burn, and like arrogant, loud voice, yelling doctors,  with average treatment this is the place for you

It is a common staff joke there that you will never be seen on time and at best expect him to be 20 minutes late if not longer. There are plenty of other options here on island stay away from this one.|Dr. Carlson saved my life. I'm in my 40s a general contractor and big wave surfer. Over the past few decades I've been plagued with back pain due to the nature of my lifestyle. I have seen multiple doctors, chiropractors, acupuncture, massage, shiatsu and several "experts" to try and help with little to no lasting affect. In late 2020 I had a bad wipeout and did myself in. I was in bed for months I needed help just going to the bathroom my wife said that's it you got to see a specialist so I reluctantly went and saw Dr. Carlson thinking to myself it's just a waste of time I've already seen so many others, tried everything known to man. Dr. Carlson examined me for the next month with several appointments,  he was extremely thorough and was able to really pin point what was causing all this pain. He did the ViaDisc stem cell injections above and below in the L4 area and months later I was feeling really good.  It has now been 9 months since the ViaDisc injections and I have no pain in my lower back, after 2 decades of chronic back pain followed with crippling pain in the end I now have ZERO lower back pain.|Dr. Carlson is a very thorough physician and surgeon.  I am now free of the back pain I suffered.  His manner and demeanor are exceptionally  professional as well as empathetic. I would reccomend him without hesitation.|So grateful to have Dr Carlson perform the DRG stimulator on my wife. He's knowledgeable, helpful, insightful, and straightforward. Post surgery scars/complications are virtually non existent. He explained the procedure, what to expect, and what to do post op, and it's been great. A true patient oriented professional. If ever we need any other pain advice/surgery, Dr Carlson is our go to. Mahalo Dr Carlson and Hawai'i Pain and Spine!|Parking in municipal lot can be tricky depending on time of day.  I ended up parking on the street.  Took my elderly parents...the building had an incorrect room number as the office moved to another floor two weeks earlier.  Dad's appointment was for 11am, was asked to come in 1/2 hour earlier to fill out paperwork.  There was another couple filling out paperwork at the same time as us, they were taken in a few minutes after turning in their paperwork.  We were taken to room at 11:30am, vitals taken & was told doctor would be in shortly.  My watch said 12:10pm & a little after doctor showed up. Pleasant to us, got right to the point, I asked a question he answered then added to check his website for more information???  Doctor advised he would set up a test procedure, the front office would give us a folder,  thanked us and left, did not ask if we had any questions...10 minutes of his time vs. waiting 1 hour & 10 minutes.   No reason from him, assistant or office staff as to the delay.  When we left no one in waiting room.  I guess they were closed for lunch. Well will see how my dad's procedure & followup goes.

column40:
I was vacationing here with my wife and we both came down with Covid and Dr. Yang was totally awesome. He saw us right away and got our prescriptions. Super nice awesome clinic highly recommend this man he received his medical degree from John Hopkins. Update: I was able to get my wife's prescription filled easily at the pharmacy that Dr. Yang's nurse suggested, however, when I went there the pharmacy tech wouldn't fill it claiming Dr. Yang wasn't in their network, I was too fatigued to argue with her, and ended up going to another pharmacy. When the next pharmacy was having issues with the coupon Dr. Yang was able to procure for me, (Paxlovid is around $1,500 since I was out of network in Hawaii) Dr. Yang texted me and helped get the issue resolved with the pharmacy. As a retired lab tech, I've dealt with Dr.s for years, and this was the first time I've ever had a Dr. go above and beyond to make sure I was taken care of, so if I could give more than 5 Stars, he and Dianna, his nurse would get them. I'm back in the mainland now, and the wife and I have finished our rounds of Paxlovid and feel great, so thanks again Dr. Yang and Dianna for taking such great care of us, you guys ROCK!!|I cannot be more grateful to Dr. Yang and his kind and compassionate nurse for their care and help. Me and my husband both had health issues, which were addressed with so much professionalism and care.  I appreciate doctor's approach because he spent lot of time with us explaining the problem and the following steps for treatment. And honestly, I need to confess, I never met a doctor who could spend so much time with me as a patient without any rush.. Each time before , when we went to urgent care, we had to wait for hours in the waiting room. But this place is absolutely amazing...Knowledgeable,  extremely professional and very caring doctor and nurse..Can't be more thankful!!!
Oh, and the tea, coffee fruit tea.. Thank you, dear nurse, the tea was amazing. I think, they sell this tea, please get it and try. It has lot of benefits for your health..|I am deeply grateful for the genuine care and attention that both Dr. Yang and Diana have shown me. Meeting them while I was in Hawaii was truly a blessing. I have never encountered anyone who demonstrated such sincere concern and attentiveness beyond what was necessary. During a time when I was feeling extremely fatigued, nauseous, and having abdominal/lower back pain, they both went above and beyond to offer their support.

Dr. Yang, with his expert knowledge and compassionate approach, made me feel heard and understood every step of the way. He took the time to explain my condition thoroughly, addressing all my questions and concerns. His attentiveness and calm demeanor provided not only physical relief but also emotional reassurance during a challenging time.

Diana, as a practitioner manager, was just as remarkable. Her organizational skills and genuine compassion were evident in every interaction. She was incredibly patient, ensuring that all of my needs were met in a timely and efficient manner. Diana took the extra effort to coordinate and keep me informed, all while managing a busy schedule. She truly excels in making her patients feel like they are her top priority, and her dedication to ensuring that I received the best care was evident in everything she did.

Both of them exemplify what it means to be not just a doctor or a healthcare professional, but a caring and committed individual who truly wants the best for their patients. I've never met anyone more dedicated to going the extra mile, and I am incredibly appreciative of the exceptional care they provided. Without a doubt, Dr. Yang and Diana are the best in their respective fields, and I am fortunate to have crossed paths with them|Dr Yang is Amazing. My husband got an allergic food reaction while on vacation. Dr Yang walked us through the condition my husband was experiencing and its progressive stages. He also made us aware of what medications and vaccines he was giving to my husband as a part of treatment. After a week we received a detailed medical report with his handwritten notes which helped us a-lot for insurance claim. He is literally the best doctor we have came across who answered all of our questions in detail. This was our first time experiencing allergic food reaction but Dr Yang's care made the navigation easy. Thank you Dr Yang!|Dr. Yang at Aloha Urgent Care provided exceptional care for my son, who was diagnosed with Type A flu. Her swift response and thorough attention to detail ensured my son received the appropriate treatment promptly, minimizing any complications. Dr. Yang demonstrated both professionalism and compassion, making us feel confident and supported during a stressful time. Her ability to explain the condition and treatment plan in a clear yet comprehensive manner was greatly appreciated. We are deeply grateful for her expertise and dedication to patient care.|Dr. Yang is absolutely amazing! My husband was dealing with a painful ear infection while we were on vacation, and Dr. Yang's care made all the difference. He was incredibly professional, attentive, and thorough. We never felt rushed--Dr. Yang took his time to assess the situation and explain everything to us. Thanks to his expert treatment, my husband's pain was gone within just a couple of hours. We are so grateful for the excellent care he received and highly recommend Dr. Yang to anyone in need of a skilled and compassionate doctor!|I traveled to Waikiki for work but was feeling extremely sick with what seemed like a bad cold at first. I took over the counter medicine but was not getting better after 3-4 days. I started having body aches and chills so I decided to call this clinic and they were able to book an appointment to see me within an hour or so. Their lobby has an open floor concept with soothing music playing in the background and a gentle water fountain which helped relax me.  The assistant or nurse Diana was so kind on the phone and in person and answered any questions I had. She even made me a nice hot tea full antioxidants. Dr. Yang was very kind, knowledgeable and explained my symptoms and treatment options with care and honesty. Turns out I was running a fever and had Type B Flu. He prescribed an antiviral medication for me and even gave me some zinc pills complimentary to support my immune system. I started to feel better after 24 hours. Thank you so much for your care, compassion and professionalism!|Rachel from the front desk was very communicative and transparent about the wait time. column3:
Suffering from knee pain or joint injuries? At Regenerative Medicine & Rehabilitation of Hawaii, we believe that personalized care is the key to achieving optimal health and performance without surgery or addictive painkillers. Dr. Dwight Lin specializes in dose-adjusted, customized cell therapy and PRP injections that harness your body's natural healing abilities. Unlike traditional pain clinics that merely block pain signals, we focus on alternative treatment options using platelets and cells from your own body to promote actual healing and recovery.

Our Specialized Services Include:

  • PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) Therapy

  • BMAC (Bone Marrow Aspirate Concentrate) containing your own stem cells

  • Ultrasound-guided injections for precise treatment

  • Non-surgical treatments for knee arthritis & meniscus injuries

  • Shoulder and rotator cuff rehabilitation

  • Low back pain management

  • Disc injury and sciatica treatment

Located in the heart of Honolulu at 1441 Kapiolani Blvd #1525, we're committed to helping you get back to doing the things you love faster and without surgery. Visit Regenerative Medicine & Rehabilitation of Hawaii or call us at +1 808-528-5500 to discover how our holistic, sports medicine approach can address your pain and mobility concerns.
