column40:
I'd like to see Dr. Lin for multiple tendon tears in both shoulders that are causing significant pain. Traditional therapies haven't helped, and I believe his PRP treatment, especially with ultrasound-guided injections, could really benefit me. However, I was told by his staff that I need current MRIs for each area before I can even schedule an appointment. The issue is that my HMO won't approve the MRIs, making it impossible for me to proceed.

I'm eager to get the MRIs and see Dr. Lin, but I'm stuck without the insurance company's approval. Is there any advice or assistance you can provide to help move this forward?|I've had 3 visits now with Doctor Dwight Lin. I've had MRI's showing tares in both shoulders and most recently looking over knee xrays. His office and procedures are state of the art with regard to how to maintain our bodies with strength and mobility long term as an athlete and Hair Salon owner and stylist.
I am currently feeling ok with my PT and my yoga to strengthen my body. I recommend getting his opinion, seeing this doctor.
Creating this relationship I know moving forward I will be in good hands.
You will be greeted by Jo in reception and welcomed kindly into his office.|How special that my wife, Marilyn was able to be treated by Dr. Dwight Lin, MD.  He was referred by our trainer of the past fifteen years and he said Dr. Lin was the person to treat her back situation.  Before seeing Dr. Lin she was an 8 or 9 out of a 10. She could hardly walk and within hours after her procedure she was free of pain. The next day there was also no discomfort.  He was so professional and clear with the steps he was taking to correct her situation.  We highly recommend Dr. Lin to the people of Hawaii.  Outstanding Dr. Lin!  We thank you, Marilyn and Jed|I had a wonderful experience at RMR Honolulu. I appreciate the very warm and friendly staff, I instantly felt comfortable knowing I'll be in great care. With my chaotic schedule, I value the follow up text messages and email reminders.
Dr. Dwight Lin was very helpful and took his time explaining his concerns and options for my situation. Before, during and after my PRP procedure Dr. Lin ensured my comfort and eased any nervousness I had.
I highly recommend Dr. Lin at RMR Honolulu for anyone, friends, family, loved ones who are looking for a non-surgical solution for pain, arthritis and orthopedic injuries.|I was referred to Dr. Lin by my Internist.  I have moderate arthritis in my left knee.  I had heard about PRP from my grandson (a physical therapist).  I had previously been told by 2 orthopedic doctors I would need a knee replacement.  I just wasn't ready for that.  After 2 visits with Dr. Lin I decided to have a PRP injection.  Dr. Lin has a wonderful bedside manner.  He listens, he provides understandable information, he's patient and instills confidence.  In addition, he is very passionate about regenerative medicine.  I had my PRP injection in Sept. 2017.  After my brief rehab & physical therapy I am pleased to report I am almost completely pain free.  I can now hike, go up & down stairs & sleep throughout the night without pain.  I would highly recommend to anyone who has been told they need a knee replacement or surgery to investigate PRP and if you live in Hawaii, GO SEE DR. LIN!!!|I experienced extreme lower back pain for quite some time and saw a few professionals regarding the issue. It wasn't until I saw Dr. Lin that I was actual able to get results and answers. Within a reasonable time frame I went from extreme pain to absolutely pain free. My life has changed significantly and I'm able to be active again and enjoy life.

I was open to hearing all of the possibilities and routes to take to help with my herniated discs, but I never felt pressured and was always given the least invasive options and without painkillers, which never helped anyway. I chose to go with cortisone and it helped me right away and has only gotten better over time. I worked hard to get my back stronger and core to help support the pressure on the discs to optimize the cortisone, so hopefully I won't have to do it again. I will do whatever it takes to avoid a surgery, which isn't a guaranteed option anyway. I've been pain free for almost five months and am very happy.|Dr Dwight  Lin really cares, takes time with his patients and is totally trustworthy|Very thorough, compassionate and detail oriented.
Very receptive to my concerns and explained options and process

column2: Hawaii Center for Regenerative Medicine: Liza R Maniquis-Smigel, MD
column3:
At the Hawaii Center for Regenerative Medicine, led by Dr. Liza R Maniquis-Smigel, MD, we specialize in innovative, non-surgical approaches to pain management and healing. As pioneers in regenerative medicine on the Big Island, our practice combines traditional physiatry with holistic treatments to address chronic pain conditions and sports injuries.

Our Comprehensive Services

We offer a range of specialized treatments including:

  • Prolotherapy for joint stabilization and pain relief

  • Regenerative injection therapies

  • Holistic pain management solutions

  • Sports medicine rehabilitation

  • Specialized care for spine and joint conditions

Our patients come to us seeking alternatives to surgery and conventional pain management. Located at 136A Ululani St in Hilo, we've helped countless individuals return to active, pain-free lives through our evidence-based regenerative treatments. Dr. Smigel's expertise in both conventional medicine and holistic approaches allows us to create personalized treatment plans addressing the root causes of pain rather than just symptoms. Visit our website at prolohawaii.org or call us at +1 808-933-3444 to discover how we can help restore your quality of life.

Dr. Smigel is   straight forward about treatments based on my xrays and cost out of pocket.  This is my 2nd block treatment and I feel great! column40:
Absolute worst pain clinic I've been to and unfortunately I've had to deal with many of them throughout 17 years. Push you towards injections. Threatened to discharge you as a patient. If you don't want to follow the injections or surgeries, office manager is the absolute worst patient care I've ever dealt with in my life. Not to mention the fact that they extort every one of their patients $650 every month for a drug test every single month. But that's probably owed to the fact that the doctor who runs it owns the drug testing facility|My experience is that, the staff is exceptionally kind, the nurses are remarkably helpful and patient. I like that they asked me questions and they showed genuine concern for me. They made me feel like they are attentively listening to me. I didn't feel pressured to do or take anything and they had effective solutions and medications. Mahalo, Big Island Pain Center for helping me have a break from pain, and gifting me with rest again. It's been so many years of suffering and I'm now reclaiming my life back in many ways.|Very poor service and understanding of a disabled veterans needs AND desires. They will pressure you heavily to take shots that don't work. Seek care elsewhere.|Used to be a good place. They try and tell you how much pain your in, they're always right and you're always wrong.  There very good at belittling you, and being dismissive of your feelings.

Find another place at all cost.|The absolute worse patient care I've received from the nurses and other staff. Doctors were great but no longer there. They screen phone calls and will not pass messages to the doctor. I called several times in one day then they finally turned on answering machine at 3:20pm when office hours are till 3:30pm. I waited almost a month for a return phone call before finding another clinic, still no return call. All doctors have left that clinic. Website is not updated, none of those doctors are there. I will be seeking representation for this mistreatment by this clinic.|I have been out of medication 14 days. I've called 3xs each day for the past 2 weeks. Be very careful to hand staff your UA samples. It been observed on many occasions that UA samples are unattended in a hallway accessible to anyone. Unsecured and meant for lab testing. Not professional at all. They push expensive injections that last maybe 3-4 days. I had multiple bruises on neck and shoulders. I've been under doctors care for pain management for a number of years with different providers. This clinic is absolutely The Worse Ever. 1 doctor for too many patients. Seems they cannot keep doctors and APRN's and general staff. This NOT pain management.|Disaster since recent staff change!! I used to see Al Braun for my lumbar injections each month. He did a fantastic job. Caring and personable. The Nurse Asia was awesome.
I heard that Al was leaving but was shocked to see that most of the other staff was gone as well.
The new staff does not have their act together. They are nice enough but waiting over an hour just to get a room is unacceptable. This seems to be the new normal. I used to be in and out in less than half an hour, feeling good.
When I inquired why there was such a long wait, the staff member gave me a somewhat blank look. She stated that they just have a lot of patients.
Hey, I'll do you a favor and you'll have one less patient to manage. I'm going somewhere else for pain management.|I'd leave a -5 star review if I could. I was referred a year ago by my pcp and come to find out after 6 months of waiting for a call back, they lost my referral.  My pcp sent the referral again with a confirmation received... again.  I called a month later and miraculously got a person on the phone. She said it will take 2 weeks to process my referral (even though they got it a month prior). I called 2 weeks later, 3 weeks later, 1 month later... and so on until 4 months after my 2nd referral was sent. Still can't get a call back or someone on the phone. I've been living with 0 pain management for my chronic back pain for over a year because this place has 0 professionalism and 0 customer service. Shut this place down so that a decent medical firm with compassion and morals can open up here instead.

column40:
I can't understand people giving any less than a 5 star review?  I moved out of state 8 months ago and not a day goes by that I don't wish I could still be under Dr Lee's care to maintain my back pain!  He is incredible in every way. He had my back pain under completely control...My back is fused but like so many people I have residual and significant pain.  When I was in Kona Dr. Lee had that pain totally under control.  I'm now living on the mainland and I've yet to find a practitioner who can even come close to resolving my back pain. The staff at Kaloko was incredible as are the nurse practitioners.   Especially Jessica, thank you for your compassion and your sharp mind. I miss the schedulers, the medical assistants and the office manger. Your entire staff is truly the best.  I never needed pain medication because you genuinely and consistently worked to get and keep my pain under control.  God bless each and every one of you!  Sincerely,
Lori Gale|I was patient.  3xs no problem.  My insurance paid in full. 4th visit i call bf for appt confirmation. Was told my insurance company won't cover. My insurance calls them, 3 way call. Told no one in billing available. I call. Same bs. I give msg from my insurance company. Need to correct last bill and resubmit. Staff person gets loud n rude. Won't do resubmit. Guess she neva makes errors. So I no longer patient because their billing person is perfect. No errors ever. Very unprofessional. The person treating me was awesome. He will never hear why I'm not allowed to come. I can of I pay the service in full myself|Dr. Lee is exceptional. I had tons of anxiety over an epidural injection in my lower back because on the mainland I had these done with mild sedation, but that is not offered at Kaloko. Dr. Lee listened to my concerns, explained the current research and told me that I would be happily surprised by the outcome without sedation. He was right. He has an excellent bedside manner, discussed my MRI images and took the time to answer all of my questions. In the procedure he talked me the whole way through it, describing what I should be feeling at any given moment and before you knew it, it was over. I never felt a thing after the initial numbing medication and I was out in 25 minutes total. He even gave me a referral for a surgeon on Oahu who deals with my specific issue. Thank you Dr. Lee.|Extremely rude and unresponsive. After a week of calling with no answer, we finally had someone answer the phone. I explained that we've been trying to make an appointment for a week and that my boyfriend needs an MRI desperately, only for her to say "That's not my problem. Did you listen to our answering machine? It says don't call more than once." and hung up on me. This is the only clinic in Kona that takes workman's comp insurance so we're left with no other option.|I took my son there who suffered an anoxic brain injury, he has multiple, very painful contractures. The office staff was a bit rude but I dismissed it as they were busy and my son arrived on gurney which is often difficult to accommodate. Rene Fabrizi saw my son, I expressed a desire to keep him off opiates to  manage his pain (he was overdosed at the hospital and almost died so I'm very wary) she gave me an electric stimulation device which helps a little but really is mediocre and not consistent in its results. My son has been in excruciating pain for over a year and we can't get Botox shots for 6 mons, he needs pain killers of some kind both for the trip to Oahu and in the mean time.I asked for them explaining this and Rene Fabrizi and her colleagues  said he "wasn't right" for their clinic, no explanation and the suggested doctor they gave me IS ON OAHU. He can't get there, but they know that. I found this, and their treatment of my son so insulting, uncaring, unprofessional, and frankly, cruel. I will be reporting them to the state and every oversight board I can think of. Please if you have a bad experience  with "any" health care provider report them to an oversight board AMA, HMA, etc. they need to know their neglect and or mistreatment of people is unacceptable.|Took a while to schedule  an appointment..But am really happy with the care and driving from Puna,took less than 1/2 hour for the injection..explained  procedure as he is doing it..Great job.|Our experience with the office staff when we walked in the door for the first time was rude.  No hello.  Asked for ID and insurance like going thru customs.  Asked for a urine sample with NO direction or where the restroom was located, I assume it would be similar experience when entering a penitentiary.
The nurse and the PA were professional, caring, and wonderful.  TOP OF THE LINE!
Leaving the examine room and having to deal with the office staff was far from pleasant.  They literally demanded and argued regarding scheduling a date for a following up appointment when the procedure had not been approved by our insurance carrier nor scheduled with the clinic.  I gave them our clipboard with pages of paperwork some of which we did not fill out because it was not applicable to our visit.  We left, took the elevator down and were entering the parking area when one of the office staff came storming down the steps literally yelling at us before she landed at the bottom (with others in the parking area) because we had not filled out a form.  After an unpleasant conversation, she agreed to give me the forms, I would fill them out, and email them to her.  As I walked away she shouted "YOUR WELCOME" AND THREW HER HANDS IN HE AIR AND SHOUTED "AASGHAA".  I was dumbfounded.   It was shocking.  I walked to my car (where my husband- the patient)  (he left the scene out of embarrassment and harassment).  As we drove away I asked him about his experience, his reply "oh boy, it was bad from when I walked in".  I called the clinic from my car (no one answered) and I left a message for the PA to call me.  I have not received a call.  I assume the office staff recognized my voice and did not give the PA my message.  I never post negative experiences, but this is experience in a medical clinic getting advise on a serious problem (not that it should matter) is unacceptable. I've been addressed more respectively upon entering a gas and asking for the key to the lua without buying gas.  My intention is not to have the office staff removed, but for them to realize their clients are hurting, need help, deserve respect,  and compassion. (Needless to say we are providing the income to pay their wages.)  Help, respect, compassion are so easy to give and don't require time, just words.|I have had 2 failed spinal fusion surgeries and a fused foot, I have chronic migraines as well,  I'm in constant  pain.  Kaloko has always put me first, they have been great with everything from scheduling tests,  referrals to other doctors,  med management,  PT, Massage,  and Injections as needed!  I feel like Renee really cares about me as a human and is always willing to help with my medical issues.  I'm so thankful for Kaloko big aloha and mahalo for putting the patients first!

column48: What kind of clinic would turn down someone that is in pain because they don't have insurance , but was willing to pay cash!! Ridiculous cold uncaring establishment!!
column49:
Eric,
Kaloko Pain Center has many cash pay patients and a comprehensive list of services provided for that subset of patients without insurance.  However, there are some services that we cannot provide on a cash basis, mainly, opioid medications for cash.  That is highly frowned upon by all government agencies.  As far as interventional procedures, physical therapy, massage therapy, and a variety of other modalities, we do regularly provide those services on a standardized cash fee schedule.

column40: This is absolutely the most amazing doctor's office I've ever been too, Dr. Kerrey Taylor is professional, kind and cares about her patient's physical and mental well being. Medicine that is superior and well thought out and planned as your doctor plans your path/journey to feeling better with you. As a team,  you and your physician plan your treatment. God bless these guys. My life has gotten incredibly better with them in my life.|If you are having any pain issues, you need this clinic. Dr Kerrey Taylor has to be my most favorite doctor ever. It's about finding solutions to make your life better. Sometimes tolerable. It's not one specific treatment either. She tries everything available to get you feeling better. God bless this clinic. Mahalo!!!|My doctor referred me to this officr as a final step for pain management for my herniated L5 S1. As usual doctors like to try all the options before considering surgery. Upon walking in you check in with a receptionist behind a glass window. They are not friendly nor do they have personality. Literally stoneface you can tell that the ladies behind the desk does not like their job or seem to be irritated. I met with dr. Chris he was very informative in regards to pain management. He scheduled me for a follow-up appointment to get injections. I came in on the day that the receptionist had scheduled and the doctor tells me that I'm not on the schedule. I live in Ewa Beach so it's not like I'm traveling right around the corner. I know that mistakes happen and I took off of work for 2 days to get this done. To be told that I'm not in the schedule and they would squeeze me in. I took this as a sign to wear if this business cant get their appointments straight I will not allow them to stick a needle in my back. At that point I left and never returned. Your first impression is your best impression. This business did not make a lasting impression. Confused desk people with no personality and a doctor that has no clue what is going on with his staff. I'm so blessed not to have had any procedures with this office. Things happen for a reason|Absolutely the best !!! Out of all my previous doctors that I have been to in the past I owe these doctors the biggest thank you ever, Dr. Kerry & Her husband gave me my life back.|Dr. Taylor is awesome she cares about her patients takes the time to talk about health care and options.|Have called for weeks after having a referral in for almost 2 months, NEVER EVER get an answer or someone to call back after leaving a message horrible way to do business, I will be changing my referral myself.|Dr Tayler is so awesome. column38: TRACY TERHORST|Rick Patton|Dianna Maree|Joseph Ostroski|Scott Gillis Choy Lee Fut|Parvana Eldark|Hawk Heresiarch|druma99801
column40:
Update his cancer test came back positive for Papillary Thyroid carcinoma!!!! Helping my ex husband who is in the middle of his cancer diagnosis.  Also he had paperwork that says he has narrowing of his cervical spine (stenosis,) and chronic anterior wedging of his thoracic spine right there in black and white. She says all this says your just have mild issues. He has no medical history of even seeing a doctor regularly. It had been several years without a doctor visit.  No prescription history. He had his biopsy and we have looked at his scans his cancer has spread to other areas including his neck. She treated him like a drug addict and wants to do injections in his neck , after we told her were sure the cancer has spread there. He will most likely go to mental health for help because he is in so much pain and they are no help. I'm appalled at the unprofessionalism and judgmental attitude from this office. They don't have any of the facts or are interested in working with you while your gathering all your diagnosis which takes time. Before he could get a referral and was awaiting help his brother gave him a pain pill . His very first office visit he willingly gave them a urine sample. Because that pill was in his urine ( because he needed help with his pain) it gave her the right to judge and disrespect him. When his biopsy results come back positive in a few days and they will. Then what is he supposed to do, who will help him. Please read all the other negative reviews. This place needs investigated.|I have seen daycare centers that were run much better than this place! They are Rude, uncaring of me and very unprofessional. I have had countless problems with them and am perusing legal council against them presently as they put me in the hospital for 5 weeks due to using an un sterol instrument to perform a nerve ablation given by Lynn Puana who  is not only  NOT formally trained in pain management but was NOT qualified to to perform that procedure that put me in the hospital!

Right after receiving the procedure, I started experiencing extreme pain so I tried calling them to see what I should do and I got a recording that said I had dialed a number that I had not dial, it didn't say, "if this is an emergency, please hang up and dial 911, like most other places do, it didn't say the name of the business, and then it said that the customer I had called has a mailbox that is FULL and that I CANNOT leave a message!!!

I took a half a pain pill to try and dull the pain until I could get threw to these clowns and it took me 3 days before I actually got someone! I told her in a nice way that I was a little surprised that I couldn't leave a message for 3 days because their mailbox was full and Courtney, the office manager who answered, just went off on me! She kept talking over me and wouldn't allow me to say anything and told me that they were not going to give me an early refill and then said that they were not going to give me another refill period!

When I got out of the hospital that they put me in, I had a registered letter informing me that I was no longer welcome there anymore!
They also caused me to be on pain medication for many months longer than I should have due to the fact that they were short handed due to Dr. Rudolf Puana having to leave the clinic because he got caught dealing fentanyl patches. I would like to hit them with a class action suit so please let me know if you would like to as well.
Stay away from this place!!|The office is in a very old house, but it is fixed up very cute and it is clean. The people at the desk are polite and efficient. The PAs that I have seen have been both professional and personable. I very much appreciate the way, according to my wishes, my health issues are being treated in a minimally invasive manner, both as far as drugs and procedures go.|I would not recommend this pain clinic, however, its only one of two on the island of Hawaii in the Hawaiian chain. I was not able to get an appointment booked in a timely manor. Additionally, I was booked to have  a simple epidural injection, which was scheduled one month out, one week prior to my scheduled appointment, I received a phone call from the office staff informing that the procedure is canceled and needed to be rescheduled for one month out; the reason given for the schedule change is as follows: a piece of equipment needed for the procedure has not yet arrived at the clinic. My question is why schedule patients for procedures, that could alleviate discomfort, if the clinic is not properly equipped to perform procedures?
My best advise is to seek a pain clinic on neighboring island or on the main land, provided that this option is not cost prohibitive.
Best of luck to you all, you'll need it with this group. The one star rating is giving because in order to post this review a selection had to be made.|Dr. Puana has made my life bearable again! I had broken my neck years ago and the pain had become extreme. One doctor after reading my MRI said that he was surprised that I could get out of bed! Dr. Puana treated me over a few months time and I had improved about 90%! He then introduced me to a phenomenal Neurosurgeon who operated on me and repaired my cervical spine. I visit Puana Pain Clinic often for other inoperable spinal injuries. Check his resume! We are so blessed to have this highly qualified and exceptionally experienced doctor in Hawaii and especially here on the Big Island!|While the front desk help was kind, courteous and friendly, their required patient dispute resolution agreement document asks you to forfeit your legal rights to malpractice and agree instead to arbitration. I refused to sign away my rights so they refused service. The second star is for how friendly the staff was in dealing with an unfamiliar situation.|Updated!

Snarky office staff. Don't waste you're time.

Don't be fooled by the positive reviews. Carefully review the negative ones and you will likely see a common denominator.

The office manager is an outright bully. They have no business being in this profession. Whatever you do don't question her about anything, or offer feedback of any kind no matter how calm or constructive you might be, otherwise she'll threaten and then remove you from the practice.|Very unprofessional and dirty office and filthy bathroom. For the second time,  I waited an hour and half for my appointment and the incompetent gal didn't schedule for a treatment.  A waste of time.  I won't be back. V.A. should sent veterans somewhere else.

column2: The Fascial Pain Clinic at Kilani Chiropractic Centre: Tracy C. Matsumoto, DC
column3: At The Fascial Pain Clinic, we're proud to feature Hawaii's only certified chiropractic radiologist, Dr. Tracy C. Matsumoto, DC. With 37 years of practice since graduating from Palmer College of Chiropractic in 1985 and completing his radiology residency at Los Angeles College of Chiropractic, Dr. Matsumoto has established himself as a leading myofascial pain syndrome specialist. We continuously stay current with the most effective and state-of-the-art myofascial techniques from around the world to provide exceptional care to our patients.
column11: Dr. Matsumoto graduated from Palmer College of Chiropractic in 1985. He went on to complete his residency in radiology at Los Angeles College of Chiropractic in Whittier, CA and is the only certified chiropractic radiologist in Hawaii. Dr. Matsumoto has been in practice for 37 years and is a myofascial pain syndrome specialist. Dr. Matsumoto stays current with the most effective and state-of-the art myofascial techniques from around the world. Dr. Matsumoto not only excels in reducing his patient's pain, he also truly enjoys being able to help them achieve their optimal health through proper stretching, strengthening, and diet/lifestyle coaching.
column38: Kassandra Krochina|Linde Masuhara|Heather Madarang|taylor mae|Kala Salazar|Anita Tacderas|Elton Shishido|J Smith
column40:
I always look forward to my appointments with Dr. Matsumoto. My pain has improved and my lower back and core are much stronger since seeing him. Between regular visits and following his advice and exercises I can lift my young daughter up without worrying about injury.|I went to see Dr. Tracy Matsumoto after dealing with a painful condition called Sacroiliac Joint Pain! Dr explained how Fascia was the infrastructure that allows my movements! He explained my need to stretch, move, and exercise to help reduce or eliminate my pain! A series of core exercises, along with pictures were demonstrated and follow up steps were provided in handouts!
Within 3 office visits, I felt hopeful and relief! As long as I maintain these stretching exercises, I can move normally again!! He also emphasizes proper nutrition for a healthier lifestyle!
Lee Ann, his Office Manager, was so pleasant!!
linde|Went in with the worst pain in my life. Unbearable and in tears. I felt very hopeful going in. Not only was I taught why I felt the way I did but I was given daily stretches, exercises and food/diet recommendations to continue my healing outside of the office. Here I am 3 weeks later and getting better every day.|I was recommended to the Fascial Pain Clinic by my TMJ dentist. At first I wasn't sure what to expect because I used to go to a difficult chiropractor who would only crack my back and do alignments, but Dr. Matsumoto showed me daily stretches and core exercises (besides the typical crunches and sit ups) to help me build my side core muscles that no one really thinks about. Turns out I was stretching wrong because once I started doing the stretches Dr showed me and how to do them properly, I actually started feeling better throughout my day and not just temporarily in the morning. Dr also told me that as long as I keep up with stretching and a balanced diet, I wouldn't need to visit more often. I love that approach to health instead of just "okay see you in a month". Best chiro I've been recommended to!|When I first started, I had severe lower back pain daily. I had almost no hope that I'd get back to normal. Thanks to Dr. Matsumoto, I'm a lot better! I love how he explains how your body works, you're diet, fascia, stretches/core exercises, etc., all work together. Without one another, it can wreck havoc on your body. My pain is now manageable (almost gone at times). I have faith that the more I do what he says, the better off I'll be. Still a work in progress, but way happier!!! Thanks!!|Phenomenal experiences with Dr Matsumoto!  Prepare to learn about what's going on with your body, read up and study books and clinical studies on your condition, receive dietary recommendations, hear a lot of information and be educated in the 15 minutes you're there, have manual chiropractic adjustments, work your body (maybe sweat a little), and get ready to do your homework of daily stretches along with strengthening and core exercises. It does make a huge difference because the information you're going to receive are to be forever adjustments that is meant to improve your overall life.|I have been in pain for decades! I have never found any injection or physical therapy that worked. It was a waste of money!! I come to this place and after 4 treatments my pain has been reduced significantly. You will benefit from the services they provide guarantee! Call them now make an appointment! They take insurance too!|Dr. Tracy Matsumoto is excellent. Not like any chiropractor I have ever been to. He's  observative and insightful about overall health as a whole system. As an example I have some various other systemic things going on that have stumped my PCP, dermatologist, GI, and infectious desease specialists and his advice regarding those things has helped more than all the others so far.
And his adjustments are done with subtle movements that allow the body to almost align itself.

column3:
Integrative Traditional Chinese Medicine in Honolulu

At Inner Chi Hawai'i, Dr. Evan Murao combines over 4,000 hours of advanced clinical training in Traditional Chinese Medicine with modern Western Biomedicine insights to deliver truly comprehensive care. We pride ourselves on our integrative approach, conducting precise differential diagnoses that address both symptoms and their underlying causes. Our personalized treatment plans are tailored to each individual's unique health needs and goals.

Our Comprehensive Services Include:

  • Acupuncture & Electro-Acupuncture

  • Cupping Therapy & Gua Sha

  • Tui Na Massage & Acupressure

  • Custom Herbal Formulations

  • Dietary & Nutritional Guidance

We're committed to merging traditional wisdom with modern science to provide effective, holistic healing solutions for our patients. Whether you're seeking relief from pain, stress management, or support for chronic conditions, we offer a balanced approach that honors both Eastern and Western medical traditions. Visit us at our convenient downtown Honolulu location at Inner Chi Hawaii or call us at (808) 445-4892 to begin your healing journey today.

column40:
I am very happy with my sessions of acupuncture and cupping at Dr. Evan F.J. Murao's office.  Over the 2024 summer, my right arm suddenly contracted frozen shoulder. I was in pain for months. I couldn't use my right arm much.  I have read about the ancient acupuncture and cupping science and I really wanted to try it before going to my PCP.  Dr. Murao is so kind and calming.  His techniques in massage and acupuncture worked wonders on my arm, body and soul.  In three sessions, my arm is much better. And I feel more balanced within also.  Thank you Dr. Murao!|Dr Murao is a magician  I mean I've been several time and I come dragging with pretty severe issues like gallbladder pain or slipped discs. Last time I wasn't able to move cos an old neck injury flaring up and couldn't turn my head or use my arms properly. One session and I'm back to mobile and no pain.  He saved my day as I had very important work to attend to next day.

I'm so very grateful to have found a real good Doctor I can trust, and that's not easy in my case. I always argue with medical professionals  because I was trained in Eastern Medicine so I need to know the cause of an issue before I accept a solution. With Dr Murao I don't need to argue because he knows what he's doing and have a holistic understanding that doesn't make him just dull or cover the symptoms but connects the dots, understands the root cause and knows what he needs to do to make the body shift itself to recover.
Highly recommended!!!|I first went to Dr. Evan Murao in August. He is incredibly easy to talk to and takes his time to learn about your issues and find real solutions. The acupuncture experience was relaxing and its the only doctor visit where I didn't feel the doctor was rushed and distracted. The reason for my visit was painful periods that I had been experiencing for 18 years. So painful, I often vomited and couldn't work or even get out of bed. During that 18 years, I had been to several doctors, had a laparoscopic surgery, MRI's, tried nearly every herbal or prescription thing I could find or was prescribed. Nothing but Naproxen (Aleve) reduced the swelling or pain. So I took an NSAID and in high quantities until I developed a stomach ulcer last year. I had been battling these painful periods with no relief for nearly a year when a friend recommended Dr. Murao. I was really skeptical that taking another herb would do anything but then my next period came and it was normal, just regular period pain. And then the next one came and it was even easier. Evan also prescribed me herbs for my ulcer and after a couple of months I can tell my ulcer is already healing. I have far less pain and I even hope to one day be able to eat or drink caffeine again. All that to say, I will be stopping by Evan's office first from now on. And I hope anyone who has this same experience will find relief and know they don't have to be in pain anymore.|Aloha! I just completed my 2nd session with Dr. Murao, and feeling fantastic. Some of the ailments I was having are as followed:
Bells Palsy Pain 
Hip Pain 
Neck Pain 
Lower Back Pain 
Ringing in Ears 
And a few issues I was having with stress, grief, and unbalance.
I highly recommend Dr. Murao for any issues you may be having. He's a kind hearted person and listens tentatively to what kind of treatment YOU are looking for.
I'm glad I found him
Love and Light,
Danielle|Dr. Evan Murao is very passionate and caring in his profession!
He first does a small talk to get to know what  my current situation.
He knows where to get my pressure points and I always felt relieved after my session.
I highly recommend him to anyone who needs an acupuncture treatment!|Been going for years! I refer everyone that mentions issues with pain. Most of my visits are a one time, one and done (thats how good he is!), he rarely needs to see me for follow up care. I suffer from sciatica, and upper back and neck pain. I go months feeling great until I mess something up again. Lol. You wont regret that awesome sunset view either!|Dr. Evan is very knowledgable in his practice and really took the time to understand my aches/ailments and didn't think they were too small or minor. I was very comfortable during my appointments and he spoke in a simple way so I could understand. Greatly appreciate him and the work he does. Thank you!|Dr. Evan was so helpful in diagnosing a myriad of different symptoms that affect my day to day life. His experience and knowledge in eastern medicine made me like I was holistically supported. I am so glad I went and look forward to another visit.

column3:
Specialized Pain Management Solutions in Waipahu

Welcome to Kai Pain Center of Waipahu! We are dedicated to providing effective pain relief through non-invasive treatments. Our specialty lies in both direct and indirect (trigger point) cortisone injections that target inflammation at its source. We understand how debilitating chronic pain can be, which is why we offer specialized treatments for various conditions including:

  • Trigger finger conditions

  • Rotator cuff tendinitis of the shoulder

  • Knee arthritis

  • Elbow tendinitis

  • Sciatica (from disc or joint disease)

Our approach is tailored to each patient's specific needs, whether through direct injection at the pain site or indirect trigger point injections to protect surrounding tissues. Located at 94-141 Pupupuhi St, 2nd Floor, Waipahu, HI 96797, we're committed to helping you regain comfort and mobility. Contact us at +1 808-342-6305 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.
column11: Welcome to Kai Pain Center of Waipahu ! We specialize in non-invasive direct and indirect (trigger point) cortisone injections. If you have pain of the joint, muscle, tendon, or nerve, a cortisone injection can be very effective. Cortisone, an anti-inflammatory medication can not only relieve your pain but also treat the inflammation that is causing the pain. Cortisone injections can treat trigger fingers, rotator cuff tendinitis of the shoulder, arthritis of the knee, tendinitis of the elbow, sciatica (due to disc or joint disease of the spine. We can do direct injection of cortisone at the site of the pain or inflammation. Also, we can do indirect / trigger point injection just adjacent to the site to avoid injury to surrounding tissues.

column38: Kelsi Mensen|Josh Cueto|Brandon L|Jhalyn Presswood|Jeremy Chambers|Alexandra Ishi|Elisha Cole|Daniel
column40:
I was referred here while pregnant with my first child because I wanted pelvic floor therapy to strengthen and train the muscles before I gave birth (which my midwife told me was a perfectly legitimate reason for referral). I was turned away because apparently they do not do preventative care or treatment. I have no issue with being turned away if they do not provide that care and appreciate the transparency regarding that. The problem was the manner in which they did so. The PT I spoke to was incredibly rude and treated me like I was stupid for thinking pregnancy care when there was no "problem" was even something pelvic floor therapists did. She demanded to know who sent me and repeatedly asked "why would you even think this is a thing?". I left feeling a little bit embarrassed for how dumb I was made to feel. I am now 10 weeks postpartum with pelvic organ prolapse . I am seeing a different pelvic floor PT who assured me that care while pregnancy even with no symptoms is certainly a "thing". I can't help but wonder if I had sought care elsewhere if I would even be dealing with the prolapse now. Only gave 2 stars because the front desk staff were kind and efficient.|I've been coming here 2-3 time per week since the end of May/early June of 2023 following a surgery on my shoulder. This was the third surgery on that shoulder, and I was pretty skeptical of the help I would receive due to some negative experiences at previous locations I had done my physical therapy as well as the daunting news from my surgeon that the operation will likely fail to hold the repair. It didn't take me any more than a few sessions to believe that I was in good hands here.

Every staff member I have encountered has been friendly, professional, and it is clear that they enjoy working with each other. Of the staff members there (as of December 2023), I have had the most exposure to Chelsea. I feel as though I lucked out with having her conduct many of my treatments because along with the clear knowledge she has within this field, she has also made my recovery plan feel as though it has been a collaborative process with my end-goal physicality which makes for a treatment plan that feels tailored to my needs. She has met me with a high level of professionalism and friendliness every time I come in as well as ensuring that the intensity of the day's exercises matches my fluctuating pain levels.

I still have a long ways to go with my recovery, but I am confident that I will make a better-than-expected recovery as I am in much less pain, much more flexible, and much stronger than my previous recoveries, and in a much smaller time frame too. Overall, I am beyond pleased with my experience here, and I would recommend this place to anybody.|Received a referral to OSR for PT after surgery. I could not be happier with the staff and care I have received. The staff is amazing to say the least, they work with you through everything and ensure you are doing your exercises properly to ensure your recovery goes well.

When it comes to making appointments they are very easy to work with and take the extra step to try and schedule your appointments around your schedule.|Was in the process of going here but due to unseen circumstances I was unable to make my appointment. I reached out a few hours later after my missed appointment and Marissa had an attitude with me. She was rude and unprofessional. If that's how you handle customers then shame on you.|Sean at OSR has restored my faith in PT!! I had some doubt about the benefit of PT after receiving inadequate treatment at separate locations.

I love how friendly they are at the front desk and love the location. Sean is determined to get at the root of the issue, which is exactly what I wanted in care! Select OSR with confidence!|I highly recommend this place. The staff is amazing, always walking into a positive place. They  always greet me when I walk in and help me if I need it. The facility is also very clean and feels like family.|The office has a great, laid back, fun atmosphere. I am in my third week of physical therapy for my knee and I couldn't be happier with my progress or my experience at Oahu Spine & Rehab. I have had issues for years and I can already tell the treatment is making a difference and increasing my quality of life. From the folks at the front desk to the physical therapists, everyone is super friendly and clearly very knowledgeable. Highly recommend for your physical therapy needs!!!|Amazing place to get fixed up. I go for chiro and medical massages. This is a 1 stop shop as they have other services to include physical therapy. The front desk girls are always very nice. They have package deals if you self pay to help lower the cost of your treatment plans too. It's very clean and everyone here is extremely professional. I absolutely recommend this place if you are in need of pain relief for either quick or chronic pain issues.

column2: St. Luke's Clinic - Pain Management: Boise
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Relief Solutions in Boise

Living with acute or chronic pain doesn't have to be a challenge you face alone. At St. Luke's Clinic - Pain Management in Boise, we provide specialized care to help you regain control of your life. Our board-certified physicians in pain medicine and anesthesiology lead a compassionate team dedicated to finding the source of your pain, developing personalized treatment plans, and restoring your health and function. We're conveniently located at 701 E Parkcenter Blvd, Boise, ID 83706.

Our comprehensive pain management services address a wide range of conditions including:

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Sciatica

  • Shingles pain

  • Arthritis

  • And many more chronic pain conditions

We offer advanced treatment procedures including injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation. Our team truly cares about your quality of life and works diligently to create individualized care plans. Contact us at (208) 947-2266 to schedule a consultation with our pain management specialists or visit our website to learn more about our services.
column11: Living with acute or chronic pain doesn't have to be a challenge you face alone. We provide pain management for a wide range of conditions, from neuropathic, cancer, sciatica, shingles, arthritis, and more. Treatment procedures include, but are not limited to, injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation.

Reason for the bad rating is because I received a bill 1 and a half year later from my procedure.
When I was there the last time I asked them is this the last amount I have to pay and they said yes. My wife was a witness to it when I asked. When I called in to go over my bill I told them it was BS I received it a year and a half later. Then I was threatened that it would just be sent to collections then. I always make sure I pay upfront or pay my co pays. I asked the person there how long they have been working there and they said seven years. Very disappointed that someone has been there for 7 years and I'm just getting a bill. I would have understood if they were new or my insurance didn't pay right away but they did. Bad service with the accounting side of it.|I honestly don't know how I would manage my pain without Johnny!! He is a godsend and so very patient. column2: St. Luke's Clinic - Pain Management: Twin Falls
column3:
Living with pain doesn't have to define your life. At St. Luke's Clinic - Pain Management in Twin Falls, we specialize in identifying the root cause of your discomfort and developing personalized treatment plans to restore your quality of life.

Comprehensive Pain Solutions

Our dedicated team provides expert care for a wide range of conditions including:

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Sciatica

  • Shingles pain

  • Arthritis

  • And many more chronic pain conditions

We offer advanced treatment procedures including therapeutic injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and intrathecal pump implantation and management. Our compassionate approach focuses on your individual needs, as we believe everyone deserves to live with dignity and comfort. Located at 625 Pole Line Rd W Suite 1A in Twin Falls, we're committed to helping our community find relief. Learn more about our services by visiting St. Luke's Clinic - Pain Management Twin Falls. We are currently accepting new patients by referral only. Call us at (208) 814-8725 to schedule your appointment.
column11: Living with acute or chronic pain doesn't have to be a challenge you face alone. We can help find the source of your pain, develop a treatment plan to give you relief, and help restore health and function. Our team truly cares about you and your best quality of life. We provide pain management for a wide range of conditions, from neuropathic, cancer, sciatica, shingles, arthritis, and more. Treatment procedures include, but are not limited to, injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, spinal cord stimulation, and intrathecal pump implantation and management. We are accepting new patients by referral only.

Intrigued, I did some research and found that TVPC offered this treatment.

From my very first consultation, Anna was incredibly helpful--she thoroughly explained everything and made me feel informed and confident in my decision. Our team of experienced physicians, including Dr. Poulter, Dr. Runyan, and our skilled physician assistants, combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to address chronic pain conditions effectively.

Specialized Pain Management Services

Our practice is built on the foundation of patient-centered care, where we take the time to listen to each individual's concerns and develop personalized treatment strategies. column38: Mystie Parris|Heather DeBuck|M|Kamelle Wickersham|Dona Robinson|Teresa Benedetti|Brandy Bennett|Michelle
column40:
I have been a patient of Dr. Tim Snell, since 2016. He is THE BEST! He listens, & sincerely cares about his patients. He never rushes the appointment, & truly wants to help better your life & well being.
I appreciate & respect his knowledge & true concern about the complexity of chronic pain. I'm so grateful for him, & his staff is so friendly. They're ALWAYS there to help, & if an error should happen, they are quick & efficient to get it fixed! Much Thanks to ALL of you! I see you, & appreciate your hard work!!!|Just wanted all of the staff there to know that "You're our favorite". Probably the most authentic, most compassionate, respectful office of workers we've ever met, (having lived all over, we've known many different offices) but the Pocatello office staff is incredibly professional, yet also extremely patient with old people in pain (and some clients have been downright rude, belligerent, loud and intolerant) but everyone at Pain and Spine does a fantastic job working with cruel and grumpy people and doing so in a positive and productive, reassuring way.

The medical assistants are extremely efficient and friendly while listening effectively whilst working well with the doctors, nurses and PAs.

The medical professionals are up to date on all of the procedures and best medical treatments available.  They don't just medicate and send one home, but rather, they provide solutions to living a more productive and pain free lifestyle.  (Even if it means not retaining a patient because their services have been rendered and the patient becomes well)

Furthermore...the entire staff LISTENS!!!  They listen to what is troubling the patient and seek the best solutions for each patient on an individual basis.  I've seen my spouse feel as though he can no longer continue living with his non-stop, ever present pain (he's a disabled veteran and a hero to our Nation) to now becoming more optimistic for his future, and thriving from the medical treatments he's received!  That's huge!  When a patient's physical health improves, often their mental health improves as well.  I believe this place truly wants to HEAL and help!  I'm ever thankful for your office, each and every one of you have made a lasting and meaningful impression!

Yes, indeedy!!  Y'all (and I mean "all y'all")  are our favorite!|This place is incredible. Dr. Runyan is one of the best doctors I've ever met. He's been there every step of my recovery and has helped me return to work and a more normal life. He truly listens and was able to point out the best treatments in my situation. If you are suffering from chronic pain I cannot recommend pain and spine specialists enough.|Dr. Snell and his PA Tyler are amazing they have always been good to try to help figure out what's going on and get me feeling better as soon as they can. They have been amazing to help keep my pain under control. The nursing staff (Sydney) and front office staff ( Shantea) are always amazing help to get me appointments or help needed.I appreciate all they do for me!!!|My husband is under  care of Pain and Spine Specialists . The PA Weldon Richardson is attentive and alert to my husband's needs and concerns. The assistant, Shawnee , mirrors Weldon's professional manner.
Previous providers have exhibited attitudes of the patient being less important.  We appreciate the respectful way my husband is treated.|Are you looking for pain management doctor's?
Doctor's that treat you with kindness understanding and respect.
Then Pain and Spine Specialist of Idaho can help you.
The doctor's there, they know you have come to them because you hurt, you're frustrated and you simply want to feel better.
When I started going to Pain and Spine, 5 years ago I was a mess.
Suffering with uncontrollable pain,  feelings of worthlessness and hopelessness.
The process has not been easy or fun. Dr Snell is kind and I found him super smart. I have my monthly appointments with his PA
Tyler Hepworth. Tyler has helped me immensely, he reviewed my history and took the time to get to know Me. We have done shots, injections, ect. all helping, but not for very long. Finally I choose to have Dr Snell do a spinal stimulator trial, to see if it would work for me. I was pleased with my experience and decided to have in placed permanently. The Boston Scientific unit has been a life changer for me. The stimulator changed my day to day life. It runs silently, but if I'm having a bad pain day then I can adjust and increase the stimulator for a few mins to get increased relief. I am personally very happy with my results.
Whenever I've needed something, from insurance issues, to venting my frustrations or to communicate what is and isn't working with my medication, Tyler has helped me figure it out. The office nurses are good, kind, knowledgeable and understanding. They work as a team to get the needs of us, the patient's met.
I'm happy and grateful to be a part of Pain and Spine Specialist of Idaho!
Thank you.
It takes a team to make a dream work!!|I appreciate PA Tyler Hepworth so much. He has always been kind and done so much to help me with my problems. I have been seeing him for a couple of years now and he is the one person who actually listened to me and has helped me alot. He is someone who genuinely cares to help his patients in the best way possible.|Doctor Snell is an angel. Very thorough and personable. I've seen him since 2015, and wouldn't switch.
The medical assistants are nice too.
I wish they had benches out front in the shade.
Thanks everyone for always taking such good care of me!

column3:
At Pain Care Boise, we specialize in providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Led by Dr. Christopher T Vaughan, our practice combines advanced interventional techniques with personalized care to help restore quality of life.

Innovative Pain Management Solutions

We offer a range of specialized treatments including:

  • Intracept procedures for chronic lumbar back pain

  • Spinal cord stimulation therapy

  • Targeted steroid injections

  • Radiofrequency ablation treatments

  • Comprehensive pain management plans

Our approach focuses on finding alternatives to opioid medications whenever possible, addressing the root causes of pain rather than simply masking symptoms. Dr. Vaughan takes time to thoroughly explain diagnoses and treatment options, ensuring patients understand their condition and participate in their care decisions. Located in downtown Boise at 301 W Myrtle St, we welcome patients seeking compassionate, effective pain relief. Learn more about our services at Pain Care Boise or call us at +1 208-342-8200 to schedule your consultation.

column40:
It took me 5 years to find a doctor that was willing to help me find a resolution instead of just throw opiates at me. Dr Vaughn opened up an entirely new realm of possibilities to treat my pain that had nothing to do with opiates! I would trust my life in Dr Vaughn's hands any day! His team and himself are so compassionate and caring. They really truly show you that they care about you as a person! It took me 5 years to find a doctor willing to do a spine stimulator to help my pain, and to allow myself to get off of all the opiates. I mentioned it to Dr Vaughn and he was immediately open to the idea and got the process started immediately! He has offered compassion and extreme knowledge in regards to the healing process and how to manage! I would recommend this office to anybody looking for a doctor who actually cares about you as a person and the quality of life that you live!|I'm 7 months post 3 level Intracept performed by Chris Vaughan. L4 through S1 and have regained most of my normal activities. I've experienced a significant pain reduction (approximately 50-80%,).

Take your time, don't be so quick to jump into fusions, and ask Chris about Intracept for chronic lumbar back pain. You may have modic changes with basivertebral endplate disfunction.

My surgery in particular took about 1.5 to 2 hours, and I know that Chris worked diligently to land the probe plumb and center.

Chris gave me much of my life back, and as a direct result, I get to be an active father to my 4 year old son now.

I'm blessed, thank you Chris!|Wow I have had back problems my whole
life and I've never had anyone explain what the problems is, what the MRI said & how the injection can help.
Thank you for taking the time to explain these things!
Super nice and caring!!!
Plus we didn't have to wait for hours in the waiting room exam room with a bad back like with St. Luke's back doctors.
Edit and update:
I was there two months ago where Dr Vaughan did a needling process in my neck. This procedure is not a once a done process and they never scheduled follow ups or asked how I was doing. I have quit a few injections that did not help so he decided he wanted to try it in a different place. I tired to make an appointment but the front desk people said they had to get prior authorization and they would call. Never did. There was one front office person that was really rude too.
I just went somewhere else. They did t seem to want my business.|This was my first procedure with Dr C. Vaughn and I was treated professionally and virtuous. Dr. Vaughn did a perfect S. I. Joint injection and I had a minimal amount of pain which is to expected.
I feel great and it's been 24 hrs.
I would recommend him and his office to anyone|I had been going to another pain clinic in Boise for over 8 years without little success in treating my pain.  I was reading up on Dr Vaughn and decided to give him a try.  This was one of the best decisions I could have made.  First of all their office staff and nurses are all so nice.  They are so welcoming and willing to work with you.  Dr Vaughn himself cares so much about his patients.  He works very hard to cure or curtail your health issues
@ .  This doctor has done more for me in 7 months, than the other clinic in 8 years.  I totally trust and believe in him.  I definitely recommend this office.|Dr. Vaughn is very caring & honest. He has a great listening ear. He explains things thoroughly so I can understand what he is talking about. He takes his time while he is in the room with me. I never feel rushed at any point during my visits. I fully recommend any one that has pain and is in  need of a pain care provider to make an appointment with Dr. Vaughn at Pain Care Boise. You won't be disappointed.|This was my first experience with a surgical clinic as opposed to the  hospital facilities.  It was not nearly as intimidating and overwhelming as a hospital surgical ward. If the choice is mine I will always choose this venue.   They were very punctual, extremely helpful and over the top pleasant. They  took the time to answer all of my question (many not related to my surgery). Thank you Pain Care staff.|Dr. Vaughn is one of the best doctors I have ever had the pleasure of working with. He not only listened to my concerns but came up with a game plan to help me feel comfortable about treatment for the first time in 20 years. Just when I was starting to feel like someone actually knew how I felt and really "got" me, I was punched in the gut by his office staff. This ridiculous attendance policy they have of if you miss 3 appointments they drop you as a patient is the most disgusting thing I've ever witnessed. I live in Caldwell and with all the construction and traffic in the treasure valley it's almost impossible to make appointments like they suggested let alone with a person who suffers from anxiety and depression, let alone other ailments. We all get sick, we all have accidents, car troubles etc. so for them to say you can no longer get care with us once you've missed those appointments is one of the most heinous acts of discrimination I've ever been subjected to. It's a crying shame because Dr. Vaughn is such an empathetic and kind doctor. Hopefully he wakes up and decides to take action against his incredibly insensitive office manager.

column3:
Living with pain doesn't have to define your life. At St. Luke's Clinic - Pain Management in Meridian, we specialize in helping patients find relief from both acute and chronic pain conditions. Our

Comprehensive Pain Management Approach

begins with identifying the source of your discomfort and developing personalized treatment plans designed to restore your health and functionality. We take pride in our team of board-certified physicians who hold credentials in both pain medicine and anesthesiology, bringing specialized expertise to every patient interaction.

We offer advanced treatments for a wide range of pain conditions including:

  • Neuropathic pain

  • Cancer-related pain

  • Sciatica

  • Shingles pain

  • Arthritis

  • And many more chronic conditions

Our treatment procedures include therapeutic injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation, all delivered with compassion and precision. Located at 520 S Eagle Rd #1222, Meridian, ID 83642, our facility is equipped to help you regain control of your life. To schedule a consultation, call us at +1 208-947-2266 or visit our website for more information about our services.
column11: Living with acute or chronic pain doesn't have to be a challenge you face alone. They lead a team that truly cares about you and your best quality of life.We provide pain management for a wide range of conditions, from neuropathic, cancer, sciatica, shingles, arthritis, and more. Treatment procedures include, but are not limited to, injections, nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation, and spinal cord stimulation.

i wish i could say good things but this place never ever answers the phone, they have been saying their phones dont work for over a month. when you do leave a message they don't call back often and IF they call back it takes several days. iv worked in health care for 17 years and iv been a chronic pain patient for just as long and sadly this place has been one of the worst at responding to patient needs. when they send a prescription to the wrong place its very frustrating to get ahold of them about it as well. my advice is if you ever want to talk to them you should drive to their location or you will end up disappointed|I have had 4 back surgeries over the last 20 years. This ain't my first rodeo. Jillian is by the BEST Pain Management provider I have ever seen. Her bedside manner is incredible. She actually listened to me, I can't remember the last time I felt heard in Pain Management. She spent almost 40 minutes with me going over past history, current issues. For the 1st time in a long time I feel hopeful! The staff is just as wonderful as Jillian! Thank you!!|Was able to get scheduled today. The woman on the phone was extremely helpful and explained that they are transitioning to a new system, so unfortunately, things are getting lost in the cracks, but they are quickly getting these issues resolved. I completely understand the frustration of new system updates, so I appreciate her taking the time to explain the delay in communication. They were able to get an appointment within the month!|It took several calls and two months of constant extreme pain for them to finally get me an appointment I needed for treatment. They explained that they had to let someone go for not following up on referrals. Well, when someone in the office is messing up, someone else should definitely be immediately finding and fixing their mess ups and not letting those of us in pain wait so long!|Si fusion with Dr Vaughn.  Went extremely well, and the staff is very friendly.  A few days of pain, but now that chronic pain is completely gone.  Would recommend Dr. Vaughn and Jillian to anyone needing pain intervention.|I called this office to make an appointment to discuss my back issues. This was NOT an appointment to provide any other services...just to discuss if they thought they were able to help with my spinal stenosis.  They would not make an appointment without having my Medicare number in advance (I did not have my card with me when I called).
Before even speaking with a doctor, it seemed obvious that they cared much more about how much they could make off of my insurance rather than caring how much, or even if, they could help with my back pain.  I realize a lot of doctors now fall into this category, but I'm choosing to look elsewhere.|This is one of the weirdest posts I've ever had to do. I was treated for upper neck problems by Pain care Boise. The treatment went well and helped for sometime. All was well so I thought. A few months later I tried to get a follow up appointment as I was experiencing problems once again. I called and left a message through voicemail as well as email. A week later I had heard nothing. I tried calling it multiple times but each time it went to their voicemail. I eventually tried calling from a different phone and finally got a person. This is where things really started to confuse me. I stated my name and the receptionist immediately hung up on me. I tried calling back and once again everything went to voicemail. As far as I know I was an upstanding patient and never had an altercation, argument, and did everything the doctor said. I did miss an appointment many months back but gave notice prior. I guess I am just very confused why I can't get an appointment let alone why no one will speak with me and explain. Please let me know, I am happy to take down this review if someone speaks with me.|The practitioners here are amazing.  They listen to you and involve you in your treatment decisions.  They are very professional and procedures are all done with the patients comfort and care care in mind.
The administration staff is excellent, they always take time to listen to your concerns about scheduling and do their best to schedule, deal with your insurance, and are always very friendly and courteous to deal with. I highly recommend this practice.

column2: Pain & Spine Specialists of Idaho: Jason M. Poston, MD
column3:
At Pain & Spine Specialists of Idaho, we are proud to feature the exceptional expertise of Dr. Jason M. Poston, MD, a fellowship-trained and board-certified interventional pain medicine specialist. As a native of Southeastern Idaho with deep roots in the community, Dr. Poston completed his prestigious fellowship training at the University of Utah and the world-renowned Huntsman Cancer Institute. His impressive academic journey includes graduating from Rigby High School and Ricks College, earning a Bachelor's degree in Zoology with high honors from Idaho State University, and obtaining his Medical Doctorate from the University of Washington. During his anesthesiology residency at the University of Kentucky, he served as chief resident and was recognized as the outstanding graduate in his class.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer specialized interventional pain management treatments including:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Minimally invasive procedures

  • Comprehensive pain control solutions

Our mission is to provide compassionate, evidence-based care to patients throughout Idaho Falls and surrounding communities. For more information or to schedule a consultation, please visit Dr. Jason Poston - Idaho Falls Pain Management or call us at (208) 522-7246. We're conveniently located at 3385 Potomac Way, Idaho Falls, ID 83404.
column9: Anesthesiologist|Doctor|Pain control clinic|Pain management physician|Physician referral service
column11:
Dr. Poston is fellowship trained and board certified in interventional pain medicine. He completed his fellowship training at the University of Utah and the world famous Huntsman Cancer Institute.

Dr. Poston is a native to Southeastern Idaho and graduated from both Rigby High School, and Ricks College. He completed his Bachelor's degree at Idaho State University in Zoology with high honors. He is a graduate of the University of Washington where he obtained his Medical Doctorate degree (MD). After medical school, attended the University of Kentucky to complete his residency specializing in Anesthesiology where he was chief resident and voted by faculty and his fellow residents as the outstanding graduate in his class.

Specialized Pain Management in Eagle, ID

At Pain Care Clinic of Idaho, we provide innovative and effective solutions for chronic pain management. Located at 742 E State St #150 in Eagle, ID, our clinic specializes in comprehensive pain control treatments under the expert guidance of Dr. Boese. We take a holistic approach to pain management, offering personalized care plans that address each patient's unique needs. Our services include:

  • Scrambler Therapy - A non-invasive treatment that has helped many patients reduce or eliminate medication dependence

  • CRPS Treatment - Specialized protocols for Complex Regional Pain Syndrome

  • Post-Surgical Pain Management - Effective solutions for persistent pain following surgical procedures

  • Chronic Neck and Back Pain Relief - Targeted treatments for long-term musculoskeletal issues

Our friendly staff ensures a welcoming environment where patients receive attentive care and thorough explanations of treatment options. We pride ourselves on spending quality time with each patient to fully understand their condition and develop the most effective treatment plan. Visit our website or call us at +1 208-939-3750 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a more pain-free life.

Todays visit was informative, and promising.
I return in two days to determine what direction we will be taking.
I look forward to a path to overcoming my long term battle with everyday chronic pain.
To be continued.
SG Charney,|I had my first appointment yesterday, and Dr. Boese was extremely knowledgable and had incredible bedside manner. He is not here to take your money and make you come in more than you need to. He wants to find the best treatment for your personal situation and make sure you are able to find relief with as few appointments as possible. He takes a holistic approach to discuss other doctors, specialists and treatments I am pursuing to make sure he is able to treat appropriately for my symptoms of chronic neck/shoulder/back tension.|Dr Boese and his staff are amazing.  Diagnosed with CRPS after knee surgery, I was referred to Pain Care Clinic of Idaho by my physical therapist.  I could not have been in better hands at Dr Boese's office.  Easy scheduling, nice office, and a wonderful and caring staff.  Dr. Boese's knowledge and treatment protocol is superior to anything I could have anticipated.  I am so grateful for his care.  I highly recommend Pain Care Clinic of Idaho.|I was being treated for muscular pain that was quite extreme after a surgery that had complications. The musketeer treatments weren't doing any good and when dr. Basie and his staff took over the results or noticeable right away. In just a handful of treatments that extreme pain is completely gone! Dr. Beasley and his staff are so kind and about me that I have been telling all of my friends and relatives that are in any pain to go see him..|Dr. Boese is very knowledgeable and compassionate and his staff members are great!.  I have suffered for many years with pain in my elbow.  After a few visits in his office the pain is almost non existent.  Thank you Pain Care Clinic of Idaho!|Great doctor who takes the time to fully explain treatment. The most caring, friendly staff I've ever experienced in a medical office. Scrambler therapy made it possible for me to get off pain meds for the first time in my adult life. Can't recommend this clinic enough!

Advanced Pain Management in the Treasure Valley

Thompson, MD, who brings 32 years of diverse medical experience specializing in pain management, our team is dedicated to improving your quality of life.
