column38: S H|Frank Loskot|James Richard|Reggie Grondin|Marianne Zinzer|Jenn Johnson|William Alford|Sandra Rodriguez
column40:
No one is perfect so I try to give grace on the first couple of bad experiences.  Today is the third time I have had a terrible experience with this office and this Doctor.  I have been in treatment with another Dr. for some time, his bedside manners and options were not good so I asked around, someone recommended this Dr.  I should have read the reviews and its partially my fault, had i read them, I would not be here today.

Here is the skinny version:  This place is unorganized, they will make you wait forever, every single time, my initial appointment was close to two hours, I was starving by the time it was done as it was scheduled at noon and they asked that I not eat anything before the appointment.  They ask you the same questions every single time, and they have not moved along in the world with technology, every form is paper.  They have perfected ways of squeezing money out of me, and my insurance provider.  I assume I am not an isolated incident and this happens to others.  The reviews I have read have the same tone, these guys are slow, non-responsive, will make you wait until you want to scream and you need medication just to sit through the call.  They will ask you for a co-pay which means they are charging insurance for every call, yes, even to call in to fill in your next months medication.  They will schedule an appointment at least 30 days in advance, they will send you reminders so you don't forget and they collect their coin.  Ultimately, someone will call you, collect your co-pay, ask you the same silly questions over and over like "what is your goal in terms of payment level from a 0 to a 10"???? ......      The doctor will never show up on time, I am writing this review as I am waiting for my appointment that was scheduled over two hours ago.  Yes, and for sure!!  they did call me to collect their co-pay before my scheduled time, but the main call with the Doctor???..  I am still on hold, 25 minutes now and counting.  Again if this was an isolated issue, then that would be fine, they did this exact same thing to me last month, I waited over 50 minutes on the phone that time.  When the Dr. Finally got on the call, she apologized, told me her team is expected to get on the phone if the call will take longer than a few minutes and that she will call later.  I did share with her that it is frustrating to have an appointment to refill medication, pay a fee, and then have to wait for close to an hour.  I shared that it made me feel like my time is not important to her or her staff.  She assured me it would not happen again, 28 minutes and counting now.  This is a joke!!  My last office, although the Dr. had terrible bedside manners, at least would fill my prescription three months in advance, all I had to do was call the pharmacy every month.  That other office would not squeeze me or my insurance company every month, and most importantly I would not have to be around waiting for her to make our appointment that was scheduled over two hours ago.  What a lack of respect for peoples time, patience and condition.  I am moving Dr.s.  Please do your research so you are not frustrated and in my shoes.  Dealing with pain is bad enough, we should not have to deal with this type of treatment from someone who is supposed to care for us.

quick update, finally 2.5 hours after my scheduled call, and after waiting over 30 minutes for to jump on.  She apologized again, said she wrote a note on my chart last time and now she will have to speak to her office staff!!  LOL!!!!  This place is extremely unprofessional!!  do your research, it will be well worth your time!|Hi, my name is Frank although you don't know me I'd like to share my Personal experience with.      Dr. Sandra Thompson. I've been seeing her now for roughly 7 years. I'm a veteran here in Boise Idaho. Many things that the VA cannot do for treatment of pain. Dr. Thompson has many different avenues to treat and deal and care for pain, in a scale of one to 10 I would highly rate nine out of ten.|I really admire the staff at the pain center. I have been a patient for several years now. If it wasn't for Dr. Thompson and her staff I would have been in life ending pain. I'm still having pain but it's more manageable than before when I didn't have a pain pump. They have truly helped me survive and manage my pain goals.|My wife and I are new to the area. Dr Thompson was suggested by Medtronic as someone who could manage her pain pump.  My wife called Dr. Thompson's office and was told by Deanna that she would have to have a referral from her doctor in California.  She called and arranged for them to fax the referral.  Dr Thompson's office could not find the fax and had my wife have the other doctor's office repeat the process on three separate occasions. When my wife called yet again to make an appointment, she was told that they are no longer accepting new patients with implanted pain pumps.  My wife had made it clear from day one that she had an implanted pain pump and yet Deanna failed to tell her from the beginning, that they were not accepting new patients with existing pain pumps.  This whole process has taken weeks to find out that she is being rejected by Dr Thompson.
To be blunt, I feel that Dr. Thompson does not care about the inconvenience and hardship she and her office have put my wife through.  She is still searching for a doctor that can help her manage her pain.  The only reason for giving her one star is there is no way to make it zero!|I am writing for my mother, Mrs Karther, who waited for months to get an appointment after two referrals from her primary Dr.  After the appointment she was scheduled for an injection which went as well as could be expected and did somewhat alleviate the pain she is continually in.  The follow up and follow thru is my complaint.  After waiting again for over two weeks, having been told someone would contact her in a few days, my mother called the office and was told she would have to schedule a follow up call.  She did and was told on that call after another week went by that someone would get back with her after they relayed the concerns to the Dr.  That was 10 days ago.  I appreciate the thoughts about relieving chronic pain, but at this point that seems to be all the staff is able or willing to do.  The follow up care is abysmal.  We should have waited to fill out their customer service questionnaire given at the office.|I've been a patient for 4 years and Im not sure why I've stayed with this practice so long.

Dr. Thompson is nice and compassionate. Yet I have waited more than an hour - for both appointments and a surgical injections, -because she was busy on the phone. I understand that she was attending to immediate issues, and returning urgent calls, but still, this is unfair to patients with appointments.

More than once, the office staff has made oversights or mistakes that affected me. Here are two examples.

Once I was called to come in a few hours early for a surgical procedure because there was a cancellation. (which I appreciated!) However, I was not "put in the queue"- someone had dropped the ball and not properly scheduled me in that cancelation spot. I ended up waiting very uncomfortably in a small partition (in hospital gown and IV) for over 2 hours while 4-5 other patients went in -and came back- from their procedure. All the while continually being reassured I was next.
I ended up having a full out anxiety attack. And the pain soared.

Another time I received a very expensive bill for a lab that has always been covered. I had to muddle through things with the insurance company to finally find out that I had been billed twice for the same lab, so the second claim was rejected.(one of the agents also said a test done for an experimental substance so it wasn't covered.?. But this might be info from an incompetent insurance agent).
I finally had to tell the Pain Center that they were wrong and have the claim withdrawn.

The even bigger deal:
An incorrect surgical injection was done- by the doctors own admission. (But I was assured two PA's were fired and my office visit was waived as compensation. ? Ha!)

Finally, The front desk has a brash matter of fact way about her that puts me ill at ease.

My reasons for needing pain care are simple, so I'm baffled by the mistakes (incompetence).
Most of the staff is nice, so that's what the star is for.
The bottom line- BE WARY! My experience could be a fluke. Maybe I'm unlucky. But I strongly recommend finding a different pain care provider. If you are already a patient here, at the first sign of a mistake, get out!|Dr. Thompson runs 2 offices in Idaho, one in Boise and one in Caldwell.  I've been to both locations over the past 5 years and have never had a bad experience with her Incredibly friendly and professional staff. I see Dr. Thompson primarily, and can't say enough good things about her. She has helped me tremendously with managing my chronic pain issues. If you need a pain management consult, the group of professionals at Pain Center of Idaho should be able to help,  but you must be an active participant in your care for it to work. If you're just looking for a pill and some sympathy, this probably isn't the place for you.|Dr. Thompson is a knowledgeable, caring, friendly amazing pain management physician. She has been providing care for my parents and has provided nothing but great care for them. My moms lower back pain has been stable along with my fathers neck pain ever since we made a appointment for them to be seen by her. She has been the most caring trusting physician we could ever ask for.

At Idaho Spine and Pain, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions through non-surgical spine care and specialized treatment for various chronic pain conditions. Our approach combines focused interventions, medical management, and physical therapy to help patients avoid painful and extensive surgeries whenever possible.

Our Specialized Services Include:

When surgical intervention is necessary, we maintain close relationships with the region's finest surgeons to ensure seamless care transitions. Our team of compassionate professionals works diligently to maximize your ability to stay active and enjoy life to its fullest. Visit Idaho Spine and Pain or call us at +1 208-672-4640 to schedule your consultation. We look forward to partnering with you on your journey to pain relief and improved quality of life.
column11:
Idaho Spine and Pain is a comprehensive pain management practice that specializes in non-surgical spine care and a wide variety of chronic pain conditions.

We use a combination of focused interventions, medical management, and physical therapy often saves our patients from painful and sometimes extensive surgery.

If you do have a surgical problem, we have a close relationship with the best surgeons in the region. We strive to maximize your ability to be active and enjoy your life. We look forward to working with you.

column38: Katie Evans|Kimberly Marie|dkgolfnut-Dennis|Alycia Dickman|Rick Youngblood|Rick Mitchell|April Bailey|Luther Klementson
column40: The office, nurses, anesthesiologist, and Dr. Zarse himself are kind, professional, and accommodating. This was the best medical experience I've had where I was listened to and the medical professionals followed through with care and understanding rather than judgement. Thank you so much Idaho Spine and Pain!!|During the time of my appointments, I had to cancel one appointment due to a hemiplegic migraine. Then I had to cancel another appt last minute due to Covid which gave me an a sinus infection. While I had Covid, my father's Parkinson's declined quickly and I had to set up hospice at home for my father. My father passed away the following weekend. I wasn't getting better with my Sinus infection and went to Urgent Care and was put on antibiotics and a Steroid taper pack. I started a steroid taper pack 2 days before my back steroid injection appointment. I called the day of my appt to make sure it was okay before I came in. The girl that answered the phone talked to the nurse. I was told by her that the nurse said to finish the Taper pack & recommended me to reschedule my injection once my taper pack was finished. That way we could see if my back steroid injection would work on its own without an additional steroid being given. I was told that Hailey the office manager would also call me back that same day. I was never called back. After waiting for a call back (one month plus) and not getting one, I called the office at the end of December to get back on the books for my 2nd steroid injection. I was informed that they dismissed me as a patient due to the 3x canceled appointments & their policy. I left a message for Hailey and she reached out to me and told me she would would call me back after talking to Dr. Zarse about my situation. Today, Hailey told me that Dr Zarse is sticking to dismissing me as a patient. It seems like Dr Zarse didn't care that it was his nurse that recommended that. That has never happened to me in all of my years of dealing with the healthcare system.  Their nurse was the one that recommended for me to reschedule. I should have not been penalized for the 3rd visit and dismissed as a patient since it wasn't me that actually canceled. They made that call. The hip steroid injection they gave me didn't do anything for the pain and neuropathy in my hip and leg. Parker the PA didn't endear himself on my first visit. He told me my pain and neuropathy was because I was old. I had no issues other than mild arthritis before my T boning car accident. Now I am in constant pain. My hip is at the point that it is locking up on me. My lower back hurts, so does my neck and in between my shoulder blades. Parker the PA didn't seem to really look at my records to see that I have a hematoma in my leg and a closed degloving injury from my car accident. I am having nerve issues with that injury as well but my ortho says I have to let it heal. I also told Parker that I had a concern that the tissues in my back look like they may have been injured (closed degloving) in the car accident but he didn't seem concerned nor want to look at the discoloration, bruising & lumps on my back. He said he didn't need to because my spinal MRI back in a June looked fine.  Closed degloving injuries take months to show up after trauma, and the pain in my back/neck, hip and neuropathy have been getting worse. Considering that I have a closed degloving injury & hematoma in my leg, it seems wise to want to look at the areas again months later to see if I had any mild closed degloving injuries. I got one hip injection by Zarse. I was dismissed from their office for reasons out of my control. I have a new referral for a new spinal doc and spoke with their office about what happened to me here. My mom is glad I have a referral to the docs/office that took excellent care of her back injury and her surgery.  They were very thorough with her, and I am hoping they will do the same for me.|My wife has been in considerable pain from a neck issue. We saw Russell Harmony and he was amazing. He was super understanding and expedited next steps for us in order for her to get the problem resolved. We were so comfortable with him and would highly recommend him for anybody that is in pain.|A year ago I herniated a disc in my lumbar spine. I was in so much pain, I felt completely hopeless. The providers at Idaho Spine & Pain helped set me up on a treatment plan that really worked, and now at a year later I'm happy to say I'm pain free.|Took my mother Shirley Buchholtz to her scheduled appointment. Dr. was rude, said he had no time for her, took her deductible & charged her insurance, said he could not take care of her appointment, come back another time.  She will never go back.|Excellent care and treatment. My experience with my usual care provider Russ Harmony has been nothing short of exceptional. The best I've ever dealt with. There aren't enough superlatives to express my thanks. Thank you Idaho Spine & Pain. 6 stars!|I have had Russell Harmony as my specialist for almost four years. He is a wonderful, professional, compassionate and patient individual. My experience with him and all of the staff at Idaho Spine & Pain has been an incredible experience in care. I have never met a more thorough and again; compassionate health care professional. The standard of care I have recieved has been no less than phenomenal. Thank you Idaho Spine & and Pain from the bottom of my heart.|They are doing what other providers can't seem to resolve, I was referred by my chiropractor and it's the best thing that happened to me. Great pain management staff

column3:
At Michael McEntire, MD, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Twin Falls.

Multidisciplinary Pain Relief Approach

We believe that effective pain management requires a multifaceted strategy that addresses the whole person. Dr. McEntire targets pain at its source through specialized procedures focused on:

  • Joint, nerve, muscle, and ligament treatments

  • Advanced spinal implant procedures when necessary

  • Carefully managed medication therapies (minimizing long-term opioid use)

  • Physical therapy integration

  • Psychological support services

Our goal is always improved functioning and lasting pain relief for our patients. We take time to thoroughly explain conditions and treatment options in understandable terms. Located at 625 Pole Line Rd W Suite 1A in Twin Falls, we're committed to helping you regain quality of life through personalized care. Contact us at (208) 814-8725 to schedule a consultation with our Dr. Michael McEntire - Pain Management Physician.
column11: Michael McEntire, MD enjoys helping patients find pain relief through a variety of methods, with the ultimate goal of improved functioning. He believes that a multidisciplinary approach to pain management is most beneficial. When possible, Dr. McEntire targets pain at its source through procedures aimed at joints, nerves, muscles, and ligaments. When necessary, he performs surgical procedures that involve implanting devices that directly target the spine. He uses many types of medication to treat chronic pain, avoiding long-term use of opioids. He believes strongly in the benefits of physical therapy and psychological support.

column2: Pain & Spine Specialists of Idaho: Daric Russell, DO
column3:
At Pain & Spine Specialists of Idaho, we are led by Dr. Daric Russell, DO, a fellowship-trained interventional pain medicine specialist with the highest level of training available in the field. Dr. Russell completed both his anesthesiology residency and pain medicine fellowship at The Ohio State University and maintains board certification in his specialty. Born and raised in Ogden, Utah, Dr. Russell is a graduate of Weber High School and Weber State University, with a Master's of Public Health from the University of Utah and a Doctor of Osteopathic Medicine degree (with honors) from Arizona College of Osteopathic Medicine.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Approach

We utilize a multidisciplinary approach to pain treatment, offering personalized care for patients throughout Idaho Falls and surrounding communities. Our services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Advanced diagnostic techniques

Located at 3385 Potomac Way in Idaho Falls, our clinic is dedicated to improving quality of life through effective pain management strategies. Learn more about Dr. Russell's expertise and our treatment options by visiting our official physician profile or calling us at (208) 522-7246.

column40:
I got a new Abbott stimulator implanted in December of 2023. I was quite leary because I had a previous spinal cord stimulator implant years ago by a different brand/company. I had a very successful trial with the Abbott stimulator and decided to go ahead with the full implant. At first after the implant I had an unsettling vibration feeling at the battery area. The team nor my doctor had never heard of this sensation happening. It wasn't painful, but felt like a vibration that wasn't the same "tingle" sensation like the program I use on my device. Even when I turned the stimulator completely off I still felt the vibration feeling. I was getting great pain relief in my back and right leg where I needed it, but the vibration sensation was scary and nobody had ever heard of it. Dr. Sandra Thompson advised me to try some muscle relaxers and give it a month to see if it was just maybe a spasm from the implant procedure. I took her advice and the vibration just disappeared in around 3 weeks. I am so grateful how caring and attentive the Abbott team and Dr. Thompson were. I could not be happier with the stimulator now and it has just been life changing with the pain relief I have gotten. I would definitely advise anybody to give it a try if it is advised to them as a pain relief option by their doctor.|Felt like I was discriminated against, because I'm a recovering addict. I didn't know I had to provide a urine specimen at first appointment because it was a consultation. I explained this to the nurse, and told her I had just used the bathroom before getting there, she told me that was fine as long as they weren't prescribing an opioid medication. Then after asking me a series of questions which is normal,p but when I was asked If I was an addict I said yes but recovering, then all of a sudden the way I was treated completely changed. When she was done, she told the provider would be right in, after waiting for 40 minutes, before coming in the room, and whispering about me out in the hall the provider, and her assistant finally came in the room, and everything about her was intimidating, and I felt like I was at the police station in an interigation. Then she said she was prescribing me gabapentin which is a non opioid medication she's all were going to meed a urine specimen before we can prescribe you any medicine. That's fine I volunteered to give one at my next appointment, and they literally made me feel pressured to give one today, before Leaving their clinic regardless and I kept telling them I didn't have to go I could give one at my next appointment. They said it was state law, but I looked it up, and it states if you're being prescribed an opioid. Anyhow so the Dr left the room and the assistant kept insisting on a  urine specimen. So then she's all I don't know what to do then so she went to ask the Dr, and she came back in and said the Dr was in a meeting and I told her that I would need two to three days notice because I had to set up medical transportation and then she got a dumbfounded look on her face like oh yeah huh like that wasn't going to work anyhow to make a long story short I got to stop providing a urine specimen I called the clinic and requested to replace with a different provider the receptionist got the manager on the phone after hearing what I had to say then she proceeded to tell me that I couldn't replace with a different provider because that was the owner of the clinic and she can talk to her or have her talk to me or whatever I told her no to ensure that they're not the only pain clinic in the area that I was going to go back to my provider and get a referral to a different pain clinic|I bring a friend here for her appointments. She likes it, likes the Dr. and the staff. I enjoy the cushy furniture while I wait.|I just want to recognize and give a big shout out to Nicole. She goes above and beyond to help her patients. She is always kind and sympathetic to the needs of others. Thank you for all your help.
Kathy martin|I appreciate the entire staff, they always make my appointments a great experience. They listen to my needs and try so very hard to help get the right meds, to make my life alot easier. I would recommend Dr.Thompson to anyone that is tired of feeling like your not being heard, she and her staff go above and beyond time and time again for me.  A BIG thanks to her and her staff.|I had been on the same medications for almost a decade for the same reasons, same dose, same amount before seeing Eric Cultbertson. I had only recently started calling due to higher pain levels after moving into a four story building. In which he prescribed me prenatal vitamins and shortly after completely took me off everything I had taken even prior to ever seeing him. I am a single mother of four children with a baby I can barely manage to hold on "good" days. Our quality of life has drastically change with no help and little hope.|I have been seeing Eric and staff for about 8 years, was very happy until about a year ago. I like many others have chronic pain. Have delt with this since 1996. Finally needed opioids to function. Eric had decided that I made a remark on a recorded line he would drop me. Had said they would extend me the courtesy of 30 day refill, he did not. I have been in the ER twice in the last week due to no medications. Have had a hard time getting my history to see someone new to help me. On the web site their moto is their patients comfort and quality of life, I don't believe that is true. Please be aware how difficult it is to see a new doctor within a day or two. Not going to happen. I wish the clinic all the best, but Please put your patients first. My name is Holli Mitchell, mother of 2, nana of 4.|I have been seeing Dr Thompson and Alla for about
6 years now, time sure has flown by fast!  My Onco Dr sent me to The Pain Center and into the very knowledgeable, skilled, and capable hands of
Dr Sandra Thompson. My Dr , Alla, and Anna, and the staff?  Are some pretty wonderful people.  I'm not sure where I'd be right now.  They saved my life, and my sanity. Chronic pain can/is debilitating!
Heather R.

column3:
Boise's Leading Pain Management Specialist

At our practice, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each individual's unique needs. Dr. Clinton Mallari brings years of specialized expertise to help patients overcome chronic pain and regain functionality. We offer a wide range of innovative treatments including:

  • Advanced diagnostic testing through GenEthix Diagnostics

  • Non-surgical interventions for neck and back pain

  • Specialized acupuncture treatments

  • Targeted spinal injections

  • Stem cell therapy for joint conditions

Our approach focuses on thorough evaluation and personalized care plans. We take the time to understand your complete medical history and develop solutions that address the root cause of your pain. Located in the Les Bois Building in downtown Boise, our clinic combines cutting-edge treatments with compassionate care. For comprehensive pain management that can transform your quality of life, visit our website or call us at +1 208-342-4700 to schedule your consultation.
column20: Les Bois Building, 115 W Main St STE 102
column38: Rebecca Shaw|Irene Strughold|CJ Burgess|Erin B|tom dalton|D&J Mouse|Tatyana Pray|Jayna Eichelberger
column40:
Dr. Mallari is the most intelegant, caring Doctor I have ever been to.  He spends quality time with each and every one of his patients .
A couple of years ago he actually saved my life! I had an appointment with him one day, and was not feeling well. I was very confused and not thinking straight. When he examined me, he knew something was not right and immediately sent me to have my blood drawn. It turned out my sodium level was at a fatally low value (which I could have stroked out,  or could have started seizuring.) I ended up in intensive care for 5 days. If he wouldn't have taken the action that he did,  I probably would have just gone home and probably died. He goes above and beyond what most doctors do.  He understands and explains in depth your diagnosis and what he can do to help. When it comes to treating your pain,  he will submit a blood test to GenEthix Diagnostics which will show what medications which will work the best for your individual needs.
I feel very blessed to have found him!|I have had a very good experience with the clinic, however a patient does have to have a different mind set for a Dr. outside the local "St." experience.
I had the stem cell in the knee treatment....much less expensive than going to Denver or Utah and equally effective.  This Dr. HAS to run his clinic like a business to keep our costs down.  If you do not get the results you want, keep asking and communicating.  When the whole staff gets to know you they are VERY helpful and I am pain free many months after treatment. I agree, one part time receptionist is a little less than helpful. ...and one is just amazing.|Easily the most dependable, honest, amazing doctor you'll ever find!  Very easy to talk to and an even better listener. His staff is AMAZING and treat everyone like family. I've been seeing Dr, Mallari for 6+ years and he's fixed what the Air Force couldn't. I can actually function now without being in constant pain. DO NOT HESITATE to call and schedule an appointment!!!|Dr Mallari is the best Dr I have ever been to. I had 2 bulging disks in my neck and he fixed them with no surgery. Also I've had a chronic illness going on for over a year and he listened and actually did some research on the virus and put me on antiviral medicine which no other dr has done. They have given me antidepressants and Adderall to take.
I am so thankful for him and all he has done for me.|I've been with Dr. Mallory for 3 years and have been able to go back to work because he will go through all of your past and find what other Dr.s couldn't ! At points where I couldn't take the pain he has used acupuncture, excellent! He just did a procedure on my lower back and I watched on the screen where he was going on L4 and L5 and put something in and relieved so much pain that I can actually sleep every night where before I couldn't. Amazing work, amazing Dr. His staff are 2nd to none. Thanks Lola!|You make the appointment after filing out too many personal info. Especially abt when did you last have S-E-X. along with other questions. Way to much abt your  personal life.  It's a 10 page form. Some of paper work is repeated on another page
The Dr charges $45.00 per visit wasn't told abt that. Paying $85 for the needles. If you cancel it's a $50 charge. Be fire you go ask alot of questions other wise you're going to get a surprise bill in the mail.|Horrible receptionist with a bad attitude.   Then after waiting almost a month they tell me they do not see spouses of previous patients and could give no real reason why.   So now here I am with some majorly wasted time on my hands and have to go through the process over again to try to see another specialist.   Which most likely tricare doesn't have another approved one on record.

This new "policy"  only hurts those that are already hurting to much to even live a normal life.|I went in for help with neck pain due to a car accident and he fixed it! He also fixed the pain leftover from a shoulder surgery. Amazing! This is life-changing. Thank you.

column3:
At Exodus Pain Clinic, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Boise area. Under the leadership of Dr. Daniel Marsh, our clinic takes a meticulous and compassionate approach to treating chronic pain conditions. We understand that each patient's pain journey is unique, which is why we develop personalized treatment plans tailored to individual needs.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

Our comprehensive services include:

  • Thorough diagnostic evaluations

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Medication management

  • Alternative treatment options

  • Intrathecal pump therapy

We pride ourselves on taking the time to truly listen to our patients, exploring all possible treatment avenues beyond traditional approaches. Our team is particularly experienced in treating complex conditions including fibromyalgia, spinal stenosis, and post-surgical pain. Located at 987 S Allante Pl in Boise, we're committed to improving quality of life through effective pain management. Visit our website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 208-947-7246 to schedule your consultation.

column38: Cherryl Skinner|Dee P|Graceful Paper|joel benson|Allison Bursinger|Nicholas Varner|The Joyful Hermit|Greg F
column40:
Disc, joint, & nerve pain nearly immobilized me for over a decade.  Dr. Marsh is my answer to prayer!  His meticulous compassionate approach is amazing. Brilliant Dr. care is worth waiting for.    Also, the Boise staff are a delight.|Dr. Marsh has been my physician for 15 years, dating back to his time at St. Al's. While his office can sometimes have longer wait times, I believe his thoroughness and genuine care outweigh this inconvenience.

I've consulted with Dr. Marsh over 75 times, seeking his expertise in managing my chronic pain. Despite the challenges of diagnosing an often-elusive root cause, he consistently approaches my care systematically and maintains meticulous records.

During the COVID-19 pandemic, Dr. Marsh respected my autonomy regarding vaccination choices. He presented his perspective, shared relevant resources, and ultimately supported my decision. This approach stands in stark contrast to the often-rigid and impersonal care I've experienced elsewhere, particularly within larger medical systems.

My prior experience with other providers highlights the importance of compassionate and comprehensive care. A previous physician prescribed a high-risk medication regimen (Hydrocodone, Soma, Xanax) without adequate consideration for the long-term consequences. When this physician retired, the subsequent providers demonstrated a lack of understanding and support, abruptly reducing my medication and creating a dangerous and distressing withdrawal period.

Dr. Marsh, in contrast, has consistently shown compassion and a commitment to my well-being. He developed a safe and effective strategy to wean me off the benzodiazepines, a process that took several years.

Ultimately, the choice between a potentially longer wait time and a physician who prioritizes thoroughness and genuine care is a personal one. In my experience, Dr. Marsh's dedication to my well-being has made him an invaluable asset to my healthcare|I never met a dr like Dr. Daniel Marsh.  From my very first appointment, Dr. Daniel Marsh demonstrated an exceptional level of expertise and compassion.
Dr. Marsh took the time to thoroughly understand my medical history and the specifics of my pain. Unlike other doctors who rushed through appointments, Dr. Marsh listened attentively and addressed all of my concerns.
I read reviews that patients stay long in the waiting room. Yes, sometimes that happens, but I know that I am listen, I am heard, and he takes time with me and other patients too.
What sets Dr. Marsh apart is the genuine care and dedication to patient well-being.
I cannot recommend Dr. Daniel Marsh highly enough for anyone dealing with chronic pain. If you are seeking a knowledgeable, compassionate, and effective pain management specialist, look no further. Dr. Marsh has given me hope and a new lease on life.
(I just wanted to say again:thank you, Camelia Stan)|While I liked Dr Marsh because of his knowledge and explanation in detail, I typically have had to wait a long time before seeing him. Twice more than an hour, walked out once, and finally follow-up visit for more than 60 minutes. I must add that prior to my last visit, I called ahead and was told the doctor was on time.|Terrible experience today. First time I was there I heard a rant about vaccinations. Which I was not there for. I have MS
So today's issue I didn't even make it past the .receptionist. She was rude and  curt as I did not bring all my medications with me. I filled out about 12 p before I even went.. and simply did not see the part that says bring your medications with you. .Mind you I take about 25 different ones. She immediately said this isn't the right place for you and the manager jumped in and said the same thing.. she's not asked for the situation was.. just cancel my appointment and I left. Do not go here unless you want to be treated like dirt!!!|If you go there, make sure you know that they make you wait anywhere from 45mins to an hour to be seen. Every time I have an appointment there, be it Caldwell or Boise. I am waiting in the back rooms. They have ZERO respect for your time!!|After over 34 years of suffering terrible pain by a drunk driver accident, then failed back surgery, I'd gone without pain help by doctors who laughed me off and ignored initial medical records.  I moved to Boise area five years ago, and was told I needed to see a pain doctor as I needed pain medication.  First appointment with Dr. Marsh, I noted his uncanny "read" of people; he sensed I was  not a malingerer nor an addict.  He also is diligent as a scientist as well as doctor.  He ordered an MRI since I had none recently, but he also listened intently to what I had to share of background regarding the chronic pain.  He immediately explored various alternative avenues of treatment which I always consider worth trying even if slight help, for any help is welcomed in my view of suffering. And he also prescribed the needed pain medication.

When the MRI results came, Dr. Marsh, meticulous and adept at reading films and noticing problems, knew I needed to have an extensive spine surgery, and got me set up with the best of neurosurgeons.  The neurosurgeon performed the serious and inctricate spine surgery, and happened to notice a rare condition that is known for progressive, severe pain and spinal, neurological effects. Dr. Marsh is familiar with this condition and has treated me ever since, monitoring and doing all feasible to help me keep going despite suffering--as he does with all his patients.

His staff at Exodus Pain Clinic is compassionate yet professional, and they run an efficient office.  Dr. Marsh is aware of many treatment modalities beyond what are the usually thought of opioids.  Dr. Marsh is a bright mind who carefully, thoroughly, delves into diagnosing and prescribing from a wide background of medical and pharmacological experience, as well as the aforementioned alternatives including supplements of which I've had some amazing relief and reversals from those he recommended (Amazon carries them!).

He knew when it was time for me to accept that I needed an intrathecal pump, and he is prudent with keeping me at the lowest possible dosing, but knows when more is required.  While meticulous and precise in office procedures that are intricate and serious, Dr. Marsh is gentle, careful, and concerned for the patient's comfort in these procedures that otherwise would be very painful.  He's an excellent mind and comfortable in conversing on topics which support and enhance a suffering person's life challenges--in all facets from support network to pets, from variety of medications as well as supplements and recently researched, inexpensive treatment options.

Dr. Marsh's concern for his patients' total needs--body, mind, heart and also spiritual well being--has benefitted me time and again as he also knows the best of surgeons and doctors in the Treasure Valley area to refer his patients, as needed.  He has a great sense of humor, as well, which helps when pain and suffering is otherwise one's  life, day and night.  If one has to wait awhile, which in my experience is not often, when it does happen I am considerate that there is someone who is in worse shape than me that day, and Dr. Marsh is doing all feasible to help the person even though it took longer than the time frame allotted. I myself have on occasion been that person who needed extra treatment and/or Dr. Marsh's added insights, or time spent reviewing tests and scans.  Dr. Marsh does not abandon patients who are serious about trying to live better lives with the trials of pain and suffering; rather, he gives himself all the more to our care with sincere concern and his vast array of medical training and wide background of experience as a physician who goes above and beyond.

All this said, Dr. Marsh has an uncanny sense of people, and he knows those who are genuinely desirous of doing all they can to manage their pain, and I'm sure he also would sense and screen or redirect those who would not be genuine.  Dr. Daniel Marsh: Great doctor, great mind, heart, soul--and great man.|By far the very best pain management clinic I have ever been too.  I am a disabled combat veteran whom has been through a lot of doctors.  Once I found Dr. Marsh my quality of life went up exponentially. He is an extremely skilled doctor. Passionate about taking the best care of his patients that he can. Goes out of his way to find the best solutions to your medical needs.
I cannot recommend this pain clinic enough.

column2: Pain & Spine Specialists of Idaho: Timothy Snell, MD
column3: At Pain & Spine Specialists of Idaho, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Timothy Snell, MD. As a fellowship-trained an
column9: Doctor|Pain control clinic|Pain management physician|Physician referral service
column11:
Dr. Snell is fellowship trained and board certified in interventional pain medicine. He completed his fellowship training at the Oregon Health and Science University.

Dr. Snell is a native to Salt Lake City, Utah. He completed his Bachelor's degree at the University of Utah in Biology with an emphasis in Pharmacology. He is a graduate of the University of Utah School of Medicine where he obtained his Medical Doctorate degree (MD). After medical school, completed a transitional internship at Deaconess Medical Center in Spokane, Washington. He completed a residency in Anesthesiology at the University of Utah, where he was elected and served as Chief Resident.

column40:
Dr. Snell is wonderful! He is one of THE BEST Dr's I have ever seen. He radiates goodness in every way possible! Dr. Snell makes you feel so loved and cared for as if you were a part of his family. How he does that is truly a gift. He his a good soul through and through. I was so impressed with Dr. Snell that I chose to drive to Pocatello from Idaho Falls for my visits. Dr. Snell's PA Tyler Hepworth is fantastic! Over the 8 years of seeing Tyler Hepworth, we have built a great patient provider relationship with trust and respect. I look forward to going to my appointments.  I know my appointment will be pleasant with mutual trust and respect. I know Tyler Hepworth will listen to my needs and concerns. Tyler Hepworth absorbs what I say. He cares about me. He cares what I am feeling and going through. Tyler Hepworth makes sure to come up with a plan that fits my needs. Tyler Hepworth is "THE BOSS!" I tell him that is why I drive 45 minutes to my appointment when I don't have to! I never get that stressed, worried feeling of concern that I will not be heard. I know when I see Tyler Hepworth, he will come up with a safe plan that works for me. I come out of my appointment with a smile feeling better than when I went in, no matter my pain level or what my day has been! I highly recommend Dr. Snell and Tyler Hepworth, as well as the amazing staff! People say, "Why do you drive that far to Pocatello when you could drive 10 minutes in Idaho Falls where you live?" I say because Tyler Hepworth is "THE BOSS!" I am happy with him, so why would I go anywhere else!!! If you want THE BEST go to Pain & Spine Specialist in Pocatello to see Tyler Hepworth *****|Very disappointed. Was referred to this pain clinic.  My x-ray was looked at and the decision was made to inject my hip which didn't help.  I called the clinic several times and was dismissed with the advice to give it more time.  The pain was debilitating.  I had asked to be referred to an orthopedic surgeon.  I finally called in tears and asked again for a referral to a surgeon and the nurse contacted the doctor.  They finally referred me to a surgeon.|Saw Dr. Snell today.  Just moved here from Colorado Springs and I have chronic jaw/gum pain.  Dr. Snell was excellent and took alot of time to listen and devise a plan.  I am so relieved to have found him.|Ok I just saw this dr. And he was terrible he diagnosed me with sleep apnea problems instead of concentrating on my back , shoulder and feet problems. I came there because I was in pain not to be diagnosed with sleep apnea which I already have. He is on of these doctors that won't do anything and referred to a health clinic. He was a waste of time|Went here for a reoccurring lower back injury that's been going on for years. The Dr. did a MRI and zeroed in on the issue and gave me the answers I was looking for. I am happy with the results.|Dr Snell is the best. He listens to you.
He will work with you. He is the best Dr to manage your pain.|They sent me to physical therapy for pain relief but it's just making things worse, I called and someone was supposed to get back to me and nothing, no one wants to listen to me that I'm actually in pain, oh we think it's just muscular.|Intelligent, knowledgeable man who seems to care and is a great listener.  Everything is good so far, will update.

column2: MISPI - Minimally Invasive Spine and Pain Institute
column3:
At MISPI - Minimally Invasive Spine and Pain Institute, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Blackfoot, Idaho. Our team of dedicated physicians advocates a multidisciplinary approach to chronic pain, ensuring that each treatment plan is tailored to individual needs.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a range of effective treatments including:

  • Minimally invasive spine procedures

  • Advanced medication management

  • Group therapy and family counseling

  • Rehabilitation programs

Our philosophy centers on not just treating pain, but teaching patients how to effectively cope with chronic conditions. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we focus on improving quality of life through personalized care. Located on the 3rd floor at 98 Poplar St in Blackfoot, our team is led by compassionate professionals including Dr. Sergio Hickey and Dr. Sneddon. Learn more about our services at pain.binghamhealthcare.org or call us at +1 208-782-3701 to schedule your consultation.
column11: There are a number of techniques and medications that can help us manage your pain more effectively. This management, in turn, can aid recovery and improve quality of life. Group therapy and family counseling may be necessary to help those who are closest to you understand all that chronic pain management involves. Rehabilitation is about teaching people how to cope with chronic pain. So even though they may have chronic pain, chronic pain doesnot continue to have them. Doctors at Minimally Invasive Spine and Pain Institute advocate a multidisciplinary approach.

Natural Pain Relief in 25 Minutes or Less!

At Treasure Valley Rossiter, we specialize in providing fast, effective natural pain relief without medication or surgery. Our unique technique addresses both chronic and acute pain conditions by targeting connective tissue restrictions that cause discomfort. We proudly serve clients in both Boise and Eagle locations, offering transformative solutions for a wide range of conditions including:

  • Back, neck and shoulder pain

  • Hip and knee pain

  • Headaches and migraines

Our certified Rossiter coaches work with you to identify the root cause of your pain and develop a personalized treatment plan. Beyond pain management, we also offer Natural Weight Solutions to support your overall wellness journey. Experience the difference with our proven approach that has helped countless Treasure Valley residents regain mobility and live pain-free. Visit our website or call us at (208) 949-3868 to schedule your appointment at our Boise location today.

column40:
Rossiter has helped me so much to go from living with chronic back pain to a pain free life! It has been so much more effective for me than physical therapy, therapeutic massage or acupuncture. The sessions are short and so effective, I feel like I walk out with a different body than I walk in with, it's that transformative because I can move much more easily and freely afterwards.|I've been to Treasure Valley Rossiter 4 times and the work I have received has always been stellar. It's AMAZING how quickly the therapy works to alleviate pain. After my first session I was able to walk. stand, and sleep with zero back pain. Then I went back for sciatica, and they got that issue resolved quickly. Then they focused on loosening the tightness in my legs (which also helps my back). And all told - I'm very impressed with the work. Much quicker results than I've received through massage, and the changes last a nice long time.|I HIGHLY recommend Treasure Valley Rossiter to anyone who has any need for pain relief, stretching, increased mobility, etc. I went in highly skeptical. I have chronic back pain and have for the better part of two decades. I sleep on a heating pad nightly just for some relief. I've done it all - doctors, different massage therapists and massage types {helps right then, but I'm back on my heating pad that night!}, chiropractors {sorry, never made a difference for me}, etc.
The first time I went to Treasure Valley Rossiter, it felt good, but didn't cure me. I remained slightly skeptical. The second time I went and saw Ellen and it hurt so good! I felt immediate relief in my upper back, more than I'd ever felt from anything else. And it stuck! For once I wasn't constantly thinking about the pain and the "zinging" in my back. I could turn my head while driving without it hurting. I just left my third appointment, and I am a believer! I will tell anyone who will listen that they MUST go have a Rossiter session. Ellen's knowledge of what to do to help certain afflictions is impeccable. She is amazing. Rossiter is amazing. If you haven't tried it (or if you have elsewhere) do yourself a favor and GO!|Ellen is the best. She unlocked my body!  I felt like I got realigned, and had more space in my joints to move around. It was like I was wearing a body sock, and she would stretch it out so I had more room to breathe and move after she was through working on me! Rossiter is like nothing I have experienced before, and I have had tons of body work done as well as practiced sports massage myself for 25+ years.  You owe it to yourself to try Rossiter therapy!|I came in to Treasure Valley Rossiter with so much pain from an old back injury that I was, at times, debilitated.  My sciatic nerve gets pinched and sends shooting pains down my hip, leg and into my big toe.  I really didn't want to have surgery, again, for a herniated disc, so when my wife said to try this out, I did.  After 6 sessions I feel a million times better!  Not 100% just yet as there's still a deeper issue going on with my back, but Josh, Avery and Nydia were able to push, pull, apply pressure to and stretch out various muscles and ligaments throughout my body to free up years of tense, irritated nerves to where I can now function as a halfway normal human being again!  The staff is kind, they listen, they care and best of all, their techniques work!  If you're having any trouble with nerve, muscle or joint pain, definitely give Treasure Valley Rossiter a try before hopping on large doses of meds or going under the knife.|Treasure Valley Rossiter is AMAZING! I have rheumatoid arthritis, fibromyalgia, chronic migraines, plantar fasciitis, chronic fatigue/malaise, and Rossiter has become a must have for my self care and health maintenance. Although I had to start out quite gentle, and work my way slowly up so I didn't cause a flare. I can now stay fairly well controlled on 1-4 sessions a month, depending on what I ask of my body in that time, how bad my symptoms are. I have been able to drop dosages and/or completely drop several medications by using this pain control modality. Anyone with musculoskeletal pain, tightness, tension NEEDS to try this! All the coaches who I have had a session with have been amazing. Cannot recommend any more. I do have to say that health is an investment though. column48: Should I avoid alcohol during the Contour Light treatments?
column49: There are three main reasons why alcohol should be avoided with Contour Light: 1. Alcohol is a diuretic and it is critical that the body stays optimally hydrated throughout the treatment program. 2. Alcohol also contains a lot of calories: a 5-ounce glass of red wine packs 100 calories! This directly conflicts with the recommendations of the program which calls for a balanced diet and a healthy lifestyle. 3. Third and most importantly, alcohol is processed as fat by the liver which directly restricts the body's ability to process the newly liberated fat.

In his previous office and his new one (moved about 2017-ish) he has always spent time and never rushed the appointment.  And that is with my personal understanding of the requirements and pressure of a medical office to rush patients and appointments in order to see as many as possible in a day while giving appropriate care.  One commenter mentioned being on pain meds for 17 years and was offended that it was brought up in the appointment?  Ridiculous...  I feel that several of these low reviews are motivated by a perceived bad experience.  Dr. Zarse, due to his focus, has probably seen more people addicted to pain meds than he can count and when someone is told that they are or have been taking them for too long (most people have no idea how pain meds even work and how the efficacy tapers off over time and long term effects) they get offended. column40:
I've dealt with constant chronic pain throughout my body as a result of surviving a near-fatal car wreck over 30 years ago. It's now part of who I am, but as I get older, it gets harder to try to pull off living a "normal" life without ongoing treatment & effective medication.

Adding to that challenge is finding qualified, empathetic, and knowledgeable professionals to be part of my medical team, especially in the realm of pain management, which has been & will be a regular part of my every day process, just as a matter of fact. I know that and am not expecting my pain to disappear, but I would like to be able to function somewhat normally and not dread waking up every day. I've made some rounds in the local pain management arena, without any real luck, until I was referred to NW Spine & Pain Medicine.

I had my first visit at the Coeur d'alene office and from my first interaction with their Spokane staff when I called to follow up on my referral, I have received the best care I could've imagined! Starting all over with new providers can be very daunting and though I had a bit of apprehension at the thought of it, that feeling disappeared from the moment my initial call was answered!

The woman who answered (I wish I could remember her name!) was reassuring & friendly to speak to, even more so once she saw that my referral hadn't yet been received & could hear my disappointment. She was attentive & gave me some heartfelt suggestions to make sure of in order to ensure that it would be sent correctly to the right place & gave me a realistic time line as to when I could expect results. After speaking with her, I completed the suggested tasks & braced myself for a likely wait of a week or so.

To my delight & surprise, she called me the very next morning to let me know that the referral had come through & I was fortunate enough to be scheduled very soon thereafter, within a week of that call, to be seen as a new patient!

My experiences with this center & all personnel with whom I've interacted thus far have been nothing short of what I needed most. From being immediately greeted & checked in to being seen, evaluated, and heard, I finally feel hope when I think of going further into care with Michelle Brothers, who was everything I could have hoped for in a pain management provider. I look forward to feeling like somebody who matters again, as opposed to somebody else's inconvenience.

(Apologies for being long-winded here but it was important to me to leave my honest review & appreciation, especially after reading some of the harsher reviews, maybe for the Spokane office,  prior to having any interactions with them, after my primary suggested that I see DNP Brothers. I can't say enough good things about the care I have received from them at every level. I would gladly recommend pursuing care from this group if you're in pain, with confidence that you will be in good hands every step of the way. Best wishes to you!)|This is a great clinic so far. The things that they have done are almost surreal even though they should be commonplace, but actually reviewing previous records, doing a good physical exam and really trying to understand what was going on and helping to find the best solution. This is the first doctors office after searching through a lot of them that don't just treat someone like an addict for having chronic pain.|First off I'd like to say the staff is very friendly but also professional and seem to be very thorough in trying to help there patients.|They effectively help my pain with care & respect for my needs.|clean/quiet office and friendly staff!|

At Pain & Spine Specialists of Idaho, we are led by Dr. Jake Poulter, MD, a fellowship-trained physician who is board certified in both anesthesiology and pain management. At QC Kinetix (Idaho Falls), we offer comprehensive non-surgical regenerative medicine treatments for those suffering from joint pain. Our specialized

Biologic Joint Pain Therapies

provide effective alternatives to surgery for residents throughout Idaho Falls and surrounding communities. We understand how debilitating joint pain can be, which is why our dedicated team delivers personalized care for a wide range of conditions including knee pain, hip pain, shoulder pain, elbow pain, wrist pain, foot pain, and sports injuries. Our treatments include:

- Advanced regenerative medicine protocols

- Customized treatment plans for each patient

- Non-invasive joint pain solutions

- Knee and hip replacement alternatives

- Specialized arthritis pain management

We take pride in helping our patients avoid surgery while achieving significant pain relief and improved mobility. Our joint pain specialists work closely with each individual to develop the most effective treatment approach for their specific condition. If you're seeking relief from chronic joint pain without the risks and recovery time of surgery, schedule a free consultation with our team at our convenient Snake River Parkway location. We're committed to helping you return to the activities you love as quickly and comfortably as possible.

column40: I'm 59 and I was having some problems in my knee and wasn't really sure what was going on. I had went into urgent care and they took an X-ray he said it could be a torn meniscus but couldn't be sure without doing an MRI. It was summer and I was busy with work and didn't want to take the time off to have it scoped if it was torn. I decided to try QC Kinetix first. I was told that if it was a torn meniscus that the injections most likely wouldn't fix it but rather than have any downtime I was willing to take the chance. It helped some over the period of a couple of months but it wasn't fixing it. I decided to have it scoped and that took care of it. I feel my recovery was amazing I felt 90% better as I walked out of the hospital. My doctor had taken lots of pictures when he was scoping it and his PA was showing them to me and said that everything with my knee looked great. He was around 35 and said if they were to scope his knee that mine would probably look better. He also said I will most likely not need any work on my knees for some time. I went back and finished the injection's and decided to do the other one as well which I'm doing right now "thanks to Jessica". She is great and was able to get me the other one done at half price per the agreement. The whole staff has been great to work with and I believe it has made a big improvement to my knees. Thanks QC Kinetix!|Well I have Arthritis in my lower back and I'm a transportation driver and listen to the radio all day. I kept hearing about this QC Kinetix and one day I decided to give them a call and I am so glad that I did. I feel so good about my decision so I made an appointment that next week and had my first treatment and it went well. I talked to Jessica and she explained everything clearly to me and I can call them anytime with questions and they get right back to me as soon as they can. There mannerisms are very pleasant. I recommend people to give them a call to hear all about it. I'm sure happy I did.|I really wish that insurance companies would recognize regenerative therapy and help clients pay the cost. I need to have my knees operated on and do not want the painful and long recovery. This option is less expensive and doesn't usually have to be done again. I so wish I had the money. My knees are getting worse and worse every day. The staff here is amazing, really listening to your concerns. I would recommend this place to everybody. Regenerative therapy is a miracle and helps with so many other ailments. I have heard nothing but good about it.|QC Kinetix has been a great experience for me. Jessica, Jennifer, and Aaron are excellent providers. They work hard to answer my questions, make me feel comfortable, and go above and beyond to provide great care. If you're suffering with pain you should definitely check them out.|I have had knee pain forever. I was sick of going to drs who didn't seem to care about actually healing or helping me the natural way. Finally a QC kinetics came to my town. From the moment I started, I felt cared for. I have been working with Jessica on my treatments. She cares about me and how I want to heal without being in pain meds or giving up my active lifestyle. Super happy with how easy the treatments are.|Jessica does an awesome job making me feel very comfortable, making the process virtually painless. My shoulder and wrist are doing much better after half way through the shots. I can now play catch with my grandchildren, which I couldn't do before.|Still going thru treatments. Jessica is great at her job. Really listens to your concerns & goes out of her way to ease them. She explains things really well. Kiara (MA) is great also, very nice & helpful.|I've had 2 of 5 treatments. So far, really good. Jessica has been perfectly professional in ensuring my comfort as well as keeping me informed of what exactly is happening. In truth, I'm excited for the potential of an excellent outcome.

column2: Pain & Spine Specialists of Idaho: Richard Runyan, MD
column3:
At Pain & Spine Specialists of Idaho, we are led by Dr. Richard Runyan, MD, a fellowship-trained and board-certified interventional pain specialist dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions. Dr. Runyan completed his Bachelor's degree at Brigham Young University-Idaho before earning his Medical Doctorate from the University of Washington School of Medicine. His exceptional training includes both residency in Anesthesiology and a subspecialty fellowship in Interventional Pain Medicine at the University of Utah and the world-renowned Huntsman Cancer Hospital.

Our Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We utilize a multidisciplinary approach to treat various pain conditions, offering:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Comprehensive pain management solutions

Dr. Runyan brings the highest level of training available for a pain specialist to our practice, holding dual board certifications in both Anesthesiology and Interventional Pain Medicine. Our team is committed to helping patients find relief and improve their quality of life. Visit our physician profile page to learn more about Dr. Runyan's qualifications and approach to pain management. We're conveniently located at 150 Vista Dr, Pocatello, ID 83201, and can be reached at +1 208-232-7246 for appointments and consultations.

At Saint Alphonsus Comprehensive Pain and Spine, we are committed to serving as a compassionate and transforming healing presence within our communities. Our dedicated team specializes in advanced pain management solutions tailored to each patient's unique needs. As part of the larger Saint Alphonsus Health System, we integrate seamlessly with our network of 4 hospitals, 6 emergency departments, and more than 86 clinics serving Idaho, eastern Oregon, and northern Nevada.

column38: Nancy Kirk|Dylan Austin|April Jackson|Steve Peterson|Zahara Al-Tememy|Jeff Habecker|Crystal Sadler|Lonnie Farnsworth
column40:
Dr. Williams and his entire staff gave me excellent care. They are still caring for me. Dr. Williams takes the time to listen to you, shows empathy and decides on a plan that he shares with you. You are part of the decision making which helps you feel valued.
Nancy|Honestly I'm so frustrated with this clinic. It took over two months for them to respond to my primary physician's referral. They cancelled my first appointment. Got in once and the treatment worked great. Finally after dealing with chronic back pain there's an answer! And then they go and cancel my second appointment...and reschedule it for a month out from that. Why am I being punished for their inability to manage their schedule?

Then I get a call - they canceled THAT appointment and now I've got to wait another month. And I can't just get on a last minute appointment cancellation list, I have to plan around this for work.

I'll be reaching out to my primary to see if there are other places to get this treatment. This is unacceptable. Patients who are seeking this care are doing so because they have debilitating pain. Based on the success of my one and only treatment, I could've been pain free within a month. Instead I've being strung on for half a year and my pain has only gotten worse. What a joke.|The staff is very professional kind, and  helpful. I appreciate the friendliness of the doctor and his nurses through the procedure. I would differently recommend Dr. Edward's to my family and friends.|After my referral, it took over 2 months until they could see me, and the scheduling itself was about 5 weeks before they could even discuss getting me on the calendar.  I was ready to trash these guys, like quite a few of the others here, but things changed for me when I actually came in for my appt.

It started with reception as they were friendly and personable.  Also, the medical assistant, Corina, was genuine and a great representative  for St. Als.  But, the highlight was Dr. Williams himself.  Dr. Williams walked me through, in detail, my MRI, my options, and then answered all of my questions in a very professional and compassionate way.  I felt like he guinuinely cared, and his kindness and passion for what he does was evident in everything he said and did.

While their staffing shortages and scheduling experience was trying, the actual care from the front desk on, was exceptional.

I'm sure others have been frustrated, but I can say that I've rarely felt more positive about a medical team, and I've had way more than my share of healthcare experiences.

If you can afford the wait to be seen, I highly recommend Dr. Williams and the team.|Took months for referral to get to them and when they finally scheduled a month out, they canceled and rescheduled it,  then called the day before THAT second appointment to cancel as well and want to schedule another month out. What a joke! Asking doctor to refer somewhere that cares about their patients!|This is another vessel in the st ALS money machine.  They are not here to perform medicine,  they are there to make money.  I was referred here,  brought stacks of records  with me.  In desperate for a solution.   Dr and I agreed that surgery isn't best option, nor are trigger point injections, been there done that.   He told me what he can offer are surgery, meds, injections.  And if that's not what I want he can't help.  He said I will refer you to my colleagues.    Not once did he look at any of my records.  He had 4-5 year old images from the saint Al's network as reference.   This is the 3rd doctor to do the same thing from this institution.  Oh you don't want our highest grossing service? Well I'll send you to someone else.    I will be calling today to ask for charges to be reversed or lowered.  Nobody performed any type of medicine, nor did they give me advice, direction, or any answers nor hope.   This is the new era of medicine folks.  The healers are gone, and it's about the cash grab.   If you have a doctor that listens and actually tries to find root problems to heal you.  Stick with them!
If you just want a quick injection, meds, or surgery without an  understanding of why;  this is the place for you.   But if you want to get healed or have an understanding of how to manage your symptoms,  I'm sorry to say this is not the place.    I am going to see this through and talk to the referred physician.  But I've also made appts with different providers.    I walked in months ago saying I was at my wits end.  Now I'm continually getting passed off to another person.   Thank god I'm not suicidal!  My lasting impression is that They don't care about the person, it's about protecting their best interests financially and legally.

I waited a couple days to post this,  I didn't want to just react.  But now that I've digested it.  I recognize the whole thing was a farce.   Goto your appt here knowing what you want and think will help.   Recognize that they are in the money making business, and sometimes treatment plans are eschewed to support that.     If anything changes in my situation, I will update this review.   But after 3 appts and now another referral,  I'm sorry to say that this is the best they can get.|This used to be a good place providing great care. I have been a patient for several years. However, the staff turnover is very HIGH!  Recently had a bad experience with one of their fairly new PAs.  Zachary Njorge.  Terrible understanding of patients needs.  Recently had surgery, right knee replacement. As I have existing issues, my need for a higher temporary pain management regime was needed. After 6 weeks of contacting this clinic, my last conversation with Zachary, I was told find another pain clinic when he tried to express his "personal" opinion rather than his professional commitment and I politely responded that I honestly wasn't interested in personal opinion and we needed to talk about handling the changes in my treatment. I now have a frozen muscle and have to go into immediate manipulation surgery for lack of proper care. I trusted this clinic (St. Alphonsus Comprehensive Pain and Spine).  Never have I ever been made to feel so disregarded. This treatment is unexceptionable.  I will be reporting this establishment to the medical board and expressing caution for anyone even entertaining using Zachary Njorge for pain management. BEWARE!|If I could rate it a quarter star I would. As the door was open for my appointment has been nothing but a comedy of error from day one. And then I find out that my referral for a pain doctor does not like to prescribe pain medication. Zach has the bedside manners of a rattlesnake

column40:
I spent years with chronic pain Dr. Roe and Lyndsey (staff) gave me a pain-reduced life I can deal with.  Their professionalism, knowledge, kindness and understanding are greatly appreciated.|Doctor placed a pain pump in my grandmother without any other options given. We were told by a doctor at Portneuf in Pocatello that the pump is normally only put in as a last resort for cancer patients. He also explained they placed it in a terrible place and this was probably causing  her so much pain and pinching nerves. After some time we got the pump taken out by Portneuf. She has had no more pain since and is finally recovering. I highly recommend to stay away from this place.|Don't waste your time. No tangible resolutions were provided, and it's obvious that helping the people that really need it wasn't the priority. Do yourself a favor and look toward any other recommendation, referral, or option before resorting to this sorry excuse of a pain management provider. You'll save yourself a lot of frustration and/or disappointment in the end|I showed up for my appointment and the  receptionist wouldn't check me for my appointment.  After 30 minutes she finally did. Then she told I was over 30 minutes late so I told that would just leave.  She had the talk with me.  Again I was late.  They accused me of lying and they very rude. I will never go back. Very unprofessional and lack of ethics.|Burley Pain and Spine, is a health center that has shown a complete lack of professionalism and basic communication skills. My experience with this center has been nothing short of frustrating and disappointing.

I had an appointment with their doctor on February 14th, 2023, for a consultation on the possibility of receiving an epidural for my herniated disk that was causing numbness in my left arm. After being approved by the doctor, I was told that they would contact my insurance for approval. However, I did not hear back from them for two and a half weeks, despite being told that it wouldn't take that long.

When I tried to call them to inquire about the delay, I was always directed to leave a message, and they never returned my calls promptly. Finally, on March 7th, I received a voicemail from their surgery center stating that they were ready to schedule an appointment with me. I provided them with my availability dates for March, and they left me a voicemail on the 16th of March, proposing a date that was not available as per my schedule.

The incompetence of Burley Pain and Spine is mind-boggling. They could not even schedule a simple appointment properly. They informed me that I had to be seen in the clinic (AGAIN) before they could schedule the injection, as it had been over 30 days since I had been seen. This is ridiculous, considering that I had been waiting for them to get back to me for weeks.

If you are looking for efficient and professional medical care, I strongly advise against visiting Burley Pain and Spine. Their lack of communication, disregard for patients' time and well-being, and general incompetence are simply unacceptable.

I hope this review serves as a warning to others, and that they do better in the future.

Edit for update. It's been 4 months and the new issue is that apparently, they only have someone in billing maybe every week and a half. Their voicemail claims someone will call back within 24 hours or the next business day, however the last two or three times I've tried to call to make payments, nobody answers the phone and they don't call back until a week and a half later. I have, multiple times, left my schedule so that they knew when I would be available for a phone call. They still called me when I was at work (the one time they would call after a week and a half, anyhow). I finally left a message saying strictly, DO NOT CALL ON THE FOLLOWING DAYS, and gave them my work schedule. Otherwise, I figure they might as well write the bill off. I am throughly frustrated and disgusted by their services and will not be seeking treatment here ever again.|I've been a chronic pain patient for 26 years, I've met a lot of doctors both good and bad. Dr.Roe is one of the best doctors I've worked with, he is fair and treats me very good, he communicates with me and works with me which is extremely important to me, especially in these times. His new P.A Lindsey is also amazing to work with. I could not ask for a better clinic to work with. The ladies in the front office are outstanding in their abilities and are very easy to work with. I don't give these recommendations lightly. They come with the utmost respect for his practice. Highly recommend Dr.Roe and Pain and spine consultants.|Trying to deal with this place to get treatment for my spouse has been awful.  Lots of the run around and being told they are waiting on something only to find out they had the proper documents over a week ago.  And the person who most often answers the phone is extremely rude and speaks down to you.  I hope the rest of the process goes better and my spouse get some relief from his debilitating pain.|My husband had an injection and it worked great! He had been doing physical therapy for months and felt more relief with this (he also continued to do his exercises afterwards).
