column3:
Specialized Pain Management in Downtown Boise

At Beacon Pain Clinic, we provide comprehensive pain management services from our convenient location at 115 W Main St in downtown Boise. Our medical team specializes in developing personalized treatment plans for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. We offer a range of therapeutic approaches including:

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

  • Medication management

  • Interventional procedures

  • Headache treatment protocols

  • Collaborative care with other specialists

Led by Dr. Rebekah Guy, our clinic focuses on improving quality of life through effective pain control strategies. We take time to thoroughly understand each patient's unique situation, creating treatment plans that address both immediate relief and long-term management. Our approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care to help patients regain functionality and comfort. For appointments or more information, please visit our website or call us at +1 208-342-2104.
column38: Ashleigh V|bondobrian|Kristy Friesen|T V|GARY Deatherage|Karen Hurst|Chelle|Jaime English
column40:
Valerie is awful. She hung up on me several times and threatened to send me to collections. I have only had two visits with this office and paid both times out of pocket. She also insinuated that because I don't have insurance there is no way I would have been seen which is in fact a lie. Dr guy is also a joke. They all treat you as if you want opioids. She literally looked me dead in the eye and said she wasn't prescribing opioids. I never asked and was only wanting to find answers to my pain which I finally found a dr that looked into my mri and helped you without the use of drugs. This office should be ashamed. Unless you aren't walking in there with a cane they treat you like a drug addict. Horrible place, move on!|I was a patient of Dr. Guy for 13 years. I followed her from St. Al's in Boise to her beginnings of Beacon Pain Clinic. At St. Al's I seen her once every 3 months, but after starting Beacon Pain and having a low number of clients at the beginning, I had to see her once every 2 months.
Now after 13 year I received a letter in the mail (which took 2 weeks to get to me from the date on the letter head) letting me know she no longer wanted to see me because of a commitment I made to her. After 13 years of seeing her we knew each other quite well, but somewhere in in-between she changed her personal boundaries and I missed the signs. But to dump a patient that receives monthly medication for chronic pain with a 2 week notice is wrong. She knows there is no way a person can get into a new pain clinic in 2 weeks, let alone 2 months.
After reading her reviews, it sounds like I was not the only one to receive this kind of treatment. I guess I should of realized what kind of person she was/is after I learned that she couldn't keep employees. Also if you're reading this, I dare you to call her phone # listen to the 54 second message, leave a message, and see just how long it takes for someone to call you back.
Oh yeah, detox was aweful and the pain is so miserable I can barely move, but hopefully in another month, I might find a new pain management doctor. I prey everyday that I can anyway.
She's the devil in a white smock who interests have change, and just wants to take care of her new Spa business.|Dr. Guy is the best of the best in this expertise! I've seen her for years and she is patient, knowledgeable, compassionate and creative  with her resources and finding ways to provide relief! I pray she never retires!!! If you're looking for someone who cares about the person, has an excellent bedside manor and will find a way to bring relief Dr. Guy is the Doc you need!|Dr. Rebekah Guy has been my pain management doctor for years. She is THE BEST not only in my opinion, but in my other doctors opinions too. She's thorough, runs complete check ups, doesn't over med, doesn't under med, is reliable, and I find her sweet calm demeanor very refreshing. I've known Dr. Guy probably since she first started out as a MD and she's still the same sweet doctor I've always known. I am getting ready for surgery and she's never given up on me. Do not try to pull the wool over her eyes with narcotics seeking because she's a great doctor and will not play that game. I've had one other pm doctor before her who used to throw meds at me and when I didn't reorder them each month, he'd simply call them to be refilled anyway. I hated that and appreciate how Dr. Guy checks our meds, does UAs randomly. It's a way to protect me, but also protect herself. I've never had a problem with her or her lovely staff. She truly is a miracle worker in many lives with chronic, severe pain. When my pain gets too much I go unconscious. Since she's been taking care of my pain, she's resolving that by getting me the help I need like finding a surgeon to help relieve my pain plus a medication schedule. Meds are not meant to take ALL of the pain away - they are used with other things like P.T. and shots to give a better quality of life. If you don't like Dr. Guy it's probably because you're abusing your meds or trying to. We need more doctors like Rebekah Guy! My referring doctor ONLY refers her to his patients that need to go into pain management. And I trust her completely. You won't find a better doctor anywhere!
Tonya V.|My wife has been on a pain management protocol for more than a decade. We relocated to the area and she was referred to this clinic. These people are the worst! In 4 months, they have yet to return a call or even scheduled an appointment.  We've had all of her records and a personal letter from her former physician sent, and still no response.|I saw Rebekah Guy several years ago (in 2019-2021)following a referral that i requested. . I was very clear on my needs and how much medication I took at the time to deal with headaches and other related pain. I actually took and wanted less than most docs are asked to prescribe!! I thought i was a pain doc's dream patient given how little i was requesting i was going in for my regular appointments, getting urinalysis'and meeting with the doc. I would report when and how much medication I took before the urinalysis and it never differed! So very shockingly after an appointment I received a formal letter in the mail  stating I was being dropped as a patient because what I Reported I took did now show in my urinalysis and that she suspected I was breach ing my patient contract..my husband and I pieced together as her thinking  I was selling my pills when it couldn't be further from the truth!!
Some ppl would take 1 full pill as a dose..I only took a half pill as my dose. I had mentioned that I had taken it 6-8 hours or more  before my appointment!! There was no consideration given to half-life and metabolism in my body processing the meds!! Nope. She just simply accused the cop's wife (the cop, who at the time was working with the DEA to crack down on major dealers of pills in the Treasure Valley)of selling pills!!  I was so angry getting this letter and inflamed that I could barely speak (which is a feat for me! Lol !! I was incredulous that I'd been accused of such a thing when I only was taking 1/2 pills 2-3 times a week!! I would've laughed had I not been so angry! And I wasn't allowed to defend myself with her or the clinic bc I was no longer a patient that could make an appointment or talk to her directly!!
So...be careful of what you may be accused of by the staff!! You could become a drug addict or dealer depending on how they see you as a patient!!

Oh and their restroom is not wheelchair accessible per Google!) by a long shot!! Think "barely bigger than an airplane bathroom!! This is a converted old house when bathrooms weren't considered needing to be beg! But don't advertise it's accessible when ppl in wheelchairs weren't asked The wheelchair fit in but the dance my husband had to to do to get us in there was sad!! As I remember there were no safety bars around the toilet either i mean..What business doesn't provide those for liability purposes!!

The staff did not know now to cope with my need to urinate into a toilet "hat" and not directly into a cup!! They acted SO put out by it!! They are medical staff who..likely worked with a variety of patients and they acted like I was the first patient to be such a pain!!|I've been with Dr. Guy for more than 3 years. She is my 3rd pain management doctor and by far the best. Dr. Guy listens-really listens-to her patients, and doesn't treat us like she's doing us a favor. She cares about how our pain effects our quality of life, and is always open to discussing our treatment plan, making changes and helping us to live normal, productive lives, again. Katie, Rachel and Ashley (her office staff) are the best ladies, and work really hard to keep things flowing smoothly!!|This is the best doctor I have ever seen and I have seen several doctors with all the stuff I have going on in my life and I still yet to meet a doctor as good as her. She really listens to what you say and wants to help you. I couldn't get no answers about what was going on with me until I started seeing her and I'm finally starting to understand why. I'm so thankful that I have found an amazing Dr. to help me along this journey and cares about what is going on with my condition. Her staff are also so friendly and helpful. #grateful

, takes a personalized approach to each patient's unique situation. We believe in creating treatment plans that restore quality of life while using the lowest effective medication dosages possible

column38: Angela Koenig|Melissa Eldenburg|Roxanne Garrett|Jenniffer Sisk|J Elements|Tiffany|Alice Hammock|Kristofer Tryner
column40:
I have been seeing Dr whiting for 10 years or more. I have RSD ( reflex sympathetic dystrophy) it is known as suicide disease. I have never had a problem with Dr whiting staff or himself. When I need medication or when I HAVE TO TAKE A LITTLE BIT OF A STRONGER MED FOR A LITTLE AND THEN GO BACK DOWN. When I don't need it. Through all this I find him to be compassionate, smart, extremely knowledgeable , honest . There is no one who knows everything. And if he doesn't know he looks it up right there. I cannot believe some  of the negative comments on his reviews. It is the total opposite of his character that I have seen. Because of my condition I have seen a lot of doctors and I think he's the top of the line..|If I could give more stars, I would....I have gone here on and off for about 4 years and continue to be more and more impressed with the care I receive. Dr. Whiting is very compassionate, very knowledgeable and takes the time to actually check in with you and teach you about how the body works, receives pain signals, etc. Recently I have been seeing Jana, who is a total gem. She  is so very sweet and actually cares about your well-being. It's very refreshing to see Dr's who want to treat you with the least amount and lowest dose of meds, while still being effective. The front  desk staff is very helpful and get back to you right away when you leave a message. The office also incorporates modern treatment options, including laser tissue therapy for pain management.  Thank you for continuing to serve me and the community in the best way possible. I hope I don't  ever have to see another office  for these services.|Have been a patient of Dr. Whiting for 10 years..it's a great clinic, well staffed and very caring..Finding a pain mgmt. clinic in any city isn't easy, thus I have been driving almost 200 mi. round trip, now that I no longer live in the Coeur d'Alene area, that's how important this clinic is for my specific medical needs..thx Dr. W. & staff!|Very unprofessional I had 1 assessment and than some providers quit. They lost my files and could not find accurate information. Than billed my insurance for an account they claimed didn't exist. Appointments were canceled in same day when I came from 45 minutes away. When I called to reschedule  days in advance and  nobody called me until 1 hour later the receptionist recorded it as a now show. She was very rude to me not recording accurate information.  She myst not want people to know than calls are not returned in 24 hours like it is stated.|Just wanted to leave a review for other people considering this place, whether it is for pain management, addiction treatment (Suboxone) or other wise.

My Doctor was Jana Qualls. Echo is the front desk receptionist.

I have to rave about these ladies. They have exceeded my expectations in everyway. Jana is one of the most compassionate, understanding, accommodating  and smartest doctor I have ever met.

I struggle with addiction, which is why I got to R.H. Quite literally this team is the absolute best place all around I have ever received treatment at. I am actually blown away by Jana. She is amazing and other doctors do not compare. Echo, the front desk lady is also the best. She isn't snarky and seems to really love her job and care about the people who come in through the door.

This is my second year there and I greatly appreciate everyone here and just wanted to put this out there, for anyone who is seeking treatment and on the fence where to go. They will work with you and your insurance.

Thank you so much Restored Horizons and especially Jana Qualls and Echo. These people truly care and wouldn't recommended anyone else, state wide or even in WA.

Thank you and God bless!!!|I have been a patient of dr. Whiting's since 2011 when I came off the streets as a full blown addict originally introduced to him at RCC where he offered ORT. He has ALWAYS listened intently to my views, and medical struggles and has always chosen what was best for me even when I didn't agree at the time. Initially he had me on subs for 9 months in conjunction with SUD, and mental health- wrap around services. I went "cold turkey" off the medication as I saw my dependency switch to another and I wanted freedom from the narcotics. A lot of people get confused on the core of the problem and believe a pill will resolve the problems they face. I didn't. I wanted freedom from the bottle and stopped at nothing to get that freedom. I truly worked a program of recovery and completed successfully.
A year later came back to see him because of an injury that has seriously compromised my quality of life and everyday ease of mobility. From the gate, he listened to me. Sent me for the images and the work up needed to substantiate and show me that in fact, I am a chronic pain patient. I fought tooth and nail to be free from the prescription bottle and the absolute last thing I was doing was going back to that helpless, hopeless, momentary living reality of the up and down roller coaster of addiction.
I think where people get messed up is they are looking for one thing, pills to solve there struggles. The pill will only for hours work folks. And dr whiting isn't about upping doses and the medical science he will explain is that less is more. The tolerance is science and the medicine doesn't need to go up, up, up. If this is you, go to the methadone clinic, go see David Robinson in Spokane valley, he specializes in this and it's not the same as pain management. That is substance use disorder and your at the wrong place for that.
Dr whiting has proven over and over to be invested in restoring quality of life with the lowest dosing possible which is different for every patient and yes, with whiting your a patient not a number on a medical invoice. Each patient is given the same opportunity and some just are at the wrong place. Drug addicts won't last in this practice. I'm a recovered drug addict that under dr whiting's care, my quality of life has been restored even through two major surgeries and the likelihood of SUD kicking back in. He did my pain management following both major surgeries and I personally do not entrust that part of my life to anyone but him. He teaches the medical and science behind your spacific medical conditions and seeks to educate his patients and offers many options not just pills. There are many ways to ease pain depending on medical conditions and limitations. Because of dr whiting's support, encouragement, education, and his compassionate heart so long as your here for the right reason he will serve you well.
He deserves the recognition of seeking to improve chronic pain patients quality of life. He is well educated on all fronts. And shares his knowledge, explains what happens in the body and brain with these substances. For those that truly are chronic pain patients and not drug seekers or addicts his practice offers wrap around services to attack your pain physically, mentally, emotionally, as well as chemically (pain meds) he will work with you to meet your own medical goals. Many services are offered right there in his practice.|I have been in pain mgt for 21 years and spanning 4 states. Of all the providers I have seen in that time, I would rank Jana Qualls as one of the top 2 in terms of compassionate bedside manner, responsiveness and expertise of her specialty and the complexities of caring for patients who suffer from chronic pain.

I felt like a 1000 lbs burden was lifted from my shoulders once Jana took over my care and I honestly believe God has shown me some favor by pairing me w a provider who feels more like a coach instead of an adversary. I can't think of enough good things to say about her and I would absolutely recommend her.|this guy is a joke he is unprofessional and dont say anything he doesnt like. he knows your in pain and need your meds so he uses it to his advantage to make you bow down to him and the way he treatd you, i tried saying something to hin on my wifes behalf and he flipped out and starts with the accusations and disrespect. he knows he can do it or he wont give u meds and label you and since his word is god you better behave. my wife died of cancer we used to see him. i wouldnt see this guy.

column3:
Specialized Pain Management in Boise

At William G Binegar MD, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Boise area. As both an anesthesiologist and pain management physician, Dr. Binegar leads our dedicated team in delivering personalized care for chronic and acute pain conditions. Our clinic specializes in innovative procedures including the MILD procedure, pain blocks, and the Minuteman procedure that have helped countless patients find relief. We offer a full range of services including:

  • Interventional pain management techniques

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Minimally invasive procedures

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

Located at 301 W Myrtle St in Boise, our professional team includes skilled physician assistants who work alongside Dr. Binegar to ensure every patient receives attentive, compassionate care. For more information about our services or to schedule a consultation, visit our Pain Care Boise website or call us at +1 208-342-8200.

column40:
I had the MILD procedure and for the first time in almost three years I've had a significant reduction in back pain. Dr Binegar and his staff listened to my concerns and answered all my questions. Everyone was very helpful and pleasant. Dr Binegar explained other possible procedures to help me stay active. I'm really happy that I found Dr. Binager.|I was nervous going to see Dr Binegar because he
Was different from the  mainstream medical treatment.
To my surprise and relief I received the best care ever!!
The MILD procedure changed my life , for the first in years I have been able to do flowers and landscaping. The staff is so wonderful, everyone has been so kind and supportive. They made me feel like they really care about me. Dr. Binegar is the man!|After seeing Dr. Binegar for over a year we tried everything to figure out my pain, a MRI, a fibromyalgia questionnaire which was obvious that was my issue he kept persisting I had an issue with my spine and only wanted to proceed with injections. He never helped me with "pain management," and now after a lot of money paid all I can tell you is DON'T go see him, frankly he's rude and treated me poorly, and won't do anything for you. I can say the staff is nice though. Do not recommend this place at all...|I have been a patient of Dr. Wm. Binegar for a number of years because of severe back pain issues. What has impressed me is his honesty and  candor. He has never promised miracle cures of my pain, just an honest  assessment of the pain relief he has to offer.  I have found him to be a compassionate professional and I am please with the care I have received.  His office staff is efficient, friendly and understanding and make the visit a pleasure. I have referred friends to him and will continue to do so.|I live with constant and frustrating chronic pain (I'm an active 56-year old who loves to walk and hike), and I have found some relief with Dr. B. He listens to me, which is not very common among pain docs, I have found, and we plan a pain-relief strategy together mostly steroid shots as there is not much else to do. I've all but given up on a pain-free life, but at least I get a reprieve on some days.

He's a good doctor, and I recommend him or his new colleague, who is also understanding and willing to try new methods.|My experience at Pain Care Boise was amazing! Dr. Binegar was so kind and took so much time in explaining the steps of the procedure that he performed on my lower back! The staff is exceptional! They went above and beyond to get me scheduled right away, and were all very professional!|Dr. Binegar treated me for almost a year. During this time I given many many injections. When the shots failed to produce good results I was told my only choice was a spinal implant. I liked him and his staff, but giving shots seems to be the only treatment they offer. So in the end it was just too bad for me.|BEWARE! Do not go to this doctor! All he wants is to make money on rejection and monthly return visits! He is not fair or sympathetic!!!! Dr. Binegar will not prescribe the pain medication I need. I have been taking the medication for over one year before moving to Boise and GP referred me to Binegar. He immediately reduced my pain medication and my pain went sky high. His personal policy trumps my degree of pain. I am scheduled for new injections in my neck on 7/20/2020. This may be my last attempt to save my life. He will not debate the issue! He just will say no. I wish HE could live with my pain for just one day. I have tried every back, hip and SI joint injections and got minimal relief in my hip. The relief lasted one day. Same with the second hip injection and many other injections. He could care less about MY PAIN! I strongly suggest you get everything in writing before you visit or undergo any procedure. If he/they do not generate results there will be no charge. I just keep rotating through their system. It's all about money, it's not about helping me! I again, look forward to my upcoming visit and pray I get some relief and he/they will be more reasonable when prescribing pain education. I am in so much pain and I know my body will shut down soon and I I could possibly die! Please help me now before I need to file a complaint with Idaho Board of Physicians. I also want a copy of my bills! Thx, Ken

column3:
Specialized Pain Management in Idaho Falls

At our pain management practice, Dr. Daniel P.W. Smith provides comprehensive care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. We specialize in treating a wide range of pain-related issues including degenerative disc disease, joint pain, skeletal muscle pain, and arthritic conditions. Our approach combines evidence-based treatments with personalized care plans that may include:

  • Targeted joint injections

  • SI joint treatments including fusion procedures

  • Medication management

  • Alternative pain relief options

  • Collaborative care with physical therapy

We pride ourselves on taking a thorough, direct approach to pain management, focusing on finding effective solutions while keeping our patients safe. Our goal is to improve quality of life through careful assessment and individualized treatment plans. Located in Idaho Falls, we welcome patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions. Contact us at +1 208-535-3626 or visit our official provider page to learn more about our services. Our office is conveniently located at 3302 Valencia Dr STE 201, Idaho Falls, ID 83404.

column38: JoAnn Fullmer|Samantha Klavon|K A|Laura Wendy Jaikaran|Kk Killer|Shawna Furniss|Patsy Williamson|Christina Archibald
column40:
Dr Smith has helped me tremendously with severe degenerative disc treatments, SI joint injections and bilateral fusion, skeletal muscle pain, arthritic pain.   I like the fact that he is direct, get's straight to the point. He doesn't waste my time, I try not to waste his time.  I respect him and value his unique talents, intellect and straightforward manner.  He's polite and often get's down to business quickly.   I see so many doctors, that I greatly appreciate the quickness of my routine appointments. (15 minutes or less)

Keep in mind it takes time to build trust and effective communication - especially when appointments are kept as brief as practical.  It was probably six months before I actually knew that Dr Smith was the right fit for my pain management needs.  I was relieved that isn't intimidated by my complex medical history with multiple rare diagnosis. He simply focussed on what he does best: Providing pain relief options while keeping his patients safe from potential pitfalls.   It's my job to make sure my other doctors are kept in the loop, then make my pain management decisions based on input from all of them.

Dr Smith's is the navigator,  his patients are in the driver's seat.  He answers any odd questions I ask, addresses any concerns I have.  He isn't offended when I question a specific approach or if I decline part or all of his offered treatments.  He also keeps an open mind when I have suggestions.    Dr Smith has a passion for practicing pain management and it shows.  He stays abreast of recent studies, new treatments, changes in practices, etc... He lets's me know when there is a new development  that relates to one of my conditions.

I have recommended him to my close friends and family.

.|I don't typically leave reviews, but I can't in good conscious not leave one. I was recently seen by this provider and left the appointment in quite literally tears. This has never happened to me, and I don't want this to ever happen to anyone else and especially when one is in severe pain. This provider made me feel shamed and made me question advocating for myself. I made it quite clear to this provider that my quality of life has been severely affected, he had physical medical documentation that he went over that showed a bulging disc, arthritis in both the neck and lower back at only 35 years old and this still was not sufficient enough for him to provide me something to manage the pain while I get through physical therapy and other alternative methods to a long term solution in regards to pain. He also made the statement that it sounded like I could have fibromyalgia which most know is painful disorder - as are most auto immune disorders. I'm on the waitlist for every rheumatologist in town. He stated his opinion was "we aren't quite there yet." and I didn't need anything more than ibuprofen. I would think my medical history/documentation would take precedence over his opinion and it's truly alarming this provider is working with pain management patients. The quality of care with this provider was non-existent, caused a flare up with my auto immune disorder due to stress, had to take the following day off work and to top it off I paid for this appointment. I've been through x-rays, CT scans, MRI's to finally get to the point of my PCP referring me somewhere to get help for pain, I finally felt a ray of hope with this appointment coming up but instead left worse off than when I went in. It was a dehumanizing experience in a place where one should feel safe, seen, heard, and taken care of considering this is a doctor's office. This has been upsetting on so many different levels for me and will have lasting impact on me and medical appointments moving forward.|I absolutely lobe Dr. Smith! He gave me hope when other pain specialists told me there was nothing wrong from a car accident! And he truly listens and cares! He will take baby steps and try everything possible. It can take a long time to heal but he was very thorough and trying everything possible before jumping to surgery. He was able to get my pain under control and got me the answers I needed to live a pain free happy life.|DR. Smith is one of the best docs I've ever come across. I have been in this pain for over 12 years. He was kind, respectful, informative, and willing to let ME have a say in my own care! Not just push his own agenda down my throat like other docs do.Highly recommend!  Miss him so much!|My wife had brain surgery in 2017. Since then she has experienced nerve pain and severe headaches. She was referred to Dr. Smith in 2021. He tried two medications that our family Dr. hadn't tried. When they didn't work he said there is nothing more I can do for you. This guy is a total ripoff, don't waste your time.|I have been going through numerous pain shots and medication. DEMETRIOS PLOMARITIS, PA-C has been my doctor for awhile. When he joined the team that made me even more inclined to come to Dr. Smith. Dr Smith takes his time to explain things.  He is not a pill pusher and that pills are the answer to it all. He explains all the alternatives before just passing out pills. I would HIGHLY recommend them.|Dr D Smith cares. He takes the time listen
He takes notes and works to find the cure.
If you have pain that is 24/7 please get in to see Dr D. YOU need to take notes and pass them on to Dr D. Listen to him, do you exercises  You work together to find the cause of pain.
He cares.|Dr.Smith is a professional provider. He has great bedside manner and delivers great care.

column3:
At Gritman Interventional Pain Clinic, we believe that finding relief from pain can lead to a more fulfilling life. Our dedicated team works in partnership with you to address the root cause of your discomfort, not just mask the symptoms.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We offer a range of specialized interventional techniques including:

  • Trigger-point injections

  • Nerve blocks

  • Radio Frequency Ablation (RFA) for migraines and chronic pain

  • Steroid injections for joint and back pain

Located in Moscow, Idaho, our clinic combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care. Our physicians and staff take the time to listen to your concerns and develop personalized treatment plans that align with your specific needs and goals. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we're committed to providing solutions that help restore your quality of life. Visit our website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 208-883-6700 to schedule your consultation.

column40:
I am most favorably impressed by the entire staff at the Gritman Interventional Pain Clinic. Dr. Justin is most helpful and informative. His staff are most excellent people. I can't remember the names of all of them, but Ben was one with whom I was very impressed. The ladies who helped me were very good and kind. Thank you to all involved.|First time going for neck, hip, back trauma and nerve pain. I didn't feel heard, I felt like the doc made light of my pain, and concerns. In one appointment he said I just need to lose weight 3x .. like I never noticed. I'd probably be fit like before if I could do the things I use to. Anyway, so rude, beyond unhelpful, and unprofessional.
Needless to say, they didn't do anything to help me.|After being misdiagnosed by Pullman Regional for severe back and leg pain, I went to the Gritman Quick Care and Dr Lynn James quickly and accurately diagnosed the source of my problem. Xrays and MRI were performed at Gritman and I was sent to the Gritman Pain clinic. I'll admit that while being in extreme pain I am not the easiest person to deal with. Dustin Gill at the Pain clinic and Lynn James at the clinic were professional, great in their engagement and explaining the issues they discovered. Not to mention I truly believe the have the right diagnoses, Kudos to Lynn James and Dustin Gill and his crew.|Everyone I met at the PC has been wonderful. I most highly recommend them. They are kind and very professional in what they do. I'm very grateful to have been in their care. Thank you to everyone who that were. Involved with my care and. Procedures.|Ablation of my knee prior to knee replacement helped with rehabilitation.  Staph and doctors knowledgeable and courteous.|I have been dealing with severe back pain from an injury, this group of people are so amazing not only did they explain everything to me so I could understand it and not ( talk in doctor) they were extremely patient and understand. Careful and gentle when it came to the injections, they explained every step, so I knew what they were doing as they were doing it. The room was full of 5-6 doctors and nurses all there to help and make the process as easy and as comfortable as possible. I was feeling extremely un easy (due to back pain). The nurses gave me ice chips, a cool rag on my neck, and blew oxygen in my face to help calm me. They were 1000% on top of it. From beginning to end. I was not a number to them I was.... like family, they treated me with the utmost respect and took their time and didn't make me feel like I was a burden or taking up their time. I was constantly told to take my time that there was no rush when it was time to leave. I had a nurse at my side 98% of the time to see how I was doing, seeing if I needed anything and to take care of me. For an outpatient process, I have never felt so calm and respected and treated with such respect. I will definitely return for any and all other pain management concerns. Definitely worth the travel to see them|I had a fairly long appointment which I appreciate and all the nurses and supporting staff were very nice. The doctor however hardly let me get a word in and I felt he minimized certain issues and didn't even address others. As a younger women getting someone to take issues seriously is important to me and I didn't feel that sense of concern at all was just told to go see a general physician as if I haven't done that for years without success. I felt belittled by the end of the appointment and don't plan on coming back.|Just awful! For a pain clinic to stretch out your healing process for 10 months. There are other options, be warned!

column3:
At Saint Alphonsus Pain Management, we provide specialized care for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Dr. Eli Harris brings extensive expertise as a board-certified anesthesiologist focused on interventional pain management. We offer a personalized approach to pain relief through:

  • Advanced spinal interventions

  • Nerve blocks and radiofrequency ablation

  • Medication management for chronic pain

  • Specialized neck and back pain treatments

Our team is committed to developing individualized treatment plans that address the root cause of your pain while improving your quality of life. Located in Nampa, our modern facility at 4424 E Flamingo Ave, Suite 310 is equipped with state-of-the-art technology to ensure the highest standard of care. For consultations or to schedule an appointment, contact us at +1 208-302-3760 or visit Dr. Eli Harris - Saint Alphonsus Pain Management.

column40:
Dr Harris has been awesome in the 4+ years I've been going to him. His clinical staff is very attentive and goes above and beyond. His NP Zac is phenomenal. The front desk people aren't very welcoming, but maybe that has to do with staffing? The only reason for not giving 5 stars is, even though I've been a patient for almost 5 years, it's very difficult to get an appointment, but thankfully, I can make my appointments well in advance. It's almost as difficult to get into see Zac. I really like the 2 providers ( Dr Harris & Zac NP ), it's just their ancillary staff that can make coming here difficult.|I have had DR Harris for a while now. I would not have anyone else do the work on my neck or back. I trust him with my life  He is a great and awesome DR.|Very judgemental before I even met him. Extremely disappointed and insulting. Had to wait over a month for him to even review my referral, I had to call, no one ever called me. Impolite front desk read his documentation to me. Dr. Harris documentation was extremely condescending and unhelpful. Pretty much told me to move on. Wonder why he went into the medical profession if he picks and chooses who he wants as a patient. I never even met him, but if that's the way he communicates with patients through his front office, no thanks. He can make his money off someone else.|I've been a patient of Dr. Eli Harris for over a year. I see him for pain management. He was recommended by my primary care physician. If you are looking for a doctor who is easy to talk to and someone who really cares, then this is your man!  I can't say enough good things about him.
I don't want to leave out his staff. The front office-terrific!  They are always pleasant in person or on the phone. And Katie his medical assistant Is one of the sweetest persons you would ever like to meet.
Thanks to Dr Harris, Katie, and staff for helping me on my journey to feeling better.

Linda Brown|The most attentive and committed doctor I have ever had. Chronic pain for 6 years even after multiple surgeries and Dr. Harris is committed. He sees me. He hears me. His ability and willingness to continue thinking outside of the box in comparison to other doctors is truly something that's rare. His willingness to collaborate with other doctors is something I've always thought was missing in the pain management world. Thank you for seeing and hearing me!|The doctor, Eli Harris was great.  Unfortunately he forgot to send in my prescription and it took a couple of calls and a futile visit to my pharmacy before it got cleared up.

As for my appointment, I felt some hope for my pain for the first time in a very long time.  I am hopeful that my next appointment will help my hip and back pain.  Dr. Harris was very informative and most important, he actually listened to me.

I would recommend him to anyone.|It honestly went from 5 stars to 1 stars because of his staff members. The staff members has zero empathy when things go wrong for a patient and is completely frustrated and being lied to.   I'm not going to name names behind, but stay away from his office unless you like to be talked down to by staff members.|First time there, the receptionist was very nice. The wait was way too long and they really should have more comfortable chairs, I mean it is a pain clinic after all. The Doctor was a nice guy and made me feel comfortable. I would recommend them. So yeah I reduced the star, and would say this, they could all use some integrity classes

column40:
Dr. Wood is extremely knowledgeable and caring. She takes the time to listen to you, and truly wants you out of pain and healthy. She has been a life saver for me and my condition. I will forever see Dr. Wood as long as I have this condition and would absolutely recommend her to anyone. Her nurse Debbie is awesome and kind and the front staff is amazing! Absolutely LOVE Dr. Wood and this entire office!|Dr Wood is top notch! She took time to look at my medical records and then after the appointment look a second time. She found things that 3 other doctors overlooked/ignored and had real solutions. She looked for the cause of the problems and didn't just blame everything on being overweight. She is one of the good ones and we are lucky to have her in our area!|So grateful to find Dr Sneddon. He saved me in a time when the pain was unbearable and I was feeling completely helpless.
He will sit and look at your MRI with you and help you understand what is going on with your pain. Something I never received from other Doctors.
He knew exactly what to do, and did it quick. After multiple failed injections from other Dr.'s, he got it done!
He's also very friendly and fun to talk to. I only wish I would have found him 2 years earlier.|Dr. Wood was wonderful.  Very knowledgeable and skilled.  She answered all my questions clearly and the suggested treatment was very successful. She was involved in all aspects of my care, and it was really nice dealing directly with the doctor.  Dr. Wood's staff was kind and professional.  The nursing staff at Bingham was excellent, also.|Dr. Sneddon did the "MILD procedure" on my back on 17 Jan. 2023. I experienced immediate pain relief after 4-5 years of increasing nerve pain! I truly haven't felt this good in years! I sleep really well, and am able to move, unencumbered, without pain!  I am not "cured" and still get occasional twinges, but my attitude, ambition and physical capabilities are 95% improved!|If I could give a 0 I would. 20 years working with Dr. s as a nurse and a patient. Gaslighting is all I have to say and I wouldn't take anyone to this dr. and am so glad I don't treat my patients this way! What shocked me was the statements she made to me based on judgement and no facts!|Dr. Sneddon has been amazing! He AND his staff are both very caring. He explains things thoroughly--which is great because I do NOT like surprises when it comes to my health. He has been very proactive in helping me finally finding relief from pain as a result of a herniated disc and pinched nerve. Thanks Doc! I'm glad I found you.|I've been going to Dr sneddon for years. He has been incredible. He has been treating my pain with injections and it has been very effective. He made it possible for me to be mostly pain free without having to take pills.

column3:
Comprehensive Physical Medicine & Rehabilitation in Boise

At Idaho Joint and Spine, we are an independent medical clinic specializing in physical medicine and rehabilitation with a focus on improving quality of life for our patients. Our practice is led by experienced physiatrists who take a holistic approach to pain management and rehabilitation. We offer a comprehensive range of services including:

  • Pain management for acute and chronic conditions

  • Specialized headache and migraine treatment protocols

  • Osteopathic manipulation techniques

  • Therapeutic injections and medication management

  • Personalized rehabilitation programs

We pride ourselves on taking the time to listen carefully to each patient's concerns and developing individualized treatment plans. Our team combines advanced medical expertise with compassionate care to address various musculoskeletal and neurological conditions. Located at 1760 N Mitchell St in Boise, we serve patients throughout the Treasure Valley area. Visit our website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 208-322-5922 to schedule your consultation.
column11: Idaho Joint and Spine is an independent medical clinic specializing in physical medicine and rehabilitation. They offer a variety of services including pain management, headache treatment, migraine treatment, osteopathic manipulation, injections and medications to treat various conditions.

I have had a great experience with Dr. Whitaker, he's kind, listens and is always willing to try many different approaches. Very flexible office staff and I really love that he works a lot with students. I enjoyed seeing new medical students each time I came, it really brings a new perspective to the exam room. I don't see that very often and I think it's awesome that Dr. Whitaker does it, not only for the medical students but for the doctors and the patients!|Dr. Whittaker has been treating my back and vestibular migraine for the last 4 years.  He is down to earth, personable, and knowledgeable in multiple areas of pain management.  He is one of the few physicians who truly cares about his patients.  We always talk Bronco football as he is a fellow BSU graduate!|This place has offered the worst customer service imaginable since day one. They re scheduled me twice after setting my appointment back two weeks from the beginning. No sense of urgency. Treated me like a number. Made it clear that they don't really care about the patients as individuals. My medical concerns are zero concern of theirs. Would recommend any other options out there before dealing with these folks.|I couldn't be more fortunate that I found Dr. Whitaker and he was able to finally help relieve my chronic migraine issues.

I had been suffering from migraines every single night when I would lay down to go to sleep for about two months, I had looked for every solution to help my pain acupuncture, chiropractic, pharmaceutical migraine medication and nothing would help. Dr. Whitaker provided trigger point injections that overnight helped my situation and I have been migraine free for about six months now.

Thank you so much to Dr. Whitaker , I will forever be a lifetime patient!|Dr. Whitaker and his staff are amazing, caring and wonderful. Dr. Whitaker listens and cares for his patiences, he is definitely that best doctor in Idaho.|My first appt. James Whitaker was 1.5 hours late after my appt time.  Came in once and said, "I am going to go do this adjustment and then be right back in.  You understand don't you?".  Had to have a prior auth completed for my injections, wasn't started until I called the office (and my insurance ahead of time to see if it had been done) to inquire about it 2 weeks after the appt.  Appeal had to be done, which was completed.  Response from insurance has been completed for 3 weeks, no call from office to schedule.  After this much time and inconsistency, not going back.  Especially since I drive one hour to get there!  HORRIBLE SERVICE.|Dr. Whitaker just solved excruciating issues I was having after a surgery. I was in pain every day that was usually bringing me to tears. I was adjusted and so many symptoms are just gone. My quality of life has restored! I had given up hope. I got my last adjustment today. I can live life! Im free! I am ready to start building muscle back and enjoying my body again  THANK YOU - YOU AND YOUR STAFF ARE WONDERFUL|His staff is amazing. Doctor Whitaker is very unique. He takes the time to Listen,  He also makes sure that after every appointment I feel a difference, Even if it's minor. I feel like he really cares for every patient. I feel like he does his very best to figure out how to fix my unique problems! I also feel like he would do the same for any other patient. I have recommended him to several of my family members.

column40:
When I tried to get the person I saw to let me know why I was denied service with this clinic I couldn't get a straight answer from the person I was dealing with. Had he taken the time to go over with me what the problem was things might have been different as the information that he was using against me isn't accurate at all. The misinformation that was used against me was created by a non related doctor to cover up a mistake made with my treatment. Health professionals that don't verify information usually make problems worse for the patient. To be clear, the information that was used against me is a work of fiction created by a non facility doctor covering up his mistake. One more thing - they sent the devastating report to my regular doctor without examining me.|I have seen two providers in the year I have been receiving care here at first everything was great until several months later when my first provider came in suddenly checking my back talking about my t12 wedge fracture and possible treatment. That confused me as I was under the impression I was receiving treatment for that already but wasn't. It was already to late for that possible treatment through inland imaging. Ended up having an ablation that has reduced pain in a minuet amount but it's not enough. The provider I see now she really listens with concern, empathy, and kindness. I feel like an adult when I see her and not like a misbehaving child that my fist provider made me feel like. Overall this PainClinic has been great Lisa schedules timely appointments, always returns my calls by the next day even if we end up playing phone tag she always tries again, she is friendly, personable and has a beautiful smile on. Madison is a wonderful provider and the doctor who comes out to perform procedures is amazing. I wouldn't want to go anywhere else. The only thing I could complain about is trying to call in it's difficult to reach anyone. I suppose that's due to the amount of patients they have and our needs.
I have recommended this business to very close friends and loved family members.|Every member of the team at The Pain Clinic in Spokane has been exceptional. Lisa has gone above and beyond in scheduling to make things happen to match my timeline because I work out of town. Extra special kudos to her, she is really on top of her game. Her efficiency and knowledge makes it all run smoothly. Jonathan has explained everything phenomenally and is just a delight. Always upbeat putting in the extra time also making things happen. The doctors who performed all my procedures have been awesome as well. They know their business and I appreciate their expertise. I have been extremely satisfied with my experiences here.|Very friendly staff. Very compassionate. Appointments always on time, a sign of great scheduling and time management of MA and PA.
Johnathan has great bedside manner and never makes the appointment feel rushed. He listens.
Will always be a patient as needed here. Thanks for quality care!|As a new patient they have been very helpful and will listen to you unlike many other clinics, etc., so far ZERO complaints .|I've gone here a few times after being referred by a NP. I had to argue with the doctor to have anything done as the doctor had felt by looking at images taken years ago, that there should have been no reason why I was having issues.

They do not care about their patients, they only care about making money. I will not be coming back, and I will be finding somewhere else that actually treats people like they should be treated.
Like people.

There is so much more going on here but i feel like it is a doctors office so your experience may vary.
I just don't care for my time and my money to be wasted, and I feel as though people deserve to be treated with respect.

The billing department also willy nilly chooses what to charge, they wait for insurance to pay, then they charge the patient some more after writing off a portion of the bill they no longer care to try to collect from insurance.

Ten outta ten don't go here folks.
Get treated like an actual person and go somewhere that the people working actually care about their patients.

Specifically to the front desk lady working today who needs to get her bias under control and not be such a disrespectful person.

It's a bad image, a bad company, and bad practices.|Jonathan Lippman is the provider I see. He is professional, caring, and most importantly; he listens to what I have to say. I appreciate the efficiency of our appointments. The pain specialty field usually burns out the best providers. Doc Lipmann is the best I've had over the decade I have been treated in this field.|Was literally told, you are better off than most of my other patients. Can you dress yourself? Take a shower? Perform daily functions? Then,  I guess we could try a nerve block and you could try LDN. The mri you had on your back 2 years ago looked great. Then told me the medication I was on wasn't helping me. When indeed it was helping me. Did a trial nerve block and was told several different things by different people that made it confusing. I switched pain management clinics and come to find out I have a disc hitting nerves in my back and chronic costochondritis. My back is not fine and my side has a legit reason for really bad pain. Told my primary all of this and she said after I told her several of her other patients complained about this place also.

column2: Eagle Rock Neuropathy and Joint Pain Center
column3:
Your Path to Pain Relief and Renewed Mobility

At Eagle Rock Medical, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions designed to help you reclaim your active lifestyle. Our dedicated team develops personalized treatment plans for various chronic pain conditions using advanced techniques and cutting-edge technology. We're proud to offer a full spectrum of services including neuropathic pain management and joint pain treatment throughout the body. Our facility features:

  • Custom orthotics created with in-house 3D printers tailored to your unique needs

  • Regenerative medicine therapies that promote and accelerate natural healing

  • Computerized Gait Analysis and Fall Risk Assessment for comprehensive care

Located in Idaho Falls, our mission is to empower you to move freely without limitations. Whether you're suffering from nerve pain or joint issues, visit our website to learn how we can help you find lasting relief. Call us today at +1 208-425-6020 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.
column11:
Eagle Rock Medical: Your Path to Pain Relief and Renewed Mobility
At Eagle Rock Medical: our mission is to empower you to move freely and live an active life. We offer comprehensive treatment plans for chronic pain conditions, including:
- Neuropathic pain management: We specialize in alleviating nerve pain using advanced techniques.
- Joint pain treatment: Our experts develop personalized plans to address pain throughout the body.
- Custom orthotics: With in-house 3D printers, we create orthotics tailored to your unique needs to improve gait, balance, and function.
- Regenerative medicine: We offer cutting-edge regenerative therapies to promote and accelerate healing.
- Computerized Gait Analysis and Fall Risk Assessment

column40:
I have had intense shoulder pain for about 5 yrs now. X-rays over a year ago revealed a bone on bone situation that requires surgery for pain relief & then healing time. I don't have the means of money, time or insurance to help this situation.
I've seen Dr Wirick about this situation & we talked about stem cell therapy could be a route for relief. But insurance doesn't help a natural therapy program.
I received a text about a special he was running & thought well, I'll sign up & see what happens.
It was a PulseWave Therapy. Oh My Goodness a Miracle has happened!!! Literally!!! I went on a Monday, for treatment & with in an hour or less ( I think I was in shock) that intense achy grinding pain was GONE !! I went back  on Thursday for a follow-up & another treatment. And the best part, I don't go back until I begin to feel that pain again. And it was more affordable than a regular doctor office visit & no healing & physical therapy treatment, that is a 6 month out of circulation surgery.
I'm so excited & relieved from that intense pain!!!
I'll be sure to follow-up with my next treatment & how long this process last pain wise. Please don't hesitate if you are considering this PulseWave Treatment. Do it !! U have nothing to lose but pain.
Thank You So Grateful I responded & did this !!!|I have been very pleased with all the services I have been receiving at the Sensor Medica Clinic . Starting with stem cell therapy in my knee.
I was due to have complete knee replacement surgery  when I heard about Sensor Medica Clinic & the  stem cell therapy.
They are friendly ,knowledgeable ,very professional and truly care about their patients.
Thank you all @ Sensor Medica Clinic !|Looking at x-rays of my back, I wondered how I was even walking.  It looked like the disc was gone at L5 and I was dealing with bone on bone. And the constant pain and numbing feelings going down my leg were unbearable.  I wondered how I was gonna continue my life this way.  I was told I was going to need surgery on my back, but that was not an option for me.
When I learned about Dr Wirrick doing stem cell injections, I met with him immediately.  To my surprise, I was quickly financed to get the injections and I couldnt be more pleased with the results.  One month after my injections, I was feeling a lot less pain.  It's been 4 months now and my back feels stronger, healthier, and the pain is gone.|Very poor service in the regenerative department all over a simple phone call. I got a message from Monty, for someone in regards to starting therapy. I messaged them back asking them not to contact my number due to the person no longer being with the number. I wanted to make sure they got my message, so I called them and a rude and impatient lady answered my call. When I told her the persons name who contacted me she said she didn't know who that was and seemed like she didn't care that I didn't want my number (a new number that I got a week ago) associated with them anymore. I mentioned I didn't appreciate how rude she was being and she started freaking out at me. And eventually hung up. Not very happy, blocking any number associated with this company.|I cant say enough good about this awesome place, Sensor Medica!  I am so excited to be out of pain thanks to the wonderful process of  Regenerative medicine!
Everyone that works there are so helpful and so wonderful to work with.|I had a great experience. I had shockwave done on my sore elbow and it helped right away. After a few treatments my pain was gone. Thank you!|You should change your hours on the door. I've come several times and no one is here. Door locked. I've had appointments and no one is here 
You need to clean your exam rooms.|This is the second go around of getting injections and once again I'm very pleased with everything that has been done and so far the results are very good.

column38: d e|Margie|KEITH Tarver|Lj|Cheryl Baugh|Phillip Talamantes|craig cavanaugh|Renee Kliebe
column40:
Dr. Marsh is by far the best pain management doctor I have ever received care from! He is the fourth pain mgmt. physician I have had in my 15 years of chronic back pain. I have been under his care for three years. Since finding him, I am at my highest level of quality of life since beginning my chronic pain journey. He is the most knowledgeable, caring, listening, problem solving, kind, and professional pain mgmt. physician you will ever find.
Dr. Marsh understands that each patient's body chemistry and diagnosis is unique; he does not treat me with a "one size fits all" approach.
Dr. Marsh is dedicated to listening to me and understanding my symptoms to provide solutions for reducing pain and identifying potential procedures or long term remedies to continue improving my quality of life. Thank you Dr. Marsh, you are a gift from above!|Review for Dr. Marsh,
In the years I have been with Dr. Marsh he has treated several of my health issues. Neck and back pain
from a motorcycle accident in the 70's and the aches and pains that come with rheumatoid arthritis.
feet, legs and entire body pains.
He has been very attentive, observant, patient, understanding, and compassionate. He also has
researched in detail all of my excruciating pain. He takes the time to talk and listen to my ideas. He has
been able to recommend many different treatments and has done much to help me navigate my pain
through the years.
He has researched pain therapies especially designed for me and provided many alternatives for me to
try. I have improved so much. When I first saw Dr. Marsh I could hardly move and now I am up shopping
on my good days and doing activities I never thought I could ever do again.
Thank you, Dr. Marsh for improving my quality of my life and teaching me pain techniques that will help
me forever.
Finally, after being tossed around from Doctor to Doctor and ignored, I found Dr. Marsh and he came up
with resolutions to help me with my pain.
Thank you for helping me getting back my quality of life|I've been seeing Dr Marsh for over 15 years and he's not a fruitcake or a flake!   He saved my life and I will always be in his debt.  He's not only a good pain doctor but is just a very good doctor to trust for just about anything medical.  He's always been very empathetic and willing to listen to you without bias.  I'm appalled at the negative responses posted here and only can say if you're unhappy with his treatment, you must have other issues other than pain.|Dr Marsh is an excellent doctor, I have been seeing him for nearly ten years and in that time he has always been courteous and respectful. He is one of those rare doctors that will spend the time needed to listen to you, and although he is a specialist, he is always open and patient in his approach to your pain and/or injury with a more synergistic view. As many doctors become more and more specialized and only look at what they specialize in, I feel that he takes the time and has the knowledge to look at at the patient and take a synergistic view. I appreciate too, that he constantly is attending conferences and keeps up on the latest findings,  procedures and techniques and present these new options to his patients--that said, he still listens to his patients and their views, and very supportive of your decisions on how to proceed. He is a rare breed, a very caring and knowledgeable doctor.I simply cannot say enough good things about him, I have the highest respect for him as a doctor and human being. He is quite brilliant yet still very approachable and kind.|My husband has been seeing Dr Marsh for years and now I am as well. Very good Dr. Dr Marsh is smart, listens and seems to me has a sixth sense about my medical issues. He leads you in questions until he can pin point what the problem is. I recommend this Dr highly.|Kind and knowledgeable he will help you achieve your daily goals|Dr. Marsh has been helping me manage my pain in a very professional way for several years. He always is trying help me and I don't mean force drugs on me.
We have a great relationship and I trust his judgment.|Dr. Marsh is a very caring, non judgmental Doctor. He listens well and asks for clarification .  Dr Marsh is non threatening and treats others with respect. I left the office feeling peaceful and with dignity. Dr Marsh is a greatDoctor.

column3:
At the Minimally Invasive Spine and Pain Institute, Dr. Sergio Hickey, MD brings exceptional expertise as a double board-certified specialist in both interventional pain medicine and anesthesiology. We pride ourselves on our comprehensive approach to pain management, focusing on advanced precision diagnostics to identify and treat the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer treatment for a wide range of conditions including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Spinal stenosis and degenerative disc disease

  • Nerve compression and neuropathic pain

  • Craniofacial pain and headaches

  • Abdominal and pelvic pain

  • Arthritis and pain from traumatic or chronic injuries

Our goal is to maximize your quality of life through personalized treatment plans tailored to your specific needs. We combine cutting-edge interventional techniques with comprehensive care to help you regain function and reduce pain. For more information about our services or to schedule an appointment, please visit Dr. Sergio Hickey at Bingham Memorial or call us at +1 208-239-8023. We're conveniently located at 850 Yellowstone Ave, Pocatello, ID 83201.
column11: Dr. Sergio Hickey, MD is a double board certified in interventional pain medicine and anesthesiology. He places emphasis on advanced precision diagnostics, and a comprehensive approach to treating the root cause of pain and maximizing quality of life. He treats a broad set of conditions such as back and neck pain, spinal stenosis, degenerative disc disease, nerve compression, neuropathic pain, craniofacial and headache pain, abdominal and pelvic pain, arthritis, and pain arising from traumatic or chronic injury.

column38: Sara|Carol Hansen|Heather "Sunshine" Feather|George Hendrix|Jeremy Jones|mikel Thompson|Linda Wylie|Greyson Belew
column40:
Had an epidural steroid injection by Dr. Ispirescu. It was flawless. I've had a couple done at other clinics and this was by far the least painful, quickest, and most effective.|Each experience is very individual, After reading the 3 reviews I felt that it would be very hard to believe those who are actually ranting against this clinic.  Maybe you had to wait a bit, let me tell you the real reason that pain clinics are different from a regular Dr's office..  As a pain patient I was seeing the same Dr in a Seattle Clinic "Minor & James".  I was getting help there until my Dr retired (I was with him since 1995).  Because of the government and what they are doing all clinics including Minor & James kicked ALL pain patients out.  You might notice that there are many "pain clinic" opening up now...that is why.  The doctors are overwhelmed and under the gun when helping pain patience.  I read a lot about the pain clinics and I was so scared, most were there to get people off medication and treated patience as if they were Dr shopping and their goal was to get ALL pain patience off of medication.  I didn't know what I would do if I had to deal with those clinics.  Drs. all over would not take pain patience!  There are many patients that have chronic pain and there just isn't a cure put pain medication helps many of us get through the day.  Remember many of us are 70 years old and more, DA, The list is too long to share, there are many chronic pain issues for us; no cure.

The day came when I went to see Dr Ispirescu and his staff.  They took a lot of time looking at my records and the many years I've been in terrible pain.  All the right questions were asked.  Because I had been on the same dose of pain med since 1995 and they help me through each day, they kept me on my retired Dr's program.  I was shocked because from what I read I thought that pain clinics were there to take you off pain medications.  Naturally there are people that are on them for the wrong reasons and they may have to work on other ways to get their pain under control.

Recently during an appointment a women asked me if I would consider giving them my DNA, I said yes.  When I got the results back I was relieved to know that I was not going to become an addict (my DNA is very clear about results)  The other finding was if I say I am in pain I AM IN PAIN.  Then it covered some medication and explained what type would not be good for me and would react against my body (DNA).  I thought that the Dr would benefit knowing what their patients DNA was so they could better plan for them.  I was asked to do another DNA and am still waiting for the results, this one will cover most if not all types of medication and what I should avoid taking.  I thought this pain clinic cared about their patients.

It is up to us to be prepared with question and if possible create a plan that you can work on to help yourself.  Not everything they have tried worked but at least we tried.  I have to live with this pain and I am thankful that this clinic is there for us.  I hope they can continue to work with us without the government scaring them to death or worse closing them down because they do help patients and if they would really benefit by taking pain pills and be respectful of them.  I don't know what I will do (and all other real pain patients) if something would make them close.  Many people would not be able to live because of the pain.

When I see any Dr. I get the Dr's notes, it is helpful to have a record of what was done and said.

Thank you Dr Ispirescu and staff.  I wouldn't want your job, it would be very hard to deal with the variety of patients that come in.  The people that are writing bad reviews apparently have not tried to get a Dr. to take them, there are not any in Sandpoint and all American cities.  We are living in very unsettling times and at 70 years old this trouble is the last thing I thought our government would do to harm us.  The people abusing medication are in the spotlight and the people who NEED the pain medications are being punished along with the doctors.|I can't believe some of these reviews!! Dr. Ispirescu is a rare and amazing  Doctor . Let me start with whats going on in the medical world. People,  everything is changing for legitimate pain patients. The Dr. That I've been seeing for over 8 years who not only was the middle man for all my specialists in Seattle and Oregon, prescribed and managed my pain medications (all per recommendations ,tests and procedures from specialists ) was informed that all patients on long-term opiod pain management had to be referred to a "pain specialist /clinc" This is happening all over the U.S.!! There's a staggering number of patients with legitimate pain needing both care and compassion from an already overloaded field looking for help,especially in Idaho and Washington to which the Majority of pain specialists either won't take, or Insist on a "Forced Reduction" against your wishes or choice . Stopping most or All opiod therapy completely .which leaves a patient with constant and acute pain helpless, hopeless and looking for help. Dr. Ispirescu from my 1st appointment listened, asked questions was compassionate and understanding. The 1st appt. with any Doctor (Especially one for pain ) will NOT prescribe anything especially opiods as not just a precaution for them but the patient as well (any Dr who does is WRONG unless it's an ER  ) to give time for any tests to come in , read medical records, confer with Your other Doctor(s) etc (he made sure my referring Dr. was still managing my meds in the meantime) a  2nd appointment was made before leaving and that appointment was when we came up with a plan of care . Dr. Ispirescu was even more attentive and amicable our 2nd appt. Not only myself but my Caregiver and friend who goes to ever Dr appt with me , felt not only comfortable and  happy with his bedside manner but his attention and time he spent answering questions . I understand that He is a busy Doctor but as I stated in the beginning he must be getting so many requests for pain patients let alone all the surgical procedures with Back patients not just at the Sandpoint location but at the clinics Washington location as well, in no way have I ever felt rushed by him ( I can't imagine how he has any personal time himself) The entire office staff are Amazing!!! I don't understand the reviewers that claim otherwise Because my experience from phone calls to front desk all the way through to nurse and Nurse Practitioner to Doctor I've had pleasant ,cheery and personable experiences above and beyond. I believe people treat you the way you treat them but still this office and entire staff are nothing but refreshingly personable,  upbeat and accommodating.|It was awful. I was treated like a junkie looking for drugs. No compasion at all for my documented cronic pain condition due to a work related injury. My previous doctor could no longer prescribe for me once I got my referral. It was over a month before I could be seen by Dr. Ispirescue. I was allowed to go for that full time with no pain management. No one could understand why I was upset and less than cheerful having gone so long with no pain management and even less sleep. A woman was sitting outside the building in a wheel chair waiting for a ride. She had received the same. Don't expect an ounce of compassion from this doctor.|Expect to be treated incredibly poorly and unprofessionally if you are even slightly overweight. Your pain will not be treated. What you will receive is a lecture about your weight from a sickly looking vegetarian who looks like he can barely lift a clipboard.

Additionally he'll push a vegetable only diet without apparently understanding that if you are overweight the reason you're overweight is not because you eat too much and have the nerve to eat meat and fat but rather the beta cells in your pancreas can't handle the extremely high amount of sugar and starch which is turned in to sugar during the digestion process. He clearly does not know or understand how and why the body produces fat. Here's a Biology 101 lesson for the doctor and anyone reading: Your body will turn excess sugars in to fat. It does not just plop any fat you eat on to your fat cells. Additionally pushing increased sugar and starch consumption on a fat person is just ordering them to develop diabetes, heart disease, and a host of other related conditions. He'll also mention calories which goes one step further in demonstrating that this doctor didn't pay attention in his chemistry courses. The calorie is a nonsense diet metric as no human literally burns their food. The calorie is a great way to know if a food is good for fire but isn't a worthwhile metric for a system that is powered by acid based chemical reactions that do not involve the ignition of the foodstuffs.

Additionally the staff will forget you are waiting to see him because if you are seeing him at Idaho Pain Clinic's Washington location you are not seeing this doctor in his own office but rather the hospital in Newport, which is deserving of a negative review of its own. If you do manage to be remembered by the terrible staff you're still in for a major wait as they overbook their appointment slots and don't seem capable of handling the workload.

Lastly if this doctor's got ethical or moral issues with treating people with pain relieving medications he should think about switching specialties. The reason patients go to pain clinics is to get their pain taken care of. If it bothers this doctor that his job is to be the gatekeeper to pain relief and can't handle the thought that patients may become addicted to their medication then he really needs to switch jobs. I recommend waste disposal that way he can still have his moral dilemmas which he appears to need and the patients he would see might be able to see a provider that can handle treating chronic pain.

Overall seeing this "doctor" was an insulting and aggravating waste of my time. I wish I could bill this joke of a doctor for my time, fuel costs, and the irritation I experienced.|Dr. Ispirescu,  is a wonderful doctor, very caring and shows true compassion for his patients. I would highly recommend him to anyone who may need pain treatment or knowledge he is very good at both. The staff is also excellent ,friendly and professional. He takes time with you and is very prompt.|Had such high hopes for this place.  After suffering with unexplained foot pain for 7 years and trying many meds and procedures, my GP referred me here.  Dr. Ispirescu skimmed my written summary of my symptoms and all the meds and procedures that were tried.  Then he told me I should go to Costco and buy a Vitamix so I could start drinking Smoothies to get enough Omega 3s.  When I asked him if that was what's in Fish Oil, he replied yes.  I then told him I had been supplementing with Fish Oil for over 10 years.  At that point he admitted that the Smoothies probably wouldn't help me.  What?!  He then recommended that I try a new therapy called Anadyne (probably not spelling that right).  I did try that for a week at this clinic with two different PTs who were amazing (and the reason I rated this place one star and not 0 stars).  I felt like this therapy provided some degree of relief.  Because we were moving the next week, I wanted to try to continue this therapy in my new community.  I tried to get a copy of my records to take with me.  I asked several times over the next week and was constantly told the doctor had to "sign off" on the records before I could have them.  Finally on the last day I left my new address so that the records could be sent to me.  It is now almost a year later and the records have still not appeared.|Compassionate, knowledgeable. I like Dr. Ispirescu very much. The other pain clinic and surgical staff are knowledgeable and friendly. I'm surprised at the poor reviews given here. I'm happy with my care.
