Stopped in to inquire about massage and was treated really well. The whole place is clean and well run. Everyone was nice and the equipment was new. Had a great experience with the massage and left with a back feeling better. Go through the front door and turn left.|I am absolutely thrilled with my physical therapy at We Care Wellness! I have been struggling with chronic knee pain for two years. I went from being very active with hiking, Pilates, yoga, strength training and cycling, to barely being able to walk two blocks without a walking stick. In just 4 sessions with Jenny Jones, my knee pain is almost gone and I am becoming more active! I highly recommend Jenny and We Care Wellness! I feel like I have my life back.|Submitted on behalf of my husband, James Jeffery We Care Wellness Patient

When I first came to NuBack in 2019 now known as We Care Wellness, I could not walk without the assistance of a cane, due to a previous work injury in 2014. While awaiting surgery for my knee, my other knee was impacted from my gait. I experienced back, hip and knee pain. I previously went to several doctors, and I was told that I could have a nerve ablation, or lifetime of a medication, neither one was very appealing. As I tried to ease the pain I was feeling, I turned to hydrotherapy at a local gym. There I met a good friend who was in a similar condition. The next time I saw him, he was walking upright. He told me about his experience with and I made an appointment. Before going in, I prayed that I would be okay with what was ultimately God's choice. Whether I was to heal or not, I wanted to be sure that I accepted the results. Then when I entered and began the treatments with the PT team, I was amazed at how much better I felt, I walked out of the first appointment without my cane. Over the course of the past few years, with additional visits strengthening me and making me feel better and better, the program has left me and my family in a tremendously positive light. We Care Wellness physical therapy changed my world and I want to thank them for it. May God who healed me bless them greatly. -James Jeffery|The back therapy I received was very helpful in relieving my cronic lower back pain. After my second session I was able to turn off my back stimulator and keep it off. I also reduced my pain medicine by 50%. The therapy help me strengthen my core muscles and start down a path of less pain allowing me to start activities, like working around the house and in the garden, and enjoy myself. Jenny doesn't believe in "No pain no gain" but rather, if you're feeling pain then we need a new aproach. It takes time and effort but in the end it's well worth it.|I injured my back in a mountain climbing accident when I was 22, and had surgery at 28, more than 40 years ago.  I've always enjoyed an active lifestyle, but have had a number of episodes over the years when my back would go "out" for 2-3 weeks at a time, unable to walk.  I've tried chiropractic, massage, physical therapy, but nothing gave me lasting results.  The last couple of years, my back pain has escalated to the point of reluctantly spending most of my time reclined, unable to sit upright for long, or enjoy my daily walks.  Last fall I learned about the back program at "We Care Wellness Center".  They use traction, low frequency vibration, and gentle exercises to increase spinal disc height and balance by 80%, and increase strength and muscle building by 30%.  The day I started treatment, I could barely walk.  By the time I left that first day, I felt better than I had for years, and walked out nearly pain-free.  Approved by the VA, I have continued the program, and am feeling better and stronger with every treatment.  I have learned exercises and techniques to do at home to avoid much of my back problems.  I am enjoying completing projects, and my daily walks again.  I can honestly say the professionals at "We Care Wellness Center" have helped me avoid another surgery, and given me my life back!|Excellent they really care and I actually feel better when I leave.
My conditions are pretty severe pain wise physical as well

I'm the patient and trusted him instead of checking to be sure he knew what he was doing.  I've been in too much pain to think clearly and I pay him to be the doctor.
I ended up in the ER and a 2 1/2 day stay in the hospital because the steroids messed up by already uncontrollable blood pressure.
When I called his office to tell them what he did, he called me back and insinuated that it was my fault for taking them and falsely claimed I was asked if these were ok.
That is not what happened.  They called me to tell me what he was prescribing and I took them.  Again, HE is the doctor, not me.|2/07/25 Update - I had an appointment today and was a little bummed that Dr. Moten was sick because I had a few questions for him.  Was pleasantly surprised by his aide Steve (I hope that's his name, or is it Scott?), anyway I was blown away by his knowledge. He actually helped me with a couple of answers. I know I wouldn't want to stop seeing Dr. Moten, but would not have a problem at all seeing his aid if he's overbooked.  Kudos to Illinois Pain and Spine. Don't let that one get away. I've been to MANY spine doctors from Northwestern to Advocate to Rush and I can honestly say he's got just as much knowledge and a better bedside manner than some of the so called "Top" doctors and nurse practitioners I've seen.

Original post - Love Dr. Moten and his nurse Erica.  Dr. Moten takes the time to understand your situation and your pain.  He is very thorough.  I was at TOP Pain Center in Aurora for 9 years and all that Dr. Chen cared about was money.

The only issue I have with Illinois Pain and Spine is the Elgin office. Two times I've had a medication refill issue and both times it was because of the Elgin location. Both times my medication wasn't called in on time.  This last time I literally had to drive to the Barrington location on a Saturday because the girls in the Elgin office were not relaying the message, not putting importance on the message, I don't know what they were doing, but this is the second time it's happened and both times it's when I've had to deal with this location. I understand that the doctor is extremely busy and may overlook things, but when I call all they say is "there's a message in there already". "I already know the message is there, but I need you to personally talk to the doctor to tell him that he left the message in there and forgot to film my meds". They don't. I can tell automatically with the attitude I get on the phone that they're not going to give him the message.  Thank Goodness Erica and two other girls helped me on the Saturday when I drove in.  They are very thorough and you can tell they like to take care of the patients.

The Elgin location is closest to me and yet I drive to the Barrington location just because of other issues also.  I always wait so long at the Elgin clinic.  I've stood at the window with girls right in front of me and they've made me stand there and not acknowledge me. Excuse me if I'm interrupting you, but it is your job and how rude you just let me stand there and then give me attitude?  Now I will say it's been months since I've gone to the Elgin location. I was just asked to write a review so I thought I would be as thorough as possible.

I would highly recommend Illinois Pain and Spine I just wouldn't recommend the Elgin location. St Charles and Barrington are good. column48: How do I know if my pain is acute or chronic?
column49: You can distinguish between acute and chronic pain based on how long it lasts and its characteristics. Acute pain comes on suddenly and is often sharp. It's a signal of possible injury or a specific problem and usually lasts briefly, from moments to three months. Chronic pain, on the other hand, lasts longer than expected for healing, beyond three months. It can stem from ongoing conditions like arthritis or nerve damage and can vary in intensity.

She gave me a positive and encouraging outlook on my current medical issues and the many ways to work the treatment she has presented to the best of my ability and some tools that can help change my outcome. I am really happy I was referred to the center/location thru Swedish Covenant Hospital. Thank you for all your help.|Love the care at this clinic, the staff is polite, professional, take time to speak with you about your concerns, & I feel that they care about the patients.|Dr. Diesfeld at Chicago Pain Medicine Changed My Life!

I can't say enough good things about Dr. Diesfeld and the team at Chicago Pain Medicine. For years, I suffered from chronic back pain and saw countless doctors who gave me one wrong diagnosis after another. They were all convinced it was an issue with my L5 lumbar, recommending endless shots, invasive treatments, and even surgery.

But Dr. Diesfeld took the time to truly understand my pain and discovered what no one else did--it wasn't my L5 at all. It was actually my psoas muscle causing the problem. Thanks to his expertise, I didn't have to go through unnecessary surgery, and now I'm feeling so much better!

The care I received here has been exceptional. Dr. Diesfeld's thoroughness, compassion, and ability to get to the root of the problem have been life-changing. If you've been stuck with the wrong diagnosis and ineffective treatments like I was, do yourself a favor and make an appointment here.|Male Dr. Very professional and concerned for patients. Front desk is another story. Only professional employee I've witnessed/worked with handles the pre authorizations. The other females at the reception desk don't even know how to utilize a greeting and say, "Hi,how can I help you?" Nothing! Meanwhile having a snack and drinking their coffee. I have to initiate why I'm there and then they respond. No manners, no customer service skills. They need training.|Omg they gave me a shot in my tail bone and the pain in my back is gone. I could cry with joy. Basically the pain clinic, the bone doc and physical therapy plus the medication will definitely help. You have to also move your body. If you don't move it you will lose it

column40:
Every time I have a need to see Dr. Louis over the past many years, he always is very kind and welcoming.  He helps me with my pain from a quick injection to leading up to and after total shoulder replacement.  I highly recommend his office.  I can't say enough good things about him as a doctor and a nice person in general.|Dr Louis is the greatest. He cares about all his patients. He listens to all my concerns and treat me like he would his own family. Thank you so much Doc|My experience with Dr. Demetrios Louis at Innovative Pain Specialists started out slow. Twelve years ago I had major surgery on my back that included titanium rods. As I age, I am beginning to have some issues with pain at the top and bottom of the stabilized area of my spine. My GP recommended this practice for treatment. On my first visit, I felt like my concerns weren't heard, but Dr. Louis suggested an injection to relieve inflammation and pain before I left on an overseas vacation, along with some medication to help with the pain. The injection worked enough to get relief for about three weeks. My body could not handle the side effects from the meds. On my follow up visit, I took all of my MRI's and X-rays from my previous doctors. At that time, Dr. Louis took a lot more time to review and discuss my condition. He asked me to have an MRI done on the thoracic spine area. I followed through with that procedure immediately. I met with him to review those findings and was treated with concern and respect for my both eastern and western medical/health beliefs. Together we came up with a plan of treatment steps that we both agreed with, and I am cautiously optimistic that I will get some long-term relief. The moral of my story: go in with as much information as you can, stay true to your beliefs, but be open to new treatments. I highly recommend Dr. Louis and his staff. They truly care about giving you the best and least intrusive care possible.|Dr.Louis and staff is a good place to go if you're having physical problems for pain and discomfort on any part of the body, he has help me in relieving my chronic pain.  I highly recommend him to all with body pain he has patience with you and he listen and respond to your needs.. Thank You Dr. D Louis for all your Help|I wanted a Dr.Marsiglia's opinion of my severe ankle pain.  He listened to me and asked questions. He was reassuring through the appointment  and decided to refer me to an ortho surgeon who exactly found the problem.
Thanks for your guidance and care, Dr. Marsiglia!|Dr Louis is the greatest!! He is nice and very nice to talk to! I have been seeing him for a very long time and would never change to anyone else!!|I have had chronic back pain for a long time. After several neurological, PT, chiropractic care, etc treatments, I found Dr.  Marsiglia. Because of his vast knowledge,  dedication and sincere desire to help, my pain is lessening and I look forward to a future where I will be pain free. If you are in pain, don't waste your time.  Go to Dr Marsiglia.|Excellent service from Dr. Marsiglia, as usual.  Quick diagnosis and had some solutions for my back issues.  Thank you!

column40:
Great practice! I've been a patient for 8 years. Dr. Dallas and PA Steve who have overseen my care, are both knowledgable professionals who display a rare compassion for their patients and practice a collaborative approach to care. As a patient, you feel part of a team and your voice is truly heard when forming your treatment plan and next steps. They are also just good people you can trust.|If I could give the 0 stars I would. They sent me for test and used a pharmacy not approved by my insurance. When I called to tell them they said " oh your prescription is on the way ", which was a lie. Don't count on bedside manner from anyone there. Ugh should have made an appointment somewhere else. This is why they were the only place that had openings! Ugh|I was a returning patient and was very to be able to return to the practice and see Dr Yacoub. He is very thorough and takes as much time as necessary to do a thorough exam And then develope a treatment plan that both Dr Yacoub and I felt would work best.|Dr. Hagle is the best pain doctor I've ever had. He is patient , understanding and compassionate. I must also mention RN Brittany, the nurse anesthetist. She is absolutely amazing at what she does and has a warm, comforting and knowledgeable presence. In addition to Dr. Hagle and Brittany, I would like to commend Kate, the medical assistant. She is just wonderful, whether she's rooming patients or working with insurance companies. I just can't say enough about these people. I would be lost without them. Thank you, Illinois Pain & Spine!  Also sending love and praise to Alli and Miranda!!|I would give this place zero stars if possible. First, horrible process of trying to schedule an appt or make any changes - you can not direct contact any office, you have to go thru a general line and if you're lucky, they will maybe connect you to the right office.  Second, they won't give you an exact time for an injection appoint until three days before when they call. And for me, who needed a driver for my appt, that meant not knowing and not being able to tell my job that I needed time off until three days before.  They did the same for my follow up and then never called me with an appt time!
Third, when I went in for my second shot, the nurse was awful. Three different times, she had the wrong info for me and kept trying to prep me for a shot in my knees when I was getting one in my back. The last time I had to correct her, she had me set up on the table and was mad I was wearing long pants. When I asked why she said "because we can't give you a shot in your knees with these pants". I finally yelled "it's going in my back". Dr Moten was in the room at this time and just laughed.
Fourth, my last shot appt was set for 12:10- I had asked for a later time but they said they had none. I had to take off work for this and when I got there, the nurse took me back for my vitals and said "I'm just going to take vitals and then you will go back to the waiting room as Doc needs to eat his lunch. He gets crabby if he doesn't it". I completely understand that but then don't book appointments for lunchtime! I waited almost another hour before being brought back for my shot. So disrespectful of my time and my job.
I would not recommend this place to ANYONE|I would recommend you if I were through with my treatment--when I would know if it is successive.
So far, I have no complaints.  Everyone has been kind and considerate and efficient.|Very nice staff and nurses. Dr  needs to work on his smile and interacting with patients more. Also, they need to work more on getting to the patients appointment times better. I really enjoy the Illinois pain and spine institute|Dr Hagel and his staff are great. I love when you have a doctor that actually listens to you, and understands your fear.
Great place, great people

column38: Sharon Harrison|Roberta Vinyard|Mike Denneny|ristev77|Regina Smietana|tim ashley|k baisley|Tracey Schock
column40:
Dr. Glaser is top notch! Pain isn't always visible.  I've been with this practice for 25+ years! I tried several other Dr's previously yet never found much relief.  I often felt like I was crazy. Often treated that way too. This office took me seriously & I've since been able to work part-time off & on. I have a new hope in my purpose and life! Many Dr's just give you an RX & tell you that's the best they can do. Dr Glaser spends time & goes over other possibilities for relief.  He knows it can be unbearable and even when a procedure is needed he offers you sedation if you need it! Clean, well maintained, & knowledgeable staff. David a MA has gone above & beyond to help me! KUDOS to David! My biggest concern is what happens if Dr. Glaser decides to retire? I hope he finds an awesome partner to take & work with his patients!! I'm here for the rest of my life. My son & I THANK him & staff in the largest possible way!! Keep up the good & awesome work you all do!!!|Dr. Glaser is a Godsend. After trying chiropractic services and physical therapy for my back issues, I was skeptical. Dr. Glaser is a professional, no-nonsense doctor. He explained what he was doing while undergoing the procedure which I appreciated.

Most importantly, he relieved me of my chronic pain with one procedure of crystal steroid. I now have my life back, and can walk my dog, garden, swim and live without pain. His staff is friendly and accommodating and they are on top of filing with insurance carriers. I highly recommend Dr. Glaser and Pain Specialists of Greater Chicago if you have chronic pain.|I've been coming to Pain Specialists of Greater Chicago for years; they have helped me get my life back after a serious auto accident. Dr Glaser cares about his patients, listens, and is the reason I'm living life again with less pain..|Dr glaser is a great doc. He listens and cares about his patients. Glad I found him to help me figure out the  best course for me|Excellent pain management care, plus I really like Brittney, PA and Dr. Glaser, they are so very smart. I transfered over to Dr. Glaser from an other PM Clinic and I am so glad I did. They knew exactly what I needed.|Before going to see Dr. Glaser I seen two other doctors for back pain. After 4 years of injections and ablation. I fell into the injection don't work they just make it worse. I went to Dr. Glaser office from friend recommendation I had no hope since he wanted to do same same thing but after year of the same procedure the other doctors did I finally got relief. Before giving up on injection give dr Glaser a chance.|Dr. Glaser along with Maria and staff have been nothing short of a God Send to me. I have been a patient of Dr. Glaser for over 20 years. He has been a warrior in his efforts to fight my chronic pain as well as the insurance companies for me, advocating pain procedures that allowed me sanity and the ability to continue to work. Dr. Glaser has stayed on the cutting edge, a champion against pain and true advocate for pain patients. Dr. Glaser and team also focus on education for both patients and the practice, assuring they retain their lead on new technologies and procedures. Dr Glaser also gives back to his field thru participation within the pain management communities and is also very philanthropic globally.

I also have to commend his team. I have never had any issues with scheduling or follow thru on actions of the staff in regard to my care plan.  Everyone is very personable, professional. I also have to add that I look forward to my monthly visits with Maria, she cares and is another advocate for the patients. She is just fantastic. I couldn't say enough good things about Team PSGC. If you are in pain and are looking for a team that cares and provides a life changing effort / service, schedule a visit with PSGC.|I have been a patient since 2018 / Dr. Glasier & Jennifer have been amazing. Because of this clinic, I have my quality of life back. My pain has become manageable.

Thank You for all you do! I would be lost without you!

*I had an appointment here today 2/25 and sometime earlier last week* ive had numerous surgeries on my foot/ankle. I've been off work for 2 years, constantly in pain, weakness is so bad you can visually notice the difference in size of both calf's. Currently my issue is a pinched perineal nerve in my left leg starting at the knee. I went in roughly 2 weeks ago for my first appointment and met with some lady doctor and everything went well. She said she'd be able to offer me at least 8-10months of pain relief when we figured this out. Told me to come back and schedule a nerve test, but ortho Illinois already sent them a recently one one but I shrugged it off and scheduled the appointments. I come in and do the EKG or whatever the shock/nerve test is. The man that did that was amazing btw! Afterwards I meet with the pain doctor who spend the entire 30 minutes reviewing everything to offer me not a treatment plan of any type besides steroid shots that I've already had done and have a bad reaction to. She wanted me to switch my PT and all my treatment beside surgery essentially to them and feel like her lack effort to produce of a treatment plan past steroid shots. Not a single pharmaceutical was offered besides said shots. This place is a joke and save money, time, and hopes. Tomorrow I will be filing a complaint w my insurance and w their company although I doubt it'll get past the email. Hopefully this helps someone!|My mom is coming here injections and physical therapy for her arthritic knee. She received 6 injections and many pt sessions. Two months later her knee is just as bad or worse.|I came here with  pain in my lower back in beginning of January. Before, I was getting steroid shut once a year from different doctor. The doctor that I was seeing at rhis clinic ordered a fresh MRI and ExRay, and said  that will request my medical records from doctor's office Wich I was seeing Before.  At the beginning of March I  did  my MRI. I called for appointment for May,  because my back pain was suddenly gone. So I  come to my  May appointment, expecting they'll have my medical records and MRI, I  can just get my shut and move on. Well they didn't have any of my records and images.  Long  story short: 5 appointments,  three of them with a doctor  and no medical help.  Even after I provided them  MRI images.  Would not advise to anybody. All what they do according my reviews is prescribed opiods and don't try to help people who is trying to manage their pain without addictive drugs!  Very  disappointed in their professionalism.!|I have been coming here for over a year now.  Dr. Osaben does my shots in my knee and is amazing.  It never hurts and when he's done I could just about dance out.  I highly recommend this place if you have knee problems.  The Physical Therapy group is great to, they are so friendly. And care how you are feeling.  The front desk girls are very friendly when you come in and don't give you grief if you need to reschedule.
I will be looking into other things there, as they don't just do knees,  they do a wide variety of things.
Thank You, for making me feel better!
Terri|Dr. C is very skilled, thorough and understanding. I wanted to extend/save my knee from total replacement with ablation of the nerves Dr. C is gentle, careful and is keeping me from experiencing severe and worsening pain in my knee. The treatments are working! The professional staff have years of experience  and are excellent, compassionate and friendly . The location is perfect for me and I have never waited more then 5 or 6 minutes. The facility is clean, pleasent and has a friendly atmosphere even the receptionists are always trying to work with my nearly impossible schedule which is really a stress reducer. I am very pleased I found a great doctor (neurosurgeon) and staff with a wonderful & compassionate practice, it's on the ground level with an easily accessible entrance immediately adjacent to the parking lot filled with friendly goal oriented staff and clean new equipment. This is Rockford's best not biggest.|I would like to thank everyone at RPM for helping me relieve my back and knee pain. The leg brace helped me walk and that also improved my back pain. I was able to go on vacation which involved a lot of walking up and down steps of cobblestone. You are all so very nice too.|I saw the chiropractor, it was a whole new experience. I was used to just being adjusted. Not ever realizing my body was being traumatized by how they would just force my body one way or another.  But this Dr. He put me on a table that moved and stretched my body I could hear a few pops here and there , but he keep on stretching my lower back and my hips. When that was done then he did the adjustment, it was the smoothest adjustment I have ever had. I walked out of there feeling pretty good. My old Dr used to tell me well you will either love me tomorrow or hate me. If you hate me call and I will fit you in. I don't think with the way they do it here it will ever be that way again for me.|I have been going to RPM for over 1 year.  My neuropathy in my feet has been greatly diminished.  I look forward to my appointments ev ery week.  I was going 2x a week.  Now only 1x per week. The atmosphere is always cheerful and greatly uplifting.  The workers really care about their patients.  I would recommend their services to anyone needing pain relief.

At the Pain & Spine Institute, our mission is to provide the most advanced and compassionate care to patients suffering from chronic pain. Our

World-Class Pain Management Specialists

are dedicated to precisely diagnosing and treating the root cause of your pain, not simply masking symptoms. We specialize in minimally invasive, non-surgical interventions designed to help you reclaim your life with lasting relief. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Nerve blocks and radiofrequency ablation

  • Spinal cord stimulation

We understand how debilitating chronic pain can be, which is why we take a patient-centered approach to care. Our team works diligently to get you back to work, back to family, and back to living as soon as possible. Located at 744 Essington Rd in Joliet, IL, we're committed to being your trusted partner in pain management. Visit our website or call us today at (815) 729-0700 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward a pain-free life.

Pain and spine institute recently purchased Gateway Pain and Spine.  At my November appt in Hinsdale Illinois and thru today I  experienced the negative side effects of pain institute purchasing Gateway.  1st, all Gateway employees grandfathered into pain and spine in Hinsdale are wonderful.  The negative side effects  included: must have MRI by end of November.  Expect to be taken off of current meds and expect to have a internal  procedure.  Without consideration that I've been a chronic pain patient since 2003, or to the many procedures I've had post back surgery since 2003. or my age, that I'm on Medicare which doesn't cover many chronic pain meds, or the meds that ive tried/ result.  The worst no consideration to my many health conditions.  And more ridiculousness.  I changed pain management clinics today. I don't recommend pain and spine institute.|I have been a patient of Dr. Sharma for over 10 years and I trust him completely. He has kept me functioning at my highest level. He and Dr. Wudell have been able to pinpoint and then target the cause of my pain and I have had excellent results. All of the nurses are amazing and the rest of the staff is always friendly and helpful. Thank you! I highly recommend Pain And Spine!

Dr. Russ was wonderful and very helpful, as always! Between him and Dr. Sharma, I receive exceptional care and have been able to avoid another surgery so far and am able to function to the best of my ability. The nurses and staff are always caring and helpful! Thank you all! I highly recommend Pain and Spine and have been going here for over a decade.|The staff is very nice. I was very pleased with the doctor, who let me ask questions and clearly explained my issue and follow up treatments.|This is the worst place. They don't explain the process.  I went there for a cortisone shot and they instead burned my nerves. They didn't tell me that they decided to do this. They didn't tell me until they did it! They dragged the process out for 13 weeks. I don't feel like they care about the patients only the money they can get!!!|I think the staff and physicians are the best! They are professional and treated me with respect. It is nice to see an office that smiles and the staff genuinely look happy and appear to get along. Dr Sharma is thorough and caring. I received a follow up call after my procedure and they were very accommodating with my busy schedule. They offered virtual and in office visits. Thank you!|Doctor Patel is terrific!!  He was very thorough with my evaluation and decided that it was best that I did NOT get a shot.  He could have easily given me a treatment that I did not need and make a few dollars.  He is more interested in making sure that I make a few corrections to my daily life so I can enjoy my retirement!   I am very impressed and look forward to working with him in the future!!|The staff/ nurses/ doctor's/ therapists explained the procedures and how it would or wouldn't correct the problem I was having. It is my go to clinic for my back/ hip issues. I would like to thank the staff for eliminating my discomfort.|So far I am very pleased with the service and doctors care. I would recommend DR Patel and his staff.

At University Pain Centers at Westchester, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. Our

Expert Pain Management Team

is led by highly skilled physicians including Dr. Lubenow, Dr. Jaycox, Dr. Amin, and Dr. Suva, who bring decades of combined experience in treating complex pain disorders. We take a personalized approach to pain control, developing customized treatment plans for each patient's unique needs. column40:
Dr.Suva was unbelievable! He took the time to listen to my problem as well as to explain my condition to me. He was personable, patient and empathetic. His exceptional expertise was able to diagnose my condition.
His staff was very attentive and friendly. Feeling grateful to have found him and his team.|I've been an RN for 17 years. I have recently become disabled due to severe neuropathy and nerve pain in both of my feet. I am unable to walk workout a walker, can't place any weight in the balls of my feet, and have severe nerve pain. I haven't been able to work or drive. I can barely take care of myself at home. I've been to several doctors and specialists in the Chicagoland area who have not been able to figure out what exactly is going on. I was sent to Dr. JayCox by my orthopedic doctor at Rush. This was the first time I have ever felt like the doctor was thinking outside the box and checking off every possibility. His resident was nothing short of the same. They were both amazing. They listened intently, were highly competent, and compassionate. They developed a plan of diagnostics that I'm very anxious about, and assured me that I would have sedation and would be well-taken care of. They're trying to find the cause of my pain and will develop a treatment plan based on the next battery of tests and procedures. I highly recommend this doctor and this pain clinic to anybody having severe chronic pain. I have worked with hundreds of doctors. These guys are top of the top. Thank you, Dr. Jaycox and team, for giving me hope that my life can maybe get back to a somewhat normal state, for the first time in a year. The entire staff was superb!|I travel 50 miles each way to see Dr. Jaycox and it is so worth it!! He is such a caring doctor. He really listens to you and takes time with you to figure everything out that you need. I was so fortunate to come across Dr Jaycox. The whole staff is so friendly too.|Dr. Amin and his staff - especially Susan - truly care about their patients. They treat the most difficult diagnosis which is chronic pain. Anyone who suffers from it knows how debilitating it can be, but Dr. Amin doesn't give up and he tries his best to lower that pain level as far as possible. Thank you Dr. Amin!|Dr Jaycox is truly the very best there is.  He is an outstanding doctor n I truly can say my life wouldn't be the same without his help.  He is my blessing.  Thank you Dr Jaycox for all yr help.|Updated 1/22/25

The entire office/staff/doctors are amazing.  Dr. Jaycox is smart and resourceful, when he makes a diagnosis he follows through with all forms of care. Ever time we talk I feel he hears me and understands where I'm at in life.
I would send your grandma to him if she was injured.  Allot of respect for this dr.

RECOMMENDED = I talk to people about him

EVERY TIME EXCELLENT SERVICE!! RECOMMENDED!! THE STAFF , THE NURSES. AMAZING!! DR. JAYCOX GAVE ME BACK LIFE. THANK YOU DR. MATHEW JAYCOX|Dr Lubenow is an amazing physician. He is always attentive to his patients needs and concerns. His office staff always goes above and beyond with the patient's insurance to advocate for the patient regarding needed procedure's. You will truly not be disappointed by Dr Lubenow and his staff.|Dr. Lubenow gave me a lot of information very clearly and I understood his diagnosis and his reasoning.  He was kind and personable and I felt I was getting the very best care.  He took his time and listened.

At MAPS Centers for Pain Control, we are a leading provider of comprehensive pain management solutions throughout the Chicagoland area. Our exceptional medical team consists of physicians who are double board certified in Anesthesiology and Interventional Pain with specialized Fellowship Training. We take pride in our balanced approach to treating various pain conditions, delivering personalized care that addresses each patient's unique needs.

Our Specialized Services

We offer advanced treatments for a wide range of pain conditions, including:

  • Back and neck pain management

  • Knee, shoulder, and joint pain relief

  • Varicose and spider vein treatments

  • Non-surgical interventional procedures

Our commitment to excellence means we continuously strive to provide the most effective pain management solutions without resorting to surgery whenever possible. With our state-of-the-art facilities and compassionate care team, we help patients regain mobility and improve their quality of life. Visit our website to learn more about how we can help you overcome chronic pain and return to the activities you love.

column40:
Zero stars would be too much. In a world where healthcare organizations are poorly, run, mismanaged, money-grabbing machines, this organization is among the worst.

Dr. is interested in billing only. Not listening to patients. My wife had the worst experience with Dr. Racik of any Doctor in her decade plus pursuit of solutions to her chronic pain condition.

The doctor is impossible to get a hold of. There's no internal communication. You call and they don't answer. You leave a message and they don't call you back. Expect to call five or more times before you receive a response, and the person that responds to you will not have listened to your voicemail or any of your emails and will act like you've never communicated with them.

They miss over bill every appointment. My wife paid 50% higher co-pays than she was actually supposed to for months. When that came to light, the overbilling was never resolved or refunded.

After months of trying to reconcile billing discrepancies, there still is no resolution. They act like we've never communicated with them.

The only way to get them to respond is to post a negative Google review, at which point you will receive a prompt phone call where they implore you to take down the review, and in turn, they can resolve your problems.

You can see the attached image they billed us twice for the same procedure, they billed us a third time for the same procedure, which was actually an office visit with the device rep, never even seen by the doctor.

Proceeded with caution, everything about this organization screams scam and insurance fraud.|In the beginning it was ok but as time went on it seemed like they only wanted to treat me if I agreed to some kind of medication. I informed them from the start that I only wanted to use physical therapy and topical treatment. Every appointment they pushed shots and when I said no and I'm not changing my mind they discharged me. The physical therapy was working and I was happy with the results. Not only that but every appointment I'd have to wait 20 to 25 mins to be sent to a room and an extra 10mins to be seen after my appointment time. I came late once and they told me I'd have to reschedule because I was late. I informed them that I will no longer wait after my appointment time to be seen. They were really rude about what i had said, not speaking in English any longer.|Review for Dr. Kang at MAPS Midwest Anesthesia and Pain Specialists

I can't express enough how life-changing my experience with Dr. Kang has been! I was suffering from severe vein disease, with swelling so extreme that my feet were constantly ballooned--I couldn't even see my ankles. On top of that, I was battling constant fatigue that affected my everyday life.

Dr. Kang came highly recommended, and now I understand why. From the very first appointment, he was attentive, knowledgeable, and compassionate. He took the time to explain the root cause of my symptoms and the best course of action. He performed a vein ablation procedure, and the results have been nothing short of remarkable.

Since the procedure, my swelling has completely gone down--I no longer have "cankles," and my feet and ankles look normal again! But the most important change has been how much my overall quality of life has improved. I feel energized, my circulation has increased tremendously, and I no longer feel weighed down by constant fatigue.

Dr. Kang is truly the best of the best in his field. His expertise, combined with his genuine care for his patients, sets him apart. If you're struggling with vein issues or pain, I wholeheartedly recommend Dr. Kang and the incredible team at Midwest Anesthesia and Pain Specialists (MAPS). He gave me back a sense of normalcy I didn't think was possible.

Thank you, Dr. Kang--you're a game-changer!|I recently saw Dr. Pooja Shah at MAPS Centers for Pain Control in Des Plaines for my neck and back pain, and she was wonderful. She took the time to listen to my concerns and provided the care and support I needed. Her compassionate approach and attention to detail made a significant difference in my treatment. Highly recommend her!|Initially when I walked in I asked God to please help me and refer me to a healthcare professional that would apply empathy and provide solution. The receptionist assisted me with paperwork and explained in details. I was in so much pain, she gave me time to fill out my paperwork, politely assisted when I asked.
Then I met PA David Gilbert, He applied his work ethics, listened, showed empathy, assessed my pain level, Range of motion and offered various treatment plans for my pain without asking him. He didn't stop there, he offered me treatment supplies like pain patch and relaxant pill. I almost wanted to hug him because I ran out of funds to get medication. I found a health personnel that did not spend 5 minutes or read previous doctors documentation to assess my situation. I ran out of supplies and my muscle pain increased so I felt hopeless. I slept well that night and the next day I had my patch on. PA David thank you for gracing your profession, I believe with you my healing is near. most patient out there would give anything to find a PA/Doctor like you. Thank you|If only I could give zero stars, I would.

Let me take you through a journey with MAPS. It started in 2022 when I was trying to get an appointment. Filling out the appointment inquiry form and following up with phone calls for years, and I never got in touch with someone - until 2024. I wish I never pursued it.

I'm a 37-year-old woman and working mom of three little girls. I cannot walk or stand for minutes without a cane or walker. I have to use a wheelchair for any distance. And with the use of these devices, I'm in intense pain. At the time, I was also coming off a medication Dr. Racik gave me with horrible, scary side effects of not only pain & illness but mental distress. At my appointment that my mom attended with me, Dr. Racik told me that I was lucky I didn't have cancer or that I wasn't an amputee in regards to my debilitating pain. I can't express what a disgustingly insensitive - not to mention potentially dangerous - comment that was, and coming from a "pain specialist." I put it in quotes because Racik did nothing to help, only harm me through interventions that made me worse.

After being told a spinal cord stimulator would be a great option, despite my hesitations, I went in with a hopeful, positive attitude. Based on my history of issues after interventions and based on my history of not being able to get in touch with the doctor, I made absolutely certain with Dr. Racik that I would be able to get in touch with him after the procedure.

See email below for how it went:

1. I had the spinal cord stimulator trial placed on Monday. When I arrived, they asked when my follow up appointment was and that that appointment should have been scheduled at the time that my trial was scheduled. No one ever told me about this. They said at the surgical center this appointment would occur downstairs in an office visit and that they would have it scheduled before I left the building from my trial.

2. After the procedure, I was told Dr. Racik would be speaking with me. That never happened. I was also told Dr. Racik would call me to follow up the next day. That never happened.

3. When a nurse called the following day, she asked how I was doing, and I told her not well. She suggested I take Motrin, which is completely useless. I asked her when the doctor would be calling me to discuss my concerns, she said by the end of day. That never happened.

4. The nurse also asked when my follow up was scheduled. I said it was never scheduled, I had no idea where or how to schedule this appointment - she directed me to the number on my post-op instructions -which, by the way, the instructions say you can bathe after the procedure, which is NOT correct. Apparently the number she directed me to call to make this appointment from the paperwork was wrong as well.

5. I had called and left messages at the number listed on my post-op instructions. I called 8 times in two days and left at least 3-4 messages with no answer.

6. Someone from MAPS just called and said this was NOT the number to call to schedule the appointment, that this appointment needed to be scheduled at the surgical center.

I'm beyond lost, confused, and irritated, to say the least. This is NOT the first time I have had communication issues with this office.

Then - when they did reach out to me finally, it seems no one looks at or takes notes because she asked me to come into the office that day for a leed removal. If anyone knew what was going on, they would know I had my spinal cord stimulator trial on Monday and would be coming in the following Monday for the removal.

This is the pattern of confused communication that has alarmed me the entire time I was unfortunately a patient there.

Finally, I have been trying tirelessly since June-July 2024 to have a billing issue resolved. Their incompetency was infuriating. Now in September, I received a statement - and nothing has changed. Nothing was resolved. I will follow-up with part 2 with those details.|Can't say enough good things about my experience!!! Very professional and courteous. Listened to all of my questions and concerns and addressed everything very thoroughly. Couldn't be more pleased|Thank you so much for your professional and wery sensitive way to help me, when catastrophe struck.
I will always recommend your clinic. Sincerely Branko.

column3:
At Modern Pain Consultants, we are dedicated interventional spine and pain specialists committed to treating patients with compassion and cutting-edge technology. Our team of expert physicians provides comprehensive pain management solutions at our state-of-the-art facility in New Lenox, IL. We understand that chronic pain can significantly impact your quality of life, which is why we offer personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Advanced Treatment Options

We proudly offer a wide range of innovative treatments including:

  • Regenerative medicine (stem cell therapy and PRP injections)

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Ultra minimally invasive surgical procedures

  • Trigger point injections

  • Nerve blocks and radiofrequency ablation

Our medical professionals, including Dr. Khan and our dedicated nurse practitioners, work collaboratively to develop effective pain management strategies. We take the time to listen to your concerns and thoroughly explain all available treatment options. Located at Silver Cross Hospital's Pavilion A, we provide a comfortable, welcoming environment where patients receive exceptional care. column40: I've been dealing with chronic pain for decades and have found Dr. Li and staff to be superb. No matter who you deal with they are very compassionate and try to accommodate the best they can.  Whether they treat me with nerve blocks, acupuncture  or various types of medication it was always excellent care. Did the meds always work no but at least they tried. I'm so very grateful to have such an outstanding clinic to help me. No matter who you deal with they are great and very empathetic to your needs. In my opinion you can't go wrong.  As a matter of fact I saw Dr. Li today and he was superb.|Way better than Dr. Nazhi, who's to worried about labeling pts. and not listening to their pain issues. Thank goodness for Nick, Ty and Dr. Li.|Highly disappointed with this place. The office has a doctor's name on the front door, but no doctor sees patients at the office. Instead, there is a nurse practitioner and a nurse assistant. On my first visit, I was diagnosed by the nurse practitioner. After that, all visits were with the nurse assistant. Had I been using my common sense, I would have ended it after the 2nd visit. I don't care how good the nurse practitioner is, he is not a doctor. I want to be diagnosed by a licensed doctor. The doctor whose name is on the front door actually practices at their affiliated surgery center on Ireland Grove Rd. It seems that's all he does; performs procedures on patients lined up by the nurse practitioner and nurse assistant. So after two failed procedures, I was out $2,000 (out of pocket after insurance) with no relief for my pain. About 8 months later, they told me that there was really nothing they could do for me but scheduled another appointment 3 months later to "monitor" me. The final straw was when they asked me for urine for a drug test. Their office has never given me any narcotics for pain; I had to rely on my general practitioner for that. They claimed that they do that with all patients. They have signs all over the place and I really got the feeling like I was being treated like a seeker. My common sense finally kicked in and I said enough. Just my opinion here, but it really seems like this doctor has quite a sweet setup; he doesn't have to deal with patients that aren't under anesthesia and performs expensive procedures all day. With that, I would suggest you go elsewhere for relief. This group doesn't have the depth of experience nor professional training to adequately deal with all patient needs.|If you have a pain problem, this is the place to go!  having chronic back and knee problems finding Applied Pain was a game changer.  Between Dr. Ji Li and his staff I've been able to get my pain under control. Can't say enough good things about Applied Pain.  Doctors are exceptional and the staff is fantastic.  They've always kind and helpful. As I said in the beginning of this review, if you have a pain problem this is the place to go,  You won't be disappointed,|Applied pain has been great. I have been dealing with back pain since my last child birth and multiple visits to mclean county orthopedic and no relief. Dr li and nick have gone well above and beyond to help me get injections and possible disabilities that I never expected to have at 36. I would suggest anyone to get a 2nd opinion in town instead of being pushed off to Chicago clinics|$500 out of pocket,  being put under twice and am worse than I ever was before! What was even the point! Then when I'm voicing my frustrations I'm told to leave as a staff member grabbed my shoulder! This is 3 doctors that run a chop shop service ! They prescribe treatment after treatment to pad the bill amd then embarrass you in the lobby for payment!! DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME!!!! There is no outside agency to keep this on the up and up! They keep sending you from the doctor to the pain center, then off to the surgery center! All ran by the same 3 doctor's! I was treated like a drug addict even though I've never been on pain meds..ever! Horrifying experience and no relief in site!|Started going last july for ongoing back problems. Ive worked 25+ years construction. And owning my own business i count on myself to do the work. The drs and staff listen to my concerns and needs. And through discussion and past experience with my back woes. We came up with a sound treatment plan. And i have been happy with applied pain institute since.|I've been a patient since Applied Pain opened their office. I previously had seen these doctors in a previous practice. They're a pleasure to deal with. They pay attention to details and listen to their patients.

column40:
From the time the doctor came into my room until I left I was treated with great regard and respect. I thank you so much for having someone like him available to work with me. He was not only personable and respectful,, he  was informative and willing to help me make my life better. And his assistant was likewise concerned and careful to make sure my needs were met and understood ... I went away feeling encouraged for the first time in a long time and hopeful   with the knowledge that I have such a great team of professionals to come to when I need their help. Thank you all very much.|I've been a patient at the Rush University Pain Center for about 25 years now; primarily seeing Dr. Sandeep Amin in the last 20. I have a complex history with a post-surgical pain syndrome along with a chronic autoimmune disease causing additional pain in multiple areas. Over the years, we've tried a variety of surgical approaches: outpatient or inpatient; one-time injections, indwelling flows of IV meds, nerve stimulators plus many oral medicinal cocktails. The Pain Center, within the University, has all types of diagnostic tools available as well: lab samples, X-rays, C-T & MRI scans. You are presented with the latest knowledge on your illnesses through residents & fellows specializing in pain management & anesthesia; you may also be offered participation in research studies if appropriate. As you can see, patients are well cared for in this facility with doctors & nurses dedicated to your diagnosis, medicinal & surgical treatments, along with frequent follow-up appointments. Anyone with moderate to severe chronic pain needs a pain specialist as an adjunct physician. It's a very supportive environment to help you through the recurrent traumas of chronic pain management. I cannot say enough about the positive attributes of Dr. Amin & his staff. Overall, I highly recommend the Rush Pain Center! Thank you so much for caring for me over these very many years!!|The physicians and residents are attentive, extremely resourceful, and seemed genuinely concerned with my well-being. My pain experiences were validated, and a plan was made that I respect. The Pain Center provides a very broad variety of treatments to address many different problems. I recommend them highly.|Dr. Lubenow is an exceptional physician. He spent a good deal of time examining my injury and listening to my questions and concerns. He addressed every one I had, and clearly explained the plan of treatment going forward. I have confidence in Doctor Lubenow.|He saw me the first time and is already trying to fix the problem with meds. I've had this issues for years. He also, has a plan if this doesn't work!! I was injured in 2018 with a wrist injury  and led to back leg and ither problems.
I've seen alot of doctors at Rush. I had to see him because my doctor  Lubenow, which i recommend as well, was on vacation. He took time to listen to what my problems where that day. Most of the doctors at Rush pain center  already know my issues since I've been going there for so long and was hurt due to my patients attacking me. I am hoping he can help me and fresh eyes is always a plus too.|I, thank you for doing a great job. Everything went great and I'm feeling great. This is the first time that I've awoken and had no headache. I highly recommend Dr Tolga Suvar. Thank you again|Every person with whom I have had an interaction has been wonderfully kind, professional, and approachable. Dr. Suvar saved my life-and that is no exaggeration. I am, and always will be, grateful to him for giving me a new positive path that is relatively pain-free.|Dr Tolga Suvar is absolutely amazing. He's a brilliant, knowledgeable, professional, intelligent, caring & thoughtful doctor. He listens intently & asks great questions.  Dr Suvar ensures that you understand treatment plan & next steps before you leave his office.

I've been dealing with carpal tunnel syndrome for a while and decided to see Pain Therapy Associates with Dr. Dabah. I'm so glad I did! From the initial consultation, Dr. Dabah was thorough in explaining the condition and the treatment options available. They crafted a personalized plan that included adjustments and therapies aimed at relieving pressure on my wrists and improving mobility. Over time, I've noticed a big reduction in pain and numbness, and I'm finally getting some relief after months of discomfort. The office environment is welcoming, and the staff is always professional and attentive. I highly recommend Dr. Dabah to anyone struggling with carpal tunnel. It's made a huge difference in my daily life!
I can now say that I can go back to my knitting and make more blankets for my grandbaby. "|Delia is Simply the Best!

Delia is an absolute gem at Pain Therapy Associates! From the moment I walked in, she made me feel valued and at ease. Her warmth, professionalism, and genuine care for patients truly set her apart. She takes the time to listen, ensures every detail is handled with precision, and goes above and beyond to make each visit smooth and stress-free.

It's rare to find someone as compassionate and dedicated as Delia--her positive energy is contagious, and she makes a real difference in the patient experience. If you're looking for exceptional care, look no further. Pain Therapy Associates is lucky to have her, and so are the patients who get to experience her kindness and expertise firsthand. Thank you, Delia!|My pain started about 7 months ago and it has been a nightmare. (I will spare you the details) I have seen many doctors and specialists and NO ONE, I repeat NO ONE has been as good of a listener,  effective, responsive, and compassionate as Yuri Kuklov. He has really helped me through one of the darkest times of my life.  Whenever I present a new problem, he always has a quick answer to help me get through it. He is open minded and takes a lot of pride in his work. I really appreciate you, Yuri!|I had a great experience at Pain therapy associates. I just started going there and had 2nd appointment and they are great. Explained everything and was so happy they are finding a solution for my pain after all the years I've trying different procedures. Dr.Dabah and Katherine are exceptional. Took their time with me. I am so glad I found them.|I was experiencing some pain in my left knee, mostly at the top of a flight of stairs, or when I twisted it. I was dreading the possibility of knee replacement surgery. After viewing my xrays, the doctor said it was mild osteoarthritis, and he recommended Physical Therapy. It was a godsend. I am still working on getting stronger, and I'm essentially pain free.|So far disappointed.  It's been 18 days and today my sciatica pain was worse then before the surgery. I hope it improves. Dr Dabah said we need 5-6 weeks to fully recover so need more time. Their follow up has been excellent.|My husband and I have been patients of Pain Therapy Associates for many years. I would have to say that most of the time,  we are treated well, our concerns are addressed and our issues are resolved.  We certainly would not remain as patients if that were not true.  However, it does seem that oftentimes, communication which is key, breaks down, and we are left without answers that we have been told we would receive.  I have even allowed a few days more, waiting for a return phone call, about my  MRI results, and I am still waiting and in pain and numbness.  That leaves me feeling frustrated. Other than that, the nurses, receptionists, have always been extremely polite and very kind to us, thank you for that! Thank you for the experienced care we have received for so many years!|Dr PA Yuri and staff has made a profound difference in my life Yuri understands me and works with me to achieve my goals I am grateful  and thankful and I completely trust what they are trying to accomplish within me. I also include Dr. Debah His Minuteman surgery has made a profound difference And giving me the ability to do things that I haven't been able to do Progress is being made. I highly recommend them to others who are struggling. Thank you, Matt

column40:
I've been with Dr. Kondelis for over 6 or 7 years and he has help me a lot with all my lumbar spine back problems. In March he will be doing injection on both sides of my lower back, Dr.Kondelis have tried everything to make me comfortable with my pain. I would recommend him him to anyone.|She was friendly and somewhat knowledgeable. The X-rays I had done (as prescribed) weeks before weren't even looked at until she was in the room with me. I asked for a detailed explanation of the results of the X-rays. She had to google to provide me with images to explain what I have going on.|Best pain Doctor with the best bedside manner and the staff is ALWAYS at the ready. From the front desk receptionist to the medical assistants / nurses, I couldn't ask for a better team of people for my care. Dr. Kondelis is the absolute best!!!!|15 year patient.  From diagnosis thru multiple procedures, Dr Kondelis is extremely knowledgeable, dedicated and passionate about helping his patients.  Highly, highly recommend.|WORST DOCTOR I've ever experienced!
If I could give this doctor zero stars, I would have.

When Kondelis walked in, he didn't introduce himself and seemed to know NOTHING about me, even though my medical records were sent to him 2-3 weeks prior. He has NO people skills.

Kondelis, right off the bat, said that because I'm prescribed a particular medicine, he would not give me ANY kind of narcotic. Even after I offered to stop taking that prescription, he wouldn't budge....even though I have been living with severe fibromyalgia for over 20 years, AND just had back surgery.

He would NOT do ANYTHING to help me. He encouraged me to go off ALL my medications as a "reset".

Kondelis told me my fibromyalgia should be handled by my psychiatrist. Because, you know, the constant, chronic, excruciating pain I feel EVERY DAY, is all in my head.

He was at least 30 minutes late for my appointment.

Kondelis had someone listening in to our conversation and transcribing it WHILE WE TALKED! And, he never asked for my permission. Can you say HIPPA violation?

He was cold and impersonal, except to tell me how his niece is "paralyzed" by her fibromyalgia, but yet managed to get her master's degree. So, I told him that I had my master's degree too - what does that have to do with ANYTHING???!?

Going to Dr. Kondelis was a complete waste of my time and money.|I started going to Dr. kondelis when I hurt my back at work. I am very grateful that I came across Dr. Kondelis and his methods because they have been so helpful and effective to getting me moving again. I was treated like family by him and when a doctor does that you know they truly care about your health and wellness. I can't stress it enough that Dr. Kondelis is the ONLY back/pain specialist that you need to be seeing!|I have never had a bad experience there. Everyone is very knowledgeable, helpful, kind and patient|Dr Kondelis has helped me immensely with my back pain. I would highly recommend him

column2: Chicago Institute for Neuropathic Pain: Michael Rock, MD
column3:
At the Chicago Institute for Neuropathic Pain, we specialize in providing innovative and effective solutions for patients suffering from various types of neuropathic pain. Led by Dr. Michael Rock, MD, a board-certified Pain Medicine Physician and Anesthesiologist, our team is dedicated to delivering comprehensive care at our convenient locations in Chicago and Oak Park, Illinois. With years of specialized experience, we understand the complex nature of chronic pain and how it affects quality of life.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer a range of advanced treatments tailored to each patient's unique needs, including:

  • Innovative neuropathic pain management protocols

  • Customized medication management

  • Minimally invasive procedures

  • Radio-frequency ablation treatments

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

Our approach focuses on identifying the root causes of pain while protecting healthy nerves from further damage. We take pride in our patient-centered care philosophy, ensuring each person receives personalized attention and treatment plans designed for their specific condition. column40:
Dr. Goodman is thorough, detail oriented and very experienced in pain management. He's been diligent in keeping me more comfortable until I get surgery for 2 ruptured lumbar discs with severe right leg sciatica. Nerve pain can be tricky to keep under control but I've had much better results with him than several other pain doctors. Very professional, straightforward demeanor but is also compassionate. A radio-frequency heat ablation procedure done in his office was surprisingly easy under his care.
Dr. Rock, who I've seen years ago at another location, has a very gentle, laid back and amiable bedside manner, thoroughly explains treatment options and addresses questions and concerns with reassuring patience. Definitely recommend for effective pain relief options.|My husband and I both see Dr. Rock.  He is interested in what is going on with both of us, makes recommendations based on what we are dealing with, but most important of all, he allows us to make the decisions on WHAT we want done.  We have discussed surgery, but I am not at a point for that right now, and Dr. Rock along with his staff understand that and do NOT pressure me to move forward with that, but rather treat me as I am right now.  They are all friendly, compassionate, understanding, caring, and attentive.  Other reviews keep talking about them not answering the phone - LEAVE A MESSAGE!  They have always returned my calls, they text and communicate with me, there is not a problem here.  If you are dealing with pain, let Dr. Rock work with you.  He has been a Godsend to both of us.|Dr Rock assessed my pain situation and had some interesting assumptions about my status.  I was impressed to Not hear "the same old dog and pony" analysis.
He recommended a treatment plan with logic that made sense and was not invasive or surgical. I liked this approach.
Post treatment I am very relieved! He is a master of his craft, a true diamond physician for pain management. Thank you Dr Rock :-)|Horrible. I have new insurance so I called them to make sure they take the insurance. They said they do. I made an appointment for my neck and back pain. Their policy is if the appointment is cancelled it's a 200.00 charge. But it was ok that they cancelled my appointment the day of. So Do I get $200 for them cancelling the appoint the day of? I rescheduled my appointment a little over a week later. No problem. My appointment was made for 10-10-24. The receptionist called me and asked if I could come an hour early.  I said no problem as I do not live far. I get there 15min early give them my insurance card and they say they don't take my insurance. Mind you they had two weeks to tell me this. Horrible practice and horrible follow up. Would definitely not recommend this practice.|Apt. mixup, but helpful staff. Each member I saw was polite, informed and helpful. Dr. Rock struck me as that one-in-a-million. Truly immersed in everything he does. Doesn't stop until he knows everything available.|For over 30 years, I have had debilitating chronic pain. The pain was so bad that I could not sit nor stand for more than 15 minutes.  The pain was excruciating so I could not go out to dinner or a movie because I can't sit that long.
I used to be very active. I skied, played tennis and other sports.
As I got older the pain got so bad I could not function. The pain was excruciating. In 30 years of pain, I've seen at least 50 doctors. I also was seen by doctors at Mayo clinic, Northwestern hospital and University of Chicago.
None of these doctors were able to significantly reduce my pain.
Then I found Dr. Michael Rock.
I consider Dr. Rock the best doctor. He is caring and empathic. He helped reduce my pain significantly and there are days I have no pain.

Because of Dr. Rock, I am able to get out of my house. I now can sit and stand long periods of time
so I can now be active again and do many activities that I could not tolerate before.
I highly recommend Dr. Rock.
Sent from my iPhone|Dr Rock is amazing! He's the only doctor who has been able to help my neuropathic pain after so many others tried and failed. Couldn't recommend him more!|Dr Rock is the most amazing pain doctor ever met been knowing them since 2006 taking care of my pain oh my God he's phenomenal He's a great doctor  you walk in with pain and walk out feeling man like you were born again or something he does a great job I just love his work love the hospitality of the office staff and everybody everybody is great but if you want to go see a great doctor go to Dr Rock he will make you pain-free

column40:
Dr, Ha is very intelligent and detailed and really takes the time to listen & understand where,  how & why ?
Where the pain is and comes from, and how we are going to treat the pain with a plan, why ? So that I can live comfortably and basically get my life back as the pain I suffer from is and can be debilitating .
It's teamwork, starting with me ( the patient), following and doing what is expected of  me to do by following Dr. Ha's orders. I highly recommend Dr. " Handsome " Ha to help you.  Dr. Ha looks young, but his education,  manners, and skills as a doctor are unbelievable.  Dr. Ha will not leave you confused.  He answers any questions you have. Dr. Ha takes time with the patient.
Believe me,  Dr. Ha is worth the wait, getting in to see him, but you will not be disappointed.
The nurses, telephone operators, and staff all work together as a team to make sure I'm happy & comfortable .
They do it all. Dr. Ha will call your medication in for you,  to the pharmacy you want.
My prescription medication is already in process even before I leave his office.
Also,  before I leave the appointment, another appointment is already set up for me.
All a patient really has to do is breathe,  try to relax, and have confidence that Dr. " Handsome " Ha has got you & will take care of your needs.
Yes, my daughter and I gave Dr. Ha a "nickname."
Thank you, Dr. " Handsome " Ha for giving me my life back and managing my pain. You are one of God's angels|Dr. Dahlberg is a caring and skilled physician.  His office is efficient and his staff are all very helpful.  If you need an epidural injection, this is the place to go.|I came in to see Dr.Ha he was great doctor!!!  But the staff that works is so rude. They can get smart with you and then if you say something back they get all mad. I'm running headaches and high blood and low back pain. Then Kim the office manager only believes in one side of the story. I hope the office staff chases everyone away.... Good luck!|The office and front staff are so RUDE and talk to you like your nothing.. I work part-time at OSF doing the same thing and we are never allowed to talk to the patients like that. I would go refer you guys to ROCFORD PAIN MANAGEMENT Clinic on Riverside dr. The staff is friendly and won't be RUDE and smart when you ask them a question.|Never helped with pain and needed a hip replacement.  If x-rays would have been taken it would have been obvious I had bone on bone with bone fragments. I suffered so long with pain unnecessarily.   It's been a nightmare with billing because they billed for a procedure I didn't have done.  I got a refund only to get another bill from them 2 years later.  I met my deductible and I don't owe them. I don't have information from 2 years ago and they need to work it out with my insurance company I had at that time.  It's been very frustrating and I will never go back.|They tend to run interference in treatment more than assist with pain management. I called to inquire about the Stellate Ganglion nerve block, which is less than a 10 minute procedure, and was told  I need a referral to be seen. Most providers who perform this procedure don't require a referral, just a consult with the doctor who is performing the procedure. Policies are antiquated here.|Was at Rockford pain center today.
Had an 11;30 appointment. Didn't get to see doctor until 11:50.
Saw for a couple minutes.
Then waited and waited to get paperwork.
Had to go to front desk and ask for paperwork then it still took awhile to get it.
If they were running behind, a courtesy phone call would be nice.
So your not sitting there for an hour.
My appointment could of be done over phone.
Doctor was nice.
Waisted 3 hours of my day.
As it takes almost an hour to drive there
Cheryl Johnson|DR. John Ha is a great doctor. Explains every very well.  I have a herniated disc in my spine . I have been to the chiropractor that actually made it worse. Couple doctors told me only option was surgery and have it fused but that wasn't a option I was taking. I did the nerve ablation and for the first time in 4 years I'm finally pain free! Thanks Dr. Ha for recommending this procedure! The procedure was fast and pain free and was able to go about normal life a few hours later.

At Midwest Physician Pain Center, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout Chicago. Our dedicated team provides advanced treatment options for a wide range of chronic and acute pain conditions. We understand how debilitating persistent pain can be, which is why we offer personalized care plans tailored to each patient's specific needs and medical history.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We provide specialized treatment for numerous pain conditions including:

  • Spinal Pain (Cervical, Thoracic, Lower Back)

  • Joint Pain (Hip, Shoulder, Knee)

  • Nerve-Related Conditions (Sciatica, Meralgia Paresthetica)

  • Post-Surgical Pain (Failed Back Syndrome, Post Laminectomy Syndrome)

  • Headaches & Facial Pain (Migraines)

Our treatment approaches include interventional procedures, medication management, and comprehensive care plans designed to improve function and quality of life.

column3:
At our practice, we understand that chronic pain can significantly diminish quality of life. As board-certified pain management specialists, we see patients at their most vulnerable moments and are committed to providing comprehensive relief through personalized care.

Advanced Pain Management Solutions

We utilize a multimodal approach to pain management that includes:

  • Regional anesthetic techniques for targeted relief

  • Radiofrequency ablation for long-lasting pain reduction

  • Neuromodulation therapies for chronic pain conditions

  • Specialized infusion therapies including ketamine and propofol

Dr. Neal Shah and our team take pride in listening carefully to each patient's concerns, developing individualized treatment plans that address the root causes of pain rather than just masking symptoms. Our goal is to improve functionality and quality of life through the most effective and appropriate interventions. Located in Elgin, IL, we welcome patients seeking relief from chronic pain conditions at our state-of-the-art facility. Learn more about our comprehensive approach to pain management by visiting Dr. Neal Shah Pain Management Specialist or call us at (815) 398-9491 to schedule your consultation.
column11: As an interventional pain management specialist, I see patients at their most vulnerable moments, when chronic pain is diminishing quality of life. I love having the ability to significantly improve my patients' quality of life through a multimodal approach to pain management. Bringing regional anesthetic options and advanced therapies like radiofrequency ablation, neuromodulation, and infusion therapies such as ketamine and propofol into my practice allows me to utilize a multimodal approach to building comprehensive treatment plans tailored for each individual.

Specialized Pain Management Expertise

Our team of highly trained neuro-anesthesiologists, physiatrists, and neurologists work together to develop personalized treatment plans using the latest minimally invasive procedures. We offer a full spectrum of pain management services including:

  • Targeted steroid injections

  • Medication management

  • Nerve blocks

  • Spinal cord stimulation

  • Physical medicine approaches

We understand how debilitating chronic pain can be, which is why we take the time to listen to your concerns and develop treatment strategies that address your specific needs. Our goal is to improve your quality of life and help you return to the activities you love. Visit our Ascension Saint Joseph Pain Care Locations page to learn more about our services or call us at (815) 729-0450 to schedule your consultation at our Madison Street location in Joliet.
column11: If you're living with chronic pain, our pain management care team at Ascension Saint Joseph Pain Care Joliet in Joliet, IL, can help you feel better using minimally invasive procedures, injections and medications. Specialized Vein Treatment Services

We offer a comprehensive range of vascular treatments including:

Our pain management expertise extends to treating various conditions including joint pain, back pain, sciatica, and sports injuries. We take a personalized approach to each patient, developing customized treatment plans that address the root cause of discomfort rather than just masking symptoms.
