column40:
I was SO anxious to get an injection in my knee. I've suffered from chronic pain and joint issues for years; tears, cracked cartilage, inflammation-the works. The day of my injection, I almost backed out. I was terrified-what if something went wrong ?
Dr. E calmly explained the procedure without judgement and was patient and kind. I felt safe going into my procedure and happy, accomplished and pain free leaving.
thank you so much !!!!|Went there to get rapid covid test. Their website said the same day results. Went there, took the swabs just to be informed I will have my results the next day and if I want the same day I would need to pay $300 for emergency test.. In that case I told them to throw away the test I took because I need the results the same day. They claimed that the same day results are only if I was there before 1pm - I had apt at 2:45pm. Nowhere on their website says that same day results are only if you make there before 1pm. Hope they won't charge me $100 for something I can't use... but I'll find out about that soon.|Went to the Loop Medical Center-Streeterville for a routine test on a Sunday.

Was able to make the appointment and complete all of the pre-appointment documentation online prior to arriving for the appointment.

Once I arrived for my appointment, the whole process took about 10 minutes and there were a few '15 minutes or less' parking spaces available in front of their building. Very efficient.|Your operation was just terrific... fast, efficient setup.
Your people were direct but polite and even patient.. just great.
I needed this test before the first open time I was able to schedule 12/26. I asked if I could be squeezed in today...in a slow time . "Sure" , was the answer.....super accommodating . I was in and tested and out of there in like 15 min.
Best yet, I got my NEGATIVE answer in less than 3 hours this evening.... They said it could take up to 24 hours.
So what did I think ..just a GREAT experience...kept up the good work.
Regards
Bill|Very smooth and quick procedure. Politely greeted by the nurse upon entry, easy guidance provided for the self testing, and done! Less than 10 minutes and we were finished. Great service to have in these challenging times to return back to normal|Legit testing site that is clean and well-run; it's my first choice when I need results for work. When I went at 8:45am I got rapid PCR results around 1pm the same day. Also as I was leaving my appointment an international traveler came in and the staff was proactively trying to figure out if they could bill his insurance instead of just charging him outright. Highly recommended.|Staff was pleasant and gave clear directions to the process. Accurate information and super quick. Very clean and organized space. I've been twice and both times were similar experiences when getting my Covid test. It's helpful to have kind people working when people are stressed about Covid. Thanks!|This place was awesome! I'm fully vaccinated, but still needed a RT-PCR test to fly to Ireland. Their website says the results take 24 hours, but because I got there early in the morning (7:50 am), I got my results by 12 noon that same day. Thanks so much for being so efficient and free!!! Great service.

At Pys Headache and Pain Clinic, we've been providing specialized neuromuscular therapy with osteopathic manual therapy since 1995. Our unique approach combines advanced pain management techniques with physiotherapy to address chronic headaches, migraines, and musculoskeletal pain at their source.

Comprehensive Pain Solutions

Our treatment methodology focuses on identifying and treating the underlying causes of pain rather than just managing symptoms. We specialize in:

  • Migraine and headache treatment

  • Neck and back pain management

  • Post-concussion syndrome therapy

  • Spinal stenosis relief

  • Neuromuscular rehabilitation

What sets us apart is our personalized approach—we take the time to educate patients about their conditions and develop customized treatment plans that promote long-term healing. Our clinic is led by Michael Pys, a highly skilled pain management physician with over 25 years of experience helping patients find relief when other treatments have failed. Visit our website or call us at +1 847-770-3332 to schedule a consultation at our Northfield location.

column40:
Not only is he a doctor who truly cares for his patients, he's also very personable 10/10 cool guy all around. Most importantly however his treatments actually work! As someone who's endured many concussions and falls I really thought I was stuck with chronic pain.. but it's gone! Go here and see for yourself.|I have been going to Michael Pys for almost a year now,  started with neck and back pain.  He is a miracle worker.  Neck pain and range of motion is 100% better.  Back pain is totally under control.
Recommend him for sure.|I finally found a physical therapist who specializes in headaches and pain after suffering from a traumatic brain injury for years. Michael Pys is one of the few people in the world who knows what's wrong with me and can make a difference immediately with my neck and head pain. I wish I lived closer to him so I could see him on a regular basis. He is worth all of your time and truly cares about each individual's pain and is brutally honest. I am blessed to have been able to see him and again wish I lived near his practice. He is one of the best.|I had been having migraines for as long as I can remember and finally went to Pys Headache and Pain Clinic to get myself checked. On the first visit, Dr. Barbara told me that my migraines were caused by my body structure and posture. I started to have some therapy sessions with Michael, which really helped me not to have any more migraines after about 2-3 weeks of visits. The treatment process did take some time but it's definitely worth it. Not only did Barbara and Michael treat me, they also educated me about how to have and maintain good body posture. Another thing that I also appreciate is that they didn't prescribe or recommend me to take any medicines at all, which lets me be more comfortable with my treatment process.|I have had chronic migraines for the past 7 years and have tried every kind of treatment imaginable. Once I started going to Michael and Barbara Pys, my migraines reduced significantly in both frequency and severity. I have never encountered a treatment/practice like theirs and could tell how different they were from the first appointment. They take the time to not only treat you, but educate you and hold you accountable as well. They truly care about their patients and are both very kind. I highly, highly recommend!|Michael Pys came highly recommended through our family GP and after providing my spouse with measurable and almost instant pain relief, I decided to attempt to get neck and lower back therapy.  As is often the case, I first went to a Chiropractor with little sustainable relief found.  After 1 treatment with Michael, I canceled my future appointments elsewhere and find that weekly treatments provide sufficient relief that allows me to remain active and relatively pain free.
I recommend Michael to anyone with neck and or back pain.|I slept on the wrong side of the bed and had been suffering with constant headache, nausea, neck and shoulder pain. After my first visit with Michael, I began to feel better. He was friendly and knowledgeable. I started seeing Michael a few times a week for treatments and eventually once every two weeks. The treatments have definitely help me feel better. I am so thankful for his help.|I had suffered for 15 years with severe migraine.

After 4 doctors who diagnosed me with different type of headaches from hormonal to migraine  and prescribed same medication, thousands of dollars in diagnosis and treatments and no relief. My former boss who had a history of pain and his wife who had a history of life headaches recommended me to Michael Pys. I came to see him with sharp headache and left with out it after first treatment, after 4 treatments my migraines decreased to ones in  2 weeks and after 8 treatments I had no migraine at all for 2 years.

I stopped see Michael Pys 2 years ago and my headaches recently came back. I have to drive about one hour to see him but it makes huge different the way I feel and function after each treatment. No drugs. I like it.

Words cannot fully convey my appreciation

column40:
Let me preface this by telling everyone I WAS until very recently a patient at first the Bolingbrook, then Hinsdale locations of (Gateway) Spine and Pain and Dr. John Hong for more than 12 years after my pelvis had been crushed over 35 years ago. (Prior to this with pain management doctors where I had previously lived before coming to the Chicago area)

Dr Hong was an excellent physician for me over the years. He was compassionate, thorough and worked together with me to try to relieve as much as was possible of my pain. Through MRI's, tests, pain meds,nerve blocks, a Neurostimulator Implant, and so on.
Sadly, However, Dr. Hong is no longer at Gateway Spine and Pain. Sadly there is no Gateway Spine and Pain. And this practice is no longer here for their patients needs. They are there for covering their selves.
It's just Pain and Spine Institute. With some very important changes in how they care for their PATIENTS AND about PAIN MANAGEMENT...

I am very concerned about the direction  the practice has taken since Dr. Hong left. It seems they are more interested in doing mostly UNNECESSARY and COSTLY procedures, including more MRI's, surgeries and who knows what else.
What Nurse Practitioner Jennifer Hinchley told me was the main focus of the practice now;  "Interventional Pain Management" , including lowering doses of my meds because, and I quote "Dr. Hong has you on a higher doseage than current policies allow"
AS Well As COMPLETELY REVERSING the practices compassionate policies regarding the use of THC products (Now Completely Legal in Illinois by the way) and actually have helped with the nerve pain as well as getting a better nights sleep than taking care of a long standing patient who was primarily stable.

I believe this practice has forgotten their "mission" is supposed to be to help us manage OUR VERY REAL PAIN with what works not what some administrator decided is appropriate and takes options away instead of providing them...
NOT ONCE have I seen an actual DOCTOR since Dr. Hong left the practice to discuss my case, . I have no idea who this new Doctor is. (Dr. Jaison J. Thekkekara, MD) Never met him, never talked to him, ever.
Now, suddenly, Nurse Practitioner Jennifer Hinchley is all let's get it authorized to replace the old Neurostimulator which I explained would need to be done later  due to some personal issues.
Nonetheless, I started getting calls from the office and mail from some other almost immediately to schedule the surgery.
In summary Dr Hong leaves, Nurse Practitioner Jennifer Hinchley starts tinkering with my meds because they don't like the dose, wants to schedule surgery, reverses THC policy and not once did I talk to the doctor.

I know this review has been long (thanks for reading) I had to say something because I cannot in good conscience say I still recommend this practice. I believe that all this practice will do is give lip service to Pain Management and don't really care about their patients in the long term.

Hiding behind a Nurse Practitioner, One Size for ALL medicine, and not allowing compassionate policies regarding THC is not serving my best interest and may not serve yours...

I went for the first time, I was very nervous, shots in my spine scared me. Everyone was so nice and understanding, and eased my fears. Doctor Kapoor was very nice, knowledgeable, very kind and answered all my questions and concerns, took his time with me wasn't rushed at all. He explained the whole procedure.  My visit was a nice one. So far the shots have seemed to help my pain. Thank you|I just started seeing Dr Esparaz and he is very kind and compassionate. I got a shoulder injection yesterday and barely felt a pinch!
There are several ways to communicate with the staff, ie phone, patient portal, email, which is helpful for someone like me that works a lot. All the staff have been great.|Dr. Kapoor and his staff were professional and responsive for treating my neck pain.  The doctor took the time to listen to my pain complaints and come up with a treatment plan with me.  I felt comfortable during the procedure and with after care.  Highly recommend this practice for pain needs.|When an old neck injury flared up I did everything right, I went to the PT, did dry needling with the chiro, sought out sports massage and regularly go to infrared heated yoga but the pain didn't ease up. My muscles were spasming and felt so tough to touch. A friend of mine recommended I see Dr Kapoor and I am so ecstatic they did! He administered some injections around the site with expert precision and little discomfort. From the moment I entered the treatment room I was made to feel comfortable and his bedside manner was impeccable. Dr Kapoor is an expert in the spine and walked me through all of my questions and explained the treatment and plan in a way that was humble, technical and easy for a novice to understand.

My gosh this was today and the relief I have felt has been unrivalled, almost immediately I was able to gain a range of motion in my shoulder that I have not felt in months.

Now I can move freely and the pain has subsided completely. He's a true miracle worker and I cannot advocate for him enough.

Sometimes and especially with children and balancing a hard working schedule, it's difficult to carve out the time to take better care of yourself but all I can say is I am so glad I have and I'll most definitely return.

The staff are knowledgeable and I got an appointment at a suitable time within days of my call. Honestly this was exemplary service and I will not hesitate to return. The quality of life I now have is the best it has been in over 4 months. Thank you so much to Dr Kapoor and team, 5* !|Dr. Kapoor has canceled my appointment multiple times delaying my required treatments and care by months and changed locations multiple times. The office staff is kind but the amount of barriers the doctor creates to not have to do his job is absolutely astounding. I have had no treatments at either location and multiple cancellations for the past 6 months. I am at my wits end with getting an appointment. They also discriminate based on age because apparently younger adults can't have any pain or injuries.|Dr. Kapoor and his staff are great! Very knowledgeable and helpful. They always provide options for pain management and use best practices with the patients input to achieve their goals. Would highly recommend!|I have been going to this center for over a decade; although the doctors are incredibly competent, the rest of the staff is rude and unprofessional.  I have often times waited for over an hour for my appointment and have had 4 different doctors in the past year alone.  No one answers the phone, often takes hours to get a phone call back.  Was running 15 minutes late for an appointment today, tried calling, obviously no answer, and when I arrived I was told I couldn't be seen.  Guess it is time to find a new treatment center that has a reasonable standard for patient care.  No knock on the doctors at all; Kapoor, Raffati, et al were all great... the rest of the team should inquire with the DMV.|Dr. Kapoor promptly identified my pain and treated the issue with a sustainable fix. His staff were truly fantastic to work with. I would be happy to refer my family and friends.

column40: Chicago pain relief  office Dr Chadha is knowledgeable n compassionate person I met. Explain very well in which area hurting and what is side effect as well what is precaution to do . Office staff is very courteous  and cooperative also|While Dr Chadha was pleasant in her demeanor, I will always regret my decision to have her perform a Stellate Ganglion Block on me to address my post Covid-19 loss of taste and smell. The SGB did not improve my taste and smell, and the next day I developed constant ringing in my ears (tinnitus) for the first time in my 56 years of life, and it continues to this day, 8.5 months later. When I reported this symptom to Doctor Chadha shortly after the procedure, she just replied she had never heard of tinnitus as a side effect of the SGB and suggested I see my primary doctor to see if "something else" might be causing it. Right, sure thing.... ;) Attempted to see an ENT and after explaining the timing of the symptoms and connection back to the SGB procedure by Dr. Chadka, he refused to see me and cancelled my appointment, saying I need to address it with her. With no other recourse, I then saw my GP who verified my ears were physically OK, then just said I have to live with it. So there you go. Just know that side effects are a real possibility to any procedure, hence the Doctor's requirement for the patient to sign a release before any procedure is performed. Not saying you will have any side effects, but if you do you will be on your own to figure it out and or just live with it for the rest of your life. Go into it eyes wide open.|Dr. Chadha and her staff are all amazing. They made me feel very comfortable.|My experience at Chicago Pain Relief was truly life changing!!! Dr. Chadha and team were amazingly caring and compassionate. There were generally interested in my wellbeing and did everything to ensure a positive treatment experience!!!|Called for an appointment on the last day before their vacation and they squeezed me in. They have been effective treating severe back pain.|This was my first visit to Dr. Chadha's office to discuss pain I have in my lower back. She asked many questions to help her identify the source of my pain. She also examined me and ordered an MRI for me before suggesting a treatment plan. I am hopeful she can suggest a treatment to lessen the pain that does not include surgery|For two years, Dr. Chadha treated my sciatica-type back pain with steroid shots and enabled me to get through my day with minimal to no pain.  Without the shots administered by Dr. Chadha, there were times when I was unable to stand or walk for more than 15 minutes without intense pain.  She took the time to figure out which areas were the source of the pain as there was more than one issue going on at the same time.  If you've tried steroid shots somewhere else and they didn't help, I would still recommend that you consult with Dr. Chadha as her process is very thorough. And all the employees I met at this clinic are patient, kind and compassionate.|They were incredible. Very attentive to my lost of taste/smell and made sure I was comfortable with the process on back to back days. They were considerate enough to follow up with me a month later and recommended continued shots if needed. I would never go anywhere else and I was lucky to find them!

column40:
Went there for back pain told me it was all in my head! Needless to say I left this worthless outfit and a great Dr. I found out I have degenerative disc disease. Had double lumbar fusion done on my back! Bit it was all in my head!! DO NOT GO HERE!!! Pain clinic my azz! I could be in the woods with 2 broken legs and have osf pain clinic as my only contact in my phone, I still wouldn't call them!!|Unqualified practitioners. They injected my spine in the wrong region, thoracic rather than cervical. They made my condition much worse. J Jones lied to me about the safety of procedures.  Go anywhere else.|After reading the long list of poor ratings regarding scheduling covering several years, I can confidently report nothing has changed.  Even with their patronizing, canned remarks, I found they do not return calls from voicemail, and are apathetic at best on the phone. My upcoming visit should be interesting to say the least.
I will provide another review once that is complete.
UPDATE: As much as I hate to say it, my instincts were correct.  The provider I saw should give her diploma back..what a crock.|Honestly I wish they had a lower rating. I was referred to this so called pain center by my primary care provider here in Galesburg. I always try to stick with OSF doctors because I so rarely have an issue with them, so initially I was very hopeful that they would help me find relief from my fibromyalgia pain. When I went in for a new patient consultation I saw some NP named Colleen or something and she seemed very kind and understanding. I stated that I am on disability and can only get medication on the 3rd thru the 5th of each month. I stated that I had seen many friends fall to opiates and really preferred to only use them when there was NO OTHER CHOICE. She typed the whole time and I went home thinking that the flare I was headed for would be easier than others had. It was way worse. When I called the clinic as I was told to when the pain was severe, I spoke to a nurse named Laura or Lauren. She laughed outright at me and said she would make sure the NP got it. When the NP called me she was also laughing. I'm guessing they enjoy other's pain there. A Sadists Haven. I lodged a complaint and was quickly turned over to a doctor named McManus who I was told was the director. When he came into the appointment, he was abrupt and rude. The first thing he said was "I hear you want some opiates." I was furious. I told him that I wanted help with the pain and didn't appreciate being laughed at by his staff. The appointment was ultimately pointless as he agreed that the Benadryl that the NP sent a script to my pharmacy for would help the pain. I told him all it did was help with my allergies. My sinuses were clear for the first time in weeks. He prescribed baclofen and it mixed with one of my other medications and I became unresponsive twice. I caught a ride to his office because he insisted I come in so he could assess my state. He then told me to stop taking the conflicting medication that was given by another doctor without ever contacting her! I made the mistake of returning because I have no other option. He stated in the MyChart app in a message to me yesterday that they only work with "chronic, unchanging pain," not fibromyalgia pain that just gets worse. My PCP, an ER, or an Urgent Care would have to handle my case. My PCP sent me to this place because she couldn't help. The ER will do nothing except perhaps run tests all day or night and maybe give me a shot. Urgent Care here is a joke. No help there. They send you to the ER. Do not go to this place if you actually need help.|Have been having trouble a lot with my neck, I had an injection done by dr Marshall. Jan 21, I was offered a 2nd injection after two weeks, of my symptoms haven't improved.I've been calling them since the 2 mark week,Every time I would try to contact there office(nurse ext) the nurses line never answered! Not once. I had to email, and I even told the scheduling that nurse never answered there extension and she still thru me to the nurses extension. I got my appointment scheduled for my injection Monday morning , I missed it and INOW March 4th Wednesday I called back to rescheduled. Was told I missed too many appointments to reschedule, which was incorrect I never missed an appointment with them. Than was told I'd get a call back, I was told it wasn't the fact that I missed appointments, dr Marshall just didn't want to perform the 2nd injection. Now I am furious because why would I get the scheduled appointment and now suddenly  just getting the notice that I can't get even  the injection! It has been chaos trying to get in contact with the plan clinic. The guy who I had my initial consultation was rude as well . It has been nothing but a chaotic mess. nothing less.. And now they throw this at me....I would not recommend this place.|The front desk tell you totally different "rules". One will say one thing, another will say something different. Even when I called my health insurance and they clarified with me, the office still called me a lie in so many words.  Also, It takes about one month or more to finally get in so you have to suffer even longer to finally get relief. Dr Baha is amazing though.|Totally took me off my pain meds and told me to go to the ER if I had withdraws after being on opioids since 207 If I could I would give 0 stars. This place is totally useless as with all so called pain clinics. Now I'm going to have seizures and with draws just had one this afternoon mild one from not having my meds. stay away at all costs. 0 and I mean 0 stars also thanks a lot for the convulsions and seizures and a weeks worth of bills i CAN NOT PAY|What the hell is going on down there ? I've called several times a day for the past week. Left several voicemails,with no return. What a mess!! I am so disappointed with this place. The only reason why I tried to get in,is becuase of my insurance. Save your self the misery and continue to Gaurdian pain clinic in Bloomington. Even if you pay out of pocket. OSF HAS GONE DOWN HILL!!! Illinois Neurology is a waste of time too!

And I do not appreciate being lied to by this clinic as I see doctors for a very serious matter to try to get pain relief and this clinic was just low effort all around.|I have used Dr. Marsiglia several times now for back pain, epidurals specifically.
Communicates well and has a good bedside manner which is rare for good doctors these days.
The staff is equally communicative and accommodating.
Very happy and will continue to go back as long as I have to.|I would recommend innovative pain specialists with a high regard. Dr Paul Marsigia is an amazing doctor. He listens to what you have to say and comes up with a plan of care immediately. He is highly educated with pain management you will not be disappointed.|Like my previous visits, Dr. Louis was very attentive, thorough and decisive about next steps in my treatment after examination. He's terrific, and I'd highly recommend him.|Dr Marsiglia listened very well to my concerns. He was patient and gave me plenty of time to ask all my questions. Personalized Care for Chronic Pain

Is it common for a doctor to not do any exams on first visit? I need to have an epidural, a couple of MRIs and was told they do steroid injections. He didn't even do any physcial assessment. He spoke to me about my pain, how much medications I'm on. And my goals for my pain management. I said I'd wanted help in coping with and living with my pain issues. I  wnt in honestly and I have multiple health concerns. Many he doesn't treat. But he happily informed me that he could help my back and knee pain with needles and steroids! What a crock, I was td that because of my health I couldn't get the steroid injections anymore. And I'm not a fan, a lot of my problems are from steroids because of chrons disease  they cause more problems. That's wht they're illegal in other places! I swear dollar signs are all some if these places see. I thought the oath was first do no harm? I've been advised to pass|My wife has been going to this pain management clinic for over 6 year now She has seen several amazing doctors throughout the years but now she sees Dr Hadi Moten And he is fantastic He listens and tries to relieve her chronic back problems  Because she doesn't want to get a complete Spinal Reconstruction as what 4 different spinal surgery doctor said to her
He works with her and tries to relieve as much pain! All the wonderful receptionist are friendly and so helpful! I would definitely recommend this place I know my wife will always be in some pain but knowing Dr.Hadi Moten I always feel so much better knowing he's trying to help her!
Guy and Karen DeFalco|Dr. Moten is great.  He actually cares and listens to you.  I am so glad I switch and started going to him.|Dr. Todd Hagle is the best pain doctor I have ever had. I have been with him for many years. He is very concerned and cares about each and every patient. You're a person not just a number. His staff is very friendly and courteous..|Dr Hagel has been my doctor for 7 plus years is very professional has great bedside manner and listens and  keeps me pain-free. I highly recommend him. For spinal issues or any other extremities. He'll have options. And will explain everything thoroughly|Dr Hagle is an excellent doctor in a field of many that just don't get it, don't care, or simply provide terrible care. However, you should be prepared to wait sometimes. That's an office scheduling issue -- not Dr Hagle's fault. The upside of that is that Dr Hagle actually gives patients the time they need to discuss their problems and ask all the questions they have. I also wish they weren't closing the St Charles office. Dr Hagle is a superb doctor who does all he can to get to the heart of the problem. He provides wonderful care and is the best doctor I have worked with after 40 years of serious health problems and seeing tons of other doctors who gave very sub par care. He a super doctor who actually listens to you and works hard to find and address what is actually causing the pain. You can't go wrong!|Dr.Hagel is a wonderful caring pain doctor who genuinely cares. He gives you 100% and works with you in order to give you a life outside of your pain. He is compassionate, honest, understanding, knowledgeable, and will give you the best care for your pain so you can live life. I highly recommend him.|I have several illnesses, all causing chronic pain. I moved to St. Charles and had to leave my old pain doctor who I had for years and loved. I met with 2-3 pain management doctors in the area and had given up on finding someone who treats me well and manages my pain correctly. (One doctor "didn't believe" in 2 of my diseases (fibromyalgia and trigeminal neuralgia) and said neurologists just "make these up when they can't diagnose a patient properly" . Mind you, TN is nicknamed "The Suicide Disease" bc of the pain level and rarely a cure found. ) Dr. Hagle was referred to me by my dentist whose office is in the same compound. He listens intently to your issues, helps find a plan to hopefully fix or decrease pain, and sometimes has been my "therapist" when I vent about my pain.

His office is very helpful with appointments, refills, and scheduling procedures. I've had injections and ablations done by him. Some successful, some not. He's always willing to try different procedures to help me, but will be truthful and not do when he knows it won't work. I've at times begged him to do one, acknowledging that it may not help at all. But he doesn't waste my money or his time when he knows I won't get relief. That shows me he's not taking advantage of me and is treating me correctly. I've been to ER many times because of pain. Every time I say his name there, the doctors and nurses at hospital talk highly of him. I've even had pharmacists who tell me how they like Dr. Hagle and how/what he prescribes to patients. Whatever type of pain you have and/or whatever intensity of pain you have, see Dr. Hagle. As you can see, I have lots of words of praise for him and it's still not enough. He's even better than my last one, which I didn't think was possible.

column40:
Update: I have seen major changes in my spine both at my lower back (8 degrees change) and neck (4 degrees change) as well as my right hip that was rotated in (11 degree change). I can move so much better now and the biggest thing for me was that I regained the 2 inches in height that I lost after my back surgery 1 year ago! Everyone here is amazing and very helpful. I don't know what my life would be like without this place, but it wouldn't be as good as it is now.

Orginal:  I have tried many places attempting to deal with my knee and back pain over several years now. I even tried back surgery (at under 30 years old). Nothing really helped and everywhere treated me poorly do to " being to young to be in this kind of pain". From the very first day I started at Superior health I have been treated fantastic! Everyone here is so kind and encouraging. I have only been going for a few weeks but I'm already feeling better than I ever have. My favorite thing about this place is that they are more of a total body health. They actually want to help me fix the underlying issues and not just give me meds for pain and sent me home. This place I like a family. You can tell how much they care just watching how they react when clients "graduate". Never seen another place like this. I look forward to coming here and can't wait to see how I continue to progress and get better. Your never to young or to old to live a life without pain.|Had one knee and shoulder treated. Well rounded program. Glad to find all treatments under one roof. Drove from Bloomington to Peoria twice a week, was worth it. My knee completely back to norm. Shoulder, part way.|My daughter calls my twice a week PT at Superior MED my social time!
The staff is great and very helpful. Always there with answers and smiles!  I am feeling stronger with every treatment.
There is a reason Superior is in their name!!|##IN THE END I WAS TOLD THIS TREATMENT IS NOT FOR EVERYONE. I WAS IN THE 20%. IT WAS A BIG WASTE OF MONEY. STILL IN PAIN.  

###Update...I'm saw Dr Sparks and we've got a great program set up. I truely believe the staff wants to make me better. Thank you all!

Very disappointed I don't think I got the treatment I paid for. I felt relief for a while and thought all was good. Then the office closed and that was that. I couldnt get a answer on follow up. They say they want to make it right but another $4000 minimum. Guess I'm back to square one.|My wife and I have had some amazing results with my hips and her neck! After doing the 8 week program we both saw great movement on our X-rays. Between the adjustments, physical therapy, assortment of tools to use at home, and injections, we were given exactly what we needed to have successful stories:) We also work hard at home as well because that's so important!! We both continue to get adjustments every other week and we look forward to seeing all the friendly faces! It's always nice to be greeted with a smile:) Don't forget to wobble! (You have to go to know what that means... Ha!)|I have been a patient of Dr. Sparks and Dr. Matt for several years. My back and neck issues were corrected and I continue under maintenance. Since coming here my immune system has improved very much. The doctors desire to educate their patients on steps we can do to improve our health. I have learned about healthy eating and avoiding toxins and the importance of keeping my spine healthy. Carrie always has a smile on her face and is always very helpful.|I had Platelet injections and after a year my x-ray came back with no change.  Its not a permanent fix but it has helped me to prolong the total knee replacement at this time. Back decompression is the best, make my back feel wonderful.  Thank you to all the staff they are wonderful.|My children and I have been coming to this practice for almost 3 years!!  The boost in their immune system as we continue coming twice a month has been amazing.  All staff members are friendly and knowledgeable....Carrie is always at the front desk with a smile on her face.  Both Dr. Sparks and Dr. Spangler give you the time and attention at each adjustment.  They go above and beyond to help work through any health issues and have many options to offer that other practices do not.  If you haven't had luck with your current treatments, please consider coming here.

I recommend him with full confidence  that him and his team will do everything at their disposal to help and he's always aware of the newest and most cutting edge treatments. If you need an intellectual physician who will apply both critical thinking skills combined with empathy and creative solutions Dr. Jaycox would be an excellent choice. We are very grateful we found him and thankful for the wonderful working relationship we have formed.|I cannot recommend Dr. Jaycox highly enough! He is truly exceptional, particularly when it comes to managing tricky or complex conditions. His bedside manner is outstanding; he takes the time to thoroughly explain every detail and ensures that I am fully involved in the decision-making process regarding my treatment options. I appreciate that he always presents multiple pathways to consider, which empowers me as a patient. I never feel rushed during my appointments, and it's evident that he genuinely cares about my well-being. I have been seeing him for over a year, and his dedication to finding the best strategies for managing my health is unwavering. Plus, the entire staff is super helpful and friendly.|I have been in chronic pain for 2 years. It has been awful. There's been a lot of switching around as to what the cause is my neck versus my shoulder. I met Dr. Jaycox and he listened probably for a half an hour to me explain what was going on. He then decided to inject two parts of my shoulder. My pain went from a seven to a zero in 10 minutes. It was so strange to experience. He he tells me this pain may come back and probably will that. This is just kind of locating the source. He has a plan for me and I am thankful that he was put in my path. He is kind and interested in what you have to say.|Dr. Jaycox and his team has been providing phenomenal healthcare to me over many years. Great bedside manner, Very knowledgeable, takes his time to explain things to me . Most important he is a listener, and his course of action to address my health issues are on point.
Love always|Dr. Jaycox is knowledgeable, caring and incredibly patient! He took the time to explain my condition in detail. I absolutely recommend him and his Rush team.|After more than 25 years dealing with back pain I saw Dr Matthew P Jaycox.  None of my  prior doctors took the time to identify the root cause of the problem. column40: Dr. DeCaria has helped me through the last 3.5 years of pain after a back surgery. I searched around for a knowledgeable medical professional to figure out how to lessen the problem I was left with after my back surgery. One problem was "cured" with surgery and another problem, just as life altering as the diagnosis which necessitated the surgery, was created. I have had injections between 3-6 months apart - going longer now that my physical therapy practice has become consistent daily and my muscle strength has built up. That's a meaningful relief of symptoms and allows me to live completely normally again. Dr. DeCaria is very caring, keeps you informed if you've got any tests/imaging which need to be done, explains the results in layman's terms. I always feel free to ask questions about my treatment and know I'm getting the best, most thoughtful care available. After 3.5 years under her care I can confidently say that. Rounding out her practice is a staff of equally caring and smart nurses, medical assistants and office professionals who are there to listen to any concerns. The personalized care is like nothing I've experienced over the years. I am very grateful to have had Dr. DeCaria and her team to live my life to the fullest these last few years.|Dr. DeCaria has treated me in a kind, holistic, and thorough way. It's apparent that she cares about her patients. I have a complex set of issues and she has provided me with a lot of relief through various methods, and I feel like she is always working to further help me. Also, her staff are great! They're always very kind and responsive whenever I have an issue. I highly recommend seeing Dr. DeCaria if you're struggling with pain and don't just want more pain meds. You'll be in good hands.|I have been a patent of Dr. DeCaria for 2 years. The medical procedures she has administered has definitely helped to elevate my chronic pain and has improved the quality of my life. I highly recommend her services.|I have been a patient of Dr. DeCaria for almost three years now. She is a fantastic specialist and a wonderful person. I am walking without pain after her treatments. The office of Revitalize Medical Center has very friendly and professional personnel. All of them are very good specialists. I would recommend Dr. DeCaria to anyone who has problems with back pain.|Y'All. I had to get away from the large health systems like Northshore and Northwestern. I found Dr. DeCaria and she is the BEST!!! I have a really painful degenerative spine disease and she jsut knows eaxctly what to try. I feel really grateful for finding her. Her staff is always so professional and her office is gorgeous.|Long story short, I had a bulged herniated disk, DR.DeCaria gave me steroid shoots that improved my pain 100%. Now after 2 years I am deadlifting 250 lbs. thank you Dr. DeCaria for the amazing work you do!|I have been seeing Dr. DeCaria for a little bit over a year and she is by far very caring and goes the extra mile to make sure that she does everything possible for her patients to alleviate pain. I have been dealing with back and feet problems for awhile now and with me being such a young patient to have someone looking out for my well being such as Dr. DeCaria if a sigh of relief. She and her team are also very responsive and quick to get answers for your questions or treatment for issues.|Dr. DeCaria reviewed all of my medical history and took a more holistic approach than any other doctor I have seen. Instead of recommending more surgery, she suggested I consider changing my diet. She has guided me through the process for the past six months and I feel better than I have in years. My chronic pain is greatly reduced and still improving. And other benefits from this way of eating are evident as well. My cholesterol has dropped significantly and all of my bloodwork looks fantastic! I recommend Dr. DeCaria to anyone who is struggling with chronic pain.

back and was out of med...to see my husband sitting in pain with his walker sit for A entire HOUR because of a NETWORK of people taking appointments lying then tell you to show up force your spouse to really good professionals and staff are amazing|I've seen Dr Donko for pain management for 2yrs. He and the staff has been professional and caring. My experience has been great and in a timely manner. Thanks team ACPC for everything.|My mother was a pt of Dr. Vaughn, a pain specialist. My mother has a condition in which she suffers with chronic pain. She has tried a number of different pain medications and non-phramacological measures and nothing has helped with my mothers pain. My mother does have past conditions that affect her from being able to take certain meds, therefore, treatment becomes limited.

This review is based off of how this doctor spoke to my mother, she told my mother that she doesn't understand why my mother cries when she sees her. My mother cries because you had told her, the pain specialist, there is nothing else you can do for her.

Do you know how devastating it is to hear those words from your doctor? How hard it is to deal with chronic pain. Pain that is constant each and every day. This is why she cried. She confided in you, someone that is suppose to and chose a profession in which should show some sympathy, some compassion.

All I can say is think before you speak, think of how your pts much feel living with pain, put yourself in someone else's shoes. Because if you can't show some compassion, I don't know what drove you into the profession.

If I could give you zero stars I would, but it doesn't allow me to.|I had a great experience here getting treatment for my lower back. The staff was very professional, courteous & timely. I was in & out in minimal time.  I would highly recommend Dr. Donko to anyone.||

column40:
I am deeply disappointed with my experience with Dr. Chunduri- I came to this doctor seeking help after a series of car accidents, Instead of providing me with the understanding and compassion any patient deserves, he LAUGHED at the fact that I had been in a third car accident. This reaction was incredibly unprofessional and dismissive, especially when I was already feeling vulnerable and overwhelmed by my symptoms.

Patients come to doctors for support, guidance, and medical care, not to be belittled or mocked for their circumstances. Being in an accident, let alone multiple, is nothing to LAUGH about--it's a traumatic experience that can cause both physical and emotional damage. I left the appointment feeling unheard, embarrassed, and even more stressed than when I arrived.

If you value empathy, professionalism, and proper care, I would recommend seeking another provider who takes their patients and their concerns seriously.|This clinic has very friendly and welcoming staff ! Everyone greets you with a warm "hello." I think my favorite staff are the ladies at the front desk, Maira, Lucy and Peggy. Dr Chunduri and especially Lauren have been amazing at helping me get better after my car accident through the exercises we work on during physical therapy. By far the most friendliest and welcoming clinic I've ever been at. They even have cute decorations|Great bedside manner. The new PA Chris fits right in. He is excellent.|I was in extreme pain but the young lady that I spoke with was kind and patient.  I had left a message as a new patient to schedule and she returned my call promptly. Once I came for my scheduled appointment I found the receptionist polite, pleasant and informative. All of the staff I met were patient professionals as I walked and maneuvered gingerly in pain. The assistant to Dr. Amish Patel was so patient and didn't rush me as I explained my car accident history which wasn't the reason I was there but I felt may demonstrate my overall pain and health history. Meeting Dr. Patel he made me feel comfortable, educated about my options and future. He didn't get upset when I had to schedule with Dr. Kapoor because of my scheduling issues. I will return to Dr. Patel for my follow up and I've very confident with Premier Pain & Spine and know and believe my pain will be manageable and hopefully over soon. I am highly recommending them to friends and clients that I know who are struggling to get back to a normal life because of pain.
Thanks Again,
Elizabeth P Matthews
5/2021|I had the worst possible experience trying to become a new patient of this center.

I tried calling Premier and Spine Chicago to set up an appointment as a new patient, and while holding, I was hung up on twice. The phone gets picked up and immediately put down.

column40: Apart from being given two different addresses, there's also no sign that states "pain management" anywhere outside the building. There's at least 10 different types of services available in the same lot all with specific signs. Once I found the building, i approached the directory inside that states the room number of the office. It Doesn't tell you how to get there though. You walk through the door and are met with one room number and exit unless you turn down a hall and walk down to find it. No other signs no employees. It's not hard  but as a person with CPTSD, Autism, and anxiety, this was a very nerve wracking process just to get to the right office. All of my forms have been filled and submitted prior the appointment and the office had one other patient. Regardless, I was 16 minutes late and I take ownership to that. Once I came in I stated my name and was met with a scowl and was told "the grace period is 15 minutes" by the receptionist who immediately went to reschedule and i had asked if we could just cancel it because it was really unnecessary at this point. She again met me with and low brow said "it already has been", referring to today's appointment. Like??? Yes I know that? Why would I tell you to cancel the appointment you just told me I was 1 minute past the grace period for?Anyways. As a relatively young person which chronic pain who's been waiting 4 months to be seen, who has anxiety and autism, and CPTSD, this was just not somewhere I feel comfortable going to at this point.|Do not use! Avoid at all costs! It's a rotating door for the doctors and they give a damn about their patients! Wish I could give negative stars!!!|The level of service I have received from this facility has been nothing short of amazing!

column38: Karen calhoun|Miranda Monticelli|Kellie Gulbransen|Bigdawgenterprise _|Carla Eastberg|Alice Romano|Chrissy Hacker|Katherine Jankowski
column40: Everyone was nice, just disorganized. I left there feeling confident that I found someone was going to help me.....then the chaos began. Phone call telling me to get an xray on my left knee to get approved for those gel shots in the knee for osteoarthritis. My left knee had a knee replacement,  its my right knee I need the shots in. So this went on for 5 weeks if not 6. Then once this is straightened out, they never ordered the shots. So they canceled all the appointments I had scheduled and that screwed up my work schedule.  And if you ever need a returning appointment the will let you know 3 days a head of time what time you appointment is. Also the person who was checking me out in the end was eating a bowl of noodles and wasnt even on my chart when she started talking about the nextvstep. I said, wrong chart, thats not me. I know they must be short staff, but everything that pertained to me was a mistake on their part. Very sad, I heard the Dr was good, but man, noone had it right with me|I have nothing but horrible things to say about this place. Terrible customer service, terrible doctors, and the worst communication at an office yet. I just transferred here from my regular pain management office down in Des Plaines. The reason why I needed a transfer is because Des Plaines is over an hour drive for me, and with the Illinois roads, it makes the drive very uncomfortable, painful, and unbearable. This new pain management place is only a 10 minute drive from me. So I thought I would give it a try. This place is so bad that it is making my old pain management look like Disneyland. Mind you, my old pain management never answers their phones, and they are very difficult to get a hold of. The first visit with The Illinois Pain & Spine Institute, they already wanted to throw me onto the table and perform procedures on me. I was told that I need to do two sets of facet blocks in order to do my back ablations, which isn't true. I've had back ablations before. I played their game and scheduled two procedures that would leave me bed bound a week at a time per procedure. I needed to go under anesthesia for these procedures, and both of those times, I had a horrific experience. The first time, when they put me under, they had me in and out of the office within 15 minutes. I didn't wake up from anesthesia until I was in the parking lot getting loaded into my vehicle! I'm sure you can imagine how scary that is. I should have been in a recovery room while I awoke and came to. I told Dr.Hagel about my experience, and he said that he will definitely have an anesthesiologist in there the next time I get my facet blocks. I had also asked for calming medicine BEFORE I go into the operating room due to PTSD. However, they did not give me anything until I was already strapped onto the table in the operating room. Who gave me anesthesia the first time? It was a nurse who took some night classes and got a certificate saying that she could give anesthesia. She got the dosing wrong, obviously. My second time in there getting the same procedure with the facet block, they told me that they didn't have an anesthesiologist and that a nurse would be administering my anesthesia again. I was explicitly told that there would be an anesthesiologist in there to give me the correct dosing this time, and yet, there wasn't. I was awake during the whole procedure, and I felt everything! Then, to top it off, they put me in a recovery room, and a male nurse came in there and tried to take my shirt off. I told him to leave so that I could dress myself. I had a follow-up appointment that I scheduled myself because apparently, they don't schedule post-op appointments so that I may discuss what my experience was. I also wanted to schedule my back ablations. While on the phone, Dr. Hagel said that I was a "pain in the ass" and that I am lucky that I haven't gotten the boot yet because most people would have by now. I then began to tell him why I needed a real anesthesiologist for these procedures and about my PTSD and he seemed shocked and may have felt bad now knowing the reason why I am the way I am . I have woken up during procedures before, and I am a victim of other traumas I do not wish to air out. Regardless, they did not take the proper care or consideration that this kind of practice should have. To top the cherry, I had a telehealth appointment with Steve on Friday, and my pharmacy was out of my medication. I called the office to get it transferred to another pharmacy, and they never got Steve to rewrite my script for another pharmacy. Now, I am sitting without my medication for 3 days. I called their after hours line to speak to someone on-call, and their phone system hung up on me. I have to wait until Monday, and I hope they are able to rewrite me my script. My body is going through withdrawals, and this could have been avoided if they had just called my prescription over to a new pharmacy like they were supposed to. Steve said it only takes 3 minutes, not 4 days! Avoid this place at all costs!|Dr Hagel is awesome. The practice still needs to work on the support staffs rudeness,politeness and doing things correctly. Nurses are great|I saw pain docs for 12 years before I found these guys. Dr Hagle and Steve Perry are the best pain guys you can ask for.|Dr. Yacoumb I think that's how you spell last name. Highly recommend ! He is a doctor that listens and helps with my pain. Staff is great too|Iam giving 2 stars for the person in charge of scheduling. I made my appointment on June 27th  for July 17th at the McHenry office.  On July 10th I received a call from the Barrington office about my appointment there on July 15th.  Because of the severity of the pain I was having I chose the McHenry office  which is 10minutes from my home. After a intense conversation with Colleen who insisted I changed the appointment.  I called the McHenry office and was told the Dr  was overbooked and I was taken off the schedule.  This is absolutely unacceptable behavior from any health care facility.|Dr Hagel is a kind, compassionate , committed , caring doctor. He takes his time with you and listens! He cares about you and the pain you are living in and wants to give you the best quality of life you can have.|I felt heard by Dr. Prunskis. He came up with a plan for me and showed that he actually wants to help me. I am hoping that we have success with his plan!

column48: What do I need to make an appointment?
column49: You'll usually be asked for your name, phone number, and email when booking an appointment. Having your insurance details handy, like the policy number and the insurer's name, can speed things up. Also, sharing a brief description of your pain or reason for the visit helps staff prepare better for your appointment.

column3:
Specialized Pain Management in Bloomington, IL

At Ji Li MD, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions at our clinic located at 1015 S Mercer Ave in Bloomington, IL. As specialized pain management physicians, we take a personalized approach to treating chronic and acute pain conditions through a variety of advanced techniques. Our practice focuses on helping patients regain their quality of life through:

  • Targeted pain injections for conditions like sciatica and back pain

  • Comprehensive diagnostic evaluations to identify the root cause of pain

  • Customized treatment plans with conservative medication management

  • Ongoing patient education about pain conditions and treatment options

Dr. Li personally takes the time to explain diagnostic results and treatment options, ensuring patients understand their condition fully. With over 15 years of experience in pain management, we pride ourselves on our professional, responsive care and personal follow-up. Our team is committed to helping you find relief and improve your functionality. Contact us at +1 309-662-0088 or visit our Dr. Ji Li - OSF HealthCare Provider Profile to learn more about our services.
column38: Cindy Sauder|Todd Shaw|Mary Slater|Kay Schneider|Charlene Trappe-Black|William McGonigle|Matt Feit|Catherine Biesboer
column40: Dr. Li took my sciatic pain away from my back down my leg and into my knee with the first injection. I am pain free.|I have been a patient of Dr Ji Li's for over 16 years. He is phenomenal at his specialty of pain management. He takes the time to explain why you are in pain and what your options are, at that time. He is very conservative with his care, which I greatly appreciate. Because, 10 or 15 years ago a lot of "so called pain doctors" would start you on such strong medications, you loved them, because you were completely without any pain. But, with all pain medications, your body is going to develop a tolerance to any pain medications, after a period of time. Then, when those individuals return wanting stronger medication, those "so called pain doctors," informed you that you must have been abusing the medication that we prescribed, because it should still be helping you. As a result, we can no longer treat you as a patient. They just left you literally "High and dry!" That is when good people, do bad things, because they truly believe they are going to die, if they don't get more medication. Unfortunately, there are plenty of drug dealers in any town, who will sell "who knows what," to these individuals on a per pill basis. Please understand that Dr. Ji Li is a true Pain Management Specialist and would not willingly allow a single one of his patients to be in this situation. He follows strict protocols and requires you to sign a very strict contact, for your own wellbeing! I trust Dr. Ji Li with my life!|Dr Li finally took the time to explain my back issues and go over my tests. Its taken me 3 years and 5 doctors to take me seriously and give me options to get my life back . He took alot of time to explain MY MRI even tho he was running late. He is caring and compassionate and I'll always turn to him in  the future. Love this place.  The staff is extremely efficient too and non judgemental. No place better!|Dr Li is absolutely the best ! If it wasn't for his help I don't think I could have took it much longer with the pain I was in. I have been seeing him for approximately 15 years and don't know what I would do with out him. His front desk secretary Rozz is the best also. He is the only dr I have ever been to that calls me personally|Dr. Li and staff are professional and consistently responsive to questions, explain options clearly, and have great follow up!|One of the best doctors I've ever been too! He listens to your concerns, has a fantastic bed side manner, and always calls to check up on you. When it comes to pain management, he's the very best!|Dr Li and his staff are absolutely wonderful!!!  Dr Li is a Physician who cares for his patients and goes above and beyond to help!!! Highly recommended!!!|DR JI LI AND HIS STAFF ARE KNOWLEDGEABLE, KIND AND GENTLE.  I WAS MISDIAGNOSED FOR YEARS BY SEVERAL OTHER DOCTORS.  DR. LI ASKED POINTED QUESTIONS AND TRULY LISTENED TO MY ANSWERS.  HE SAW THE PAIN I WAS IN AND IMMEDIATELY ADDRESSED IT.  HE THEN ORDERED TESTS AND FOUND THE TRUE SOURCE OF MY PAIN.  I CANNOT TELL YOU WHAT IT IS LIKE TO BE TREATED WITH RESPECT BY A PROFESSIONAL TEAM WHO ONLY WANT TO SEE YOU PAINFREE AND ENJOYING LIFE AGAIN. I WAS SO BLESSED TO FIND DR. LI AND I AM SO GREATFUL.  THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME.  SUSAN

column40:
Spoke to Jessica's front desk in Glenview to schedule an appointment for Dr Gates , I was referred to see her by Dr Shapiro , she was very condescending on the phone , I asked to speak to Dr Gates assistant to see if I can get an appointment earlier than 30 days out for my symptoms , Leanncy who is on Dr Gates team told Jessica she would not talk to me on the phone since I am a new patient, I am not new to IBJI, it's to bad healthcare is like this now ...|I was a patient of Dr. Bruce Noxon at the Illinois Bone and Joint Institute in Glenview. I saw him on August 10th in his Glenview office. He advised me to have my five pairs of orthotics modified. He took my orthotics and sent them to his chosen lab, DPM Orthotics, in Kent Ohio. After not returning my orthotics to me for over six weeks, he stopped responding to my phone calls. Both he and his staff "ghosted me". They just walked away from any responsibility to get them back. Unconscionable!
Finally, after two months I contacted the manager of Illinois Bone and Joint to get my orthotics returned. In the interim, Dr. Noxon moved his practice and is no longer associated with IBJ. I then reached out to IBJ's clinical manager, Sherry, for help. After two weeks of calls, I finally received a call back because I contacted her supervisor. She said that she would investigate this matter. After a week I received a call   from her stating that while IBJ accepted my orthotics, they share no responsibility for returning them to me and in her words, it was okay with her if I walked around with blood blisters and pain.  She unprofessionally stated that she doesn't care who else I contact.
The five pairs of orthotics are quite expensive, and Medicare does not cover the cost.  I am a senior citizen on a fixed income and cannot afford to replace them. I'm writing this review to make others aware of the totally irresponsible, unprofessional behavior of Illinois Bone and Joint. I would never trust them again! I still have no orthotics.|I was greeted 15 minutes early by the nurse. She recorded my medical reasons for seeing doctor and advised that she would be in shortly.
Dr Vanderbee is a lovely tall blonde who greets patient with a dazzling smile. She is able to take a real interest in the patient's pain, and gets right to the solution.
She has been my doctor for several years. She is possessed of a human quality that is rare with medicine. She has been very successful in solving pain issues I have associated with Arthritis. Her whole team, from Debbie to Nurse Raquel to Dr, honestly are interested in helping the patient. And their friendliness is most unusual.
I have often said that knowing this team, gives her patient power|Dr. Vanderby is very professional, but also very personable.

She knows her medicine.

She conveys a warm, friendly manner that makes you think she really cares about you.|Excellent and effective care. Explains procedure carefully and interested in my progress and prospects. Dr, Vanderby has helped me manage my condition without needing a surgical solution.|I've gone to Dr. Vanderby several times to help with horrible back and pain going down my leg. She is an outstanding doctor and care's very much about the outcome. I would highly recommend her to anyone seeking relief, she is the best!|I was hurt at work in feb 2020 and have been seeing Dr. Portland and Dr. Gates for the whole time.  They have been amazing.  Such great bed side manner!!  I tell everyone that's needs a ortho doc and pain doc to see these guys!!  Thank you for all your service!|I was seen for the second time in 5 months by Dr. Visotsky to correct a problem with 2 trigger fingers. I was given injections in each. My experience was pleasant and easy and uneventful.

column40:
I had a great experience with the Pain Institute in Glenview IL.  I was injured on the job a year ago.  I had a bad knee injury,  that could have led to surgery. I was in a lot of pain and I barely could walk.  I looked up the Softwave treatment.  And it was a blessing,  they specialize in no surgery and no injection.  That was good to hear.  I went to the Pain Institute 2 twice a week with my Blue Cross and Blue Shield insurance coverage.  I got laser treatment and exercise.  I'm 100% now,  I could not do stairs without pain.  Now I can do stairs without mo problems.  It took a while but I did it . These ladies are the best here at the pain Institute in Glenview IL,  Shannon is super nice and very patient with me and also did my laser twice a week. Awesome experience the laser saved me from surgery.  Samreon very nice and polite lady always called me the day before therapy to remind me.  Dr. Mariam El-Baghdad was very nice and came in and examined my knee injury and made recommendations.  I am  so happy that I came here and would recommend anyone to the Pain Institute in Glenview IL only.  Wonderful experience,  the rest of the staff are great.  The Pain Institute is the best in the entire city of Glenview IL. Very happy that I came there.|Was referred to PRI by a family member with similar issues, chronic knee pain. Got an appointment, met with the doctor and agreed to the procedure (P2P and gel shots). During treatment I did their PT regimen which was conducted by a couple different therapists. Everyone I interacted with here was friendly and knowledgeable of what their mission was. Bottom line, I got the relief I sought and my knees haven't felt like this in years.|Very discriminatory place.  Only interested in money!  I have insurance fully covered and they insisted I pay the same bill again on last visit after confirming payments sent to them from insurance.  I gave them the check numbers and dates and still no?! Pay it again?!  Calling their own billing dept is too cumbersome and complicated for them.  Instead they prefer to send an email to ask and confirm.|I was very impressed by the staff and Dr. E. I'm now deciding what I'm going to do if I'm going to do PRP injections or what for my knee. They were very very informative|I have had PRP and StemForce and my knees feel better than they have in two years. Great staff. Very friendly.|Had a very bad lower back,Dr Tom fixed that,3 other Chiro 's couldn't. Have a bad knee,(bone on bone),not afraid of surgeries,had 4 open hearts but it's a big deal for me because I take blood thinners so a knee replacement is a big process,hospital stay and recovery so I tried this and so far it's going very good.|The "Keep You In Pain (Institute)"!

Dana called me after my terrible first appointment for feedback. The doctor took that feedback personally, and was standoff-ish with me during my next appointment where they asked me to come back. Shannon and the staff there are nice but they don't listen to you and certainly don't care about helping you.

Avoid this place at all costs. They call themselves an "institute" but there's no thinking outside of the box. There's no learning here or an openness to do so. Nor is there any adaptation to patients' needs. In particular, younger patients. They mostly seem to "treat" elderly people. They're therapy is mostly the therapists watching you do exercises you could do at home. The small bit of hands-on stuff they did wasn't very helpful. They will rope you in with false promises then suggest expensive out of pocket treatments like PRPs. They also like to call you incessantly if you don't answer right away or are busy instead of just leaving a brief message. If I didn't answer the first 3 times why keep calling and not simply leave a message?!

In the end, I wasted a lot of time and money bothering with this place and suggest you not do the same. If you have rare or persistent chronic pain issues you're better off avoiding this place. I'd write more but Google doesn't allow you to type that much for reviews.

Edit: Reply to their reply

You call the doctor and Shannon wasting my time and not listening to me above & beyond?! You call not informing me that my visit would be only be a "talk" with the doctor above & beyond and still require a copay? You call charging me and my insurance for mostly useless efforts with little regard to my needs or previous experiences above & beyond?? I don't think so. This wasn't even my complete review. It was shortened because Google has a character limit. Also, I normally don't even bother with reviewing clinics like this. My treatment here was so negative that I had to. You are welcome to look my my past reviews on Google. You will find few reviews of medical clinics. What's actually unfair and unjust here is the fact that this clinic can get away with what you do and call it healthcare. Especially after you people contacted me looking for feedback after my first treatment with the doctor. Above & beyond?!! What a joke!|The copay was $55. Medicare listed it at $45. And just like another reviewer said, they tell you it's approved by your insurance. During all my visits they never once asked for any other payment so I was shocked to receive a $727.88 bill!  And as a bi-note, the gel injections didn't work. I also went to joint relief institute a few years ago. They didn't try to pull this stunt. Charged copay and that was it. So when this company says I made a mistake, trying to say it was the other company, I didn't.

At Medical Pain Management, we are a team of three board-certified pain physicians and three advanced practice nurses dedicated to helping patients find relief from chronic pain.

Specialized Pain Solutions

Our expertise lies in providing minimally invasive techniques that effectively reduce or eliminate pain across various conditions. We proudly offer advanced procedures that few others in North Central Illinois perform, including:

  • Treatments for neurogenic claudication due to spinal stenosis

  • Vertebrogenic pain management for patients with Modic I and II changes

  • Specialized care for metastatic disease of the spine

  • Comprehensive nerve blocks and interventional procedures

We understand that each patient's pain is unique, which is why we utilize a full spectrum of treatment options tailored to individual needs. Our goal is to improve your quality of life through precise diagnosis and targeted interventions. Located in Rockford, we serve patients throughout the region with compassionate, evidence-based care. Visit our website or call us at 815-397-8400 to schedule your consultation at our Mulford Road location.

The office staff and the nurses are all top tier, very thorough, professional and kind. I'm not sure why there were bad reviews as I can't even imagine how that could be. They are the best in my opinion.|Great staff and great doctors.   Been going there for years and always got good treatment.|After 3.5 months of trying to get into Dr. Weiss, calls made and ignored by the director of nursing to find out what was going on and why could I not get an appointment, I finally spoke to his office manager and R.N., Sandy Davis for 4 minutes! She said, without ever speaking to me,"I don't think we can meet your expectations here. This is an intervention clinic and we rarely give out pain medication." I stunned, replied," my only expectation is to get control over my pain which now controls my life. My dr (of 3.5yrs) is also an interventionist and they know him! She said it had to go before the board! She said she'd call me back that day. After several more months, being crippled by back pain due to documented reasons, all my voicemails and calls were simply not returned!!! Like every "pain management" clinic that are now billion$ businesses, if you were ever on pain meds you are treated like a criminal and abusively neglected!!!!! I'm convinced by much research that the government is giving a kick back to these criminal institutions for taking ppl off their much needed pain medications! Debilitating chronic pain is real! And after 3.5 years of injections and medication, I have now had 5 referrals to drs not even in my area, and whom I've met and NOT ONE  even asks what work you do or how is your pain stopping you from living! It's causing the very thing the government wants to stop-street drug abuse! Where else do ppl in severe, daily pain have to go to get help? The streets where it is unsafe, too costly for those disabled and now you see the heroin/fentanyl epidemic!!!! These clinics need to be shut down! They are cruel to ppl who are suffering and going against the oath taken when they became drs!!! To not cause harm!!! This office doesn't care about you! STAY AWAY!!!|When I was having difficulty finding a provider to continue my sleep medication for fibromyalgia, Dr. Minore did so "delightfully."  Clearly brings him happiness to be able to help his patients. I've been a patient of his since January 2017, always a pleasant experience. Excellent front desk.

column3:
Compassionate Pain Management in Peoria

At UnityPoint Health, we're more than just healthcare providers—we're your partners in wellness. Dr. Avni Gupta specializes in comprehensive pain management solutions tailored to each individual's unique needs. As part of our dedicated team, we work collaboratively to deliver high-quality, cost-effective care across our network spanning Iowa, Illinois, and Wisconsin. Our approach to pain management includes:

  • Personalized treatment plans focused on long-term relief

  • Advanced interventional procedures including epidural injections

  • Comprehensive evaluation of chronic pain conditions

  • Multi-modal therapy options beyond medication management

Located in downtown Peoria, our practice combines specialized expertise with compassionate care. We understand that pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take the time to listen carefully and develop solutions that help you return to the activities that matter most. Connect with Dr. Avni Gupta today at (309) 672-5950 to begin your journey toward improved quality of life and effective pain management.
column11: As your partner in health, we're dedicated to making it easier for you to live well--so you can show up for the moments that matter most. To us, people are more than patients. We work together as a team to champion high-quality, low-cost care. Our providers and services span hospitals, clinics and at home settings across Iowa, Illinois and Wisconsin. Our presence in metropolitan and rural communities allows us to innovate through partnerships, organizations outside of healthcare, and our family of team members remains dedicated to shared values that put our people first. Because you matter to this world, and we'll show you just how much.

column40: Dr Gupta is very kind, she listens carefully to her patients to find the best treatment plan. I am very pleased with my treatments so far. I was relieved when she did not recommend giving me pain pills.( I don't take pain pills.). She had a better option. The entire staff is very friendly and caring. I wish I had found her sooner!|Had an appointment scheduled for today for a steroid epidural and called two days ago for a possible reschedule if I couldn't find anyone to come with me but was never able to speak with anyone. I sent a message through MyChart to reschedule and was greeted with rudeness from their scheduling lady. When I found someone to come with me, I checked MyChart to tell said person what time my appointment was and realized it was gone. I called the office again yesterday and was told that their scheduling lady had canceled it without even speaking to me. Was also told she would call me early yesterday morning and waited all day with no call back. I have had back issues since 2018 that have just gotten significantly worse over the years and to the point where I needed to do something about it as soon as possible. I've waited months to get this epidural just for it to be canceled without even being spoken to. I will be going elsewhere since this place doesn't care about their patients whatsoever. Thank you for letting me to continue being in pain 24/7, it's greatly appreciated!|Seen DR Gupta several times. She took as much time as I needed to answer my questions and help me understand. I did not feel like my time was limited or she was rushing me to get to the next patient. I feel comfortable to be under her care. Her team was really comforting as well. I feel they are taking the appropriate actions to help. Thank you to you and your team for helping.|I feel like she is very disrespectful..the first appointment went so bad and I feel like she is totally disrespectful.. just because I told her my doctor's in Minnesota did my care a certain way, she tells me this not Minnesota.. patients don't have withdrawals from medical marijuana... really?!? You are wrong doctor.. but you will cut my pain meds even tho I'm a newly spinal cord survivor.. you can't care about a patient's health if you would.. you forgot to fill my Lyrica SMH so I have to go the rest of the weekend in major pain because you were mad so I have to suffer then Monday morning had to debate to get my meds filled..I don't have a choice right now because it takes forever to get a appointment for pain management.. this is the wrong doctor, if you don't have compassion and empathy for you patientris is the wrong profession..|Dr Gupta has done amazing work for me. She and her staff care very much about my pain management, and relief of pain through different procedures or medications. Anytime I call and have a problem they are quick to help me and do an amazing job. Dr Gupta and her staff understand my pain and work diligently together to try and reduce as much as possible. I would highly recommend Dr Gupta and her staff if you have chronic back pain.|Honestly ZERO stars! Went and seen this so-called doctor got zero help! she was in the room three minutes insisting on injections until I informed her I don't have insurance so she laughed and shamed me asking why I don't have it that was the end of my visit. now I'm stuck with a $550 bill for receiving zero care, help, guidance or anything! Someone has said it before I will say it again she deserves to be sued there's nothing professional or doctor like about this woman or place!|Dr. Gupta has been a wonderful doctor! She not only explains procedures and treatments, but she sincerely takes the time to listen to your concerns and questions . I highly recommend her ! I've had several previous spine surgeries and this is the first time I've gotten some actual pain relief in years ! Thank you Dr Gupta for being your fabulous self !|I have been a patient of Dr. Gupta for a few years now.  I cannot sing her praises enough. The team at this office is very patient oriented.
