column40:
ZERO stars.
Called to make appointment on July 9th, 2024. Gave insurance information and appointment was made for months later. (Sept)  I had forgotten when appointment was and called on September 3rd, 2024 for reminder.  Message left for me from clinic on September 4th, 2024 stated they do NOT except my insurance and would NOT be able to help me.  My major complaint with that is that I'm in severe pain and I was waiting to be seen. If my insurance was not exceptible, they should of told me sooner. I went without help for months waiting. And now I'm in the same boat I was in, in July!  
NOT VERY PROFESSIONAL AT ALL!

ZERO stars.|First, let me say that. I have been a critical care/ER/PACU nurse for almost 40 years. I am extremely careful who I see for medical care. Found out I have a degenerating condition that causes extra bone to be deposited in various areas. I've dealt with this for 30 years and have seen numerous doctors, with no actual diagnosis. I saw Dr. Tubic, who diagnosed me in q0 minutes, then confirmed it on both CT scan and MRI. This disease causes multiple bone spurs to develop, pressing on nerves in my spine and causing extreme pain throughout my body, specifically my head, my shoulders, and my lower back. It also causes tendons and ligaments connected to my spine to turn into bone. Also causes vertebrae to fuse together, stopping normal movement. As a result, I consulted the pain clinic about 4 years ago. I have had a ton of procedures and a spinal cord stimulator implanted. Both the doctors and the nurse practitioners have been great to work with. I have mentioned recently that I wanted to get off opiate pain medicine, since it knocks me out badly. They have worked with me to provide alternatives. I am now looking at an implanted pump that can distribute medicine to control the severe muscle spasms that come with this. I had to stop working about 4 years ago and their staff had to go through a ton of paperwork for my short and long term disability, including my application for state disability. I can't recommend them enough! Yes, they are usually very fast with their appointments because the doctors focus on interventional pain relief. If you want actual answers and pain management, call for an appointment. The first time you'll likely see a doctor, but the nurse practitioners and PAs handle it from there. They are knowledgeable, esp. Natalie K. I schedule procedures with whatever doctor has an opening because I trust all of them. And for all the negative reviews about insurance denials, THE ISSUE IS YOUR INSURANCE, NOT THE CLINIC! And yes, many insurances take more than a month to issue either a rejection or approval. They do this to try and get you to give up and not get things done.|I've had a fabulous experience here with Dr. Tubic. I appreciate his understanding of Ehlers Danlos Syndrome and the complications that come with it. He has been super relentless in figuring out how to reduce my pain. Only giving 4 stars because the front desk folks never answer the phone and sometimes don't return voicemails.|I'm giving 2 stars on this even though I would like to leave 1 but the office staff/nurses are all very nice, courteous, and helpful. I don't feel the same way about the standard of care from my doctor though.

I went to pain management yesterday for my tailbone that I broke a while ago and saw Dr. McDaniel. He was 50 minutes late to my appointment and then rushed me through mine. He was aware I'm on disability for fibromyalgia yet with barely any warning he pulled my pants pretty low and slipped his finger down my crack and pushed really hard. It was excruciating. Then he bent me backwards from the shoulder on each side which was also painful... not so much to the tailbone but my back. He was too rough and I felt a little violated and not listened to. He told me he wants to give me a shot in my tailbone and more x-rays, didn't tell me what kind of shot or go over any risk factors or questions I might have. He just left the room and I assumed he was coming back with my paperwork but he had moved on to the next patient. The nurses came in to give me my paperwork and I asked about pain meds til my shot and I had to wait another 20 minutes in the lobby because he was with another patient. The nurse came out looking sad and said he refused and to take Tylenol. I wasn't even given a reason. He also wants to use only local anesthetic for my shot as opposed to sedation because I'm not squeamish with needles but wouldn't someone with severe fibro fair better with this under sedation? I feel very uncomfortable and do not trust him. I'm waiting to hear back from my primary about her opinion on it but honestly I just came home yesterday and cried.|I wish I could rate them less than one star. Staff is rude, and uncompassionate. I called to schedule my mom for a Dr. Visit, they confirmed they received the referral and asked me about her health insurance. I provided them with all information, they told me to call me back within 48 hours after running the insurance and verifying it. They called and scheduled her. After waiting for two weeks we took my mom that has been suffering back and neck pain, staff ignored my wife explaining to them and the situation. They told her that they couldn't find a refferal for her and don't accept her insurance. Then they said they found the referral and I gave them the wrong insurance althight they said they verified the insurance and the insurance name and the ID is on the refferal.they didnot apologize for their mistakes and rudes. Now we have to start looking for another Dr. This review is not about the Dr. It is about the s stsff kike that need to be fired or out on corrcgive acrion for messing up with people pain.|I was going to start as a new patient!  With that being said I received a call back and the lady who called me was not nice at all she was very rude ! As well as I explained to her I have a cancer doctor that I have to pay for as well as other doctors I need to pay for if my visit is 75 for first exams or 175 I needed to know!  And I have a deductible I need to meet ! And she had the nerve to tell me you need to take that up with your insurance company on what you will be charged ! Once again I told her it has nothing to do with my insurance company I have a deductible first and foremost.  And she kept saying we will bill your insurance!  As I told her you have no knowledge about deductible!  But then they say stright off we don't accept state insurance!  This office will never get my money!  Never ! I will deal with my pain before I will ever give an office like this my money ever ! I will give it to a homeless person on street before I give them money ever !for them stright off the back to tell me they have no control over what the insurance charges  that tells me you think people are stupid!  Insurance companies don't change your office does and then you bill what you want ! I feel bad for the people they was able to steal from and get there money that h! They need to shut this office down as far as I am concerned!  They just want deducted and copays and charges probably a arm and a leg to even for the doctor to lay there eyes on us ! And probably charge for the chairs you sit in ! That is how I took the very rude person that called and work me up out of my sleep!  When I clearly left a message and told them I work the 3rd shift call me around 4pm or after or early morning!  Right there that upset me as well !they don't know how to respect people that are going to pay or nothing!  People like me that have high deductible rates pay there Bill's.  Thank goodness I have not and will not go too this doctor!  If the receptionist talks like this over the phone on first phone call ever I can just imagine how the doctors are going to be!  I will pass hope all you that plan to visit fo the same and find a doctor that will really help your and treat you the right way physically and emotionally!|For many years I suffered alone because I look healthy. Turns out I have a connective tissue disorder. I was referred by a brilliant health psychologist who knows Dr. Tubic, the whole 6 weeks of waiting I was so excited to meet him but I had no idea how much he would really change my life. He flies around the office with a huge smile on his face, voice carrying throughout the practice. He is sincere, enthusiastic, and although he must be quick to accommodate us all (how does he even do it?), I always leave feeling excited about the next steps. He has a wealth of knowledge he always shares with me and is proactive in his treatments which makes a huge difference in my quality of life! I have made huge progress in the last 8 months and am looking forward to the future. His entire office and medical staff is incredible, so helpful and caring. I've learned so much from his nurses already. Office visits and procedures are days I look forward to!|I came from another clinic and I am so very grateful that I have. The staff is wonderful and really cares about you and gets to know you on a personal level and that alone is rare and Dr Tubic definitely cares about you and does not give up on you and your quality of life and he is above and beyond caring for his patients from the day I met him he has given me hope and kept me going and fighting to get to a better quality of life than I have had in a long time. Natalie is my life saver and she really cares about you as well and is very sharp with picking up when something is going on before you even say anything. That's what makes you a good nurse but I feel that she's more qualified and she knows how to make sure you are ok. I love this Dr practice and I highly recommend them to you. Thank you all so very much for your support and great staffing and Dr Tubic and Natalie. You are all wonderful people.

column40:
Just want to share my experience with Global Clinic.
Few months ago, I had a car accident, and it was my first (and I hope last) experience in the US.

The next day I found Global Clinic, so I called to get more information, and I got answers to all my questions and made an appointment.
From the moment I walked in, I was greeted by very kind and welcoming staff. Everyone was incredibly helpful, and I was especially impressed that almost all stuff speak multiple languages, which makes communication very easy
I had a chance to meet there 2 therapists: Jesse and Nikolay, both are real professionals, they helped me to recover faster, gave me some recommendations and communication was very good. Also, Mariana was very nice and helpful, she was trying to do her best if I arrived earlier
At every step of my treatment, they were genuinely caring, always checking in on my progress and adjusting my therapy as needed.
Overall, the clinic has a great environment, with skilled professionals who truly care about their patients. I'm very grateful for their help and would highly recommend this place to anyone in need of post-accident treatment or any similar issues you may have.
Thank you again|I recently had the pleasure of undergoing physical therapy and massage treatment at Global Clinic, and I must say, the experience exceeded my expectations. The clinic is incredibly well-organized, clean, and professional, making each visit seamless and comfortable.
I would like to specifically commend Anna, the manager, for her exceptional service. She ensures that every aspect of the clinic runs smoothly and goes above and beyond to make patients feel welcome and cared for. Her attention to detail and friendly demeanor truly set the tone for a positive healing environment.
The therapists at Global Clinic are highly skilled and attentive, tailoring treatments to individual needs. Thanks to their care, I noticed a significant improvement in my condition. I wholeheartedly recommend Global Clinic to anyone seeking professional and compassionate care. Thank you, Anna and the entire team, for making my recovery journey such a positive experience!|I'm so happy to find Global Clinic! I like how flexible they can be with appointments. Very professional therapist especially Jesse! I recommended already Global to all my friends! They know how to address your concerns and will help to forget about pain. Now I'm coming here through my insurance, but when it will be terminated I'll still go only to Global for physical therapy because there is no better place! Thank you!|I had an exceptional experience at Global Clinic, and I can confidently say it's one of the best healthcare facilities I've visited. From the moment I walked in, the staff was welcoming, professional, and attentive, ensuring that all my concerns were addressed. The clinic itself is spotless, modern, and well-equipped with the latest technology, making it feel like a truly top-tier medical facility.

The healthcare providers at Global Clinic are incredibly skilled and knowledgeable. I felt genuinely cared for throughout my visit. They took the time to explain my condition and treatment options thoroughly, which gave me great confidence in their expertise.

What truly sets Global Clinic apart is their holistic approach to patient care. They focus not only on treating the issue at hand but also on ensuring long-term health and well-being. Whether it was a consultation, treatment, or follow-up, every step of my experience was seamless and reassuring.

I highly recommend Global Clinic to anyone looking for top-notch medical care in a comfortable, compassionate environment. They truly go above and beyond to deliver excellent service!|Fantastic staff!! I would recommend Global Pain & Spine Clinic to anyone looking to improve their health in multiple ways. From chiropractic work, to physical therapy, personal training, massage, IV Therapy and much more. The staff is attentive, caring, professional and friendly. Especially Olena and Valery!! Their hours of operation are convenient too. I would not hesitate to send my family members to Global Pain & Spine Clinic and I have had great results there.|Global Pain & Spine Clinic! This place is great starting with all Staff very professional and dedicated. I was there 5 months doing my physical therapy after very bad accident. I can't explain how happy I was there and every time I had to go for my exercises. Thank you very much for meeting great people there specially Emily and Kasia. they walked me through this hard and difficult time of my rehabilitation. Once again thank you Global clinic and I am very satisfied and can highly recommend this place to anybody and I will. Warm regards Tomasz.|I am a patient of Global already for a year. Very happy of results of treatment of my son, we were working with his scoliosis and I was doing IV therapy and vitamin B shots. The therapists and nurses are very professional. The best chiropractor Peter Slavin! Thank you so much for getting us back to life!|I had a great experience at Global Clinic for my physical therapy. The staff was welcoming and professional, and the therapists were highly knowledgeable and attentive. They personalized my treatment plan and provided clear explanations throughout the process. Thanks to their support, my recovery has been significantly improved. I highly recommend Global Clinic for anyone seeking quality physical therapy.

column40: After 20 years of sciatica relief after spinal surgery, my constant pain came back. Dr. Ammar Divan examined my records and uodated MRI, followed by a thorough conversation about my history and need of pain relief. I was given a flawless and successful epidural, experiencing only mild, brief and well-tolerated discomfort. That night, I was beyond grateful for complete pain relief and a tare, good night's sleep. I have had 4 months of relief now and was reassured that I could return for another injection as needed and after consultation. Dr. Divan was totally professional knowledgeable and kind. I felt comfortable describing my situation with him and will not hesitate to return. My injection was followed ny a prescription for PT with a gifted therapist at this same Center, Aleksander "Alex" Kerzee-Stamatelopoulos. His experience and work is focused on this specialty. Alexis the best and most effective therapist I have worked with. I have successfully avoided spinal surgery and will return to Dr. Divan and Alex if I need future consultation and/or pain relief. I cannot more highly recommend this excellent team!|Total waste of time.  I am a mail carrier and just because I wasn't in pain, on the day, of my visit(I was on a week's vacation), I was told to call if I needed an injection.  Called 2 months later, when I needed an injection, and was asked, by the female on the phone, what kind of injection I needed.  I told her to look on the screen and she stated that the dr. had not put anything about an injection.  Also, they don't make appts. after 4 pm.  Some people have jobs.  If they don't want to work, Northwestern should shut this wasted facility down.|Horrible place don't go here. CNP Steven Stakenas was rude, neglecting, and just seemed like he didn't care. The staff communication is terrible. I was in a lot of pain when I went for a visit, waste of time. I provided all the info over the phone and online before the visit to make things faster. When I got there they had nothing on file. They had to get all my info again. Don't waste your time coming here.||

A++|Worst place I never went to! Got a referral and over 3 calls from THEM scheduling, canceling, rescheduling, asking the doctor about if I needed an MRI, recancelling and then yapping about their administrative duties to EPIC. I never complained about it or tried to do anything to get them increased again.These days, I find myself basically needing to be at the PA's beck and call to come in whenever she sees fit, or else she threatens to withhold my medication (both of which I've been taking for years with no issue. And both which would be dangerous to stop cold turkey). My previous doctor understood that because I'm in my 30s with a job AND a small child, that my availability is not the same as most of their clients who are twice my age. column40:
Dr. Chen and his staff are wonderful! He's doing everything he can (fighting my insurance) to ensure I can get relief! He even took a peer to peer call on Christmas Eve on my behalf. The staff up front are very helpful and will call you for wait list appts. Thank you so much all your efforts!|I'm late in writing my review I had my back injection a week ago!! My blood pressure got alittle low, they were all on top of it. Corina the Anesthesiologist I didn't get her name the Nurses & Dr Chen were all right there.  I went on with my procedure  & everything went well  & feeling better!!! Thank you!!!|I am a Chronic painfull Sciatic pain patient and doctor chen is helping me wounderfully to control my Pain.He is a  best of best doctor to control  any Pain. God bless you doctor Yuan Chen . My experience say excellent  I am feeling much better now...Blessing doctor and all your worker are smoot people.The best Over any pain|Dr Chen is the most cold-hearted, cruelest doctor I have ever met in my life! He said he doesn't treat chronic pain patients like me, and that even HE has pain.  Since it was obvious his pain must be more credible than mine in his opinion, I asked him how could he know how MY pain feels? He saw me dragging myself into his office, all stiff and bent over at the waist while he in his "pain" was prancing around in no pain!  He of course had no answer

And even giving my history with proof of my various degenerative spinal issues, which he never even looked at, he was constantly rude and nasty!

STAY AWAY!  This guy is not a caring doctor! I don't know how he's getting any good reviews, unless he has some secret system in choosing who gets pain mgmt and who doesn't get it!|I would never come here again, I got out of the hospital with a broken collarbone which required surgery and hardware, a shattered wrist which was in 7 pieces and too had surgery requiring hardware, got my eyesocket broken, severed nerves in my face, head split open all across my entire forehead, injured my lower back and finally multiple compressed disc's in my neck, I fell over 30 feet off scaffolding and this doctor was not interested in treating my pain he wanted money to run tests and try alternative medications. Yep it's all true and this doctor will not manage your pain,  he makes it worse.|Despite Dr. Chen being a great, skilled doctor who really tries to help with pain, the billing department is incredibly difficult to work with. Getting an EOB and/or statement with breakdown of services takes a lot of work. When I finally received this, I discovered I've been billed for services that I did not receive. Many of these charges are coming out of pocket (although I'm sure the insurance company won't be thrilled about the additional charges either.) I've been trying to get an answer from billing for months and they are horrendous at communication. They refuse to answer why I've been charged for these services or to make the adjustment to take these off. I am now in the process of reviewing 3+ years of statements to see what other services I was charged for that I never received. If you go to this outstanding doctor, ask for a breakdown of your services EVERY TIME and check the codes!|The only reason I give top pain a two is that the doctor did a fine job and helped my husband. However, billing has been a complete nightmare. Not only was the billing department rude (2021) but for two years I've been trying to get a substantiated bill that shows why their number is different than mine. We're off by a lot. No one has been able to help me. They say they'll email me and then six months later, I'll get another bill. I'll call someone will be very nice say they'll help me and six months later I will get a bill. This is been going on for over two years. I can't even recommend this doctor because of his billing department.  And for the record, I rarely write reviews.  I just feel so strongly on this one.|Dr Chen didn't cure my pain, I got 3-4 injections with minimal results, I do believe I have piriformis syndrome, I suggested him to treat me with Botox injections, I've read are more effective and plasma injections, ultrasound guided. But not he refused. Seems to still using an old fluoroscopy technique, didn't work for me, by the way I still on pain !

Dr. George Macrinici and staff are amazing beyond words! Not only are they compassionate to your pain, but very knowledgeable in order to put a plan together. I am so grateful for finally getting the right diagnosis and the help I needed. So grateful to have found him!|Welcoming atmosphere,  the receptionists are nice and willing to help.

The office manager is present and ready to help you if needed.

Dr Macrinici has that calming effect and he makes you feel comfortable being there.

Very knowledgeable and answering your questions patiently.

The procedure went good, giving me the chance to have a good night sleep for the first time in the past 3 years, without feeling the burning and the pain in my lower back and legs.

Thank you all !!!

I already recommended your office to my family , co- workers and friends.|I had an MRI last September 2023 then an ALIF (lumbar fusion) by a surgeon who was recommended and has great reviews. My surgery was on 2/6/24 and 3 days after I told my surgeon my pain was intense and different than before.
It's been 4 months, the pain is debilitating. I made an appointment to see Dr. Macrinici based on my PT attending a lecture from Doctor over the weekend. I was squeezed in.
Doctors staff is exceptional! The first time I've felt welcomed, cared for and HEARD. The staff heard me so I knew Dr. Macrinici would too!
When he came in he was reading my chart, MRI & CT I had done earlier this week. We came up with a treatment plan; higher dose muscle relaxer and nerve blocker. 3 times more than the surgeon gave me after surgery. It has been a few weeks since I have had any pain medication/nerve blocker.
This appointment made me cry happy tears!  I se Dr. Macrinici again Friday for an SI injection.
I am thrilled by this doctor and his team! I highly recommend!|I feel so comfortable in the office. All the girls in the office are warm and caring. Dr George has so much compassion and never wants you to feel pain. Epidurals are a breeze.
I'm a chicken and he is just kind. I am so thankful I was referred to Advanced Pain Management|The Doctors at Advanced Pain and Spine Management have been life changing for me. They were the first to diagnose my condition and come up with a pain management plan that works. As long as they are around and I'm in pain, I will be going to them.|Best pain doctor ever. I have MS and Dr George is the first pain doctor that actually is helping me. Even everyone in the office is amazing. Would recommend him to anyone!|Dr George and his staff are fantastic. Can't say enough about how great I was treated and would recommend them %100.

I absolutely love this whole office! Dr. Belmonte and Dr. Lee are very knowledgable and friendly. Nurse Gail knows her job and does it well! MA Alexis was very comforting and sweet. Thank you to whole office for being so great!|Dr. Belmonte listened to me and took the time to explain things. He is like night vs day compared to my previous pain management doctor. I'm SO happy I found him!|Wonderful staff. Dr Belmonte is very caring and genuine. Discovered what caused my back and hip problems and helped so much. I'm pain free!|Dr Belmonte is a wonderful physician. He is collaborative with his care. He is compassionate and has helped me over several years! I trust his advice and his skills. I feel safe in his care . I have chronic back and neck pain. I would recommend him to anyone.|I have been in the Martial Arts since age 12. In about 2014 due to not taking care of my body and injuries I had to take a serious step back. I began to look for a way to manage pain and injuries. I'd received tons of physical therapy, pain medication, and injections by many different doctors. Nothing seemed to work, no one seemed to really care, and I had lost trust and faith in doctors. I was convinced everyone was in it for the money

My Mother is a patient of Dr. Belmonte and had been urging me for about two years to check him out. I finally gave in to her suggestions and had my first appointment with Dr. Belmonte 4-6 months ago.

I cannot say enough good things about Dr Belmonte and his staff. His office staff is extremely professional and the office is filled with a positive energy! The experience is not like anything I had run into in the past. Dr. Belmonte had a treatment plan in about 20 min! He is unbelievably intelligent and a true master of his craft. I thought it too good to be true but after following the treatment plan of Dr. Belmonte I am beginning to feel better than I ever have! I am also training again! I do not have the vocabulary to explain what this too has done for my mental health. Dr Belmonte is one of those rare doctors who seems to love every person that walks through is door and truly desires to help people. Its not about the money with this doctor. If every doctor conducted themselves as Dr Belmonte conducts himself we would probably have a cure for cancer already!

If your faith in doctors has been lost I highly recommend giving Dr Belmonte a shot. you wont regret it. The only regret I have is I didn't go see him sooner.|Dr. Belmonte and his staff are absolutely wonderful! Dr. Belmonte cares deeply for the welfare of his patients. He never makes me feel rushed through an appointment . Dr. Belmonte listens and explains different options that will help you.  He and his entire staff are very friendly and helpful. They go out of their way to help you. If you are looking for a team who truly cares about you, your well being, and total quality of life...... then Dr. Belmonte and his staff are for you!|Dr. Belmonte and his staff are awesome! He takes the time to know you as his patient, listens and talks about his plans to help fix your issues.
I've been seeing him about 5-6 years now and would recommend him to anyone who needs a Dr who cares about you. He really goes out of his way to make you feel comfortable.
His staff and office is like one big family, you will be wondering why you didn't know about Dr Joseph Belmonte sooner, if anyone can fix you it's him. Karen Tolstead|Dr. Belmonte is the most wonderful person I know! He is very professional but makes you feel so welcome. I had a not so good experience while living in SanFrancisco, I had injections and it was awful and seriously made me never want to go threw that again, however when I got injections from Dr.Belmonte it was really painless. I would recommend him to everyone and the staff is very friendly and considerate.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

Dr. Issa brings several years of specialized training to our practice, having received his Doctor of Medicine from the University of Balamand in Beirut, Lebanon. His extensive education includes a Post-Doctoral Fellowship in Clinical Research in Interventional Neurology at the Medical College of Wisconsin Froedtert Hospital, followed by an Internal Medicine Internship at North Shore LIJ Staten Island University Hospital. We offer a wide range of innovative pain management treatments including:

column40:
I have been going to this pain clinic for over two years. I am a patient of Sarah Sloan, she is kind, personable, and compassionate. I have nothing but wonderful things to say about this business. The staff is wonderful. The nurses are wonderful. 10 out of 10 would recommend|My husband was a patient here, but we will never step foot in this building again.  We had success at first as a new patient in April and May. He had a steroid injection in May. Dr Graham was very good with that, and the nurse practitioner was also thorough.  However, we did have a problem in May, from Jay who does the insurance pre- authorizations.  He did not send in the pre- authorization in a timely manner and said my husband may not be able to get the injection that day.  We had to call the insurance company and try to get a supervisor to approve it, which we did. (They said it was day 4 or 5 of the approval process, which is why they could approve it).
Fast forward to August, he was having neck pain. They put him on a medication, and said they would have to get him on the schedule for a neck injection and would call him. 15 days later we called to see if he was on the schedule yet.   They were very rude stating they only have 1 dr and limited staff and he was still not on the schedule, to wait until they call him.  The next day, they called him and said they scheduled it for 45 days out.  That neck injection procedure was scheduled for 3 pm.  My husband came home from work and we were getting ready to leave.  Jay, the guy who works in the insurance, called my husband at 1 pm, 2 hours before the procedure and after 45 days of being scheduled) and said the insurance hasn't approved it and that if they didn't approve it, he couldn't get it done.  We called again (this is the 2nd time this office has not done the pre authorization correctly). United Healthcare said that Jay didn't send the pre authorization paperwork in until late the day before the procedure, and the turnaround time is 7-10 days. Jay called in and put "urgent" the day he was supposed to have the procedure, but urgent still takes 48-72 hours. After 2 reps and a supervisor with the ins company, they said they couldn't do anything and that Jay didn't get it submitted in time.  We called Jay back and told him this.  He said it was just "OUR" insurance and all other companies "just approve it". My husband said he would just sign a self pay because we knew it would get approved shortly after, and Jay said if we could make it by 3, yes we could. It was 2:15 & we had a 45 minute drive.  We had conversations with Jay on the way about trying to still getting it approved, self pay, my husband had been given 2 Valium to take which he did.  After Jay continued to be rude and had no empathy for any of this, I told him he has failed at doing his job now twice. He didn't send in the paperwork in a timely manner twice. He waits until the last minute to do anything.  I've been in insurance over 26 years, and I know pre authorizations don't work the night before..  and that its not just "our insurance.  He then called us back and told us he had called Dr Graham and told him not to do the procedure whatsoever that day when we pulled into the parking lot right at 3. I told him I was outside the building with my husband who had taken 2 Valium for the procedure. He said he didn't care and he wouldn't allow the procedure to commence. I walked into the building absolutely furious and asked for Dr Graham or the office manager. They made me wait forever and never came out. I left and told my husband we would never step foot in that office again. I would NOT recommend this office to ANYONE! No one ever called to say they were sorry, to follow up, nothing. 4 weeks later, they call my husband out of the blue to confirm his injection procedure for the next day and to call back.  No one ever called to tell my husband they had even scheduled this, or to follow up from the cancellation of the neck injection.  This office does not follow up, does not care about you, and is not ran efficiently.  If you are looking for a good place, we recommend Dr Beuer, any of his PA'S and Barnes Christian Hospital Pain Management Center in St Louis. Phone # 314-653-5228. They actually run a great practice, schedule what you need that day,  and do the pre authorization correctly, unlike this office.|I've been trying to get a call back for 2 weeks!  I have left 5 messages.  They have a Referral from my surgeon, he sent it May 6th...today is the 21st. Did call the patient experience line and left a message.  Wonder if they'll call me back?  I wouldn't bug them so much but I need pain management, guess I'll go to the ER again.  At least they help me.|Dr Graham and Sarah are very knowledgeable  and do everything possible to help me with my back and neck problems. Any of the staff that I've had contact with are very nice and efficient. I recommend the pain clinic to anyone who suffers with pain.|Horrible experience with one of the nurses. I had been going for nerv blocks and other treatments for sometime, a year or more. This time while taking my vitals the nurse decided she needed to put the pulse ox on my paralyzed hand/arm. I'm paralyzed due to brachial plexus injuries. My arm is completely atrophic and my fingers have curled up because of this, and I have CRPS on top of it. This is painful I let out a paind yelp and she gets angry. Now she argues with me about my pain medication then snatches my paperwork out of my hand causing some to hit me in the face and some to fall on the floor. I got up said you aren't going to throw things at me and walked out. This lady then proceeded to get me kicked out and wrote false information in my patient profile causing yet even more troubles with my healthcare. I was only going there to receive help because it is the only place around here that can help me. In no way was I going in there to be a burden or malicious. I did not deserve this treatment. I have a whitness that was sitting in the room and saw the entire thing!|Scheduled a consultation for my back pain.  I was at the facility less than 30 minutes, 20 of which was sitting around waiting.  Less than 5 minutes with the actual doctor, who seemed perturbed that I was referred to him.  He asked a few questions then recommended I go to physical therapy.  I was billed $1,000 for the visit...$700 for the doctor and $300 for the "use of the facility".  I would not recommend this place.|Discovered I had degenerative disc disease, pinched a nerve in my back and after 2 day I couldn't even walk. After my doctor trying everything else she finally sent me here where I got 2 epidurals and was like new again. I would definitely recommend it to anyone in constant pain from pinched discs.|Would recommend to anyone suffering with pain they are kind and have a great bedside manner

column48: What are the neck pain treatment options?
column49: Treatment options for neck pain can differ significantly based on the cause and severity of the discomfort. Typical treatments include physical therapy, pain management medication, and sometimes, interventional procedures like injections. Depending on the underlying condition, more advanced options may include radiofrequency ablation or spinal cord stimulation. It's crucial to undergo a thorough evaluation by a specialist to determine the best treatment plan for your situation.

Turns out I had a tumor growing in my spine and it broke my back. I was diagnosed with breast cancer. Today I am cancer free and living my best life. I am not exaggerating when I say I wouldn't be here today if not for Dr. Cha.|5 Stars!

I have been in unbearable pain for many years, and after coming to Algos Pain and Spine Care, under the care of Dr. Daniel Cha and his amazing team, my quality of life has significantly improved. Dr. Cha's expertise, compassion, and attention to detail are exceptional. He took the time to truly understand my condition and tailored a treatment plan that has given me relief I didn't think was possible. The entire team at Algos Pain and Spine Care is professional, kind, and dedicated to patient care. I highly recommend Dr. Cha and his team to anyone in need of pain relief. Thank you for giving me my life back!|I really enjoyed my visit to Algos Pain and Spine Care! It was easy to access right off the highway and find parking. I loved how bright and big the office space was as well. Dr. Cha is awesome, he is patient and spent a lot of time going through each of my questions and coming up with the best options for me. I highly recommend Dr. Cha as a pain management doctor!|Dr Cha is awesome.I've been ableTo increase my activity and I've actually been able to help take care of my mom who is 91and declining quick.
Thank you Dr Cha!|Dr.Cha took his time to explain what my body is doing and recommended solutions. Well rounded staff and have recommended my family to him for their back problems.|He has treated me for various issues throughout the years. I have not been back to there for two years. He is an amazing pain doctor and I am blessed to be able to rely on him.|I have worked with Dr. Cha for several years, as I've had unrelenting neck pain, broken a couple of bones, some health conditions/procedures that cause pain, and chronic pain that flares. I have never had such a helpful, knowledgeable, well informed and compassionate doctor as I do in Dr. Cha, especially when it comes to pain management. Dr. Cha uses a variety of treatment options, which is invaluable to me. Dr. Cha knows my significant anxiety (largely due to medical trauma, previous experiences), and has never appeared judgmental or impatient. He does what he can to make sure I can relax.

My experiences with doctors before Dr. Cha felt hopeless and overwhelming. Dr. Cha has always taken time to answer my (many) questions, and I truly trust Dr. Cha and his entire staff (especially *Aracelli* thanks for all of your help and always being so professional and kind) to help when I've been at my most vulnerable.|I had been suffering for over a year with with thinning of my spine.  I had several procedures done, but all had failed until my best friend recommended Dr Daniel Cha to me.  He performed the Vertiplex procedure on my back & I have received instant relief.   I had muscle pain & nerve pain in my leg and also felt as if everything in my back was sitting right on my tailbone.  The very next day all of this pain is gone.  Dr Cha & his staff were all very professional & pleasant during the time that I was there.  I am so thankful for them.

column40: Since Jenine retired. It has gone downhill. My orthopedic  surgeon sent me to the hospital near where we live in Freeport and Elizabth Kuhn kicked me out because  the doctor there gave me a Norco. She told me I was taking meds that she had not prescribed. It has made me not trust doctors now.|Doctors are very thorough and well staffed due to it also being teaching hospital.  State of the art ultrasound for instrument use and insertion of needles for treatment.   Impressive staff and building.   Great physician.  If i were getting a hip replaced,  i would see them.|Please do yourself a favor and do not see Jeanne! I had gone to get some help with a prep op order from my orthopedic! She couldn't even read the order and insisted it was post help! My Orthopaedic the next day said that was not how the order was written! WHAT I could barely get there. Please don't go try another center! I would like to hear from Kiswaukee's manger that mangers this women!|Jeanne was the rudest person I have met. Withing the first 5 minutes she took my tramadol away the my primary doctor wrote the prescription for my fibromyalgia. Without even talking to me about my fibromyalgia she said you don't need tramadol for that. I was standing because my back is pretty messed up and my sciatic nerve was flaring up and my arthritis is bad. She told me to sit down. I told he I would rather not because of the sciatic nerve and my arthritis was hurting bad. She said " I have said I have arthritis to and it hurts so you can sit down". My chiropractor took xrays and don't think she even looked at them. She have me 20 tramadol and told me to wean of the ones my doctor had been giving me. All and all she was rude and had no compassion for her patient. She rushed through the appointment. Had me do what she wanted me to do, not want made me comfortable as a patient and a human being. The only thing she did do was order a MRI. My second visit was just as bad if not worse. So I have to live in pain because she chooses i'm not bad enough for pain meds or she does not want to prescribe said pain meds.  That's a huge choice for someone to make that is not even a doctor. It is also inhumane to treat a person like that. To make them live in pain because you chose to not give them pain medication.|I have always  had the best care at the KSH pain clinic. Jeanne is wonderful and very caring.  Dealing with  people who are in pain is a difficult job. Filtering patients who are addicted to pain killers is a tedious chore. God bless her and the staff in the pain clinic.|Dr. Jerry Loch is fantastic. We had a situation yesterday. Much confusion. My partner was in the ED and I needed answers. I walked up to his office. He came out and spoke with me, then walked back to the ED to address the situation. He went above and beyond to help us in the situation. Thank you Dr. Jerry Loch!|I would have left less than one "star" actually but the ranking system doesn't allow for less that one star, unfortunately. And I went to N.W.P.C. originally in the naive hope of continuing a pharmaceutical medicine regimen started approximately a decade ago by my physician.  Unfortunately, my doctor's retirement caught me up in the doctor's corporate parent's policy dictating that I had to go to N.W.P.C in order to continue the same level quantity and type of medicine since I never abused it. I actually went with great hope that a facility doctor would assess me so imagine my surprise when I was assigned to a nurse practitioner (that's a nurse with a Graduate Degree in some medical arts field)- with little practice experience who ordered a variety of tests-costing Thousands of Dollars-- that I had already gone through and which my insurance wouldn't pay for because of that very reason. When I told this to the nurse practitioner, on a paid second assessment meeting, I was informed that was my concern and even though the nurse practitioner freely conceded more than once during this meeting I had medical conditions requiring specified care that it was the policy of N.W.P.C. to not prescribe opiates for pain control but, instead, use "diffent modalities"--such is psychobabble for meditation, bio-feedback and such. When I asked that it meant I still would NOT be given the medicines I needed even if I managed to scrounge up the money for the redundant tests, it was tactily acknowledged by the nurse practitioner that despite my very real need for the type of care offered by these LEGAL and commonly used medicines, I wouldn''t be prescribed them. Furthrmore, it was mentioned that my now former doctor had "over-prescribed" opiates and that all similarly-situated patients were undergoing the same (LACK?) of treatment. It was almost funny that both of these fundamental components of this discussion were NOT mentioned during my first session with the same nurse practitioner: the only mention had been about "dfferent modalities" but NOT that the nurse pactitioner wouldn't prescribe LEGAL opiate medication, and when I asked if she was inferring my then (but now retired) doctor had over-prescribed in her opinion, the only response was a blank stare from the nurse practitioner. It strikes me that it is easy to be boldy disparaging about a colleague's professional expertise when that colleague can no longer refute that claim.  Furthermore, to treat--or NOT treat similarly-situated patients of the same retired doctor as a gebmneralizex unfeeling burueacratic approach at best...in my humble opinion.To be clear, I write this not to share my "tale of woe" because no one besides my relatives will care--and I have my doubt that a couple of them will be concerned--but to let current and future patients of this facility know that they should inquire at the very beginning of the first session what their policy is regarding issuing opiate presciptions to patient's already receiving lawful prescriptions for some time now and how burdensome and expensive the process will be to even find out if you "qualify" for consideration of said prescriptions.  In my opinion, the only loss worse than your time and money to participate in this process is the possible loss of self-esteem when, in my opinion of my two experiences, you realize it all seemed to be a charade to force credible patients to stop using prescribed LEGAL medicine--whether they want to stop or not. Of course, the worst effect would obviously be the loss of medicines essential to the well-being of the patient, wouldn't it? As a disclaimer, this is simply my opinion; albeit supported by copious recordings of the events detailed in my account of my experiences. It in no way should be taken to indicate other patients would have the same treatment and I sincerely hope that they wouldn't since the patents are trying to safeguard the most fundamental aspect of their life--their health and well=being.|After i went to er at Kish hospital in Dekalb, this nurse in pain clinic wont help you if you have reference and i explained i have a reference to help with my neck/spine issue. I keep getting runaround with callings between this place and er and primary dr. I never experience this bad before.. highly recommended not to go here. Very lousy service. At park ridge is better than dekalb...

column40: Dr. Hashim is the best pain management doctor I know! After 7 back surgeries and a total hip, I will never see anyone else! If you require special injections, Dr.Hashim has the best hands I know. I'm a R.N., and have seen many injections but none as good as Doctor. If you do not like following the current requirements by law for prescription medication for pain don't choose Dr. Hashim! She follows the law, you will feel safe, my pharmacist states it's always right. Just remember when you're a chronic pain patient you want a doctor who follows the rules and keeps you safe! I've been her patient over 15 years!|I am no longer in neck pain thanks to Dr. Hashim. I have faith she will fix my lower back pain too. Even when something doesn't work, she never gives up and keeps trying for a fix. She keeps things very simple and to the point so that you can receive the best care possible as soon as possible. She works in a certain way in order to get you out of pain quickly by sticking to the facts. She suggests what she thinks should be done, schedules it as soon as possible, and even confirms it with the insurance all at once. If it doesn't work because injections are 50/50, she tries another approach. Coming from a girl who contemplated her life due to her chronic pain; I appreciate her so much and know how much she cares.|I waited several months after leaving this practice to think about my experience and write a review. I would highly not recommend this practice or doctor. First and foremost, the cost. I was self pay and she charged me double what I am paying at a much bigger practice. I am also self pay there. She also always presumed I didn't have the out of pocket cost to pay for injections. Maybe at her inflated costs, no I wouldn't have. But I did at my new place, Gateway Spine. It was still expensive and she shouldn't make assumptions. Nor should she be over charging for sub par care. I keep getting bills that randomly get bigger and bigger for the same dates or service. I will not be paying. Being I was self pay, there should never be a bill. Then there was the care. It was horrible. She has zero bed side manner and she actually speaks down to you. It all felt very narcissistic which is the last quality you want in a doctor!  She has no trust between her patients. Requires you to bring in old prescriptions counts every pill. She might say this is required or standard but I highly doubt Gateway Spine and all my other pain doctors aren't following the law and standards when it comes to prescribing pain medications. I'm not required to do that anywhere else it's her own thing.  My first appointment was THREE long agonizing hours and she is ALWAYS running behind and all follow ups were super long. I get it there was a lot to review and, I've never had that lengthy of an appointment with any other pain doctor, so it is indeed possible to use appointment time for efficiently. She would literally scold me like a child. She has one great staff member Iliana and she treated her how she treated her patients, horrible. I'm hoping by the time I am writing this she has moved on to something else, I know she was working towards other things. I'd also like to thank her for her support, kindness, and she was able to give me direction that the doctor could not. Communication was difficult and she was extremely invalidating. She wasn't willing to adequately help with my pain. I was in a rough spot after a cross country move. I'm feeling so much better now. And I came to find at my new practice that along with my back pain I had a very sick gallbladder that needed removal. The organ was actually dead. So yes, I was experiencing immense amounts of back pain. She chose to not believe me. It's hard enough being a pain patient. The stigma is real. So if you are a pain patient looking for a new doctor? I highly recommend you going elsewhere. Her own staff told me she was "crazy" and not providing appropriate care and for my own safety? To go elsewhere. That says A LOT.|Dr Hashim was so much help for my low back pain. She is so attentive and very available. I wish I had delt with her to begin my treatments.|Dr. Hashim has been my doctor for over a year. She is very caring and really listens to you. She really thinks about what problems you are having and will try everything possible to help you with your pain. I would definitely recommend her to anyone that has been dealing with chronic pain. There is no other doctor I would want to handle my care. Her office staff is also very friendly and love the changes they have made to the office.|I've been seeing Dr. Hashim for several years and I've been very happy with my care. I've had chronic pain and other health issues that makes my pain hard to control sometimes. Dr. Hashim always listens to me, and with her help we've found ways to control my pain with minimal medication. She's strict and expects patients to follow her rules, but with all the abuse in the news I don't blame her. I've been very happy with my care and will continue to see Dr. Hashim in the future.|Dr. Hashim is the BEST! She's very thorough & thoughtful. She gives great advice and if you listen, you will have pain relief for sure. I'm so grateful I switched to her.|Dr. Hashim is a caring and supportive doctor. She's mindful and is knowledgeable of important regulations regarding prescription drugs. Though some patients might be less understanding in the importance of keeping track of prescription drugs, it doesn't bother me. I consider the counting of meds prescribed by Dr. Hashim invaluable. This keeps me safe from potential harm from them. Drug screening through random urine tests is a key in keeping transparency and honesty as a patient. All that she does keeps us from causing harm to ourselves, or anyone else.

column40:
I have been a long-time sufferer of cluster headaches, a condition known for its excruciating pain and debilitating impact on daily life. After searching for effective treatment options, I discovered Neuragenex, and it has been nothing short of life-changing. The relief I have experienced from their treatment is beyond what I ever thought possible.

From the moment I walked into Neuragenex, I was impressed by the professionalism and warmth of their staff. The clinic exudes an atmosphere of genuine care and empathy, which immediately put me at ease. The medical team took the time to listen attentively to my symptoms, medical history, and concerns, ensuring they fully understood the nature of my cluster headaches.

The treatment plan devised for me was tailored to my specific needs and aimed at providing long-term relief. The expertise and knowledge of the medical professionals at Neuragenex were evident throughout the process. They explained each step of the treatment comprehensively, answering all my questions and addressing any doubts or fears I had.

What truly sets Neuragenex apart is their commitment to staying at the forefront of medical advancements. They employ cutting-edge techniques and utilize the latest technologies to deliver the most effective treatment for their patients. This dedication to innovation is reflected in the outstanding results I experienced.

Within just a few weeks of starting treatment at Neuragenex, I noticed a significant decrease in both the frequency and severity of my cluster headache attacks. The relief was remarkable, and it continued to improve with each subsequent session. The pain that once consumed my life began to recede, allowing me to regain control and enjoy activities that were previously impossible.

Besides the excellent medical care, the overall experience at Neuragenex was impeccable. The clinic is modern, clean, and well-equipped, creating a comfortable environment for patients. The support staff were friendly and accommodating, ensuring that my visits were as stress-free as possible.

If you are searching for a pain clinic that truly understands cluster headaches and can provide effective relief, look no further than Neuragenex. Their commitment to patient well-being is exceptional, and they have proven themselves to be a beacon of hope for those seeking respite from this debilitating condition.|I found this place while looking for chiropractic services. Knowing that I could have nerve damage I decided to try a different route and so glad I did. Everyone in the office is so and helpful. Melissa (APRN, FNP-BC) was very knowledgeable with everything she told me about my muscle spasms I had that was causing pins and needles in my upper back. I also have had lower back pain for years and after the first treatment had significant relief. I have gone 3 times now and notice my knee, lower back and upper back and shoulder are feeling better (not 100%, but noticeably better).
I finally was able to receive the vitamin IV and feel awesome. Looking forward to my future treatments!|I suffer from Carpal Tunnel and I was referred to Neuragenex for pain management. During my visit, I was treated with care, and my questions were answered. Tiffini was great! She is knowledgeable and she put me at ease.  Also, I had an IV Detox and afterwards, I never felt better.|This place is a gem. They listen to your health concerns and provide a customized treatment plan that works.|Everything was perfect. All of the employees are very nice and friendly. Thank you...

column2: Medical Pain and Spine Care of Indiana
column3:
At Medical Pain and Spine Care of Indiana, our dedicated team of pain management specialists in Noblesville provides comprehensive chronic pain treatment solutions. Our practice features an experienced pain management physician and two nurse practitioners who specialize in both interventional procedures and medication management for effective pain relief.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a wide range of treatments including:

  • Major joint injections for shoulder, hip, and knee pain

  • Spinal procedures (medial branch blocks, radiofrequency ablation, Intracept)

  • Advanced therapies (ketamine infusions, PRP, pain pumps, spinal cord stimulators)

  • Wellness services (IV vitamin infusions, therapeutic massage, microneedling)

  • Physical therapy and trigger point injections

We specialize in treating arthritis, diabetic neuropathy, migraines, low back pain, neck pain, and nerve pain conditions. Conveniently located to serve patients from Indianapolis to Kokomo, we're committed to improving your quality of life through personalized care. Visit Medical Pain and Spine Care of Indiana or call us at 317-776-7028 to begin your journey toward effective pain management.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Relief Solutions Across Indiana

At Center for Pain Management, we are dedicated to providing minimally invasive, interventional pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Our extensive network spans seven locations throughout Indiana—Carmel, E
column11: At Center for Pain Management, our providers specialize in minimally invasive, interventional pain management. Our network of pain management clinics serves Indiana in seven locations: Carmel, Evansville, Jasper, Indianapolis, Avon, Lafayette, and Greenwood. Our pain management doctors offer a wide range of treatments with additional services like physical therapy, psychological services, and diagnostic imaging. Conditions treated include: post laminectomy syndrome, CRPS, sacroiliitis, sciatica, spondylosis, facet syndrome, and more. Treatments offered include: spinal cord stimulators, steroid injections, intrathecal pain pump implants, and more.
column38: RL RL|Paula J|Holly Roper|Jamie C. Cox|Tanner Langley|cami reese|Dee Allen|Paul Legge
column40:
Hi, Dr. Tolbert I truly miss you at the office as my Primary Doctor. The last few trips to your office haven't been satisfactory. After my appointment today, when I got in my car, I just busted out crying. Being in pain 24 and 7 isn't fun. It's debilitating. But, today I don't know if I want to return until you come back from maternity leave. The nurse that took me back to the room just rushed through my paperwork, she could barely answer my questions because she was so in a rush to get to the next patient. So, she came off as being RUDE. Bottom line no good results came from this visit.  Very disappointing once again!

C.Lee|If I could put zero stars I would. I hardly ever write reviews but I am making the rounds with this one as I would hate if anyone else would ever had to experience what I just had.

Originally the appointment was with Dr. Bush for an epidural injection. I arrived at 10:30 for an 11am appointment. The waiting area was full, which I had no issues with, but was told that Dr. Bush had apparently over booked themselves with appointments. Without any prior warning I was told I would now be seen by the "owner"' Dr. K (I do not know his last name, it was what the staff called him) who specifically came in to help with the load.

By 11:30 the clinic was beginning to empty, with new patients beginning to be checked in and seen. I go up to the staff and ask if there was an estimated time that I would be seen. I wasn't given any information on when that might be and was only told that they were behind.

I was annoyed given that I am a caregiver that cannot be too long from the house, but decided to wait due to my back pain. Also my pain was currently becoming more severe as I purposely didn't take any medication for the appointment.

By 12:30 I once again go up to the staff and ask what is happening. By this point at least 3 other people have came in checked in and had been seen immediately. The clinic's waiting room was completely empty and I was the only person left.

Another woman came up (I do not know if she was a nurse or not, she didn't even speak to me) and spoke to the front desk staff about my appointment. She then proceeded to tell the front staff who then notified me that my new doctor, Dr. K, had just left to go on his lunch break and would not be back for 45 minutes. As a reminder this man is apparently the owner of this establishment. He also came in to help with the overflow and even though they were an hour and a half late behind and there was no one else waiting besides me, decided that now was a perfect time as any to eat.

To say I felt completely disrespected and disregarded of my pain is an understatement. I decided to cancel and leave instead of wait. I refuse to be touched by any doctor who shows so little respect towards their patients time. The least the staff could have done is say please come back this afternoon or send someone to explain why things were so behind. Instead I was left sitting at the waiting area looking like a fool while no one said a thing and would probably still be sitting there had I not asked any questions.

I am a believer that good doctors take care of their patients from check in to check out. I have been to enough doctor appointments with both of my parents to see that there is almost always a direct correlation to how doctors' manage their patients and time, to how they behave professionally and their ability to treat patients.

If they are willing to disregard their patients in this way, how can you expect them to take care of your condition.|Please beware of Dr. Bush! I have been a patient of Dr. Nodine's for over a year and then I had a hip replacement and I loved her. She was terrific. After that surgery my back pain became more significant so I set an appointment to see her again. The day of my appointment the front desk contacted me and told me I would be seeing Dr. Bush. From the moment this woman stepped into the exam room I was treated like garbage. She kept interrupting me. Dismissed what i was trying to tell her about my pain. Barely did an exam and then brushed me off by saying I need physical therapy. I have been managing my back pain for ten years - I have tried everything and I tried to tell her that and she dismissed me. I just wanted to get out of there so I left - in tears. Fast forward 6 months and my back pain was worse so once again I attempted to see Dr. Nodine. I called and made an appointment. Drove 45 minutes and waited 20 minutes only to be pulled into an office and told Dr. Bush had discharged me and they had no idea how I got an appointment. I didn't even know what that meant and the lady said - didn't you get a letter and I said no and asked for a copy but was told the "printer" was down or something. She explained it basically meant Dr. Bush fired me as a patient and I couldn't return or five years. Once again - I left in tears. I will be taking every single available action against the unprofessional, abusive manner in which Dr. Bush treated me - so beware if your scheduled with her. She is the nastiest most unprofessional person I have ever met.|I love this location. I was considerably late due to vehicle issues and they still managed to fit me in and without any wait!!! They really care about each person and I don't feel like just a number to make someone money like most pain management facilities. Plus my Doctors awesome!!!!|The Physicians, Nurse Practitioners, Nurses, and the Administrative/Front Desk Team are all incredibly kind and understanding.m. This team of skilled healthcare professionals will treat you with patience and professionalism and will genuinely care for your overall well-being. It will be difficult to find a team that is more well-rounded or more suited to care for you and your healthcare needs. I highly recommend this facility and its staff to anyone in need of long-term pain management.|I would like to clone Dr. Gordon!
I have been seeing Dr. Gordon since we moved here a few years ago. He has found a plethora of ways to treat my chronic pain. I have a good understanding of the treatment plan and the limitations.
As a side note - I think his job would be a tad bit easier if this state legalized medical Marijuana!|I have a new issue with them now unfortunately.  Dr Tolbert canceled my appointment with for 11/21/24 and I was told to reschedule. Now Dr Tolbert knew my Rx were going to run out on the 23rd but didn't bother to tide me over. I rescheduled for the 25th which was the only opening before Thanksgiving. I saw Shay that day and I had told her I had run out and she put a new Rx in while I was sitting there. I checked with Kroger in Bloomington the next morning and it hadn't gone though. I called Greenwood and the staff member told me she would send Shay a msg. and call me back. She never called as usual. I checked Wednesday late afternoon and it hadn't gone thru again. I have been left without medication for the last 5 days. I'm in severe and going thru withdrawl. This isn't right to treat a patient like this.  I called at 0815 hrs. this morning and of course no one answered and it is now 1000 hrs. and I still haven't heard from them. I can't go another day like this and shouldn't have to. This is patient neglect!|The surgery center (that conducts nerve blocks) is in the same building as the doctors, physical therapist, and imaging, yet unlike everything else, it is NOT in network for UHC. Even though office staff assured me it was in network, it is not, and I was charged thousands for a nerve block. In addition, there were multiple billing errors for physical therapy which they refuse to own up to, despite my insurance company agreeing they were in error. Too much headache and stress to deal with this operation. I strongly suggest going to specialists in a better organization that has its act together.

column40:
My second visit went very well. The tests that she ordered at my first visit, indicated that I should be seen by my doctor sooner than the original 6 months wait I was given. Since that visit is still 6 months away, she suggested I make an appointment with a Doctor who can see me sooner and keep my other appointment as a 2nd opinion. She also gave me 2 doctor's names to try. Very helpful.|I've been going to centers for pain control for well over a decade and will continue. I used a walker on my first visit and had given up many activities like gardening, bicycling and fishing due to severe neck, back and leg pains.  Thanks to Dr Puranik and his team, I've been able to resume doing the things I enjoy.  I'm approaching 80 years old. I recommend them wholeheartedly.|Great place! But my pain is getting unmanageable.!  Its all over my body. Trying to sleep at night is the worst. The shots are remarkable but good for only one area at a time. Heavens a great place, cant wait to be pain free someday.|Julie is always on time and has an excellent bedside manner. She listens and is genuinely concerned. She had all the right information and addressed my questions.|She is amazing!  She listened to me and then came up with a plan to help relieve my pain.  She was compassionate and cared about the pain I was in!  Very pleased!  First time I have had hope in many many months.|I was a patient here for approximately 7 months.

During this time they almost injected a corticosteroid into the wrong hip. Had I been put under, they would have. I was the one that notified them of their mistake.

Vanessa during my last visit, argued with me, about me having Osteoartharitis of the hip. She said "you have mild DJD". Trying to dismiss my pain. Vanessa doesn't know Osteoartharitis is also known as...Degenerative Joint Disease, or DJD for short.

I have multiple pain sources, verified by advanced imaging and by an orthopedic surgeon. They acted as if I was drug seeking the entire time. I must've been a pretty dumb one for denying anesthesia for every single procedure.

When I was sent to physical therapy, they ordered the wrong thing. Not even remotely close to my pain source.

This place is beyond unprofessional. I should've known when they called me prior to any paperwork or meeting me when they said "we wont give painkillers because your charge from 2018". The phone staff huffs and puffs if you have questions. These people are not passionate about helping.

They legitimately just looked me up on mycase. Had they actually went further than their bias they'd see all those charges were dropped. Beyond that, I requested more help than what they were giving me and stated I did not want opioids. I had 0 pain relief from this place. Most these reviews are fake or have relations with the staff.

I'm a union brother through and through. I have no reason to lie. If you value yourself, or your family members. Do not come here. Read the other 1 star reviews. This place is a malpractice suit waiting to happen.|My visit to the Centers for Pain Control and Vein Care was a pleasant surprise. Chelsea Dalton was very helpful in coming up with a plan to diagnose and treat my vein issues. I'm looking forward to my upcoming visits.|Physical  I could not do everything  I want to do if it wasn't  for Center for pain control. Just got my neck done .I drive a very lot! Life is alot easier, with there help.I would  not be going place without them! Thank u!

At Indiana Spine Group, Dr. Ashwin Madupu and our dedicated team provide comprehensive pain management solutions at our Muncie location. We specialize in treating various chronic pain conditions through advanced interventional techniques and personalized treatment plans. Our services include:

I feel cared for and am living a manageable life because of the excellent care and treatments I receive. I am always treated with respect and genuine concern. Everyone's great from receptionist to Dr's.  Appointments are taken on time which is appreciated as I work. No complaints!  I highly recommend!|Very professional, friendly and get you in quickly to your appointment.  The doctors are always friendly as well and don't try to rush you and find out what your medical needs are.|I have been going to Commonwealth Pain in New Albany for over 7 years.
The folks there almost feel like family

Lisa truly is very concerned / committed to LISTENING and CARING, to what I have to say and has been a huge help to me over the years, following a chronic issue I have been living with and most likely, will have to continue with for the rest of my life.

Everyone there is so friendly, from reception, to nursing, to care givers / doctors, everyone.
I Always see a smile when I walk in. ALWAYS !

The staff works very hard to schedule my appointments to fit around my work schedule

With the recent pharmaceutical shortages, I have experienced my pharmacy having no availability of prescriptions a few times - Commonwealth Pain New Albany, quickly rerouted my prescription to another pharmacy which did have availability.

In all fairness / honesty ...
When calling in for something - calls seem to get routed to Louisville
My level of satisfaction - not very good.
I wish the company would allow phone calls to go through to the office I visit instead of routing me through (what feels like) an answering service.
I have never received an answer to any issue or question I had - - I always get the same response of, I will forward your question / concern, to the staff.
(( as I said - feels like an answering service ))
> use the portal for the quickest response <
You will hear back in a VERY short time

Bottom line .....
New Albany location - 5 Star  -  Highly Recommended
Phone in service - 2 star|On my second visit, they rescheduled me via voicemail, and when I was 9 minutes late to the new assigned time they refused to see me, saying it was 12 minutes and their policy is 10, and no exceptions apparently for canceling my original appointment and expecting me to be available at the new time. This was a Friday when my rx was due, and because of a 3 minute difference they had no problem that I will be in pain for 3 days until yet another appointment time. Not to mention I explained difficult circumstances beyond the pain. I loved Corydon Pain Management, wish they would have turn business over to a more compassionate provider.

column49: Some of us have different opinions about the care and treatment we receive from Commonwealth Pain and Spine , I just so happen to be one of those people. I have been going there for several years, and they have always listened to my concerns and addressed them accordingly to help keep my pain under control. However, I am no longer with them and haven't been for about 4 or 5 years due to them saying I had failed too many drug tests. However, I was never once told I had ever failed a screen until I went in for my regular appointment, and it wasn't until I was taken into the room and waited for the doctor to come in and she informed me I would have to find a new place to go for pain management because I could no longer go there... I do think  I don't really remember, but I think she did give me my medication 1 more time.  I have since found a new place and really like them a lot better, and they're more professional and care more about their patients.

At Commonwealth Pain and Spine in Jasper, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout southern Indiana.

Specialized Pain Treatment

Our team of board-certified physicians offers personalized care for various chronic pain conditions, utilizing both interventional procedures and medication management approaches. column40: What I like about Common wealth is I never have to wait very long. They have a young lady to greet you show you to the restroom then direct you to the examining room after she ask you every thing she needs to know for the Dr. It's know time before the Dr.s in to see you she is very pleasant to talk to she ask me a lot of questions about my pain and if there's anything she can do to help me.  We've got a plan  I feel comfortable with her.|Went with my mother for her back issues. She was going to Evansville for a couple years not related to this one. After a fallout between her and the staff and the care provider. We decided to go here instead (Commonwealth) Now at first I was nervous about it cause it was a new place to get her treated. But fortunately they were kind-hearted and you can tell they cared for you. It's almost unbelievable now days but these guys were absolutely amazing. I'm happy we changed places. (First visit)|I have had an excellent experience with the Doctors and staff in Jasper.  They care about your health and make sure to manage your pain in the safest and healthiest ways possible. They are kind and caring. I recommend them!|I trust my life with, and admire, those associated with Commonwealth Pain and Spine! For they are always there, in my darkest of times of horrendous pain; and they always help me when I need anything taken care of. Through surgeries, physical therapy, spinal injections, permanent Spinal Cord Stimulator, MRI's, X-Rays, medications, fighting insurance issues, they are all just the most caring staff to get the job done! I don't know where I'd be without all of these people, because they truly understand and are so knowledgeable and explanatory and do all they can to help those of us who need them the most! The staff is always wonderful, in every office I've been to, and there's no one else that I would trust with the conditions that I deal with on a daily basis! I would recommend them to anyone. Thank you Commonwealth Pain and Spine for everything you do!!!|This is my 3rd pain mgmt group over the years and the Jasper office is the best! When I called with an urgent message I was put on hold for 30 - 45 minutes, and when I asked the operator in the Louisville office to expedite my message because I was running out of medication she responded rudely (I was needing to transfer my prescription to a different pharmacy because the other was closed due to bad weather, my PA had told me to let them know if that became the case so just let them know so they could send it to a different pharmacy). Attempting to do this I was told by the Louisville person that it would take 24 to 48 hours for the Jasper office to respond to my message. This isn't the first time that I've had issues with the Louisville answering service, it's been almost everytime. However, the Jasper folks ended up getting the message/info the same day and I was able to finally get my prescription filled -- thanks to the Jasper office personnel I'm sure!|I've had nothing but great visits. Our team of board-certified physicians specializes in treating chronic and acute pain conditions using the latest interventional techniques.
