column40:
I had a great experience with Doctor with my recent appointment! When I met with the doctor, he took the time to thoroughly review my medical history before asking about any concerns. He didn't rush through the appointment but listened carefully and answered all of my questions with clear, thoughtful explanations.
After the appointment, he provided me with additional resources and even followed up a week later to check on my progress. It was refreshing to feel heard and genuinely cared for in a medical setting.|If I could I would give them -10. These are suppose to be pain specialist, I have a broken back and a shattered ankle, but dr. Dasari acted like I was somehow not the right kind of person to recieve treatment. My question is well then who i?. Because I suffer from chronic pain, I somehow have done something wrong? Everyone cannot have surgery, or afford surgery. I was treated like some kind of criminal. From the time he came in the room, Dr. Dasari was condescending, and short, and rude. They are suppose to treat pain, but if you are african american don't expect to get prescribed any medication to relieve your pain and suffering. But if you are Indian or Caucasian you will get everything you need to feel better. Yes I am African american, and I am a big guy. The doctor was absolutely judging me from the time he laid eyes on me. Don't judge a book by its cover. I am a college graduate, who is a single father, and care taker for my senior mother who had a stroke. For some reason Dr. Dasari feels like my mri that shows my back is broken and herniated disconnected two places among other things is not valid because it is a few years old. That doesn't change the fact that it is in fact very painful and worsening. So he gets paid, to tell me nothing I can do sorry.. goodbye.   All I can say is WOW. I DO NOT RECOMMEND!!|It was wonderful to walk in and from the receptionists,n, the E-xray tech, the nurse to the doctor. It made a nervous visit to a calming one. The professionalism is outstanding. Dr. Wallace did great speaking to me, explaining everything to me so that I would.understand. Asking if I had questions without rushing with an answer.
What a group of professionals, you wont be disappointed.|To doctor sherry and his whole crew is one the best medical and loving, kindness place to visit when it comes to caring about there people health. I also would like to say they are a blessing in my life n love too you all.

Mr.Bryd|Everyone I had an interaction with at Midwest Interventional Spine Specialist were so friendly and kind. I was in and out they were very fast, and the staff was very knowledgeable you can tell they've been doing this for awhile.|0 stars should be an option. It took a week to get an appointment. Waited a hour and a half to be told nothing. The actual interaction with the Doctor was 5 minutes and I wasn't listened to. No help at all|I was extremely unimpressed with this place. Upon arriving for my appointment, I filled out a lot of paperwork but then waited for about an hour past my appointment time. I was eventually seen by the Dr. and medical assistant (Who were great!) for about 15 minutes.... I then had to wait another 30 minutes because they had not received something from my referring doctors office, which I'm amazed wasn't caught prior to my appointment. I then saw the doctor for another 3 minutes or so, and injections were scheduled. After receiving a call from the surgical center doing the injections, I had second thoughts and wanted to get in contact with the doctor again to discuss if there were any other options for me as none were discussed with me at the visit, despite being there for almost 3 hours. I was told (very rudely) by someone at MISS that I could not communicate with the doctor, etc, without coming in for another appointment. I thought it was a little strange I couldn't have open communication with the Dr. I explained I had literally just had the appointment and nothing was discussed with me, and if there truly were no other options for me I would do the injections. Eventually, I received a call back from someone (very nice, understanding and helpful!) who scheduled me for another appointment with the Dr. the morning of the injections so I could discuss any other options I had prior to moving forward with the injections, which was helpful! However, fast forward to the day of the appointment and injections (Which I took off of work for!) I received a call a few hours before my appointment stating that the Dr. was ill and my appointment needed to be cancelled. I called back because I still had the procedure scheduled at 2pm! I left a message and after an hour no one had called me back. I called again and spoke with someone who said my appointment for the injections needed to be cancelled as well because the Dr. appointment and injections scheduled in the same day (by someone in their office!) was not approved by my insurance because it was all in one day. This was the first I was hearing of this! No one had told me anything about this issue with my insurance prior, and I feel like I would not have known if I didn't call myself. So now I have taken a whole day off of work to have everything canceled like an hour or so before my appointment. I liked Dr. Woods and the assistant, but the scheduling area needs some serious help with organization. I am also a medical receptionist and I am not a fan of how they handled this. I canceled all future appointments as I do not have time for a doctor's office that does not respect MY time.|Loved the receptionist's at the front desk they were very patient and professional and Dr. Shetty he was so nice and took his time and listened to me and understood what was going on immediately! I rate this office a10/10 five stars aren't enough

At Lafayette Pain Care, we specialize in providing personalized pain management treatments to help our patients regain control of their lives. Located at 770 Park E Blvd, Suite B in Lafayette, Indiana, our dedicated team of pain specialists including Dr. Siddiqui, Dr. Sebai, and Nurse Practitioner Laura Peacock work collaboratively to address various chronic pain conditions. I was promptly seen by Dr. Macadaeg, he again reviewed my situation, requesting I do resistance to his procedures.  I answered his question about my leg discomfort.  Reviewing location of my previous shot he then proceeded to give me an injection.|For 7 years, I lived with intense pain in my lower back after an injury and tried PT, exercise, aqua therapy, stretching, weight training, etc. I did not want to take pain pills, but I knew I needed to do something about how uncomfortable I was feeling.

I met with Dr. Macadaeg, had my scan, and qualified for surgery within the month.
On the day of surgery, I went in with the expectation that any improvement would be a success. I am committed to continual strength training, mindful movements, and self-care.
The entire procedure took 4 hours and 4 months post-op; I am pain-free (in the previous injury spot).

I cannot praise Indiana Spine and Dr. Macadaeg enough! They performed magic in my eyes, and I will forever be grateful for their expertise and care.|Dr. Macadaeg listens and provides the best care for his patients. Dr. P is a great doctor and deserve more than 5 stars!|I went for a consultation based on referral in March for an epidural. Before I agreed to consultation I was assured that the clinic is out of network but would be treated as in network and I would only have to pay copay. I paid copay at the time of visit.  No further imaging or tests were done or ordered. I was told I would received a call from them to schedule the procedure once insurance had approved it. I hadn't heard from anyone since, no follow up, not even a call to assure anything was in order or check on my status, and today I receive a bill from them for the consultation beyond my copay amount. Not sure why the dishonesty. Buyer beware.|I highly recommend this facility to everyone! I am very grateful that I was referred here by my surgeon.
Every staff member, including the doctors that I have had contact with, have been very nice, compassionate, and knowledgeable.
After reading some of the negative reviews, I actually had to go back and look at the address for this office to make sure that I was rating the correct location because my experience here is the complete opposite of the detrimental reviews.
I sure do hope that the horribly adverse reviews aren't because medication wouldn't be prescribed  for what may not be valid medical conditions.|I had excruciating pain down my neck, shoulder, and arm. I met with Dr. Tupper and his staff and I couldn't have been happier. His staff was extremely professional and kind, Dr. Tupper listened to my concerns, discussed all of my options, ordered my MRI and I was diagnosed with foraminal stenosis at various levels of my cervical spine. His bedside manner is fantastic and I felt so comfortable with him knowing he has the experience and knowledge on how to treat this kind of acute pain.
We made a plan for a cervical epidural steroid injection at Lake Park (St. Mary's) surgery center, which went extremely well. I am sleeping through the night finally and my pain is almost 100% gone.
Highly recommend Dr. Tupper at Pain Control Associates!|I am a patient at PCA for several years due to severe back problems in which I have undergone many surgeries.   Although my back issues are many, I am Blessed to have Dr Tupper as my Dr.  Through my debilitating  ordeal Dr Tuper has been my constant. He always takes his time to listen to my concerns and to determine the next best course of action, never pushing me to make decisions that I am not comfortable with.   I much appreciate and highly recommend him.|If you're dealing with pain in life for whatever reason, then you have to be in pain management... almost all of the pain management facilities out there are just terrible, and are just rotten to deal with and be involved in.

If you want to be treated different, then you're gonna want to go to Pain Control Associates. And the more that you know about the plan to correct your issue, the faster the doctors can focus on your problem area and get it fixed for you...and they are very good at educating you on what's wrong and what they're going to do to fix the problems...

So if you want to be treated great, with professional doctors. Then go to Pain Control Associates... they won't let you down!!!!!

At Center for Pain Management, we specialize in minimally invasive, interventional pain management solutions for patients throughout Indiana. Our comprehensive network spans eight locations, including Evansville and Jasper, making quality pain care accessible to more communities.

Comprehensive Pain Solutions

We offer a wide range of advanced treatments complemented by essential services including physical therapy, psychological support, and on-site diagnostic imaging. Our dedicated facilities include ambulatory surgical centers specifically designed for outpatient procedures, ensuring patients receive the highest standard of care in comfortable settings.

Our specialized team treats numerous conditions including:

  • Post laminectomy syndrome

  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)

  • Sacroiliitis

  • Sciatica

  • Spondylosis

  • Facet syndrome

We provide innovative treatment options such as spinal cord stimulators, targeted steroid injections, and intrathecal pain pump implants. Our integrated approach means we can address both the physical and emotional aspects of chronic pain, helping patients regain function and improve quality of life. Visit our Evansville pain management clinic or call us at (812) 437-7246 to discover how we can help manage your pain effectively.
column11: At Center for Pain Management, our providers specialize in minimally invasive, interventional pain management. Our network of pain management clinics serves Indiana in eight locations including Evansville & Jasper. Our pain management doctors offer a wide range of treatments with additional services like physical therapy, psychological services, and diagnostic imaging. Our pain management clinics are complemented by ambulatory surgical centers for minimally invasive outpatient procedures. Conditions treated include: post laminectomy syndrome, CRPS, sacroiliitis, sciatica, spondylosis, facet syndrome, and more. Treatments offered include: spinal cord stimulators, steroid injections, intrathecal pain pump implants, and more.

Living with chronic pain shouldn't mean giving up the life you love. At The Pain Medicine & Rehabilitation Center, we understand how debilitating persistent pain can be, making even simple daily tasks feel impossible.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

We provide personalized treatment plans designed to address the root causes of your discomfort and restore your quality of life. Our specialized services include:

  • Advanced medication management

  • Interventional procedures (injections, nerve root blocks)

Under the expert guidance of our compassionate medical team, we take the time to listen to your concerns and develop targeted strategies that work for your specific condition. Don't let pain control your life any longer – visit our website or call us today at +1 812-523-3700 to schedule your consultation at our Seymour, Indiana location.

column40:
Dr. Alexander goes out of his way to help find the root cause of any problems. He is kind, compassionate, and extremely intelligent.

I have a medical issue that is not related to pain management and he has gone above and beyond with researching and guiding me to where I need to go to receive the proper treatment. He cares about his patients and their wellbeing.|Everyone is very pleasant in the office.  Dr. Alexander is very caring and does his best to help. I have been going to pain centers for over 15 years and they are by far the best. My only complaint is he doesn't take Medicaid.|My wife (Rhonda) has been a patient of Dr. Anthony Alexander's for 14 years now. Dr. Alexander was actually a workman's comp physician for her after she suffered an accident 3/18/2008. After she was released from w.c. her family physician ask her "what would you like to go from here?" and she ask to be be referred to Dr. Alexander. He has never second guessed himself, always sending Rhonda to another specialist (Indy & New Albany) for another opinion on her case. He has truly been a God send to our family. He and all his staff are always kind, professional, yet show us the best of care.|I think Dr. Alexander is the best doctor to ever come into my life. Him and his staff are always caring, organized, efficient and respectful. They listen and try to help, instead of judge and patronize like so many health care providers do these days.|The local hospital's pain center sent me a letter stating I was dismissed from their practice because "the risks of continuing my pain medication regimen outweighed the benefits."

I thank Lord Jesus I found Dr. Anthony Alexander.  After years of spinal injections, physical therapy, narcotics, and several doctors including three neurologists and one research MS specialist at IU plus two other hospitals Dr. Alexander did an MRI and found a massive cyst pressing on my lumbar spine.  I had many brain, cervical, and thoracic MRIs, but never a lumbar study!  Dr. A knew exactly what to look for and where to look for problems.

Dr. A set me on a course of surgery and extended treatment with his colleague and friend, Dr. Kahri of the Goodman Campbell Spine and Brain Group in Carmel, Indiana.

Now more problems have been found once again on an MRI that require extensive surgical intervention, and once again Dr. Anthony Alexander is on top of my rescue.  He goes out of his way to not only provide referrals, pain medications, and other rehabilitative help, he helps find solutions to the enormous cost of specialized medical help.

Having said al this if at all possible steer clear of Seymour's local hospital should you find yourself or someone else needing pain relief and rehabilitation because Dr. Alexander will find the root causes of your pain, find you the help you require, and he will treat with kindness and professional consideration.|Dr. Alexander and staff are very professional in handling all pain care. They are very helpful in managing pain! Receptionist are very polite and helping with directing questions and needs! Thank you for your services and caring about your patients!|The staff is very pleasant and professional. They are courteous and guide patients through their appointments. Dr. Alexander is very understanding. He listens to his patients and tries to get to the cause of the pain.|Dr. Anthony Alexander and his staff are consummate professionals in every sense imaginable.  I have been a patient for many years and they have helped me tremendously.  It's satisfying in knowing that Seymour, IN has choices when it comes to pain management and are not forced to use the more expensive option of the local hospital.

column3:
At Centers for Pain Control & Vein Care, we provide comprehensive pain management solutions under the expert guidance of Dr. Tarek H. Shahbandar, MD. As a Michigan-born, Wisconsin-raised physician, Dr. Shahbandar brings exceptional credentials to our Merrillville practice, having completed his medical education at the Medical College of Wisconsin followed by prestigious residency and fellowship training at the Cleveland Clinic Foundation. His experience includes three years training physicians at the University of Illinois at Chicago, establishing him as a leader in interventional pain medicine.

Our Specialized Pain Management Services

We offer a full spectrum of pain management solutions including:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Vein care therapies

  • Advanced pain relief techniques

Our approach combines medical expertise with compassionate care, ensuring each patient receives the time, respect, and diligence they deserve. Located at 8687 Connecticut St in Merrillville, Indiana, we're committed to helping men and women throughout the region find relief from chronic pain and improve their overall wellness. Visit our website or call us at +1 219-476-7246 to schedule your consultation and take the first step toward effective pain management.
column11:
Tarek H. Shahbandar, MD, is a devoted and seasoned physician who brings the necessary warm-hearted diligence, time, and respect to the practice of interventional pain medicine. Dr. Shahbandar helps men and women relieve pain and amplify wellness at the Centers for Pain Control, located in Merrillville, Indiana.

Dr. Shahbandar was born in Michigan and raised in Wisconsin. He attended the Medical College of Wisconsin in Milwaukee before completing a residency and fellowship at the Cleveland Clinic Foundation. At the Cleveland Clinic in Ohio, Dr. Shahbandar had the privilege to train under some of the world's most prestigious pioneers in pain medicine. He also spent three years training physicians at the University of Illinois at Chicago.

Then they told me that they didn't refill my pain pills because I had to give a urine sample...they could've told me that three weeks ago when I was here but instead they made me wait! I wish just one time one of these people could deal with the pain that I deal with on a daily basis and then they would know what it's like to not have something to make the pain go away!  Seriously thinking about looking for a different office   Also, did I forget to mention that you have to wait another 30 to 45 minutes to get checked out before you can leave after you've been seen.|Dr. Shahbandar is the only good thing about his office.  I had an appointment yesterday and at an hour past my appointment time, I went to the desk and let them know I could not sit any longer and I had another appointment to get to, and the doctor still took forever to get to me.  The check out process is FOREVER!  They definitely need better chairs if people are going to wait for so long.  The staff are rude.  One called me the evening before my appointment and told me she was going to cancel it because I never started PT....i have been in PT for two months now and she continued arguing with me over it.  I would only recommend Dr. Shahbandar.  He listens and actually knows what he's doing!!|The Doctor was personable & showed concern for my medical conditions. He gave me confidence that he will do his best to treat my medical conditions. The receptionist were hospitable and gave service with a smile!|I was seen quickly and treated courteously. My check out was about 10 minutes, much faster than in the past. I have no complaints . I do think that some chairs that are higher are needed as some people have difficulty getting out of chairs and some social services can be added to let people know that they can get rides to doctor appointments etc. I spent a long time talking to one patient that could benefit from information. She lives alone and has no family. She did say that one of your staff told her about the ride options.|Dr Varners  patience and attentive listening is what I like most, she's kind and respectful. Simply pleasant and I feel I can talk to her about anything

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Relief Solutions in Lafayette, Indiana

At Center for Pain Management, we specialize in minimally invasive, interventional pain management designed to help patients regain control of their lives. Our Lafayette location is part of our extensive network serving Indiana with eight convenient clinics throughout the state. We take pride in offering a multidisciplinary approach that combines advanced pain interventions with comprehensive support services including physical therapy, psychological services, and on-site diagnostic imaging.

Specialized Treatments for Chronic Pain Conditions

Our board-certified pain management physicians treat a wide range of conditions including:

  • Post laminectomy syndrome

  • Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS)

  • Sacroiliitis and sciatica

  • Spondylosis and facet syndrome

  • And many other chronic pain conditions

We offer innovative treatment options such as spinal cord stimulators, targeted steroid injections, intrathecal pain pump implants, and other advanced interventional procedures. Our Lafayette facility at 3750 Landmark Drive provides a comfortable environment where we focus on developing personalized treatment plans for each patient's unique needs. For more information or to schedule an appointment, visit www.indypain.com or call us at +1 765-807-2780.
column11: At Center for Pain Management, our providers specialize in minimally invasive, interventional pain management. Our network of pain management clinics serves Indiana in 8 locations: Carmel, Evansville, Jasper, Kokomo, Indianapolis, Avon, Lafayette, and Greenwood. Our pain management doctors offer a wide range of treatments with additional services like physical therapy, psychological services, and diagnostic imaging. Conditions treated include: post laminectomy syndrome, CRPS, sacroiliitis, sciatica, spondylosis, facet syndrome, and more. Treatments offered include: spinal cord stimulators, steroid injections, intrathecal pain pump implants, and more
column38: Sarah Stratt|Sean McGill|Deborah Moran|Megan Clawson|Joyce Pasel|David Coffman|Erin Gilbert|Lisa M
column40:
I am not the patient, but my wife is/was, and I have attended every appointment and been present for every phone call made. Dr. Rutledge is a wonderful doctor - Great listener, takes things seriously, very personable guy. The nurse practitioner (Amy, or Anne?) is new, but is also wonderful. Very caring, great listener, amazing at her job.
My complaint is with the office staff and how horribly they handle just about everything. My wife just had major surgery not too long ago, and is on a VERY high dose of pain medication - today, 30 minutes before her appointment (we are over half way there), they call and say they no longer accept her insurance, that she's had since October. It is mid January. I watched my wife hand over her new insurance card to them in October, to which no one said I thing about them not accepting it. I have walked into places myself, handed my card over, and been immediately told that place doesn't accept my insurance more than once, why did the person working up front not know that the facility she worked at did not take that insurance? Seems very unprofessional to me. So now, my wife has no medication, and no doctor (she will be in chronic pain the rest of her life), because of a mistake they made. Pretty big mistake if you ask me.
Not only this - But right after she had major surgery, her surgeon sent over paperwork that was incredibly important for them to look at, somehow it didn't make its way to the doctor, and neither did the notes of my wife calling and asking them to please look at those papers and respond. After a week, I drove an hour up there to be told that someone just simply didn't send any of that information back to her doctor, it just sat there, and it took the woman one second to do it. She sat without pain medication for days, after getting cut wide open just a few days prior. Another pretty big mistake if you ask me.
Not long before that, we showed up to her appointment, were told she had no appointment. Yes she did. We had the appointment card proving it. Someone didn't put it in, their mistake. After going back and forth with the front desk people and standing firm, they did allow her to be seen, but pushed pretty hard for her to just leave due which I felt was a bit inconsiderate and unprofessional.
The doctors at this place are amazing - But whoever handles the rest of the stuff honestly just needs fired. They all do. This is a *pain* clinic. You can't just screw people over and mess with their lives like that and act like it is a little mistake. I do understand what's done is done, but dang. I sure hope no one else is dealing with anything similar from this place, no human should suffer due to another's mistake, it is incredibly sad.|So let me get this straight,  after my appointment with the doctor,  I approach the reception/ nurse area and ask if there is a copay i need to take care of. She replied no. 2 weeks later, I get a bill for $80.00. I cancel my next appointment because I was in California at the time and I get another bill for $75.00. . So now my bill totals $155.00.  From this point,nothing really makes sense,  so I wait to hear from you guys and that never happens. Next, today,  I'm being contacted by the Paragon collection agency. Now considering that I don't owe anybody, it couldn't be anyone  else but your office who has turned me over to collection. U asked all the right questions, made all the right moves, you charge me for an appointment that I canceled and turn me over to collections with even once attempting  to contact me? That doesn't seem right|Thanks to Dr. Rutledge & his staff for their patience, knowledge & understanding in making my visits pleasant & for helping me find a way forward in managing the pain I've had for a very long time.|I couldn't tell you what the doctor was like because I never got to see him! I sat in the room for an hour and 23 minutes waiting. They don't value patients they value their own pockets.|As the spouse, I am grateful for the care Dr. Rutledge has given my husband. He is a skilled doctor who conveys his concern by listening and reaching a decision that best suits my husband's needs. The doctor manages my husband's arthritic pain, enabling him to participate in those aspects of life he values.|I've never treated so rude by a doctor in 70 years of my life! I work in the Medical field also. Doctor Kim or doctor I don't care didn't even come all the way in the room. Half in the door with his computer. Never introduced his self or asked me how was doing. First words out of his mouth was I don't think I can take you as patient! Because of the dosage I was taking from the last pain clinic I went to for 8 years. When I tried to tell him of all the things that I had been through. He stated," I don't care what you been through!" I've have had 3 lower back surgeries and 2 extensive neck surgeries. Cancer in which radiation damage my lower colon for life. Not going into the other surgeries I've had. I need knee replacement surgery in which I'm trying to put off. After being insulted he just left. I needed not help instead of feeling like a nobody!|I had back surgery a little over a year ago and I am in worse pain now than before I had it. I found Center For Pain Medicine online. I called and was assigned to Dr. Hom. He was very understanding of the pain I'm in and provided me with pain medicine to help me try to get through each day as best I can. I appreciated how kind Dr. Hom was and how he listened to me. The receptionist and nurses are also very sweet. I am so glad I went to the Center For Pain Management.|I am a Nurse and have professionally met many pain management Doctors.  I however on a personal level this Pain Management office and Dr. Rutledge have absolutely always made me feel respected and a part pr deciding my care.  Dr Rutledge does not push pain medication as my only option and talks to me as a person about potential medication and treatment procedure options.  He is very down to earth and makes you feel very comfortable.  My first personal experience with pain management place and as a Nurse and a person with chronic pain I was appalled at how I was treated.   I highly ensure that you will never be treated like a drug seeker with Dr Rutledge and any of the Nurse Practitioners, Medical Assistants, and office administration.  I without a doubt recommend this office for your pain management needs.

Thank you|Hobart Office .. Amazing Staff ! Completely! They Took Amazing Care Of Me And Their Personalities Are Just Amazing And Friendly. All I Can Say Is I Love The Vibe And That Is What The Doctor Needs An Amazing Staff That Works Great With Patients Along Side An Amazing Doctor.Dr Shabandar..Fabulous.|After seeing Dr Simon Ho for ten years he suddenly treated me with disrespect, raised him voice & cussed at me when questioned about pain meds. It was as if he became he different person. I was quite frankly scared during my last office visit.|Dr. Shahbandar is my doctor and I love him and his staff! I met Dr. Ho yesterday because my doctor wasn't working at the surgical  clinic and he was good u can tell that he cares about what he does. P.S. Claudine|Lacks the necessary compassion for a specialized office who's name is actually Centers for Pain Control.

I don't know how they deal with their cosmetic fiscally efficient clients.

Maybe the patients that are paying more so they can have pretty legs, have not been through serious injury, and/or pain patients that have significant income disagree with me.

Right now the primary doctor is on vacation for a month and I was not offered any alternative temporary pain remedies while waiting for Dr. Ho to return from his pleasure at my cost.

The staff, however, is wonderful. But for a simple question about anesthesia, the staff seemed too afraid of there own boss to make an important thirty second call to him during business hours. Almost like they would face extreme wrath or unemployment if they disturbed him for even one minute.

Dr. Ho has amazing manual dexterity and precision. Even though his expertise seems to be going to his head; he has a wonderful staff and is great in surgery.|All the nurses are super friendly & knowledgeable: from the intake exam person to the ultrasound tech to the team who did the procedure. They made my vein procedures go smoothly & with minimal stress.  Selena Velasco noted some issues with my legs I was unaware of & referred me to a specialist who diagnosed me with lipedema--something I wasn't aware I had, but explained many things.  Thank you so much!  Christy Kersey has a great bedside manner.  She did my procedure & follow up & everything went so well.  Would recommend to others for sure.|A "pain clinic" that refuses to help with your pain ! The only way they know how to deal with pain is to stab you in the spine with needles ! Nurse practitioner had nerve to tell my wife (that has LUPUS)  "every time you come in here there is always something new!" Like she is making stuff up. My wife has been on pain meds for 30 years and they took them away OVER NIGHT ! They say they don't prescribe pain meds ? WHAT IN THE HELL DO YOU THINK A SPINE INJECTION IS ? A PRESCRIBED PAIN MEDICAL PROCEDURE!  They make more money from the injection not the script ! They DONT CARE ABOUT THEIR PATIENTS!
AVOID , AVOID , AVOID AT ALL COSTS!

I don't understand what the bad reviews are about. Before I moved to Florida I was a patient there for a good while, they're kind, compassionate and thorough. They DO NOT FALSIFY urine drug tests, if you fail it's because you tested dirty, period!! I've had no problems with my tests because I was clean, period.  If you follow the rules and their pain management guidelines, there will be no issues.|I really enjoyed this clinic. I am sad that they close down and since they close. D, my doctor refuses to fill my scripts. And his clinics sent me to the wrong clinic and I have been in pain since this place. I filled my script last. I really miss having my doctor that I had here. He did a knee injection on me and it was awesome. I didn't hurt all day or anything the way he did. It was amazing. And I really wish they would come back|I've had to deal with pain doctors the past two years. Some who were forcing injections/pain pumps/various forms of surgery without looking at my patient profile. Not the case here. Dr. D actually reads his patients files ahead of time. He's blunt and straight to the point, which I appreciate greatly. He won't push anything unless it's absolutely medically needed, but he will give his advice and directions up front. Three doctors later, I'm glad I found one that has empathy enough to read my profile (which is rare) and actually be straight forward to the point without beating around the bush. Thank you guys again! I greatly appreciate your whole team more than you know.|So I went here before Covid and last visit in 2021. I'm a happy go lucky person that's nice to everyone until you piss me off.
Well I got along with everyone at this clinic, I made them all masks and everything.
When I got my last pain injection I had a headache for 2 weeks straight, no breaks in the pain. Then my blood pressure shot up and I had a seizure, which I've never had before.
When asking Dr. Provenza, of course he denied doing anything wrong.
Well since I confronted him with my problems and concerns, he "discharged" me for inappropriate behavior.
This here proofs his wrongdoing to me.
Found this out today and now that he has passed away, he can't justify his actions and lie about my "behavior"
He wasn't the only shady doctor there, they fired the other one that was prescribing medication that actually helped me instead of covering the pain.
If you want pain meds and don't want to fix your pain, this is the place to go, they give it out like candy.|I'm just gonna ECHO MiaX. She pretty much had my experience before I ever went there. They called me for a pill count on the 23rd of December 2023. I informed them when they called I was out of town. The "nurse" that called me said you need to be here before 5 pm on that 23rd day. Again, out of town. She told me bother coming back, and said it's my fault I'm not|I went to see these people. I was hit by a semi in 2007. I've had neck problems ever since plus I've had other accidents that further damage my spine. I've had all types of treatments for my pain. When I went to see them, they had my x-rays and limited medical records. They spent 20 minutes telling me what they wouldn't do for me. Neither Dr Doraswamy or his nurse ever ask me anything about previous treatment or anything else.  They judged me and decided what they would do before ever even seeing me. Had they asked they'd have known that their recommendations had failed in the past for me. Don't waste your time,  they an inadequate office. If you really need pain treatment, find a different place because they don't care or listen to you.|These people are rude disrespectful and uneducated knew nothing of my medical history and did not actually refused to do their job. Dr didn't want to prescribe meds unless agreed to injections and the women upfront tell him what to do . This place and their staff are shady|Dr. Brian is amazing I have seen him for a few years now. He's such a awesome person. Has worked with me through alot this past year. My year has been a nightmare. He always understood and threats me like a person.  Some of them can be rude there I agree certain ones. But over all this facility is awesome to me. Thank you Brian. Keep up the good work..

column40:
I went to see Dr. Ring and his staff on December 20th with a pain level of 10 out of 10. After receiving three epidurals and ongoing pain management treatment, I can confidently say that today, my had been relived! Dr. Ring and his team have been compassionate, professional, and truly dedicated to my care. They took the time to listen to my concerns and provided a treatment plan that made a real difference in my quality of life. I highly recommend Dr. Ring and his staff to anyone in need of pain management. They have been a lifesaver for me!|I am blown away by the exceptional care I received from Dr. Cawley and the entire team! From the moment I walked in, I was treated with kindness, compassion, and professionalism.

Dr. Cawley is a true expert in his field. He took the time to thoroughly understand my back pain issues and developed a personalized treatment plan that has made a significant difference in my life.

The entire staff, including the other doctors and workers, were friendly, attentive, and made me feel at ease throughout my visits. The office is clean, modern, and well-organized, which further added to my positive experience.

I have struggled with back pain since my car accident, but thanks to Dr. Cawley and his team, I am now experiencing significant relief and improved mobility. Their dedication to providing top-notch care is evident in everything they do.

If you're seeking a chiropractor who truly cares about your well-being and will go above and beyond to help you achieve optimal health, look no further than Dr. Cawley and his team. I highly recommend them to anyone seeking exceptional chiropractic care!|Advanced pain care has expanded their services and now offers a new weight loss therapy!!! I am currently on the therapy and have lost an amazing 20 lbs in three weeks!!! Included in your therapy is access to a physical therapist to help you with your exercise needs during your therapy, a nutritionist and  great staff to care for you while you are on this new therapy!!! I strongly urge and highly recommend that you give them a call if you have been struggling with losing those unwanted pounds!!  The length of the therapy is six months and I have no doubt that I will reach my desired weight in this time frame due to my results after just three weeks and the support of an entire care team!!! Dr. Cawley is great with pushing and motivating and pushing me in the exercise department!!! Which I do right at the clinic in their gym!! The entire care team is very positive, motivating and understanding when it comes to helping you lose those undesired pounds!!! I  not only high recommend Advanced Pain care for their weight loss therapy but also for any pain management you may be needing!! The entire office treats you like family and always has your best interest at heart!!! What are ya waiting for??? Give them a call today so you can start living your best life with out the pain and extra pounds!!!!
UPDATE!!! I have lost 78 lbs in the last four months!!! Yay!!!|I am giving it 5 stars and wasn't offered compensation or even ever asked to write a review. The office staff is helpful and Dr. Ring and my chiropractor there were very understanding of my pain after suffering many years with migraines and also after a neck surgery. I feel they are passionate about helping people who truly need help with quality of life care.|Great office! Friendly,  professional,  easy parking,  they evaluated me,  gave me a procedure the same day,  prescribed medicines including a muscle relaxant,  anti inflammatory,  and some medicine for pain,  ordered an MRI,  did therapy,  all in the same day.   The doctors and Nurses were very knowledgeable and explained a lot to me.   I am happy my doctor referred me to this office!|Good experience here. There is a bit of a wait time with this place, which is a definite area for improvement, but otherwise I think these guys are great.
Can't speak to previous reviews - but I have been here twice and the staff have been friendly and courteous on both occasions.
I came in for epidural injections both times, and each visit has left me feeling better and better.
Dr Ring is great. Very personable, funny and puts you at ease with what has to be done. His nurses assistant Chastity (? - sorry, I was on drugs when you told me your name) is also great. The anastestesiologis Robin and Carleen were also great.
I see Dr O at the Fullerton location, but he is also top notch.
Great experience all round. I would and have recommended these people.|Have been going here for pain management for nearly a year and everything about my experiences there has been a nightmare. I started going there to treat a bulged disc. This required chiropractic treatment and pain medication. As several months passed my pain was no getting better so Dr Ring suggested a procedure to relieve the pain. The day of that procedure, while I was waiting, Dr Ring and a patient got into an argument which eventually led to the police being called. I ended up walking out rather than go ahead with the procedure fearing he wasn't in the right state if mind after dealing with the police. I should never have gone back but the pain was getting worse, so I finally committed to having the procedure done. What a mistake that was. I am now in more pain then before and its almost unbearable now. Obviously I have a lot of questions to ask him but he never returns my calls and his staff just makes excuses for him. Making appointments is also a joke. I always made an appointment so Im the first one he sees, yet every time I go I have to wait a minimum of 45 minutes and several times as much as an hour and a half. Everyone there seems to be completely disorganized too. Bottom line is you should do your homework before you place your well-being into someone's care and trust your instincts when you see or feel that something just isn't right. Overall this has been one of the worst experiences of my life and I still haven't resolved my pain issue either.|This place is very unprofessional. They charge for services and orthotics that were not rendered. This office does nothing but push pills on their patients. The therapy and chiropractic services is a joke too. I hope the medical board and insurance companies begin investigating  this fraudulent company. And no I'm not disgruntled because "I didn't get what I wanted." I'm not an addict, never was and that's why this joke of a place wasn't for me. They want addicts here so you don't question their fraudulent billing and idiotic treatments. I advise all to stay far away from this place!

This place is a joke. I'm a single dad with 3 kids. I work 2 jobs. Have not been able to complete physical therapy. Finally able to get it set up and get kicked out the program for failure to comply. Ok that's fine but you say your gonna send in my meds. You reduce them to half of what I take for 1 week reduce in half again for the next week and then cut me off for the rest the month. You guys are pathetic. Been on my meds for years. Thanks for the upcoming withdrawals. That's when you know there not there to help there  just there for the money.|This practice is awful! My 72 year old Mother  has been going here for almost a year. She has urinary issues and a history of UTIs. We have had to take her to get blood work at some point because she couldn't give a urine sample. This is not a big deal.  Her last appt (we didn't know it yet) Dr Chad Hemmer berated her like a child in front of staff and other clients. Telling her they have had this issue with her before. "She has 30 mins to pee and if she can't do that then she has broken contract and will no longer be able to come."  I reminded him that her UTI issues is part of her diagnosis and offered to go have labs done. He refused, stating that that's unneeded work to be done for something she knows she has to do. He also made it clear she was making them late to lunch. He dismissed  her from the program with nothing to sign or other information. Horrible treatment. He talked to her and I both like berated children for something that wasn't her fault. I will be writing a letter to the Attorney General's office. If you can help it. Don't go here.|The ONLY reason I'm even giving them two stars is for their physical therapy department and Julie. The front staff is rude and I've been going there for almost a year now and I have NEVER received a phone call back from them. The last time I went in to get referred to a different surgeon because the one they referred me to wouldn't see me, as there was another doctor in my wrist after that doctor, I walked in to see a man that I've never seen before. Dr. Dunham, and at the end of it, he basically told me that there was nothing they could (would) do for me and refused to send over a referral to another surgeon "because that's not a responsibility I want" and refused to fill the controlled medication they wrote the scripts for throughout the past year. He didn't give me a weaning dosage, no side effects to watch out for. Nothing. He didn't even give me the simple courtesy of telling me they would no longer see me until I asked if I needed to make a follow up appointment and his response was "no". No explanation, nothing. It's been a week and I've called every day to request copies of my medical records and I haven't received a phone call back. It was a fantastic place to go, until the front office staff changed and the environment shifted. And from what I've seen on these reviews, I'm not the only person they've done this to.|Dr Dave was the most attentive doctor I have ever seen. He actually listened to me and wanted to know my game plan so we actually had a great conversation. Everyone's quick to leave bad reviews but he deserves a shoutout for being great !

However, I'm very upset because I've tried to get PAs for my scripts and I can't get anyone to answer the phone or send them in after waiting 48 hours.|Been getting my pain management for a few years now and up until 10/18/2022 I've never been so discussed with any care provider in my life!! James Julie and Amber are all compassionate and care about getting the pain under control! But that Dave Durham is a complete bully and uses his powers as owner to control and put people down! He's real rude! Talked to me like a dog and discharged me without even meeting me! I will gladly take my services elsewhere before I deal with his rude self! A straight bully!|I just got out of hospital on a Friday and they are closed!! They had sent my script to where I told them to days ago, but they haven't had any. Tried to get a hold of them to send it to a different pharmacy that I have already checked on.  And they are closed! Now I'll have to go to the ER, (ED), all weekend 3 times a day. This is crazy. They do need to care more for their patients,  but I believe they're hands are tied to some extent. That said, they should at least be open 5 days a week.|Very compassionate employees. Both nurse practitioners Amber and Julie  are both knowledgeable in the chronic pain field.  The physical therapists are good too. I have only been itoDr Bogus once, but she did a very good on my epidural injection.|I would give this place 0 stars if possible. I had been going here for 2 years and on my final appointment( didn't know it yet) a random dr who said he was the owner told me my insurance is requesting my records and he isn't going to deal with it, then said I failed a UDS in FEB. He cut my meds down and told me to report him because he doesn't care. I did injections, PT, never missed an appt and bam! He was so demeaning and refused to explain or answer my questions. Do not go here!!!

At Wellspring Pain Solutions, we specialize in providing personalized pain management treatments to help our patients find relief and improve their quality of life. Our team, led by Dr. Beck, takes the time to listen carefully to each patient's concerns, thoroughly explain conditions, and develop customized treatment plans. We offer a calm, understanding environment where patients receive attentive care from our professional staff. Our services include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Comprehensive pain assessments

  • Customized treatment planning

Located at 455 S Landmark Ave in Bloomington, our clean, modern facility is designed with patient comfort in mind. We pride ourselves on minimal wait times, especially for patients who pre-register online. For questions or to schedule an appointment, call us at (812) 269-7674.

column40:
I am a disabled nurse of 23 yrs just moved to Indiana 1week ago I can't get into pcp I am autoimmune I have ME/CFS, Lupus, and RA I am currently on Buprenorphine/Nalaxone because it works the best for me my last refill was in November and I am now out and going thru withdrawal NO physicialns in INDIANA will help me and OK almost killed me I have medical PTSD it is ALL DOCUMENTED. I CANT go to the ER's. I just has SEPSIS and was unconscious in the Shawnee OK hospital in JUNE 2024 were I was also in renal failure, metabolic acidosis because my OK Dr would not get me in with abdominal pain and diarrhea   I do not frequent ER's so I do not get sicker. I know people understand this at least people likeminded. I know risk management has to know this is not okay with your facilities. I tried getting into Dr Thompson MD office. I moved from one medically illiterate state to another?|This was my first time at Wellspring. Everyone was so nice. They kept me informed every step of the way. They really seem to care about their patients.|I  had a great experience at this facility, everyone was very accommodating and nice. Betsy was especially great  and caring to make sure that the treatment prescribed for me was right and she explained the procedures very carefully.|Dr Beck's office staff was very pleasant and helpful.  I got in right away. Dr. Beck was very thorough and explained my condition to me. After our visit we came up with a plan to address my issues and get me some relief. Would recommend this practice to anyone seeking pain relief from back issues.|Dr. Beck and i discussed some new options for controlling my chronic back pain today. He has worked with me for three years and I couldn't ask for better care. He really listens and genuinely wants to help. As a bonus today, one of Dr. Beck's nurses noticed a tick on my back and 3 nurses and a PA worked together for 40 minutes to remove it. This wasn't something in their field and they didn't have to take the time to help me but they did. They definitely went above and beyond!  Great staff! I would highly recommend this practice!|This was just my initial visit, and I was pleased with the information I received and the fact that the doctor said he would be able to give me a path forward to possible pain free days. The nurses and office staff were friendly and personable, and made me feel comfortable.|A very good experience from start to finish as the staff filled me in on what to expect and how to proceed forward. All
My questions were answered and I received text from the pain center reminding me of times etc. All of
The staff were supportive and kind ready to answer questions at any time. The facility was clean , bright and welcoming. I didn't have to wait long until my turn.
Thank you to Dr. Beck for a positive outcome and treating me like one of the family. I would recommend Dr. Beck and his staff to all who are looking for help !!|Staff was caring and physician listened to us. FYI be aware that they use a call center and phone conversations may not be with someone at the clinic.

Advanced Pain Management Solutions in Highland, Indiana

At Ramesh Kanuru, MD, we specialize in comprehensive pain management services designed to improve quality of life for patients suffering from chronic and acute pain conditions. As board-certified anesthesiologists and pain management physicians, our team provides personalized treatment plans utilizing the latest evidence-based approaches. Our services include:

Visit us at our conveniently located office in Highland or learn more about our services at painkanuru.com or call us at +1 219-838-1100 to schedule your consultation.

column3:
Specialized Pain Management in Greenwood, Indiana

At Center for Pain Management, we provide comprehensive interventional pain solutions through our network of clinics across Indiana. Our Greenwood location is led by Dr. Scott Kim, who serves as Medical Director for both our Greenwood clinic and the Center for Southside Surgery. Board Certified in anesthesiology with specialized training in pain management, Dr. Kim brings exceptional expertise to patients suffering from both chronic and acute pain conditions.

Advanced Interventional Procedures

We offer a wide range of minimally invasive treatments including:

  • Sacroiliac joint injections

  • Occipital nerve blocks

  • Radiofrequency ablation (rhizotomy)

  • Intrathecal pump implants

  • Neuroplasty procedures

Our approach focuses on identifying the root cause of pain and developing personalized treatment plans that minimize medication dependence while maximizing functional improvement. Located at 533 E County Line Rd in Greenwood, we're committed to helping patients regain their quality of life through advanced interventional techniques. Learn more about our comprehensive services at Center for Pain Management or call us at (317) 706-7246 to schedule your consultation.
column11: At Center for Pain Management, our providers specialize in minimally invasive, interventional pain management. Our network of pain management clinics serves Indiana in three locations: Indianapolis, Lafayette, and Greenwood. Dr. Scott Kim is Board Certified in anesthesiology with a specialization in pain management. He serves as the Medical Director for Center for Pain Management at Greenwood and the Center for Southside Surgery. He serves patients at both locations. He has expertise in diagnosing and treating chronic and acute pain with interventional procedures. He specializes in treatments such as sacroiliac joint injections, occipital nerve blocks, radiofrequency ablation (rhizotomy), intrathecal pump implants, neuroplasty, and more.

column40:
Dr. Kim is an excellent doctor that you know has his patients best interests at heart. He is also very skilled at doing many different types of procedures designed to lower your pain levels in general, and sometimes the results can be dramatic reductions. I would recommend Dr. Kim to anyone who needs help managing chronic pain as he is one of the best doctors I've seen for this.|Dr. Kim is nothing but a pill pusher.  At my first visit (10 minutes) he didn't touch me to examine the areas I have pain.  His main focus was that I was Ativan.  He gave me six months to go off of it, but did prescribe hydrocodone.  If it is really that dangerous, why would he give me six months to go off.  At my following appointment he spent about three minutes with me to tell me when I could pick up my prescription at the pharmacy.  The waiting room was like a herd with over flow into another room.  I came to Dr. Kim through referral.  I guess I'm all you want is pain medicine, he may be "wonderful", but I wanted help with my pain without having to use pain meds.  I do not recommend this doctor to anyone!!|I have severe neuropathy in my feet, legs, and hands for the first time in 20 plus years the pain is under control. Dr. Kim is personable timely and efficient, Have never waited more than 10 minutes to be called back to be seen. If you're living with severe or constant pain I recommend you see Dr. Kim|I've lived with debilitating fibromyalgia for 20plus years
I've been to an endless amount of doctors. I've had endless amounts of different kinds of treatments and NOTHING ever worked
so somehow I found Dr. Kim and on my first visit with him. I told him that what I wanted him to do was to disconnect my head from my spinal cord so I would quit feeling pain
He said that he could not do that but that he had something else that would work for me that didn't involve narcotics and I'm in recovery so that's important
So a spinal cord stimulator by Boston scientific, it was placed in back
I woke up from surgery vibrating, and have not had fibromyalgia pain since
It's the ONLY thing that EVER worked
Life Saving!!!!!!
The whole team at his office, including Boston  Scientific have been wonderful to work with

They should stop giving pain pills and narcotics Two people that are suffering and make the spinal cord stimulator the first option
It's incredible|Terrible front staff they'll turn you away from the window if you don't have your patient information filled out. Terrible availability, after they denied me service they offered to see me in a month as a new patient even though I've been going there for about 5 years just wasn't able to see him last year due to unavailable insurance. When and if Dr.Kim is able to see you he interacts with you quickly really doesn't give you time to sit and talk with him and express your concerns accurately and makes you feel rushed.|I was referred to the center for a pain pump. I got assigned him even though I was referred to a specific doctor. Well this doctor comes up with the idea to use a spinal cord simulator, which in the appointment with the sales rep to ask question I was given a pamphlet and pushed to schedule a trial. From my own research I figured out it wasn't going to work which other specialist have agreed. But the worse part was he done a caudil block on me. I was to be "sedated" and wouldn't remember anything. I remember well because I wasn't fully numb when he done whatever. I asked him to stop numerous times and he continued going. I never got any relief and in fact my legs since then have hurt as if I was post op for a spinal surgery. So whatever he done increased my leg pain. Had he read my chart or operative report he would have known it was a bad idea to try anything like that. He also doesn't wash his hands between patients as I watched him walk patient to patient in the surgery center and never even sanitize his hands. I spent almost 6 months trying to reach someone to be able to switch to the doctor I was originally referred to. I also requested a call from the office manager no one called back.|Worst experience of any specialist I've ever seen, unfortunately I've seen too many due to other health issues. My first visit was maybe 10min in length with Dr Kim. Most of the time spent with him telling me his rules. I've been on Norco due to chronic pain and he wanted me to try a different med to see if it worked better. I don't have an issue with trying something different, however I have been prescribed his recommended medication to be taken along with Norco. He would have known this IF he would've actually spent time with me or read my well documented file. On top of this, I am self pay due to being out of work for surgery. I paid 75$ the day of my visit and then got a bill for 929.00$ ..... WHAT??? After over 15 calls talking to the billing and office staff, nobody could explain the charge. When it's.coded as an advanced visit, even their billing tops out mid 700$ range. In order to bill 99204 or 99205 the Dr is required to spend 45min to one hour WITH the pt. NOT 10min total. I am scheduled to have a follow up visit 9 days after the initial visit and even after expressing my concerns and leaving 5 unanswered voice mails Dr Kim only prescribed 7 days worth. I have done tons of research and am engaged to a cancer nurse, who deals with specialty charges and codes (all the same in Indiana) I have notified my RA Dr who sent me to Dr Kim and they find what I have encountered completely unacceptable AND against the oath taken by all Dr's. Even to the point of filing charges against the office and the Dr with the medical review board. They obviously DON'T care about their patients, keeping them informed or the quality of care they give.  I have sooo many more things I could write, including facts to back them up, but this is long winded enough. I am a retired FF/Medic so I understand and believe in excellent pt care. Please do not accept this office to help you or your loved ones. I know my RA Dr's office won't refer anyone else to them.....nor will the other Dr's in her office. I truly hope you all have your needs taken care of and that you have or find a Dr's office who actually cares. Have a blessed day.|I am giving this "doctor" for lack of better terms, a 0 rating. My wife went in to discuss an issue with her hand and all he did was look at her medication chart and told her he would NOT be filling both of her medications and that she had to pick one or the other. When she tried to verify what she said, he yelled at her and told her she was not listening. This is contradicting to what his video says. Where he says they want to help their patients. If you have to go to the Greenwood location pick someone else to see or go elsewhere!

At APAC Centers for Pain Management, our mission is to provide the most advanced and compassionate care to patients suffering from chronic pain. Our world-class physicians are dedicated to precisely diagnosing and treating the source of your pain, not simply masking symptoms. Located in La Porte, Indiana, we've established ourselves as a leading pain control clinic serving patients throughout the region.

Specialized Pain Management Services

We specialize in minimally invasive, non-surgical procedures designed to help you reclaim your life. Our comprehensive approach includes:

  • Advanced diagnostic evaluations

  • Customized treatment plans

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Physical therapy recommendations

  • Epidural injections

We understand how debilitating chronic pain can be, which is why we're committed to finding effective solutions that get you back to work, back to family, and back to living as soon as possible. Our compassionate team takes the time to listen to your concerns and develop personalized treatment strategies that address your specific needs.

Visit APAC Centers for Pain Management or call us today at +1 219-575-7578 to schedule your appointment at our convenient location: 500 Legacy Plaza W, La Porte, IN 46350.

column40:
What a great Dr.  I've seen several pain doctors and Dr Khan is on the top of my list.   He actually listens and responds.  I value his opinion as he's been honest and easy to talk with.  He doesn't sugar coat the problems he sees with my spine. He also refers me to my Ortho when he feels it's necessary.
When I get the pain injections he explains what he's doing rather than just surprising you with the needle.
His staff is top notch as well.
Not many Drs earn 5 stars with me.  They have to earn it!  Thanks Dr Khan for always having my best back!|Dr. Khan is a phenomenal physician who is very knowledgeable and cares deeply about helping his patients.
This is not your typical "pain management" team. They are redefining pain control. Highly recommend.|Sick to my stomach about this.

The one star is not for Dr Khan. I really like him as a doctor, and I'm leaving this review due to his two receptionists. Michelle is one of their names. She is absolutely cold, perhaps the rudest person I've ever spoken to.

We hadn't had any problems before, as her general demeanor gives off a really nasty vibe. I understood to keep my distance/kindness upon check-in at my first appointment years ago.

There is no way to speak to anybody else at the office besides these two, and it is a nightmare literally every time.

I had to reschedule two appointments for one procedure - my ride for the procedure didn't realize they were on eastern time, and the second time was admittedly due to anxiety.

Both times I was reassured that I'd be able to reschedule the appointment without issue. I gave notice. These weren't 'no shows'.

When I went to reschedule the procecure, I received no call back for over 2 weeks, and when I called today for the 4-5th+ time, I was told I'd need to make another office visit in order to have the appointment done since I hadn't called to reschedule. I have left them countless voicemails to reschedule this thing.

Mind you, I've been seeing Dr Khan for over a year, and I have never missed an appointment outside of this. Their office is almost an hour away, and the soonest appointment was about three months away.

That has *never* been the case, and I suspect due to Michelle's tone, she wasn't trying to be helpful. It sounded like she was smiling to give me this news, and I also suspect she rarely smiles generally.

I was then abruptly discharged as a patient over the phone. It caught me off guard as the conversation had been calm (albeit patronizing) before that.

I'm not on any pain medication. I'm not a disgruntled patient who isn't getting their meds filled or what have you. I'm nearly 12 years sober from pain meds, and the reason I go to see Dr Khan is for a physical therapy prescription and epidurals.

I have had bad luck with the medical community as a whole since a very early age, and it takes quite a lot for me to trust a doctor.

Having said all of what I said, I still trust Dr. Khan. He was very kind, we had a good rapport, and I have a strong feeling he would not be happy to hear that I was discharged from his practice.

To the office: I'm willing to delete/edit this review if I'm able to speak to Dr Khan, or someone who isn't Michelle/the other younger receptionist. Otherwise, forget it.

I will be passionately, annoyingly protesting this decision as long as I'm still in pain and discharged.

Dr. Khan = 5 stars (you need new staff)
Receptionists = 0 stars (you need a new job)

Roughly balances out to: stay away from this place. I cannot fathom depending on them for anything related to medication.|Dr Khan is amazing, he fixed my husbands pain 3 years ago, but now cant get anyone to answer the phone or call back. Heaven forbid you keave more than one message. , but a big problem with office staff. They say they'll  call within 24 to 48 hours, took over 3 weeks. They didn't answer the phone, we even had a referral from another doctor. We are changing Dr's because of the rude one. I've read other reviews, others aren't happy either.|In my opinion Doctor Kahn is a wonderful Doctor. He is caring. He asses all situations. He has helped me in so many ways. His nurses are nice. Good to see they change the woman in the office because she was rude.|Doctor and staff are nice.  However they give very short reminder notices for appointments and then charge you $75 if you miss an appointment, even one time.  By short I mean less than three hours one time and less than one hour notice the second time.  I realize I am responsible for my own appointments but sometimes you get overwhelmed, especially when you're dealing with pain and things happen.  That day I was in bed, in pain, slept in and completely missed my appointment.  I was told by one member of the staff it's a "courtesy" to get the call, but that short notice isn't very "courteous" at all, and I've NEVER gone to a doctor's office of any kind before that didn't give at least a full day's notice.  Even my dog's doctor sends reminders.  It's just bad business to be treated this way.  I also heard while waiting for my turn several others call in just receiving their short notice reminders.  One person I believe said he got a five minute "courtesy" call.
Also after being charged that additional $75 I then had to wait just short of TWO HOURS for my appointment.  I should maybe give less stars, but I'm being "courteous" as well.  I mean being charged $75 in times like these for an appointment you never had really rubs you the wrong way.|Dr Khan was attentive, kind and caring. Most importantly he was able to come up with an evidence based plan that helped me get better. Highly recommended!|My office visit was on time!
This doesn't always happen at many doctor visits these days.  The staff was friendly and professional as always.
I appreciate Dr. KAHN taking time to ask questions about my pain and lifestyle and then offering suggestions on how i can expect to get the best results .

First time meeting with Dr Kundi was very easy to talk to. Have to say great dr!  The staff was also very nice & helpful. So understanding & listen to you!! When they do procedures they take their time & let you no what to expect. Makes it easier to get through. The staff are super nice as well.|everyone is so nice and polite! The staff is happy when I come through the door and call be by my middle name which I  prefer. I always recommend Dr Kundi|Great people all.   It starts with the great front desk people and at least for my experience. When you talk to the doctors they tend to listen and really try to help you. They don't just try to make you a drug addict and depending on it for the rest of your life, they work with you to get you through your issue and develop a plan to hopefully never need the drugs again. They simply seem to care|I can't say enough good things about Dr. Kundi. He is compassionate, kind and understanding. He is very gentle and has done alot to help control my pain.  He gets 5 stars however I have had problems with office staff not returning calls, relaying messages to the doc or answering the phone.|Everyone that works there is Respectful, Kind & Caring.   They always make me feel Comfortable there.  The waiting area is Clean.
I've been there many times, and Dr. Kundi always takes good care of me.  Dr. Kundi listens to me.  Dr. Kundi has given me shots in my back several different times, after tests.  Dr. Kundi is understanding.  Dr. Kundi is always Professional.  That's why I go to Dr. Kundi.|He is without a doubt extremely professional and so very very passionate in all that he does. It's always about you and your needs and I could never be under better care anywhere else. Dr Kundi is highly experienced and I highly recommend him to many others out there suffering with back pain or pain with anything at all because, HE CAN FIX IT!!! I love him and his staff. Truly wonderful people and they're all on it. They all work together to make you feel good as new. There is just so much respect and if i could give more than 5 stars, believe me, I would. I couldn't ask for a doctor with more heart or dedication in his profession. What he does for his patients who struggle every single day out there, is really indescribable. You get more than 110% with Dr Samiullah Kundi. I know I don't ever want to lose him as my doctor.|Dr Kundi is patient oriented. He gives medical options and keeps patients informed.
Dr Kundi makes sure his patients are comfortable with his diagnosis and explains the treatment plan that's understandable for current and future procedures. He is also just always looking out for his patients.|I always enjoy this practice.   I've had many different nurse practitioners and 2 different doctors yet am still pleased.  Usually when I'm forced to see a variety of medical professionals I'm bound to be unhappy,  however; after a couple of years of going here I'm still pleased.  They do listen to you, they are always in a rush, like all medical professionals,  but they will take time to listen if you ask the questions.   They're also empathetic and really try hard to find a solution to whatever you seem to be struggling with at the time.  I definitely recommend this practice and that is saying a lot coming from me!  If you visit with an open heart and positive attitude you won't be sorry.   I have had a couple issues with the front desk but mostly they are great.
