column38: Tara Brewer|Jasmin Wang|Tammie Scott|Kacie Symes|Celena Bullard|Eddie Winamac|C. R. W.|DEEDEE
column40:
On my first appointment, they said be there an hour early so I came an hour and a half early to make sure I had time to actually read the paperwork that I had to sign. My appointment was at 2 o'clock. At 1:20 the M.A. called me back, I said i wasn't finished with the paperwork. She acted pissed off. So I tried to read faster and she came back at 1:40. I said I'm so sorry but im still not quite finished. They wanted all your medical background, surgeries, medications, plus I wanted to read all of their rules and stipulations. So I finally was done at 1:50. (Remember my scheduled apt time was 2:00p.m.) So at 2 o'clock on the nose she comes out and says how much longer are you going to be because the doctor says we're going to have to reschedule you! I said, I've been done for 10 minutes. My apt was for 2. I really don't understand why you weren't wanting to give me the full time to READ and sign the paper work. Most of it I just initialed and signed without reading after the second time she came out and got angry. So, my next visit they did the EMG test and found out I have bad neuropathy in my lower extremities. Not news. I've known this for years.
The pain meds the doctor put me on the first visit I noticed I was having some itching on my back, but thought it was unrelated. So, when it was time I got my refill. Then, my face started flushing and started having hives on my back. So I told the doctor doing the test (EMG) I needed to change my medicine. She said "It's against the law for me (who's a neurologist ) to fill any medication. You'll have to wait to your appointment in 3 weeks)
Now I'm really having bad luck. The following Saturday my husband and I go out shopping and the store on the inside has a step up. I walk with a cane anyway because I have a (foot drop) so I go to step up but my damn left foot didn't make it and I fell. The footage from the store camera looks like I'm doing some kind of gymnastics move. It was so humiliating! But, let me back up a min. Earlier that day I took my remaining meds to my drugstore, I was there anyway, and put them in the box where you can safely get rid of unused meds.
So, I go to ER and I broke my ankle. I call the pain clinic and they said let's get you an earlier appt. So I go, and my doctor says I can't give you anything unless you bring back your unused medications. I said if I'd known that I'd done that. They never gave me time to read my contract.  So now I don't have anything for my broken ankle.|Horrible service! I needed a prior authorization sent to my insurance for an epidural. The problem is that my appointment took place towards the end of Dec 2024, and the prior authorization was sent to my old insurance, not my new insurance plan beginning in January 2025. A representative from my insurance company had me on the line with a front office member in the clinic to provide them with my new insurance information. Two days later, I spoke with my insurance company only to find out the new prior authorization still hasn't been submitted. Now come to think of it, half the time I call this office, I don't get a call back or any follow-up. Honestly, trying to advocate for my care is like pulling teeth with these people.|I absolutely love the people there.Dr kundi, Kat, Ashley, Mo-lo and Mallory. Very caring. Problem I have is I can't get thru their lines for assistance from the actual office. I get a call service who in turns sends a message to the office. I have a matter to speak to them about and called 7 days ago and never received a reply. It seems like my messages are never responded to since this call service took over.
Again, love the staff.|Dr. Vogel is incredible. Smart, patient, kind. Helped me with my migraines when I really needed help. I've been with her over 10 years. Indiana Neurology and Pain Center is a different story. Impossible. I provided insurance 3 times including once leaving it on a recording. My first bill arrived without insurance having been billed. No one answers the -2040 number on the bill. It's a generic voicemail box without ability to leave a message. I emailed billing on 5/17, received a link to pay on 5/20, paid my bill on 5/22. Guess what came today, 6/28? A bill that's 60 days past due. Add dysfunctional to impossible. I'm so mad that I'm leaving a great doctor over an office that is so bad!! This only scratches the surface.|I've been seeing Dr. Kundi for 2 1/2 years now at the East location. Not once have I ever had a problem with him or the staff until today. I have been calling and leaving voicemails on the nurses line for 7 days now. I had to drive there to talk with someone about not being able to get my pain medication filled due to a manufacturer issue. I called every single pharmacy in a 50 mile radius of my home to see if any of them had the amount I need to fill it. No one did. As I get there, I was left standing there at the desk and they could see I was standing there but no one would come to the desk. Finally the young lady working for the other office asked if she could help me. I explained my situation. She goes and gets a nurse. This nurse came at me with such disrespect. I'm trying to explain to her what's happening and I'm crying as I'm in severe pain and can barely stand. I told her I've been calling every day multiple times a day and left numerous voicemails. She cut me off and said that's not possible because we answer our phone and reply to the messages. I said, so basically I'm the liar then? Would you like to see my phone call log? She said to me, " get rid of your attitude or I will TERMINATE YOU FROM THIS OFFICE"!!!! I seriously had to compose myself before I lost my ish. She tells me we can't be calling pharmacies for you to find drugs for you. You need to do that. I said I have and no one has them. Then she tries to give me a script for a medicine I'm ALLERGIC TO!!! I told her I can't take that. She cops an attitude even more. Well like I said find someone who has pain medicine and we can send it over. Send what over? What medicine am I to ask for? I don't know what Dr. Kundi is willing to let me take! She just kept repeating herself. I go to sit down to call and she is still running her mouth from the window and I said I can't call if you keep talking over what I'm trying to do. She walked away and she never came back to help me. She had the guy at the front desk do it all. I can't believe they allow her to work with patients who have serious medical conditions and chronic pain. When I go to my next appointment I am filing a complaint against her and speaking with Dr. Kundi while he is destroying my lower back nerves to give me some comfort for the excruciating pain I live with. And if she ever speaks to me like I'm beneath her and she's god again or treats me inappropriately in any kind of way, I will not take it. They only reason I'm giving four stars is because everyone is is amazing and treats me fairly and humane. Dr. Kundi has been nothing but professional and caring. I love this place but I seriously despise that woman!

Edit: yesterday Mallory terminated me because she believes I'm on heroine and fentanyl plus other narcotics. If I was, I'd be dead! Never have I ever done those drugs! She wouldn't even let me tell her that one of the ladies dropped my oral swab after it was in my mouth. She said it'll be fine. Guess what it's not fine. She tried to blame it on CBD!!! I believe she's had it out for me ever since the first incident where she wanted to terminate me. 3 years I've been with Kundi, just to be treated like I'm beneath them and I'm a junkie.|Dr. Caryn Vogel is the best neurologist in the city and surrounding area! No wonder so many physicians refer patients to her.  She is so kind and knowledgeable and thorough.  She never rushes me and listens to patients. She's excellent at diagnosing what the problem is! I'm so impressed with her. She deals a lot with neurological issues and is an expert in treating migraines.  Dr Vogel will
Order appropriate tests when medically necessary ! I won't go to any other neurologist and am grateful for her!  You won't find a better neurologist in town ! Thank you Dr Vogel !|After following my doctor here, I'm totally disappointed with the service I've Received and after being hung up on by a MA unwilling to help because she didn't have the answers and is new! I requested a call from a supervisor and 2 days later no response and I'm at a critical junction in my process and I find it funny their page says their dedicated to getting their patients out of pain! If pain was my only problem I wouldn't complain and go else where but I'm dealing with a rare condition and I'm in the insurance with my specialist! If your looking for attentive staff that cares about what your saying when all your trying to do is advocate for yourself, this is not the place for you!|This office, staff and all physicians and associates are great. I just recommend asking for them to send the PA to the pharmacy and/or insurance during your appointment. But they treat you kindly and with empathy. They take time to listen to you and your concerns, and do not force procedure after procedure. They let the patients decide on what they are comfortable with doing.

column40:
Dr. Doran and all of the support staff at Goodman and Campbell are amazingly kind respectful and very skilled at what they do. I would highly recommend this particular office to anyone having difficulty with the spine. All of the procedures are done with care they explain exactly what's going on and they take them to consideration how you're feeling about everything. Overall an amazing experience.|Dr Doran and his staff are amazing!  On top of their normal procedure things, they are trying their best to get everything done by end of the year since they will no longer be in network for my insurance.  They truly care about their patients in multiple ways.  I wouldn't choose anyone else.|First, the office staff are friendly and efficient. They obviously care about each patient, individually.

Dr Doran was well prepared for me as a new patient. He had already reviewed Myspace xrays and my MRI results. He asked pointed questions to rule out other issues and offered thorough plans for my treatment. He answered all of my questions about my current neck problems and long term prognosis for my situation and my care.

Very well done.|Dr. Doran is fantastic. I have gotten several injections and always knew what was going on, as far as touches, numbing, placement and then medicine. I have never had to have sedation. He has a great rapport with the techs in the room. I would definitely recommend Dr Doran for pain management. His team and staff are all supportive and knowledgeable. My husband has seen Dr Doran, as well. He set him up with a nerve stimulator that has done away with the need for pain medication. He saves a lot of people from daily, disabling pain. 5 Stars for this practice.|Dr. Doran is always friendly and takes the time to go over everything with the patient.  I'm always anxious when I have procedures and he makes me feel comfortable.  His office staff is also friendly!|Dr Doran was great as always and staff did great too.  He lets you know everything happening first and makes sure all is good before he leaves.  His staff is always kind and helpful with all your needs.|Dr. Doran and his team, especially Jenny are so very kind, compassionate, and caring.  They put you at ease.  You leave knowing you'll get better or they'll find another route of care.  They always hit it first time with me.  I couldn't be happier, unless I never had pain.|Dr.Doran is wonderful.  I never feel a thing with back injections, painless. I never get sedated either when I get them.  He really is great. I highly recommend him.

column38: Nancy Barton|Mike & Holly Tomblin|Amanda Sutton|Michael|sharon Kramer|jamie lawson|william fowle|Amy Provancal
column40: Dr Nath is very good.  We were finished and I didn't realize it. I like her entire staff. Very personable and friendly.  No pain from injection.|She is ABSOLUTELY wonderful. Takes time with her patients. I am dealing with a very unexpected and scary outcome of a surgery and she has instilled in me this is temporary and together we will " fix" my problem. Highly recommend Dr. Nath.|I have been coming to her since 2015.  She has always worked with me and I have had no issues.  She has always made conversation and made me feel welcome.  I know when I first came to her she had been late a couple of times but she made sure she corrected that.  I would not go anywhere else and she is a valued doctor to your team.|Wonderful very professional and passionate practitioner who does wonders in alleviating lower back pain.  In addition the staff at the surgical center are very friendly and considerate!|My experience with Dr. Nath was a very pleasant one.  I was nervous about the injection on the tailbone but she assured me I would be okay.  I didn't even feel it and was surprised it was over.  I was very comfortable with her style of working with her patients.|Dr. Nath is an amazing doctor and she knows what she is doing. You are in great hands as long as you don't long term care managed by medication. I had been a patient for 10+ years. I was moved to her N.P's since injections were no longer working and I was being treated by medication. I have been on the same medications for the last 10 years or so with the doses changing here and there. I always made it to my appts., usually early. Sometimes waiting hours to be seen. I never complained because I understood she was busy. I never asked for more medication or for my medication to be changed. After my last appt, I scheduled my next appt for 3 months out as normal. I thought I put the date in my phone wrong so I called the office. For over a month, I couldn't get anyone to answer or return my call about my next scheduled appt. After a month someone finally called me back and said that the N.P was leaving and they were not filling her position. I asked if I was able to schedule my next appt with Dr. Nath then. I was told no, that she was releasing me as a patient. I wasn't given a reason why at this point. Instead of being angry or panicked, at this point, and I'm sure it sounds silly, but I was hurt. Over 10 years and I felt like I was being abandoned. That same day I received a letter in the mail saying the same thing I was told on the phone, that I was being released. In the envelope was a list of other "pain clinics" in the area. I start calling the clinics to try and get an appt and get established. Due to the high doses of medication I was on, most refused to even schedule an appt with me. The others told me they could schedule an appt, but they wouldn't be able to give me the doses I have been taking for the last so many years. I felt pretty defeated by this point and I called Dr. Naths office back and explained the situation and asked if they have any recommendations or if there was anything I could do. I was told there was absolutely nothing that they could do and the list they sent weren't their recommendations, but just other pain specialists in the area. I asked if I could speak with Dr. Nath or her nurse or even just leave a message for them. I was told no. I called every pain specialist that I could find and I found only 2 willing to see me. The first appointment was in April. The doctor was incredibly nice and wanted to help me,.but because of the doses, he could only prescribe a little less than half of what I was taking. I tried. The pain in my leg became unbearable pretty quickly. He referred me to another specialist because by this point, I couldn't even drive myself the 3 minutes it took me to drive to his office. The new specialist is also amazing. They started me on a new medication that worked better than the high dose of pain meds I was on in the first place. Now of course my insurance no longer wants to cover that medication. So here I am 9 months later and I'm still fighting just for help because I would like to be able to at least function. So while I agree that Dr. Nath truly is an amazing doctor and knows what she's doing, I guess I now feel she picks and chooses which patients matter to her. Maybe because I'm no longer getting the costly injections, maybe because LBJI thought the time I took up was better used on a patient that they could charge more, that I no longer mattered. I'm not sure. What I am sure of is this...I'm still trying to get medication sorted out and I have no idea what to do because the spinal stimulator she put in isn't working properly and I don't know how to get help with it.|I have liked Dr Nath since I was introduced to her about 4 months ago. She is helping me with the pain and the crps that I have. I enjoy her and her nurse, Andrea. Very helpful and kind.|I absolutely LOVE Dr. Nath. She is kind, caring, compassionate and never makes me feel rushed. She always makes me feel important and like her only patient at that time.  Andrea is just as wonderful. I feel blessed to have them both

column40:
Your experience here comes down to the luck of the draw. I was initially treated by Dr. Wellington, who is a prince of a man. Unfortunately, Dr. Wellington left and I feel like I've been thrown to the wolves. Some of the NPs I see are great, and others treat me like I am scum. I'm prescribed a small amount of medication and I have never called in to ask for more or claimed it was lost, yet I'm treated like an addict. I understand that the medical staff has to be careful, but you can perform due diligence and still be cordial.|I have a rare chronic pain condition. After being treated at another office, I was told they couldn't help me anymore and I was referred to Dr. Michael Dorwart. My first visit was 7 years ago, he listened, asked questions, did his own research, and he came up with a way to treat me for a long time. There is no cure for my disease, no treatment, Dr. Dorwart gave me an option to have one medication instead of 5. My pain level is around a 3-5 most of the time. He made sure I understood he couldn't relieve my pain 100%, but he could get it low enough that I could function and I can. As this disease attacks my body Dr. Dorwart is always ready to listen and to provide options for me. I hope and pray that he and I will continue to fight this disease together, I would not trade him for anything and I am extremely grateful and blessed he is my Doctor!!|I was very fortunate to have Dr Wellington as my new Pain Management Physician.
He was the best Pain Management Physician I have ever had.   He listened to my concerns.   He was very friendly and respectful.   I referred my husband to Dr Wellington .  He was extremely impressed with him.|Dr dorwart is extremely rude and assuming. He treated us terrible and I'd rather be in pain than see him! The left  bold face lie in my chart!|I love Dr.Michael Dorwart. He is an amazing doctor. He was caring and honest with me from the start in regards to my treatment for chronic pain. He has gone above and beyond in working with my insurance company which sadly is lacking and interfering with Dr.Dorwarts preferred therapy for me. Even though they were ultimately uncooperative, he kept me on as a patient and is helping me to manage my pain. He is a great physician, a nice man and a good person. His staff are always polite and I feel fortunate to be in his care.|I have been blessed to have had Dr. J Wellington as my physician at the IU pain clinic in Indianapolis since 2006.  I would recommend him to anyone that has back pain.   He is a physician that treats you with respect and takes his time to listen to you.   You're a person when you see him not a number.   I still see him on a regular basis.   I don't know where I'd be if it wasn't for him.  Sincerely, MARY FEARS|Today was my first appointment here. I saw Dr. Wellington. I was treated with kindness,  caring, concern and upmost respect. He and his staff are amazing. I couldn't be happier.|I have been seeing Dr wellington for more then 10 years he is a great Dr his staff are amazing he shows me care and concern I will say he is like family and I have nothing but true respect for him

column38: Kevin East|Crystal "Caz" Inman|Sabrina Maria Walters|Hoosier Slots|Avis Smith|Patty Lawyer|Brenda Earley|Thuy Bogart
column40:
Dr. Lee and his staff do not care about their patients. Don't take your loved ones here. They will not receive the care they need. When an elderly woman hobbles into the clinic for her appointment because she was referred there by her PCP to manage the pain she's experiencing after breaking her back whilst struggling with scoliosis, osteoporosis, rheumatoid arthritis, and Parkinson's, the response CANNOT be to do absolutely nothing and tell her to come back in month to receive a treatment she's already tried that failed in the past. No part of me believes if Dr. Lee's mother came into the clinic with a spine so contorted she could barely eat or breathe because her ribs were pressing against her organs that he'd do nothing and tell her to keep suffering for another month. When I called back begging them to show a little compassion for the patient they just saw and do something to ease her discomfort until the upcoming appointment, their response was, "Take her to the ER." This is the kind of treatment you can expect if you take your loved ones here. The entire staff should be ashamed to call themselves healthcare providers.|Dr Shaffer left me unheard at my last visit. He i believe is one of those physicians that rides your insurance provider. He is sending me for more testi.f that is unnecessary and says there's nothing wrong in my mri when.it clearly shows bulged discs, herniated discs, straightening of the spine, a tumor in my neck and degenerative disc disease.|I liked Dr Lee and his nurse Rebecca, Rebecca gets many more stars than are listed here!! It was just a short first visit, but I'm hoping that he's a very kind and compassionate doctor.  Rebecca went above and beyond to make me feel better and she was very sweet and comforting. I'll add more when i spend more time with them. I'm hoping that he's going to be super kind and helpful. I've suffered for a very long time and need doctors that truly care. There just aren't very many doctors that actually care about their patients these days. It makes me very sad. Especially when someone needs real help. Compassion is key.
UPDATE!! Two days ago Dr Lee and his kind staff, Sherry and Jessica did Nerve Blockers on both of my knees. They were extremely kind and compassionate and Dr Lee was amazing at his work!! I had several needles inserted in each knee with minimal pain and I'm happy to say I'm already almost totally pain free. After years and years of suffering with knee pain and quarterly cortisone shots, I'm so happy to report that my knees feel better than they have since longer than i can remember!! Thank you Dr Lee and staff and thank you Rebecca! I can't forget to mention sweet Rebecca. A zillion stars!!!

UPDATE!! The nerve blocker procedure worked for about a week and a half. I called on Day 7, like they asked me to, to answer a series of questions about my pain before and after the procedure... I left a voicemail and someone did call me, but I had trouble disconnecting from my Bluetooth and told them to hang on. The call got disconnected.. I waited and waited and waited for them to call back, but they didn't. I called back and left a voicemail. No one called. Finally I left a message on my portal and was called early Monday morning but I was unable to answer because I was finishing packing my husband's bags for Simon Cancer Center, he was just getting ready to leave. I am upset that the procedure didn't work. I thought Dr Lee did a great job, but he isn't overly kind at all. I really wish he was more kind. His nurses are very sweet. Which I like very much. I don't know what the next steps will be, if any. At this point, I don't really care anymore. I'm used to being in pain.|I had an appointment there today. I showed up 15 minutes early to ensure time to do paperwork. I walked in the office and stood at the check in for about 5 minutes; the whole time while my knee hurt extremely bad and it felt like someone took a knife and ran it down my leg. Finally I had to sit down. I was the only patient in that clinic for 30 minutes. Finally after that time I left. As I was pulling out of the parking lot an employee there ran out to stop me. At that point I was so frustrated and had prior engagements I had to go. Perhaps if they were more concerned doing there work this would have not happened. They knew I was there I made contact with multiple employees.|Do not go see Dr. Lee . I tried to go to pain management after having two surgeons , one from IU as well as one from St Francis , both told me I needed a fusion surgery on my L5 . Dr Lee told me I did not need surgery I needed more injections , he wanted to give me one in each one of my lumber vertebrae's . Even after telling him I tried those already. He don't care , he just wants to make money putting injections that do nothing in his patients spine THAT'S IT . I think BOTH the surgeons I saw knew  what they was talking about . Dr Lee did not . Die don't have a good bedside manner either . Office staff that checks you in , they are unprofessional as well . Horrible experience .|I see Dr. Lee. When I started going they said they will take great care of me. I get flare ups and he does nothing to help. Currently having a flare up and he wanted me to make an appointment it's 6 WEEKS OUT! said to take OTC until then. Does he not think I've done that?! So I get to spend the weekend in pain with my family while he gets to go on vacation with his and have a great time. Doesn't seem like they take great care of their patients like I was told. I don't think he cares for his patients at all!!!! STAY AWAY FROM HIM IF YOU TRULY NEED HELP!!|My experience with this pain center, they have had some good caring doctor who are Willing to help folk just live without suffering & being in pain.. Dr Kumar was kind caring doctor & so was Dr. Martinez.
The staff at these offices has always been polite.
These New doctors Seem like they don't care if you are pain. One actually told me basically to get use to being in pain. That he has seen images of spine a 80-90 yr old who should be In pain but there not. That they just adjusted to being in pain. Got used to living in pain.
It's very obvious these young doctors have never been in pain a day of there life.
I pray God opens there eyes & there hearts.|I'm writing specifically about my experience with Dr Edgar Martinez who has given me back my life. Previously I was with Dr Earl Craig who ignored my concerns to such a degree that I was bedridden for almost 2 years.

When I heard that another Pain doctor was moving to Bloomington, I jumped on it and I was not disappointed. Dr Martinez is courteous, friendly, informative and most of all sympathetic. He never pushed a pain medication on me. He informed me of options for procedures, describing in detail and answering my questions on the way. When it became clear that my condition had progressed to a point in which a second opinion was needed, he was not afraid to ask. And I'm glad he did, because it turned out that I was actually slightly overdue for a back surgery. I can walk again. I can play with my children. I can sit in a chair. None of these things could have happened without his sharp eye and deep concern for my well being.

column3:
Specialized Pain Management in Fishers, Indiana

At Central Indiana Pain, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Led by Dr. Randall J. Franiak, our practice offers a range of advanced treatment options including:

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Spinal cord stimulator implants

  • Customized pain management plans

  • Interventional procedures

We understand that chronic pain can significantly impact your quality of life, which is why we take a personalized approach to each patient's care. Our team works diligently to find effective solutions that help our patients return to their daily activities with reduced pain. Located at 10412 Allisonville Rd UNIT 100 in Fishers, we serve patients throughout central Indiana with compassionate, expert care. Visit our Central Indiana Pain Management website to learn more about our services or call us at +1 317-572-2240 to schedule your consultation.
column38: Amanda Barnhart|Linda Cassity|Leslie Jonas|Elayne Arididon|C|Beth Shadday|Tina Barnheart|Mark Bailey
column40:
I'm only giving a three at this time. I will come back and update you after the procedure. The front desk secretary was rude and unfriendly. We called early in the morning on the day of our appointment. We received two texts with different times for our appointment.  I wanted to ensure I arrived on time, so I called to ask about the appointment time. I left a message at 8 a.m.; my appointment was at 2:15. I never received a callback. The desk clerk was very rude when I asked about it in the office.
We saw the Doctor, and he was very friendly and thorough. The procedure is set for the next week. We will update after the procedure is done.|Unbelievably RUDE front desk gal! Franiak is good as a doc, but the front office gal is rude and lazy! My husband has been trying to get a pre-authorization for a very important pain med & we were just told that she doesn't have time to do them. So, she goes through some fly-by-night specialty pharmacy that doesn't need pre-auths. And, it's no wonder they don't need pre-auths, they're a scam!!! Check out Sterling Pharmacy ... they take patient money & don't send the drug or send a fake drug!
I hope this gal NEVER has a loved one in pain & is forced to deal with someone like herself! She needs to work somewhere where she doesn't have to care about people!!
Doesn't matter anyway, Franiak's closing his private practice due to inept office staff!!|EXTREMELY disappointed with whomever is responsible for returning messages.  My mother had a procedure and had complications with the antibiotic but could not get through to the office at all during regular business hours.  Several messages were left throughout the day with concerns about her reaction and need for a different prescription called in before too much time got away since she was told it was very important to take.  Does anyone check the messages?|I haven't seen Dr Franika for the last 2 yrs, I just think the world of him and his wife Melissa. He's the most tender pain doc I've ever been to. I was having epidurals and other docs hurt me doing them. I did have the stimulator surgery and it helped b4 the surgery but not after it was implanted. They controll ur life always charging them, usually daily and it took about 2 hrs. Having MRIs was very scary they have to b fully charged, and it did heat up.
I had it removed I wanted it and the wires removed, That was the most painful surgery and I've had many surgeries I was IU in Carmel spine center, I hate that place, and Dr Smucker, that was 3 yrs ago and my right leg still doesn't have feeling, it's cold all the time, and now I have major neuropathy in both feet and legs. I fall, I broke 2 toes and never even felt pain. Every nite I bathe my right foot n ICY HOT because u have severe feet and leg cramps. I never know I have icy hot. on. I was told my feeling would come back In 6 months then 12 months then 18 months, I have to hold onto somewhere, driving is very hard because it's my right leg, I lost the job I loved. SO THINK VERY LING AND HARD B4 U GET A STIMULATOR...|Dr Franiak rushed into doing a pricey procedure to have an implant placed, where the equipment alone was 50k+, not including surgery and hospital fees. Very little alternative treatment was attempted or suggested. Now, 3 years later, I haven't had to use the implant in about 2 years, I've lost 100 pounds, my device has shifted and gets caught on things, and I've been having pain with the device. I've been trying to get in for 9+ months, but no one ever answers the phone or returns my calls, which I think is on purpose. Someone messed up one day and answered the phone and scheduled me over a month out. I show up to the appointment, which I drive an hour to get to, to be told that since they don't take either of my two insurances, that Dr. Franiak won't see me unless I pay an office fee out of pocket - They won't do a follow up visit on a patient they placed a medical device in years later because they can't keep profiting off me, Dr. Franiak pocketed the 100k+ from my procedure, but are worried about an office visit fee. Apparently I lucked out because I have a device that other surgeons *might* take out because of the equipment they chose. If they made a small change or went a different route, I would be SOL, which I might still be. Dr. Franiak does not care about his patients. I wish I never trusted him.|While the Dr's. Procedures mostly produce satisfactory results, the office personnel are very very slow if at all to respond for appointments.  I have left 2 messages in 1 1/2 weeks with no response whatsoever.|I was referred to Dr. Randall Franiak a few years ago to assist me with chronic back pain.  He helped me to maintain my activities with injections for several years.  As I aged the injections were not enough to treat my symptoms  Recently, he suggested an Medtronic Neuro Stimulator implant.  I was reluctant in the beginning.  I didn't want to give in to loosing any form of control or independence.   Dr. Franiak and I discussed my options.  An appointment was scheduled to meet with someone from Medtronic.  I even called Dr. Jill Donaldson  for her thoughts since she performed spinal surgery in the past.  I opted to do the surgery for the implant.  Well,  I'm 4 weeks post surgery and I'm doing well.  I'm looking forward  to a summer that is limitless for my outside activities/hobbies.  Thank you Dr. Franiak.|I have had lower back pain for many years. I was referred to Dr. Franiak by my family doctor.
I am very pleased with the courteous and professional staff at this office.
Dr. Franiak replaced my spinal cord stimulator stimulator with a newer model and so far, I'm very pleased with the surgery.
The people here are absolutely committed to finding a solution for your pain.
I'm very satisfied with how I'm treated here and will continue to trust Dr. Franiak and his staff to care for me.

column40:
I've been going here for over 2 yrs. I've always been treated respectfully and with compassion and professionalism. The staff are friendly. Dr Feng listens to everything I saw. Even if I sit there and cry. I would go no where else.|I decided to quit going to this pain management clinic today. They gave me a letter during my last visit, saying I had rescheduled 4 appointments and 1 more, would result in me not being able to been seen again. I had 2 appointments rescheduled because of emergency eye surgery I had for a detached retina. 1 other missed because we accidentally forgot my pain meds for them to count. They said I did a no show, even though me and my wife tried to call for a straight hour and they weren't answering their phones. They made me go several days without meds as a punishment for rescheduling. The letter from them was very threatening. The yell at you for breaking certain rules, but they never tell you the rules before hand. They count your pills and treat you like a criminal even if you are just a pill off. They have you do a drug screen at every appointment and it is a very basic one that can give false positives or false  positives. I have gastroparesis and have issues absorbing meds. Entire pills pass through me sometimes. I would take my pain meds and they would not show up in a test because of it. They think they are God's gift to medicine and that you cannot know anything about your conditions. The actual doctor is a nice guy and is very professional. The nurse practitioners are extremely rude, talk down to you and they act like jerks. They all have God complexes and talk down to you. They don't respect the fact that they wouldn't get paid if you didn't come to your appointments. The nurse practitioners act like they are above you and have no qualms about doing it. This clinic is not about helping patients, they are just in it for the money. In the months I went, my meds were changed only once. They would ask what my pain levels were, I'd say 9/10, and they'd do nothing to address it. Nothing to help lower the pain or any real med changes. They are just glorified pill pushers. I call them legal drug dealers. I'm pretty sure they get some kind of incentive to prescribe certain pain meds. Avoid this clinic like the plaque as you will end up getting treated bad like I did. They have no respect for their clients and the bad treatment they give you makes any anxiety you may have worse. Do yourself a favor, and go somewhere else.|I actually give this place no stars. They dr and staff are very rude. They belittle you and act like you are someone bad. Do not send your love one here.|If I could give no stars, I would.

My husband referred to this place over a month ago because his insurance takes it, and he needs better control of his pain issues which are caused by a rare disease.

First, it was "the doctor didn't send enough records." Then it turned into "the office manager needs to review them." Waited over a month with no callbacks only to call today and speak with a snotty receptionist (believe everyone who says the staff is rude!) who said that they couldn't speak with me, his wife, despite other staff having talked with me in the past, and then we get told that the office isn't accepting new patients. They could've said THAT over a month ago so he and his PCP weren't waiting! Ridiculous!|This is absolutely the WORST office to be a patient at. The Nurse Practitioner is extremely rude. The Doctor DOESN'T listen and he will prescribe medication that people are allergic to. They treat people like addicts. The only thing they do is count pills, and send refills. They don't treat any conditions and have no clue into people with Chronic Pain Conditions & Diseases. Their attitude (including their staff) is so horrible, it instantly makes a person's anxiety go through the roof, which in turn raises their pain level. This place needs to be shut down!!! Horrible. Just Horrible!|Always professional and kind. Recommend Dr Feng highly. Has been my dr for several years after my cancer center sent me there.|The staff is great !
Problem is my GBM stage 4 in temp remission as in one month 3mm to 5mm so here I am is the pain that started as I was not told that chemo can raise shingles and it did twice almost lost my eye they set a vaccination for shingles for 600 my cost and nobody yet to help me.
It's no just OMG it's the state of Indiana as I am a living proof that this is not working.

Do I have to go to the ER will they say I am to suffer

In two years 2 times I went over as on a recording with Dr Bhave said take while on vacation a couple if needed I did I have a recording and I will play
I have four doctors only a couple talk
I think I will file suit
IMD, USM Indian medical asocial
John Logan
Killcancer.pro
Opioid's is growing need of mg increase as I was up to 6 a day then 7 one week by Dr, Fing happened when. drug
I miss the old days refills and MRIs
I will be in the worst shape anyone can after being on a drug that could have been avoided if I got the vaccine first, the pain has never gone away.
OMG
Is Not to blame they don't want a federal affiance by helping someone that made a mistake
PLEASE READ this Dr Fing and crew is not to blame.
I messed up I am human and I need a excuse they took part of my brain|8/28/22 Starting year 3 with them, Nothing but positive experiences, the few negative things that have happened even if it completely had nothing to do with them, they bent over backwards to help!!! Cannot recommend enough!

Great people doing good work, definitely worth checking out. Nothing but a  pleasant experience so far.

Edit still awesome place to be everyone there has been kind and caring and they go above and beyond what I have experienced. Thank you to all the wonderful employees doing great work.

column2: Centers for Pain Control and Vein Care
column3:
At Centers for Pain Control and Vein Care, we provide comprehensive solutions for patients suffering from painful musculoskeletal conditions and vein disorders. As a

Complete Pain Management Solution

serving Northwest Indiana, our expert physicians deliver personalized care through a multi-faceted approach. We specialize in accurately diagnosing and treating:

  • Back and joint pain

  • Uterine fibroids

  • Varicose veins and other vein disorders

Our team of highly experienced physicians takes pride in developing comprehensive treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. With convenient locations in Hobart, LaPorte, Merrillville, Munster, and Valparaiso, we make quality pain management accessible throughout the region. Our LaPorte office at 204 Legacy Plaza W serves as one of our primary hubs where we focus on identifying and addressing the underlying causes of pain and vein disease. Contact us at +1 219-476-7246 or visit our website to learn how we can help you regain comfort and mobility.
column11:
The Centers for Pain Control and Vein Care is a complete one-stop-shop for patients affected by painful musculoskeletal conditions such as back and joint pain, uterine fibroids, and vein disorders such as varicose veins. The practice has multiple convenient locations throughout Northwest Indiana in Hobart, LaPorte, Merrillville, Munster, and Valparaiso, where the expert and highly experienced team of physicians offer a multi-faceted approach to patient care.

The team focuses on accurately diagnosing the underlying causes of pain and vein disease to provide a comprehensive treatment plan personalized to every patient's unique needs.

column38: Melissa Evers|Yolanda Griffin|LaShonda Parish|Francis janiewski|Carol Ott|Andrew Sopko|Kathy Welch|Emilio Diaz
column40: The staff understood my needs and fear of being awake during a procedure , I asked to be put under and even though it wasn't a procedure that you typically would be put under for, They understood my fear and the Staff and anesthesiologist decided it would be best if I did get put under to calm my anxiety. It was a pleasant process. I didn't feel any pain .All of my anxieties were put to rest. I wasn't in any pain after the procedure and I appreciate all the staff, especially the girl who did my IV who got it in in one try. I have very rolling veins and that wasn't an issue for her. She was professional and took care of Me. Dr. Maxfield is highly qualified. He's the only doctor that I like to see there because I feel so safe in his care.. I appreciate the time that they take to make sure that you are comfortable and their staff is always professional.|I thought the Hobart location was horrible. And I actually wished I would have listened to my friend who left this clinic and went somewhere else. We had discussed a care plan that the N.P. didn't follow herself. She said she wanted to see if the injections worked and decreased my meds. Well, first, she decreased my meds, which left me in tremendous pain. I asked for her to give me back my gabapentin and muscle relaxers, she refused. Not even being  fully aware of my multiple conditions. I was scheduled for a procedure early morning. I woke up to a flat, I couldn't change the tire because I was already in pain, and it was freezing out. Even if I could I didn't have a spare or anyone to fix it because I'm not working. So, I rescheduled my appointment until my daughter could get it fixed for me. I messaged for a refill and got a generic response saying I had to wait for my appointment with my provider. I have no appointments with witch is what I messaged. I get a response full of crap talking about how I broke our treatment plan because I missed my appointment. I call b.s. our treatment plan was broken when she said it. I've been going through this mess since both my "DR.s" left. I don't want to see anyone who will cold heartedly leave their patients in tremendous pain. How do I leave a zero for care and concern.|The staff at the LaPorte location have no compassion and it shows that most of them are just there for a paycheck. Most of the doctors have a terrible attitude towards the patients and only care about the billing concerns. The doctor I seen was rude and not at all concerned about how I felt as a patient. Honestly I would not let them treat my pets. I am seeking  treatment else were, unless I can get into see NP Chelsea Dalton, she is a real doctor and cares for her patients. The others need to take lessons from her or go work at McDonald's|I was all psyched out for more additional pain. After living in a level 8 pain for so long pain is just a everyday issue. Dr.Maxfield and staff said it was going to be all right. That I would have some minor issues. So far better than before. I have noticed I still have issues trying to stay standing upright. But generally better than before|Christy Kersey was the best! All along she was very informative and explained everything to me.  Christy and the wonderful staff were so kind, and caring. I have told my friends and family how awesome they were, and I am really a hard sell.  My treatment for now is done but I would not hesitate to call them again.  Also, Thanks to Tasha Blaker for the recommendations.  Thank you all so very much for making a great change in my life!                               Sincerely Carol Ott|Everyone was so kind and worked so hard to help me get relief for my pain. Thank you seems inadequate to express my gratitude.|Loved being in the office didn't have to wait long and things were explained to me and Christy Kersey listen and seemed like she genuinely cared|Dr Maxfield has been my pain specialist who has helped me through my recovery from being paralysis. He has been the best in understanding my condition and communicating his plan to help me.

column40:
They are so nice, helpful the staff is great!! The doctor is super kind and friendly! he had a backbrace for me when I came in for my first visit he even help put it on me that was so kind of him! Doctor really easy to talk too and he listens to you about your pain! I really suggest if you need a pain management he's the one for you!|Worst clinic ever!  I have never been treated like this on the phone.  I will not defend myself for needing pain medication for a physical impairment, nor should I have to.  Everyone who is on pain medication is not seeking drugs to get high!  These people, and that includes the manager are toxic and assuming instead of compassionate and professional.  They are exactly the type of people who Should Not be in the medical business.  Which is completely how they approach patients. All business!  Instead of trying to help, they reveled in telling me what I was thinking, and why at every turn they could not assist me. From the wrong kind of  insurance to the wrong  kind of pain to actually cutting me off and accusing me of lying, they could not get me off the phone fast enough.  They finally refused to qualify me even if all the stars in the universe lined up and hung up in my face!  I feel sorry for anyone who goes to them. They most certainly will show you the door if you expect them to act professionally.|Excellent service and helped me on the first visit with relief from the pain I was in. Highly recommend this staff. A+
Edit - After going on the referral of the Dr I finally was able to get an MRI done and needed surgery. Now that I had my surgery I still am in pain and have been trying to get back in to see them and have g been able to even get an appointment scheduled for over a month. Stay away from them!|THIS ENTIRE PRACTICE IS A JOKE AND DR. DUNHAM IS AN UNSTABLE INDIVIDUAL! DO NOT TAKE YOUR LOVED ONES HERE! My father is a patient here and after a recent fall and other issues I've taken over managing things for him so I took him to his last appointment. He has been on 3 pills a day although they bumped down the dosage a while back. At this last appointment his dose was changed to 2 pills a day but the doctor did NOT inform me he made that change. So I continued giving my dad his medicine as usual. Then I noticed there were not enough pills and that's when I discovered it was changed to 2 pills. So I called the office to see why it changed and if they could give him something to get by until his next refill because he did not have enough. The woman in the office was VERY rude the entire time while insisting the doctor told us and that it's my fault for not reading the label. Which I admit I should have looked but to be honest I had no reason to look since I wasn't informed it would be changing but lesson learned. Anyways they wouldn't give him anything to get him by until his refill so his home health nurse (who is extremely sweet) called to try to get him something and she said the office lady was extremely rude to her as well. Also just to add they are knocking down his dose due to him being on oxygen but i spoke with his pulmonary doctor and he said there is no need to knock it. So today this same office lady called me to reschedule his appointment for next week from Monday to Wednesday. Well Wednesday didn't work well so she said it would then be NEXT Wednesday. I said he shouldn't have to go another week without his medicine and she again in a nasty and aggressive way asserted it was my fault he is out and if Wednesday didn't work then she could take him off the schedule  PERMANENTLY. I told her she had a bad attitude and she says "Why because you didn't read the bottle?" No because she is a disgusting person and is threatening to take an innocent person off the schedule permanently. So I called back later and another lady answered. I told her I wanted to make a complaint on the other lady AND SHE TRANSFERRED ME TO THE LADY I WAS MAKING A COMPLAINT ABOUT. So nasty lady picks up the phone and I realized it was her and said I didn't want to talk to her. She then said "Then don't call back" and hung up on me. I don't think you can get more unprofessional than this woman. Then I called the Anderson office and I spoke to the clinical director about thr situation and she said we could have the pulmonary doctor send a form explaining that his dosage is not an issue for his condition, which he did. My mother ended up having to take my dad to the appointment (they are divorced but friendly) and Dr. Dunham was looking for a fight the moment they walked in. Granted I was not there for this interaction but both of my parents have the same account of what happened and have no reason to lie. Dunham was immediately rude and condescending about the entire situation and began SCREAMING at my parents and accused them of cussing at him (which I would be absolutely shocked to see either of my parents cuss at someone, they are not that kind of people). At one point while yelling Dunham stood up and my mother was afraid he was going to physically hit her. He then kicked them out of his office and my father still is without his pain medication. After speaking with the clinical director again I discovered Dunham FALSIFIED my father's records and stated that my parents were the ones that were extremely rude and cussing at him. THIS MAN IS UNSTABLE AND SHOULD NOT BE IN HEALTHCARE! None of us have ever had any issues with a healthcare provider but after reading other reviews about this "doctor" it is no surprise we had issues with him. We will definitely be reporting him to the insurance and the board of health.|The lady's at front desk are always so cheerful & friendly. Dr. Dunham has been a blessing to me. I have arthritis in my neck & lower back, ever since I've been going there I actually have relief from pain. He listens to me & genuinely wants to see you pain free. Definitely recommend going here if you're in pain. I also love how they play KLove in the office.|They are  heaven sent for me I have had problems finding a pain management doctor willing to take my pains on. I had to have an amputation and dr Dunham is genuinely concerned and asks how I'm handling things. Most my other doctors dont.|I absolutely love the dr's and staff. Everyone is very friendly and I love that dr Dunham and dr Franklin listen to me and help me like they do.  And chiropractor in office is awesome. Dr Olsen is great.|Doctor nice but the front desk people are horrible rude inconsiderate and un professional and so would not recommend this place to anyone good luck

column3:
Specialized Pain Management Solutions in Newburgh

At Deaconess Comprehensive Pain Center, a department of Deaconess Hospital, we take the time to understand the root cause of your pain and develop personalized treatment strategies. Our dedicated team works collaboratively with each patient to break the pain cycle through comprehensive evaluation and targeted interventions. We offer a range of specialized services including:

  • Individualized pain assessments

  • Advanced interventional procedures

  • Medication management

  • Multidisciplinary treatment approaches

Our modern facility at Gateway Boulevard features short wait times, clean facilities, and convenient amenities including MyChart integration for seamless communication with our providers. We understand that living with chronic pain is challenging, which is why we're committed to providing respectful, professional care in a supportive environment. Learn more about our comprehensive pain management services at Deaconess Pain Management Services or call us at 812-842-2737 to schedule your consultation at our Newburgh location.
column11: The Deaconess Comprehensive Pain Center, a department of Deaconess Hospital, takes the time to figure out what is causing your pain and the best way to treat it. By working together, we can find solutions that work for you and break the pain cycle.

column38: Adam Matthew|T Fisher|jared schaefer|Nate Ussery|David Stover|John Young|Calvin Wilder|Laura Drennan
column40: I wanted to thank Laura for being proactive during my injury and a shortage, I appreciate you. The MTM staff are great and really helpful (Stephanie and Melissa). And I have to say Dr. Roberts has provided the best consistency of care of any office I've seen in over 30 yrs. Nobody wants to have to go to pain management, but they do the best around. Of course, there are rules that must be followed. But, and it's a big one, it's because there are a lot of laws they have to follow or they could lose their career and education. Plus youre actions could cause them problems as well if you arent acting right. If you're unhappy with the rules, call the FDA, they set limits and limited medications and cut production of meds if there is a shortage of meds. The providers here are some of the most professional if not the best practicing. Its a hard job dealing with people inpain (hard to be in pain too) and they are understanding about it. Years ago there were dozens of pm clinics, deaconess is one of the few left for a reason. Thanks to the staff, you are appreciated|I find this office to be the utmost professional.  The office is clean and the wait time is short.  There is a bathroom located within the waiting area.  The staff is kind and courteous.  MyChart makes it easy to communicate with providers by skipping phone calls.  I feel like the staff really listens and responds to needs as they come along.  I would recommend this office for all your pain management needs.  I have used them several times whether for COMP or for personal chronic pain needs.  I have been treated with absolute respect and not made to feel beneath me for getting assistance with easing my pain.  The lobby is usually empty when I attend and telehealth appts are sometimes available skipping the wait.|Dr Roberts and his staff are the best, one of the very few doctors I've ever met with that actually sat with me and truly listened to what I had to say.  He changed my life by getting me to the right people to figure out what my injury actually is.  I'm very thankful for the help he has given me.  You may have to wait a little while to get back to see him but it's well worth it, and the nurses and RN's are always helpful and friendly.|The doctor and his staff truly care about the patient's that they take care of...|Christina W. at check in, to Dr. Roberts ability to manage my pain, is first class.|Great staff. Short wait times.||

column3:
At the Center for Pain Management, we are dedicated to providing

Minimally Invasive Pain Solutions

across our three Indiana locations in Indianapolis, Lafayette, and Greenwood. Dr. Jocelyn Bush, our Board Certified Anesthesiologist and certified interventional pain management physician, brings over 15 years of specialized experience to our practice. We take pride in our multimodal approach to pain management, focusing on responsible medication management and advanced treatments like spinal cord stimulator implants. Our comprehensive services include:

  • Neuromodulation therapies

  • Peripheral nerve stimulator implants

  • Epidural steroid injections

  • Occipital nerve blocks

  • Adhesiolysis procedures

We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of life, which is why we develop personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs. Visit our Center for Pain Management website to learn more about how we can help you regain control of your life through effective pain management strategies. Located at 8805 N Meridian St Ste 100 in Indianapolis, we're committed to helping you find relief and improve your quality of life.
column11: At Center for Pain Management, our providers specialize in minimally invasive, interventional pain management. Our network of pain management clinics serves Indiana in three locations: Indianapolis, Lafayette, and Greenwood. Dr. Jocelyn Bush is Board Certified in Anesthesiology and is a certified interventional pain management physician. Her specialties are responsible medication management and spinal cord stimulator implants. She uses a multimodal approach to address patients' needs and develop the right pain management plan. With over 15 years of experience, she provides a wide range of services, including: neuromodulation, peripheral nerve stimulator implants, epidural steroid injections, occipital nerve blocks, adhesiolysis, and more.

column40:
Dr. Jocelyn Bush, MD is an amazing provider. She took the time to listen to my concerns, followed by an exam which pinpointed the problem. Dr. Bush devised a plan of treatment which resulted in minimizing the pain for longer periods of time. As someone who has lived with pain for a good portion of my adult life, I have the utmost confidence in Dr. Bush because her results are proven.|The ladies at the front desk were nice checking in....checking out terrible. She gave me another patients paperwork.  Insisted I needed  a back brace. She had the wrong patient !
I waited an hour and 1/2 to see Dr. Bush. Dr did not listen to me...rushed me, barely looked me in the eye. Dr did not explain her plan well, wanting to do injections. Dr did apologize for the wait. Dr or nurses did not have name badges. This was an issue since it was my 1st time there.|I found Dr Jocelyn Bush to be a caring and thorough doctor.  She listen to me
and made a medical decision on how to treat me based upon her assessment and her medical abilities.  Before any surgery of the back, I would totally refer you to Dr Jocelyn Bush....|HR did an awesome job in bringing Dr Bush on board
She's definitely straight forward in her field and I appreciate that in her character. Always professional with a touch of humor. Thank you Dr Bush for your continued Care in my treatment therapy|Dr. Bush is no fuss and has been fair in treating my chronic shoulder pain. Listens and gives opportunity to talk and discuss problem. Doesn't push procedures but makes you aware of what's available. Would recommend|Dr Bush is an amazing doctor. She knows what she's doing and she does a good job and I'm very glad I have her as my doctor.|Dr.Bush and her associates are wonderful. They always greet you with a smile. Dr. Bush is very knowledgeable in her field. She's the best!!|Dr. Bush is AMAZING!!! She is kind, compassionate, and tenacious about finding the source of and solutions to pain. For the first time in a long time I have hope that I'll get my life back! I'm so excited for my upcoming treatment plan and the fact she likely found the source of my debilitating pain within the first two appointments when nobody else has is a testament to her knowledge and capabilities. I truly don't understand any of these negative reviews she's received on here because she isn't anything like these people have described. Dr. Bush looks to find real and longer term solutions to pain. I can't stress this enough. Dr. Bush is doing something nobody else has been able to do for me so far, and that is getting me on the road to living, not merely existing, and I couldn't be more grateful.

column3:
At Center for Pain Management, we are dedicated to providing comprehensive, minimally invasive interventional pain management solutions across our eight Indiana locations in Avon, Carmel, Indianapolis, Evansville, Greenwood, Lafayette, Jasper, and Kokomo. Our specialized team of pain management physicians delivers personalized care using advanced techniques to address chronic pain conditions.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We offer a complete spectrum of treatments and support services including:

  • Advanced interventional procedures (spinal cord stimulators, steroid injections, intrathecal pain pump implants)

  • On-site physical therapy

  • Psychological services

  • Diagnostic imaging

Our expertise extends to treating numerous chronic pain conditions such as post laminectomy syndrome, Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS), sacroiliitis, sciatica, spondylosis, facet syndrome, and many more. With our multidisciplinary approach, we're committed to improving quality of life for patients throughout Indiana. Visit www.indypain.com to learn more about how we can help manage your pain effectively.
column11: At Center for Pain Management, our providers specialize in minimally invasive, interventional pain management. column40:
Dr. Wellington is a very good Human being he listens to you and never judges you for anything. He is there to help and listen to your issues. I've never had a doctor that didn't look down on you. The staff is also great and down to earth. Very friendly. I would recommend this place to anyone dealing with pain that has no quality of life and is completely honest with them from day one. Thank you Dr Wellington and staff.|This place and Dr. Nodine are a joke. Waited a month for my appointment. Was told to come in 30-60 minutes early, so I come in 35 minutes early and they decide they want to reschedule me for another month out. When you're dealing with pain this isn't the greatest way to help your patients. Very unprofessional. Especially when I followed your instructions.|I am very delighted to say that Dr. Joshua Wellington is a very compassionate and thorough doctor. He put my mind at ease and gave me a much clearer understanding of what was going on with my health. He took his time and answered all of my concerns about my conditions. I came into his office with a feeling of nervousness and anxiety due to my pain and concerns about my health but after our conversation I felt completely at ease. Dr. Wellington took his time and made all of worries diminish, I look forward to my next visit with him.  I highly recommend his services to whoever needs a great doctor that gives you the time and care that everyone needs. I am a very satisfied patient.|I followed Dr Wellington from Indiana University to his new location because I am so fond of him as a doctor and is a human being.  He is beyond caring and extremely interested in each individual patient.  His clinical staff is also very professional and caring.
What I have been unhappy with is the difficulty in communication with the office.  It just been almost impossible to reach a live person when it is  necessary.  It is a totally automated system, and when given the option to speak with someone in the Carmel office, you are again left to leave a message.  Often it takes days for the message to be returned.  I firmly believe that these messages are not being transferred to the doctor.  They are very much in need of a designated person to answer, triaged are being called back in a timely manner.  Once that situation is corrected, I would not hesitate for a second to recommend Dr Wellington.|Dr. Wellington is a amazing blessing to me and my family. I am so grateful that we found his care for my chronic pain. The nurses I typically see Sherry and Cindy are amazing!|I would post a 0 if i could. The patient service is terrible. You cannot get ahold of anyone. You must leave message and no one calls you back. This has happened twice . It took 3 weeks the first time and i am still dealing since 5/17 requesting by the hour to please call me. I have an urgent request regarding my pain pump. I cannot get the test that my neurosurgeon has requested, Until someone calls me back.

Love Dr Wellington, love his support staff. But would not recommend anyone seeing him because of lack of support for the patient's  from the office.|Dr. Wellington is the best Dr. Whose ever taken care of me. His willingness to listen without interrupting makes him easy to talk to. His knowledge about the best treatments for pain and ability to explain in English to patients is amazing. I have a much better Quality of life since Dr Wellington took over my care.|I've been a patient of Dr. Wellington's for several years and recently began seeing him at Center for Pain Management. I never would have thought that I could have a better experience; however, his superb staff and the warm atmosphere of the Carmel office exceeded my expectations by far.  Dr. Wellington and his team not only provide exceptional medical care but do so with unmatched compassion, attentiveness, and true patient focused medicine.

column40:
Dr Adams is one of the only Dr's left, in my opinion,  that cares more about his patients than some big insurance company opinion or pharma "pizza party". I know I can always trust what he says and feel confident in his decisions.|I was extremely pleased with Dr. Brian Adams.  He really seems to care about resolving some of these pain issues I have had for a long time.  He is very personable and speaks in terms that I can understand.  He doesn't seem to mind being asked a lot of questions about the procedures I need to undergo.  He even suggested another place to take my MRI since SIRA was going to take a month to get me an appointment.  I was able to get my MRI in just a few days instead.  He seems to have a plan and not just throwing things at the wall to see if they stick.  I am very grateful I found him!|Dr. Adams is a great doctor he's trying his best to get me together with all this pain I have going on with my back. In January I know he will get me halfway mobile with my back so I can walk more. I appreciate the staff so polite and smiles when you walk in.|Dr Adams
I've had around 15 cortisone shots in my spine and absolutely the best one I've ever had. Let's just say I've had some pretty horrible experiences with these cortisone shots and some other doctors they seem to not care and just shove the medicine in not with Dr Adams. Thanks for being gentle with me I appreciate it|Dr. Adams was very thorough.  He carefully went over imaging with me.  He was patient and unhurried when discussing my pain and options.  I called back to ask about a prescription, and he personally called me back to discuss it with me. Before I was called back to the examination room, I had the opportunity to watch Dr. Adams interact with front desk questions. He was also kind and patient with the support staff's questions.  Watching him interact with them and also two sales reps who interrupted his day gave me yet another positive impression. I was very impressed with Dr. Adams and would recommend him to anyone.|Wonderful experience. Staff and Dr. Adams are exceptionally kind and professional, and took time to listen to my concerns and pursue solutions.  A welcome change and enthusiasm to the Columbus area!|Dr. Adams was very quick in diagnosing me with Complex Regional Pain Syndrome!  He also realized the sooner treatment was started, the quicker the CRPS can be broken and the pain relieved.|Dr Adams and the entire team are always helpful, courteous and focused on providing me the best possible care. I thoroughly recommend them.

column38: KellyJo Hepner|Laura Hess|April (Aprilanna)|Donna Bannister|Ted McGraff|Brent Nichols|David Horne|Kim Payne
column40: I've been a patient of Dr. Murphy's for 10 yrs now. He is one of the most compassionate Dr's I've ever had. He takes his time with you and listens closely to your individual medical needs and will try different options that may help you. He's not an assembly line Dr. that treats all patients the same. You are truely an individual with Dr. Murphy. He has helped me get my quality of life back and for that I am very thankful!|Dr. Murphy is wonderful, caring, and knowledgeable. His staff is another matter. They won't return phone calls, they won't send your pharmacy prescription refills, and they don't do reminder calls because they "have too many patients". However, their paperwork that patients are required to fill out states that they do provide reminder calls as a courtesy.  I've never been to any medical provider that didn't do appointment reminder calls. And the receptionist could have easily made twenty reminder calls instead of running her mouth in the two hours past my appointment time that I waited to see Dr. Murphy. I gave up after two hours and left and will never return, nor because of him but his staff.|I have been a patient of Dr. Murphy since 2001.  He has truly helped me with my chronic pain (back issues and neuropathy).  I like him so much because he is open to natural ways of healing.  He treats you like family and truly cares!  He is a brilliant doctor and I am so glad my neurologist referred me to him so many years ago.|Dr. Murphy Is a the best at his job and keeps me pain free with No drugs. I have been going to him for more then ten years. Thank you for being the best at your job.|Murphy Pain Center is slowly killing my wife. They keep pumping Fentanyl and others that I do not know about in her.Why have they not noticed that she only weighs 89 pounds.She should weigh 110-115 pounds I have to force her to eat. She is constantly in LA LA Land and is a danger to herself and others. She has been involved in several car accidents, fortunately none were serious. If she dies, I will hold Murphy completely responsible. This has gone on for years. I was always curious why they closed their practices in Louisville, Ky and moved everything to Indiana. Now I know. They could not keep giving all these drugs in Kentucky because of laws regulating these substances. If you are a Junkie, then Murphy Pain Center is the place for you.|Worst most unethical doctor around in southern Indiana. He makes you sign a contract that says you will notify him of other doctors that may prescribe narcotics to you and when you do tell him he still will say you voided his contract and tell every other doctor you try to go to the same when you told him the truth and even had a prescription. He is a heartless pig that cares about nothing. The Nurse practitioner Karen however is the best and should go out on her own.|Dr Murphy & staff has always been there for me. Took care of me when dealing with cancer 2 yrs ago. Went above & beyond. Staff called me to check on me several times. When I see him he takes his time & listens. I like him.|I first started seeing dr murphy over 20 years ago. Never failed a random drug test or pill count. Dr Murphy used to fight for humans to have the right to live pain free. Wow has that ever changed slowly over the years. Cut off of 1 of my medications in the middle of going thru stage 4 bladder cancer. I went thru having my bladder removed and came home with nothing for that pain because other drs won't write scripts when you have 1 doing it. But he refused. Then I was told I could no longer be a patient because they moved to Indiana and I lived in Ky. Went thru getting records transferred but asked for 1 more apt to last till my new apt. But told by Karen that I could stay. So I stayed with what i knew. Went a month later,  Where I was told self pay only. No longer would he file insurance. Which also means you pay full price for meds and drug tests. New year and new surprises. I go in and told they want to do a mouth swab, ok fine. The girl kept redoing it over & over. Said it wasn't working. Finally after leaving most of the swab broke up in my mouth she said ok. A week later I get called saying I failed & need to drive another hour away, couldn't do it near my home, to Bradstown for a 2nd test. I can't afford to pay out anymore. Explained that I am stretched with no pay this month due to disability and can show that. As well as my mother in stage 4 kidney failure at this time and I'm just not paying anymore. After 20 years of not even a shadow on my record this is how you do a patient. Dropped. Nothing but another bill for the past month that I was never seen. I can't even begin to describe how pissed off, let down and hurt that I am. And you wonder why people are doing the things their doing. It's in desperation of a dr playing god. Who knows me better than this. I'm made to feel like a criminal over a medication I never asked for or wanted but was talked into 24 years ago. Karen is wonderful, can't say enough good things bout her. Do like Michael and get out. Now I'm unable to get an appointment with any pain Mgt dr.  To live without pain is a basic human right. I wouldn't wish this on anyone.

column3:
Specialized Pain Management in Carmel, Indiana

At Indiana Spine Group, Dr. Robert D. Funk and our dedicated team provide comprehensive pain management solutions for patients throughout the Indianapolis area. We specialize in treating various spinal and chronic pain conditions using advanced interventional techniques. Our services include:

  • Spinal injections for targeted pain relief

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations and personalized treatment plans

Dr funk spent 5 minutes with me before jumping to needing an Injection that did nothing to help. He then said he can't help me and I needed to go see someone he would put in a referral for. Dr. Funk is down to earth and made my experience less intense.  He talked me through every step, preparing me for what was coming.  I appreciate that.  I look forward to being pain-free eventually!
Thank you for your service.|Excellent customer service from all. Dr. Funk listened to my concerns. He was very caring. Looking forward to him finding a solution. This was my first visit.|Will refuse to speak with you. Especially if it's for an IME and after leaving the visit he said I could call back if I had any questions. Really helped me with understanding my situation and all the staff there is amazing!!!!|Great..I had an injection yesterday..This the 1st day I have not woken up with a numb arm and hand..|I was referred to Dr. Funk by Dr. B. Boody (amazing surgeon). Dr. Funk is very knowledgeable and talked me through the injections. Unfortunately they did no good for me and I had to have a spinal fusion. This was by no means his fault. It is just one of those things that are out of the control of any doctor. Dr. Funk has great bedside manners and answers all your question. Even though Dr. Boody gave him very detailed information Dr. Funk still looked over my MRI very carefully. I will again be seeing Dr. Funk for pain management as another surgery is not what I want nor is it something Dr. Boody thinks is needed at this point. I am very hopeful that Dr. Funk will be able to give me some refile that is not from steroids. I look forward to working with Dr Funk. Side note he is also very funny. Reminds me of the ortho surgeon from Grays Dr. Link.|Dr. Funk does an amazing job on my injections.  I feel so much better again.  10 Minutes on the injection table and walk out feeling 10 yrs younger.
