My husband just left a review. He really loved going to Dr Biglar until a new employee came on board. I was standing beside him when someone called saying he was being dismissed. A 75 yr old man cold turkey. Thank you. Also they asked about upcoming injections and my husband said "will they cancel those too?" And the person hung up on him. What? A letter said he was "very angry" on the phone. He wasn't angry, he was in shock. Anyone that knows my husband knows he's very laid back and being married over 25 years I'm a pretty good judge of his character. I understand you doing what you need to do but please don't lie and hang up on people when you just ripped their quality of life away.|I was just fired from Dr. Bigler's office saying that I have been taking my pain meds too much. I have been on pain meds for over 13 years due to a broken back. His Nurse Harmony Stein is not a nice person. All she wants to do is get people off of pain meds. She shut me down with no refills. She is on the wrong profession.|Only giving 1 star so I can write review,  all this place does is push opiodes,  I did everything they asked so I could get off meds and get pain pump or TENS unit,  but Dr. Bigler said " I just don't feel you are ready". That was after the fact I had to drive 2 hours to psychologist (which by the way insurance didn't cover so I'm stuck paying $300-$400 out of pocket for), Dr. Bigler stated " let's do injections, the surgical center will waive cost of sedation", this is the 6th time he has canceled injection ( have proof of all canceled injections) with little to no notice. Try to bring up thoughts and concerns about costs of meds,  about meds not working and get dismissed.  Never feel wanted,  heard of validated. I came to them from previous IU pain management( Dr. Llyod office the best, only left for better pain control without opiodes) bc I didn't want to take opiodes,  but did it here to move forward,  but got me no where then they want to drug test ($90 after insurance),$35 co-pay, then only pharmacy in area that will fill them chargers arm & leg bc they from upon so many opiodes for long term.  I am no longer returning so of course they cancel all meds,  BUT they shouldn't have canceled the 2 meds that I was on before I came to Bigler's office.  So cold turkey should be a great way to end the worst experience, in the worst pain management ever!!!!!
UPDATE: Called number below to discuss issues and get no answer typical blah blah blah recording leave name, number, issue your calling about and we will get back with you!! What a joke!!|Dr. Bigler was a physician for my father Steven Burchfield. My father had absolutely nothing but wonderful things to say about Dr. Bigler and if you knew my daddy and all the pain he was in physically due to so many injuries, Parkinsons also dealing with Cancer to find a Dr. That he can crack jokes with and talk to comfortably; that's saying something! My daddy has passed six years ago now and told me then if there were ever a time I needed to see a pain management physician that I should definitely seek out Dr. Bigler. I have tried but to no avail only get an answering service and no returned calls. Regardless,  I am thankful my daddy found a physician he truly liked, that could help him in the final months before he passed away. Thank you Dr. Bigler and God Bless you.
Tammy Troxel Burch|Dr Bigler has been so awesome . His care is amazing . His care team is just as awesome. Ive never had a Dr to walk me to the desk to schedule your next appointment , but he does. He's very caring when it comes to your pain. I made it clear I did not want any narcotics and he respected my wishes and found treatments so much more affective.. The burning injections has helped so much . I can't say enough about this Dr and his team other than you all are absoulty amazing. Thank you for having me as a patient..|Dr Bigler allows you to feel safe and secure, and has a wonderful since of humor that makes you laugh and feel comfortable.  His entire staff is very professional, very attentive and very, caring!|This is the only Doctor I have ever had to joke around and make me feel comfortable while getting an injection! Not only that, he literally walked me to the front desk to make another appointment... the injection was amazing.. some people had me worried about how bad it would hurt BUT I felt hardly anything.. I have to say, with the type of work he does and the pain that should be involved, I had very little... I would refer him to others def! He is a great pain doctor as well as very pleasant to talk to.. thank you for easing my back pain..|Dr Bigler and his nurse are wonderful and kind/caring people with outstanding empathy for their patients. So blessed to be in their care, and know that they truly want me to get better.

column40:
Dr. Shukla did an excellent job in my neck-pain injection procedure. Before we went back into surgery, he explained in detail what our two choices of approach were and decided which would be most beneficial. Because I was awake, he also warned me when something might hurt. When I had a complication of blood pressure dropping during procedure, whole team was quick to respond and attentive with care back in the exam room. I would go to him again if I needed more pain-relief injections. My main concern was that I had no information before going to the procedure, about what was involved: that it was more than a "shot",  that I'd get an I.V., that you might want full sedation, that you might want to bring someone with you. It seems people are usually sent this information, but I did not. Those would have been factors in whether I'd get something done, especially if you can't be sure it will work.|I have been seeing Dr Shukla for several years.  I have low back pain L4 & L5  causing sciatica.
Approximately every 5-6 months I see Dr Shukla and he injects a steroid into the nerves that transmits the pain.  Within 24 hours I have complete relief.  I have told many people how great he is, I can't say enough great things about him.|he is the worst doctor, I went to him for the procedure called coolief, there was nothing cool about it, he burned my lower spine area, in two places. he could have cared less, it is all my fault of course. no water cooling, as explained, no pain reducing medication, offered but not received, no nothing, except burning like a clothing iron. if people give this doctor high marks, see relatives, it is fake. Kent Adsit|Dr. Shukla, is a great positive god fearing man. Hands of God!

column38: Cassie Becker|Russell Ricks|Sarah Owen|Lorinda Benson-Lyons|Jayne Farber|Joseph Smith|Robert Grays|Matt Ferguson
column40: I left another spine group and came to ISG with the recommendation to see Dr. Gentile. When I described my pain & symptoms, he wanted to do an MRI right away and was able to quickly get it scheduled. I was thankful a Dr. was finally taking me seriously. He was patient with me and listened to all of my concerns. We went over my MRI together and he showed it to me on the computer. My disc herniation was massive. He encouraged me, but never pushed me, to schedule an ESI. Honestly, I should've listened to him and gotten the ESI scheduled sooner. I waited a week and was in a lot of pain. He was very professional and kind while he administered the ESI and made me feel comfortable and safe. Sadly, the ESI only helped me for a few days, but he was able to quickly refer me to a surgeon that was able to meet with me fairly quickly and complete surgery. I'm feeling MUCH better now thanks to ISG!|I have seen Dr. Gentile numerous times. What a great doctor! He is genuinely committed to helping his patience and improving their condition. He is also easy to talk to and explains everything very clearly. A good, kind, and caring man. I highly recommend him and Dr. Riley.|Very professional group. Dr. Gentile tool his time speaking with me and made sure I understood what was going to happen with the procedure.  On what could have been a very tense situation everyone made me feel comfortable and confident.|He put me at ease and explained as he went. He did a selective nerve injection, so I had to be awake. All previous injections were done with conscious sedation. If I have to ever have another injection, I don't know if I need to ask for sedation.|Dr. Gentile spent quality time prior to the injection, explaining all the details of what the injection experience would be like.  I was especially interested in the anatomy and physiology of the procedure, and Dr. Gentile was thorough and patient as he explained the details.  I also greatly appreciated Gentile's running narrative as the procedure itself progressed.  Understanding what sensations I would be experiencing, as well as the pain levels to be expected during the procedure was very, very helpful to me.  Thank you to both Dr. Gentile and his assistant.  Their "bed-side" demeanor was excellent and Gentile's level of professional expertise was exceptional.  Kudos!|Outstanding results from procedure. Dr Gentile is very informative prior, during and after the procedure. Immediate pain relief. Knowing this is only short-term relief, Dr Gentile went the extra step to provide a referral for the next step, when the time comes. Excellent patient care. Can't thank him enough!|I've seen Dr.Gentile for the past 12 years. He has always put my health and getting me better a priority! I highly recommend him if you're having issues with pain management. Thank you again!|Everyone on staff has always been very professional and courteous. I think they are the gold standard for how all offices should be run. And Dr. Gentile is top quality.

column40:
I was very happy with my visit to see Dr Patel concerning back pain.  I first saw the Nurse, then PA and finished with the doctor.  All were very informative and discussed options for a variety of different ways to get me back to walking with less/no pain.  I have opted to go with the MILD procedure which my hubby had about 6 weeks ago and has seen improvement.  Entire staff was pleasant to work with.  I was treated like part of the family.|The doctor seemed a little indecisive and had to base all of his decisions on what the insurance company wanted. Seemed like he was more worried about the insurance company than me. I'm unsure if I will continue treatment at this doctor. Unfortunately most doctors seem so willing to give up and bow down to the insurance companies.|When I first visited this office in December, I was told that they did not issue pain meds to new patients until a urinalysis was returned.  I had been on both morphine, and methadone from my pain management physician in Florida, but my relocation to Indiana in late November eliminated that treatment regimen. I had experienced 5 back surgeries and experienced a significant continuation of pain. My followup appointment was scheduled for mid-January, but a stretch of bad weather changed that appointment to a telehealth appointment. The appointment was with one of the doctor's physician assistants. Before hanging up, I asked about pain meds. At my first appointment, a new MRI was ordered, which took place about a week prior to the telehealth appointment. The answer to my question concerning pain medication was "we want to wait until we receive an evaluation from a neurosurgeon." They gave me the name of a neurosurgeon, but not his address or phone number. At my next PCP appointment, I expressed my displeasure with the "pain" clinic to my PCP. He told me that if I was dissatisfied with APAC, they would refer me to a different pain management physician. An appointment was made for me, not at a different pain clinic as I expected, but with a different neurosurgeon in Crown Point. I went to the appointment with the neurosurgeon in Crown Point, and took along a copy of the MRI written report, as well as the DVD that I was given by the imaging center. The remarks by the surgeon drew me aback: he showed me on the DVD the area at L2/3. The nerve root at this level was so compressed that it didn't even show up on the MRI. (His remark.) He recommended immediate surgery, which would add another fusion, my third, this time at L2/3. I left that appointment with a sense of shock.
At my next PCP appointment, I told of the appointment with the neurosurgeon. My PCP recommended that I have the surgery ASAP, as it was quite possible that the condition could result in my waking up one day completely paralyzed. It has been my intention to return to Florida once finances permit it. My PCP told me NOT to even try to ride that far without having the surgery FIRST. By this time, it was mid April. I decided to give ACAP one more chance. Heck, with the PROOF of the MRI, and the report from the neurosurgeon of my choice, how could they possibly refuse to get me the pain meds that I OBVIOUSLY need? The appointment was scheduled for May 3. I called the neurosurgeon's office, asking them to send a copy of the doctor's report to the APAC office in Dyer, Indiana. I was promised that the report would be faxed immediately.
The May 3 appointment arrived. I was confident that I would leave that appointment with the scripts for the pain medication(s) that I obviously needed. I was once again paired with a physician's assistant, although the doctor was in the office that day. After the initial pleasantries, I told the PA why I had not returned sooner. It was because I felt that I had been LIED to over the timing of pain medication being prescribed. Not much was said about this "lie". I then asked about their opinion of the report by my neurosurgeon. THEY CLAIMED TO HAVE NOT RECEIVED IT. An attempt to reach that doctor's office was supposedly made, but by this time, it was after 4pm on a Friday, and it was said that they could not reach them because the office was closed. I asked if their office had received a copy of the MRI films and report. I was told "YES". I replied, " then you KNOW, based upon the MRI, that it's OBVIOUS that I'm in pain!" I once again asked about prescribing pain meds for me. The reply to me was such that I thought it to be TOTALLY INCREDULOUS. The response was "we don't want to mask your symptoms". WHAT IN THE HELL ARE PAIN MEDS INTENDED TO BE FOR????
I stomped the best I could, since I use a stand-up 4 wheeled walker, out of their office, stating "YOU'LL NEVER SEE ME AGAIN!!"
This narrative spells out my experience with the APAC Centers for Pain Control office in Dyer, Indiana.|I have been a patient at APAC since 2009 and have always had a positive experience. The staff is efficient and friendly. There have been several changes in staff, including the physicians, and I have been impressed with the way changes were handled. Every effort was always taken to make sure my issues were addressed. When a schedule change was necessary I was able to make the change with very little wait time.|The best decision I made was to see Dr. Patel...after testing and evaluations, I was given a new lease on life via a nerve stimulator.  I should have gone years ago!   If you are in unbearable pain, I recommend him and his office!!|I've been going to see Dr. Patel for a long time, he has taken care of me . He is always so nice and explains everything that he's going to do to me. He very gentle and makes sure I'm comfortable when he has to give me an injection in my back, neck or any other part of my body. I would recommend him to everyone I know he's a Great doctor...

Sandra Hernandez|I have been with Dr Patel for many years.  I have recommended him to friends and strangers.  A doctor that cares for his patients and listens to come up with the best treatments available.|Dr. Patel really listened to my concerns. He took time to listen to me and worked out a treatment plan that will help me. He acknowledged things wrong that several other doctors ignored.  He and his staff have an amazing bed side manner.

column40:
Dr. Ferrell is absolutely amazing. She comes into the room like a breath of fresh air - always bubbly and happy. Amazing bedside manner, relatable and friendly. She takes her time, you never feel like you're being rushed -- which is rare nowadays in healthcare.
Her staff members are always patient, friendly and helpful.
Without going into detail, I'll just say Dr. Ferrell changed my life. I have a quality of life I haven't had in many years, thanks to her knowledge and skill.
I HIGHLY recommend her.|Always pleasant environment at every visit. Dr Ferrell shows she is really concerned about my health and treatment for pain relief.|I've been seeing Dr. Ferrell for many years. She literally saved me from a shaddy doctor. The doctor she filled in for required that you get injections if you wanted pain meds. Didn't matter if they helped you or not. He wouldn't listen when I told him the injections cause more pain because I have fibro. He had long waits & a rude staff. I sat in his office one time for 6 hours because I upset his staff when I asked how much longer the wait would be. After 2 years, Dr. Ferrell covered his patients one day & that was the day she saw me. She was my blessing. She reviewed my chart & told me injections don't help when you have fibro. I told her I've been saying that & they ignore me. I became a patient of Ferrell's that day. Later, that other doctor was arrested & lost his license for using pain pills to get things he wanted from patients. Dr. Ferrell has helped me so much over the years & I'm truly grateful. Her nurse assistant is amazing too. She works just as hard to help people as Ferrell does. The office staff is so polite and professional every single time I interact with them.|I love her! She listens and explains things in a way that is easy to understand. She works with me to get more mobility and ease my pain.|She's a great Pain Mgmt Specialist! I have been going to her around 10yrs. She's caring, kind and very concerned about my needs for my for my pain which is high! Her entire staff are kind, thoughtful, caring, and understand what I'm going through! I would never change to another pain management specialist!|Dr. Ferrell is a godsend! She is smart and listens, she has a great personality. Cynthia and staff are great too! I thank God for Dr. Ferrell and u will too! I truly would not be here if it wasn't for her!|I was referred to Dr. Ferrell by my primary care doctor to get a 2nd opinion after a different spine doctor tried 2 failed nerve root injections and said there was nothing more they could do for me. Dr. Ferrell took a look at my MRI results and said she felt I would benefit from an epidural injection, which is exactly what I suggested to the previous doctor I had seen and was told it wouldn't help. Turns out she was right, and the epidural has been the only thing that has truly given me some relief from my constant nerve pain. I'm beyond thankful for Dr. Ferrell and her team!|The best of the best.  Truly cares about her clients.  Honest and Truthful, she goes beyond the call of duty to make sure you feel good about where you are with your health.  Gives you a plan and makes sure you follow it, and all the rules.  God Bless Dr Farrell...you will love her.

column40:
I have been going to Dr.Khan for 16 years. I will say when I first went. I didn't like him much. But, I thought maybe I'm just not thinking right. I was in a lot of pain, you know the kind didn't know if I want to cry or be mad!! The second time was awesome. Got in and he looked a my M.R.I. Let me know what I needed for care. It was 2 to 3 days later I was walking again. And only had to go about every 9 months for a shot if needed. I still will not go to anyone else. I have seen other docters because I had moved. What a joke that was. So I'm going to continue with the best and the heck with the rest. Thank you to all Dr. Khan, Mary,Bobby, Julie who has been there from day one. Thank you all so much for my  GREAT CARE!|Idiosyncratic. Got here at 11:15 and we're still waiting, now it's 2pm. Got called back and then doctors and nurses decided to take a LUNCH BREAK! Absolutely unacceptable and unprofessional. I would find a different doctor if I were you.|Excellent physician, excellent nurses and staff! I always feel anxious before injections and the nurses are so inviting and friendly and really truly know you, and that anxiety just melts away! They are such a busy clinic, and they still take the time to let you know you are valued and heard! I truly feel blessed that I became a patient here and refer Dr Kahn to anyone who I share my pain story with!|Dr Mansoor Khan, his nurses, and staff are the best. Super friendly and I don't feel anything during my injections. If you had a bad experience somewhere else, you need to call him. GOD BLESS y'all who work with him.|I don't know why there would be any bad reviews on here. I have been to another pain doctor here in Evansville with absolutely no bedside manner, so I love Dr. Kahn and he doesn't just automatically sedate me for injections because I don't need it he just sprays the freezing spray on gives me the injection and I am good to go unless I want sedation then he will. His staff is very nice and helpful. I love them all and would recommend anyone in fact I am recommending my mom to go to him.
Thank you
Dr. Kahn and Staff|The last two visits i had were the most unprofessional i have ever experienced. After 2 hours of waiting, i came out of the room to ask what was going on. The poor lady had to tell me that he wasn't there. He was in a meeting. She had no idea how long he would be. I am finding another doctor. Apparently his expansion meetings are more important than his patients!|Not a fan. They tried to take me for a procedure that I was not comfortable with and with no explanation of what it was or what was about to happen. Next thing I knew they were going to sedate me! It has been an absolute joke dealing with Indiana Spine and Pain Institute. Not to mention, majority of the nurses are not friendly whatsoever. I would not recommend this place to anyone.|I work for a clinic and am referring (trying to) a pt, How is it when trying to find a good number, I see this doc giving himself the best quality of life from his injections? Hmm

column38: Scott Reneer|Trisha Spears|Pamela|Debora Harmon|Mindi Hutchinson-Hough|Rachael Phillips|Miztevens|Karen Johnson
column40:
Bailey and Joseph Edward's are  great to work with at the Marion office,my compliments! Other than that phone in to  office is very very frustrating.  I found it so much easier to show up at the office other then get the run around, I have to travel aways for this.   Also NP Zachary may have been a good NP if I had had seen him originally.  I found it odd I had to go over my intire situation when at my last visit. Because I travel aways for these appointments and would be nicer if I had the same NP familiar with my case..... just saying.|On my first visit it was NP Edward's and he was wonderful. The second visit I seen I don't know some Zachary person. Everything that was discussed with Mr Edward's the Zachary person basically called me a liar. Third visit the Zachary person basically said I was off on 1 or 2 of my meds he basically made me feel like a drug addict. Told me they couldn't help me any longer and cut me loose. I am a 60 year old grandma. Not some 20 year old seaker. I have psoriatic arthritis and have had for years. I would not recommend this place because the Zachary guy will make you feel like crap.|I had my first appointment with this facility and it was wonderful. I could not have asked for a better experience. The staff was great and everyone listened to what I had to say.|I would highly suggest that patients keep an eye their blood work.
I question the nurse practitioner why they did not advise me that my creatine levels were dangerously low Which indicated I was in early signs of kidney failure They were negligent in not Telling me or notifying my primary care doctor So by questioning there negligence they dismiss me as a patient. But little did they know my primary spoke with me the week before stating that they did not want me to be seen at summit pain management any further and I had already seeked out another office.  They also break the new state rules on opiate prescribing. Only one Medical physician is to Prescribe a Patient opiate pain medicine. And I have had 3 or 4 people from summit pain management which  is against the rules. That Right there my pharmacy brought to my attention.
Always be your own advocate and don't be afraid to question them. I'm sure they'll be under investigation.|They listen, they are kind, and they care. They have helped me more than any other doctor and helped solve some medical issues that were being ignored by other doctors. I can't thank them enough.|They act kind, caring, and understanding. They say they will work with you to provide the best care possible. But then you express having problems with the micro dose of meds not being enough, and you just get treated like an addict. This place was my last hope. I know now that doctors don't care about chronic pain patients at all. Their idea of working with you is to dictate to you everything and then expect you to meekly go along. They say to call if you are in unbearable pain, but then you do and they just tell you they will talk about it at the next appointment. I really thought I had found a place willing to work with me enough to get me back to work. Sadly, I was wrong and I feel beyond discouraged.|I finally was scheduled to see Dr. Roth after going to Summit pain management in Marion for about 10 months. During this time, I saw a different nurse practitioner every appointment, many times causing me to have to start at the beginning to explain what was going on with me. When I finally got to see the doctor, I was very impressed with him, but communication with the office is a nightmare. He wanted to see me again in 4 weeks, but the office made the appointment in 5, and then called after 2 weeks to cancel THAT one and put it off another month after that, even though I tried to explain this was the doctor's recommendation. (After 10 months of waiting to see him in the first place). During these first months, I found they do not return calls, and they "dropped the ball" several times with my treatment, causing 3-4 week delays with tests and treatment that my insurance required. Twice they blamed the insurance for dropped communication that was obviously their fault. This doesn't sound like a big deal, unless you consider this is " pain management". I was in chronic pain, which was severe at times, so an extra 3-4 weeks waiting with each unnecessary delay caused me needless suffering. After seeing how inefficient they are, I chose not to let them prescribe narcotics for me. This was a wise choice, because after all these months, I would surely be dependent on them by now, one more problem to add to my list. I was told by one nurse practitioner that I did not need to go to a specialist because I "didn't need surgery". I could not stand the pain any more, so I made an appointment through my GP and went ANYWAY. I was told by the specialist, after all these months, that surgery was the ONLY thing that would help me.  In addition, it was bad enough NO insurance would have made me "jump through the hoops" that pain management told me that I needed to do.  If you need pain management, there has got to be a better choice than Summit!|DR. Roth comes across as a very understanding and caring person. You see him the first time and then you are only seen by one of his assistants.  He has 3 "phone nurse's. 2 out of 3 are caring. However- 1 bad apple can spoil an entire practice.  You voice your concerns about how rude and unprofessional is and you will receive a letter on plain white paper, no business letter head , stating they will "no longer be a provider " for you ,due to "a breakdown in communication".  It does not say who drafted the letter. It also states you "can not be on any company property. Tried to express concerns to office mgt. And, was angrily defensive about the complaint I made about 1 of the phone nurse's.
Dr. Roth promised to take over my pain control after a surgery I had. Instead- he left me to handle it through my surgeon, after the 2 of them discussed follow up care after surgery. My surgeon could not get him to contact him back. I was left to taper off the Fentanyl patch on my own. I was on 75 mg, then this problem happened. I was told all my future appointments were canceled and there would be 1 prescription for 50mg to taper off with.  But yet had no problem writing prescriptions for 2 other powerful pain pills.  Which went to waste because of the side effects I had from trying to take them.  I dont think he has any clue as to what is going on in his office.  Try calling his office and see the difficulty there is to even get through to talk to someone!   So, if you want someone to bail out on you at the last minute it, he's the guy to go to.  However, there are avenues. I am going to bring this kind of information to light.

column40:
I'm currently sitting in the office. I've been here for exactly 1hr 20 minutes! I'm just here for a simple follow up. The reason I didn't give 1 star is because I like Dr. Mcdonnell and some of the staff. There are a lot of staff who are very unprofessional. I wonder how some of these people were able to get a job in the medical field. They have no respect for a persons time. In typically in and out with my appointments. I requested my normal amount of time off for these simple follow ups today, and this is absurd. If this decline in service continues, I will find a new doctor's office to go to. I may have to update this review once I get out of here with the final amount of time spent here for this appt. I'm generally in and out of here in 15 minutes. I hear the staff through the doors just laughing and joking with eachother, having a good time. They seem to lack knowledge, professionalism, and care for a persons time. *UPDATE* 1hr and 41 minutes for a discussion with the doctor that lasted 3 to 4 minutes.|Dr. McDonnell is amazing.  He preformed a Spinal Cord Implantation in October of 24. I have completely healed, and have never been happier with the results. It's been life changing. I spent years in severe pain, and unable to stand up straight. I could not stand for more than a few minutes without pain. I was unable to leave my house except for appointments. I can now live a normal life. I highly recommend Dr. McDonnell.|Very unprofessional.I had no problem with this clinic before my doctor retired. I was giving a new doctor I've yet to see him or her I have no idea who it is. I was giving a nurse practitioner who was rude yelled at me changed all my medicine doses explain to me she would not send in some of the medicine that I had gotten before and had treated me like I was nothing. even though I'm the one paying her salary. she was rude condescending very obnoxious and unwilling to listen or answer questions. I will be leaving this clinic and going to someplace else I wouldn't send my dog to this clinic just to get a flea bath because they are so rude and acts like they're above us. I would encourage everyone not to go there and if you are going there leave.|I been going to this center for at least 4-5 months and never missed one appointment and I make my physical therapy appointments also and get discriminating concerns that need to be addressed despite customer service which is very poor I'll tell you what else after going there today the Dr says to me if you are late or any minor flaw I'm cutting you off and last time they refused to send a PA to the pharmacy and now I question there tactics because as I said if I make all my appointment and don't miss and do my best why would you threaten me with being cut off and she says knowledge is power umm do you mean FEAR is power ok here is the deal this same Dr I question rather or not she is going to send over my meds to ensure she gets the last laugh rather then being genuine with patience other wise I wait on my pills  I have to suffer for that with pain she also implied that I should see a regular Dr for pain medication I said lady good luck with that POV she was very manipulative and I hope this message gets spread to the right people TY and also you all deserve better then this Evansville the people deserve better|That place is terrible and very unprofessional. They have no compassion or empathy whatsoever. The whole experience is impersonal...they communicate through text messages and you can never get anyone on the phone. I've never had a copayment before but one day one of the workers at the front desk was very rude and yelling and refused to check me in unless I made a $40 copayment...that's just one example of why I hate going there. I don't have the energy to go on and on, I could but I'm so disgusted with this place it's not worth my time.|Worst experience with a medical "professional" that I have ever had. The doctor was arrogant, rude and would not listen to me. He felt the need to assure me that since he is a doctor and has taught, that means that he is a better doctor than others. He was completely dismissive of my MRI results and assured me that the pain I was in from an injury 12 years ago was from something that is not there, even though the MRI showed that it clearly was still an issue. Will never go back. The single star is for the staff that have to work with this man.|Who wants go to the doctor? Not me! But eveyone at this facility is kind, courteous, knowledgeable, and capable. The office and surgery rooms are always clean and well lit. Dr McDonnell and Doctor B are highly skilled and diminish any fears I may have with a smile and explanation. I'm unable to name everyone but know I am grateful to have your care.|The single star that I gave them was for the nurse practitioner, she was a good person and had taken care of me for several years previously with my last doctor.
I received a simple cortisone shot for some recurring tendinitis during a bi-monthly medication check up, this was the first time that PMCA  had done my cortisone shot.
,They had recently acquired the practice of my long time pain management doctor after he retired. Like I said, it was a very routine injection that I could have performed myself. I overheard the nurses talking to each other prior to giving me the injection  about the fact that there were no doctors present in the building for whatever reason. . One of them said "that's OK, we don't need him anyway, go ahead and give him the injection, it's just for tennis elbow". at the time I didn't think it was a big deal since it  was only a thirty second job. Then I got my bill, they were charging me hundreds for the Doctor and "procedure". My entire visit lasted less than a half an hour, even with the injection that the nurse gave me.   Injections  like that were always part of the visit with Doctor Rupert's practice. . Whatever happened to the days when honest work and honest pay meant something? Today's business culture seems to be " It's OK if you can get away with it ". Goodness knows how much they charged Medicare and my supplemental insurance if my little percentage of it was that much!!! I fired them that same day, my family doctor referred me to another clinic here in town. They are so much better at everything. I'm sure there are people who have good experiences with PMCA, but you need to be aware of what you're getting into. Two years on and they are still trying to send me bills and collections for that day .Maybe I'm old fashioned, but don't believe that a business should profit from that type of behavior.

column40: All of the staff are incredibly nice and understanding. They took the time to get to know us.  Dr. Johnson is awesome and made sure to answer all our questions and lay out a treatment plan. My wife and I had a terrible experience at another local pain clinic. This was the opposite and the example of how they all should be.|I came in 3 x in one week. All appointments scheduled for January 1st were conducted in December - this, 3 straight weeks. It cost more out of pocket because I'm scheduled 2x per month. My Script was sent in on the 18th. I have several serious issues. I can't go three days without meds. My script was due on the 31st of December .On December 27th someone ( I'm assuming it's the person constantly sending my script to the pharmacy who's informed them/and me that they don't have it in stock. So, I always wait to be assured that it's sent to a pharmacy that has the medication in stock. I am scheduled for a 6 am flight out of Evansville on January 1st to California.  The Dr. The Staff. The Nurses all were supposed to send my script in on the 18th of December my 3rd visit in as many weeks to be filled on December 31st. Well it's marked for the 3rd of January (2025). 2 days past the actual due date. This will cause me serious medical harm. Withdrawals without medical supervision is not wise. I tried calling the Answer company . After 2 hours I hired someone to drive me over. And of course the office is closed and no recourse. No emergency back up. No reply from anyone. I had to suffer and stress while going to visit with a sister with a life vest and another who's 71 and in declining health. The 1,300 tickets were non refundable. Lost cause. And not one person from the pain clinic responded. I could have been serious injured and suffered extreme emotional distress. I didn't know what to do. I did my part by coming 3 weeks in a row only to have the Drs office not follow up on the required medical care necessary and agreed to. I've suffered extreme harm. I'm terrified. I'm frozen. I had to pay to be driven over only to be greeted by an empty building. The Answering Rep stated staff were in the office. I paid for 3 straight visits with Shots. And they deliberately and grossly incompetently didn't do what they are charging my insurance for. A terrible, frightening experience. I'm seeking therapy and help. My trust is shattered. Robert Paul Lee. Henderson Kentucky|Dr Johnson will only see you once then every 2 week you'll see a chiropractor, or a counselor. And he will only prescribe Suboxone, a drug used to combat addiction NOT pain relief. In my personal opinion and I could be wrong, a pharmaceutical company or something is paying him good money to push Suboxone cause how else can he afford TWO Rolls Roice cars? Seems strange to me but it's only speculation about that, not fact. But he has advertising for Suboxone everywhere in his office and in the 3 years I saw him he would only prescribe me Suboxone, strange.|Always have a pleasant visit. Everyone I've met is very nice. When I first started I was very worried about my treatment and a nurse named Melisa was extremely helpful she definitely went over and above to assure me I was in good hands. I was very worried about the chiropractor because I was in a lot of pain but she is amazing!! Tasha is always nice and on top of everything. I have been to a few pain clinics and this is by far the best one!|This doctor office has helped me 100% they actually care about how you feel and your concerns actually mean something to these doctors and nurses! And they amazing people they make you feel comfortable and actually listen to you that's hard to find in this city I definitely recommend this clinic if you need help with your pain ! I will always give them 5 stars but dr.wright and ms.ashley definitely gives me the help I need ! Also the nurses are so sweet , front desk is excellent and the whole doctor office is just great !|Everyone at the Medical Pain Clinic is great!!!  Just today I  had a problem with insurance (who doesn't?) and something stupid.. Everyone there jumped in to help get it resolved, because today was Friday and I could not be without my prescription.  They didn't make me feel stupid but got it taken care of.  Thank you to everyone there.  I am not putting names in here because I'm afraid I'll leave someone out.  But THANK YOU.|Been coming here 5 years and I'm glad the people are great|I've been a patient here for over a year now and I can honestly say the doctors and nurses here are amazing! They really take the time to listen to what is hurting you, and they help to make a treatment plan that will help you get on the right track to feeling better. They truely care about their patients and want to help them get better. I see Dr. Wright and he is so sweet and takes the time out to listen to you and answer any questions that you may have. They also offer adjustments to help with the pain as well as counseling. I recommend them to anyone who wants to get on the right track to get to feeling better. I couldn't be more happy to be a patient here! Thank you Dr. Johnson and your amazing team!

column3:
At Center for Pain Management, we specialize in minimally invasive, interventional pain management solutions for patients throughout Indiana. Our dedicated team of pain specialists provides comprehensive care at our eight convenient locations in Carmel, Evansville, Jasper, Kokomo, Indianapolis, Avon, Lafayette, and Greenwood. We understand how chronic pain can impact every aspect of your life, which is why we offer personalized treatment plans tailored to each patient's unique needs.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

We provide a wide range of advanced treatments and services including:

  • Spinal cord stimulators

  • Steroid injections

  • Intrathecal pain pump implants

  • Physical therapy

  • Psychological services

  • On-site diagnostic imaging

Our expertise extends to treating numerous chronic pain conditions such as post laminectomy syndrome, Complex Regional Pain Syndrome (CRPS), sacroiliitis, sciatica, spondylosis, facet syndrome, and many more. With our multidisciplinary approach, we focus on improving quality of life while minimizing medication dependence. Visit our official website to learn more about how we can help you manage your pain and regain control of your life.

column40: Dr Loyd has always been very patient and understanding, he remembers who I am and my specific issues during every visit with him. He truly is a very pleasant young man. I've only had 1 bad experience at his clinic and then, it was a nurse that caused the embarrassing issue. Being in pain having Fibromyalgia and Sciatic spine issues makes twisting and reaching very difficult. On this visit to receive an epidural, the nurse naturally swabbed the lower part of my back with an alcohol wipe and immediately said to the other assisting tech "eew filthy, that's nasty" did you see that"? Living alone and not always able to reach my back made me who shower's daily feel "dirty". While I never mentioned this to Dr. Loyd, I have never forgotten it in fact, the next day I purchased a long handled battery operated shower wand. I scrub extra careful before all visits now.|Absolutely horrible experience with Loyd and his entire staff. First appointment I felt like I was rushed through and no one even wanted me there. When I met with doctor  I had been in extreme pain for 10 days. Was referred to him by neurologist for steroid shot. Had orders to do it that day. He told me that it couldn't be done that day and I would have to wait 2 more weeks in pain. So I waited. On the day before my appointment to get it done the office called me to reschedule because he was going to be out that day. WHAT??? How are they allowed to treat people this way? Also very arrogant and acts like he doesn't care at all. Get out of pain management if that is the case. Never will I ever recommend him to anyone.  Cant believe he is still in practice. Awful experience with doctor and staff. DO NOT GO TO HIM!!!!!!|Absolutely do not understand Dr. Loyd and certainly do not recommend him. Went to him for radio frequency Ablation for neck nerves to treat arthritis in my neck causing severe pain. Had exhausted all other forms of treatment and was looking at neck fusion surgery. For some reason Dr Loyd does not use anesthesia for his procedures (just one versed which does nothing!) and the treatment is extremely painful! After enduring treatment on one side of my neck, while I experienced relief the idea of going through another painful procedures again for the left side left me sick at my stomach. So I decided to research other pain management doctors in Lafayette and found that most of them provided anesthesia for this these procedures that made a world of difference! Do not understand why Dr. Loyd didn't offer the same anesthesia- see no reason to put patients through soooo much pain!!???? He also provided me misinformation  on when I could proceed with treatment on the other side of my neck. He told me I had to wait six months to treat the other side and that is completely incorrect. He and his staff were also very standoffish and hurried you through any appointments with very unsatisfactory answers not to mention incorrect information! Staff very cold with no sympathy for people in pain!  Just cannot figure out for the life of me why he would put people through such pain when there are alternatives??? Since my original treatment with him, I have found two other doctors that are extremely well-informed, really seem to care about the pain you've been in, very understanding and sympathetic staff and completed treatment on my other side with very minimal pain and better results than when he treated the original side!!  Still can't believe what he put me through!|Dr. Loyd is so set in his ways and treats each patient the same way instead of a case by case base. He kept insisting on steroid injections for my lower back pain and numbness in my lower extremities from the back pain. Even after several unsuccessful injections he continued to only offer me injections as a treatment plan. I went back to my primary physician who had referred me to him to begin with and explained to her the terrible experience I have had with him over the last year and she wrote me a script for oral steroid pack instead of injections and then ordered some physical therapy and now I follow up with her every couple months and we do a steroid patch and my back hasn't felt this good since before my first back injury and surgery back in 2006!!! I would never step foot in Dr. Loyd's office again nor would I let any of my family or friends go to him for any issues as everyone I know describes the same issues I had with him that he just keeps throwing these injections at his patients that hardily ever relieve any of the pain his patients are having. For a Doctor that specializes in Pain Management he doesn't do a very good job of managing the pain of his patients.....|Dr. Loyd and his staff  are kind, courteous and their procedural skills can and do give their patients back a quality of life.  I trust in the care and help I have gotten and continue to get from Dr. Loyd and his staff.  I am grateful.  Integrity and help and compassion.  Thank you!!|Dr Loyd is a very pleasant and understanding doctor. Explained the procedure and it worked!!  I'm pain free for the first time in five months. Thank you|Dr. Loyd and his staff are very polite, courteous,  and caring. I enjoy my time under his care. I am confident he is doing everything for me when I am there. Scheduled over the phone, got right in,  does what he can to get you in, out, feeling better in no time.|I am real happy with Dr. Loyd and his nurse practitioner , Kaylee,  I have been going eight years for bad disk and SI (sciatica) joint pain.  I do not want surgery.  They found the right combination of drugs  to help relieve my pain!  I get an occasional shot every so often when it starts to act up again.  It is mainly when I over do it.

column40:
This place is a joke. Had a work comp accident causing new injuries after already being a patient and
taking Norco.  MRI clearly shows I have not 1 not 2 but 3 herniated disc's two fractures and won't increase my pain meds. Been on Norco for 9 years and it did manage my pain ok to where I could work and function. Now the Norco doesn't help but maybe 10% of the pain on my new injuries. ER gave me Percocet and it did help relief about 60% of the pain. I was told to deal with the pain. Holidays ruined due to the pain. I understand not prescribing hard opioids for just anything but I have proof of new injuries and never had BP issues before and now running on avg 152/113 due to the pain. Will be finding a new pain management doctor.|This is place is pathetic. I wish I could give them a  negative star but. I canceled my frist appointment because I had COVID. I received a warning letter because I canceled. I really didn't think much of it. because I was doning what healthcare providers instruct you to do when you test positive for COVID. So, I get there for my rescheduled first appointment and was told they wouldn't see be because I was late and had received a warning letter. I was late because their address on their website is incorrect. It is there old address, never updated and no one in the office informed me that they had moved. Needless to say they got the bad side of me and I left. Very unprofessional in my mind. I have put off for many years seeking out this service because it has such a stigma. I will be visiting my back surgeon, who is not affilicated the JMH and revisit this issue with him. I was also warned to stay away from this clinic but it is convienent for me. column40:
I am so beyond grateful that I found Dr. Lindzy,  he is so nice and caring, it is so amazing to find a Dr.  who actually listens and sincerely tries to help. Thank you to Dr. Lindzy for being so kind and never once made me feel bad or feel judged. Hands down Greatest group of medical professionals.|Dr. Lindzy is beyond amazing. He listens so well, he is so kind and so caring. He understands and if he doesn't, he tries his best to. I wanted to write another review, but there's no  option. I wanted to add that Dr. Lindzy is one of the most caring doctors I have come across. His willingness to help me through pain as much as he can, I can't even put into words the appreciation and gratefulness that I have. Karen, she's so amazing and she went above and beyond for me today, walking me out to my car as I was lightheaded after my cervical epidural or injection. Dr. Lindzy and Karen, have almost even became a friend of mine, this is how I feel, they're professional I know. I love them though, and consider them as family. Karen, I feel we could be best friends lol. She's awesome!! The staff is just all around so very wonderful! The woman behind the desk when I get weighed, so sweet. Samantha, she's sweet. The newer woman, she has glasses, also very nice! Dr. Lindzy, you have really changed my life in so many ways, your determination to relieve as much pain as you can, and your understanding, caring nature, is never unnoticed and very much appreciated from the bottom of my heart. column48: Does Sage Interventional Pain Medicine require a primary physician referral?
column49:
Hello Martin,

We do NOT require a PCP or surgeon referral.

column38: Delbert Jarman|marilyn napier|Angela Saunders|Sonya Coleman|Carlita Arila|Cali Miller|Twylla Bartlett|Sally Farinella
column40:
My wife was recently a patient of this practice.  In my professional career, I must say that I have never been more disappointed. My wife will be having pain pump surgery and Dr. Kundi was selected as the pain management physician to service this Medtronics device.  Awaiting the preliminary punture test, she was given a patch to relieve her pain.  The original dosage needed to be increased.  Five days post administration, she began exhibiting negative reactions necessitating hospital intervention.  One day prior to admission, I called the office to request a brief consult on a first available basis.   I made 4 additional phone requests during her 4 day hospital stay.  Neither Dr. Kundi or his PA returned my call even after I spoke with the practice prior-authorization manager who stated that she had made an "urgent request" to both Dr. Kundi and his PA.  I realize that others have submitted strong reviews for this physician and practice and I'm happy that their quality of care has warranted such a response.  However, my wife and I can not report the same level of support.  We have since moved my wife's care to another pain management practice in Carmel.

Dr. Delbert W Jarman|I have been a patient here for 3 years and I love care that I receive, all of my issues are addressed, my care team listens to what I have to say concerning my care, everyone is very respectful with positive attitudes, I love the East Office,Dr. Kundi and his whole team are awesome, I am truly blessed to be in the care of this office, thank you guys for everything you do! Stay Blessed...|Dr. Kundi with Indiana Neuro and Pain Center is attentive to my needs. He is very knowledgeable to my care and treatments. He listens to my concerns and treats them accordingly. He gives suggestions but leaves it up to me with what im comfortable having done.
I recommend him to anyone and everyone needing treatment for their aches and pains.|The  Doctor's Assistant were extremely caring, professional great bed side manners(10 stars) THE WAITING TIME was less than 10mins for my schedule appointment.  Very busy practice but the entire practice work as team. Love the compassion of
nurse on call WERE EXCELLENTLY KNOWLEDGEABLE.
But The Front Office Assistants are the first person of contact, this mean  more of an accepting voice personality.  Beautiful smile,  gentle but professional communication skills and eye contact. Make the patient feels as if they ARE IMPORTANT and welcoming.|I gave a five star for doctor k u n d i based on his professionalism, knowledgeable and caring spirit. I have no complaints with my doctor everything has always went very well. Dr. Kundi is awesome with his communication with what he is treating his patient for with your appointment, as well to how I understand what he is doing for my health and well-being. Thanks|All of the providers and staff are friendly. I've found the interns are generally the most thorough out of all of the providers. They seem to listen to my concerns and explain things most often.

I've had a few occasions where my prescriptions were not sent to the pharmacy on time. I once went 5 days without one of my prescriptions and was stuck in bed, unable to move. An opportunity for improvement would be to work on communication. I've found it's really hard to get a hold of the office. They rarely pick up or return phone calls.

The last few visits however have gone well. Dr. Kundi, took the time to listen, gave me recommendations for how to pursue my disability claim, and my meds were sent to the pharmacy immediately. I am grateful that Dr. Kundi's practice is willing to prescribe the pain meds that I need, despite government over-regulation. Thank you.|Dr Kundi is quick and excellent treatment! His bedside manner is wonderful! The office is clean and runs very smooth! I've NEVER had a problem or long wait! I'm glad that I chose to be his patient!|His staff is very helpful friendly courteous and have always been nice to me.  Dr. KUNDi takes his time he makes you understand what's going on he gives you alternatives. He has a sense of humor. And that is truly important when you're dealing with people in pain. Even if you weren't dealing with people and paying doctors should be sensitive and respectful to the patient. I had another pain management Doctor Who was very very unprofessional.   He and his staff would Yell at you and talk down to you. If you didn't like what they had to say they just gave you a notice and said they weren't going to take care of you anymore.  I highly highly recommend Dr. KUNDi and his staff. Sally F

column40:
I've been going to Kokomo Lafayette Pain Care for several years. I've been seen by several Doctors and Nurse Practitioners, NP Nathan Wheeler is who I seen on my last visit, Dr. Siddiqui is my primary doctor there whom has been taking very good care of me. NP Oberle Morgan fills in for Dr. Siddiqui and she's very knowledgeable with spine care and is very caring about my pain management program. NP Wheeler is also very knowledgeable about spine care always explains how my treatment is going. All of the Doctors and Nurse Practitioners there are very knowledgeable about my condition and they are willing to help me with any questions I may have. Overall all I can say is that I've been very well taken care of during the years that I have been being treated at Kokomo Lafayette Pain Care. I am very grateful for all of the staff there for their support and help. I've got a few years left before I can retire and I'm confident that Dr. Siddiqui and her staff are going to see me through.|I have had very good experiences here. The staff is caring and thorough. The doctors really listen and plan your care to meet your specific needs.|I recently just switched doctors to get a 2nd opinion on why I'm losing my ability to walk. Dr. Devries and Dr. Nathan found out so quick what was going on and sent me to an Orthopedic surgeon. I finally feel good knowing my issues are fixable with surgery. Dr. Nathan is very nice and takes alot of time getting to know u and ur issues rather than just throwing a bunch of pills at you and sending u out the door. I would recommend this place to anyone dealing with arthritis, and hip and joint issues.|I was a patient of Dr Michael Carl for a couple years. Extremely caring, nice and very helpful. I had decided to give my body a break from pain meds but very scared if the withdrawals, so I went on Suboxone for awhile.After so many months on that, I just couldn't take the pain anymore so decided to come back to Lafayette Pain management. I was told Dr Carl left and would have to see Dr Sadeki. So at my appointment with here, I told her I need to get back on my prescription of pain meds and had told her I need a revision for my shoulder replacement that was done incorrectly.  And now my other shoulder is doing the same thing of catching, getting stuck and very painful.Told her my L4 and L5 have slipped out and have arthritis in my back and my entire body. Also Osteoporosis. She then tried to say i was taking Suboxone and pain mens at the same time. I told her no way. If you take both of those at the same time it will put you in withdrawal
She shook her head. She was extremely RUDE! Looking down her nose at me.Acting like I'm a drug seeker
Didn't even care that I have so many medical issues. And she said she's not giving me pain pills until she talks to my Suboxone Doctor. I had also needed a refill of the nerve pain medication Lyrica which she did not refill.And when I called back later that day about the Lyrica, the girl at the front desk said I terminated myself! I told her I did nosuch thing
She said she was asking Dr Sadeki and call me back. Never got a return call. The whole vibe of that office has completely changed from very friendly and caring, to very rude and very judging!!! It's hard enough living with all this pain. And then to be treated like that on top of it! Shame on Dr Sadeki!! You took an oath to be caring a helpful and you are none of those!|Very caring and proactive health care for treating chronic back pain that I have dealt with for 48 years. Dr. Devries and PA Wheeler both explore multiple methods and treatments to successfully alleviate chronic pain.|I like Lafayette the staff actually seem to care and are helpful I however received a letter today informing me my doctor will be leaving and that does cause some what frustration after you finally find a great doctor who actually listens and helps find a resolution they end up leaving and having to start all over again to have to explain what's going on etc to another doctor you don't know is non needed extra stressors! Nothing more irritating than having to yet again explain your situation and pain you live in day to day life. I will miss Dr. Carl.|Dr. Sebai helped me to feel much better. My pain improved 80% after the procedure. He is very kind and knowledgeable.|I called and stop going I got tired of different doctors. Dr Carl was the best. Now starting my journey somewhere else

column40:
I was referred to Dr. Pai by a neurologist for my spinal stenosis pain. He gave me my life back!! Several injections over 2 years and I'd go back there if I ever have that much pain again!!|Have went there for years But one day I called when I woke up and my voice was groggy so they blamed it on the valium!! She said No Valium I said No Problem I Will Get Off It Right Now! Then she wanted to give me a patch I have had patches before and No they don't work and they come off before the week is over with!! Pain patches are a Joke! Guess I will look for a new Dr,!!|Great experiences. Had great results from the treatments. No longer there because I eventually needed surgery that fixed the issue. They offer anesthesia for injections, which I declined. Was no more uncomfortable than the pinched nerve already was. The treatments did give pain relief. Don't waste their time and yours if you just want prescriptions.|Not sure what's up with all the bad reviews.  I've never had a bad experience. Maybe customers are representing themselves in a poor fashion and are getting treated as such. The are usually lots of people when I go in and the waiting period reflects that. I have seen a lot of people go in and out. Some don't even bother to shower or dress nicely for the appointment. You can tell they are there for the pills, and probably get treated as such. Other people who have pain and actually care about their appearance and respect the dr get treated as such too.|Words cannot Express how upset I am with Dr. Pai!
Two years ago I was a patient there and never had a problem. I recently moved back to mishawaka and I ironically enough still have major back pain from blunt force trauma and he has the MRI to prove it!
I had to wait a month to get in his office and for nothing- I have to wait two more weeks for my urine test to come back...TWO MORE WEEKS. Now were at a month and a half of constant pain interfering with my life, my wife and my kids!!
Icing on the cake was I do not get any say in my treatment whatsoever! I have to do physical therapy even though I have done physical therapy in the past and it hurts physically to move my spine...not a good idea!
They also signed me up to see a back surgeon...not something I want to do!
They scheduled me with 30 other people at one time crammed into a very small waiting room on top of it!!
I am talking to a lawyer in the morning! This is not helping me with my pain and it is unbearable!!|I was seen in office 1 time. They forced me to do a drug test even though it was a consult. Then they prescribed medication that I'm highly allergic too. I even dropped off paperwork a few weeks prior to my appointment. Here I am 9 month later and I get a bill for Trilabs for over $3k. They tested my pee and dumped it out. I'm talking to my insurance company about insurance fraud on the offices part.|I am very disappointed with the physician at this facility.i am in line for a reverse shoulder surgery. Their is little knowledge of what pain is prescribed Tramadol and Diclofenac. Tylenol works as well as these meds. Waste of my time and money going there|For an entire year I've tried to get some sort of relief for chronic pain. I need a second shoulder replacement and my body is full of authrytis and scar tissue. Back fusion isn't working very well and my level of life and happiness is hampered. Putting my well being in the hands of this man was a big mistake. I will be looking for a new specialist ASAP.

column40:
Great, knowledgeable, friendly & patient are only 4 words that describe Dr. Cook, at the Center for Pain Management!  I am very satisfied with the direction my treatment is going & very happy to have found Dr. Cook.  He takes time to explain things in terms that's easy to understand & if you still don't understand, he will do his utmost best to explain every little part of not only your problem, but of the treatment & the expected outcome of the treatment.  I gave him a 5 star rating, but would like to give him 10 stars or more if possible.|I was pleased with Dr. Cook.He has a pleasant personality , actually communicates and listens to his patient like he cares. That seems to be something rare in today's society and something I for one definitely appreciate. This was my first visit with him.He seems like a keeper! I will update this review as time goes on. A Good doctor deserves recognition and ones that aren't deserved to be called out. Especially since we hire and pay for them.|Absolutely the worst service I have received in the medical industry and any other industry for that matter. They  were supposed to order MRI on January 2nd This is. Feb 12th. Between those dates I found out they never sent the request to my insurance company.  After explaining my frustration as politely as possible they told me they would send it to Putnam County Hospital to get my MRI done instead of the first place and now a week later I have called Putnam County to see if they received the order and they still have not received the order from Dr. Cook's office. Meanwhile, I suffer in pain with absolutely no action from dr cooks office who told me I needed the MRI in the first place. They do not return phone calls when I leave a message ever. Meaning not one single time after seven messages.! Not to mention my minimum wait time in the waiting room is one hour. Strongly advise you find a different pain management doctor if you're not into deep already.|I was always scared to go to a pain management doctor's because I was scared they would prefer to put me on strong pain medication which is not what I wanted. Dr. Cook took his time to listen to what causes my pain and came up with a solution to take scans and then come up with a plan from there. I started coming to Dr. Cook when my doctor retired and she recommended me to him and I see why! Thank you Dr. Cook for listening to me and making me feel like you genuinely care.|Dr.cook is a Excellent Pain Management Professional he cares for his patients and listens and a lovely office has well totally recommend him.|The Dr. walked in an had no clue why I was seeing him that day. I felt like a human lab rat that he wanted to just poke with needles. This Dr has to much on his plate to take it all on . He didn't even read my chart before coming in the room. And didn't have a clue what to do to help me with my  symptoms.|I've NEVER BEEN TREATED SO AWFULLY EVER..
I went for 12 months no issues no dirty drops always showed up..
I had to take my sister for a whole specialized knee replacement in TENNESSEE..
I was not aware we were like in PROBATION AND HAD TO REPORT OUT OF STATE..
They called me for a pill count..
I take sleeping meds so was not awake completely..
I first said I was in terrehout but wasn't I knew she lived there .
I called back after I woke up got the same AWFUL PERSON DEMANDING I CAME IN FOR A PILL COUNT..
I told her I couldn't leave my sister at all.
Her SMART ASS SAID YOU SAID TEERHOT I SAID YES I WAS HALF AWAKE..
She said she didn't care at all and I had till 3 pm to be there
Considering I was 6 hours away awaiting discharge to take my sister home n COULD NOT LEAVE HER..
The RUDE AND UNCALLED FOR UNCARING PERSON TOLD ME I COULD NO LONGER COME..
I called back next am said I worked it out to come..
Hell no she claimed I would be receiving a good bye mailer..
Wow I went into severe depression and couldn't believe this woman..
I found another Dr THANK GOD N WAS STATED SHAME ON HIM!!
As I awaited in waiting room 4 people were talking hell of shit about a DR TO MY SURPRISE IT WAS DR. COOK..
I had no issues with Dr cook or SOPHIA..
My last appointment there 4.5 hour wait they called no one.
They had to open rooms for pt to sit..
SOPHIA WALKED OUT..
When the other DR UP AND LEAVES OVER THE SAME NURSE I HAD TO ENCOUNTER SAYS VOLUMES..
They definitely do NOT CARE ABOUT YOU OR EMERGENCIES THAT OCCUR..
They allow people to call in on pts as well
One Dr put it as so...
If THIS IS ALL I DID ALL DAY WAS LISTENING TO MAD PEOPLE ARGUING N LYING ABOUT MY PTS I WOULD BE OUT OF BUSINESS..
Lesson learned
IF NURSES USE THEIR ENTITLEMENT RUN LIKE HELL
I COULD SEE IF I JAD DIRTY DROPS CAUSED ISSUES NONE OF THE ABOVE!!
They didn't even contact my psychotherapy wow works for them she had no idea
She was in dismay as well|He is a nice enough fellow. But so far I've seen him twice and he says he can get me out of pain but so far is falling short. Running out of patience fixing to go back to marijuana something that is all natural created by the great spirit.

The nurse's are wonderful. He was in the room 6 1/2 minutes. Put down the medicine I get from my doctor was just for my fybro. I didn't say that. It was also for my back. He said I will have to deal with it. Madupu. Find another doctor. Your just money to him. I have a bad back he said no. Even I have x-ray.and MRI to prove it. Maybe try the female doctor there maybe she's better.|I saw Dr. Madupu for severe bilateral knee pain and I could not have been more disappointed. He was inappropriate and unprofessional. The first thing he said to me when he walked through the door was "what are you doing here?" After asking for a bridge of medicinal pain relief until surgery, he refused to give me medicine. He said I am "too young" (I am 30 years old) and he also called my primary doctor a liar, saying she could give me the pain medicine if she wanted to. I tried to explain that my doctor could not give me pain medicine because of restrictions and because my pain is chronic and Dr. Madupu would not let me speak. He said that his job is not to give pain medicine but to do procedures. I highly recommend NOT seeing Dr. Madupu if you are suffering in pain like I am because he does not care and will not listen to you.|Dr. Madupu is a very understanding Dr. Helped me so much to get my chronic issues under control. Highly recommend him. Office staff are very nice & have helped me in any ways that could.|Dr. Madupu is NOT "Dr. Feelgood", so if you are only seeking a doctor to give you hundreds of pain pills, go somewhere else. I am surprised at the negative reviews because he has NEVER done anything that is not in my best interest. Pain management is NOT a quick fix, so again, if you're just looking for the doctor who writes you a script for 100 Oxycontin, Dr. Madupu is not the professional for you.|I've gotten minimal relief from pain even tho I've done everything I have been asked to do, tried everything we agreed I would try and I was told today that it's not his job to manage my pain and that I have nothing he would even consider pain medication for. And it  " isn't my job to manage your pain"
When I tried to explain to him my situation (I was in tears by this point) he said he couldn't understand me and he basically dropped me as a patient.
I have Dercums Disease, lupus, fibromyalgia, deteriorated cartiledge in knees, lymphedema and arthritis in my spine and neck.
I've done everything, tried everything for the last 15 years. I finally get a med/treatment combo that works ( was given 21 Tramadol ,50mg twice by his NP)  and then you have a doctor that literally shoots down your Disease as being "just lipomas" and refuses to treat you beyond stuff you've already been on for years.
Thanks for nothing, doc!|Dr Madupu was wonderful. Absolutely the best interventional pain diagnostician in Muncie. Courteous and Caring & Skilled.
I'd give him 10 stars if I could!!|Arrived 27 minutes before scheduled appointment and the receptionist lied to say we were later, then refused to see us. Tim, the RN, and the receptionist were both extremely rude and hateful. If this was the ONLY pain doctor in the world, we would NOT come back!|Long story short hurt my back 2 years ago got it fixed and re injured it 2 days back to work now docs tried many different things to fix me but could not and released me with pain medication therapy that I have already been on for 2 years so my workers comp doc who had been treating me had to release me from her care so I went to this clinic to continue my medication therapy and was met stereotypical doc that introduced herself and immediately after denied me of the meds that I have been getting for 2 years she denied me because 8 am young and thinks I am going to sell this drug that gets me through my day told me tough and will have to deal with it I have nevery felt so bad in my entire life that this doc is to terrified to continue my meds that my previous doc ordered for me I can understand why but there is no reason to peg me as a user or a drug dealer..

column40:
Wont provide care other than more referrals, but will send you to a shady collection agency after not receiving any invoices or calls, followed by shady collection agency and attorney not calling or billing you at all before sending you to small claims court. Doc, attorney, and collections agency don't answer or return messages through whole process so unless you can make it to a randomly assigned bogus court date you have to pay astronomical extra fees. Feels like a scam honestly.|My skeletal health is a mess! My dr has given me over 10 years of relief in my spine with radio frequency saving me from surgery! He listens to what I say! He knows what to do and knows when I need surgery!He has sent me to the greatest neck surgeon and thdbest shoulder replacement surgeon in Ft Wayne! I trust his judgement completely!|Love the Dr. and his team my only complaint is how long things can take sometimes which is no fault of the employees.|We've been coming here for 7 years for my grandfather. As his primary caretaker, it's always felt like a struggle getting him decent care. With the very old and people with chronic pain, doctors are always too willing to throw drugs at people to make them go away without actually listening to them at all. This hasn't been the case with Dr. Bodrab and Suzy, our nurse.  We've never felt like they weren't working towards improving my Grandfather's life. Genuinely listening to any issues he has and concerns. Answering questions, taking their time.

We've only had an issue once or twice with the wait time to actually see the doctor. But even then the staff and service has always been top notch. Definitely recommend.|Dr. Bojrab I highly recommend. He has been so great for each injection I have had. Great personality that shines through in his bedside manner. He is always able to put me at ease before an injection, if you are in need of someone you can't go wrong here!|As many times as I had to call & have my injections for my neck rescheduled, or simply trying to change the appt to a routine check up during all of the Covid-19 & being told I could not change the appt to a routine one & that it had to be only for the injections.
I questioned this numerous times, but they didn't seem to care (let me clarify that - the gals that answered the calls to schedule, change, remind of appts). I could not get any injections per Dr Bojrab & his nurse until I provided them with 'Releases' 1st from all of my dentists I was dealing with since I was having all different kinds of work done on my teeth + the infection was still healing (I mentioned it was quite extensive & could take a bit). I had just finished an antibiotic for an infection in my tooth until we all know how the Covid-19 virus caused many problems for everyone & people who were trying to get into dentist offices, & the like, even for routine work let alone extractions & getting them scheduled was quite a task at times. I finally got 1 of my dental releases & the other was forthcoming shortly  when I get a call stating they are letting me go as a patient since I haven't been seen! I'm like this is a joke right? My goodness I did everything to the book except stand on my head & I've been in serious pain for awhile now begging all the dr's &/or dentists to please get this done so I can get my injections again. A week in a 1/2 or so after they got rid of me, I got my last dental  release I needed but they already said it's "beyond that, & too late". So they left me in quite a quandary and suffering! Not happy with this situation especially when I followed their rules to the letter. None of dentists even knew what kind of release they wanted either, nor did I. It's a shame since their office staff in the building was all very helpful & quick to get things rectified. I also asked if notes were put on any of my records & they actually said none were made & they couldn't find any. Wow - I feel real important!|Dr Bojrab and his team are amazing.  I have been going here for years and always find that Dr Bojrab is attentive and caring.  He has a great sense of humor and makes you feel comfortable before your procedures.  I have had many procedures and would not hesitate to refer to him.|My doctor referred me to Dr. David bojrab without consulting me first. Had I looked at his qualifications first I would have realized he was not qualified to deal with all of my pain needs. On my first visit he sent me to another doctor to deal with half of my issues. If you compare his list of specialties to almost any other pain doctor in the area you'll find his list is extremely short. To add insult to injury hIs diagnosis was incorrect. He made No interviewing efforts to get details of my history. He didn't wait for more information before jumping to conclusions. I mean this literally, he did not wait for my extensive records to arrive from multiple sources.     He was clearly in a hurry to get me in and out of the office as fast as possible and this was my intake interview! To the best of my knowledge he did not follow the CDC interviewing guidelines or tapering guidelines as his intent was, without much consideration, to cut me off all medication. His office personnel are visibly hostile to even the simplest questions. The girl acted like I was rude for asking if they had water; a question I only asked because there was no water fountain and I could see their mini fridge full of bottles! I've been going to pain clinics for several years in multiple states and this was almost the worst experience. I recommend Summit Pain Management.

At Summit Pain Management they helped me tackle each area separately. I went from being in a significant crisis of pain to a well managed trajectory of pain control. They introduced me to procedures and medicines that weren't even mentioned with Dr. bojrab. At this point in time I have had a number of injections and ablations that have given me my life back. I am taking far less pills than any point during my crisis. Both he and his nurse assistant turned their back on me. I'm glad they did, because I found a far friendlier office staff and quantifiable help at Summit Pain Management.
