Expert Care from Board-Certified Specialists

Dr. Ashley Tolbert brings exceptional credentials as a dual Board-Certified physician by both the American Board of Anesthesiology and the American Board of Pain Medicine. While specializing in chronic pain management, she offers particular expertise in:

  • Cancer-related pain management

  • Post-surgical pain following joint replacements

  • Chronic pain from orthopedic injuries

Dr. Tolbert practices at both our Indianapolis and Greenwood locations, providing specialized treatments including vertebral augmentation, neuromodulation, and platelet-rich plasma therapy (PRP). We combine advanced medical techniques with compassionate care to help our patients regain function and improve quality of life. For comprehensive pain management solutions, visit our website or call us at 317-706-7246 to schedule your consultation.
column11: At Center for Pain Management, our providers specialize in minimally invasive, interventional pain management. Our network of pain management clinics serves Indiana in three locations: Indianapolis, Lafayette, and Greenwood. Dr. Ashley Tolbert is Board Certified by both the American Board of Anesthesiology and the American Board of Pain Medicine. She specializes in chronic pain management, but she has additional focuses in cancer-related pain and chronic pain following either joint replacement procedures or orthopedic injuries. She serves patients in both the Indianapolis and Greenwood pain management clinics. Some of her treatment specialties include vertebral augmentation, neuromodulation, and platelet-rich plasma therapy (PRP therapy).

They are really good and you won't be disappointed very good service. And the staff is very carrying I give them 10 stars.|This is one of the top notch medical facilities in Indiana. From the staff at the front desk all the way up to the Dr.  I Saw Dr. Vitto. I do not ever want surgery on my back. He understood this and he listens to you. I have now had nerve blocks in my lower spine and cervical neck area. I haven't felt this good in probably 10 yrs. I would recommend him 100%.|Dr. Vitto and his entire staff I'd recommend to anyone needing help with spine issues!
I'm hearing impaired and him and his staff accommodated that with care and understanding, and went above and beyond my expectations with that alone!
Such a classy, professional, courteous Doctor and staff!
Pin pointed my spine issues,  Dr. Vitto came up with a plan of treatments, explained them thoroughly, and  executed them with extreme accuracy and gentle touch!
Since getting them done it has made a TREMENDOUS difference in my life!
Thank you Dr. Vitto and staff at Indiana Spine Group|They were quick at getting me in I was in extreme pain I got a shot it helps but it's wearing off now hopefully eventually it works this way in but everybody there was great|Every appt took 2 to 3 hrs. Wait times were insane which is hard when you are sick and in pain. When I asked about using a cervical collar for a few hours, here and there, because it actually relieves my pain. I was told "no". Pushed into steroid injections which you should know are NOT FDA approved and have NOT been studied in patients long term. Also, I have Type 1 Diabetes. The shots made my blood sugar insane for several months. Impossible highs. You shouldn't be giving steroids to those who are diabetic. I got thrush so bad in my mouth and down my esophagus that I could not eat. I had to be on Diflucan for 3 months to get rid of this complication.  I also suffered reduced kidney function for 3 months. I had an undiagnosed Adrenal tumor at time. Common sense says that you should NOT give steroid shots to someone with this condition as Adrenal tumors are known to cause steroid excess in the form of cortisol. 5 months later I was diagnosed with Adrenal Cancer. In my opinion, this is just another drill mill. It's scary to me that doctors are no longer managing pain. Instead they are pushing un-proven and invasive procedures on patients.|Dr. Vitto was absolutely great to my family and I. He is kind, genuine and truly cares about his patients. I would recommend him to anyone with spine care needs!|Dr. Vitto was the calming voice I needed for something I was a bit nervous going in to. He was truly amazing and comforting. Thanks Dr. Vitto

column38: Tia Rose|K "Bent Rusty" M|Steve Burchett|Jeff Craig|Clint Brown|Anita Hamblin|Sheri Williams|Kristin Gault
column40:
Sorry if this is long...
Today was my first time in Dr Taylor's office and I don't ever wanna go anywhere else!! I have had severe lower back pain for 4.5 years. I have had 1 surgery on my L4/L5 for a herniated disk 3 years ago. Since then it's been hard to find a doctor who not only takes me seriously (I'm a 30 year old female who often gets told I'm too young to have the serious back issues that I have). From the moment I walked into their office the staff greeted me and were super nice and friendly, the nurse who took me back to the room was extremely kind and sympathetic and really listened to what I have gone thru the last almost 5 years and communicated with me like I was family even tho I had never been seen there before. Then in came Dr Taylor... and I have NEVER been seen by a doctor who actually took the time to LISTEN to me and what I've had done and what I've been going thru and experiencing like he did without rushing thru the appointment to get to the next patient. He was super friendly and talked to me like a friend and even took the time to educate me more on my MRI scans and pinpointed which of my discs are causing which issues I'm experiencing (I now have 2 bulging discs L4/L5 & L5/S1). He showed me demonstrations on how my last epidural was done (elsewhere) and how this one will be done differently to better help with the nerve pain I'm experiencing.

I am blown away with the care I received today. Best experience I have EVER had in ANY Dr office setting. The compassion that this office has for their patients is out of this world. I thanked them all, but words cannot express how much it truly meant to be seen and HEARD and immediately have a plan set to help me. I am so grateful for this office and the way they treated me during my visit. 20/10 would recommend!!! I am confident when I say I finally feel like I'm in good hands and look forward to being their new patient.|This review is about my only treatment so far by Dr. Taylor.  I have chronic, spine and sciatic issues and it did take me almost a month of  enduring severe pain before I could get in to see  him.   That is my only complaint.  I finally got in and he scheduled an epidural for 2 days later.  The staff at Ball Outpatient Surgery was good.  Dr Taylor's treatment was fantastic.  He came to see me before the procedure, reviewed everything and even chatted with me.  When it was my turn, I was whisked into the surgery theater and he explained everything he was doing.  I have had four previous epidurals and endured various levels of pain, even with an anesthetic infusion.  Based on his assurances, I opted to go with local anesthesia only.  I was nervous, but he did a fantastic job.  There was no terrible pain and only mild discomfort that lasted seconds.  I was so happy I opted to go without and IV.  I would gladly do this again as long as he is the one doing it.  He also does minimally invasive surgery of which I am a big believer.  He showed me an option for a more long-term solution, should I need it.  At this point, I am very pleased and will put my faith in him going forward.|I love Dr Taylor wish I could use him and his staff for all my medical issues. The Spine surgeon gave up on me said my fusion is healed  and sent me back to Dr Taylor who already tried an epidural after the fusion that didn't help but the spine surgeon says nothing is wrong he wanted Dr Taylor to put in a pain stimulator. Dr Taylor could but he agreed there's something wrong and sending me to another surgeon.|I started seeing Dr Taylor around 2009/2010 because of some nerve damage from a back surgery. He listened to my problem's and pain issues and set me up with the pain stimulator. It has helped me exceptionally well and was a life changer. I would recommend him to anyone and now both of my parents are seeing him with back issues and also my father in law. The whole staff is caring and friendly. If you have chronic pain or any kind of pain hopefully you can get in to see Dr Taylor.|Dr. Taylor is the best doctor I've ever had in my life. He and his staff are so caring and not judgemental. Dr. Taylor was sent from God to me. I've just had injections in my spine yet the pain is not gone but it is at least 50% better and that is amazing in my book due to my amount of pain. If I could rate this man a 1,000,000 I would.|Dr Taylor is amazing. I had melanoma skin cancer removed and had alot of pain. From my first visit he treated me and put a drg stimulator in me and I'm doing so much better. Just healing from the surgery part. Thank you again Dr Taylor and your staff. God bless you all.|My dad is 90 and has excruciating back pain and just started seeing Dr. Taylor about 9 months ago. Dr. Taylor set a pain management plan in place for dad where he gets pain shots every 3 months. Dr. Taylor is a very caring doctor. Definitely recommend him!|So far, I am very happy with Dr. Taylor and his staff. It took me a long time to get in to see him due to insurance issues but I felt like a weight was lifted when I finally saw him. I constantly feel as if medical professionals either don't listen or make me feel like the pain I'm feeling is just in my head but I didn't feel that way at all at his office. It's been years since I had someone actually act as if they cared to help.

Dr. Masimore is a very intelligent doctor. He's big on educating his patience. Every single visit he will go over the material to make sure you understand you can ask him any question he will answer it he ends every appointment by telling you if you have any questions don't hesitate to call. I've currently gone through a very tragic events in my life the office staff and Dr M have been caring and amazing . Doc offered words of encouragement he truly cares.
I want to address some of these bad reviews. If you're not willing to put the work in and you're only trying to come to this office to get meds this is not the place for you. If you want to learn about pain how it affects both your body and your mind, or how underlying issues can exasperate pain and how to help ease it or fix it this is the place for you. As far as raising a voice at a patient I will say this. Dr m is human . It's not right for someone to come into your home and scream at you just like it's not right for someone to walk into his office and scream at him and his staff. When you read these reviews just remember there's two sides and you are getting aside of someone who is upset possibly not getting their way. If you're considering a doctor to help with pain this is the doctor.|My first time seeing Dr. Masimore was today. In less than 2 hours he gave more info than any doctor I've ever seen. He also took the time to explain everything in great detail and didn't  run in the room and spend 5 minutes and leave like most doctors in the past have. He was very thorough with his exam and getting to know myself and my conditions. I don't believe the negative reviews one bit. If you do what you're supposed to there should be no problem! The office staff was also beyond polite and helpful! 5 stars!|Let me start off by saying I was not his patient my husband was until he passed away in Dec 2023. I went to each appointment, though. The office staff is friendly and easy to get along with. We had issues with my insurance not paying, and they didn't hound me about it they said they were working on getting it fixed. You do wait a short period before seeing the doctor, but in my experience, you do no matter what doctor you see anymore. Dr. Masimore is a very intelligent man. He was nothing but informative and helpful to my husband and myself. He is very keen on making sure you're taking your medications as directed and not abusing them. Which is great because so many people nowadays are addicts. He was always willing to adjust his medication as needed if it was necessary. My husband had decompensated liver disease and was struggling with many complications of his disease. Dr. Masimore would always take time to go over what the struggles were since the last visit and try to give any advice or education he could to help. I appreciate the helpfulness and compassion that he had for my husband during the last year.|I have never been treated so badly by a doctor...He talks the whole time...and if I tried to answer he cut me off...He tries to intimidated and bully you....I didn't agree with him and he labeled me uncooperative...Said he Cldnt help me...then proceeded to degrade me in waiting area and say u can come back....I said no ty! This man who has a God complex is arrogant and verbally abusive...NOBODY DOES THAT TO ME....Btw the staff was so nice and u can tell they tip toe around this angry man...They were so apologetic for his behavior....I left and sat and cried in my car!|Just want to start off by saying I have been a patient of Dr. Masimore around 8 years. Of all the doctors I've encountered personally and in the work place, he is genuinely the nicest and most compassionate person I've ever met. Dr. Masimore  is very knowledgeable and competent in his practice and well rounded in general health care. As Dr. Masimore says, pain medicine is not the solution but is sometimes necessary to support the patient needs. Dr. Masimore has helped me understand my injuries and best alternative practices to mitigate my discomfort. I.E.- stretching , breathing exercises , ice/heat, topical gels, injections and support braces.

I could go on and on with how great Dr. Masimore is, and the positive impacts he has had on my life and others. It's very seldom a happy patient comes to write a review for a their provider. I would like to address the bad reviews on here. I've seen a variety of people in and out of Masimores office over the years , and it's typically the same type of patients. These doctors are under a microscope nonstop and have strict guidelines and regulations to follow. If you can't follow the simple rules in place, then your service can't continue. That being said, Dr. Masimore is very understanding and able to help you, but he can only do so much before it is recognized and has to be escalated. I can promise you this, the disgruntled patients had several opportunities for improvement before escalation took place. To simply summarize my post, if you can follow the rules; Dr. Masimore will be your best pain management solution. If you would like to ask any questions, feel free to respond to my post. Thank you.|I have been a patient of Dr. Masimore for almost a year now! He's great & I HIGHLY recommend him! I haven't had any issues whatsoever. I actually enjoy my appointments and talking with him and his staff. I'm usually always in and out because I do early appointments. I have a back disease I was born with and Dr. Masimore actually knows about the disease itself and what I'm going through! Most doctors I have seen in the past don't know much about the disease I have! In fact, I recently found out he doesn't take my insurance and I told him I will pay out of pocket to continue to go there. So you know I like him if I want to pay out of pocket, rather find another doctor that is covered by my insurance! I'm very thankful that he is giving me that option because I plan on using him for my doctor always!|I have been a Patient of Dr. Masimore for about 5 years and wouldn't trade him for anything. He truly cares about his Patients, and takes time to listen and understand their concerns. I recently came down with Shingles, and the pain is debilitating. I was ready to go to the hospital, but called Dr. Masimore first. He faxed in the medication to treat Shingles, and within 24 hours I felt a significant difference in my level of pain, and I am now able to walk without so much difficulty. And although I still have pain, it is no longer a 10..A good Doctor is hard to find, but I found one with Doctor Masimore. I wouldn't hesitate to refer him to anyone.|Not sure why there are so many bad reviews on here, Dr Massimore and the staff has been nice and caring towards me. Only been there about 4 months but I haven't run into any issues with them. The staff are really nice and are very helpful if you need something. The reason I don't give it a 5 is because nothing is perfect. Occasionally though I had a very long wait, the first visit especially, 4 to 5 hour weight. But once you are a paitent it is a lot faster. Some days you could spend couple hours for your appointment, but most of the time they are pretty quick. At my last appointment I was in and out in 30 minutes

column2: Wellspring Pain Clinic - Comprehensive Pain Management & Recovery
column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management & Recovery Solutions

At Wellspring Pain Clinic, we offer an integrative approach to pain management and addiction recovery that addresses the whole person. Our experienced medical team provides personalized care plans that consider the physical, emotional, and psychological aspects of wellness. Located in Merrillville, Indiana, we specialize in treating chronic pain conditions while also offering comprehensive addiction medicine services. We combine advanced medical treatments with complementary therapies to help our patients achieve lasting relief and recovery. Our patient-centered philosophy ensures that each individual receives attentive care in a supportive environment designed for healing.

Our Specialized Services Include:

  • Addiction Medicine & Recovery Programs - Comprehensive support for substance dependency

  • Chronic Pain Management - Targeted treatments for persistent pain conditions

  • Holistic and Integrative Therapies - Complementary approaches to enhance traditional medicine

  • Pain Relief and Rehabilitation Plans - Customized recovery programs for injuries and chronic conditions

Visit our Wellspring Pain Clinic Website or call us at +1 219-250-3255 to schedule your consultation at our facility located at 300 W 80th Pl Suite D, Merrillville, IN 46410.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Management & Neurological Care in Indianapolis

At Indiana Neurology & Pain Center, we provide the most effective and highest quality pain management and neurological care throughout the Greater Indianapolis area. With two convenient office locations, our highly trained physicians and staff specialize in an array of cutting-edge treatments for pain relief. We offer both invasive and non-invasive options to address your specific needs:

  • Advanced Pain Interventions: Epidurals, nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation

  • Innovative Therapies: Stem cell therapy, steroid injections, pain pumps

  • Alternative/Holistic Treatments: Including CBD oil options

No matter the type of pain, its severity, or how long you've been suffering, our team can bring you relief—fast. We understand that chronic pain affects every aspect of your life, which is why we take a comprehensive approach to treatment. Join our network of thousands of satisfied patients by making an appointment today. We accept most insurance plans and are committed to providing accessible care at our Shore Drive location and beyond.
column11: Indiana Neurology & Pain Center provides the most effective and highest quality pain management and neurological care within the Greater Indianapolis area. With two convenient offices, our highly trained physicians and staff specialize in an array of cutting-edge invasive and non-invasive treatments including epidurals, nerve blocks, spinal cord stimulation, stem cell therapy, steroid injections, and pain pumps. We also offer numerous alternative/holistic treatments including CBD oil. No matter the type of pain, the severity of the pain or how long you have had the pain, our team can bring you relief--fast. Join our network of thousands of satisfied patients by making an appointment today. Insurance accepted.

column40:
My first appointment was cancelled last minute, and I was rescheduled to a time when I could not arrive an hour before the appointment -- a ridiculous requirement for first time patients. I was sent paperwork to fill out ahead of time and told to arrive 30 minutes before the appointment. I did so, and I was treated very rudely when I arrived, being told that I would have to be rescheduled again because I didn't arrive an hour before the appointment time, and then being told by the receptionist that the person on the phone shouldn't have told me that. The receptionist was equally rude to the officer manager. I don't trust this office with my care, and yes, the Shore Drive office reeks of cigarette smoke.|They DON'T answer the phone at the Westside location on Shore Drive. They receptionist DON'T do their jobs!
A referral was signed by the Dr. 2 weeks ago and they have not sent it over to the other doctor.
The people I speak with are not in the clinic , they're support staff so you can NEVER talk to anyone in the clinic. It's RIDICULOUS!
If your insurance pays for you to go somewhere else I recommend you do so!!!|I was told to arrive at 8 am for a 9am appointment, and I did so. I watched several people come in after me and go before me. I walked up to check in counter and noted my paperwork still sitting on her desk. She said I can't send you back before your apt, which was at 9am. It's now 937am and she just put my paperwork in to be seen. Very unprofessional, and it smells like cigarettes in offoce here. They didn't apologize and I can not recommend this place. 2 more were called back that came in while I was writing this and were taken back. Also, I seldom give a bad review, but she acted too rudely to me and didn't apologize as if this was OK. I will be informing the MD!!
update the exact same receptionist did it AGAIN. She said your appointment isn't until 9am even though they say be here at 8am. I was also the first one to arrive and 1st one to fill out and turn in paperwork. They then called back 3 people before me stating my Dr Jei wasn't in yet. Once back, I inquired about Dr Jei arrival and was told he was here. This receptionist told the entire office infront of me and loudly that I told her I was letting the Dr know, which I did, again. I am not sure why they allow this ridicule and hostile bullying if patients they don't like when we confront them over not putting our charts up to be seen in order of arrival and let our appointment time.
I'd like management to call me to discuss this.|My first, second and third experience with this company seemed very dysfunctional. My family doc referred me to this business for a neurology consultation. They mailed me a packet and scheduled me an appointment for the west location. I took the day off work for them to let me know they canceled my appointment and I would have to reschedule. The second day I took off and arrived at my appointment for them to tell me the appointment was at the east location. The secretary at the west office used white out to cover up the initial appointment and wrote in my next appointment at the east location. This is now the third day I have taken off work for the secretary to tell me I didn't have an appointment so she referred me to the pain management secretary to also tell me I indeed had No appointment. After them passing me back and forth they told me they found my appointment and it for next week!!!! I refused to take another day off work. I told them neurologists are a dime a dozen in this town and I'm pursuing another doctor that hopefully is competent enough to set my appointment and stick with it. Very unprofessional.|I have been going to this facility for almost 3 years now. However, This morning I had an appointment for an emg. The nurse comes and gets me and walks me to the room & it is not clean. She said I'm sorry excuse me and leaves me in the hallway while she continues to "clean" the room. I said okay and walked back to the lobby and she takes me back to the same room. It hadn't been wiped at all. The table was dirty, the bed had blood on it, and I said something to her and she just said "mhhmmhhhmmm" and I was like that was rude & she responded with I wasn't talking to you I was talking to the computer. (Conveniently)
Then Dr. Kundi comes in and says Michelle since you're having OCD let's change you to a follow up. I felt awful. It was as though I was the one being punished and I hadn't done anything except for advocate for myself. So I go to take my drug screen and went to put the cup in the compartment in the wall & I realise there's a name on another cup but not mine? I found this odd and mentioned it to the staff. One of which swore it would just be okay. I did file a complaint with the other office because this office won't do so. Today's appointment was super stressful on my body. Which in turn caused me to be in more pain. Dr. Kundi is usually super sweet but today was stern and standoffish. I get told they're swamped but that is not my fault. I am still a patient and human as they are. I stayed as calm as I possibly could under the circumstances. But the unprofessionalism I experienced today was completely uncalled for.|I have read all of the poor reviews on here and I'm confused. The only thing I would at all agree with is the answering of phones, but I've only ever the best interactions with the front office staff. Melissa Anthony has been handling my care and I'm extremely happy with it. I feel like she is the first doctor to actually listen to my concerns. Dr. Kandi has been very kind as well.
I have suffered with multiple chronic pain diseases for a number of years and I finally feel like I've found a place to help.|Very caring and very professional  Takes the time to explain my care.   Dr Kundi has improved my quality of life immensely.  The staff are very friendly and helpful.  The front desk is one of the nicest lady's I've ever spoken to.   OUTSTANDING care.|The most ghetto office I've ever been to in my life. It use to be so nice. They talk about their personal problems openly and the office manager can't even handle a complaint as he can't speak English so it's impossible to get through to him. You can get your medication though and Dr Jay is very nice

column3:
At Elkhart Clinic Pain Medicine, we specialize in comprehensive pain management solutions for patients suffering from a wide range of conditions.

Advanced Treatment Options

Our dedicated team provides minimally invasive, state-of-the-art procedures to effectively treat neck, back, and musculoskeletal sports-related injuries. We also offer specialized care for headaches, migraines, and neuropathic pain conditions. Our approach combines innovative techniques with personalized care plans to help our patients regain their quality of life and return to their daily activities pain-free.

Our Services Include:

  • Targeted pain injections and interventional procedures

  • Comprehensive headache and migraine management

  • Treatment for sports-related injuries

  • Neuropathic pain condition therapy

  • Addiction treatment services

  • Neurological consultations

Located in Mishawaka, we're committed to providing compassionate care using the latest advancements in pain medicine. Visit Elkhart Clinic Pain Medicine or call us at +1 574-296-3200 to schedule your consultation at our 6915 N Fir Rd location. We look forward to helping you find relief from chronic pain and improving your overall well-being.

column38: Bancy Mwangi|Tara Zeeb|Adrian Dennis|John Hughes|Emily Witt|Aral Ynot|Pam Messer|Stacia Weaver
column40:
My husband had severe shoulder pain for years. He saw Dr. Kazi and got an injection. We couldn't have been more happier now that he is pain free. Kudos Dr. Kazi.|I had started with Dr. Khazi Nov 2nd 2023 when I went to office I was without care due to my Dr of 5 yrs office was closed by hospital.

I told the office I was out of my script and had been without that substance that I took for 2 yrs. I hadn't had any procedures since may 2023 when the office closed.  When I went for consultation I told nurse I felt I was detoxing from meds and did not feel great.

Dr khazi prescribed a new regiment for me and I started that. By the 10th I called them saying I felt terrible. More side effects than benefits. They took me off this med and got me right in to change it up. Then a 2 wks later  (1 mth since first visit) I go in. Nurse was rudely and obviously talking to front desk ab why I was there. This appt was scheduled by them and khazi asked to see me in 2 wks but nurse said when I approached desk, "we are trying to figure out why you are here bc we can't bill your insurance every two wks. I said I had a severe reaction so he wanted to see me back in 2 wks. So they finally took me back. I said I have a terrible rash and I am not sure why. Dr khazi said you are reacting to the meds still. Took me off all and put me on a steriod.  It was Dec 14 now and I was finally feeling like myself. But pain from inflammation continued to increase while my condition was not managed. I get a text and call from my pharmacy saying Dr khazi called in my old script that I detoxed from in Oct but he only sent script for one pill. We've called them but it says their office is closed from 15th to 2nd of Jan. They did not get it fixed. Jan 2nd I called office as I asked in voicemail what date of my follow was that I lost card. No response to voicemail  on 3rd... called but no answer 3rd. Called 4th no answer. Called 5th no answer and I left another voicemail upset stating I thought my doctor would want to see me after having 2 major reactions to medication. That maybe I need a new doctor. They never returned call and they've refused to forward my records or no response states that message.

Do yourself a favor find a real specialist that cares about their patients wellbeing. More often than not you cannot talk to anyone and have to leave a vm. They did not respond to any messages. They botched the mri request and hospital had to ask them to fix it. They are not professional and they do not put the patient first.|I use to like Dr. Kazi, that until recently. Before I went on vacation I had 0 balance but when I came back my bill was over 400 dollars. I went to speak with the office about it and they absolutely refused and told me to call billing. Umm or not. I called my insurance company, because I was told my injection was covered which it technically wasn't. Which was never told to me. And this happened back in March but didn't get billed until recently. Not too mention you can't ever get anyone on the phone he's always short staffed and the staff he does have are lazy and rude. And he continuously wants to injection you and give you drugs. I don't even like to take my meds as it is. And I forgot to mention that I went for my appointment 1 day and the office was closed all because he was under staffed but didn't call his clients to inform them not to come and I was not the only client in the parking lot wondering what the heck. 

No I'm not mad about paying my bill. I'm mad about how when I went on vacation I had 0 balance and than ended up somehow having a over 400 dollar balance after returning from my trip. And not 1 person wanted to explain to me why. Besides saying call billing. I shouldn't have to your office should be able to answer these questions. And what makes me even more upset is the fact I was told the injection was covered and approved, not only discounted. That should have been explained to me before the injection. That injection was back in March and was sent to my insurance in June. Make that make sense. I had to find all this out by insurance company. Very frustrating and disappointing that I had to even leave a bad review. A simple request to answer my questions in person would have been helpful and much appreciated. Thats all I asked for. And considering the fact I was on the clock to come speak face to face about my bill and you and your staff couldn't even do that. And just an FYI I have never got upset about paying my bill ever. Thank you for your time Dr. KAZI which you'll probably ignore my email but respond to my review.

Ps my insurance company has sent in an adjustment
Have a wonderful rest of your week.|I was referred to this guy, I was awaiting major surgery on my right ankle in October and saw him for pain management.  His staff never returns phone calls, will not issue prescriptions without paying your bill in full, and several other issues.  No matter what response he provides to this review I will never see him again.  Save yourself a lot of headaches and find another doctor.|I started seeing Dr Kazi about 9 months ago. He listened to my issues and there are many! He came up with a plan, gave me options and then executed his plan pursuant to my wishes. After having back pain for 20 plus years, I finally have relief after a minimally invasive procedure was done.

When there was a procedure I did not want, he listened and did not pressure me to get it done. When I had a severe migraine for days, he had me come to the office without an appointment and gave me a treatment that got me past the headache. I could not be happier with Dr. Kazi and his staff. Jamie and Emily are compassionate, caring and understanding, as is all of the Dr.'s staff. I have never had any issues with these guys. They have been a godsend.|Dr. Kazi cured my headache! He is the way Doctors should be: honorable, honest, and having just good wholehearted intentions for the benefit of his patient's overall health. I had the longest headache I've ever experienced in my entire life. It was so awful and lasted for hours on end! After he asked me a couple of questions he gave me two medications. The first medication he gave me was apparently the latest and best thing on Earth. A very expensive medication (I looked it up afterwords). Unfortunately that didn't change anything with my headache, but he had free samples so that medication didn't cost me a cent! Finally gave me the second medication called zipsor; FOR FREE TOO!!! Thank you Doctor Kazi! In less than 20 minutes the most miraculous thing happened; MY HEADACHE COMPLETELY DISAPPEARED! I've never had a headache like that, and I've never had a headache last so long before either. Having it cured like that so quickly was nothing short of righteous! Ever since Dr. Kazi cured me I haven't had one yet and I thought I would leave this review. Dr. Kazi is an extremely kind gentleman who follows all the rules and who cares about the people he's entrusted with. I have faith that he will continue to help many other people in the future and I am just so grateful I got to meet a doctor like him. He truly is the way doctors should be|Dr. Kazi has been very professional and respectful to me. He is a joy to talk to and he listens! He did not jump into diagnosing me until he did multiple diagnostic testing. He did not try to cover the pain, but he tried to diagnose the pain and find out my reasoning for it. I praise God for finding this doctor for me. His staff has been  nothing but kind and respectful to me. I would recommend him to others with no problem. It is great having a doctor who cares.|Would recommend to anyone! He's gained control of my migraines and the shots I get for pain relief are working wonders! I left his office after an issue with staff but I had to come back because no other Dr compares! They are fixing staff issues but other than that this is THE BEST PAIN DR AROUND!

column3:
Advanced Pain Management Solutions in Indianapolis

At Center for Pain Management, we are led by Dr. Edward Kowlowitz, CEO and founder of American Pain Consortium. With over 25 years of specialized experience treating acute and chronic pain conditions, we provide comprehensive care at our facilities in Indianapolis, Lafayette, and Greenwood. Our integrated approach combines pain management clinics with complementary ambulatory surgical centers at each location. We specialize in:

  • Neuromodulation techniques

  • Spinal cord stimulator implants

  • DRG stimulators

  • Innovative pain management solutions

As a nationally recognized leader in pain management, Dr. Kowlowitz continues to research cutting-edge treatments while maintaining our core mission: alleviating suffering and recruiting exceptional physicians to serve our patients' needs. Our Indianapolis location on North Meridian Street offers convenient access to our full range of services. Visit Center for Pain Management to learn how we can help you regain control of your life through effective pain management.
column11: Dr. Edward Kowlowitz is the CEO and founder of American Pain Consortium and its affiliated pain management facilities. This includes Center for Pain Management in Indiana, which serves patients in Indianapolis, Lafayette, and Greenwood. All locations have pain management clinics and complimentary ambulatory surgical centers. Dr. Kowlowitz has over 25 years of experience treating acute and chronic pain conditions. He specializes in neuromodulation, studies spinal cord stimulator implants and DRG stimulators, continues to research into the latest innovations in pain management, and is nationally recognized in his field. His mission is to help alleviate the suffering of pain patients and to recruit exceptional physicians to serve their needs.
column38: Evon Rex|Marylou Devery|Kathy Brown|Tim Sheehan|Cherise Ynocencio-Schock|K. Russell|Charise Griffin|Stan Lawler
column40:
I would NOT recommend
Dr. Kowlowitz to anyone! This man is completely out of line and absolutely rude. The way he treated my grandmother was absolutely unacceptable. He completely lacks compassion and empathy for his patients. He don't listen to what his patients are saying in fact He would not even let her talk, he just kept interrupting her, calling her a liar. He was shouting so loud everyone out in the waiting room could hear him. If you are looking for a doctor that you can connect with and that understands you and your situation then I would suggest finding a different doctor.|Discharges patients for no reason. Even with acute pain and recovering from surgery. Jennifer Emmert doesn't listen or care. I was denied care. And they do not answer phones after hours. This place is a scam. Jennifer treats everyone like an addict. All I wanted was a hip injection. What is so addictive about that? These so called doctors are only in it for the money. There is no compassion or empathy.  Jennifer has no idea what she is doing. Maybe some patient care services training is in order.  Don't waste your time or money. Jennifer assumes everyone just wants pills...Jennifer  - I wanted a shot in my hip!!! How dare you call me an addict. Shame on you. I am suing for defamation.|This man??  was the anesthesiologist for my surgery. I met with him twice prior to surgery and he assured me that he had treated many patients with my condition, which is a rare condition. I was a naive patient but I knew the questions to ask and he had all the right answers. He tells you what he wants to, which is the protocol for a patient's condition.. My surgeon told me after I faced many difficulties following surgery that this so called Anesthesiologist, for whatever reason, did NOT FOLLOW THE NECESSARY PROTOCOL. Now I face many more unnecessary medical difficulties because of his incompetence.|At my trail I felt relief go to my arms and was totally surprised. Afterwards I realized that I still needed better control. Then I was transferred to Dr Kim
Who after reviewing charts was very uncomfortable with amount of meds in my damage location. Back to Dr K, ,his  adjustments with pump PM gave big relief when boost was used. 1st time I felt like I had some control.Good Job|I'm not sure where I reviewed him already but I was legally declared disabled by SSDI this man questioned it I haven't worked in 10 yrs and am forced by my insurance to go to him. So apparently every Dr I saw before was wrong.  This man has a God complex and zero empathy cause apparently only he knows. At this point I pray he just let's me get my RFA then I will go out of network cause I'm not asking for drugs just a Dr that helps. He NEVER even introduced himself I didn't know his name til this survey|Save yourself lots of time and $$ by avoiding this place at all costs. The "Dr", "Anesthesiologist" or whatever titles she claimed to hold, came across as snooty and lacking any compassion for my situation. Didnt even bother to introduce herself upon walking into the room. Judging by her appearance, i could tell immediately where her priorities lay. She showed absolutely no concern for my pain, and when I left I felt like i had just left a car dealership. The place is just concerned with one thing. You guessed it...the ring of the cash register!|I had gone through years and years, surgical procedures after surgical procedures at OrthoIndy. Then I was recommended to Dr. K. by my PCC. I was very skeptical going to a new pain management and the thought of starting from scratch again. But that didnt happen. His team started treating me and FINALLY a Dr that got to the root of my problem. Today I am pain free and hugged this man. I was so happy to get the relief I had been needing for so long. Highly recommend this group.|I've been going here for awhile and am happy with the treatment.  You have to realize how these Dr's hands are tied with pain management laws.  The Gov't has gone way too far to fix a "problem" that isn't with patients going to certified Dr's and taking meds as prescribed, It's with "patients" seeking out pain meds on the street and not realizing that they can be mixed with Fentanyl.  Or "patients" going to heroin because they aren't getting the high anymore from a couple of opioids. We just have ro hope the Drs are treating their patients as best as they can within all these new "opioid crisis" laws.  And that's what the Center for Pain Manager does.  They treat us as best they can. The PA I see (Ted) is caring and will make adjustments to prescriptions,  when warranted,  and he doesn't make predetermined judgements on patients seeking pain relief.

column40:
My wife just got out of the hospital for a week due to intractable back pain. This joke of a pain clinic wouldn't even write her an emergency prescription to get her to her appt time due to a drug test not being back for over 3 weeks. Seems like they lost it due to negligence and now are taking it out on my wife. Brittany is a joke of a Nurse Practitioner who can't see that patient care comes first. I plan on showing up to see if I can speak to Dr Aziz in person to untangle the mess of negligence and poor management.

Update- it's 10 days later and she misses her appt by 1 hour due to the poor scheduling issues by the clinic. They discharged her from the clinic altogether when there have not been any issues with anything else. Again Brittany is a menace on mental health care and shouldn't be allowed in a pain clinic anymore|Dr Harries has been treating my husband for awhile now. We find him to be very knowledgeable, and yes very serious. He has absolutely done everything that he knows to help my husband. He has been kind to us. I do not agree with the clinic not prescribing pain meds, because they do. and yes they test and keep up with your meds. They have all been so nice and accommodating to us. The pain clinic where we live is a pill mill. We wanted help, not more pills to get addicted to. We came to deaconess and glad we did. Treating chronic pain is so hard to figure out and Dr Harries has tried so hard with my husband. Yes, some Doctors do not have great bedside manners, but the level of care is what we're looking for.|This is an update. I called to make an appointment to see Doc Frank only to be told he is no longer with West Side pain Clinic. I want to say this man is a Jewel in the desert of Doctors that think patients are just numbers. He always took the time to help me and my spouse in any needs we had. I have had such a improvement in my life since I started seeing him some SIX years ago. They will not say what happened to him, to me that implies it was not his choice. He will be missed at the West Side. Love ya Doc :(
As a side note Frank is still in Evansville.|They're very professional and have never let me down . Thank you Dr. Aziz .    Patient R. Givens|Worst experience with a doctors office I've ever had. I'm fully aware I need to lose some weight but I've never had any back issues prior to this. I had an accident 4 months ago and I'm dealing with a lot of lower back and hip pain. Dr Harries basically told me I need to lose weight and because I have hypothyroidism there's nothing they can do besides have me lose weight. I have a compression fracture on t12 and a bulged disk between l4 and l5. He tried to send me for an MRI of my brain for a "pituitary gland tumor" because I have hypothyroidism and a sleep study. I don't sleep well because of pain, not because I have sleep apnea.  Absolutely a waste of my time. I will never go back. AVOID AVOID AVOID if you don't want to leave in tears.|Suffer from Trigeminal Neurapathy or facial pain. My life completely changed after a routine dental procedure when my wisdom teeth were removed. Went to several doctors in St. Louis and was like a zombie due to all the drugs given to me. I believe my doctors gave up. Heard of a special procedure that can be done to the facial nerves from a lady in Australia, who has the same condition as me. This lead me to Dr Macdonnell and Deaconess Pain Management.
I can not say enough good things about Dr Macdonnell and the whole staff really. He thinks outside the box and genuinely cares. I had a somewhat unusual surgery last year and have improved a lot. I don't know where I would be if I had not met these great people.|Worst experience with a doctor by far. He only recommended neck infections for a vertebrae being moved out and slightly twisted. My insurance wouldn't approve them because they said it is not medically necessary. Doctor Sridhar Bhaskara, MD told me there are no other options and to come back when I have a better job with insurance or when I get better insurance that will approve them. Saying all this without even telling me how much said injections are or asking if I could even afford them. Very degrading. This place is a joke!|If I could give this place a 0 I would. I have been prescribed medication for osteoarthritis, degenerative disc disease, several bulges, a bone tumor in my shoulder, and stenosis down my entire spine. The doctor basically said my pain was due to anxiety and depression. I have ALWAYS had anxiety and depression and that is being treated by a doctor who is qualified to make decisions about my mental health, NOT Dr. Harries. Don't waste your time going here unless you like being treated like garbage and sent out the door untreated.

Dr. Schneider is a talented physician.  He has helped reduce and eliminate my pain.  He listens to what I have to say and pinpoints the issue (s).  I have been a patient of his for at least 10 years and would recommend his services to anyone who wants their pain issues resolved.|Kristin is such an amazing Doctor..very caring listening to everything you have going on and most importantly she is so concerned with your overall wellbeing!!|Dr Schneider and his team.
I was blown away by the friendliness from start to finish.
Dr Schneider was straight forward, honest and clear on what was to do immediately and ahead of time. He clearly explained why it was needed and how we were going to get there. The shot in my knee was in and out without discomfort and overall, I could not feel better, or more confident. An easy 5 stars.

The support staff, starting with the receptionist, are so sweet, friendly and efficient, the nurses and office staff, simply amazing in demeanor, efficiency and emphasis.

They even arranged transportation for me, going way out on what can be expected.

I'm picky when it comes to my health care, but I am definitely recommending this Dr and team, you cannot find any better than Dr Schneider.     Thank you|I have been going to HH pain management a little over a year. I would not go anywhere else. Adam is well educated as a CRNA, one of the best I've seen. column40: Dr Rutledge is a good listener & carefully reviewed a recent scan & neurosurgeon's notes to make a corresponding treatment plan. His staff is pleasant & engaged, making everything goes quickly & smoothly. I would definitely recommend seeing Dr. Rutledge to find a way forward if you're in pain & need help managing it.|Dr.Rutledge has been a great Pain Management Doctor he has always had my best interest at heart I can't say enough good things about him. Well the bad part of the review is his NP Aimee Neal was the rudest medical professional I've ever had to deal with I had my wife and grand daughter in the room because I just had surgery 3 days ago this lady didn't want to give me the prescription Dr.Rutledge had previously written and pushed Narcan on me saying I was going to die and my family would be paying the price for me refusing she yelled this btw as well as letting me know she would never see me again or anyone in the office then left telling the nursing staff as well as any patient walking by my business which last time I checked is breaking patient doctor privileges I politely asked her to please stop putting my name in the dirt her story was her story and mine was mine then she starts yelling saying stop yelling at me like I was yelling in other words causing a seen I continued to wait at the exit desk hoping for answers from Dr.Rutludge when they had a receptionist poor lady bring me exit paperwork saying I would no longer be seen at any pain management facilities I am very saddened by the whole event wish the Dr. would review cameras and ask me my side of the story Goodluck Dr.Rutledge it was a pleasure being under your care|Dr Rutledge is a very good doctor who communicates well with innovative treatments. Have been a patient for several years and would highly recommend|I've had several surgeries by Dr Kowlowitz and Dr Rutledge throughout the last 20 years. I've had great surgical outcomes with good pain relief. However, I've been struggling with pain for the last 5 years and feel I'm not getting much pain relief because of other new and emerging health conditions developing. Chronic pain is no fun! The staff & Docs are thoughtful and good at the pain center.|Dr Rutledge is very knowledgeable, considerate, and helps you know what is going on with your X-rays, MRI's. I have back issues that I have had for years. He told me about new procedures called MILD, an outpatient procedure on my back. After the surgery I I went 55% usage of my back to 85% better.|Dr. Rutledge and the other doctors and faculty at the center for pain management in Lafayette have always done their best to put a dent and/or completely stop my chronic pain from my many pain bearing diagnosis'. I have complete faith in the team and am extremely thankful to have them in my life. Giving me my life back so I can better raise my daughter and live almost completely pain free. Thank you for all of your help, support and abilities.|Dr. Joseph C. Rutledge has been by far the best pain and nerve problem issues Doctor that I have been very fortunate and lucky to have treating my many problematic issues. My age is probably the biggest problem causing starting point. Dr. Rutledge starts with my worst ares and proceeds from there. I trust him with my life. I would highly recommend  Dr. Rutledge to any of my family members and or friends in a heart beat. He is a very busy doctor but he has never once not answered many of my concerns. Thank you Doctor Joseph C. Rutledge I certainly appreciate your expertise and kindness. I'll see you next month at the Surgery Center!|Dr. Rutledge is excellent. He went above and beyond for me to find the root of my issues. He is compassionate and empathetic to his patients. Hands down one of the best doctors I know.

Has always been direct and professional. Very quick but thorough and always listens to your concerns and polite. Highly recommend. Also respect having to be accountable for meds/ Tests.Also he truly cares and has resources if there is a problem instead of just handing out drugs and sending you on your way which I experienced last few Dr's I've interacted with. Much respect for him and his staff. Always been a pleasant experience for me personally|I have been seeing Dr feng since he was my family Dr. He is knowledgeable and is good to me always.|If not for Dr Feng & Stacey Engle I would not be the mother or person I am today they have been with me every step of my almost 4 years in sobriety, also adding this is the longest I've ever been clean! They are very in tune with their patients as well as get to know them on a personal level! They ask about my kids all the time & my successes that I've achieved in my time with them! I'll never go anywhere else for my treatment & the 1 time I did I was done so wrong & immediately got back to my original treatment Doctor which was Dr. Feng! These people helped me become a person I thought I could never be again & for this I'm forever grateful! I have recommended them to many people & will continue to do so because I truly believe they care & want to help people!

PS these people who I've been with since the beginning give me more hell than I ever deserved for having the length of sobriety I have & I feel so sorry for anyone that he's throws out to the wolves because while moving from 1 town to another he felt it would be best not to give me a script to hold me over until I could see my doctor even after seeing & explaining that I'd had enough of the awful treatment & this is Dr. Feng's doings. I hope he's very proud of his self because he left me to have withdrawals, seizures, & even more but I won't go into any more details. I will WARN ANYONE WGO GOES HERE TO BE VERY CAREFUL ABOUT HAVING BO RESPECT FOR YOU, YOU'RE LIFE OR IF YOU DIE OR NOT!|Have been treated professionally and with respect for years.  I understand wait times can be long, but if you are a good patient and honest, you are treated with respect and dignity. I owe a lot to Dr Feng for saving my life and taking me on as a patient. The NPs are great too!|For those who actually follow the rules, and aren't there to abuse the dr, it's a wonderful resource. Dr Feng is thorough,  clear instructing, and patient.  He actually cares! Some of the previous NPCs are no longer there, but it's still an incredible resource.|As other reviews has started, this office is not for the chronically disabled/ill. Even if your primary physician refers you to this clinic, in our experience, it is purely due to them accepting your insurance. They "manage medication not pain". They promote this in their patient bill of rights that their patients are treated with dignity and respect. That appears far from the truth. Instead a veteran was treated as an addict- without his knowledge mind you-  verses a patient that is prescribed opioids for pain management. This will  now be in his medical history, and potentially affect his experiences in other medical facilities that may have access to these notes/documentation. What is frustrating is that after the initial appointment ethically Dr.Feng and his nurse practitioner had an obligation to inform the patient that he was not a proper candidate for their scope of practice. Instead, they proceeded to prescribe an opioid that is specifically created for opioid addiction- not for chronic pain. After extended use of said prescription, pain was still unmanaged and little solution was provided. After seeking a second opinion, we began to ask questions regarding to why they felt this specific drug was appropriate only to learn his status as an addict per their charting. I find this behavior negligent, appalling, and unprofessional. I seriously recommend if you are seeking a pain clinic for a disability or illness- this is not the place for you.|They're the best pain Management group I have ever been to. I usually schedule mornings so there's no wait. Stacy Engel is the nurse practitioner who takes care of me and she says sweet and caring, she takes care of my needs for pain. Would recommend this place to anyone.|Not professional. Like to accuse my spouse of steeling my medication. As he stated hi staff are always right and the patient is always wrong.  I believe his practice on State Road 135. Opioid management group needs to be investigated. DONT GO THERE

  • Innovative interventional procedures

  • Supportive care throughout your treatment journey

  • Community support resources as needed

Our dedicated team is committed to evaluating and supporting your condition with the goal of helping you achieve a better quality of life. We invite you to learn more about our services by visiting our website at Pain Centers of Iowa or calling us at +1 563-344-1050. Located at 5515 Utica Ridge Rd in Davenport, IA, we're here to help you reclaim your life from pain.
column11:
Pain Centers of Iowa, P.C. focuses on the causes of pain, which determine the best interventions and paths to take so patients can get their lives back. Not every patient has the same response to pain-physically or emotionally. Your pain is personal to you. We want to help you achieve a better quality of life.

The staff at Pain Centers of Iowa, P.C. is here to evaluate and support your condition through innovative interventions combined with community support as may be indicated. Dr. John Dooley has been treating pain for 25 years and continues to be a pioneer in the field of pain management. He believes that "it is important to be technologically prepared in this evolving challenge to keep patients ahead of their pain.

column40: I can't say enough good things about this clinic and its amazing team! From the moment I walked in, I felt welcomed and truly cared for. column38: MARK BLOCK|Vincent White|Debbie Baldwin|TOBY KUMM|Irene Wilson|Donna Campbell|Randi Lea|Anon Zeta
column40:
I like my provider, Karla Stapes NP, but the receptionists at the front desk are sadly lacking in courtesy and friendly reception. I have experienced on numerous visits to see my provider. Having been less than 10 minutes past my slotted appointment time, the front staff needs to understand the complicated and malfunctioning processs we as patients must go through before we arrive at the clinic. First, the parking lot is repeatedly full in both regular and Handicapped parking spots, with overflow parked alongside the curbs in both front, side, and rear locations, with numerous cars waiting while idling to get the next available spot. Second, although tge online checkin is my preferred, partially bc I can thereby avoid the front desk receptionists, the Kiosk at the front door to the reception area appeared to be malfunctioning and wouldn't accept my input. So as my last option, which used to be my first when the clinic was on 2nd Floor, I went to the counter and was received with "We may have to reschedule your appointment..." followed by a snarky redhead at the end of the counter. The same redhead that was complaining out loud about having to work, I overheard while waiting for my appointment with Karla last time! Perhaps, it might be time the front desk receptionists perform a different task within the office. Unfortunately, negativity is contagious, as is positivity, and I shouldn't have to leave for my appointment earlier than I already do. I realize these are difficult times, but when the clinic was on 2nd Floor, sharing the office with PT, the reception area was filled with positivity, smiles, and friendly receptionists, of which I often smiled and said "Thank you for being so nice!" Not quite sure why that has changed, other than experience has taught me that it only takes "one bad apple" to ruin the cart. Thank you Dr. Patel and Karla Stapes for the service you provide us.|Checking in was simple and easy.  The staff was extremely friendly.  My nurse (Shara) was pleasantly nice.  Dr. Xu walked me through the procedure, asked plenty of questions regarding my current pain and past pain. The procedure (epidural C5 / C6) itself was pain free.|Maddie was wonderful. Very kind listening to all our concerns and sent us in the right directions for pain relief.|I have been a patient at this clinic for over 6 years.  Originally, I felt as if their service and treatment was adequate.  About a couple years ago things started to go downhill very quickly.  It started taking forever to get anything done and every appointment took far too much time.  In fact about 2 years ago I arrived for a scheduled treatment time where I waited in the lobby for over 45 minutes past my appointment time before I was called back.  I waited in the exam room for an hour without the doctor coming in to see me before I walked out without receiving my scheduled treatment.  No one from the office called to ask any questions as to why I left and still haven't.  I know laws with some  medications this clinic prescribes have changed recently but it doesn't seem they are concerned with any sort of customer service regarding their patients.  I understand why there are laws regarding timing of scripts but I don't understand why they aren't able to figure out a better system for refilling them in a timely manner that is compliant with laws.  Also, I know they could purchase software to help their process which could almost eliminate handwritten refill scripts or the need for patients to make a monthly trip there just to pick up the script but they haven't agreed to purchase it.  I don't believe it would take too long for them to recoup the $100k it costs for this program.  There is NO reason we shouldn't be able to expect them to complete a refill request within 24 to 48 hours but I've had times where it took over TEN business days!  Then, I'm told I should do a better job of remembering when to request my refill to get it on time and I generally request it over a week out.  Absolutely awful!!  I'm in the process of looking for a different clinic and hope I won't have to deal with this place again!|This department at the Iowa Clinic is so frustrating to deal with. The staff that greets you are lovely. And Dr Gates is, I think, doing the best she can, but she's the only doctor there. I had to literally badger them to get MRI results that were a week old. I called on Friday and was told someone would call me. No one did. I called on Monday at 10AM and the staffer said she would put the request in and mark it urgent. I waited until 4:00, knowing they close at 4:30, and was told she would send the request again marked "urgent". I called a third time at 4:29 and she said she would request that someone call me tomorrow. I was SO frustrated, didn't use bad language but voiced my frustration. A little before 5:00 the doctor finally called me. This department is giving Iowa Clinic a bad name. I haven't had issues with other departments there, but Pain Management needs some attention.|I came here having moved from NC to St Charles Iowa. I am on medicine and of course it's mandatory to come every 90 days. While the visit was OK, I don't think that the tech or Dr are very compassionate people. May just be their personality. I am surely missing my NC Pain Clinic doctor. They cared for you no matter how long it took.|Let me start by saying that I LOVE TIC. I simply, HATE, LOATHE, AND DESPISE the pain clinic. My first appointment mlthey called my name, turns out 2 Randi/Randy. Apparently they didn't look at the chart to see that they wanted a male and I infact was a female or even in the current time, verify the last name. So I was taken back to see a doctor that had never seen my records and was confused as hell for the 20 minutes he spent with me. My 2nd appointment I saw the PA, and she acted as though it was my first ever visit to any TIC office, and switched me off my meds that were controlling pain to something different to try. I tried it didn't work. I wound up in the ER because my pain was excruciating. I call to get in to go back on my old med was told I couldn't get in for over a month! After yelling, I was suddenly able to been seen after a long and miserable 2 weeks for a steroid injection (mind you I told yhem on the phone that I was given oral steroids but they said to come in it wouldn't be a problem). I go in and paid my $75 co-pay to be told that no, they can't do the injection to come back in another 2 weeks. Injection was fine, but the doctoe that actually oreformed the procedure is rude and acted like I should tell him how wonderful he was for just seeing me at all. He also told me that I don't need the medications or PT if I would simply do easy at home stretches every day like he does. He actually told me that PT is just a way for the clinic to make money off of people who are willing to do anything due to pain. I go in for another appoitment to follow-up after my injection and again was treated as though I was a new patient. I asked to be put back on the medication I was on when I previously was taking that had completely managed my pain and was tokd to simply take more of the current medication.
This is my third month dealing with this clinic and I'm done! I called in my Rx the required 10 days ahead of time and mysteriously that request wasn't sent back. They mark it as urgent because I'm overdue for my medication now and while they got it for me, they couldn't call to let me know it was ready or give me an estimated time on when to call back, was simply told to call back later in the day. I was in pain and it was getting worse by the minute, broke down and asked them to havea nurse call me to let me know if I should go to the ER or if they wanted me to tey something different. When I called back 3 hours later for the Rx, I still hadn't heard from a nurse. I blew up. I couldn't walk down a 10 foot hallway without crying and stopping to take a break. I needed to know if they had any kind of fix before forking out the $300 co-pay for an ER visit. I again stated my problems to the woman on the phone while crying in pain and magically a nurse WAS available to take my call and it wouldn't take the 24 hours previously stated to get a call back. I was told to go to the ER. Which leads me to today. Obviously, I need to get in to see the PA, but when I called before closing I was put into a call queue and held for roughly 10 minutes before 4:30 arrived and it dumped my call into some voicemail system that I was unable to leave a message with instead of the people on staff clearing the queue before leaving. To say the least my review would be to stay clear of this clinic. The staff is rude, uncaring, unprofessional, and just plain awful. I will be going in to see my amazingly wonderful family practitioner at TIC on Monday to get a referral to literally any pain specialist that isn't with TIC. Sadly, with the organization being capable of employing staff as awful as what they do in their pain clinic, I'm seriously considering finding a different clinic for all of my needs. I'm disappointed to say the least. If you're ever revered to this office, run away and find someone else. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY OR YOUR TIME ON THIS SUPPOSED PAIN SPECIALIST CLINIC. All they will do is take your money, cause you mental and physical pain above and beyond what you already have from whatever chronic ailments send you here.|Pretty sure the rating and the comments speak for themselves, if you want a 2 star "woke" doctor that does nothing for you hit this place up lol!  The nurse I spoke with speaks down to you like she does her husband and kids from what I imagine.

column3:
Specialized Pain Relief in Council Bluffs

At Bluffs Pain Management, we specialize in providing comprehensive treatment for both acute and chronic pain conditions in adults throughout Council Bluffs, Iowa. Our practice is led by board-certified anesthesiologist Dr. Andrew Huff, who implements a multidisciplinary approach to pain management using advanced interventional and nonsurgical strategies. Our facility is equipped with cutting-edge diagnostic technologies that allow us to accurately identify the root causes of persistent pain conditions. We offer specialized treatment plans for a variety of painful conditions, including:

  • Back and neck pain

  • Joint pain and arthritis

  • Spinal stenosis

  • Sciatica

  • Fibromyalgia

We're committed to developing personalized pain management solutions that address each patient's unique needs. Visit our website at Bluffs Pain Management or call us at 712-256-3511 to schedule a consultation at our convenient location at 201 Ridge St, Suite 102, Council Bluffs, IA.

Pain management plans are available for a variety of painful conditions, including arthritis, spinal stenosis, sciatica, and fibromyalgia.

column40:
I have been seeing Dr. Szczepanek for over 3 years now. He is the BEST pain specialist I have ever been to. Very intelligent, friendly, compassionate, and has improved my quality of life greatly! His PA Christy is exactly the same!! Very thorough and is a great listener. All of the rest of the staff from the nurses to the front desk staff are all kind and helpful. I have recommended the group to my friends and family and I also highly recommend them to anyone else who is suffering in pain and wants to be heard, taken seriously, and wants to see results!!|Could not say better things about this clinic. I moved to Cedar Rapids from Des Moines this past summer, and have continued to make that drive to see Dr. Szczepanek and his team because of their speed and quality of service. In CR, I have to wait 3-4 months to get seen just for a consultation for service at any other clinic. At Central States? They offered me a next day appointment! I have done injections both with anesthesia and without, and each time Dr. Szczepanek made me feel 100% comfortable with the procedures. I also appreciate how real he is with me - my first consultation he told me I would probably need surgery, but he would do the best he could. One year later, I'm scheduling surgery, but the multiple injections I've gotten have helped me make it through this year without being entirely bedridden. Thank you, Central States, for your amazing care team and attention to my pain! I never once felt like my pain was ignored or minimized. I cannot recommend this clinic enough!|I have been a patient with this clinic for many years. The staff is amazing and always take care of my needs. I would highly recommend them to anyone suffering from chronic pain. Christy Haack is awesome. She definitely is in tune with my pain, and does everything she can to make my pain bearable. Overall, this clinic is top notch, and I would definitely recommend them.|I was diagnosed with multiple herniated discs, so I had to come here for an intra spinal injection for pain relief. The scheduling was easy and there was barely any wait time. The doctor listened to and addressed my concerns. The building is clean & my procedure went smoothly. I'm extremely grateful for the care I received & I will be returning for a follow up and future injections as necessary.|Very negative experience, my husband was getting an injection, I heard him holler in pain from the next room, I got concerned so I went to stand in front of the door of his procedure room, and I heard the doctor say to my husband, if you don't stop your bullshit this will be your last visit. When my husband came in the original waiting room with me to tell me what he heard the doctor say, the nurse came in the room and stood behind him and said that is inappropriate, the conversation was between my husband and I and of course he got a bit agitated. We ended up leaving very confused.|I had another appt.  at Central States Pain Clinic last week.   Again my experience was positive.   Not because my pain was completely relieved, rather, because I was heard, my concerns were taken seriously and I was offered options beyond acetaminophen.
I am so grateful for the team of Caring health care providers at this office.|This clinic is the real deal. They include you in the med planning. They try to do the very best at managing you pain without putting your life at risk. They explain everything to you. They have multiple treatments available to you. I highly recommend this clinic and the staff!|This place has helped me through the worst times of my life.  Not just helping to be more active and pain free, but understanding and helpful on a personal level.  They have been compassionate and helpful through death close to me and without them I'm not sure where I would be.  They know ME. Not just what's wrong with me.  I will always be grateful for them. The care they give is a rare thing.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Solutions in Des Moines

At Metro Anesthesia & Pain Management, we provide effective chronic pain relief at our two convenient locations in West Des Moines and Des Moines, Iowa. Our practice specializes in treating a variety of musculoskeletal conditions through our innovative in-office approach, which significantly reduces co-pays and deductible costs for our patients. Our team of board-certified anesthesiologists and pain management specialists takes an interactive approach to addressing chronic pain conditions, particularly focusing on:

  • Neck pain management

  • Back pain treatment

  • Knee pain relief

  • Comprehensive musculoskeletal care

We believe in combining multiple treatment modalities to not only alleviate symptoms but repair the underlying causes of pain for long-term relief. Our in-office setting allows us to provide personalized care while maintaining cost-effectiveness for our patients. For more information about our services or to schedule an appointment, visit our website at Metro Anesthesia & Pain Management or call us at +1 515-261-7246.
column11:
At its two locations in West Des Moines and Des Moines, Iowa, Metro Anesthesia & Pain Management offers chronic pain sufferers effective solutions for a variety of musculoskeletal conditions in a convenient in-office setting. The practice's dedication to in-office treatments results in fewer co-pays and deductible costs for their patients.
An interactive approach to pain management is at the core of Metro Anesthesia & Pain Management's approach. The board-certified anesthesiologists and pain management specialists offer multiple modalities to effectively relieve chronic pain, including in the neck, back, and knees.
Using a combination of treatments can help repair the underlying cause of pain for long-term relief.

column3:
At Iowa Ortho Des Moines, Dr. J. Wesley Rayburn brings exceptional credentials to our pain management practice. A summa cum laude graduate with a background in electrical engineering, Dr. Rayburn combines technical precision with compassionate care.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions

With over 2,400 procedures performed during his specialized fellowships in biodesign and pain management, we offer expertise in:

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Advanced therapeutic interventions

  • Regenerative orthopedic procedures

  • Innovative pain management techniques

Our approach integrates Dr. Rayburn's unique background in both engineering and medicine, allowing us to deliver precise, effective solutions for patients suffering from chronic pain conditions. Located in downtown Des Moines at 450 Laurel St A, we welcome patients seeking relief through our evidence-based treatments. Contact us at (515) 247-8400 or visit Dr. Wesley Rayburn at Iowa Ortho to learn more about our services.
column11: Dr. Rayburn earned a bachelor's degree in electrical engineering from the University of Mississippi, graduating summa cum laude and receiving the prestigious Taylor Medal. He attended medical school there before completing a general surgery internship and a physical medicine & rehabilitation residency at the University of Missouri, where he became known for his innovation and energy. He also completed fellowships in biodesign and pain management, performing over 2,400 procedures. In Des Moines, Dr. Rayburn applies his expertise to comprehensive pain management, focusing on personalized care, therapy, and regenerative orthopedics. He enjoys road trips and medical innovation.
