column40:
I had an ablation with Dr. Rayburn today. The new Riverhills center is very nice. Everyone there was kind and attentive. Dr. Rayburn described the procedure and asked if I had any questions. It went quickly and I am looking forward to the pain relief.|I liked Dr Rayburn. He had reviewed my MRI, X-rays and other doctors' documentation.  He was ready for my appointment. He was very thorough and evaluated what I needed and what he needed to do. He was very positive and confident. His demeanor exuded a high level of caring and compassion. He emphasized the need to concentrate on relief in the first hours after the epidural as well as the long term relief providing feedback for future treatment.|Dr. Rayburn, aside from procedures, has never spent more than a few minutes speaking to me. He definitely failed to warn me of one potential downside to nerve ablation, which resulted in significant pain increase after right side. Although I contacted his office a few days after with concerns, his nurse called in meds I already take and offered ibuprofen, which conflicts with a medication I take. My medication is well documented in their files, including time of last dose by med prior to first ablation.
Today, I left without doing the left side ablation. He indicated my pain increase only happens about 1% of the time, but it could happen again with the left side- and this pain can last for 3 weeks?! In addition to the pain I have, this would cause me to need possibly 3 weeks off work unplanned. He was rushed, and seemed more concerned with getting to the next patient and said he would do the next in line while I thought about it. It felt like he had an assembly line of patients...
I dressed and left immediately. The pain had me literally crawling at home at points over the last week. This should have been discussed up front, at proactively offered to be rescheduled when I called to report pain I was NOT told could happen.
Now I will be seeking a second opinion with DMOS, and this caused a likely significant delay in my care.|I think Dr Rayburn is an excellent doctor he's got an excellent bedside manner and I really like him o|De Rayburn is the most compassionate Dr I have seen so far regarding my back pain! I have had several pain injections and yesterday I had a Radio frequency ablation on my Thoracic spine. Though the sedation they used didn't work well for me, I am very hopeful that this procedure will give me relief. If it works I would love for him to do my lumbar area- I have had very severe pain for several years. I am seeing Dr Rayburn as my only hope for less pain and a better level of living life! I highly recommend him and his staff is amazingly kind and helpful! Big thumbs up Dr Rayburn!!!|The cortisone in my left hip helps but I need a few days off work for the agony from the injections to go away but he won't give me a work excuse for any time off. I can't even get out of bed to use the bathroom but I'm expected to go to work. If it weren't for the relief I got from the bursa injection last time I wouldn't go through the pain but he hits the right spot and his staff a very kind. I just need 2 days off work after the procedure. Otherwise I'd give 5 star. Pluss I need something to bite down on to help the pain from the extremely painful procedure.|I have been to numerous Doctors for the extreme pain in my back and Dr.Rayburn has given me the most relief.  When he did shots in my back to help take away the pain, I did not even feel the needles, he was that smooth and concerned about my pain.  I would most highly recommend him to anyone.|Dr. Rayburn and the Staff at Iowa Ortho have been a Godsend for me!
Had hip injection elsewhere and suffered horrifically during and after procedure.
Have had two injections now from Dr. Rayburn and I can tell you the man knows what he's about.
While not a completely painless process he does it with competence and skillful care so as to make you as comfortable as possible.
Would recommend him to anyone needing an injection.
Thank You Dr. Rayburn and Staff
***Had another injection on 6/30/2021***
Same Professionalism from Dr. Rayburn as per usual.
The Nurse that I had on this Visit was Absolutely Wonderful! All of the Nurses are Polite and Professional, but this particular Nurse deserves an Extra Special Shout Out from me! She was Above and Beyond in Personality and Professionalism. So Very Compassionate and Empathetic with me that I have to let everyone know how Exceptional she is and Deserves the Recognition!

column3:
At Central Iowa Pain and Wellness in Ames, Iowa, we combine cutting-edge technology with expert care to create a premier destination for regenerative medicine. Our state-of-the-art facility at 400 Main St serves patients throughout central Iowa with innovative solutions for chronic pain and wellness concerns.

Advanced Regenerative Treatments

We specialize in a comprehensive array of regenerative therapies including:

  • PRP (Platelet-Rich Plasma) therapy for joint pain and aesthetic procedures

  • Softwave treatments for accelerated tissue healing

  • Customized Peptide protocols for optimal recovery

  • Functional wellness plans tailored to individual needs

Our compassionate practitioners utilize diagnostic ultrasound technology to precisely identify problem areas and deliver targeted treatments. Each patient's healing journey is approached with meticulous care and personalized attention. Visit Central Iowa Pain and Wellness or call us at (515) 468-2427 to discover how we can help restore your true vitality and get you back to living pain-free.

Our state-of-the-art facility and compassionate practitioners ensure that each healing journey unfolds with precision and care. At Central Iowa Pain and Wellness, true vitality is restored. At The Iowa Clinic, we're proud to have Dr. Jun Xu as part of our exceptional pain management team. After completing both his residency in anesthesiology and fellowship in pain management at the University of Iowa Hospitals and Clinics, Dr. Xu joined our practice, drawn by our strong primary care foundation and experienced management team.

Comprehensive Pain Management Services

Dr. Xu specializes in treating chronic pain conditions through a multifaceted approach that addresses the physical, emotional, spiritual, and social aspects of pain. We understand that chronic pain presents unique challenges in healthcare due to its prevalence and resistance to traditional treatments. Our services include:

  • Specialized pain injections with minimal discomfort

  • Comprehensive pain management consultations

  • Personalized treatment plans for chronic conditions

  • Compassionate, patient-focused care

Located at 5950 University Ave in West Des Moines, our team is committed to providing high-standard, patient-centered care. Learn more about Dr. Xu's approach to pain management by visiting Dr. Jun Xu at The Iowa Clinic or call us at (515) 875-9902 to schedule your consultation.
column11:
Jun Xu, MD, PhD joined The Iowa Clinic after finishing both his residency in anesthesiology and fellowship in pain management at the University of Iowa Hospitals and Clinics. He was impressed with our strong primary care and experienced management team. It was also important for him to begin his practice with a group who provided high-standard patient-focused care.

Chronic pain is a unique challenge in healthcare due to its prevalence and resistance to traditional treatment approaches. However, it can negatively affect a patient's life in so many aspects, including physically, spiritually, emotionally, and socially. Dr.

column38: Shannon Chase|erin swisher|William Keesler|krazy-kahleesi 7|Brena Corona|Jennifer Stillions|Kathy Kath- Kinsella|Annie Paul
column40:
I don't recommend this clinic. I went with my husband to his appointment that he was referred to and we were literally told I'm not sure why you're even here by Dr. Smith. My husband has chronic shoulder pain that he has been dealing with for years. Capital Orthopaedics said they would do surgery but unfortunately my husband can't have it till 2025 due to work issues. That being said Capital referred him to this clinic for pain management in the meantime. He asked for tramadol until he can have his surgery to manage the pain and she said no she would not help with that and referred us back to Capital. Waste of time and money. I would not be seen at this clinic as they are rude and not helpful at all. I put 1 star as I had no choice so I can post this. Zero stars all around.|I have been rejected TWICE by this clinic saying my chronic pelvic pain caused by stage FOUR Endometriosis doesn't qualify to be treated. I have had 6 surgeries, one of them was FIFTEEN hours long, and i still am in chronic daily pain. So much pain that when i go to the ER and get Fentanyl that doesn't even take away the pain. This is my daily life. How dare you reject my case saying I am not in chronic pain. Your website specifically says you treat pelvic pain. You should be ashamed of yourselves.|I've been dealing severe back pain for years and when my doctor referred me to pain specialist. I had an MRI in 2022 that showed the issue with my back. I had 3 injections and they didn't last over a month at most, plus I couldn't move for a couple days after getting the injections. Had 2 nerve blocks and then the nerve ablations, I couldn't hardly move for almost a week after that ordeal. I guess I was charged an outrageous co-pay at Westlake Surgery Center, in the same building and affiliated with Pain Specialist, and we live on SS and SSD and was stunned when I got the bill for my co-pay. I didn't have the extra money then and I don't have it now. My back pain has gotten significantly worse, usually have to roll out of bed, can't stand for long at all, feels like I have boiling water flowing from my back to my feet and sometimes clear to my toes, and it's now on the point of being unbearable. Now sometimes I can be walking and every once in a while one leg or the other won't get the message to move. Needless to say I've fallen flat on my face a several times. Now I get muscle cramps any time I try to do anything and quite often when it's one of those days that I can't hardly move. The days I can't hardly move and then I get the. Muscle cramps so intense it's unbearable because I can't get up and move around. I can't remember how many times I've been to pt and had x-rays. Like I said, I had an MRI 2 years ago, I used to be 5'10" but now I'm just over 5'6." So I went back to the pain center and she had NO EMPATHY. I had done some research and talked to 3 other people about my issues in my back and the severe muscle cramps, sometimes in my chest, and every one of them said that I needed to get off the gabapentin asap. They said that they take the same exact medications as I do and the gabapentin is the culprit for the cramping. But she said that I would have to jump thru all the hoops, x-rays, pt,and then another MRI, that we can't afford. The 3 other people I talked to said that their doctor weaned them off the gabapentin and prescribed them hydrocodone, one in the morning and one at night. They said that they were able to get thru the day with their chores and be able to tolerate them and one just before bedtime and was getting a full nights sleep. She said that she wouldn't help me out with a med change unless I jumped thru all her hoops again that I can't afford, and blah blah blah. So I just wasted $40 co-pay to see her in Pain Specialists and basically told to go kick rocks. I don't think she would give a damn if I had a broken leg or arm or neck because she don't give a damn about my back pain or the muscle cramps.  The cramps I get in my chest feels like I'm having a heart attack and she didn't give a damn about that either. Last I knew the heart is a muscle as well as the pectoral muscles in the chest. But guess what, she didn't give a damn about that either so I walked out and made sure everyone heard what what I had to say about the treatment I received.|Went there hysterical crying from pain and left crying even harder when they told me they wouldn't help me unless I did physical therapy so I could get an MRI. I can't do that as I'm practically bed ridden from pain with nothing to manage it. I hate how horrible our healthcare system has become. How can you send someone out of your office in tears like that? It's inhumane. What I'm being put through is inhumane. Dogs get better treatment. I haven't showered in over 2 weeks, I'm hardly eating, I haven't slept in days because of this pain and no one seems to care. If I could give 0 stars I would.|Dr. Jolene Smith, the nurses, the office staff are all helpful and caring.  Dr. Smith is a "miracle worker" in my book.  She has relieved me of severe pain thus increasing mobility.  I plan to get back to physical fitness!!|Dr Moyse is one of the most honest, compassionate and caring doctors I've seen in my 2 year pain journey with cervical osteoarthritis and two cervical bulging discs. He always takes time to explain things, and from our very first visit, he refused to schedule me for injections until I first met with a surgeon to weigh ALL of my options, so i could make an informed decision. I do know that ESI's bring in nice profit for doctors, so i really really appreciated that he did not push it on me until i was certain this was the best care plan for me.
And, when i was in severe pain and explained why I do not want to go down the opioid path, (he defintely did not attempt to push those on me, but offered it as a one time solution to help me sleep while i waited for my injection) he prescribed a muscle relaxer that allowed me to get comfortable enough to sleep at night. The comfort i received from the medicine and my injections has given me back so much of the quality of life i had lost and i truly have no words for how grateful I am for this!
I have been through the ringer of being bounced back and forth from chiropractors to doctors to physical therapists to orthos and was beginning to lose hope. I never thought Id be writing a review raving about medical care, but here we are ;-) I have faith that I may very well be on my way towards healing without surgery!
The whole staff here is also very friendly and kind!|Dr Allen Eckhoff & his team have worked with me over the past year to help me with my chronic back pain. Each visit they take their time and really listen to me. Even when I have felt emotional, they're so understanding & help me feel not so alone in all of this. I appreciate them so much :)|I went there as I have been having back pain for my hr last 2 1/2 years. I have been told I have a disc bulge spinal stenosis, I have been told to get si joint injections, pirformis syndrome injections, I have done chiropractic, I have done pt. Nothing has helped I am beyond frustrated! The whoever she was talking to me after the nurse saw me she talked to me like I was an idiot as I needed her to explain in in non medical terms what a discharge budge is and spinal stenosis means. She answered and she has the audacity to tell me I don't know what else you are looking for here. I said to be able to figure out why I am in so much pain. She said well your symptoms don't match up with your symptoms. I'm line okay your point? She's like well you don't want to try injections anymore. I said no why would I they have Not helped before why would they know. She's like well I suppose I can give you a referral to a surgeon. I'm like okay well then. Like rude. I am in pain I have been in for 2 years and you're the one asking me what I want them to do for me? Seriously. She had zero empathy. I have no idea who she was. She was not even the doctor who gave me the priformis syndrome shots. She acted like it was case closed or do more shots. Screw this place the office at the front desk girls are never very friendly. I would NNEVER recommend this place! Ever! A waste of my time insurance money and my time to get asked what do you want me to do for you then? Learn empathy hire a friendlier staff make your doctors feel like they are heard and you want to help them come up with a plan instead of being rude and dismissive. Peace out Pain Specialist you suck!
Tv

column40:
After trying for the better half of 2 years just to be seen I was met with there's nothing we can do for you. I'm in excruciating pain almost everyday. My regular doctor pushed for them to get me in just for them to basically tell just keep moving and the pain will get better. This is not my first rode. No the pain isn't going to get better. It's been like this and getting worse since age 16. I have tried all physically therapy, chiropractor and other treatments all of which have failed or made my situation worse. I do not feel heard by these doctors at all. And I'm at the end of my rope and don't know what to do. This is what sends ppl over then edge and I'm teetering right there about to fall with no compassion or care in the world shown. I don't recommend going here.|I went a while back and spoke to 3 different people about my pain. Two of the individuals were working with my pain specialist and the third I spoke to was the specialist. None of them heard me nor did they acknowledge what I was talking about. They did however draw their own conclusions and focused on one diagnosis that had absolutely nothing to do with the reason I was being seen. I left in tears. I was completely frustrated and disgusted beyond words.Worst experience I have ever had and I refuse to return. I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy.|I am unfortunately writing a review for the Pain Management Clinic. I would not recommend coming here. When I expressed that I was terrified of getting injections I was not met with compassion and the doctor there looked at me like she could not believe what I said. Her reactions were so noticeable to me that it was to the point where I responded with "Am I the only person that has expressed being afraid of this procedure?" The doctor nodded her head indicating a yes. I went to Patient Experience and it took them well over 10 business days to respond with "I am sorry you are not satisfied." Wouldn't anyone be if they were treated like that? Not to mention the doctor expressed she was not comfortable performing the procedure and I was denied seeing anyone else. This delayed my diagnostic testing from my surgical consult. I saw this doctor once, which was enough, so obviously I was not doctor shopping. Don't worry UIHC I went to another hospital Interventional Pain Management Clinic in Cedar Rapids. Check out my review there. They were fabulous and took my worries seriously. There bedside manner was outstanding and I got through the procedure just fine. I would suggest doing some training at that hospital and learn how to treat patients. I would like to add that there instructions were confusing. At first they told me no antianxiety meds and then they said it was alright. They did not like my confusion and my questions about this and a nurse did not even return my call. Also the clinic I went to in Cedar Rapids stated they could only do one side at a time because it was too dangerous to do both sides of intercostal nerve blocks as there is an increased risk for complications. Do NOT go to this clinic. Go to Cedar Rapids.|I used to have confidence going to the pain clinic. And felt like I was being heard. After the last time, no.
When I talked about the pain I was having at the time the doctor's response was something like " oh now you have a new pain ".
I was just being honest. I can't help it. That's where I was hurting.
When you have 1 whole side of your body hurting, I would think they would be more sympathetic.
Do they know what it's like to not get sleep when you lay down. Because the pain in your shoulder wakes you up. Try sleeping in a chair.  And then go to work. It's rough.
Maybe someday you doctors will be in pain and see what it's like.
Karma.
I can no longer recommend the pain clinic .

Respectfully,
Patti Meyer|The Doctors and staff have been outstanding!  So happy to have this pain clinic within driving distance. Again the entire team has been A + to work with.|2nd worst pm ! Zero compassion.
Unless.|The doctors are really nice, scheduling not so much|

column3:
Exceptional Orthopedic Care Since 1950

At Steindler Orthopedic Clinic, we have remained the experienced leader in providing exceptional orthopedic care to patients throughout southeastern Iowa for over 70 years. Under the expertise of Dr. Frederick J. Dery, our team specializes in comprehensive pain management and physical medicine solutions. We are dedicated to treating patients suffering from bone, joint, and muscle injuries with personalized care plans. Our specialty-trained doctors provide specialized treatment for conditions affecting the:

  • Ankle, foot, and lower extremities

  • Back, neck, and spine

  • Shoulder, elbow, hand, and wrist

  • Hip and knee joints

As both a Pain Management Physician and Physiatrist, Dr. Dery offers advanced treatments including fracture care, joint replacement and revision, pain management, physical medicine and rehabilitation, and sports medicine care. We take pride in our patient-centered approach, ensuring clear communication and thorough explanations of all procedures and treatment options. Visit Steindler Orthopedic Clinic at 2751 Northgate Dr, Iowa City, or call us at (319) 338-3606. At Steindler Orthopedic Clinic, we keep you moving.
column11: Since 1950, Steindler Orthopedic Clinic has remained the experienced leader in providing exceptional orthopedic care to patients suffering from bone, joint, and muscle injuries and conditions. Our specialty-trained doctors are dedicated to providing our patients throughout southeastern Iowa specialized care for injuries and conditions of the ankle, back, elbow, foot, hand, hip, knee, neck, shoulder, spine, and wrist as well as fracture care, joint replacement and revision, pain management, physical medicine and rehabilitation, and sports medicine care. At Steindler Orthopedic Clinic, we keep you moving.

At Bluffs Pain Docs, Dr. Andrew Huff specializes in comprehensive interventional spine and pain management solutions for patients throughout Council Bluffs and surrounding areas.

Expert Care for Neck and Back Conditions

We provide advanced treatments for a wide range of orthopedic and pain-related issues, including:

  • Herniated discs

  • Neck and back arthritis

  • Nerve compression and pain

  • Spinal cord stimulation therapy

Our approach combines thorough diagnostics with personalized treatment plans to address the root cause of your pain. Located at 201 Ridge St, Suite 102 in Council Bluffs, we're committed to improving quality of life through advanced pain management techniques. Visit Bluffs Pain Docs or call us at +1 712-256-3511 to schedule your consultation with our experienced team.

Looking forward to seeing Dr.Huff again in 3 weeks.|Dr. Huff is very kind and listened to me every time I saw him.  He and his staff always project calm and confidence.  I would definitely recommend him to anyone who is having chronic pain.|Tried to reach office by phone, 3 times, and had to leave message.  When I arrived at office, only one receptionist at desk and was overwhelmed and didn't even have time to hear my message.  While waiting another patient came in and also had the same issue.  Was about 10-15 minutes behind.  Nurse brought me back, but got feeling that as I was talking, she seemed distracted.  I did not take offense knowing they were behind.  Dr. Huff came in about 5 minutes later, and was professional and attentive to my overall history.  At the end he told me that he was unable to affectively help me unless certain additional medical conditions were taken care of first.  With his upfront honesty, I was able to respect and trust his determination of my condition.  I would recommend to other people.

column3:
At Iowa Ortho Des Moines, Dr. Thomas Klein brings exceptional expertise as a board-certified Interventional Pain Management Specialist with a unique background. Having practiced pain management since 2009, Dr. Klein's distinctive journey from podiatric surgery to anesthesia and pain management at Des Moines University gives him comprehensive knowledge from head to toe.

Comprehensive Pain Management Approach

We believe in treating the whole person rather than isolated symptoms, which is why Dr. Klein entered this specialized field. Our holistic approach enables patients to maintain active lifestyles with family and friends while effectively managing pain. As part of our dedicated team at Iowa Ortho, we offer:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Comprehensive pain evaluations

  • Personalized treatment plans

  • Collaborative care coordination

Located at 450 Laurel St A in Des Moines, our Midwest-raised specialist combines professional expertise with compassionate care. Contact us at (515) 247-8400 to schedule your consultation.
column11:
Dr. Thomas Klein is a board-certified Interventional Pain Management Specialist. He was raised in the Midwest and has been practicing pain management since 2009.

Dr. Klein originally went to school and practiced as a podiatric surgeon. He later went on to Des Moines University to study anesthesia and pain management. This education gives Dr. Klein pain management knowledge from head to toe.

Dr. Klein entered the pain management field because he believes that pain is best managed by looking at the body as a whole as opposed to individual parts. He enjoys being part of a treatment team that enables patients to continue to work and stay active with family and friends.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Relief Solutions in Cedar Rapids

At Mercy Medical Center's Interventional Pain Center, we specialize in advanced pain management techniques for residents throughout Cedar Rapids and surrounding communities. Our dedicated team provides personalized care for patients suffering from back, neck, and spine pain resulting from cancer or chronic conditions. We understand how debilitating persistent pain can be, which is why we offer a comprehensive range of interventional procedures designed to improve quality of life and restore functionality.

Our Specialized Services Include:

  • Interventional pain procedures

  • Cancer pain management

  • Chronic condition treatment

  • Spine and back pain relief

  • Neck pain interventions

Located on the 4th Floor at 701 10th St SE in Cedar Rapids, IA, our state-of-the-art facility is equipped with the latest technology to ensure optimal care. We're committed to helping our patients regain mobility and comfort, enabling many to return to work and daily activities they once thought impossible. For more information about our services or to schedule a consultation, please visit Mercy Pain Management Services or call us at (319) 398-6636.

column40:
Even though the shots didn't end up helping me, I give 5 stars. Dr. A. is very professional and knowledgeable, as are the staff, and incredibly helpful, and very thorough about explaining everything. I never felt rushed as I struggle to walk and go a lot slower than I used to walk. I wish there was some medicine to help get the edge off when the pain is absolutely excruciating, and I wish there was some miracle cure. But I was informed that the shots don't always help prior to getting them, and that the body heals in time. Dr. A. told me that I had 4 mildly to moderately bulging disks in my low back and possibly some torn muscles as well. He recommended that I continue with physical therapy for at least another month, of which doing the physical therapy exercises are slowly helping. I never expected to ever be in this much pain and limited range of motion for so long, but the care I have received throughout all of this at the Pain Clinic, at Occupational Health and at Physical Therapy, has been top notch. Well done to all for all of your outstanding and professional work. Thank you so much.  Have a safe, splendid and blessed Memorial weekend, and may God's grace, mercy, and peace in our Lord and Saviour Jesus Christ be with you all, always. Amen.|This is the worst run pain clinic ever. I asked a few questions and was told to get out by the woman in charge because she couldn't answery questions. She was a very small and spiteful person, she came out looking for a fight and when I just sat there and asked questions she couldn't handle it. She should not be in charge of anything.|Very happy with the first meeting with Dr A. The sweets nurse checked me in. Dr A Had my MRI's up for me to look at.  Dr A showed me where the pain was coming.  Dr A felt I should wait before having any injections. I set up for a return visit. At my return visit, I was still in pain but getting better. The nurse who checked me in was very impatient. Dr A came in I felt rushed and he was not wanting to hear anything from me.  A totally different atmosphere from the first meeting. He did offer to refer me to someone else. After thinking about it I did contact Dr A and said yes I would like a referral since I still had pain! He stated he had nothing more to offer go to my family Dr.   I am very grateful to Dr A for pointing out one of the area's the pain was coming from.  Knowing where your pain is coming from is HUGE!  I had more questions since I still was having pain but I could tell he did not want to hear it.  Today I received a letter from Dr A telling me he would no longer be my Dr. I had no intention of seeing him again. So to have Dr A send me a letter telling me he would not see me anymore? I am not sure what the point was for sending the letter.|So very frustrated with this office. First appointment I showed up at the given time and was told they gave me the wrong date and no doctor was available. 2nd appointment the doctor decided a hip MRI was necessary and didn't do anything for my pain. 3rd visit I showed up and they didn't have the written report from my hip MRI. I was sent home until they received it. I called 2 more times and finally called the office where I got the MRI myself and had it faxed to them. I made a call to see if they got it and was told they would be referring me to a surgeon as the doctor didn't feel he could do anything for me. I now have received 2 bills for the same date with 2 different account numbers and literally they never treated me for anything. I called them and the very curt secretary gave me the UnityPoint general billing department. I requested a detailed bill 2 weeks ago which I never received. I called the office again 2 days ago and requested to talk with the person in the office who does the billing and still waiting for a return call. Terrible experience and now trying to figure out my next step for the fraudulent billing!!!|If your primary care physician tries to refer you here tell them no you want to go somewhere else. I went Friday the 6th of October for bulging of discs in my back because I have been in pain for two years now and Dr Afzal acknowledged yeah you have bulging then shrugged it off, I have brought up I also had knee issues that I have been taking Physical therapy for. He then said I don't have that much cartilage left in my knee. I said okay, thinking can I get something for my pain because that's the whole reason I am here? He goes straight to my weight and because I am "too fat". He tried pushing weight loss surgery on me multiple times going around the subject why I was even there. I walked out in the same amount of pain as I walked in with. Don't go here for actual help he won't give you anything he'll comment on your weight and tell you to lose it but instructs you not to walk or be on it for a period of time... He upset my husband with talking down to me like I was uneducated person, the only reason they get ONE star is because the nurses were amazing, sweet, and caring.|KIND STAFF only!

I would not trust ANY surgeon here in the W'loo/CF area PERIOD! I swear someone poisoned the water here when I left to CO for 11 years.

Not sure about Afzal, yet the other Dr, wrote in MY records I toe/heel walked for him, not true, I denied back surgery (told him my L4-L5 is fused) . Now I refuse to let any "Dr" around here do ANYTHING invasive. Just like the drug slogan: Just Say No!|Dr. Afzal was extremely professional when I saw him 2018 for lower back pain. He gave me an injection to relieve the swelling and pain. It worked great for me. Pain returned late in 2020 . Dr. Afzal looked at my MRI and told me it didn't look good. Told me I could try the injection again . He said it might help, but thought I needed to see a surgeon. Sent my paperwork on to surgeon. Thank you.|Dr afzal is amazing. I was having trouble with my lower back. He seen me the same day I called. Did some test. And he called me twice to make sure everything was doing well. Wanted to see me before he went on vacation. I love the fact that he cares about his patients

Expert Pain Management Specialist in Waterloo, IA

At Cedar Valley Medical, Dr. Ashar Afzal brings over two decades of specialized experience in pain medicine to our patients. We provide comprehensive pain management solutions based on Dr. Afzal's exceptional medical background, which includes his MBBS from Allama Iqbal Medical College (1993), Anesthesiology Residency (2001), and Pain Medicine Fellowship (2002) from the University of Iowa Hospitals and Clinics. Board-certified by the American Board of Anesthesiology since 2002 and in Pain Medicine since 2005, we specialize in:

  • Chronic pain management

  • Perioperative pain management

Our approach combines advanced medical techniques with personalized care to address each patient's unique pain challenges. Located at 3630 W 4th St in Waterloo, we've been serving the Cedar Valley community since 2002. For comprehensive pain management solutions, visit Dr. Ashar Afzal at Cedar Valley Medical or call us at (319) 235-7246 to schedule your consultation.

column3:
Comprehensive Pain Solutions in Des Moines

At Metro Anesthesia & Pain Management, we provide effective chronic pain relief at our two convenient locations in West Des Moines and Des Moines, Iowa. Our practice specializes in treating a variety of musculoskeletal conditions through our innovative in-office treatment approach, which significantly reduces co-pays and deductible costs for our patients. Our team of board-certified anesthesiologists and pain management specialists takes an interactive approach to pain management, working closely with each patient to develop personalized treatment plans.

We offer multiple treatment modalities for chronic pain, including:

  • Specialized neck pain treatments

  • Advanced back pain interventions

  • Effective knee pain management solutions

By combining various treatment approaches, we help repair the underlying causes of pain for long-term relief rather than just masking symptoms. Our comprehensive care model ensures patients receive the most appropriate and effective treatments for their specific conditions. Visit our official website or call us at +1 515-221-9222 to schedule your consultation at our West Des Moines location.
column11:
At its two locations in West Des Moines and Des Moines, Iowa, Metro Anesthesia & Pain Management offers chronic pain sufferers effective solutions for a variety of musculoskeletal conditions in a convenient in-office setting. The practice's dedication to in-office treatments results in fewer co-pays and deductible costs for their patients.
An interactive approach to pain management is at the core of Metro Anesthesia & Pain Management's approach. The board-certified anesthesiologists and pain management specialists offer multiple modalities to effectively relieve chronic pain, including in the neck, back, and knees.
Using a combination of treatments can help repair the underlying cause of pain for long-term relief.

column40:
DONT BOTHER WITH THIS "PAIN" CLINIC

They aren't interested in helping with your pain and will invalidate everything you say to them. The receptionist mocked me when I asked to speak to a supervisor and was refusing to do so until I persisted.

The last nurse I saw there named Karen, put on a blood pressure cuff upside down, after it errored 2 times I finally mentioned it to her and she fixed it. Then the machine wasn't working, she took it off and then it popped up numbers that she wrote down. Instead of using the manual cuff that was hanging on the wall.  She was confused on how to document what I was describing as far as pain and said out loud that she wasn't going to mention the knee pain. The computer she was using died within minutes and she was gone for 5 or more minutes to find a cord. Basically the worse nurse I've experienced in a clinic, had she been new I would have understood. But she was not.

I have been subjected to over 12 shots in 3 different body parts, tried every OTC option and every prescribed medication and nothing has helped. I have done everything Dr. Ransdell recommended with no pain relief at all.

When I finally asked for further help with my continuing high level of pain he told me to go see my primary care doctor.

He clearly is not in the right profession and doesn't understand anything about chronic pain. He should simply go back to being an anesthesiologist and leave the pain management to doctors who truly care.|Dr.Quam is the most calm, caring, professional/doctor I have ever had. His patients are lucky to be treated by him, he cares about your well-being,  and will do all he can to help you feel better. I have seen him for about 20 years so I know him and his staff well. All his staff are very helpful and caring, they know there jobs and they do them well.|Sara is a medical professional I trust completely. She is always willing to listen to my complicated health situation with care and compassion, and has always been willing to help me figure out whatever care plan is best for me. column40:
Dr. Morrissey is awesome and has great bedside manner.  He's been doing my steroid epidurals for about a year now and I'm very pleased.  The nurses there are also so sweet too- Especially Cortney!!|Contrary to what Miss ( Gravincas ) says because so far, any of the 4 reviews she has given have been negative. This place has been very helpful and understanding. They listened to my wife about what is going on with her and had a positive discussion about treatments and things to help manage her pain when the other doctors she had seen just blew her off. People need to realize that help and treatment is a joint effort between patient and care professional|Excellent staff and care. Was transferred from UofI after another back fusion. 2yrs ago I was transferred to Mercy Hospital for physical therapy after my first disc fusion. While the staff were very nice and helpful, the therapy however was very limited and lacking physical excursion. However this time I was transferred to St Luke's thankfully. Everything and everyone in the unit was very helpful, knowledgeable and understanding. The therapy room was very extensive and accommodating. They have a piece of equipment for every need you will have. Very laidback and happy atmosphere. I will only go back to them after future surgery's. Highly recommended|I had cervical epidural on 7/22/20. I was very scared and nervous.  The nurse and training nurse made me feel so relaxed and comfortable.  The Dr. Explained everything and I was in and out very efficiently.  They allowed me to wake up fully before sending me home. I slept most of the day. Although the meds they used are wearing off now, I can feel the difference already. Outside of the soreness of the shot. I feel okay right now.|I walked In and was instantly greeted . Dr. Saddler is very nice and wants to get my pain under control. She is very knowledgeable. All the nurses are great! I appreciate all of the staff
.|They diagnosed me with cervical dystonia and said Botox was a treatment for it. It needed prior authorization and it would take awhile. So, my next appointment a month later I thought thats what would be happening. It wasn't. I saw a Dr Matthews that time and he honestly made me a little uncomfortable with how he called me pet names and was just creepy. Literally nothing happened at that appointment. I asked about the botox and he laughed and said it takes forever to get approved. Come to my appointment today 2 months later and asked about the botox and Dr Driscoll (who I saw the first time) and was told no orders were ever put in for it  to be authorized for my insurance. What? She's the one who told me that was what she wanted to try, AND Dr Matthews made it seem like it was still processing at the insurance company. I've wasted 3 months of my time thinking something was going to happen to relieve my pain, instead I've just given them money for nothing. Not going back.

Edit: as I was leaving the nurse asked if I wanted to put the request in for Botox. Hesitant at first, she said you don't have to do it (I made it known I wasn't seeing them again) but just so you know if you do go somewhere else. 2 DAYS LATER I got confirmation it was approved. 2 days. SMH.|I've been going to the clinic now for 17 years and I have never had an issue of any type. Dr Kline is the greatest and I recommend him for your care. He is tops, A-one!! Great bedside manner and really cares!!|Kind and a great group of nurses. This doctor is good to his patients. And extremely qualified!! You will not regret his care. Bette.

column40:
Today people were coming into the ER on ambulances and then told to wait in the waiting room.  I came by ambulance and sat for 2 hours before leaving.  A woman with dry heves was there when I arrived and was still there when I left.  The lab tech came out to take blood from her but because the woman sat in her wheel chair backwards curled in a ball as she dry heeves, she just shrugged and left.  One of the other waiting patients expressed loudly to no one in particular that she probably went to the back and said she was noncompliant when she did not even talk to her.  I called|I have not had a good experience. Wait times are extreme. Did not feel heard.|If this is the direction all hospitals are going then there's no hope for the humanization of medical care
Unlike my previous stay nursing staff was great. My earlier stay was in the peak of Covid and night staff was neglectful,incompetent, and obviously stand ins.
This time it was the pencil pushers trying to discharge me the day after surgery. This woman I'm not sure what her title was made me feel like it was the inquisition, her goal was nothing more than to see me gone and I felt attacked
It took me making it clear in no uncertain terms that I had at least a working knowledge of patients rights to end up being able to stay another day.
As a 65 yr old woman who's blood pressure went a bit wacky during surgery it was inexcusable to try to give me or anyone else the bums rush. Again, I can't say enough about the nursing care I received but here was another case of putting profits above people
You have PATIENTS RIGHTS, ALWAYS ASK FOR A PATIENTS ADVOCATE|I give five stars to the staff,  the nurses are great.   I liked two of the providers (I say providers because they are not doctors) I saw each one once - they  both had great bedside manners and were caring.  I had hip injections by one and I barely felt them.  The provider I saw the majority of  my visits over 18 months I didn't care for.  I felt he was condescending and that's not the type of provider I want to see for pain management,.  I didn't have a choice he was the only provider they would schedule me with.  Being new to the area there aren't many options so I've been driving to Chicago for my epidurals.|I have never met a more unprofessional staff in my life.  The doctor has no clue how Wful his staff is with patients. First they couldn't find my records. Then one nurse refused to have a Medtronic Representative attend my meeting. The doctor said the Medtronic Representative was welcome to come in the room. The Representative had crucial information about my case to share. A week later I  get a call from the office staff asking for my Medicare number. She said I  couldn't have my operation until Medicare approved it so it could be November before I  can maybe have my surgery
Why didn't they handle this on Se623rdinstead of calling me on September 29th and asking for my Medicare number. I have had so much back pain for several years and this  mess has prolonged the time for me to get help. I will never go back. I've never seen such incompetence.|It isn't their fault. The government has doctors under their thumb not to prescribe real pain meds.  Prescribing psyche meds for pain is reckless and dangerous. Most chronic pain sufferers already wish they were dead adding psychemads to the mix is just asking for trouble.|This was by far the most unprofessional experience I've had with Unity point. Not all departments are like this. The pain management and Dr. Kari was unprofessional in his approach at helping patients. I understand Dr. get busy. But to provide a statements about working long and not wanting to be there is frightening for patients. If you schedule to take off work a certain time, that's the time you plan to get treated. I wouldn't recommend Dr. Maruti Kari|Horrible staff here. Never return phone calls. Don't submit paperwork to insurance properly. Rude in person and when you do scripture get a call back, which only happens when you call the Patient Advocate and compliance about the lack of return calls. Appointment times are a joke- over an hour wait and Barb at the front desk makes a snider remark about not being a doctor's office so they run slow.

column40: PLEASE READ BEFORE MAKING AN APPOINTMENT HERE! Before you ever get in the door they will try and make you sign a document saying they will charge you for a missed appointment. I refused to sign it saying there is no disclaimer for inclement weather (IOWA ice and snow storms) nor illness. That was a HUGE ordeal, but I did get in. They are not interested in you as a person in pain, only in taking as much money from you as possible without giving you any insight into your condition or what you REALLY need to FEEL or GET better! I was even told at one point that the doctors do not speak to patients directly! You have to go through their assistants. WOW!!! Less than 30 days after being seen for a back problem. They said I'd need to have a nerve ablation test done. Well, really two, because insurance won't pay for the surgery unless you have two. So the first one didn't help me at all so I came in again to tell them that and I said I don't think I want to do the second one. They talked me into it, saying they were here and ready to do it and you never know it, might work! What a lie. It was less effective than the first test! I wanted to talk to them about my hip pain as well, but I'd have to make another appointment for that! Geez, REALLY? When I got the hip appointment, I called to make sure they got the MRI I'd had taken from Lutheran. Told them to call and get it. A month later, they had no idea I'd even had an MRI! I talked to them about my back pain and not once did they say I'd need to have that done before I could have back surgery, which I found out later by the surgeon's PA. So I tried to get it scheduled and they wanted me to come back in for a re-assessment before deciding to give me the doctor ordered Epidural, so ANOTHER OFFICE CALL and PAYMENT that was completely unnecessary! And then to get rescheduled it was going to be 2 full months! Ridiculous!|Never again! She never listened or helped me for my pain. I have back problems and it's extremely painful to live with everyday and I have MRI proof something is wrong still no help! She had to have her nurse practitioner tell me that they couldn't help. She couldn't even face me herself! Sad! I'm very displeased with all that has happened. Never again!|Dr. Smith has been helping to manage my health care for several years.  She offers straight forward, no nonsense care, which I absolutely appreciate.  She replaced my spinal cord stimulator, which has been of great help to me.  Her office staff is friendly and efficient.  It's nice to be able to have a team who understands the needs of people who live in constant pain. I strongly recommend her!!|Dr. Smith did a Regenexx procedure on my back.  I must say that it worked far beyond my expectations and I play golf 4 - 5 days a week.  I hope it lasts. She took time to answer all of my questions.|Very disappointed.  Suggest I would sell my pain medication.  Would not prescribe anything for my pain. I have been seeing pain management for 6 years. I would not recommend her to anyone in pain. Timothy Warnell. I discontinued our visit when she said I don't know these Dr.  Won't take there advice. I don't know if there giving you fentanyl patches to sell on the streets. How inappropriate is this.  Some of the things she said was absolutely off the chart.|Communication with her is limited and done strictly via her nurse and I question how well my input was relayed. I don't think she takes enough time for diagnosis.|Great physician and staff! Friendly|The only pain specialist in the entire state of Iowa I trust.

Comprehensive Pain Management Solutions
